reviews: not the best city to live in Denmark, it gets boring very fast
aalborg.description:
Aalborg, in Denmark, is nice, but it might not be for everyone. For those who want a relaxed atmosphere, the city has some nice cafes and a comfortable feel, but some visitors say it can become boring after a while. If you enjoy culture, Aalborg has a few museums and parks to visit.

The cost of living here is usually lower than in larger cities, which is good, but public transportation options are limited, so having a bike or car might be useful for getting around. Safety is generally good, but it's always smart to be aware of your surroundings.

The waterfront area is good for walking, and the nightlife can be enjoyable with local bars and music. However, if you don’t speak Danish, you might have some trouble with the language. Overall, Aalborg is a decent place if you like a quieter life, but it might not always be entertaining.
aalborg.description_kor:
덴마크의 올보르(Aalborg)는 매력적인 도시지만, 모든 사람에게 적합한 곳은 아닙니다. 편안한 분위기를 선호하는 분들에게는 몇몇 멋진 카페와 아늑한 공간을 제공하지만, 그로 인해 시간이 지나면서 지루함을 느끼는 이들도 있을 수 있습니다. 문화 활동을 즐기는 분들이라면 올보르에 방문할 만한 박물관과 공원들이 몇 군데 있어 만족할만한 경험이 가능할 것입니다.

이곳의 생활비는 대체로 대도시보다 낮아 경제적이지만, 대중교통 수단이 제한적이기 때문에 자전거나 자동차를 이용하는 것이 이동하는 데 더 편리할 수 있습니다. 안전성은 대체로 양호하지만, 주변 상황을 항상 인지하는 것이 좋습니다.

해안가 지역은 걷기에 좋은 장소이며, 현지 바와 음악으로 구성된 밤 문화를 즐길 수 있습니다. 다만 덴마크어를 하지 못하는 경우 언어적인 어려움을 겪을 수 있습니다. 결론적으로 올보르는 조용한 삶을 선호하는 분들에게는 괜찮은 선택이지만, 항상 흥미롭지는 않을 수 있습니다.

reviews: Great small city on the beach! A few weeks in late summer were lovely, not too hot or rainy. Great food and drink, super cheap, with a beautiful old city and a roman lighthouse! Connectivity was good and people were friendly
a-coruna.description:
A Coruña is a small city on the coast of Spain that has a lot to offer. You can enjoy spending your days in the sun on nice beaches with pleasant summer weather that is not too hot or rainy. The food here is great and affordable, so you can enjoy local dishes without spending too much money. Don't miss the old town, which has interesting buildings and the famous Roman lighthouse that has been there for a long time.

Getting around is easy, and the locals are friendly, making you feel comfortable. However, even though the city is relaxed, you might face some language barriers, so it may help to learn a few Spanish phrases.

To really feel the atmosphere of A Coruña, check out its neighborhoods and get to know the local customs, like sharing tapas and a glass of wine with friends. Whether you are walking through the scenic streets or relaxing by the beach, there are many experiences waiting for you!
a-coruna.description_kor:
아코룬냐(A Coruña)는 스페인 해안에 위치한 매력적인 소도시입니다. 여름철에는 기온이 적당하고 비가 오지 않아, 아름다운 해변에서 햇살을 만끽하며 하루를 보내기에 안성맞춤입니다. 이곳의 음식은 정말 훌륭하면서도 가격이 저렴해, 많은 돈을 들이지 않고도 지역 특선 요리를 즐길 수 있습니다. 오래된 건물들과 역사 깊은 로마 등대가 있는 구시가지는 꼭 방문해보세요.

이 도시에서는 교통이 편리하고, 현지인들이 친절해서 편안한 분위기를 느낄 수 있습니다. 아코룬냐는 느긋한 분위기를 자랑하지만, 가끔 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니, 간단한 스페인어 구문을 배워두는 것도 도움이 될 것입니다.

아코룬냐의 매력을 진정으로 느끼고 싶다면, 현지 이웃을 탐방해 보세요. 친구들과 함께 타파스와 와인을 나누는 전통적인 지역 문화를 경험하는 것도 좋습니다. 경치 좋은 거리를 거닐거나 해변에서 휴식을 취하는 등, 이곳에서 기다리고 있는 다양한 경험들이 여러분을 기다리고 있습니다!

reviews:
Been to Aarhus many times and always enjoy coming here. The people are incredibly friendly, and I personally would change the Friendly to Foreigners rating to “Great”. There are also a lot of cosy cafes and bakeries, which are nice to hang around in when the rain and wind show their faces — as they often do. 

The city has a good range of things to keep you interested, and the nature nearby is also pleasant. Definitely go to ARoS when you visit; the panoramic view is cool, but the exhibitions were also interesting when I went. 

The city is expensive, but Denmark is a pricey country in general. I would recommend staying in either Aarhus Ø or Frederiksbjerg if you could choose any neighbourhood, though those are also the most desirable ones so the competition for places is high haha. 

I personally don’t mind the weather so much, but that would be a negative for a lot of people. Ditto for cost of living. The only thing that would stop me moving here is that Aalborg and Copenhagen have better airport connections IMO.
aarhus.description:
Aarhus is a city that feels cozy, making it good for visiting cafes even when the weather is not nice. The local people are very friendly, which helps visitors feel welcome. There is a good mix of art and culture, and ARoS is an important place to visit. The views from there are great, and the exhibitions are interesting.

On the downside, Aarhus can be expensive, which is common in Denmark. If you want to live here, you might consider areas like Aarhus Ø or Frederiksbjerg, which are popular, so there may be competition when looking for a place.

If you enjoy nature, you will like the parks nearby, but be ready for some rain and wind. For getting around, public transport is okay, but some people think it is a bit limited. Overall, Aarhus offers a mix of culture and a cozy feel, making it a good place to explore!
aarhus.description_kor:
아르후스는 아늑한 분위기를 가진 도시로, 날씨가 좋지 않아도 카페에 가기 좋은 장소입니다. 현지인들이 매우 친절해 방문객들이 따뜻한 환영을 받는 느낌을 줍니다. 이곳은 예술과 문화가 조화를 이루고 있으며, ARoS는 꼭 방문해야 하는 명소입니다. 그곳에서 바라보는 경치는 환상적이고, 전시회도 매우 흥미롭습니다.

그럼에도 불구하고 아르후스는 다소 비쌀 수 있는데, 이는 덴마크 전역에서 흔히 볼 수 있는 일입니다. 이곳에 살고 싶다면, 아르후스 Ø나 프레더릭스베르그와 같은 인기 있는 지역을 고려해볼 수 있습니다. 이 지역은 매우 인기가 많아서 집을 찾는 데 경쟁이 있을 수 있습니다.

자연을 즐기시는 분이라면 근처의 공원들을 탐방할 수 있지만, 비와 바람에 대비해야 할 필요가 있습니다. 대중교통도 괜찮은 편이지만, 일부 사람들은 조금 불편하다고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 전반적으로 아르후스는 문화와 아늑한 느낌이 잘 어우러져 있어 탐험하기에 아주 매력적인 장소입니다!

reviews: Cold and windy and wet. People hardly smile or give eye contact. Pity as rich history which should be more captured and used. Run down Main Street as too reliant on chain stores…if it got more local and Indy, it could be a great place.

I studied in Aberdeen for a year and loved living there. The city has charm and is very walkable. It was easy to meet people from the university and through my student accommodation but could see it being difficult if you aren't attending university. It wasn't too expensive coming from the US and was manageable on a student budget. It is easy to catch a train to explore nearby cities. The train ride from Edinburgh to Aberdeen is very scenic and shows a cliffside view for the majority of the ride!

Nice for a short stay -- the old city and university campus are charming, and cafes and even pubs are pretty laptop friendly. Does not seem to have a nomad scene though and you can see the key sights in a few days. Decent bus system. I wouldn't spend more than a week here unless you have a specific reason to be there.
aberdeen.description:
Aberdeen is a city that is worth visiting, even if it can be cold and windy at times. Visitors often talk about the weather, but those who stay longer find interest in its history and friendly student environment. The city is easy to walk around, making it simple to meet new people, especially near the university.

On the other hand, some may find the people less chatty and the Main Street has many chain stores. It could be better with more local shops. If you are on a budget, living costs are affordable, especially when compared to larger cities. There is a good bus service and a train to Edinburgh that offers nice views along the cliffs.

For things to do, the old town and small cafes are nice for relaxing or working on your laptop. There is enough to keep you occupied for a few days, but most people think it is better for a short visit unless you have specific reasons to stay longer. So bring an umbrella and get ready to explore Aberdeen!
aberdeen.description_kor:
앱 본딘은 꼭 방문해볼 만한 도시입니다. 가끔 춥고 바람이 불기도 하지만요. 많은 방문객들이 날씨에 대해 이야기하지만, 오랜 기간 머무르는 사람들은 이 도시의 역사와 학생들의 따뜻한 분위기에 매력을 느낍니다. 이 도시는 도보로 이동하기 편리해 새로운 사람들을 만나는 것이 아주 쉽답니다, 특히 대학 근처에서는 더더욱 그렇죠.

하지만 일부 사람들은 이곳 사람들이 조금 덜 말을 걸어온다고 느낄 수도 있고, 메인 스트리트에는 체인점이 많이 있습니다. 좀 더 많은 지역 상점이 있으면 좋겠다는 생각이 드네요. 다행히도, 예산이 한정된 경우에도 생활비가 비교적 저렴해서 특히 대도시와 비교할 때 부담이 적습니다. 좋은 버스 서비스도 제공되며, 에든버러까지 가는 기차는 절벽을 따라 펼쳐진 멋진 경치를 즐길 수 있습니다.

구시가는 할 거리가 많고, 아기자기한 카페들은 휴식을 취하거나 노트북 작업을 하기에 안성맞춤입니다. 며칠간의 여행에는 충분한 볼거리가 있지만, 대부분의 사람들은 특별한 이유가 없다면 짧은 방문을 선호합니다. 그러니 우산을 잊지 말고 앱 본딘을 탐험해보세요!

reviews:
For internet, don't bother with landline. Just pay for the biggest 4G plan you can get and tether constantly, save yourself the headache.

Kukun is the nicest coworking spot, but very expensive, even by international standards ($90usd/week).
accra.description:
If you go to Accra, you will have an exciting experience. This busy city is known for its friendly people, diverse culture, and active markets. The cost of living can be complicated, especially if you need good coworking spaces like Kukun. It is one of the better places, but remember that it costs around $90 a week.

Getting around can be variable. While public transportation is available, many people choose to use ride-hailing apps for ease. If you want to stay online, it is better to avoid landline internet options. Instead, get the largest 4G plan you can find to avoid problems.

Accra has interesting local customs, tasty street food, and historical sites, making it worth visiting. However, be careful of language differences and always be aware of your safety. For a good trip, explore its active neighborhoods and talk to the locals—they are what make this city unique!
accra.description_kor:
아크라에 가면 흥미로운 경험이 기다리고 있습니다. 이 분주한 도시는 친절한 사람들, 다양한 문화, 그리고 활기찬 시장으로 유명하죠. 생활비는 상황에 따라 다를 수 있는데, 특히 Kukun 같은 훌륭한 코워킹 스페이스를 이용하고 싶다면 비용이 더 들 수 있습니다. 이곳은 좋은 장소 중 하나이지만, 이용하는 데 주당 약 90달러가 필요하다는 점을 염두에 두세요.

이동 방법은 상황에 따라 달라질 수 있습니다. 대중교통도 있지만, 많은 사람들이 편리함 때문에 차량 호출 앱을 이용합니다. 온라인 연결을 유지하고 싶다면 유선 인터넷을 피하는 게 좋습니다. 대신, 문제를 예방하기 위해 가능한 한 대용량의 4G 요금을 사용하는 것을 추천합니다.

아크라는 흥미로운 지역 문화, 맛있는 길거리 음식, 역사적인 명소로 가득 차 있어 꼭 방문해볼 가치가 있습니다. 다만, 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니 주의하고 항상 안전을 유의하세요. 좋은 여행을 위해 활기찬 동네를 탐험하고 현지인들과 이야기를 나눠보세요. 그들이 바로 이 도시를 특별하게 만드는 주인공들이니까요!

reviews: We have lived in Abu Dhabi for over four years and it is an amazing city! It is completely safe (for couples, solo women, etc.) and there is so much to do. The nightlife is plentiful and alcohol is easily available in licensed places (nearly all hotel bars and restaurants). The locals are friendly, and everyone speaks English. We absolutely love this city.
abu-dhabi.description:
Abu Dhabi is a busy city that has something for everyone. With its combination of modern attractions and rich culture, it's easy to see why people like living here. Safety is important; it’s great for couples, solo travelers, and women, making it easy to explore. The locals are friendly, and you’ll be glad to know that many people speak English, so communication is simple.

When it comes to nightlife, there are many restaurants and hotel bars where you can relax with a drink. The city also has great sights, from the large Sheikh Zayed Mosque to the lively Corniche. While living costs can be high, many people feel that the experiences and quality of life make it worth it.

Keep in mind that public transportation is not as available as in some larger cities, so having a car can help. Overall, whether you’re visiting or looking to live here, Abu Dhabi is a safe and lively place that welcomes everyone!
abu-dhabi.description_kor:
아부다비는 다양한 매력을 가진 바쁜 도시로, 모든 사람에게 좋은 경험을 제공합니다. 현대적인 명소와 풍부한 문화가 어우러져 있어 많은 사람들이 이곳에 살고 싶어하는 이유를 쉽게 이해할 수 있습니다. 안전하게 여행할 수 있는 환경이 조성되어 있어 커플은 물론 혼자 여행하는 사람이나 여성들에게도 매우 적합하며, 쉽게 탐험할 수 있습니다. 친절한 현지인들이 많고 대부분이 영어를 잘 구사하기 때문에 소통에도 큰 어려움이 없습니다.

밤문화 역시 다양합니다. 여러 레스토랑과 호텔 바에서 음료와 함께 편안하게 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 도시에는 대규모 셰이크 자이드 모스크와 활기찬 코르니시 등 멋진 명소들이 많이 있습니다. 생활비는 좀 높을 수 있지만 많은 사람들이 그 경험과 생활의 질이 그만한 가치가 있다고 느끼고 있습니다.

다만 대중교통이 일부 대도시에 비해 부족할 수 있다는 점은 유의해야 합니다. 차가 있으면 편리할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 아부다비는 방문하든 거주하든 모두를 환영하는 안전하고 활기찬 도시입니다!

reviews:
If you don't like chaotic developing world cities and don't want to be exposed to issues like petty crime, poverty, etc. - stop here, you won't like Addis one bit.
If you clicked here because you're a seasoned traveler coming in with eyes wide open that Ethiopia is (very) poor but the experience and empathy to make it work in order to have an amazing travel experience: you can make it work. Ethiopia is the most foreign experience I have ever felt coming from a Western perspective. Nonetheless there are still loads of cafes, food is amazing (though you will get sick at least once), I was getting 25mbps on my phone, weather is good, everyday life is cheap. Modern apartment blocks are going up like crazy, but from a low base so housing can still be relatively expensive for what you get. It's enough to give you a home base to explore other areas of the country (which are insane travel experiences), and there is a young professional/expat scene to engage with when the rest of the city is overbearing. Granted, I spent only a week in Addis but have made good friends with a small group of locals/expats who had good insights, and have spent several years in Africa.
The security issues in the rest of the country affect the vibe a lot, so it's tough to plan going there, but if that gets resolved I would recommend it for (very) adventurous travelers because the payoff in terms of experience is there.

Pros: 
- I loved the inejra 
- Weather was nice
- The home country for my parents, so it felt nice being able to just blend in, compared to living in western countries. 
- The USD goes a long way

Cons:
Coming from a western perspective, life in here in Addis Ababa is just unnecessarily difficult. Day to day things are filled with an absurd amount of inefficiencies that I often wonder how things get done at all. 
- The pedestrian infrastructure is completely lacking with uneven sidewalks & lack of cross walks. 
- Traffic rules are practically non existent with cars never having an actual lane to drive in, roundabouts regularly stopped and malfunctioning stop lights. 
- Dilapidated housing is absolutely hideous as everything is made from scrap metal
- Wifi speeds are extremely slow as they never cracked higher than 15 mbps and were regularly below 1mbps. How on earth is someone supposed to complete virtual tasks when internet speeds are extremely slow? The Ethiopian government has a monopoly on the telecom industry which has greatly stifled innovation. 
- Streets are filled with beggars ranging from young children to the disabled elderly

Addis Ababa is an overcrowded city with poor infrastructure, illitrate civilians and numerous criminals. The air is highly polluted, All water supplies are contaminated and the streets are filled with homless people and beggars.
addis-ababa.description:
Addis Ababa is a city with many differences. For those seeking adventure, it offers a lively experience, but it may be tough for some. The busy atmosphere is noticeable, and while the culture is interesting, the challenges of a developing country can be a lot to handle. You will find good cafes serving traditional food, like injera, and the relaxed vibe is good for meeting locals and other foreigners.

The cost of living is affordable compared to Western prices. However, rent can be high for what you get. The city's traffic is not great, with busy streets and few places for pedestrians, so be careful when you explore.

You may face some issues, such as slow internet and difficulty in communication. Still, the pleasant weather and friendly community make it worth it. Just stay alert, especially in crowded places. Renting a place in areas where expats live can help you feel more comfortable as you experience this interesting city. Overall, Addis offers a special adventure full of learning and cultural experiences!
addis-ababa.description_kor:
아디스아바바는 서로 다른 매력을 지닌 독특한 도시입니다. 모험을 찾는 이들에게는 활기찬 경험을 선사하지만, 어떤 이들에게는 도전이 될 수 있습니다. 도시의 분주한 분위기는 눈에 띄며, 다채로운 문화는 흥미롭지만 개발도상국의 여러 어려움은 감당하기 힘들 수 있습니다. 전통 음식인 인제라를 맛볼 수 있는 멋진 카페들도 있으며, 편안한 분위기 덕분에 지역 주민들과 외국인들과의 만남도 즐길 수 있습니다.

생활비는 서양에 비해 비교적 저렴하지만, 고급 주거 공간의 임대료는 다소 비쌀 수 있습니다. 또한, 이곳의 교통은 좋지 않아 도로가 혼잡하고 보행자를 위한 공간이 부족합니다. 그래서 탐험할 때는 각별히 조심해야 합니다.

느린 인터넷과 의사소통의 문제에 직면할 수도 있으나, 여전히 쾌적한 날씨와 따뜻한 공동체는 그만한 가치가 있습니다. 특히 혼잡한 장소에서는 항상 경계를 늦추지 않는 것이 좋습니다. 외국인들이 많이 사는 지역에서 거주하는 것은 이 흥미진진한 도시를 보다 편안하게 경험하는 데 큰 도움이 됩니다. 종합적으로 아디스아바바는 배움과 문화적 경험으로 가득 찬 특별한 모험을 제공합니다!

reviews: Always on the Top Livable Cities List, but it really should be in the Top Boring Cities List. It's like a big town, and it's kind of stuck in the past. You really feel like you are in the South. Plenty of old people & Asian students. Normal - everyone moves to Sydney or Melbourne which are incredibly more fun and exciting.
adelaide.description:
Adelaide is often seen as a good place to live, but it does not have a busy, high-energy city feel. Think of it as a large, calm town with a strong Southern influence, where life is slower. Some people find it a little too relaxed and say it feels "stuck in the past," while others enjoy its quietness. The city's population includes a mix of retirees and students, especially from Asia, which adds variety to the local culture.

Living costs are lower than in bigger cities like Sydney or Melbourne, which many people like. Public transportation is not very extensive, so having a car could make things easier. Safety is generally good, which helps you feel safe when you visit local spots like the Adelaide Zoo or the busy Central Market.

If you visit in March, you can enjoy the well-known Adelaide Festival, and don’t forget to check out the nice parks around the city. Just remember, if you want a place with constant excitement, this may not be the right city for you. Explore areas like Norwood for a taste of local life, and enjoy Adelaide's unique feel!
adelaide.description_kor:
아들레이드는 종종 살기 좋은 도시로 평가되지만, 그곳은 바쁘고 에너지 넘치는 도시의 느낌은 별로 없습니다. 차라리 큰 조용한 마을이라고 생각하는 게 좋을 것 같아요. 남부의 강한 영향을 받은 이곳은 삶의 속도가 느릴 뿐만 아니라, 어떤 사람들은 이곳이 너무 느긋하다고 느끼며 "과거에 갇힌 듯한 느낌"이라고 표현하기도 합니다. 반면에, 다른 사람들은 이 조용함을 정말 즐깁니다. 도시의 인구는 주로 아시아 출신의 은퇴자와 학생들로 구성되어 있어 지역 문화에 다양한 요소를 더하고 있습니다.

아들레이드는 시드니나 멜버른 같은 대도시에 비해 생활비가 낮아 많은 사람들이 선호합니다. 대중교통이 다소 제한적이기 때문에 자동차를 소유하면 훨씬 편리합니다. 일반적으로 안전한 편이어서 아들레이드 동물원이나 번화한 중앙 시장 같은 인기 명소를 방문할 때 안심하고 다닐 수 있습니다.

3월에 방문하면 유명한 아들레이드 페스티벌을 즐길 수 있으며, 도시 주변에 있는 아름다운 공원도 놓치지 말고 들러보세요. 그러나 계속해서 흥분을 원하신다면 이곳이 그리 적합하지 않을 수도 있습니다. 노우드와 같은 지역을 탐방하면서 지역의 분위기를 느껴보고, 아들레이드만의 독특한 매력을 느껴보세요!

reviews:
Most of the photos are a lie, the only one that is accurate is the “plaza de toros” all the others aren’t from Aguascalientes. Actually, Aguascalientes is a City, we have a pretty great urbanization, also, at least the 50% of the population have a great proficiency in English (including me), must of us are bilingual. I do really thing must of the information that you have es bay far incorrect. Also, there are better places here in which you can work than the one that is suggested here. 
Also, Aguascalientes is ranked in the very first top ten in terms of security (is really safety).

I pretty much suggest you to do a trustful and accurate review of Aguascalientes… My city.
aguascalientes.description:
If you are considering Aguascalientes, you will be pleasantly surprised. This city has a modern feel with good city planning. The famous “Plaza de Toros” is important to see, but there is much more to discover. The local people are friendly, and about half speak English, so it is easy to communicate.

Aguascalientes is one of the safest cities in Mexico, making it good for both visitors and residents. The cost of living is low, allowing you to enjoy local cafes and restaurants without spending too much. Just remember that public transportation may be limited, so having a way to get around can be useful.

You will find cultural experiences and historical sites, along with markets that have local character. When you visit, be sure to check out popular areas like Centro for their lively atmosphere. Overall, Aguascalientes offers safety, culture, and some fun! Just keep an open mind and enjoy the local traditions.
aguascalientes.description_kor:
아구아스칼리엔테스를 고려하고 계신다면, 기분 좋은 놀라움을 경험하실 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 현대적인 매력과 뛰어난 도시 계획이 잘 조화를 이루고 있습니다. 유명한 "플라자 데 토로스"를 꼭 방문해야 하지만, 발견할 것들이 훨씬 더 많습니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하고, 약 절반이 영어를 할 수 있어서 의사소통에 큰 문제가 없습니다.

아구아스칼리엔테스는 멕시코에서 가장 안전한 도시 중 하나로, 방문객과 거주자 모두에게 적합한 곳입니다. 생활비가 저렴해 지역 카페와 레스토랑을 부담 없이 즐길 수 있죠. 다만, 대중 교통이 다소 제한적일 수 있으니, 이동 수단을 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다.

이곳에서는 다양한 문화 체험과 역사적인 장소, 그리고 지역 특색이 담긴 시장들을 찾아볼 수 있습니다. 방문할 때는 활기찬 분위기를 자랑하는 센트로 같은 인기 지역도 놓치지 마세요. 전반적으로 아구아스칼리엔테스는 안전하고, 문화적 깊이가 있으며, 즐거운 경험을 선사합니다! 열린 마음으로 현지 전통과 문화를 만끽해 보세요.

reviews:
An interesting place which has a decent Russian-speaking community from post-Soviet republics. 
Pros: 
- quite affordable
- proximity to the sea/beach (plenty of condos 2-4 mins walking distance)
- Fiber Internet (50mbps is easy to get)
Cons:
- limited food options (Turkish cuisine)
- really slow at times (might be a pro for some)
- no coworking spaces
alanya.description:
Alanya is a coastal town in Turkey that is hard to resist. There is a friendly Russian-speaking community from post-Soviet countries, so you’ll notice some familiar culture as you explore. One of the great things is that it is affordable, making it easy to live near the beautiful beaches—most condos are only a short 2-4 minute walk from the sea.

The internet here is fast with fiber connections available, which is good for remote workers. However, there are not many food options beyond Turkish cuisine, and sometimes life here can feel a little slow. This relaxed atmosphere can be refreshing for some, while others may find it frustrating.

While there are no coworking spaces here, it’s a nice place if you enjoy simple living. Just be ready for limited comforts and a slower pace! If you want a calm beach life with some cultural elements, Alanya might be a good choice for you.
alanya.description_kor:
알라냐는 저항하기 힘든 매력을 가진 터키의 해안 도시입니다. 이곳에서는 포스트 소련 국가 출신의 친근한 러시아어 사용 커뮤니티를 만나볼 수 있어, 탐험하는 동안 익숙한 문화를 느끼실 수 있습니다. 이곳의 장점 중 하나는 저렴한 비용으로 아름다운 해변 가까이에 살 수 있다는 점인데, 대부분의 콘도는 해변까지 단 2-4분 거리에 위치해 있습니다.

여기 인터넷 속도는 빠르고 광섬유 연결이 가능해 원격 근무자에게 딱 알맞습니다. 하지만 터키 요리 외에 선택할 수 있는 음식이 많지 않으며, 때때로 이곳의 삶이 조금 느리게 흐르는 것처럼 느껴질 수 있습니다. 이런 느긋한 분위기는 일부 사람에게는 상쾌하게 느껴질 수 있지만, 다른 이에게는 답답하게 다가올 수도 있습니다.

여기에는 공동 작업 공간은 없지만, 간소한 생활을 즐기시면 충분히 좋은 곳입니다. 편안함이 제한되어 있고 느린 페이스에 대비해 주십시오! 다양한 문화적 요소가 어우러진 차분한 해변 생활을 원하신다면 알라냐가 훌륭한 선택이 될 수 있습니다.

reviews: Went to school nearby in Corvallis, OR at OSU. I have no idea why anyone would want to come to Albany, OR. Especially when you have several other cities in the state with more to offer.
albany.description:
Albany, Oregon, may not be known by everyone, but it has its own charm. Located in the Willamette Valley, this city has a friendly, small-town feel with many parks and outdoor areas to enjoy. From the old downtown with nice shops to the nearby hiking trails, there is a comfortable atmosphere that attracts some visitors.

However, Albany can seem quieter than nearby cities like Corvallis or Eugene, which have more activities and attractions. The cost of living is lower here, which is good, but some people find that public transportation options are a bit limited.

If you visit Albany, checking out the local craft fairs and farmers' markets can be enjoyable. Just be ready to relax and appreciate the slower pace. Whether you enjoy the local coffee or explore the nearby nature, there are some hidden spots here waiting to be found.
albany.description_kor:
오리건주 올버니는 모든 사람들이 잘 아는 곳은 아닐지도 모르지만, 그 자체로 매력이 넘치는 도시입니다. 윌라멧 밸리에 자리한 이 도시는 아늑한 소도시의 느낌을 주며, 공원과 야외 공간이 많아 여유롭게 즐길 수 있습니다. 멋진 상점이 모여 있는 구시가지를 거닐거나 인근 하이킹 코스를 탐방하며 편안한 분위기를 만끽할 수 있어 많은 방문객들이 찾곤 합니다.

올버니는 코르밸리스나 유진과 같은 인근 도시들에 비해 조용한 편이지만, 후자의 도시들은 더 다양한 활동과 명소를 제공합니다. 생활비가 비교적 낮아서 살기 좋은 곳이지만, 일부 사람들은 대중교통의 선택지가 다소 제한적이라고 느낄 수 있습니다.

올버니를 방문할 계획이라면 지역의 수공예 박람회와 농산물 시장을 꼭 들러보세요. 느긋하게 쉬면서 여유로운 일상을 즐길 준비를 하세요. 현지 커피를 맛보든, 주변 자연을 탐험하든, 숨겨진 명소들이 여러분을 기다리고 있습니다.

reviews: I really like ABQ. There is a crime problem and people complain about it all the time, but if you choose your neighborhood carefully and lock up your stuff that can mostly be avoided. Fun, sort of weird vibe with a unique culture, fascinating history, and great food. Perfect weather year round with just enough of each season without too much snow or too much heat. Bosque area or Sandia mountains are great for hiking, easy weekend getaways to New Mexico's national parks (White Sands, Carlsbad Caverns in particular are fun!) and other areas to explore (blue hole in Santa rosa, Santa Fe, Native american ruins, etc), as well as southern Colorado and Arizona. Its just a different kind of place than any other city. Good size and decent airport, but doesn't feel huge. Politically somewhat moderate- the north half of the state is liberal and the south and all the Texan transplants are conservative so it lands somewhere in the middle. Generally friendly locals and a nice melting pot of Native American, Mexican, and other cultures without a lot of judginess- very live and let live. And cheaper than almost any other "big" city in the USA. I have no idea how anyone chooses to live in Phoenix when the weather is so awful compared to ABQ, or chooses Denver when the cost of living is so high compared to ABQ. And Texas is too humid, so New Mexico is a nice little spot in the middle of all of it.
albuquerque.description:
Albuquerque is a unique city that is different from other cities. You will see a mix of cultures here because of its Native American and Mexican influences. People who like food will enjoy the local dishes, known for their special tastes, and there are always interesting events happening in the city.

One of the good things? The weather! You can experience all four seasons without extreme temperatures. The Bosque area and Sandia Mountains are great for hiking and exploring, and Albuquerque is a good starting point for day trips to places like White Sands and Carlsbad Caverns.

However, like any city, there are some issues. Crime can be a problem, but choosing your neighborhood wisely and being careful can help you stay safe. Public transport is not very good, but getting around is possible if you plan ahead. Visitors also note the friendly locals, who have a relaxed attitude.

In general, Albuquerque is affordable compared to many other large cities, making it a good place to live or visit, especially if you want a different experience with culture and nature!
albuquerque.description_kor:
앨버커키는 다른 도시들과는 확실히 다른 독특한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 이곳에서는 미국과 멕시코 문화가 아름답게 혼합된 모습을 쉽게 찾아볼 수 있습니다. 음식 애호가라면 특별한 맛으로 유명한 지역 요리를 꼭 경험해보셔야 합니다. 또한, 도시 곳곳에서 언제나 흥미로운 이벤트가 열리니, 즐길 거리가 풍부합니다.

앨버커키의 큰 장점 중 하나는 바로 날씨입니다! 극단적인 기온 없이 사계절을 고루 즐길 수 있죠. 보스케 지역과 샌디아 산맥은 하이킹과 탐험에 최적의 장소이며, 앨버커키는 화이트 샌드와 카를스배드 동굴 같은 명소로의 당일 여행을 떠나기에 좋은 출발점입니다.

하지만 다른 도시와 마찬가지로 몇 가지 고민거리가 있습니다. 범죄가 문제로 지적되기도 하지만, 이웃을 잘 선택하고 조심하면 안전한 생활이 가능합니다. 대중교통은 그다지 발달하지 않았지만, 미리 계획하면 불편함 없이 이동할 수 있습니다. 방문객들은 느긋한 성격의 친절한 지역 주민들에 대해서도 긍정적인 후기를 남깁니다.

종합적으로 보면, 앨버커키는 많은 대도시에 비해 상대적으로 저렴한 생활비로 문화와 자연이 함께 어우러진 특별한 경험을 원하는 이들에게 매력적인 장소입니다. 살기 좋고 방문하기에도 좋은 곳이에요!

reviews:
So much potential. 
Amazing coast line, well-connected airport, 2hrs drive from Lisboa. Superior winter climate.
The real estate tends to be of a higher standard than the rest of the country.

Unfortunately it is completely dominated by boomers. 
The cafes, restaurants and bars are all targeted towards older folks. Half of the places are closed in Winter.
The one exception is the brilliant Al Gharb coffee shop.
albufeira.description:
Albufeira is a small town on Portugal's coast, known for its nice beaches and relaxed atmosphere. It has an airport that is two hours from Lisbon, making it easy for visitors to reach. The winter weather here is pleasant, making it a good place to visit any time of the year. If you like nice views, you will enjoy the coastline.

However, Albufeira has some peculiarities. Many of the cafes and bars are mostly for older people, which can make the place feel a bit quiet, especially in winter when many places close. Don't miss the Al Gharb coffee shop; locals like it a lot!

If you consider living here, the real estate is usually better compared to other areas in Portugal. Just remember that getting used to local customs might be tricky, like language differences. If you want to visit or move here, look at different neighborhoods and be ready for a slower pace of life. It’s a nice place with a lot to offer, especially if you enjoy peace and quiet!
albufeira.description_kor:
알부페이라(Albufeira)는 포르투갈 해안에 위치한 아담한 도시로, 아름다운 해변과 한가로운 분위기로 많이 알려져 있습니다. 리스본에서 차로 두 시간 거리에 있는 공항 덕분에 방문객들이 쉽게 찾아올 수 있습니다. 이곳의 겨울 날씨는 쾌적해 연중 언제든지 방문하기 좋은 장소입니다. 멋진 경치를 좋아하신다면 해안을 따라 펼쳐진 경관을 만끽할 수 있을 것입니다.

다만, 알부페이라에는 몇 가지 특징이 있습니다. 많은 카페와 바가 주로 노인 분들을 위한 곳이어서, 특히 겨울철에는 여러 곳이 문을 닫게 되어 조금 조용할 수 있습니다. 알 갈르브(Al Gharb) 커피숍은 꼭 들러보세요. 현지인들에게 인기 있는 아늑한 장소입니다!

이곳에 이사를 고려하고 계신다면, 부동산 가격은 보통 포르투갈의 다른 지역보다 상대적으로 저렴합니다. 다만, 현지 문화에 적응하는 것이 쉽지 않을 수 있다는 점은 유념해 주세요. 예를 들어, 언어 장벽 같은 어려움이 있을 수 있습니다. 방문하거나 이사할 계획이라면 다양한 이웃을 탐색하고 느린 삶의 tempo에 미리 대비하세요. 평화롭고 조용한 환경을 선호하신다면, 알부페이라는 정말 매력적인 장소입니다!

reviews: I'm a native Ålesunder, and I'll be honest: this city is boring as hell. Very few cafés/restaurants/bars/museums/etc. Therefore it'll also be hard to make friends and connections. As with the rest of Norway, it's very expensive. The public transport is limited. The pros: Art Noveau architecture and lots of green areas, generally very safe city regardless of neighborhood. I'd recommend stopping by for a few days (a week tops) if you're in Norway anyway, but I would not recommend moving here for an extended period of time. (BTW: if you're in Ålesund, plan a day trip to Geiranger – the drive there takes a few hours and is well worth it!)
alesund.description:
Ålesund, with its Art Nouveau buildings and beautiful surroundings, is a place worth a short visit, especially if you are in Norway. Some locals think the city is a bit quiet, but its appeal is in the nice views and green areas around it. If you walk through the town, you will see the unique buildings that show a history of creativity.

However, you may find it expensive since Norway is known to be costly. The dining and nightlife options are not very active, so do not expect many late-night bars. Public transportation may also feel limited if you want to explore outside the city. Safety is not a major issue here, making it a calm place to walk.

For a great outing, plan a day trip to Geiranger. The views are amazing and worth the trip. Whether you stay for a few days or are just passing through, Ålesund gives a nice mix of culture and nature, suitable for a short getaway.
alesund.description_kor:
알레순(Alesund)은 아르 누보 스타일의 건물과 아름다운 자연이 어우러진 매력적인 도시로, 노르웨이를 방문한다면 꼭 들릴 만한 곳입니다. 일부 현지인들은 이 도시가 조금 조용하다고 생각할 수도 있지만, 알레순의 진정한 매력은 멋진 풍경과 넓은 녹지 공간에 있습니다. 시내를 걷다 보면 창의성의 역사를 담고 있는 독특한 건물들을 만나볼 수 있습니다.

노르웨이가 일반적으로 비용이 많이 드는 곳이기 때문에, 예산에 따라 다소 부담스러울 수 있습니다. 또한 식사나 야간 활동의 선택지가 많지 않아 늦은 밤에는 바가 거의 없으니 이 점은 미리 알고 가시길 바랍니다. 시 외곽을 여행하고 싶다면 대중교통이 다소 제한적일 수 있으니 참고하세요. 하지만 이곳은 안전한 지역으로, 걷기에도 매우 평화로운 곳입니다.

만약 멋진 외출을 원하신다면, 게이랑에르(Geiranger)로 당일 여행을 계획해보세요. 그곳의 경치는 정말 환상적이며, 여행할 가치가 충분합니다. 짧게 머물든지, 며칠 간 휴가를 즐기든지 간에 알레순은 문화와 자연이 조화를 이루는 곳으로, 훌륭한 휴양지입니다.

reviews:
Very convenient, dirty, good weather and affordable. Overall it's a harsh city environment, which paradoxically typically shapes friendly people. I saw only a handful of westerners / tourists in my month (June) in Alexandria. You order everything. Food ie meals, groceries, clothes everything seems available 24 hours. People are nice. It's unique and different world. I thought it would be similar to Turkey. It's very different to any place I have been to. 
Note I would choose Alexandria over Cairo just for the weather (I was here in June).

I lived in Alexandria from 2001 to 2003. The air pollution doesn't stagnate because it's blown inland, unlike Cairo, and the quality of life is better. I have happy memories. I went back for a visit in 2008 and it hadn't really changed, but since then Egypt has endured tumultuous times.
alexandria.description:
Alexandria is a city that provides a rich experience, mixing history with local life. Known for its nice weather, especially in the summer, many visitors find it a good alternative to busy Cairo. The city is affordable, making it easy to enjoy local meals and shop for clothes or groceries almost any time of day—you can order just about anything at any hour!

While Alexandria may sometimes seem a bit dirty, this aspect adds to the friendliness of its people. Locals are welcoming, giving you a chance to see a different side of life compared to usual tourist areas; you might hardly see other Western visitors during your trip.

If you plan to visit, be ready for some challenges like language barriers and using public transport, which is not as developed as in other large cities. But with its beautiful coastal views, local traditions, and a slower way of living, Alexandria certainly makes a strong impression. Just remember to look beyond the obvious and enjoy the city’s history!
alexandria.description_kor:
알렉산드리아는 역사와 지역 문화가 어우러진 풍요로운 경험을 제공하는 도시입니다. 특히 여름철에는 좋은 날씨로 인해 많은 관광객들이 바쁜 카이로의 훌륭한 대안으로 이곳을 선택합니다. 알렉산드리아는 비용이 저렴해 언제든지 맛있는 지역 음식을 즐기거나 의류 및 식료품 쇼핑을 쉽게 할 수 있습니다. 원하는 것을 언제든지 주문할 수 있는 편리함도 큰 매력입니다.

이 도시는 가끔 더러워 보이기도 하지만, 그럼에도 불구하고 주민들의 따뜻한 환대가 더욱 감동적입니다. 현지인들은 관광지와는 다른 삶의 모습을 보여주며, 방문객들을 친근하게 맞아줍니다. 여행하는 동안 다른 서구 관광객을 거의 만나지 못할 수도 있습니다.

여러분이 알렉산드리아를 방문할 계획이라면, 언어 장벽이나 대중교통 이용 등 몇 가지 도전에 대비하는 것이 좋습니다. 이곳의 대중교통은 다른 대도시에 비해 발달이 덜 되어 있습니다. 하지만 아름다운 해안 풍경과 지역 전통, 여유로운 생활 방식 덕분에 알렉산드리아는 확실히 강한 인상을 남깁니다. 뚜렷한 것들 너머의 풍경을 바라보며, 이 도시의 역사를 즐기는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews:
will be top destination in a few years. lot of nomads, amazing beach, very cheap, good food, gyms, park, golf, etc.

I recommend it.

Went there for a few days at the beginning of October. The weather was perfect for going to the beach with warm water. It has great restaurants and during that time it wasn't that crowded as it looks like their vacation spot for summer. A few days are enough to enjoy the whole city.

Really hot in the summer. 
Many old Boomer retire there. 
San Juan Beach is really nice 
Food is simple as Spanish love to deepfry
alicante.description:
Alicante is becoming a popular place to visit in Spain, and it's easy to understand why! Visitors talk about the nice San Juan Beach, where the warm water and good weather make it a fun day in the sun. The city has many food options, with lots of simple but tasty dishes, often fried in the typical Spanish style. It is known as a good place to relax and also enjoy activities like golfing and going to the gym.

Many expats and retirees have made this city their home, especially in the warmer months, but it is quieter and more pleasant in October, allowing for exploration without the summer crowds. The cost of living is quite low, which is attractive for those who want to enjoy the local lifestyle.

However, be ready for the summer heat and some language difficulties, as not everyone speaks English. Public transportation could be better too, so it’s best to plan how to get around. Engage with the local culture and enjoy a few days experiencing everything this nice city has to offer!
alicante.description_kor:
알리칸테는 스페인에서 인기 있는 관광지로 떠오르고 있으며, 그 이유는 쉽게 이해할 수 있습니다! 많은 방문객들이 따뜻한 바다와 화창한 날씨 덕분에 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있는 아름다운 산 후안 해변을 언급합니다. 이 도시는 다채로운 음식 옵션을 제공하며, 간단하면서도 맛있는 요리가 많아 전통적인 스페인식으로 자주 튀겨져 나옵니다. 휴식하기 좋은 장소로도 유명하고, 골프나 헬스장 같은 다양한 액티비티를 즐기기에도 좋습니다.

수많은 외국인과 퇴직자들이 이곳을 제2의 집으로 정착시켰으며, 특히 따뜻한 계절에 많이 방문하지만 10월에는 한적하고 쾌적해 여름의 인파 없이 탐험하기에 안성맞춤입니다. 또한 생활비가 비교적 저렴해 현지 라이프스타일을 즐기려는 사람들에게 매력적인 선택지입니다. 

하지만 여름의 더위와 언어 장벽에는 주의해야 합니다. 모든 사람들이 영어를 잘 구사하는 것은 아니니까요. 대중교통 또한 개선이 필요하기 때문에, 미리 이동 수단을 계획해 두는 게 좋습니다. 지역 문화를 경험하고 이 멋진 도시가 제공하는 모든 것을 만끽하며 며칠간의 휴가를 즐겨보세요!

reviews: The people are open, warm and enthusiastic with travelers. Service is brilliant (generally) - much better then Europe. WIFI is poor, drivers have one hand holding their mobile and the other on the horn. Really nice "pace" and the diverse ethnicity get along beautifully. This is NOT BORAT land - Almaty is 2.7 million people.

+ Very small hipster scene but nice... techno place, hipster cocktail, hipster café, tattoo scene... its not that indie though, like organised hipster. still too small, you always go to same places
+ Really good service, fast, they come and pour you water while drinking cokctail and stuff, cray
+ Young people who can speak english are friendly, come speak to you easily and are all like "wtf are u doing here"
+ Not a busy city, you feel you can take your time here, go to ice rink, walk in park
+ Nature and mountain not too far, its common to take car 30 min to go iceskating in mountain
+/- Everyone with a car is a taxi driver, so u rarely use Uber/YandexTaxi, just go on the road, show your hand and people stop, you tell destination and it costs 1$. Problem you need to speak russian, im not good enough yet
+/- People are mixed friendly. They are very nice and give you stuff and all when you are introduced, but people who dont speak english and dont know you, they are not helpful and a bit rude
+/- city safety idk, I feel safe but every local tells me it's not a safe city
- No one speak english ffs
- city is bullshit communist wide street for car, shitty to walk, everything is far, cars everywhere, city center is not a city center, 4-lane in city center wtf fix this
- Police is corrupt and not your friend. My only encounter with them was ok tho
- People behavior is oldschool, men harrassing girls, men buying big car or iphone has status symbol, men trying to fight, girls expecting guys to be alpha male
- Always fog in city and pollution
almaty.description:
Almaty is a city in Kazakhstan that has a lot of character and friendly people. Locals are usually welcoming and like to talk, especially if you smile and are patient with the language differences. Many young people speak English, but it can vary, particularly outside of trendy areas.

The food and service here are good, often better than in some European places, which makes eating out enjoyable. However, be prepared for busy streets where drivers frequently use their horns. Public transport can be difficult to use, but locals might offer to give you a ride for a low cost—just know a bit of Russian for the best experience.

Almaty is not only a city; it is also a center of culture, with nice parks and nearby mountains that are great for ice skating and hiking. There is a growing trendy scene, but choices can still be limited, so you might find yourself returning to places you like. Safety can be uncertain; while many people feel safe, some have concerns. With all its unique features, Almaty encourages you to explore, but stay aware of your surroundings and enjoy your time at a relaxed pace!
almaty.description_kor:
알마티는 카자흐스탄에 위치한 도시로, 독특한 매력과 친절한 사람들이 가득합니다. 현지인들은 대체로 환영해주며, 특히 미소를 띠고 느긋한 태도로 대화를 나누는 것을 좋아합니다. 많은 젊은이들이 영어를 구사하지만, 특히 트렌디한 지역을 벗어나면 다양한 수준의 영어가 사용될 수 있습니다.

이곳의 음식과 서비스는 상당히 퀄리티가 높아서, 일부 유럽의 식당보다 나은 경우도 많아 외식하는 것이 즐겁습니다. 하지만 거리의 혼잡함에 대비해 운전자가 자주 경적을 울린다는 점은 기억해두세요. 대중교통은 다소 불편할 수 있지만, 현지인들이 저렴한 비용으로 태워줄 수도 있으니 최상의 경험을 원하신다면 약간의 러시아어를 배워두면 유용할 것입니다.

알마티는 그저 일상적인 도시가 아니라, 문화의 중심지로서 멋진 공원과 가까운 산들이 있어 아이스 스케이팅과 하이킹을 즐기기에 매우 좋습니다. 스타일리시한 장면도 점점 성장하고 있지만, 선택할 수 있는 옵션이 여전히 제한적일 수 있어 자주 가는 장소에 다시 돌아가게 될지도 모릅니다. 안전에 대해 불안함을 느낄 수 있지만, 대부분의 사람들은 안전하다고 느끼고, 일부는 여전히 걱정을 하곤 합니다. 알마티는 여러분을 탐험하도록 유도하지만, 주변을 잘 살피고 여유로운 속도로 시간을 즐기는 것을 권장합니다!

reviews:
This was my first experience living in the Middle East. I lived here 2 years. It's such a diferent culture: the dressing, the food, the music, their traditions.

 It's more modern than some other Arab countries but it is still a male dominant society. Female don't have a very active role in the public Jordanian society. Of course I met many couples where the woman is the dominant one and makes all the desicions, but it is the man that takes action in public. 

As the minimum national salaries are around 300JD -395 Euros, I was expecting Amman to be cheaper, but surprisingly prices are similar to many Europeans capitals. Just housing can be cheaper depending on neighbourhood.
Amman is a dirty, crowded, trafficking and a poor city with some rich well kept neighbours, like Abdoun.
There is no much Middle class. It's a big contrast between luxury and poverty. And the government don't seem to care how can people survive with a salary of 300JD while the cheapest house is 300/ 350JD. The wives normally don't work. It's a family support system.

Foreigns pay more in places like the Downtown. That used to be a more traditional area and now is more "modernized"due to tourism.

To avoid male attention, I would recommend woman to just wear big cleavages and mini skirts in clubs and bars, in rich neighbours. Female foreigns are considered easy and promiscuous for having boyfriends and not marrying virgin.

Arabs are friendly but that doesn't mean that they like you. They are very envious, love to brag and to show off and the majority is inexperienced. They leave parents home to marry. The ones that studied in university maybe are a bit different. 
Traffic is crazy and people don't follow any rules. They just respect traffic police and red traffic lights.
There are not many public transports . There are buses that are cheap but crowed and just used by poor people. Other option is uber. Taxis can be dirty and taxi drivers may smoke and talk on the phone while driving a client . There is no train or metro. So it's cars and people walking in the middle of the road s there are no side walks or zebras. side walks are used for stores, for trees or parking cars. Amman is not a walkble city. 

If you have money to spend and just stay around the better areas, you will love Amman.

Much more livable that I expected. Downtown is a bit dusty and unclean, but suburbs are great, with lots of restaurants and malls. Furthermore Jordan is smaller than it seems, there is basically one road crossing the country from North to South and you can always visit Petra or the beaches of Aqaba in a daytrip. Just avoid Ramadan as it can be very annoying for foreigners with all the restrictions.
amman.description:
Amman is a city with many differences, mixing old traditions with new styles. Imagine busy streets where the smell of spices is strong, and people often gather together. Locals describe the culture as lively, with interesting music, tasty food, and special customs that make everyday life exciting.

However, like any city, it has its problems. The cost of living can be high compared to the average salary, making it difficult for many residents. If you plan to live here, be aware that public transport is somewhat limited, so you will need to use taxis or Uber—just don't expect a perfect ride!

Safety is usually okay, but women should dress modestly outside of clubs and bars since cultural rules can be strict. Areas like Abdoun are known for being nice, while Downtown has a more traditional feel with some modern shops.

If you have some money to spend, there is a lot to see: from the famous Petra to the nice beaches of Aqaba, all within a day's trip. Just keep in mind that Amman's traffic can be busy, so it's important to be patient!
amman.description_kor:
암만은 오래된 전통과 현대적 스타일이 어우러진 독특한 도시입니다. 향신료의 진한 향이 감도는 분주한 거리와 사람들의 활기찬 모습을 상상해보세요. 지역 주민들은 이곳의 문화를 다양한 음악과 맛있는 음식, 그리고 일상을 풍성하게 만드는 특별한 관습으로 표현합니다.

하지만 다른 도시들과 마찬가지로 몇 가지 문제도 존재합니다. 평균 급여에 비해 생활비가 높아서 많은 주민들이 어려움을 겪고 있는 실정입니다. 이곳에서 생활할 계획이라면 대중교통이 다소 불편하다는 점을 고려해야 하며, 택시나 우버를 이용해야 할 것입니다. 완벽한 승차감을 기대하기는 어려우니 참고하세요!

대체로 안전한 편이지만, 여성들은 클럽이나 바 밖에서는 단정한 복장이 좋습니다. 문화적인 규범이 다소 엄격할 수 있으니 유의해야 합니다. 압두운 지역은 멋진 관광지로 유명하고, 다운타운은 현대적인 상점들이 있는 전통적인 분위기를 지니고 있습니다.

여유 자금이 있다면 볼거리도 많습니다. 세계적으로 유명한 페트라에서부터 아카바의 아름다운 해변까지 모두 하루 여행으로 다녀올 수 있습니다. 다만, 암만의 교통이 혼잡할 수 있으니 인내심을 가지고 계획하는 것이 중요합니다!

reviews: What I tell people is it's windy, dusty and at times smells like cow poop. It's hot and if not it's cold. The water tastes terrible but will keep you from dying. BUT, the people are great, I have met only one sourpuss and he was from L.A. OH well, the rest make up for it. love it here.
amarillo.description:
Amarillo is a city that is very authentic. This Texas city is known for its cowboy style and open spaces. It is windy and dusty, and you might notice the smell of farm life, which is not always pleasant. The weather can change a lot too—hot in the summer and cold in the winter—so dress accordingly!

Life here has a friendly small-town feel. The people are nice and welcoming, and while you may meet a few unfriendly ones, most are really pleasant.

Attractions like Cadillac Ranch and the Big Texan Steak Ranch provide unique experiences, mixing local culture with interesting art and famous food challenges. Just be careful about the water—it may not be the best, but it works.

If you plan to visit, it is important to have a car because public transportation is not very good. Check out local diners and walk through the neighborhoods; you will find special places and real Texan kindness! Just bring some water bottles for the hot days and enjoy everything Amarillo has to offer!
amarillo.description_kor:
아마리요는 아주 진정한 도시입니다. 이 텍사스 도시는 카우보이 스타일과 넓은 대지가 유명하죠. 바람이 불고 먼지가 날리는 날이 많아 농촌의 향취를 느낄 수 있지만, 모든 순간이 편안한 것은 아닙니다. 날씨도 많이 변덕스럽습니다. 여름에는 덥고 겨울에는 춥기 때문에 옷차림에 신경 쓰는 게 좋습니다!

이곳에서의 삶은 소도시의 따뜻한 느낌을 줍니다. 사람들은 친절하고 반갑게 맞아주며, 가끔 불친절한 사람을 만나기도 하지만, 대체로 사람들은 정말 친절합니다.

카드릴락 랜치나 빅 텍산 스테이크 랜치 같은 명소들은 특별한 경험을 제공합니다. 지역의 문화와 흥미로운 예술, 그리고 유명한 음식 도전까지 다채롭게 즐길 수 있습니다. 물에 대해서는 조금 유의하세요. 가장 깨끗하진 않지만, 사용할 수는 있으니 괜찮습니다.

방문할 계획이라면 자동차는 필수입니다. 대중교통이 그리 원활하지 않거든요. 지역 식당도 둘러보고 동네를 걸어보세요. 그러면 독특한 장소와 진정한 텍사스의 따뜻함을 느낄 수 있을 거예요! 더운 날에 대비해 물병도 챙기고, 아마리요의 모든 매력을 만끽하세요!

reviews:
Coworking Antalya is always praised here. 
I can't disagree more. It's overpriced for rocked down furniture and basically charge you western European prices. 
The only advantage they have that they are the only coworking in the center.

Antalya is kind of nice, maybe better in autumn and spring, as it's super touristic.
Also, i think one month is more than enough.
Keep in mind that you need a VPN for some tools, and also then they don't work really well.

Pros:
1) Amazing coworking space (Coworking Antalya) with lots of events and cool people and the best outdoor working terrace ever (proper desk chairs + plug sockets + good wifi). 
2) Good value activities e.g. rafting for 20euros.
3) Local women very attractive and can sometimes be friendly
Cons:
1) Not particularly cheap in nice restuarants, basically London/Lisbon prices. 
2) Maybe too hot for some (I like the heat personally)
3) Alcohol expensive

I would recommend doing a month.

Antalya has been growing so much as a DN destination...
There are events and meetups every day of the week. Most of them centered around Coworking Antalya. They solved the problem of inspiring workspace with their facilities right in the center of town with an extraordinary sea view. 
The great thing about Antalya as a destination is that you get it all: amenities of a big city (without the chaos of Istanbul), nature, culture, beaches, history, nightlife etc. Despite the heavy inflation, it's still reasonably affordable for those who earn In Euro or USD. The people are super friendly and easy going. And the nomad and expat community is rather interesting because there's a great diversity of nationalities that you don't get to meet in most famous DN-destinations.

Generally favorable on Antalya, but not perfect. The weather was excellent (~26 C almost every day) and the nature of the city is absolutely stunning. The mountains on the west side of the city seem to just explode out of the ocean and it's special to see. That said, the built environment is pretty uninspiring. The center of the city is full of interesting restaurants and shops, but outside of the old town it's not very exciting to look at. My primary complaint, however, is on public transit. It's easy to use the tram to get to/from the airport and bus station, but outside of those destinations you better be ready to walk (or use a cab, which I try to never do). Wifi was solid but I did have some drops here and there, my apartment was decent, and the city felt pretty safe. It's also incredibly cheap. I tend to be very frugal, so take this with a grain of salt, but you can easily get a quality meal for about $4 US and would have no problem getting an awesome meal for $8 US. Overall, I enjoyed it, but I wouldn't have wanted to stay much longer than the two weeks I was there.

i wanted to reply to one of the review that gave 3/5 to Antalya. I think Antalya deserves much better! It's a huge city of 2million inhabitants and it still feel super great because of the nature, the parks, the mountains, the sea, the culture, etc. It's true that locals don't really speak English but they are super nice and try to communicate with you the way they can. For taxi, there is literally taxi buttons every few meters in all the streets: you click on the button, and a taxi is coming withing a minute. For internet, you should buy the simcard in the city center, it's gonna be cheaper than at the airport. Btw Wikipedia is not blocked in 2020. You have many food and cafe options, after traveling the world Antalya is one of the best places I've been. One thing though: it needs a bigger digital nomad community and better coworking spaces.

Antalya is not that bad, but here are the problems:
1) Not much in terms of co-working options. Feels like there are just a few options there. I found one coworking space, but honestly doesn't feel like a nomad place
2) Too few people speak English. It's really a struggle to communicate.
3) Feels too slow sometimes
4) No ridesharing apps. Literally. The only option is to book traditional taxis.
5) Internet is slow, including Airbnb's
6) Mobile internet plans are expensive. Not worth it.
7) VPN is a must. Wikipedia is blocked, for example.

On a flip side:
1) Airbnb's are cheap
2) Many options to go in the mountains, etc. Beautiful place.
3) Has a potential to grow

Overall 3/5 I would say. Not bad, but there are better places for nomads.

Antalya is becoming more and more popular for digital nomads because of great city life, amazing nature (sea + mountains), a great beach park right in the center, a walkable and bicycle-friendly center, multiple international connections from its international airport (that also has a tramway to the center of the city for around $0,50), cheap prices for a high quality of life. And Turkey is of course famous for being very hospitable and offering tasty food!

We need some options for coworking spaces but I'm sure there will be many soon. 

Antalya is my favorite city in Turkey so far :)

one of the most popular spots for european and russian tourists during summer (june-july-august). especially its counties are known for beaches, resorts and other natural beauties. temperature can be over 40 degrees.
antalya.description:
Antalya is a popular spot on Turkey’s southwestern coast, and it is becoming a favorite for digital nomads and travelers. With its combination of beaches, mountains, and historical sites, this city offers both natural beauty and culture. Many visitors like the weather, especially in spring and autumn when it's warm but not too hot.

One notable place is Coworking Antalya, where you can work outside with a view of the sea. Just keep in mind that while it has a good community atmosphere and events, some people think the prices are a bit high compared to other coworking spaces around the world.

When it comes to eating, you can find good meals at reasonable prices, but some nicer restaurants are similar to Western prices. Public transport is okay, but you might need a taxi or a walk to get around. Language can be a challenge, but locals are friendly and willing to help.

With its nice parks, friendly atmosphere, and interesting mix of cultures, Antalya is more than just a tourist destination—it’s a place where you can enjoy both relaxation and fun!
antalya.description_kor:
안탈리아는 터키 남서부 해안에 위치한 매력적인 관광지로, 디지털 노마드와 여행자들 사이에서 점점 더 인기를 얻고 있습니다. 해변, 산, 그리고 역사적인 명소가 조화를 이루는 이 도시는 자연의 아름다움과 풍부한 문화를 한꺼번에 느낄 수 있는 곳입니다. 많은 방문객들이 특히 봄과 가을에 이곳의 날씨를 즐기는 이유는, 이 시기에 따뜻하면서도 너무 덥지 않기 때문입니다.

특히 주목할 만한 장소 중 하나는 코워킹 안탈리아(Coworking Antalya)입니다. 이곳에서는 바다를 바라보며 야외에서 작업할 수 있는 즐거움을 누릴 수 있습니다. 활기찬 커뮤니티와 다양한 이벤트가 있지만, 일부 사람들은 다른 지역의 코워킹 스페이스에 비해 가격이 약간 비싼 편이라고 느끼기도 하니 참고하시기 바랍니다.

식사에 있어서는 합리적인 가격으로 훌륭한 음식을 찾을 수 있지만, 몇몇 인기 있는 레스토랑은 서양의 가격 수준과 비슷할 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 괜찮지만, 이동할 때는 택시를 타거나 걸어야 할 경우가 많습니다. 언어 소통에 어려움이 있을 수 있지만, 지역 주민들은 매우 친절하며 도움을 주고자 합니다.

아름다운 공원, 따뜻한 분위기, 흥미로운 문화가 어우러진 안탈리아는 단순한 관광지가 아니라, 휴식과 재미를 동시에 즐길 수 있는 특별한 장소입니다!

reviews: İt is capital city of turkey and very safe enjoyable environment , relax and warm place :)
ankara.description:
Ankara, the capital of Turkey, is a city that combines a relaxed feeling with a lot of history. Visitors often say that the city feels safe and enjoyable, making it good for both exploring and resting. The warm weather invites you to walk through its large parks and comfortable cafes.

Culture is alive here, with many museums and galleries showing Turkey’s heritage. Do not miss the Atatürk Mausoleum, which is important for anyone wanting to learn about the country’s history. While living costs are mostly low, some areas can be more expensive, especially for eating out.

It is fairly easy to get around, but you might find public transport a bit limited, so it is good to plan your trips ahead of time. A helpful tip: learning a few words in Turkish can help you connect with locals.

For a look at the local scene, visit neighborhoods like Kızılay, where you will find busy shops and good street food. Overall, Ankara’s welcoming atmosphere and rich culture make it a special place in Turkey.
ankara.description_kor:
앙카라는 터키의 수도로서, 편안한 분위기와 깊은 역사를 함께 간직한 도시입니다. 방문객들은 이 도시의 안전하고 즐거운 느낌을 자주 언급하며, 탐험과 휴식 모두에 적합하다고 이야기합니다. 따뜻한 날씨 덕분에 넓은 공원과 아늑한 카페를 산책하기에 아주 좋습니다.

이곳은 문화가 생생하게 살아 있으며, 많은 박물관과 갤러리가 터키의 유산을 잘 보여줍니다. 나라의 역사에 대해 더 알고 싶다면 아타튀르크 묘소를 꼭 방문해보세요. 생활비는 전반적으로 저렴하지만, 외식할 경우 일부 지역은 상대적으로 비쌀 수 있습니다.

교통은 꽤 편리한 편이지만, 대중교통이 다소 한정적일 수 있으니 미리 여행 계획을 세우는 것이 좋습니다. 유용한 팁으로는, 터키어 몇 마디를 배우는 것이 현지인들과의 소통에 큰 도움이 됩니다.

현지 분위기를 제대로 느끼고 싶다면, 활기 넘치는 상점들과 맛있는 길거리 음식을 즐길 수 있는 키질라이(Kızılay) 같은 동네를 방문해 보세요. 전반적으로 앙카라의 따뜻한 분위기와 풍부한 문화는 터키에서 특별한 매력을 만들어냅니다.

reviews:
Ao Nang is a Good Hub for jumping into other beaches and islands.
A few services are available for everyday use ( restaurants, bars, laundry, markets, shops, etc ).
Still, I consider it quite underdevelop.
Internet connectivity was quite intermittent on the two places I stayed. Also, not many places to get work done!
I always worked from my villa room.
Highly suggest staying by Nopparatthara beach rather than Ao Nang side.
No many nomads in here aswell
not a good place to get work done. limited cafes and slow internet speed
ao-nang.description:
Ao Nang is a small coastal town that serves as a starting point to some of Thailand's nice beaches and islands. Whether you want to relax in the sun or check out nearby sights, Ao Nang is a good place for your trips.

The town has some restaurants, bars, and shops, but many visitors think it is a little less developed than other places. You will find what you need for daily life, but if you want to work remotely, it might be hard. Internet connection can be inconsistent, and only a few cafes have good spaces for people who work online.

If you plan to stay, think about the Nopparatthara beach area for a quieter experience, away from the busier part of Ao Nang. Enjoy the local culture and relaxed atmosphere, but remember that there are limited public transportation options for getting around. Overall, Ao Nang is good for beach lovers who want to relax, but it might not meet everyone’s work needs!
ao-nang.description_kor:
아오낭은 태국의 아름다운 해변과 섬으로 가는 출발점 역할을 하는 작은 해안 마을입니다. 태양 아래에서 편안히 쉬고 싶거나 근처의 관광지를 구경하고 싶다면 아오낭은 여행하기에 훌륭한 장소입니다.

이 마을에는 몇몇 레스토랑, 바, 상점이 있지만, 많은 방문자들은 다른 인기 명소에 비해 약간 덜 개발된 느낌을 받기도 합니다. 일상생활에 필요한 기본적인 것들은 찾을 수 있지만, 원격 근무를 희망한다면 조금 어려움을 겪을 수도 있습니다. 인터넷 연결이 불안정할 수 있으며, 온라인 작업을 위한 괜찮은 카페는 몇 곳에 불과합니다.

아오낭에서 머무를 계획이라면, 번화한 지역에서 벗어나 조용한 경험을 원하신다면 놉빠랏타라 해변 근처를 고려해보세요. 이곳에서 현지 문화를 즐기고 편안한 분위기를 만끽할 수 있지만, 이동을 위한 대중교통 옵션이 제한적이라는 점은 유념하셔야 합니다. 전반적으로 아오낭은 휴식을 원하는 해변 애호가에게는 적합하지만, 모든 사람의 업무 요구를 충족하기는 어려울 수 있습니다!

reviews: As a very sociable expat who's been living here for the past 2 years, and with still no friends outside of work, I can say it's HARD making friends in Antwerp.
antwerp.description:
Antwerp is a nice city in Belgium where the old and the new blend well together. You will enjoy walking through its old streets, with interesting buildings and good museums nearby. The fashion scene here is lively, making it a good place for those who like shopping and design.

However, some people find it hard to meet new friends outside of work, which can make it a bit difficult to settle in. There may also be challenges with the language, especially if you don’t speak Dutch or French well.

Living costs in Antwerp can vary; some things, like eating out, can be expensive while others are quite affordable. Public transportation is usually good, but can be limited in some areas, so it's useful to plan your journeys.

Make sure to visit the Cathedral of Our Lady and the busy port area. Just take your time and explore all the cafes and bars—they are good places to start meeting new people!
antwerp.description_kor:
안트워프는 벨기에에 위치한 멋진 도시로, 오래된 건축물과 현대적인 요소들이 조화롭게 어우러져 있습니다. 흥미로운 건물들이 늘어선 오래된 거리와 훌륭한 박물관들을 걷는 것은 정말 즐거운 경험이 될 거예요. 이곳의 패션 씬은 아주 활기차서 쇼핑과 디자인을 좋아하는 사람들에게 안성맞춤인 장소입니다.

하지만 일부 사람들은 직장 외에서 새로운 친구를 사귀기가 어려워 정착하는 데 어려움을 느낄 수 있어요. 특히 네덜란드어나 프랑스어에 익숙하지 않다면 언어적으로 힘든 부분이 있을 수도 있죠.

안트워프의 생활비는 다양하게 나타납니다. 외식 비용은 비싼 편이지만, 다른 것들은 상대적으로 저렴할 수 있어요. 대중교통은 대체로 괜찮지만, 일부 지역에서는 다소 제한적일 수 있으니 여행 계획을 잘 세우는 것이 좋습니다.

성모 마리아 대성당과 활기찬 항구 지역은 꼭 가보셔야 할 명소예요. 여유를 가지고 모든 카페와 바를 둘러보면 새로운 사람들을 만나는 좋은 기회가 될 거예요!

reviews:
I spent two months in Arequipa and loved most of it! Lovely people and a lot of nature around. The beautiful Colca Canyon is near, where you can also see the Andean Condor or book multiple-day hiking tours. It is close to Puno which you should visit as well and it's easy to go to Cusco from here, to see the famous Macchu Picchu.

For working it wasn't that great, unfortunately, with slow internet and the available coworking spaces not quite as nice as I had hoped. It's still okay though, so not terrible.

The city itself is nice. Traffic can be terrible at times and taxi drivers never have change (ugh...) but old town is wonderful and the zocalo super beautiful. There are some nice bars as well. Everything is cheap of course and the locals really friendly.

So all in all it depends what you are looking for but if you like nature and speak some amount of Spanish you should consider Arequipa for some time!
arequipa.description:
Arequipa is a city that attracts anyone who visits. It is known for its natural beauty and is a good base for exploring nearby places like the Colca Canyon, where you can see the Andean Condor. It is also close to Puno and Cusco, making it easy to enjoy more of Peru.

The old town is a main attraction, with its nice streets and the square that is good for experiencing the local atmosphere. The cost of living is affordable, and locals are friendly. Do not miss the busy bars—just remember to bring small bills, as taxi drivers often do not have change!

On the other hand, some visitors find the internet speed slow, and the coworking spaces may not satisfy everyone. Also, be ready for some traffic problems. If you can handle these issues and know some Spanish, Arequipa can be a great experience full of culture and adventure!
arequipa.description_kor:
아레키파는 누구에게나 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳은 자연의 아름다움이 돋보이며, 앤디안 콘도르를 관찰할 수 있는 콜카 캐년과 같은 인근 명소를 탐험하기에 최적의 거점이죠. 게다가 푸노와 쿠스코와 가깝기 때문에 페루 여행을 더욱 수월하게 즐길 수 있습니다.

구시가지에서는 아름다운 거리와 현지 분위기를 느낄 수 있는 광장을 구경할 수 있습니다. 생활비도 저렴하고, 현지인들은 매우 친절합니다. 바쁜 바를 놓치지 마세요! 단, 택시 기사들이 종종 거스름돈이 부족하니, 작은 돈을 챙기는 것을 잊지 마세요!

그러나 일부 방문객들은 인터넷 속도가 느리다고 느낄 수도 있고, 코워킹 스페이스가 모두의 기대를 충족시키지 못할 수도 있습니다. 교통 문제도 있을 수 있으니 미리 준비해 주세요. 이런 점들을 감안하고 스페인어를 조금 알고 있다면 아레키파는 문화와 모험이 넘치는 멋진 경험이 될 것입니다!

reviews: Asheville is an extremely new age micro metropolis where everyone is obsessed with healing their inner child. Food is good though.
Absolutely LOVE Asheville. So much, that it's now my home base. Beautiful scenery, great hikes, and one of the best food & art scenes in the US. If you're debating visiting, just do it.
asheville.description:
Asheville is a small city in the mountains, where people enjoy a relaxed way of life. It's a great place for food lovers, with many restaurants that offer a variety of meals and drinks. There is also a lively art scene, with galleries and street art that show the city's creativity. 

The outdoors is very nice, with great hiking trails and views nearby. Residents enjoy the beautiful scenery, making it a good place for weekend nature trips. However, it can be a bit expensive, so plan your spending well.

Public transport is not very extensive, so having a car could make getting around easier. The locals are friendly, but you might notice some unique local language if you are not familiar with it.

Popular neighborhoods each have their own feel, but wherever you go, you will experience a friendly atmosphere. If you want a place that helps you unwind and reconnect, Asheville might be the right choice for you!
asheville.description_kor:
아시빌은 산속에 위치한 아담한 도시로, 사람들을 위한 편안한 삶의 방식을 제공합니다. 다양한 음식과 음료를 즐길 수 있는 레스토랑들이 많아 음식 애호가들에게 최적의 장소입니다. 또한, 갤러리와 거리 예술이 어우러져 도시의 창의성을 뽐내는 활기찬 예술 씬도 매력적입니다.

자연 경관이 정말 아름다워서, 근처에는 훌륭한 하이킹 코스와 경치 좋은 장소들이 많습니다. 주민들은 멋진 풍경을 즐기고 있으며, 주말마다 자연을 만끽하기에 좋은 곳입니다. 다만, 약간의 비용이 들 수 있으니 지출 계획을 잘 세우는 것이 중요합니다.

대중교통이 그다지 발달하지 않아서, 차량을 이용하면 좀 더 편리하게 이동할 수 있습니다. 지역 주민들은 친절하지만, 처음 방문하는 경우 특유의 지역적인 표현이나 언어에 낯설 수 있습니다.

각 인기 있는 동네마다 고유의 분위기가 있지만, 어디를 가더라도 친근한 느낌을 받을 수 있습니다. 만약 편안하게 쉬고 재충전할 수 있는 장소를 찾고 있다면, 아시빌은 당신에게 안성맞춤일 것입니다!

reviews: Wonderful city, but for Europeans it might be shocking how low the walkability actually is. Everything is spread out far, and the city is beautiful, but the cars are definitely number one priority in the (rather young) Citys Architecture. Yandex taxi or busses will get you around pretty well. In winter you'll spend most of your time in cafes and work from there. I have to disagree with the suggested "best coffee" place. Visit "Kul'tura Diktuyet" in syganak street ten and ask Radmir for a cappuccino. You won't need to find any other coffee place after that. Great, fast, stable wifi, funny staff and you can work in peace as well.
astana.description:
Astana, the capital of Kazakhstan, is a city known for its unique charm and modern buildings. You will see a mix of old traditions and new influences in its skyline. However, be ready for the city to be hard to walk around; many visitors find it spread out, with many cars. But you can easily get around by taking a Yandex taxi or a bus.

When winter arrives, sitting in local cafes is a popular activity. You should visit “Kul'tura Diktuyet” on Syganak Street 10 for a good cappuccino—just ask for Radmir! It has good WiFi and a friendly atmosphere, making it nice for both work and relaxation.

Safety is usually good, but knowing the local customs can make your visit better. Exploring different neighborhoods will show you the city's history and character, so take your time and enjoy your visit!
astana.description_kor:
아스타나, 카자흐스탄의 수도는 독특한 매력과 현대적인 건물들로 유명한 도시입니다. 이곳의 스카이라인은 전통과 현대가 조화를 이루는 모습을 보여줍니다. 하지만 도심에서 걷는 것은 조금 불편할 수도 있으니 미리 감안하세요. 많은 방문객들이 도로가 넓고 차량이 많이 다닌다고 느끼곤 합니다. 하지만 Yandex 택시나 버스를 이용하면 편리하게 이동할 수 있습니다.

겨울이 되면 현지 카페에서 앉아 시간을 보내는 것이 인기 있는 활동입니다. "Kul'tura Diktuyet"라는 카페는 Syganak 거리 10에 위치해 있으며, 뛰어난 카푸친노를 맛볼 수 있는 곳입니다—Radmir에게 주문해 보세요! 이곳은 좋은 WiFi와 아늑한 분위기를 갖추고 있어 작업이나 휴식 모두에 적합합니다.

대체로 안전하지만, 지역 문화를 이해하면 방문이 더욱 즐거워질 수 있습니다. 다양한 동네를 탐방하면서 도시의 역사와 개성을 느껴보세요. 천천히 즐기며 탐험해 보세요!

reviews:
I’ve lived here for 11.5 years & been a landlord the entire time. A 1 bedroom starts at 1000, and that’s not in the city center. I have no idea why they’re saying it’s dangerous. There’s literally cops putting bike traps up to tempt people into stealing because there’s so little crime. It’s incredibly safe and welcoming to people of all races & genders. 
It’s also dry, incredibly dry with forest fires in the summer so the smoke can be intense for several months. It’s not rainy at all like the weather on here states. It appears the map & hospital are linked to another Ashland not in Oregon. The photo is however of Ashland, Oregon. 

Ashland is very white bread. There’s essentially no people of color or ethnicity. It’s comprised of people who took to spirituality instead of psychotherapy to work out their issues so there’s a fair amount of spiritual arrogance. There’s an infinite amount of spiritual workshops & endeavors. 

The town survives off of tourism & weed. It’s often joked that there’s 3 women to every man. I don’t know if that’s accurate though it feels like it. Almost all married couples who move here divorce. It’s an incredibly healing place for women, but not a place for relationship as most remain perpetually single here. It’s the single mom capital of the US. The hospitals, at least the Asante one that owns most, are incredibly low quality. Drive to OSHU in Portland should you need a hospital.
ashland.description:
Ashland, Oregon, is a small town located in Southern Oregon. If you want a safe and friendly community, Ashland has that. Crime rates are low, and people here are usually nice to everyone. There are many spiritual workshops, making it a good place for those interested in personal growth and wellness.

However, keep in mind that Ashland can feel a bit lacking in diversity, as it is mostly similar in its population. Some say it has many single mothers, so if you want to meet someone special, it may take some effort. The cost of living is also high, with one-bedroom apartments starting at about $1,000.

The weather can be difficult, with dry summers that can lead to forest fires and smoke. Public transportation is not very good, so having a car is helpful. However, if you want to enjoy outdoor activities or learn about the local culture, Ashland’s history and arts scene are worth checking out! Just be sure to check the air quality in summer before planning any outdoor activities.
ashland.description_kor:
오리건주 애슐랜드는 오리건주 남부에 위치한 아담한 마을입니다. 만약 안전하고 친근한 커뮤니티를 원하신다면, 애슐랜드는 그런 곳이 될 것입니다. 이곳은 범죄율이 낮고, 주민들이 대체로 매우 친절합니다. 다양한 영적 워크숍이 열려 있어 개인 성장과 웰빙에 관심 있는 분들에게 적합한 장소입니다.

하지만 애슐랜드는 인구 구성의 다양성이 부족할 수 있으니 이 점을 고려해야 합니다. 특히 미혼모가 많은 편이라고 하니, 특별한 인연을 만나고자 하신다면 약간의 노력이 필요할 수 있습니다. 또한 생활비가 높은 편이라 원룸 아파트는 약 1,000달러부터 시작합니다.

날씨는 다소 까다로울 수 있으며, 여름철에는 건조한 날씨가 이어져 산불과 연기가 발생할 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 불편하기 때문에 차량 소유가 큰 도움이 됩니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 야외 활동을 즐기거나 지역 문화를 접하고 싶다면 애슐랜드의 역사와 예술씬은 꼭 들러보실 만합니다! 여름에 야외 활동을 계획하신다면 공기 질 확인도 잊지 마세요.

reviews: The best Bitcoin community I've been part of so far! They organize monthly events for 100+ people, which is absolutely mind-blowing... The name of the organization that does all this is Bitcoin Paraguay.

Great place to relax for a few days. As a person of color I have to disagree about the lack of racism rating Asuncion has received. I felt very welcomed there and had no issues. The Recoleta neighborhood is super convenient and very safe. I never had any issues walking around day or night even with my phone out. Talking to locals, they love foreigners and are just very friendly people overall. Even though I'm considered Black in the USA they referred to me as "brunette" which I found endearing. Although I will say, you do need to have a basic level of Spanish. If you're A1-A2 Spanish you'll be fine. The dollar is very strong against the Guarani as well so dining out is very cheap. There's also a lot of new buildings so it's easy to find clean/well maintained AirBnBs. I think the biggest negative is that power outages can happen somewhat frequently and entire neighborhoods can be without power for a few hours at a time.

This city is a hidden gem in South America. The atmosphere is very laid-back, the locals are friendly and open to foreigners, and there is a lot of freedom (no stupid regulations or other rules). The infrastructure is definitely not as developed as in other countries, but it is developing very quickly. There are a lot of foreign investments because the country is probably the safest in South America, and the local government is small and right-wing. In the city itself, there is not much to do. There are some nice bars, padel courts, shopping centers, etc. The best thing you can do in the evening after work is to jump into the pool, drink a beer, and do asado (barbecue). It is a great place to chill. Living costs are lower compared to Europe or other countries in Latam.

Personally, I came here to set up a residency, and my plan was to stay a maximum of 2 weeks. I have been here for 4 months already, and I am sure there are many more to come. And I am not alone. There are many people in the same situation, some of them already moved to Paraguay. Consequently, there is a rapidly growing international community. Furthermore, if you are a businessman, you will love it - Paraguay is the land of opportunities. There are business opportunities wherever I look.
asuncion.description:
Asunción, the capital of Paraguay, is an interesting place in South America. With its easygoing atmosphere and welcoming people, you’ll feel comfortable as you explore the city. The Recoleta neighborhood is a safe and convenient area, great for walking around—both day and night. Visitors appreciate the affordable food options because of the strong dollar against the Guarani, making it easy to enjoy local meals and drinks without spending too much.

While there are some fun things to do, like bars and shopping centers, you may notice the city doesn't have a lot of attractions. But what’s better than relaxing with a cold beer by the pool or grilling with friends? Just expect some occasional power outages!

One thing to remember—knowing a little Spanish will help you connect with the friendly locals. The cost of living is lower than in many other places, and it is becoming a popular area for expatriates and business people. Asunción is a great place to relax, have fun, and possibly start a new life!
asuncion.description_kor:
아순시온, 파라과이의 수도는 남미에서 정말 매력적인 도시입니다. 여유롭고 따뜻한 분위기 덕분에 도시를 탐험하는 동안 편안함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 레코레타 지역은 안전하고 편리해 낮과 밤에 모두 걷기 좋습니다. 방문객들은 강한 달러와 과라니의 환율 덕분에 다양한 저렴한 음식 옵션을 언제든지 즐길 수 있어 기쁘게 생각합니다.

바와 쇼핑 센터 같은 재미있는 활동도 있지만, 도시에는 많은 관광지가 없을 수도 있습니다. 그러나 수영장에서 시원한 맥주를 마시거나 친구들과 바비큐를 즐기는 것이야말로 진정한 여유가 아닐까요? 가끔씩 정전이 있을 수 있다는 점만 염두에 두세요!

하나 기억해야 할 점은, 스페인어를 조금만 아는 것이 친절한 현지인들과 더 잘 소통하는 데 큰 도움이 된다는 것입니다. 생활비는 다른 많은 지역에 비해 저렴하며, 외국인과 비즈니스 관계자들 사이에서도 인기를 끌고 있습니다. 아순시온은 휴식과 즐거움을 동시에 누리며 새로운 삶을 시작하기에 완벽한 곳입니다!

reviews: Aveiro is a place that hasn't been ruined by tourism yet. The city is full of young people, thanks to its university and vibrant nightlife. Many people compare Aveiro to Venice, but it's more like Amsterdam, with its narrow houses and canals lined with bars and lively spots. The comparisons to Amsterdam or Venice likely arise because Aveiro is still relatively unknown... ones the city is better known, it will not be needed to compare it any more. Living in Aveiro is quite pleasant—it’s less stressful and expensive than Porto, yet it offers the benefits of city life in Portugal right at your doorstep, with the added bonus of the nearby beach, Costa Nova.

Aveiro is regarded as Portuguese Venice and Salt City.
Here is the perfect Portuguese city to ride a bicycle as the road is super even.
Many good bakeries and cafes sell famous Ovos moles, the Portuguese famous egg yolk desserts. 
 People are very friendly but the majority with limited English.
aveiro.description:
Imagine walking along quiet canals with narrow houses—that's Aveiro! Often called the "Portuguese Venice," this city has kept its original feel, making it a nice place free from large numbers of tourists. With a busy university scene, the nightlife is fun, attracting young people who enjoy gathering in local bars and cafes.

Living here feels relaxed and less stressful than in bigger cities like Porto. Plus, the cost of living is affordable! From Aveiro, you are close to the beautiful beaches of Costa Nova, great for a sunny day out. The city is also good for cycling, making it easy to explore on a bike.

Just be prepared for the local language; while the people are very friendly, many speak only a little English. Don’t miss trying the famous Ovos moles at one of the local bakeries—the egg yolk dessert is a must! So whether you’re here for the culture, nightlife, or the peaceful feel, Aveiro has something special for you.
aveiro.description_kor:
조용한 운하를 따라 좁은 집들이 늘어선 모습을 상상해보세요—그곳이 바로 아베이로(Aveiro)입니다! 종종 "포르투갈의 베니스"라고 불리는 이 도시는 원래의 매력을 잘 간직하고 있어 관광객이 많지 않아 조용한 분위기를 즐길 수 있는 곳입니다. 활기찬 대학이 있는 덕분에 밤문화도 흥미롭고, 젊은이들이 지역 바와 카페에서 모여 즐거운 시간을 보내는 모습이 눈에 띕니다.

아베이로에서의 생활은 포르토와 같은 큰 도시에 비해 훨씬 여유롭고 스트레스가 덜한 느낌입니다. 게다가 생활비도 저렴해 경제적인 면에서도 부담이 적습니다! 아름다운 코스타 노바(Costa Nova) 해변도 가까워서 날씨가 좋은 날에 방문하기 아주 좋습니다. 이 도시는 자전거 타기에 안성맞춤이라 자전거를 타고 둘러보며 탐험하는 것도 손쉽습니다.

다만, 현지 언어에 꼭 대비하는 것이 좋습니다. 사람들은 매우 친절하지만, 영어를 할 줄 아는 사람이 많지 않습니다. 지역 제과점에서 유명한 오부스 몰레스(Ovos moles)를 꼭 맛보세요—계란 노른자를 사용한 이 디저트는 반드시 경험해봐야 할 맛입니다! 아베이로는 문화, 밤문화, 혹은 평화로운 분위기를 원하시는 분 모두에게 특별한 경험을 선사할 것입니다.

reviews:
Baghdad is improving and becoming a bit more liberated, a few things for foreigners coming in, especially women.

don't go out alone, for your safety, please have a companion with you.
do visit malls of al-mansour district, and the top-notch restaurant on the west side of Baghdad
do visit the cultural sites on the east sites too s.a almutanabi street, etc..
do visit Iraqi museum in the center of Baghdad (25,000 IQD/person) open till 1 PM weekdays (not fiday)
Iraqis in general study english in schools for 6 years but they still can't speak it well, so assume that they only speak basic english in general.
Iraqis love to small talk and make general jests or jokes to lighten the mood without revealing any personal information.
however, some do complain a lot and emit negative energy, please understand that they're having a hard time.
don't get anxious, enjoy the weather and the easy talk, and take pics :D

Baghdad is a great city , It has a lot of amazing places to go to ,for example if you are an entrepreneur you can go to " The station " it include a free coworking space , cafe both and you can buy food from the food corner ,also there are halls to rate if you want.. , don't forget to visit almutanabi street , it's amazing Baghdadi Icon , go to Sinbad Land to have fun or you can go to alzawraa park it's bigger than Sinbad , and if you love both of books and cofee go to Ridha alwan coffe..
If you want more inf I'm ready Because I'm Resident of Baghdad ,check my E-mail 
[email protected]
baghdad.description:
Baghdad is showing signs of change, becoming a bit more open and welcoming, especially for visitors. The city has a rich cultural scene and many places worth visiting. Be sure to check out the busy Al-Mansour district, where you’ll find modern malls and some good restaurants. The Iraqi Museum is a must-see, providing a look into the country’s interesting history, though remember it closes at 1 PM on weekdays (not Friday).

While Baghdad is friendly, it's good to stay careful. It is suggested to explore the city with a companion for safety, especially since some locals still feel the effects of difficult times, which might show in their behavior. English is not spoken widely, so being patient with communication is important.

Don't miss the busy atmosphere of Al-Mutanabi Street, a cultural spot, and if you are a business person, "The Station" offers a nice co-working space. From Sinbad Land amusement park to Al-Zawraa Park, there is fun to be had! Enjoy the local hospitality, appreciate the sunny weather, and take some photos!
baghdad.description_kor:
바그다드는 변화의 조짐을 보이며, 특히 방문객들에게 더 열려 있고 친근한 분위기를 조성하고 있습니다. 이 도시는 다채로운 문화적 풍경을 자랑하며 꼭 가볼 만한 장소가 많습니다. 현대적인 쇼핑몰과 맛있는 레스토랑이 있는 번화한 알만수르 지구도 꼭 들러보세요. 이라크 박물관은 반드시 방문해야 할 명소로, 이 나라의 흥미로운 역사를 살펴볼 수 있지만, 주의할 점은 평일에 오후 1시에 문을 닫는다는 것입니다(금요일은 제외).

바그다드는 친절한 도시지만, 조심하는 것이 좋습니다. 안전을 위해 동반자와 함께 다니는 것이 바람직하며, 일부 현지인들이 여전히 어려운 시기의 여파를 느끼고 있을 수 있어 그들의 행동에 주의해야 합니다. 영어가 널리 사용되지 않기 때문에 소통할 때 인내심을 가져야 합니다.

문화적 명소인 알무타나비 거리의 활기찬 분위기를 놓치지 마세요. 사업을 하는 분들은 "더 스테이션"에서 편안한 코워킹 공간을 이용할 수 있습니다. 신밧드 랜드 놀이공원과 알자우라 공원에서는 다양한 즐거움을 느낄 수 있습니다! 현지인의 따뜻한 환대도 만끽하고, 화창한 날씨 속에서 즐거운 순간을 사진으로 남겨보세요!

reviews: Busy city. Lots of fun. Lots of different choices for food. Great night life
auckland.description:
Auckland is a lively city full of activity. If you enjoy different cultures, this is a good place for you. The food here is great, offering many local dishes and international foods to meet your tastes. When night falls, there are many bars and clubs to visit.

While Auckland's busy city life is a main attraction, some visitors say it can feel crowded at times, which may be too much for those wanting a quieter time. Public transportation can be unreliable, so be ready to use buses or taxis if you want to explore more.

Also, keep an eye on your spending, as costs can be high. But with its beautiful waterfront views and friendly people, you'll quickly understand why many return. For a fun experience, visit different neighborhoods, each with its own feel, and remember to engage with local customs for a complete experience!
auckland.description_kor:
오클랜드는 다양한 활동으로 가득 찬 활기 넘치는 도시입니다. 다양한 문화를 즐기고 싶다면 이곳이 최적의 장소입니다. 이곳의 음식은 정말 뛰어나며, 여러 가지 현지 요리와 국제 음식을 맛볼 수 있어 입맛을 사로잡습니다. 밤이 되면 방문할 수 있는 바와 클럽이 많아 즐길 거리가 풍부합니다.

오클랜드의 분주한 도시 생활은 큰 매력 중 하나지만, 일부 방문자들은 때로 혼잡함을 느낄 수도 있습니다. 조용한 시간을 원하는 분들에게는 조금 과할 수도 있습니다. 대중교통이 가끔 신뢰성이 떨어질 수 있으니, 더 많은 곳을 탐험하고 싶다면 버스나 택시를 이용할 준비를 하시는 것이 좋습니다.

또한, 비용이 다소 높을 수 있으니 지출에 유의하세요. 하지만 아름다운 해변가 전망과 친절한 사람들과 함께라면 많은 사람들이 왜 다시 오고 싶어 하는지를 금방 알게 될 것입니다. 재미있는 경험을 원하신다면 다양한 분위기를 가진 이웃들을 방문하고, 완벽한 경험을 위해 현지 관습에 참여하는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews:
I loved my stay in Austin. I had heard a lot of people moved here during COVID and wanted to see it for myself.

We stayed around Lady Bird Lake, like on the south side of the river, a very nice area. We were there in July so it was quite hot, but in the shadow it was fine to walk. It is dry heat, not like in Thailand, so while it's hot it's not sweaty which is much better. 

The average quality of food here is very high, like some of the best food I had in the world besides maybe Japan. Not everything is great of course but just the average level is much higher than other places in US or the world.

People are generally very friendly. There is some thing where they say Austinites are friendly but behind the facade mean. I did see this sometimes but not a lot. One thing that helps is that a lot (maybe most?) people here are import from other places. Especially in the last few years. So people are quite open to meeting new people and making friends.

People generally are VERY FIT here. You see women walk in Lululemon everywhere, and guys also shirtless and in shorts. Everyone here seems like they're fit and active. Lots of runners. 

Also everyone seems to have a dog here and they walk it. People also seemed quite individualistic here like you see a lot of people here walk alone, drive alone, sit alone, go places alone. Much more than other US cities, and the rest of the world. Maybe that's a part of people being new here and not having lots of friends yet. Or maybe it means it's hard to make friends here, I am not sure yet. It seems to me it'd be easy to make friends here if you just put effort in like go into your work, hobby or sports subculture.

Austin feels very tech-y now, lots of people you overhear talking about building startups and business here. You see lots of money, rich people, expensive cars, but not in an annoying way.
