There's lots of shopping, all the big brands are here, some good malls although there has to be more I think. South of Congress Avenue (SoCo) is a place we kept going, a nice area with shopping, food and good coffee. Also much further drive 20 minutes up is The Domain, also nice area.

We went shooting at The Range, very cool experience. And we went to Sandbox VR in The Domain which was fun too.

One thing is, but maybe American problem, it was hard to find good healthy food. We did find Sweet Green which seemed to be relatively healthiest option. But most food here is great but not so healthy if you eat out every day. I guess you really have to rent a place here and cook.

I think it's a great city to live if you are single and looking for a fit boyfriend or girlfriend. But also great if you're in a relationship because there's so much stuff to eat, drink and do here.

One thing that was VERY bad is the homeless people. They were in downtown and it was very scary seeing them do drugs right on the street and you have to pass them. Problem is they're NOT JUST in downtown in Austin, they're kinda everywhere. Not like A LOT. But also not nothing either. You'll hear random homeless shouting or standing in the middle of the road. Sometimes you're surrounded by homeless and you can't cross the street and it's scary af. They're not harmless homeless either, they will spot you and come up to you and shout at you. Very creepy. I really think the city should clean that up and take the homeless of the streets and help them. And don't let them get back on. It's dangerous for people and children and it makes the city look really bad.

Austin is walkable and very good for bicycling, but random homeless make that more dangerous. I guess that's one reason why running clubs are so big here because people feel safer running in a massive group.

All around I do think it's a GREAT city and a great place to live or visit. It's one of my top places I've lived in the world and it is very comfortable and nice.

All in, Austin is a good city. We live in Hill Country now so we're a bit removed. But it's beautiful area once you get away from the highways. A good tech scene. Not too expensive (~$2100 for a nice 2 bedroom apt) for the U.S. Has wineries and breweries galore. Not a great place if you are a recovering alcoholic (!). Cons: extremely hot in the summer; reaches 110 F (43.3 C) in summer afternoons from June - September. Not very diverse. Highways are loud and obnoxious.

Grew up here in the 80s/90s, moved back in 2015 after 10 years in LA and 10 years abroad. I don't get why it's so highly rated. It's a far cry from the free-living, cheap to live, music-infused past. The old music venues are being torn down to build condos. Tech bros moving en masse has caused housing demand to spike, and with it, property values, rent, and cost of living, and no scale with increases in pay.

 All the musicians and artists are leaving, and everyone here is young, white, and has the same pedestrian, reactionary opinions about everything. If you want Orange County, CA without the Pacific coast, this is it. I'm getting the hell out of here.

One of the fastest growing cities in the USA with a lot of tech companies opening offices. Usually a fun city with a lively downtown (music, University, bars), a lake for boating, and lots of land outside the city. Texas is the second largest state in the USA and generally hot, so you may want to check the weather for any intended visits. Generally, a pretty good place to go: lots of young people and pretty good paying tech related jobs.
Not a great place to live for diversity. It may seem diverse but when you actually live there, it’s just a group of diverse white people from small towns. High population of Hispanics and whites.

Great place to hang out in Texas. Enjoy the crowds? Head downtown during and after a UT football game in the fall. Avoid the crowds? Take a short drive to the hill country to hang out on a lake, hike the hills, or tour one of the many wineries or distilleries.
austin.description:
Austin is a busy city with a mix of culture, food, and outdoor activities that brings in many new people each year. Located around Lady Bird Lake, the south side is nice for walks, especially in the hot Texas summer. Food lovers will be happy—Austin has some of the best food in the U.S., from barbecue places to fine dining.

The environment here is friendly, with many people focusing on fitness, and you often see locals running, biking, and walking their dogs. However, this personal vibe can sometimes make it hard to meet people if you're new, but joining local groups or clubs can help you connect. Be ready for some challenges, like the visible homeless population that can feel overwhelming at times.

Public transportation is okay, but many people find biking and walking to be better options. The cost of living is generally reasonable, especially with the growing tech industry attracting newcomers. If you are thinking about visiting or staying longer, don't miss the busy downtown and interesting neighborhoods like SoCo. Just remember, summers can be very hot, so drink enough water while you explore!
austin.description_kor:
오스틴은 매년 많은 새로운 사람들을 끌어들이는 문화, 음식, 야외 활동이 어우러진 활기찬 도시입니다. 특히 레이디 버드 호수를 중심으로 한 남쪽 지역은 더운 텍사스 여름에 산책하기 좋은 장소로 알려져 있습니다. 음식 애호가라면 오스틴에서 정말 만족스러운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 이곳은 바베큐 전문점부터 고급 레스토랑까지 미국 최고의 맛집들이 즐비해 있습니다.

오스틴의 분위기는 아늑하고 친근하며, 많은 사람들이 피트니스 활동에 열중하고 있어 현지인들이 달리기, 자전거 타기, 강아지 산책하는 모습을 자주 볼 수 있습니다. 다만, 이런 개인적인 분위기 덕분에 새로운 사람들과의 만남이 쉽지 않을 수도 있지만, 지역 모임이나 동호회에 참여하면 좋은 인연을 만들 수 있는 기회가 생깁니다. 때로는 눈에 띄는 노숙자 인구 같은 몇 가지 도전 과제가 있을 수 있으니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다.

대중교통은 괜찮은 편이지만, 많은 사람들은 자전거를 타거나 걷는 것이 더 나은 방법이라고 생각합니다. 생활비는 일반적으로 합리적이며, 성장하는 기술 산업 덕분에 신입들도 많이 유입되고 있습니다. 방문하거나 오랜 시간 머무를 계획이 있다면, 바쁜 다운타운과 소코와 같은 흥미로운 동네를 꼭 놓치지 마세요. 단, 여름철은 특히 덥기 때문에 탐험하실 때는 충분한 수분 섭취를 잊지 마세요!

reviews:
Much cooler climate due to the altitude and a lot of good nature settings (some of the parks require 100 Pesos entry). Still has the comforts of a city with a big SM mall and good shops and restaurants. Absolutely packed in summer as it's a popular vacation destination for locals.

Getting around can be difficult because only taxis are allowed, not ride-sharing, and the taxis are in high demand. Grab app only shows taxis and often fails to secure a ride. That said, the city is compact and traffic does flow well, probably because of the ride-share restriction!

For mobile internet, I found PLDT Smart works well. Globe rarely works at all.

The air quality in Baguio is awful. I left with a cough and sore throat. Streets are crowded. Lots of traffic. Internet is not very stable. Head north to Sagada for a much more beautiful place in the mountains—equally unstable internet but at least the food and air quality are better in Sagada!
baguio.description:
Baguio is a city in the mountains known for its cool weather and natural sights. You will enjoy the parks and green areas, although some may require a small entrance fee. Baguio also has the comforts of city life, with a large SM mall and different shops and places to eat. It is a popular summer spot for locals, so expect many people and busy streets during the peak season.

Getting around may take some time since only taxis are available, and they can be hard to find. However, traffic is usually smooth, likely because of ride-share rules. Many people say PLDT Smart works better than Globe for mobile service, but the internet connection can still be inconsistent.

Even though air quality can be poor and you may face some traffic, Baguio provides a special cultural experience. If you want an adventure, consider traveling north to Sagada for cleaner air and beautiful views. Be ready for some language difficulties and a few challenges when getting around!
baguio.description_kor:
바기오는 상쾌한 날씨와 아름다운 자연 경관으로 유명한 산속의 도시입니다. 공원과 녹지 공간을 즐길 수 있지만, 일부 장소는 소정의 입장료가 필요할 수 있습니다. 바기오는 대형 SM 몰과 다양한 상점, 음식점이 있어 도시 생활의 편리함도 제공합니다. 여름철에는 현지인들에게 인기 있는 휴양지로, 성수기에는 많은 인파와 활기찬 거리를 예상해야 합니다.

이동은 택시만 이용 가능하여 다소 시간이 걸릴 수 있고, 택시를 찾는 것도 어려울 수 있습니다. 그러나 교통은 대체로 원활한 편이며, 이는 아마도 차량 공유 규정 때문일 것입니다. 많은 사람들이 PLDT Smart가 모바일 서비스에서 Globe보다 더 잘 작동한다고 느끼지만, 인터넷 연결은 여전히 불안정할 수 있습니다.

대기 질이 좋지 않거나 교통 체증이 있을 수 있지만, 바기오는 특별한 문화 체험을 제공합니다. 모험을 원하신다면 북쪽의 사가다로 가보세요. 그곳은 공기가 더 맑고 아름다운 경치를 즐길 수 있는 곳입니다. 이동 시 언어 문제와 몇 가지 도전 과제가 있을 수 있으니 미리 준비하세요!

reviews: I don't know where the other people stayed in Bakersfield but it is not walkable by any means. Everything is very spread out and separated by very wide streets. Sidewalks (if they exist) are tiny. There is a downtown, but that is not bigger than a few blocks and hardy describes the rest of the town accurately.
bakersfield.description:
Bakersfield is a city that may surprise you with its charm, even if it isn’t the easiest place to walk around. Many visitors say the city is quite spread out, and you will probably need to drive to get from one place to another. The downtown area is small but has its own feel, making it a nice spot to visit.

The cost of living here is usually affordable compared to many other cities in California, making it a good option for those looking to settle down. Public transportation is limited, so having a car is useful for getting around. Some visitors mention that while safety is generally good, it is always wise to stay aware of your surroundings.

Bakersfield has a friendly atmosphere, full of local customs related to farming. Don’t miss the chance to try some tasty food from local restaurants. Overall, if you are ready to drive a bit and explore some hidden spots, Bakersfield can be a good choice!
bakersfield.description_kor:
베이커스필드는 매력적으로 놀라운 도시입니다. 물론 걷기에는 최적의 장소는 아니지만요. 많은 방문객들이 이 도시가 꽤 넓게 퍼져 있다고 이야기하며, 한 곳에서 다른 곳으로 이동할 때는 차를 이용해야 할 수도 있습니다. 도심은 작지만 독특한 매력을 지니고 있어 방문하기에 좋습니다.

여기서의 생활비는 캘리포니아의 다른 도시들에 비해 비교적 저렴하므로, 정착하기 좋은 선택이 될 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 제한적이기 때문에 이동을 위해 차가 있는 것이 편리합니다. 일부 방문객들은 대체로 안전하지만, 항상 주변을 주의하는 것이 좋다고 조언합니다.

베이커스필드는 농업과 관련된 지역 문화가 가득한 친근한 분위기를 자랑합니다. 지역 식당에서 맛있는 음식을 즐길 기회를 놓치지 마세요. 총체적으로, 조금 운전하고 숨겨진 장소를 탐험할 준비가 되어 있다면, 베이커스필드는 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews: Do not go to Baltimore. Very unsafe, not much to do, bad roads, bad air, pollution everywhere (including water), and it’s not a nice place to be overall. Many murders and gangs. Do yourself a favor by never going here.
baltimore.description:
Baltimore has a mixed reputation, and it’s important to think about this if you're going to visit. Some people like the culture and history here. The Inner Harbor is a popular area with places like the National Aquarium and the Maryland Science Center that can keep families busy.

However, some visitors worry about safety, noting that crime rates can be high in some areas. While many neighborhoods are friendly, it's better to stay in well-known places. The public transportation system can be improved, so having a plan or a car can make your trip easier.

In terms of local life, there is a strong sense of community, and you might enjoy trying some famous Maryland crab cakes or attending one of the city's festivals. Just remember, like any city, being aware of your surroundings and doing a bit of research on neighborhoods can help you enjoy your trip.
baltimore.description_kor:
볼티모어는 다양한 평판을 가지고 있으며, 방문을 계획하고 있다면 이 점을 고려하는 것이 중요합니다. 이곳의 문화와 역사를 매력적으로 느끼는 사람들이 많습니다. 특히 내부 항구(Inner Harbor)는 가족 단위로 즐길 수 있는 국립 수족관과 메릴랜드 과학센터 같은 명소가 있어 매우 인기가 높습니다.

하지만 일부 방문객들은 범죄율이 높은 지역 때문에 안전에 대한 우려를 표하기도 합니다. 친근한 이웃도 많지만, 유명한 관광지 주변에 머무는 것이 더 안전할 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 개선이 필요하지만, 여행 계획을 세우거나 자동차를 이용하면 이동이 훨씬 편리해질 것입니다.

지역 생활 측면에서는 강한 공동체 의식이 돋보이며, 메릴랜드의 대표 음식인 크랩 케이크를 맛보거나 도시의 다양한 축제에 참여하는 것도 큰 즐거움입니다. 다른 도시와 마찬가지로, 주변 환경을 잘 이해하고 이웃에 대한 정보를 미리 조사하면 여행이 더 즐거워질 수 있다는 점을 기억하세요.

reviews: I have to disagree with some of the scores: there is NO freedom of speech when it comes to the Royal Family, government or Islam. Anyone who speaks in a derogatory way about the government, royal family or Islam will be deported (or jailed if they are Bruneian). There is NO freedom of the press either. Downtown Bandar is walkable if you don't mind the heat, but a car is 100% a necessity living in Brunei. There is a small bus service that runs at apparently random times, but no other public transit in the country. The English level is very good. Almost everyone can speak English and it is the language of instruction in all public schools from kindergarten.
bandar-seri-begawan.description:
Bandar Seri Begawan is the capital of Brunei and is known for its culture and calm environment. The city has notable mosques and traditional buildings, making it interesting for visitors. It has a relaxed feeling, but there are strict rules about what you can say, especially about the royal family and religion.

Living here can be different; having a car is important because public transport is limited, with only a small bus service that runs at random times. Walking in the heat can be difficult unless you are prepared for it. On the positive side, English is commonly spoken, so it is easy to get around and talk to locals.

For practical advice, check out the neighborhoods by the waterfront and visit the local markets where you can try good food. Be mindful of cultural customs, especially when visiting mosques, and dress modestly. Overall, if you want a peaceful place with interesting sights, Bandar Seri Begawan could be a good choice!
bandar-seri-begawan.description_kor:
반다르 세리 베가완은 브루나이의 수도로, 그 풍부한 문화와 평화로운 환경으로 유명합니다. 이 도시는 아름다운 모스크와 전통 건축물들이 많아 방문객들에게 매력적인 장소입니다. 편안한 분위기가 느껴지긴 하지만, 왕실이나 종교에 대한 언급에는 엄격한 규칙이 있으니 주의해야 합니다.

이곳에서의 생활은 조금 다를 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 제한적이어서 자동차를 가지는 것이 중요하며, 작은 버스 서비스는 예측할 수 없는 시간에 운행됩니다. 더운 날씨에는 걷기가 쉬운 일이 아닐 수도 있으니 준비가 필요합니다. 다행히도 영어가 일반적으로 쓰이기 때문에 이동하거나 현지 주민들과 소통하는 데 큰 어려움은 없습니다.

실용적인 조언으로는 해변 근처의 동네를 탐방하고, 맛있는 음식을 즐길 수 있는 지역 시장을 방문하는 것이 좋습니다. 특히 모스크를 방문할 때는 문화적 관습을 잘 이해하고 단정한 복장을 갖추는 것이 중요합니다. 전반적으로, 아름다운 경치와 평화로운 환경을 원하는 분에게 반다르 세리 베가완은 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
Pros: Safe, beautiful views, loads of nice little beach towns a taxi ride away. Native cuisine is delicious, maybe the best value restaurants in Europe. 
8 months of pleasant weather. Old town is pretty charming. Local fruits are excellent and inexpensive. 1 Euro taxi rides. Georgians are generally warm. English ability among youth is good for FSU.

A decent hipster coffee/bar/cafe/coworking scene is emerging from the Ru/Bel/Ukr exile community.
The boardwalk on the coast is long and excellent - perfect for running and cycling.
Kutaisi airport is only a 24 euro taxi ride away, so lots of cheap connections to central Europe and FSU.

Cons: Roads are total chaos, being a pedestrian is scary. International food options and supermarkets are limited. 
New apartment towers are poorly built, extremely noisy and waiting for the elevator can waste 30 minutes of your day. 
Businesses seem poorly managed, this results in queues and mistakes.

For a nomad who wants to live somewhere for 6 months, on a low cost of living, focus on work and maintain an active lifestyle. Batumi is one of the best options in 2023.
These are the wrongest infos in the history of infos😄😄 the cost of living, the internet, restaurants, I mean someone really suggested that the airport cafe is the best place in a city. well ok bye
After living there for 2 months, I did not like it at all. Too much crowded now, lot's of cars everywhere. And it is really hard to find a good place to eat, cause the service quality of awful.

I‘ve spent a couple of days in Batumi in Sep. ‘21. First the cost of living is waaay lower than what nomad list says. You can rent a nice serviced apartment with sea view for 29€/Day. People barely speak english in Batumi and there is not a lot going on (compared to Tbilisi). It is a nice place, if you want to live very cheap, safe, enjoy sea views and like modern buildings. However keep in mind, it is a small city, so there is not a lot going on.
batumi.description:
Batumi is a seaside city in Georgia that has nice views and a relaxed atmosphere. It has warm weather for most of the year and good local food at reasonable prices, giving you many reasons to stay. The old town has its own charm, with nice streets and a friendly feeling—locals are known for their kindness, and there are many bars and cafes due to a mix of cultures.

Getting around can be difficult. The roads can be busy, and walking can be challenging. There are some good local restaurants, but options for international food can be limited. Finding a good restaurant is not always easy, and service can vary.

Practical advice: be patient with the slow elevators in new apartment buildings. A taxi ride to Kutaisi Airport is quite cheap, making travel easier. If you want an affordable lifestyle, nice beaches, and a chance to relax, Batumi could be a good choice for you, but be prepared for a slower pace of life!
batumi.description_kor:
바투미는 조지아에 위치한 해변 도시로, 아름다운 풍경과 여유로운 분위기가 특징입니다. 온화한 날씨와 합리적인 가격의 훌륭한 지역 음식 덕분에 오랫동안 머무르기에 좋은 장소입니다. 구시가지에는 매력적인 골목길과 친근한 분위기가 가득하고, 현지인들은 따뜻한 친절로 유명합니다. 다양한 문화가 어우러져 있어서 많은 바와 카페를 즐길 수 있습니다.

교통은 약간 불편할 수 있습니다. 도로가 혼잡하며, 걷는 것이 쉽지 않을 때도 있습니다. 맛있는 지역 식당이 몇 곳 있지만, 국제 요리를 찾기에는 선택지가 제한적일 수 있습니다. 또한, 적절한 식당을 찾는 것이 항상 간편하지 않고, 서비스의 질도 고르지 않습니다.

실용적인 조언으로는 새로운 아파트 건물에서 느린 엘리베이터에 인내심을 가져야 한다는 점입니다. 쿠타이시 공항까지의 택시 요금은 매우 저렴해 이동이 용이합니다. 저렴한 생활비와 아름다운 해변, 그리고 휴식을 원하신다면 바투미가 훌륭한 선택이 될 수 있지만, 느긋한 삶의 속도에 익숙해져야 할 필요가 있습니다!

reviews: I lived in Beijing for almost 3 years from 2014-2017. It's an incredible city with a lot to offer. It's an imposing place and not the most welcoming, but that's because it takes time to adjust. In a nutshell: beautiful parks, very modern infrastructure , friendly people, good transportation (the subway is FAR superior to London or NYC, for example), amazing food, relatively cheap, extremely safe, loads to do, incredible history. The one major con is the air pollution—it can get really bad, so beware. Throughout my time in Beijing, I was constantly discovering new places and meeting interesting people. When I was there, there were plenty of foreigners and people were mostly very welcoming towards us. It's a special place. There are also loads of cafes and bars where you can work from, with good internet. A must-visit is the Friends Cafe—it's modelled after Central Perk from the sitcom Friends. They have good internet, delicious coffee and snacks, and Friends is playing on the TV 24/7! Disclaimer: Not sure if it's still in operation now.

Definitely an underrated place for nomads - Huge city with a small town feel. Lots of different neighborhoods to appeal to different types of people: some commercial, some hipstery, some historical, some modern. Food and rent is cheap (and the food is damn good). People are very friendly as compared to other big Asian cities. You can also get easy work as a tutor and make good extra cash. I survived for five months tutoring and doing other English related work for max 12 hrs a week (leaving me lots of time to work on other projects). You could also easily get a full time teaching gig but that defeats the whole nomad idea i guess. My favorite area is Gulou, or the Drum Tower. Old, local style with ancient buildings and some great cafes.

The GFW is a *huge* bother in daily work. VPN is not a perfect mitigation as it is throttled and frequently completely blocked (Have tried shadowsocks, outline, lantern, openvpn and expressvpn to about equal success). The VPN availability seems to fluctuate with the political climate (for example if there is a party conference or such). 

The air quality is so-so. Worst in winter time. The streets seem very safe and their is little crime (Except maybe in tourist areas, beware the scammers). It is super easy to get by with a little English and a translation app. Metro system is super easy to use. Food is fairly cheap, and it can come as cheap as you want... but sometimes of questionable quality.
If you get an account from a local bank, then you can connect it to your WeChat or AliPay and stop bringing cash with you. You can pay EVERYWHERE with these 2 apps.

You can't pay ANYWHERE with MasterCard or VISA. You can usually pay with cash though. Problem is most ATMs don't accept MasterCard or VISA. Easiest is to go to any ICBC Bank office with your passport, open an account (for $0.50), deposit some money ($50) and install WeChat. Then connect WeChat Pay to your ICBC account. This will let you use WeChat Pay which works with a QR code and is accepted anywhere! WeChat is pronounced Wei-Xin (whey-shin). Ask the ICBC staff to help you set up WePay if you need! Good luck.
beijing.description:
Beijing is a city that mixes history with modern life. You can see old palaces next to tall buildings, which shows its appeal. Living here, you will notice a friendly atmosphere, especially if you visit different neighborhoods—from the trendy cafes in Gulou to busy shopping areas. You can easily find cheap and tasty food, which many people appreciate.

Another benefit? The subway is easy to use! It is better than the systems in London or NYC, making it simple to get around the city. But remember, air pollution can be a problem, especially in winter, so prepare if you are sensitive to it.

While many locals can speak some English, it's a good idea to have a translation app since not everyone speaks it well. Also, using local cashless payment systems like WeChat Pay can make your life easier; just remember to set up a local bank account!

Beijing is generally a safe city with low crime, but be careful of scams in tourist areas. Overall, Beijing is a city that you will enjoy more as you explore it—full of surprises and memorable experiences waiting for you!
beijing.description_kor:
베이징은 역사와 현대가 조화를 이루는 도시입니다. 오래된 궁전들이 현대적인 고층 건물들과 나란히 위치해 있어 독특한 매력을 자아냅니다. 이곳에서 생활하게 되면 특히 다양한 동네를 돌아다니면서 따뜻하고 친근한 분위기를 느낄 수 있습니다. 예를 들어, 세련된 카페가 즐비한 굴로에서부터 활기찬 쇼핑 지역까지 다양한 경험이 가능합니다. 저렴하면서도 맛있는 음식을 쉽게 찾아볼 수 있어 많은 이들이 이를 높이 평가하고 있습니다.

또한, 베이징의 지하철은 정말 편리합니다! 런던이나 뉴욕의 시스템보다 훨씬 더 사용하기 쉬워 도시를 돌아다니기에 편안합니다. 단, 겨울철에는 공기 오염이 문제가 될 수 있으니 이에 민감한 분들은 미리 대비하셔야 합니다.

많은 현지인들이 어느 정도 영어를 할 수 있지만, 모두가 유창하진 않아서 번역 앱을 사용하는 것도 좋은 방법입니다. 그리고 위챗 페이와 같은 현지 비현금 결제 시스템을 활용하면 생활이 훨씬 편리해집니다. 단, 현지 은행 계좌 개설은 잊지 마세요!

베이징은 전반적으로 범죄율이 낮고 안전한 도시입니다. 하지만 관광 지역에서는 사기를 조심해야 합니다. 전반적으로 베이징은 탐험할수록 더 많은 즐거움을 선사하는 도시로, 여러분을 기다리고 있는 놀라움과 잊지 못할 경험이 가득합니다!

reviews:
A city in the grip of a financial crisis (Feb 2023), plus other calamities, so requires a bit more effort to do stuff than many places. But IMO worth the effort. You have to carry cash around and lots of bills as worth 1/40th of what they were a few years ago. You can't really use cards anywhere, except dollar ATMs and some supermarkets. 
Electricity mostly from generators, which have downtime a few hours a day. You need to check the daily hours of supply for the building before booking a place.
4G internet good 30+Mbps. Wired internet variable. Local SIM, I got a Touch Lebanon one with 20GB data for about $25/month. Pricier if you buy at the airport.
Airport close to city centre. $10-15 taxi fare.
Uber and Bolt work but you must assign payment as cash and it will be more than the app says, because of the high downward volatility of the LBP currency. Some classier cafes or restaurants will take USD notes but mostly you need LBP. 
Heaps of culture and history. Heaps of street art. A heartful people who have suffered insanely but still keep going, shows you the power of the human spirit to survive and thrive. 
I like the place and will be back in summer.

Beirut is a place where ideas are formed, and where art, culture, cuisine and an ardour for life thrive. Bars, restaurants and clubs come and go more frequently than the snow on the mountain peaks that form a backdrop to the city. But finding the new places - only to later realise they have vanished - is what makes for singular, memorable nights on these warm shores of the Mediterranean. Unlike in many other capitals in the region, there is a liberal attitude towards drinking in Beirut, where you will find a wide selection of cocktails and beers. The new tower blocks built after the civil war ended in 1990 have provided no end of rooftop bars - one of the first and biggest is SKYBAR- but it divides opinions thanks to its strict door policies and high prices. Alternatively try B 018, a nightclub with a retractable roof opening onto the stars, and known for its liberal attitude and dance music.
beirut.description:
Beirut is a lively city with culture, history, and a strong spirit. While the financial crisis can make some things difficult—like needing to carry cash since cards are not widely accepted—it is this spirit that makes visiting worth it. You will see interesting street art everywhere, and the locals are very friendly, always happy to share their stories and traditions.

Public transport can be difficult; taxis are cheap and Uber works too, but remember to bring cash! Electricity can be uneven, so it is important to check power schedules before booking a place to stay. On a positive note, the internet connection is good enough to keep you online.

Food lovers will enjoy the local dishes in busy cafes and good restaurants, along with a lively nightlife. Bars like SKYBAR and B 018 offer fun nights under the stars if you like adventure. Just remember that new places can open and close quickly! So, get ready to explore and make your own special memories in this bright city by the Mediterranean.
beirut.description_kor:
베이루트는 문화와 역사, 그리고 강한 정신이 깃든 활기찬 도시입니다. 최근 금융 위기로 인해 신용카드 사용이 제한적인 편이라 현금을 꼭 챙겨야 할 필요가 있지만, 바로 이런 도전적인 환경이 베이루트를 방문할 만한 가치로 만들어 줍니다. 거리에서는 다양한 스트리트 아트를 감상할 수 있으며, 현지인들은 매우 친절하여 자신의 이야기와 전통을 기꺼이 나누곤 합니다.

대중교통은 다소 불편할 수 있지만, 택시는 저렴하고 우버도 이용할 수 있습니다. 다만 현금을 꼭 지참하는 것을 잊지 마세요! 전기 공급이 불안정할 수 있으니 숙소 예약 전에 전력 스케줄을 확인하는 것이 중요합니다. 긍정적인 점은 인터넷 연결이 양호하므로 온라인으로도 문제 없이 소통할 수 있다는 것입니다.

음식 애호가라면 분주한 카페와 훌륭한 레스토랑에서 현지 요리를 맛볼 수 있으며, 활기찬 밤문화도 경험할 수 있습니다. 모험을 사랑한다면 SKYBAR나 B 018 같은 바에서 별빛 아래 즐거운 밤을 보내보세요. 다만 새로운 장소는 빠르게 열리고 닫힐 수 있다는 점을 유의하세요! 그러니 이 지중해의 찬란한 도시에서 탐험할 준비를 하고, 특별한 추억을 만들어 보세요.

reviews:
Lived here three years. On the plus side the people are friendly and the women are beautiful. The urban area is huge but all the action takes place in a fairly small central area. 

On the minus side, there are very few parks or green spaces. There aren't many attractions or cool things to do in the city. People's leisure time is mostly spent drinking in roadside bars.
belo-horizonte.description:
Belo Horizonte is a lively city in Brazil that has its appeal. One of the best things about it is the people – they are friendly and welcoming, making it easy to feel comfortable. The city is quite big, but most of the activities happen in a central area, so it's easy to enjoy the local atmosphere without going far.

However, it’s important to remember that there are not many parks, so if you like green spaces, you might feel a bit limited. While there may not be as many attractions as in other places, the local culture is strong. Many people enjoy spending time at roadside bars, having drinks and enjoying the vibe.

If you plan to visit or stay in Belo Horizonte, exploring the local bars and meeting the friendly locals is a must. Just be careful with your belongings, especially in busy areas. Overall, it’s a city that offers a special experience—great for those looking for a relaxed but active place!
belo-horizonte.description_kor:
벨루오리존치는 브라질에 위치한 매력적이고 활기찬 도시입니다. 이 도시의 가장 큰 매력 중 하나는 사람들입니다. 그들은 친절하고 환영해 주어서 방문객들이 편안하게 느끼기 쉽습니다. 도시 규모는 꽤 크지만, 대부분의 활동이 중심 지역에서 이루어져서 멀리 가지 않고도 현지의 분위기를 쉽게 즐길 수 있습니다.

다만, 공원이 많지 않다는 점은 기억해야 합니다. 그렇기 때문에 녹지 공간을 좋아하는 분들에겐 다소 아쉬울 수 있습니다. 관광 명소가 다른 도시만큼 많지는 않지만, 지역 문화는 매우 풍부합니다. 많은 사람들이 도로변 바에서 여유를 즐기며 음료 한 잔을 나누고 있는 모습이 자주 보입니다.

벨루오리존치를 방문할 계획이라면, 꼭 지역 바를 탐방하고 친절한 현지인들과의 만남을 가져보세요. 특히 붐비는 지역에서는 소지품에 주의할 필요가 있습니다. 전반적으로 이 도시는 특별한 경험을 선사하며, 편안하면서도 활동적인 분위기를 원하는 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다!

reviews:
Bengaluru, January 4-9, and 13-13, 2020. Had a good time in Bengaluru ( formerly Bangalore). At first I stayed at the Parijatha Gateway Hotel, Near Soap Factory Metro, which was ideal for my purposes. Transit & shopping was nearby, and there was a mall and good food. The Metro in BLR is VERY modern and smooth- be prepared to be patted down (women and men separately) to get into the station, and you can but a metrocard at the ticket window. In Bangalore the internet is VERY fast (it is India's Silicon Valley) and every other person is an engineer... and can chat you up in multiple languages.( their English may be better than yours :). Uber works well inside the city, but I advise a pre-paid taxi from the airport to your hotel (as flagging down your Uber at the airport is a bit difficult because of the congestion there). Now, lets talk about traffic- I have lived in NYC and I can say with authority that, yes, Bangalore has the worst traffic congestion I have ever seen. Any time that Google maps gives you to get anywhere by Auto or bus in Bangalore can be Doubled or Tripled to get the actual time of transit- you can't make this sit up... I am not kidding. All that aside, I never felt unsafe in Bangalore. 

Food in Bangalore is varied and tasty... You will have a good variety of Vegetarian and non-vegetarian options available to you. I did not seek out the night life, but there sure are some fancy upscale places if you want them.

 My second stay ion the trip was at the Conrad Hilton, which is in a class all by itself but not your everyday Nomad kind of place (My expenses were being covered for that, the price per night is insanely low by western standards, and so if you need some amazing pampering for a night or two, this is your go-to place) . Internet was fast, staff was attentive, scenery can't be beat. Uber back to the airport was easy.

I will return to Bengaluru in the future.

Bengaluru is a city in India which is known for its night life. Nightlife in Bengaluru is very vibrant and colourful. In Bengaluru, you get a lot of options to have fun at night. You can go for a disco night at a famous club or restaurant. You can enjoy the nightlife in Bengaluru and also visit the famous parks, gardens and tourist places.

Bengaluru is located at the foot of the Western Ghats, on the Deccan Plateau. The city is often referred to as the "Silicon Valley of India" and "IT Capital of India" because of the large number of information technology companies that were established in the city in the last decade. The city is also referred to as the "Pensioner's Paradise" because of the large number of pensioners that reside in the city.

Bengaluru is famous in India for its gardens, parks and lakes. You can visit the most famous parks such as Cubbon Park, Lal Bagh and the Bangalore Palace.
bengaluru.description:
Bengaluru, formerly Bangalore, is a busy city that mixes technology with culture. It is known as India’s Silicon Valley, where you can find fast internet and many engineers, making it a center for tech jobs. The new Metro system is efficient, but expect security checks. Dealing with heavy traffic can be difficult—sometimes Google Maps may not work well—but Uber is a good option for getting around.

Food fans will be happy here, as Bengaluru offers a wide range of vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. From high-end restaurants to small cafes, there is something for everyone. If you enjoy nightlife, the city has many clubs and bars for a fun night out. Nature lovers can visit parks like Cubbon Park and Lal Bagh, which are great for a relaxing walk.

On the downside, living here can be expensive, especially in popular areas, and you might face language issues, although most locals speak English. For a good experience, consider staying in areas near shopping and metro stations. Overall, Bengaluru offers a unique experience, and you may want to come back!
bengaluru.description_kor:
벤갈루루(구 벵갈루르)는 기술과 문화가 조화를 이루는 활기찬 도시입니다. 인도의 실리콘밸리로 불리며, 빠른 인터넷과 많은 엔지니어 덕분에 기술 업계의 중심지로 자리 잡았습니다. 새로운 지하철 시스템은 효율적이지만 보안 검색이 있을 것으로 예상되니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 교통 체증이 심할 때도 있어 때때로 구글 맵이 제대로 작동하지 않을 수 있지만, 우버를 이용하는 것은 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다.

식도락가들에게는 천국과도 같은 곳으로, 벤갈루루에서는 다양한 채식 및 비채식 요리를 맛볼 수 있습니다. 고급 레스토랑부터 아늑한 카페까지 모든 입맛을 만족시킬 수 있는 곳이 많아요. 밤에 유흥을 즐기고 싶다면, 이 도시는 여러 클럽과 바가 있어 재미있는 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 자연을 사랑하는 분들은 큐본 공원이나 랄바그 같은 공원에서 여유롭게 산책할 수 있습니다.

단점으로는 인기 있는 지역은 생활비가 비쌀 수 있고, 대부분의 지역 주민들이 영어를 구사하지만 언어 장벽이 있을 수도 있습니다. 좋은 경험을 원하신다면 쇼핑과 지하철역 근처의 지역에 머무는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로 벤갈루루는 독특한 경험을 제공하며, 다시 방문하고 싶어질지도 모릅니다!

reviews: Stayed here for 2 weeks to get back some Schengen days and had a really nice time! Not the MOST exciting city in the world, but certainly a lovely place to stay and take it easy for a couple days or weeks and get some work done. My favorite part of the city was the canals that run through certain parts, they were really pretty and added a lot of character and there were oftentimes bars/restaurants along the water or trails for running/walking/biking. There are a lot of good restaurants and bars, the people were all very friendly, and we had fun going to an area of town called Digbeth one night - it's a very hip area with a lot of bars and of cool graffiti. Not a ton of sights to see, and of course you can expect typical UK prices, but a very nice place never-the-less! I'd recommend staying either somewhere near the canals on the western side of the city, or right in the city center.
birmingham.description:
Birmingham is a friendly city that has its own appeal, good for relaxing and getting some work done. With nice canals going through parts of the city, you can enjoy walks or bike rides by the water. These places often have bars and restaurants, making it easy to get food or a drink while enjoying the views.

Digbeth is a must-see area, known for its lively bars and colorful street art. While it may not be the most exciting city in the UK, it has many good places to eat and a welcoming feeling. Just remember that it has typical UK prices, so planning your budget is a good idea.

About public transport, it’s okay, but some visitors find it can be a bit limited in certain areas. Also, while people are generally friendly, a few may not speak much English, so knowing a few local phrases can help. If you want a calm place to relax, staying near the canals or in the city center is a great option!
birmingham.description_kor:
버밍엄은 각자의 매력으로 가득한 친근한 도시로, 일과 휴식을 모두 즐기기에 안성맞춤입니다. 도시를 가로지르는 아름다운 운하가 있어, 물가를 따라 산책하거나 자전거를 타며 자연을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 이런 곳에는 바와 레스토랑이 많아 경치를 감상하면서 맛있는 음식과 음료를 쉽게 구할 수 있습니다.

디그베스(Digbeth)는 활기찬 바와 독특한 거리 예술로 유명한 꼭 방문해야 할 핫플레이스입니다. 영국에서 가장 흥미로운 도시라고는 할 수 없지만, 다양한 맛집이 많고 사람들의 환영을 받는 분위기가 느껴집니다. 단, 일반적인 영국 가격대이니 예산을 잘 계획하는 것이 중요합니다.

대중교통은 괜찮은 편이지만, 일부 방문객들은 특정 지역에서 다소 불편하게 느낄 수도 있습니다. 사람들은 대체로 친절하지만, 몇몇은 영어를 잘 하지 못하기 때문에 간단한 지역어를 아는 것이 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 여유롭게 쉴 수 있는 조용한 장소를 원하신다면 운하 근처나 도심에서 머무는 걸 추천합니다!

reviews:
Green, clean, organized, cheap, good food.
Very easy and cheap to go around with Yandex.
Amazing hiking opportunities nearby.
Bus to Almaty costs ~5€ and runs several times a day.
Bus to Karakol costs also ~5€. 
Internet was great. Did several video calls without any issues. Data plans are super cheap (5€ for unlimited data, 1 month).

Pros:
Wonderful and friendly people
Cheap
Green and clean - many parks with big trees in the city center
Several modern and nice cafes and bars, especially around Erkindik boulevard
Enormous opportunities for hiking - huge and beautiful mountains right near the city. For instance, Ala-Archa national park is just 30 km from center
Good opportunities for skiing in winter, especially for freeride, but it might be better to travel to Karakol for this activity
Close to Almaty (Kazakhstan), so you can combine your travel with another beautiful country. The bus costs around USD 5
Several good hostels and hotels in the city and good coworkings also
Cons:
Bad public transportation, but taxi is cheap
Sometimes bad air quality, especially in winter

Bishkek is very cheap. However, I do not agree with several points mentioned in scoring:
1. Bishkek certainly has more English speakers than, for example, in Budapest
2. The air quality is not great - Bishkek is one of the most polluted cities in the world
3. Internet - depends, you can find internet faster than in the UK
Other points - it is difficult finding a job here, I am glad I am working on a project in the UK. The costs of living are very low, average person will earn about $100-200 in the city, so money for food goes really far (though Cambodia is cheaper, Brazil is more expensive). You can find a good flat in the city centre 80 m2 for around $350/month, but you can find a room for around $120/month too. Travelling around is cheap - taxi is around $0.7 for 4 miles trip. City is quite small when comparing to London
Recreation - skiing, swimming (in Issyk-Kul, though summer costs are higher than in Spain, I find this ridiculous), thermal waters, "Dead Sea" (highly salted lakes), mountains
bishkek.description:
Bishkek is a lively city that offers warmth and nature. It is known for being green and clean, with nice parks and many large trees in the center of the city. Getting around is easy and affordable—Yandex taxis are very cheap, and while public transport might not be the best, taxis are a good option.

You will like the friendly people and tasty food at modern cafes and bars, especially along Erkindik Boulevard. If you enjoy nature, you will like Ala-Archa National Park, which is a short ride away and has great hiking and skiing opportunities, especially in Karakol.

Bishkek has good internet and low living costs, but be aware of air quality problems, especially in winter. Finding a job can be difficult, but the low housing costs make it easier to enjoy life here. Overall, Bishkek may be small, but it offers unique experiences and a welcoming environment!
bishkek.description_kor:
비슈케크는 따뜻함과 자연이 어우러진 활기찬 도시입니다. 이 도시는 푸르름과 청결로 유명하며, 도심 곳곳에 아름다운 공원과 큰 나무가 많습니다. 이동이 쉽고 저렴해서 Yandex 택시도 매우 가성비가 좋고, 대중교통은 최선의 선택은 아닐 수 있지만 택시도 훌륭한 옵션입니다.

친절한 사람들과 현대적인 카페, 바에서 맛있는 음식을 즐길 수 있으며, 특히 에르킨딕 대로를 따라 다양한 식당이 있어요. 자연을 사랑하신다면, 짧은 거리에 위치한 알라르차 국립공원도 좋습니다. 이곳은 훌륭한 하이킹과 스키 기회도 제공하며, 특히 카라콜 지역이 인기가 많습니다.

비슈케크는 좋은 인터넷 환경과 낮은 생활비를 가지고 있지만, 겨울철에는 공기 질 문제가 있을 수 있으니 유의해야 합니다. 일자리를 찾는 것이 쉽지 않을 수도 있지만, 낮은 주거 비용 덕분에 이곳에서의 생활이 한층 더 즐거워질 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 비슈케크는 작지만, 독특한 경험과 따뜻한 분위기를 제공합니다!

reviews: Bodrum is an overpriced (central) but quite beautiful (surrounding villages/quays) place, mainly made up of the retirement residences of educated rather educated, secular population. There are amazing quays in driving distance that wouldn't be any different than beautiful coasts of Bali or Thailand.
bodrum.description:
Bodrum is located on the Aegean coast and offers nice views and a lively culture. Many visitors enjoy the attractive quays and nearby villages, which remind them of the lovely beaches of Bali or Thailand. If you want beautiful scenery and a friendly atmosphere, Bodrum is a good choice.

However, keep in mind that the city center can be expensive, so expect higher costs, especially in tourist areas. Despite this, the nice cafes and beautiful sunsets make it a great place to spend time. You will find a friendly and educated local community, mostly made up of people who appreciate their way of life.

Public transportation may not be very good, so renting a car or using taxis can help you explore places outside the main attractions. Be ready for some language differences, but don’t let that stop you! Overall, Bodrum is a great mix of relaxation and culture, ideal for enjoying the sun and experiencing a part of Turkey.
bodrum.description_kor:
보드룸은 에게 해안에 위치해 있어 아름다운 경치와 활기찬 문화를 자랑합니다. 많은 방문객들이 매력적인 부두와 인근 마을을 즐기는데, 이는 발리나 태국의 사랑스러운 해변을 떠올리게 하죠. 아름다운 풍경과 따뜻한 분위기를 원하신다면 보드룸은 정말 좋은 선택입니다.

하지만 도심의 물가는 다소 비쌀 수 있으니, 관광 지역에서는 특별히 비용이 더 올라갈 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고, 아름다운 카페와 멋진 석양이 있어서 시간을 보내기에 좋은 장소입니다. 또한 친절하고 교육받은 지역 주민들을 만날 수 있는데, 그들 대부분은 자신들의 삶의 방식을 소중히 여기는 분들입니다.

대중교통이 그리 불편할 수 있으니, 자동차를 렌트하거나 택시를 이용하는 것이 주요 관광지 외의 장소를 탐험하는 데 도움이 됩니다. 언어의 장벽이 있을 수 있지만, 그것이 여러분의 여행을 방해하지 않도록 하세요! 전반적으로 보드룸은 편안한 휴식과 풍부한 문화를 동시에 경험할 수 있는 이상적인 곳으로, 태양을 만끽하며 터키의 숨은 매력을 느껴보기에 완벽한 장소입니다.

reviews: I strongly disagree with some statements on your website about Biarritz. This is a surfers' paradise year around, weather is good to fantastic throughout the year, life is peaceful and healthy. This is also a golfer's paradise with 16 courses around the city. Many biking roads start in Biarritz and wind up into Pyrenees. There is always plenty to do here, and international festivals abound, so do surfing and swimming competitions. How about helicopter tour or airplane free fall? Salt water swimming pool. Miles of fabulous sandy beaches and dunes. We have wonderful farmer's markets, luxury clothing stores, local creators, theater with very high quality ballet troupe, opera directly from the METH, wonderful food, nightclubs, museums... Prices are very reasonable for France, and almost everybody speaks English, French and Spanish. You can live on shabby-chic or extreme luxury, what every your budget allows. High speed internet, city wide Wi-Fi coverage. People are very friendly, both locals and transplanted ones. Oh yeah, just 25km from San Sebastian in Spain. International airport with direct flights to many European capitals, train to Bordeaux and Paris in a few hours... I can't imagine better place to live and work - except maybe Kauai island.
biarritz.description:
Biarritz, located on the French coast, is a mix of rest and fun all year round. Known as a place for surfers, the city has good weather, nice beaches, and exciting surf competitions that draw visitors from many places. But if surfing is not for you, there are around 16 golf courses nearby and many biking trails in the beautiful Pyrenees area.

The vibe here is friendly and relaxed, with a lively cultural scene that includes ballet, opera, and busy farmer’s markets. There are many shops, from luxury stores to local shops, which makes shopping enjoyable. The cost of living is quite reasonable for such a nice place, and many locals speak English, French, and Spanish, making communication easier.

Public transport can be limited, but the city is charming and it's easy to reach San Sebastian, which is just a short drive away. So, whether you're looking for luxury or something simpler, Biarritz has something for you!
biarritz.description_kor:
비아리츠는 프랑스 해안에 위치한 연중 내내 휴식과 즐거움이 어우러지는 곳입니다. 서핑의 메카로 알려진 이 도시는 화창한 날씨와 아름다운 해변, 그리고 많은 관광객을 끌어모으는 흥미진진한 서핑 대회가 열립니다. 서핑이 취향이 아니라면, 근처에는 약 16개의 골프장이 있으며, 아름다운 피레네 산맥 지역에는 다양한 자전거 도로도 마련되어 있습니다.

여기에서는 친근하고 편안한 분위기를 느낄 수 있으며, 발레, 오페라, 그리고 활기찬 농민 시장과 같은 다채로운 문화 활동도 즐길 수 있습니다. 고급 상점부터 지역 상점까지 다양하게 마련되어 있어 쇼핑도 즐겁습니다. 이렇게 매력적인 장소임에도 불구하고 생활비는 꽤 합리적이며, 많은 현지인들이 영어, 프랑스어, 스페인어를 구사해 소통이 원활합니다.

대중교통은 다소 제한적일 수 있지만, 이 도시는 매력적이며 가까운 산 세바스티안에도 쉽게 접근할 수 있습니다. 따라서 당신이 고급스러운 경험을 원하든, 좀 더 간편한 즐거움을 찾든 비아리츠는 모든 이들을 위한 매력을 제공합니다!

reviews: Boise is an up and coming city with loads of people moving in. It has accessibility to lots of great outdoor adventures including hiking, biking, rafting/kayaking, hotsprings, and more. There are four seasons, but none too harsh. There's a cool downtown bar scene. Also, the highest concentration of basque immigrants in the world is in Boise, so there are some interesting cultural elements as well as great basque bars and restaurants. Because it is a smaller city, there are some limitations (not that many great restaurants). It is safe and a pleasant place to live.
boise.description:
Boise is a great place for anyone looking for a mix of city life and outdoor activities. With its nice views, there are many chances for hiking, biking, and rafting—ideal for people who enjoy being active. The four mild seasons mean you will have a bit of everything without extreme weather. 

One interesting part of Boise is its lively downtown bar scene, where you can relax after a day of exploring. Also, with the largest group of Basque immigrants in the U.S., the city has unique cultural spots and tasty Basque restaurants that you should try! 

While Boise is smaller, which makes it feel welcoming, it does have some limits, like fewer high-end dining choices. On the positive side, the city feels very safe and is a nice place to live. Just keep in mind that the public transport system is not very large, so having a car can be useful. Overall, Boise offers a good mix of activities, culture, and friendly neighborhoods for visitors and residents!
boise.description_kor:
보이지는 도시 생활과 야외 활동의 조화를 원하는 사람들에게 아주 좋은 장소입니다. 아름다운 경관 덕분에 하이킹, 자전거 타기, 래프팅 등의 다양한 활동을 즐길 수 있어 활동적인 사람들에게는 천국 같은 곳이죠. 사계절이 온화해서 극단적인 날씨 없이 다양한 경험을 할 수 있다는 것도 큰 장점입니다.

보이지의 매력 중 하나는 활기찬 다운타운 바 씬입니다. 하루 종일 탐험한 후 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 바와 레스토랑이 잘 마련되어 있습니다. 또, 미국에서 가장 많은 바스크 이민자들이 거주하는 이 도시에서는 독특한 문화 공간과 맛있는 바스크 요리 레스토랑이 많아서 꼭 한번 경험해봐야 합니다!

보이지는 비교적 작고 아늑한 느낌을 주지만, 고급 레스토랑 선택지가 적은 한계가 있을 수도 있습니다. 하지만 긍정적인 점은 이 도시가 매우 안전하게 느껴지고, 살기 좋은 곳이라는 거죠. 다만 대중교통 시스템이 그리 크지 않아서 차가 있는 것이 더 편리할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 보이지는 방문객과 주민 모두에게 활동, 문화, 그리고 친근한 이웃이 조화를 이루는 곳입니다!

reviews:
It's a fantastic spot for kitesurfing nomads within the season: you can kitesurf on the windy side of the island or go to the White Beach where the wind doesn't reach and chill on one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. It's a small island, so expect to start bumping into people you know after a couple of days, but it's got enough to offer to keep you entertained for a couple of weeks, and if you kitesurf even longer. 

There are some apartment with internet speed allowing you to work from there, and two coworking spaces if that's what you prefer. 

One thing to keep in mind is that the prices in Boracay are not as low as in other countries in Asia. Good lunch can cost you anywhere from 8-10 euros up.

If this place is Hostile towards LGBT, then non of the rich movie stars in Hollywood would even think of visiting this place. When I say rich,
I mean Billionaires and Millionaires, that even a fraction of their money can probably buy the whole island itself. Now, they say that this beach is world famous? World famous for what! for bashing LGBTs? This narrow mindedness that's going on around this island is nothing but hypocrisy. Women are allowed to wear pasties and dental floss on the beach, while men has to wear a skirt? What kind of a screwed up society do they have there. If for anything, they should turn this island, that is a size of a "Booger", into an all adult nudist island, where everybody is welcome - straight or LGBT alike.
boracay.description:
Boracay is a small island in the Philippines that has something for everyone. Known for its beautiful White Beach, you can spend a nice day sunbathing or walking along the beach, and then do windsurfing or kitesurfing on the windy side of the island. Since it's a small place, you will likely see the same people again after a few days, making it feel like a friendly community.

There are some good places to stay, with good internet if you want to work remotely. There are also a few coworking spaces if you prefer that. Just note that prices can be a bit higher than in other parts of Asia, with meals starting around 8-10 euros.

While the island is beautiful, some visitors have mentioned cultural challenges, including a less open attitude toward the LGBT community. Still, Boracay offers beauty and adventure that is hard to match. Whether you want to relax in the sun, make new friends, or enjoy some excitement, this nice island has something special for you. Just remember to keep an open mind!
boracay.description_kor:
보라카이는 필리핀의 작은 섬으로 모든 사람에게 어울리는 매력이 가득한 곳입니다. 아름다운 화이트 비치로 유명한 이곳에서는 일광욕을 즐기거나 해변을 따라 산책하며 멋진 하루를 보낼 수 있고, 바람이 시원하게 부는 쪽에서는 윈드서핑이나 카이트서핑 같은 수상 스포츠도 즐길 수 있습니다. 섬이 작기 때문에 몇 일 지나면 같은 사람들과 다시 마주치게 되어 친근한 커뮤니티처럼 느껴질 것입니다.

원격 근무를 원하신다면 좋은 인터넷이 갖춰진 숙소들도 많이 있으니 걱정하지 않으셔도 됩니다. 또, 코워킹 스페이스도 몇 군데 있으니 참고하시면 좋겠네요. 다만, 다른 아시아 지역에 비해 가격대가 조금 높은 편이며, 식사는 대략 8-10 유로부터 시작합니다.

섬은 정말 아름답지만, 일부 방문객들은 LGBT 커뮤니티에 대한 개방적인 태도가 부족한 점을 문화적 도전으로 언급하기도 했습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 보라카이는 그 어떤 곳과도 비교할 수 없는 아름다움과 모험을 제공합니다. 태양 아래에서 편안한 휴식을 취하고 싶거나 새로운 친구를 만나고 싶거나 짜릿한 경험을 하고 싶다면, 이 멋진 섬에는 여러분을 위한 특별한 무언가가 가득합니다. 열린 마음을 잊지 마세요!

reviews:
Lived here for 6 months 2X over the last few years. This city is so under the radar. While medellin is overrun with gringos you will find very few here. International food is quite good and you will even find michelen starred restos here. Internet is great, and many cafes or coworking/weworks to work out of. Bogota is a tech capital in latam, so a decent place to farm out work, although dont expect mass english proficiency. 
Women here are very good looking but more of the "classy" type versus the reggaeton video types you see in medellin. If you can find a solid gf/wife you will never leave trust me colombian women are one of a kind. 
Traffic is some of the worst so make sure you can walk everywhere you gotta go or alternatively only travel outside of rush hour. Has all your favorite apps like uber and rappi as well. Rappi was actually invented here. Where you stay really matters as the class divide in Bogota is huge. Personally lived in Chico which I loved. Other people say rosales is good and if you like suburban life usaquen. South of the city is a no go, and probably a warzone. Night life is decent and has all types from classy to grungy. Chapinero and 85 are good for parties. Careful in chapinero at night, dont drink too much. Safety can be a problem mainly at night but if you live in chico,rosales, usaquen you dont really need to worry so much. Also Bogota is one of the most creative cities not just latam but worldwide. A true haven for artists of all types, big graffiti culture, and a ton of cool museums. Place is generally cheap if you earn dollars, but if you wanna spend big there are places. Also good for people on a budget as well. Weather wise it rains a lot and almost has a permanent "fall feeling". If you love fall its the place for you. Pollution can be bad so avoid high traffic areas in rush hour, but rain clears away pollution. For me personally Bogota is a true hidden gem, and an awesome place.

Lived in Bogota for 2 months, living with a local was great. The Bogota restaurant scene was amazing if you stay mostly in the tourist or rich parts of Bogota, outside of the tourist parts I only found a couple of good restaurants. I lived in the center and lived in the south of the city. Avoid the South like the plague, didn’t feel safe, low-quality infrastructure, and poor-quality restaurants. Only stay in the touristy areas as the traffic is some of the worst in the world. The weather was ok, not very cold and can have some hot days. Road quality is some of the worst in the world, I was constantly dodging potholes and if it rains the traffic becomes quite terrible. Pollution I found to be quite bad

Dating for me was pretty good, a lot better than Medellin that’s for sure.
The city itself after a few days you have seen it all and you will need to go on day trips for things to do. The city wasn’t very clean to be honest and I wouldn’t walk the streets alone at night. 
Has great malls, cinemas, and medical care. 
Not the worst city but not the best, I wouldn’t recommend it for long-term living. Happy to leave 5/10.

I've moved here permanently. Kids are in an elite school for $600pm, and I'm the only non-Colombian parent. I'm surprised there aren't more foreigners. Going to Gringo Tuesdays is a very touristy thing, I only ever went once everyone is 25 and trying to get laid basically, and its P$11,000 a beer, my local pub sells beer for $P2,000 by comparison. The longer you are here the more you discover. The "centre" of the city is really from 83rd-93rd-115th roughly, 83rd has loads of great clubs and restaurants and getting an uber at 2am is perfectly safe. Don't be hanging round calle 13 or something, visit and leave before dark! The further north you go the safer it is, above Parque 93 its probably safer than NY. There are a lot of WeWorks and the internet is super fast, I have 350MB broadband in my house, a six bedroom house with 1/4 acre garden for $400k. ScotiaBank/Colpatria gives you the best exchange rate.

Strongly agree that this is an underrated city! If you want to buckle down and get some work done, it's a great place to be. Folks here are a bit more serious and business minded, and it comes with generally good internet and functioning services around the city. There are a number of cool coliving buildings that make life really fun. I stayed in one called Plura Coliving for about $700/month. You get a private room/bathroom + gym, spa, bar, restaurant, laundry, coworking, rec rooms, etc. all built into the same building. Awesome place to stay!! Knowing Spanish will be more helpful, since the nomad community is much smaller than Medellín, but if you want a more authentic experience it's a great place to meet locals. Go to "Gringo Tuesday" nights at a local bar called Vintrash while you are there, great vibes and lots of fun people to meet!
Wildly underrated city. Lots of great restaurants, bars, nice people and wonderful museums and parks

I was at Bogota for two weeks last month and did not felt like doing much tourism. Its a packed city, traffic jam at its worse and a wierd vibe. Im not a city guy, though internet its great and services run 24/7. I stayed at a comercial barrio, Muequeta, in front of a uni, which felt safer.
I was told I was staying in an insecure part of the city by a local, but I really, truly didn't notice anything too sketchy. Walked down some bad roads, but no one tended much to be on them.

Nice city. Need cash in many places still hence long lines for ATMs. Safe. Pretty. Goes from cloudy to sunny to cloudy to sunny. Take a bike tour to see the city. I stay in Chapinero which was nice. There a gym called Body Tech and they'll let you work out there for free your first time. No water fountains though so bring your own.
bogota.description:
Bogotá is a lively city that often goes unnoticed, making it a great find for those who come here. If you want a mix of culture, good food, and a tech-friendly atmosphere, this place may appeal to you. The restaurant scene is busy, with choices from affordable meals to high-end dining, especially in northern areas like Chico and Rosales. 

However, there are some challenges. Traffic can be very bad, so it's best to avoid rush hour or consider walking. Safety can vary—stay in tourist-friendly areas and be careful at night. The weather can change often, with regular rain that gives it a cozy feel and helps reduce pollution.

There are many cafes, coworking spaces, and fast internet, making it a good location for online work. Just remember that speaking Spanish can make your experience better. For nightlife, visit Chapinero and the 85 area. Whether you want artsy experiences, creative scenes, or a different adventure, Bogotá has something waiting for you!
bogota.description_kor:
보고타는 종종 주목받지 못하는 활기찬 도시로, 방문하는 이들에게 멋진 발견이 되어줍니다. 문화, 맛있는 음식, 그리고 기술 친화적인 분위기를 모두 경험하고 싶다면 이곳이 매력적일 것입니다. 레스토랑 씬은 매우 다양하고, 저렴한 식사부터 고급 다이닝까지 선택할 수 있는 옵션이 풍부합니다. 특히 치코와 로사레스 같은 북부 지역에서 다양한 음식을 즐길 수 있습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 챌린지도 존재합니다. 교통이 꽤나 혼잡할 수 있으므로 출퇴근 시간은 피하거나 도보를 고려하는 것이 좋습니다. 안전은 지역에 따라 차이가 나니 관광객이 많이 찾는 곳에 머물고, 밤에는 주의하는 것이 필요합니다. 날씨가 자주 변하고 정기적으로 비가 오는 편이어서, 아늑한 느낌을 주면서도 공기를 정화하는 데 도움이 됩니다.

또한, 보고타에는 많은 카페와 코워킹 스페이스가 있어 빠른 인터넷을 이용하며 온라인 작업을 하기에 좋은 환경을 제공합니다. 스페인어를 구사할 수 있다면 더 풍부한 경험을 할 수 있겠죠. 밤문화를 즐기고 싶다면 차피네로나 85번 지역을 방문해 보세요. 예술적인 경험, 창의적인 분위기, 그리고 다양한 모험이 있는 보고타에서 여러분을 기다리는 즐거운 일들이 가득합니다!

reviews:
Best climate in the UK, excellent beach, nature and sport options. Low crime and pretty friendly.

Plenty of good coffee shops for working in (Boscanova, Velo Domestique, Coast . Surf + Moto, L'arte Coffee). 
A bit overpriced due to tourist economy, but still more affordable than London or Brighton.

One of the few British seaside towns which does not feel like a retirement home.
Due to universities, it has a large amount of young people from continental Europe and South America. Good social scene.

Infrastructure is a bit lacking. With a poorly connected small airport and a 2-3 hour bus ride to Heathrow.
bournemouth.description:
Bournemouth is a nice seaside town in the UK, known for its beautiful beaches and good weather. The friendly atmosphere here makes it easy to meet people, especially with a busy social scene supported by the local universities. You'll find many young people from Europe and South America, which adds to the town's lively feel.

People who enjoy outdoor activities will appreciate the area's natural beauty, with many nature trails and sports options. If you like coffee, the local coffee shops like Boscanova and Velo Domestique are good places to work or relax.

While it costs more because it attracts tourists, it is still cheaper than nearby London or Brighton. Keep in mind that public transport may not be the best, as the airport is small and bus rides to Heathrow take 2-3 hours.

Overall, Bournemouth is a nice place to enjoy beach life without the feel of a retirement community that some coastal towns have. Just pack your bags and get ready for a fun beach escape!
bournemouth.description_kor:
보뫼르스는 아름다운 해변과 좋은 날씨로 유명한 영국의 멋진 해변 마을입니다. 이곳은 지역 대학들의 활발한 지원 덕분에 친근하고 활기찬 사회적 환경이 조성되어 있어 사람들을 쉽게 만날 수 있는 분위기입니다. 유럽과 남미에서 온 많은 젊은이들이 이곳을 찾아 더욱 생동감 넘치는 느낌을 줍니다.

야외 활동을 즐기는 사람들은 이 지역의 자연 경관을 만끽할 수 있으며, 다양한 산책로와 스포츠 기회가 마련되어 있습니다. 커피 애호가라면 Boscanova와 Velo Domestique 같은 지역 카페에서 일하거나 휴식을 취하기에 좋은 장소를 찾을 수 있습니다.

관광객이 많아 가격이 조금 비싼 편이지만, 인근 도시인 런던이나 브라이튼에 비하면 여전히 저렴합니다. 공항이 작고, 히드로까지 가는 버스 이동이 2-3시간 걸리므로 대중교통은 최선의 선택이 아닐 수 있습니다.

전반적으로 보뫼르스는 은퇴 커뮤니티의 느낌 없이 해변 생활을 만끽할 수 있는 매력적인 장소입니다. 짐을 꾸리고 즐거운 해변 여행을 떠날 준비를 해보세요!

reviews:
Bologna is considered one of the best cities in Italy. The city doesn't hold any world-famous monument as it could be Pisa's tower, but has one of the oldest universities in the world (with much of it converted to a museum), is home to the best and well known meals (lasagna, mortadella, tortellini, just to mention few), is home to so many famous people that I cannot even count, has the headquarters of the gay association (with one of the nicest night clubs in the city), there are almost 16000 students at the university, 10% of which are foreigners, and the rest you can google it.
In the Pros and Cons someone said "not much to do": they are clearly living in another dimension, because Bologna is literally THE CITY of entertainment.
Also, I don't know how they came up with almost 5000$/month to live... If you don't aim for luxury, with 1000€ you can live a cheap but fair life: with 2000$ you can live a nice and happy life, going out every other day.
In few words: to the hell the data about the cities on this website, it's all bs.
The old center is ok but the rest is not so great!
bologna.description:
Bologna is a special place with a strong culture and interesting history. It may not have famous landmarks, but it has one of the oldest universities in the world, with nearly 16,000 students, creating a lively environment. The food is also a highlight; Bologna is known for dishes like lasagna, tortellini, and mortadella, making it great for food lovers.

Living here is quite affordable if you avoid luxury. Many people find that with about 1000€ a month, you can live comfortably. Safety is usually good, but like any city, it's smart to be cautious, especially in busy areas. Public transport is okay but can be limited, so be prepared to walk a bit.

For entertainment, Bologna has a lively nightlife and many events, great for those looking to have fun. Each neighborhood has its own character, from busy student areas to quieter parts. Just remember, if you have trouble with the language, don't hesitate to smile and communicate! It will help you a lot in this friendly city.
bologna.description_kor:
볼로냐는 풍부한 문화와 흥미로운 역사를 지닌 특별한 도시입니다. 비록 유명한 랜드마크는 없지만, 세계에서 가장 오래된 대학 중 하나가 자리잡고 있어 약 16,000명의 학생들이 재학 중입니다. 이로 인해 도시 전체에 활기찬 분위기가 흐릅니다. 식음료 또한 주목할 만한데, 볼로냐는 라자냐, 토르텔리니, 모르타델라 등으로 유명하여 음식 애호가들에게 완벽한 장소입니다. 

생활비는 사치를 피해 가면 꽤 저렴하게 유지할 수 있습니다. 많은 사람들은 한 달에 약 1,000 유로로 편안하게 지낼 수 있다고 합니다. 안전한 편이지만, 모든 도시와 마찬가지로 혼잡한 지역에서는 주의가 필요합니다. 대중교통 수단은 괜찮지만 다소 제한적일 수 있어 약간의 도보가 필요할 수 있습니다.

볼로냐에서는 활기찬 밤문화와 다양한 이벤트가 많아 오락거리를 찾는 이들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 각 동네는 바쁜 학생들이 모이는 곳부터 조용한 지역까지 각각의 개성이 담겨 있습니다. 언어 문제로 어려움을 느낀다면, 주저하지 말고 미소를 지으며 소통해 보세요! 이 친절한 도시는 많은 도움을 줄 것입니다.

reviews: Boston is a city in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. It is the capital of the state, the largest city in New England, and the U.S. state of Massachusetts. The city proper is home to about 617,900 people, making it the largest city in New England and the 26th largest in the United States.
boston.description:
Boston is a lively city full of history and energy. People enjoy how easy it is to walk around, with many attractions nearby. You should explore the Freedom Trail, which takes you to important landmarks and shows part of the city’s past. The local culture has many universities, art, and sports, great for anyone looking for fun or education.

However, the high cost of living can be a concern for some visitors, and public transportation is not as extensive as in other big cities. The T (the subway) works well, but it can get crowded, especially during busy times. Also, driving can be difficult because of some confusing one-way streets.

Overall, the city is generally safe, but it's wise to be aware of your surroundings, especially at night. You might also notice some locals speaking with a strong Boston accent. In summary, this lively city has much to offer, from its history to its neighborhoods, making it an appealing place for both visitors and people looking to live there.
boston.description_kor:
보스턴은 역사와 에너지로 가득 찬活기찬 도시입니다. 이곳의 사람들은 많은 명소들이 가까이 있어 걷는 즐거움을 만끽합니다. 특히 '자유의 길(Freedom Trail)'을 따라가며 도시의 역사적인 랜드마크들을 탐험해보세요. 이 길은 도시의 과거를 생생히 보여줍니다. 보스턴은 여러 대학과 예술, 스포츠 시설이 가득해 재미와 교육을 동시에 원하는 이들에게 적합한 장소입니다.

그러나 생활비가 비싼 점은 일부 방문객들이 걱정할 만한 요소가 될 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 다른 대도시에 비해 널리 퍼져 있지 않으며, T(지하철)는 잘 운영되지만 특히 출퇴근 시간에는 붐빌 수 있습니다. 또한 복잡한 일방통행 도로로 인해 운전이 어려운 경우도 있습니다.

전반적으로 보스턴은 비교적 안전한 도시지만, 특히 밤에는 주변을 잘 살피는 것이 중요합니다. 그런가 하면, 몇몇 현지인들의 독특한 보스턴 억양이 귀에 감길 수도 있습니다. 요약하자면, 이 활기찬 도시는 역사부터 동네 매력까지 풍부한 경험을 제공하여 방문객들과 새로 이주하려는 사람들에게 매력적인 장소입니다.

reviews: Brasilia is a hidden gem in the middle of Brazil. Very safe city, with good restaurants, super safe traffic, very green, perfect for biking, and with a high level of education. Shaped like an airplane, it is the most famous planned town in the world, by legendary architect Oscar Niemayer. Internet is good, you can rent a cheap Airbnb, most of them with a green view, There are more than 800 waterfalls close by (check Chapada dos Veadeiros) and hiking spots. The climate very pleasant as long as you don't go in August/September which is too dry and hot. It's also a cafe paradise, with very good baristas. Its the perfect place to chill if you have to focus on a project while living abroad. It's not big on clubs and nightlife but meet some locals and you will find the best parties at home or crazy places in your life. Rent a car for your stay to have a better experience - or get yourself a bike, cuz it has bike lanes everywhere - and bikes for renting on an app if you wish to. There's a lake with many activities around it, from bars to bike lanes to Hawaiian canoeing, windsurfing, etc. There are many boat rentals around it. There are many recreational parks in town too- check Parque Olhos D'agua. Never ever miss the sunset, the sky is amazing!!! 360 degrees of color explosion. Look up at the trees and you will see tucans and macaws flying among many other types of birds. There are many interesting bars, you just have to do your research. There are many malls with stores that go from Louis Vuitton to the local store, so you will find anything. All the embassies are in Brasilia, so you will find many expats living here. This review is referring to Brasilia only, not the cities around it - which are a bit less safe, so if you go stay at Asa Sul or Asa Norte. Lago Sul and Lago Norte are safe too but there's not much going on there.

Great restaurants. Very organized city, unique architecture, traffic is usually good and drivers respect pedestrians. Very dry weather between may and september, great for outdoor activities in parks and at the Paranoa Lake. You can meet people from all over the country, since they usually leave their home state to work in public agencies in Brasilia. Public transportation isn't great, but taxis and uber work very well. Brasilia itself is a safe place, the surroundings not much. Cost of living is high compared to cities of the same size.

Big city that feels like a small town. It’s safer than most cities in Brazil and has a very diverse population. It’s a gastronomic and cultural hotspot. Cons: awful public transportation, cracked sidewalks, poor accessibility and not much to do at night (most establishments are closed at around 11).
brasilia.description:
Brasília is located in the center of Brazil. This planned city, designed by architect Oscar Niemeyer, is known for its airplane shape and green areas. It feels safe to walk along its tree-lined streets, and traffic is easy—drivers usually respect pedestrians.

For outdoor lovers, there are about 800 waterfalls nearby and good hiking at Chapada dos Veadeiros. The weather is generally nice, but be careful in the hot, dry months of August and September. If you like biking, Brasília has many bike lanes, and you can rent bikes using an app.

The nightlife is not as lively as in other big cities, but you can find local events and small bars if you spend time with the locals. The cost of living can be high, and public transportation may not be great, but with Uber and taxis, you can get around easily. Don’t forget to enjoy the beautiful sunsets; the sky has colors that are worth seeing. For a mix of culture, safety, and nice views, Brasília is a special place.
brasilia.description_kor:
브라질리아는 브라질의 중심에 위치한 도시입니다. 유명한 건축가 오스카 니에메이어가 설계한 이 도시의 독특한 모습은 비행기 모양과 넉넉한 녹지로 잘 알려져 있습니다. 나무가 늘어선 거리에서 산책하는 것은 매우 안전하며, 교통 체계도 편리합니다. 운전자들은 보행자를 대체로 배려합니다.

야외 활동을 즐기는 분들에게는 인근에 약 800개의 폭포와 샤파다 도스 베아데이로스에서 제공하는 좋은 하이킹 코스가 있습니다. 날씨는 일반적으로 맑고 좋지만, 특히 8월과 9월의 덥고 건조한 시기에는 주의가 필요합니다. 자전거를 좋아하신다면 브라질리아에는 많은 자전거 도로가 마련되어 있어 앱을 통해 쉽게 자전거를 대여할 수 있습니다.

밤문화는 다른 대도시들에 비해 활발하지 않지만, 현지인들과 함께 시간을 보내면 지역 행사나 아늑한 바를 쉽게 발견할 수 있습니다. 생활비가 다소 높은 편이며, 대중교통이 불편할 수 있지만 우버나 택시를 이용하면 편리하게 이동할 수 있습니다. 아름다운 일몰은 꼭 놓치지 마세요; 하늘의 색깔이 정말 매력적입니다. 문화, 안전, 그리고 환상적인 전망이 완벽하게 어우러진 브라질리아는 정말 특별한 장소입니다.

reviews: Brasov is absolutely beautiful. Not a ton to do socially, and certainly no big nomad community. But the food is amazing, cost of living is cheap, and the parks and mountains surrounding you make it worth visiting! You can literally hike a gorgeous mountain walking about 5 minutes south of the old city center. It's also the most central location to visit nearby castles and national parks. You can buy tickets online and the trains are easy to navigate to get to places like Peles Castle in an hour or so. Highly recommend staying here a couple weeks! I hope to return.

Amazing location for the adventure nomad. If you love mountain sports it is hard to find a better spot. Romania has one of the best internet providers you could want in Digi. Be careful where you stay, anything up towards Poiana Brasov will not have wired internet, anything in the square will be great and super cheap. This is a great spot for anyone in the summer but def rough in the winter. We did 4 months in Bucharest and moved up here after we were visiting every weekend. If you plan to travel Europe and see all of Romania this is a very central location to accomplish both of those.

I have tried Brasov for 1 month in August. 
I was desperate to find any place that was not run down by tourists. There is virtually almost no cafe that is suitable to work from, as they are overcrowded by hordes of tourists, families, people drinking.
I had a hard time. I booked in advance for 1 entire month in light of other reviews I saw, but this was my mistake. I would not recommend this for someone who is trying to be productive. The atmosphere is way too much 'vacation' style and reminds me of Disneyland. If I had to redo it I would much more consider other cities in Romania. Bucharest looks quite great. Unfortunately, I did not see other cities in this country yet.
Brasov looks like any historic German city, but Brasov is a resort city, the entire old town is only catered to tourism. There's nothing special about it.

If you love hiking Brasov is like heaven. The mountains nearby have a widespread network of trails. Also it becomes a ski spot in the winter. Architecture is also nice, locals are friendly, prices are low, English is spoken and Romanian is a very interesting language, by the way.

Brasov, is very beautiful, and interesting city, with a huge mountain, "Tampa" near city. Center of city, it is a museum, churches, buildings, restaurants, good infrastructure, is not very expensive, quality of life, is high, very much tourists, of all countries. 
Brasov it is a treasure, Romanian treasure. Brasov it is amazing. 
Brasov, is on the top!
Lots of cafes with English-speaking staff and great Wi-Fi. Very close to Sibiu and Bucharest, but also the mountains, with lots of stuff to do during the winter season.
Brasov should be in top 5 in europe for quality of living. gorgeous city, fresh air, mountains, booming it industry,way ahead, sofia, kiev, krakow, warsaw, minsk
brasov.description:
Brasov is a city with beautiful views and a rich history. Located at the base of the Carpathian Mountains, it is great for mountain lovers, providing quick access to hiking trails and ski areas near the old city center. You can go just 5 minutes south for great nature, offering a nice break from daily life.

The food is very good, and the cost of living is low, so you can enjoy a nice meal without spending too much money. While the city has many tourists—sometimes making it hard to find a quiet café to work in—locals are friendly, and many speak English, making it easy for visitors to feel comfortable.

A visit would not be complete without seeing nearby places like Peles Castle, which is just a short train ride away. However, be careful: staying further up toward Poiana Brasov may mean you do not have good internet. If you enjoy a mix of nature and culture, Brasov is worth a couple of weeks, but if you are looking for a lively social scene or a better working environment, you might want to look at other cities in Romania.
brasov.description_kor:
브라쇼브는 아름다운 경치와 풍부한 역사를 자랑하는 도시입니다. 카르파티아 산맥 기슭에 자리 잡고 있어 산을 사랑하는 사람들에게 최적의 장소이며, 구시가지 근처의 하이킹 코스와 스키 리조트도 쉽게 이용할 수 있습니다. 남쪽으로는 불과 5분 거리에서 한가로운 자연을 만끽할 수 있어 일상의 스트레스에서 잠시 벗어날 수 있는 훌륭한 휴양지입니다. 

음식도 정말 맛있고 생활비가 저렴하여 적은 비용으로도 훌륭한 식사를 즐길 수 있습니다. 이 도시에는 많은 관광객이 찾아와 때때로 조용한 카페에서 작업하기 어려울 수 있지만, 현지인들은 매우 친절하며 영어를 구사하는 사람도 많아 방문객들이 편안하게 지낼 수 있습니다. 

근처에 위치한 펠레스 성(Peles Castle) 같은 명소를 반드시 방문해야 여행의 완성도가 높아질 것입니다. 하지만 조심해야 할 점은 포이아나 브라쇼브(Poiana Brasov) 쪽으로 올라가면 인터넷 연결이 원활하지 않을 수 있다는 점입니다. 자연과 문화를 동시에 즐기고 싶다면 브라쇼브에서 몇 주를 보내는 것이 충분히 가치가 있지만, 활기찬 사회적 환경이나 더 나은 근무 여건을 원하신다면 루마니아 다른 도시도 고려하는 것이 좋을 것 같습니다.

reviews: Was there for one month. Beautiful place, but not a lot to do. We were happy to leave.
braga.description:
Braga is a nice place in northern Portugal, known for its charm and history. You can walk through streets with many churches and parks. The city's atmosphere is relaxed, which is good for taking things easy. Many visitors like the friendly locals and the local food, especially the pastries.

However, it is important to note that while Braga is nice, some people feel there are not many activities for a long stay. If you want constant excitement, you might find it more quiet than bigger cities. The cost of living is generally reasonable, making it a good place to live, especially if you have a limited budget.

Public transportation is okay, but it can be limited, so having a plan for getting around is important. Most visitors feel safe while exploring the city. Enjoy the local customs, try the food, and experience the relaxed life that Braga offers!
braga.description_kor:
브라가는 북포르투갈에 위치한 매력적인 도시로, 풍부한 역사와 아름다운 경관으로 유명합니다. 이곳의 거리에서는 많은 교회와 공원을 탐방하며 여유롭게 걸어 다닐 수 있습니다. 전체적인 분위기가 한적해 느긋하게 시간을 보내기에 정말 좋습니다. 많은 여행객들이 친절한 현지인들과 다양한 현지 음식을 특히나 디저트를 즐기는 점도 큰 매력입니다.

그러나 브라가는 좋은 곳이긴 하지만, 일부 사람들은 장기간 머물기에는 활동이 부족하다고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 지속적으로 다양한 볼거리를 원하신다면 대도시에 비해 조용하게 느껴질 수도 있습니다. 생활비는 대체로 합리적이라 특히 예산이 제한된 분들에게는 살기 좋은 곳입니다.

대중교통이 이용 가능하지만, 다소 제한적일 수 있으니 이동 계획을 미리 세우는 것이 중요합니다. 대부분의 방문객들은 이 도시에서 안전하다고 느끼며, 지역 문화를 즐기고 음식을 맛보며 브라가의 느긋한 삶을 경험해 보세요!

reviews: Nothing much to do in Bratislava, a lack of decent restaurants, expensive for what it has to offer. The walkability is nice.
The best airbnb of my life and very cheap, at night I ended up in a brothel by accident, magical nights in Bratislava

To be quite honest, the old town of BRATISLAVA is easy to finish in 1 day + the outer parts of it. Seemed quite mischevious in some ways with the people over there or maybe I am just confusing it with KOSICE which is by far one of the awful experiences I have had in SLOVAKIA.

Great Hospitals? ahhh nope. They're atrocious here. Even getting referred to an english speaking doctor as an insured customer is an ordeal. Their best university is ranked 450th in the world & that's where the doctors are getting trained. All the locals go to vienna. enough said.
Was there a couple of weeks ago. Has a bit of Prague feeling + Warsaw style. Or maybe I am wrong. But really enjoyed it! Fully recommend!
bratislava.description:
Bratislava is a city that has its own charm. While some visitors say there isn't much to do beyond a day or so, the old town is easy to walk around and has interesting historical sites. The buildings remind some people of Prague, making it nice for a walk, but you might find the food choices a bit limited.

On the other hand, there are good and affordable Airbnb options that can make your stay comfortable without spending too much. Just be careful; going out at night can lead to unexpected situations—like ending up in a brothel by mistake!

In practical terms, public transport is not very good, and some visitors have had trouble with language at hospitals. If you're looking for a busy food scene, you might want to go to nearby Vienna, where locals often go for more dining choices.

Despite some downsides, many travelers liked their time in the city, especially if they want a relaxed experience with a bit of fun. So if you're looking for a short and different adventure, Bratislava might surprise you!
bratislava.description_kor:
브라티슬라바는 독특한 매력을 지닌 도시입니다. 일부 방문객들은 하루 이상 특별한 즐길 거리가 많지 않다고 느낄 수 있지만, 구시가는 쉽게 걸어다니며 흥미로운 역사적 명소들을 탐방할 수 있습니다. 건물들은 일부 사람들에게 프라하를 연상시키며, 느긋하게 산책하기 좋은 분위기를 제공합니다. 다만, 음식 선택지는 다소 제한적일 수 있습니다.

반면에, 저렴하고 좋은 에어비앤비 옵션이 많이 있어 부담 없이 편안하게 숙박할 수 있습니다. 단, 밤에 외출할 때는 조심하는 것이 좋습니다. 예상치 못한 상황이 발생할 수 있으니까요—예를 들어, 실수로 매춘부의 집에 들어가는 일 같은 게 있을 수 있습니다!

실용적인 측면에서 보면, 대중교통이 그리 좋지는 않아서 일부 방문객들은 병원에서 언어 때문에 어려움을 겪기도 했습니다. 다양한 음식 문화를 즐기고 싶다면, 가까운 비엔나로 가는 것이 좋습니다. 그곳은 현지인들이 더 많은 음식을 즐기기 위해 자주 방문하는 곳입니다.

몇 가지 단점이 있지만, 많은 여행객들은 브라티슬라바에서의 시간을 즐겼고, 특히 여유롭고 새로운 경험을 원하는 분들에게는 더욱 만족스러운 여행지가 될 수 있습니다. 따라서 짧고 색다른 모험을 찾고 있다면, 브라티슬라바가 여러분에게 놀라운 경험을 선사할 수도 있습니다!

reviews: Extremely bicycle-friendly. Making friends is not hard if you adopt some group hobbies, such as dancing, which is pretty popular here. Hamburg and Hannover are close enough to drop by for concerts and events.
bremen.description:
Bremen is a nice place in northern Germany that is great for people who like to ride bikes—it's very bike-friendly! Whether you're cycling along the Weser River or through the busy neighborhoods, you'll quickly feel welcome. Join a local dance class or other group activities, and you will find it easy to make friends.

With Hamburg and Hannover close by, you're never far from fun concerts and events. While Bremen has a calm atmosphere, it still has an active cultural scene.

However, if you don't speak German well, you might struggle a little with the language. But don't worry! The locals are friendly and will appreciate any effort you make. In terms of living costs, Bremen is usually cheaper than its larger neighbors.

If you plan to visit, be sure to see the UNESCO World Heritage sites like the Town Hall and the Roland statue. Overall, Bremen is a nice city that is easy to enjoy!
bremen.description_kor:
브레멘은 독일 북부에 위치한 아주 매력적인 도시로, 자전거를 즐기는 분들에게는 최적의 장소입니다. 자전거 친화적인 환경 덕분에 베제르 강을 따라 자전거를 타거나 분주한 거리를 누비며 쉽게 환영받는 기분을 느낄 수 있습니다. 또한, 지역 댄스 클래스나 다양한 그룹 활동에 참여하면 쉽게 친구를 사귈 수 있답니다.

함부르크와 하노버가 가까워서 언제든지 즐거운 콘서트와 행사를 찾을 수 있는 것도 큰 매력 중 하나입니다. 브레멘은 차분한 분위기를 가지고 있지만, 여전히 활기찬 문화 예술 씬이 형성되어 있습니다.

하지만 독일어에 자신이 없다면 언어 문제로 약간의 어려움이 있을 수 있습니다. 하지만 걱정하지 마세요! 현지인들은 매우 친절하며, 여러분의 노력을 반겨줄 것입니다. 생활비 측면에서 브레멘은 대도시들에 비해 상대적으로 저렴한 편입니다.

방문하실 계획이 있다면, 유네스코 세계 문화 유산인 시청과 롤란드 동상을 꼭 들러보세요. 전반적으로 브레멘은 편안하게 즐길 수 있는 멋진 도시입니다!

reviews: Brisbane really is Australia's best kept secret. It wont stay this way forever but it is still great for now. In a few years it will be too busy like Melbourne and Sydney.
Brisbane is great, much quieter and more relaxed than Sydney or Melbourne, and if you're near the city it's very walkable, with everything you need within a short stroll
brisbane.description:
Brisbane is one of Australia’s hidden gems. This lively city has a relaxed vibe, which is a nice change from the busy atmosphere of Sydney or Melbourne. Many visitors like that it is easy to walk around—most things you need are often close by.

You will enjoy the sunny weather and the helpful locals who make it feel welcoming. The city has nice parks, like South Bank, with great river views and green spaces. However, as Brisbane becomes bigger, some people say it might lose its peaceful charm, so visit while you can!

The cost of living is usually lower than in the larger cities, but like any place, some areas may be more expensive. Public transport is decent, but not very extensive, so planning your trips can be useful. When it comes to local customs, feel free to start a conversation with the locals; they are known for being friendly. Just appreciate the city’s mix of culture, and you are likely to have a memorable experience!
brisbane.description_kor:
브리즈번은 호주의 숨겨진 보석 중 하나입니다. 이 활기찬 도시는 편안한 분위기를 지녀서, 시드니나 멜버른의 바쁜 느낌과는 확실히 다른 매력을 발산합니다. 방문객들은 대부분의 필요한 것들이 가까이 있어 걷기 편하다는 점을 특히 좋아합니다.

햇살이 따사로운 날씨와 친절한 현지인들 덕분에 당신은 언제든지 환영받는 기분을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다. 이 도시는 남쪽 강(South Bank)과 같은 멋진 공원이 있어 멋진 강 전망과 녹지 공간을 제공합니다. 하지만 브리즈번이 점점 성장함에 따라 일부에서는 이 도시의 평화로운 매력이 사라질지도 모른다고 우려하고 있으니, 가능하면 빨리 방문하는 것이 좋습니다!

생활비는 대도시에 비해 일반적으로 낮은 편이지만, 특정 지역에서는 더 비쌀 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 괜찮지만 매우 광범위하지 않아서 여행 계획을 잘 세우는 게 유용할 수 있습니다. 현지 사람들과 대화를 시도해 보세요; 그들은 친절한 사람들로 유명합니다. 도시의 다양한 문화를 경험하게 되면, 잊지 못할 소중한 추억을 만들 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews:
Brighton has some obvious positives. It has a beach, it's one hour from London and the UK's 2 biggest airports.
It's one of the few UK places outside of London which has a considerable cultural/creative scene.

Unfortunately, the city has a massive problem with street-sleeping, begging and drugs (Many street people from the rest of the UK relocate to Brighton). 
It's difficult to spend an hour walking through the town centre without being harassed. In my 6 months living there, my apartment (in a 'posh' area) was broken into twice at night.

The city is expensive. Affordable if you are on a London salary & commuting - otherwise it's not worth it. For nomads, I'd recommend looking further along the South coast for a better cost of living.
brighton.description:
Brighton is a busy city with many things to do. It is located on the coast and has a nice beach. It is about an hour away from London, which makes it good for day trips or weekend visits. The city has a lot of art galleries, music festivals, and unique shops that you may not find in other parts of the UK.
