However, like any city, there are some problems. You will see many people who are homeless and begging, which can be hard to see as you walk around. Some people also say they have safety concerns, especially about break-ins, so it is smart to be careful, even in better neighborhoods.

Living in Brighton can be expensive, especially if you do not earn a London wage. If you are thinking of staying longer, you might look at other areas along the South Coast for cheaper options. Public transport is decent, but having a car can be easier.

Overall, Brighton is busy and interesting, but be ready for some challenges too!
brighton.description_kor:
브라이튼은 많은 볼거리와 즐길 거리가 있는 활기찬 도시입니다. 바다 근처에 자리 잡고 있어 아름다운 해변을 즐길 수 있습니다. 런던에서 차로 약 1시간이면 도착할 수 있어 당일치기 여행이나 주말 나들이에 제격입니다. 이곳에는 다양한 미술관, 음악 축제, 그리고 다른 지역에서는 잘 찾아볼 수 없는 독특한 가게들이 많아 두루두루 재미가 있습니다.

하지만 모든 도시가 그렇듯이 브라이튼도 몇 가지 문제를 안고 있습니다. 거리를 걷다 보면 노숙자와 구걸하는 사람들을 자주 보게 되고, 이는 뒷골목의 씁쓸한 현실을 드러냅니다. 또한, 일부 주민들은 특히 주거 침입에 대한 안전 우려를 표시하기도 하니, 아무리 좋은 동네라도 경각심을 늦추지 않는 것이 좋습니다.

브라이튼에서의 생활 비용은 다소 부담스러울 수 있으며, 특히 런던의 월급에 의존하지 않는 경우에는 더욱 그렇습니다. 만약 장기간 머물 계획이라면 남부 해안의 다른 지역에서 더 저렴한 대안을 찾아보는 것이 좋습니다. 대중교통은 괜찮지만, 개인 차량이 있으면 이동이 훨씬 편리합니다.

종합적으로 봤을 때 브라이튼은 바쁘고 매력적인 도시이지만, 일부 도전에 대한 준비도 필요합니다!

reviews: I lived in Brno for 6 months and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's a small city with nothing to do for expats. There are a few cafés and some nice bars but nothing really special plus. I really don't mean to be rude but Czech people are no fun. It's just...boring and dull. Generally speaking people here, even millennials, don't speak English. I found it very hard to do basic stuff like go to stores in the supermarket because nobody speaks English. There are waaaay better places to go to as an expat, Prague is one of those.

I lived in Brno for 6 months working as an expat. I am from US and have lived in NJ and NYC and been to almost every major city in the US. Compared to US Cities, this place just works, it's very easy to live here and the public transportation is wonderful. It was also extremely cheap compared to any US city and I could afford to eat out every meal and go to the fancier restaurants on my US salary. The beauty of the buildings in the center and quick access to nature was my favorite part as well as the beer and drinking culture which is kind of built into the czech blood. There are a lot of traditional czech pubs but also some very interesting hip things that you would see in Berlin or Brooklyn, I was impressed for the size of the city how many quality offerings they had. 

As for cons.. there were a bunch too! Language is hard to learn and Czech people can be hard to warm up to you. Everyone was nice and could speak english but when going out in groups it often switches to Czech. I didnt mind this obviously because I am a visitor in their country but it was hard and felt isolating. The city is small and I felt like I saw almost everything in the 6 months. You can tour the main parts in one day but there are a lot of hidden gems and festivities that happen throughout the seasons to keep it interesting. 

I would recommend visiting and living like a local here for a couple of months. It was a very rich experience for me!

Was in Brno recently and honestly I didn't found the city as interesting as it looked in the pictures + videos. It's a bit overrated or maybe I didn't took my pills in the expected timeframe. Just jokin'! You can check it for one day and that's enough.
100/100 mbit from netbox for 500 czk = 22 usd
brno.description:
Brno, in the center of Czechia, is a city that combines history and a bit of modern life. Some people think it is small and not as exciting as larger cities like Prague, but others like its affordable prices and friendly feel. You can find nice cafés, traditional pubs, and some modern places that might remind you of Berlin or Brooklyn.

One important thing to know is that the cost of living here is low—eating out usually feels special without costing too much. Public transport is easy to use, so you can see the beautiful buildings and nearby nature easily. However, not many people speak English, which can make shopping or eating out a bit tricky sometimes.

Brno has many hidden places and seasonal events, so there is more to see than just popular sites. If you visit, try to enjoy the local customs and take your time in the city. You might discover some of its unique features!
brno.description_kor:
브르노(Brno)는 체코(Czechia) 중심부에 위치한 도시로, 역사와 현대적 생활이 어우러진 매력적인 곳입니다. 일부 사람들은 이 도시가 작아서 프라하(Prague)와 같은 대도시에 비해 덜 흥미롭다고 생각하지만, 다른 이들은 저렴한 가격과 따뜻한 분위기를 좋아합니다. 여기에는 아름다운 카페와 전통적인 펍, 그리고 베를린이나 브루클린을 떠올리게 하는 현대적인 공간들이 많습니다.

특히 주목할 점은 생활 비용이 낮다는 것입니다. 외식하는 것이 특별한 경험처럼 느껴지지만, 생각보다 비용이 많이 들지 않아요. 대중교통도 매우 편리해서 아름다운 건물들과 자연 경관을 쉽게 즐길 수 있습니다. 다만, 영어를 하는 사람이 많지 않아서 쇼핑이나 외식할 때 가끔 어려움을 겪을 수 있습니다.

브르노는 숨겨진 명소와 계절별 행사들이 많아서 인기 있는 관광지보다 더 많은 볼거리가 있습니다. 방문하신다면 현지 문화와 풍습을 경험하고, 여유롭게 시간을 보내보시길 추천합니다. 이곳에서 독특한 매력을 발견할 수 있을지도 모릅니다!

reviews: Stayed adjacent to the Sotomayor neighborhood. Felt the safest here vs Medellin and Bogota, even while walking outside in the wee hours to smoke. Very friendly and hospitable people. Lots to do in and surrounding the city. Good places to eat are plentiful and scattered about. Try the hormigas culonas if in season on your visit.
bucaramanga.description:
Bucaramanga is a lively city that attracts visitors with its friendly locals and rich culture. If you want a safe place to explore, many say this city feels safer than larger Colombian cities like Medellin and Bogota, even at night. The people here are known for being warm and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.

Food lovers will enjoy Bucaramanga’s many restaurants, where you can find different tasty dishes. Be sure to try *hormigas culonas*, a local dish that’s worth a taste if it’s available during your visit. Besides the food, there are many activities to do in town and in the nature around it, making it a good place for adventures.

Remember that while Bucaramanga is affordable, some services might cost more than you expect. Public transportation can be limited, so it’s smart to plan your trips in advance. Overall, Bucaramanga is full of life, good food, and friendly people, making it a nice stop on your trip to Colombia.
bucaramanga.description_kor:
부카라망가는 따뜻한 현지인들과 풍부한 문화로 방문객들을 매료시키는 활기찬 도시입니다. 안전하게 탐험할 수 있는 장소를 원하신다면, 많은 이들이 이 도시가 메데인이나 보고타 같은 대형 도시보다 밤에 더 안전하게 느껴진다고 말합니다. 이곳 사람들은 따뜻하고 환영하는 성격으로 유명해, 방문객들이 마치 집에 있는 듯한 편안함을 느낄 수 있습니다.

음식을 좋아하신다면, 부카라망가의 다양한 레스토랑에서 맛있는 요리를 즐길 수 있습니다. 방문 중에는 꼭 지역 특선 요리인 *호르미가스 쿨로나스*를 시도해 보세요. 음식뿐만 아니라 이곳에서 할 수 있는 다양한 활동과 자연 속 모험이 있어 탐험하기 좋은 장소입니다.

부카라망가는 전반적으로 저렴한 곳이긴 하지만, 일부 서비스는 예상보다 비쌀 수 있으니 유의하셔야 합니다. 대중교통이 다소 제한적일 수 있으므로 미리 여행 계획을 세우는 것이 좋습니다. 전체적으로 부카라망가는 활기차고 맛있는 음식, 그리고 친절한 사람들로 가득해 콜롬비아 여행의 훌륭한 중간 기착지가 될 것입니다.

reviews: I really enjoyed my time here as the city is walkable, very friendly people, good holiday vibe, loads of touristy activities (I could barely fit everything in 2 weeks, prices are high compared to other countries for the same activities). Budva is the largest tourist city, so it feels more like a city compared to other places. Budva isn't for beaches, as it's overpacked, expensive, dirty and the water is unhealthy dirty (If you want to swim go to Sveti Nikola and the beach on the right of the ballerina statue - the only clean water places). Budva is known as a party place with loads of Serbians. Nightlife stops at 1am except nightclubs which are filled with smoke, music is mostly Serbian or a mix with Serbian, all places are pretty casual (no high end feel) and at night all the streets (even the furthest ones) are filled with party people. Locals and Serbians like to stick to tables and don't socialize with others.

Budva is a terrible place. Yes, it has scenic mountains, but the rest of the Adriatic coastline does too. I went to all of the Balkan counties and Montenegro and Serbia were pretty bad. The others are pretty nice, and I will definitely go back to them. 

Here's why it's terrible: 
1.)Bad food, overly pretentious restaurants that are smoke-filled, and rude and/lazy staff in them. 
2.) Rude people. There are a few friendly ones but you need to work hard at it. They also seem to not like western Europeans or North Americans as much as their Russian and Serbian friends. 
3.) Accommodation is overly priced and not great. 
4.) They don't seem to understand hospitality as well as the other Balkan countries. 
5.) English isn't very widespread like the other Balkan countries. 
6.) Hard to walk around the city, not very walkable. 
7.) More expensive than some of the actual good Balkan places like Croatia. 

The good is that it has nice scenery, but it's basically the same scenery as Croatia and Albania, so there is absolutely no need to visit Montenegro when you can see the same stuff in better places like Albania and Croatia.

I really like Budva. It has paradisiac beaches, with extremely clear waters and very affordable prices for almost everything (Coming from Central Europe/Germany). Internet costs here 15€ for 500GB (no joke) and you can set up your life quite easily here. The gym costs around 40€ a month without a contract and the usual Taxi ride doesnt exceed 5€. You have very nice beaches everywhere and the boat ride is not so expensive. Specially after September on prices get really cheap for renting.

not great - known for night life, but things actually close quite early unless you take a cab to one club outside of the city - beach is just endless rent-able chairs, restaurants that all look the same, and juiced up Serbs

Th walkability in Budva is not good at all: almost no sidewalks, strong road inclinations, and roads do turn into waterfalls during raining period, which isn't make them more comfortable for walking at all.
budva.description:
Budva is a city with both good and bad points. On one side, it is the biggest tourist place in Montenegro, full of energy and friendly people (eventually!). There are many activities to enjoy, from nice beaches to lively nightlife. The views are impressive, with mountains around the city. However, if you like beaches, you might find some crowded and dirty. The best places for swimming are away from the city, like Sveti Nikola, where the water is cleaner.

While Budva is famous for its party scene, do not expect much activity late at night outside the clubs. Be prepared for expensive hotels and meals that may not be good quality. Walking can be hard – with steep streets and few sidewalks, it is not as easy to walk around as you might wish. Also, English is not spoken by many people, which could make it hard to get around.

If you are visiting, try to explore the area after September for better prices and bring your party shoes, but also pack good walking shoes for the hills!
budva.description_kor:
부드바는 장점과 단점을 모두 가진 도시입니다. 몬테네그로에서 가장 큰 관광지로서 활기찬 분위기와 친절한 사람들로 가득 차 있습니다. 아름다운 해변과 화려한 야경 덕분에 다양한 즐길 거리가 존재합니다. 또한, 도시 주변의 산들은 멋진 경관을 제공합니다. 하지만 해변을 즐기고 싶다면 혼잡하고 더러운 곳도 있을 수 있습니다. 수영하기 좋은 장소는 도시에서 조금 떨어진 스베티 니콜라(Sveti Nikola)와 같은 곳으로, 물이 더 깨끗합니다.

부드바는 파티로 유명하지만, 클럽 외에는 늦은 밤에 할 수 있는 활동이 많지 않습니다. 다소 비싼 호텔과 저렴한 식당이 공존하니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 도보 이동이 어려울 수 있으며, 경사진 거리와 좁은 인도가 있어 원하는 만큼 편하게 걸어 다니기는 힘들 수 있습니다. 게다가 많은 사람들이 영어를 잘 하지 않기 때문에 이동 중에 애를 먹을 수도 있습니다.

방문할 계획이라면 9월 이후에 이 지역을 탐험해 보세요. 더 좋은 가격을 찾을 수 있을 뿐만 아니라, 파티를 위한 신발도 챙기되 언덕을 오르는데 적합한 편안한 신발도 꼭 준비하세요!

reviews: Romanians are friendly and welcoming people. The young generation speaks perfect English. The city itself is rather disappointing. Dirty, rundown, many empty buildings.... plenty of traffic and not much to do.

Bucharest is one of my favorites city as a coffee lover. Also, there are awesome people and the city has plenty of activities to do: indoor, outdoor... whatever you prefer... The place to be is the co-living Vine 21, with amazing people, good internet, and a place for work...

I agree with the +- list posted a few years ago here. Beautiful city in different ways, cheaper than Western EU, beautiful people. Restaurants are understaffed and have terrible service, at least in Old Town. First thing on the menu at Van Gogh is "all our staff are trainees, please be patient" even, so not sure what happened that places are struggling.

Activity wise it doesn't seem like it has much, but there are nice parks and walking through the city with the architecture is something to behold.

Socially it does seem a little closed off, but that doesn't make it impossible to make friends.

Soooo underrated city, it's not so calm at least the old town with all those bars competing to see which one plays the loudest music and in general the crazy traffic and that cars burnouts at 3am. But aside of that it's a wonderful city, with lot of things to do, lot's of places to go and very affordable prices. I was there for 3 weeks in July and surprisingly it's warmer than Barcelona and safer, and airbnb prices are really good. I enjoyed trying food and walking the city, I like to work from coffee shops and I didn't find anything better than Starbucks, that close a bit early (around 20:00).
My favorite restaurant by far, I went two times and already missing it: Hanu Berarilor Casa Oprea Soare
And a famous restaurant that I also went two times and both experiences went bad (too touristy): Caru Cu Bere

Bucharest is a lovely, calm and joyful city. I was staying at ICANSEE villa, a family stay place and I’ve just had everything I needed.
The streets are safe, people are nice, nice clubs, terraces.
It has a good vibe, I love it!

I spent 2 weeks in Romania, one week in Bucharest. I loved it, will definitely go back. The city is a mix of cool/hip, some great cafes, the Old City. Then there are the parts that are like razed ghettos. I'm single female and always felt safe. Even the taxi drivers were all lovely and helpful. Most young people speak english really well, the older people not at all. Lots of parks and fountains. One thing I loved, there is almost no tourism there, no tourists, no tourist pricing. Wifi is generally good.

I lived here 3 months during summer and it was amazing. The weather is beautiful, 2 hours away from the beach, the internet is fast, the coffee shops are chic, nightlife very alive and the prices are good. Go here during summer because there are more events, activities to do than the winter when it's cold and snowy.

I visited Bucharest for one week in early September, in between Varna in Bulgaria and Warszawa, and I like these more. Not to dismiss Bucharest which is nice, impressive, and safe. I was happy to be there, the internet is amazing ( I got >200 Mbps of free wifi in a public park) etc., but I probably won't be back any time soon.

So underrated.
It's a beautiful city, lots of parks and the lake in Herastrau is very nice. Constanta/Mamaia (beach area) are a 2 hour drive away and Busteni, which is in the mountains is also within reasonable distance. 
People are usually quite friendly but theres the odd rude taxi driver, especially if you speak 0 Romanian. The food wasn't that great in my opinion, lots of meats and potatoes, but some like it. i'd recommend chimney cakes (kurtoskalacs) and Covrigi (Romanian soft pretzels).

Hidden gem in Eastern Europe - loads of awesome co-working spaces and co-living places popping up all over the place. Plenty of awesome nightlife, cheap, loads of beautiful parks and only 2 hours to the mountains or 3 hours to the sea.

Honestly underated, the city is extremely clean apart from graffities, old town is a lot of fun and the architecture is beautiful, looks very french like paris, could still be improved in the next few years though!

Here is my summary of Bucharest:
+ very nice and growing hipster/alt/techno scene
+/- the city looks like crap, lot of graffiti, demolished buildings, communistic buildings etc., but i kinda like this vibe
+ prices are great
+ young people in hipster clubs/cafes are very open and speak good english
+ super cheap UBER
- romanian food = bullshit
- airport = bullshit
- old town / touristic center kinda bullshit, overpriced, crap
- taxi and public transport is crap I heard, but you never use it cuz UBER
- people are not nice to each other, not helping, kinda rude, etc. (except young people)
Very cheap and Romanian people are rather friendly and open to foreigners. City itself is a disaster, rundown infrastructure, lots of pollution and little to do outside of oldtown.
Bucharest is cheap and a heaven for expats . It outranks kiev or chisinau and even budapest.

Bucharest is cheap, but that's about the only attraction for the roaming wanderer. The city is extremely dirty, smoggy, and chaotic. The internet is amazingly fast, but it's one of the last cities in Europe to visit. I have lived here for over a year, spent a long time trying to find some quality about it, but the culture is very unfriendly and it's not easy to develop friendships. I really recommend going north or west for some better quality for a foreigner: Chisinau, St Petersburg, Budapest, all are better choices.
bucharest.description:
Bucharest is a city that keeps you active. It has a mix of old and new, which can surprise you in different ways. Many visitors talk about the friendly locals, especially younger people who speak good English, making it easier to connect. However, some people mention issues with the city; some areas look a little worn down, with many empty buildings and graffiti, which may not appeal to everyone.

The cost of living is quite low compared to Western Europe, and there is a growing tech and co-working community, especially in popular areas like Vine 21. Food lovers can try Romanian dishes, but don’t expect top-notch service everywhere; some restaurants may be short on staff and slow, especially in busy tourist areas.

Parks like Herastrau provide some green space in the city, and you are just a short drive from the mountains or the beach. While public transport can have issues, many people use affordable and effective ride-sharing as a good option.

Overall, Bucharest may have its flaws, but with its busy nightlife, cultural differences, and friendly atmosphere, it is often not given enough credit and is worth visiting!
bucharest.description_kor:
부쿠레슈트는 활기차고 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳은 오래된 것과 새로운 것이 독특하게 어우러져 있어 여러 모로 놀라움을 선사합니다. 많은 방문객들이 특히 영어를 유창하게 구사하는 젊은 현지인 덕분에 사람들과 쉽게 소통할 수 있었다고 말하곤 합니다. 물론, 일부 사람들은 도시의 문제점도 지적합니다. 몇몇 지역은 다소 낡아 보이고, 빈 건물과 그래피티가 많아 모든 이에게 매력적으로 다가오지 않을 수도 있습니다.

생활비는 서유럽에 비해 꽤 저렴하며, 바인 21과 같은 인기 지역에서는 성장하는 기술 및 협업 커뮤니티가 활발히 형성되고 있습니다. 음식 애호가들은 루마니아 전통 요리를 맛볼 수 있지만, 모든 식당에서 고급 서비스를 기대하기는 어려울 수 있습니다. 특히 관광객이 많이 찾는 지역에서는 직원이 부족해 서비스를 받는 데 불편함을 겪는 경우도 있습니다.

헤라스트라우 공원과 같은 곳은 도심 속에서 여유로운 녹지 공간을 제공하며, 산이나 해변까지의 거리가 짧아 쉽게 접근할 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 때때로 문제를 일으키기도 하지만, 많은 사람들이 저렴하고 효과적인 차량 공유 서비스를 이용하여 편리하게 이동합니다.

전반적으로 부쿠레슈트는 결점이 있을 수 있지만, 화려한 야경과 다양한 문화적 매력, 그리고 친근한 분위기로 인해 종종 과소평가되는 도시입니다. 꼭 한 번 방문해볼 만한 곳입니다!

reviews: I have been several times to Burgas. The Sea Garden is amazing and you see so many people doing sports activities, jogging, gym in the park etc. The center of the city is the best part along with the Sea Garden, beaches are nice and has airport that starts to get traffic also in winter season. It is peaceful city and in terms of food and friendly people it is great. The downside is during winter you have not much to do and I have heard there are sometimes shortage of water for locals.

I was in Burgas in June 2018. Stayed there like 2 days, which for most of you guys wouldn't be enough to establish if it's worthy or not. Cheap city with a nice old town, the sea side is really clean + the food/drinks and other services are quite affordable.
Do not know exactly if this will match with the NOMADS for a long timeframe, but I am positive about the time spent over there and would return for a longer period.
burgas.description:
Burgas is a nice coastal city with a lot of energy. The Sea Garden is a main spot, where you can see locals jogging, exercising, and enjoying the sun. The beaches are clean and welcome visitors, great for relaxing by the sea. The city center also has many shops and restaurants, with prices that are affordable.

However, it's not always perfect. Winter can be quiet, with fewer activities, and some visitors have reported occasional problems with water supply. But this shouldn't stop you from visiting; the friendly locals and good food make up for any issues.

If you visit, be sure to walk through the old town, where you can experience the history and culture. If you plan to stay longer, remember that public transport may not be very good. Still, Burgas is likely to win you over and make you want to come back!
burgas.description_kor:
부르가스는 에너지가 넘치는 아름다운 해안 도시입니다. ‘바다 정원’은 주요 명소로, 현지인들이 조깅하고 운동하며 태양을 즐기는 모습을 쉽게 볼 수 있습니다. 해변은 깨끗하고 방문객들을 환영하며, 바다에서 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 최적의 공간입니다. 시내 중심가에는 다양한 상점과 레스토랑이 즐비하고, 가격도 부담스럽지 않습니다.

하지만 모든 게 항상 완벽한 것은 아닙니다. 겨울철에는 조용해질 수 있으며, 활동하는 사람들이 적은 시기도 있어요. 때때로 일부 방문객들은 물 공급 문제를 경험하기도 했습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 이는 방문을 망설일 이유가 되지 않습니다. 친절한 현지 주민들과 맛있는 음식은 어떤 문제도 충분히 상쇄해 줍니다.

방문하신다면 역사를 느낄 수 있는 구시가지를 꼭 한 번 걸어보세요. 좀 더 오래 머무를 계획이라면 대중교통이 다소 불편할 수 있다는 점을 기억해 두세요. 그럼에도 불구하고 부르가스는 분명 여러분을 매료시켜 다시 오고 싶게 만들 것입니다!

reviews: People shoul eat “iskender kebap”
bursa.description:
Bursa is a Turkish city that shows local culture well. It has a rich history and beautiful nature, making it a good mix of old and new. One thing you should try is the famous “iskender kebap.” It is a popular dish that locals enjoy, and you will find many places serving it fresh and tasty.

It is helpful to know that while public transportation is decent, it might not be as extensive as in larger cities, so plan ahead. The cost of living is generally affordable, which makes it a good place for visitors and residents.

Bursa is relatively safe, but like anywhere, it is smart to stay aware of your surroundings. You can explore neighborhoods like the historical area, where you can see nice buildings and try local food. Also, language can be a challenge, so it helps to learn a few Turkish words. Overall, Bursa’s friendly atmosphere and tasty kebabs make it a nice place to visit.
bursa.description_kor:
부르사는 터키의 로컬 문화를 잘 보여주는 도시입니다. 이곳은 풍부한 역사와 아름다운 자연경관을 가지고 있어, 전통과 현대가 조화를 이루고 있습니다. 꼭 맛봐야 할 음식 중 하나는 유명한 "이스켄데르 케밥"입니다. 현지인들이 즐겨 찾는 인기 메뉴로, 신선하고 맛있는 요리를 제공하는 많은 식당들이 있습니다.

대중교통은 괜찮지만 대도시만큼 광범위하지는 않으니 미리 계획하는 게 좋습니다. 전반적으로 생활비가 저렴해서 방문객과 주민 모두에게 알맞은 곳입니다.

부르사는 비교적 안전한 도시지만, 어디서든 마찬가지로 주변을 잘 살피는 것이 중요합니다. 역사적인 지역을 탐험하면 멋진 건물들과 함께 현지 음식을 즐길 수 있습니다. 또한 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니 몇 가지 터키어 단어를 미리 배우면 도움이 될 것입니다. 전반적으로 부르사는 친근한 분위기와 맛있는 케밥 덕분에 꼭 방문해볼 만한 장소입니다.

reviews: Busan is a hidden gem for summer runaways from the SE Asia heat. It's a great city for cafe-hopping. There are nice cafes almost everywhere in the city. You normally don't have to worry about the internet as almost every cafe I've visited has strong WIFI. The city is very walkable. You can enjoy mountains beaches and many city scenes. There's even a surf town in the city. Public transportation is very advanced and convenient so you won't need a motorbike or a car. So many gyms around the city so its easy to keep your exercise routine. The only missing piece is some good community vibe coworking space as there are a few coworking places in the city but they are intended for startups rather than nomads. But a quick solution is to just work in cafés. In general, the living cost is about twice of Thai and Vietnamese cities. Probably a bit more than Canggu Bali; but you get the extra values of a modern city with all the things to do and convenience.

Gimhae is a nice area to stay if you enjoy nature, art galleries, shops, and a smaller city feel near the airport. You will have access to Busan as well. The light rail is a handy automated above ground rail to use. The line goes into Gimhae, to the Gimhae International Airport, and slightly into Busan before having to shift to another metro or transportation line. Gimhae also has a Costco and major supermarkets. The street art is also quirky.

Great place if you like Korean cuisine and fresh fish in general. Haedong Yonggungsa seaside temple is the absolute highlight. Locals are helpful, too bad 8/10 won't speak english. Young people included! 
Remember: Uber, Grab, Google Maps won't work in Korea, in favour of Kakao app which is pure garbage and all in Korean. 
And by the way pornography is illegal.

Korea's second biggest city after Seoul. Busan is a nice place to go if you want to see another part of Korea that's still pretty comfortable. It's in the south of South Korea, on the ocean, and that makes it a great place to eat fish. In fact that's where all the fish in Seoul comes from, so you can eat it fresh in Busan! In many ways Busan feels like Seoul but 10 or 20 years ago. It's a bit more grimy and broken down and less futuristic than Seoul, but still very nice. I'd suggest staying in Seomyeon, which is kinda like Seoul's Hongdae. It's a student area with some hipster vibes to it. But take hipster vibes with a grain of salt, this is Busan after all. People are very friendly, even more friendly than Seoul. Where in Seoul as a foreigner they don't really care anymore, in Busan you're still hailed as a curiosity which can be fun! If you want to see the beach, take a taxi to Haeundae Beach. It's especially nice in the evening if you'd like to party. Korean beach culture is a bit different than in the West, so you'll probably see less swimming and sunbathing that you're used to. More like people walking on the beach boulevard. Also nice is to see the Jagalchi fish market, pick some fish you like in the big building and you can ask them to prepare it for you upstairs and cook it. Fish as fresh as you can get in Korea.
busan.description:
Busan is a lively coastal city that offers a nice mix of city life and nature, making it a great place to escape the Southeast Asian heat. With its big beaches, beautiful mountains, and many cafes, there's always something to see and do. The city is easy to walk around, and its good public transportation system, including a helpful light rail, makes it simple to get around—no need for a car here!

Cafes are found all over Busan, and most places have strong Wi-Fi, making it a good choice for moving between cafes or even working remotely, although coworking spaces are limited and more for startups than for digital nomads. The cost of living is higher than in countries like Thailand or Vietnam, but with modern services and fresh seafood, many find it worth it.

You might face some language challenges (not many locals speak English), but that can make it more interesting. When in Busan, be sure to visit the Haedong Yonggungsa temple and the busy Jagalchi fish market for the freshest seafood. For a fun night out, go to Seomyeon, which has a lively atmosphere and friendly locals who like to talk. Just a note: be prepared for a different beach culture, as walking on the beach is more common here than sunbathing!
busan.description_kor:
부산은 도시 생활과 자연이 조화를 이루는 활기찬 해안 도시로, 동남아시아의 더위를 피할 수 있는 훌륭한 장소입니다. 넓은 해변과 아름다운 산, 그리고 다양한 카페가 있어 언제나 즐길 거리와 볼거리가 가득합니다. 이 도시는 걷기에도 편리하고, 경전철을 포함한 효율적인 대중교통 덕분에 차량 없이도 쉽게 이동할 수 있습니다.

부산의 여러 곳에는 카페들이 많이 있습니다. 대부분의 카페에서는 빠른 Wi-Fi를 제공하기 때문에 카페를 옮겨 다니며 원격 근무를 하기에 안성맞춤입니다. 다만, 공유 오피스는 적은 편이고 스타트업을 위한 공간이 더 많이 마련되어 있습니다. 생활비는 태국이나 베트남보다는 비싸지만, 현대적인 서비스와 신선한 해산물 덕분에 많은 사람들이 그 가치를 충분히 느끼고 있습니다.

현지인 중 영어를 하는 사람이 많지 않아 언어 장벽에 직면할 수도 있지만, 이 또한 부산에서의 경험을 더 흥미롭게 만들어 줄 것입니다. 부산에 가면 해동 용궁사와 분주한 자갈치 수산시장을 꼭 방문하여 신선한 해산물을 맛보시길 추천합니다. 즐거운 밤 외출을 원하신다면, 활기찬 분위기와 대화를 좋아하는 친절한 현지인들이 있는 서면으로 가보세요. 마지막으로, 부산의 해변 문화는 조금 다르니 일광욕보다는 해변을 산책하는 것이 더 일반적이라는 점도 기억해 주세요!

reviews: I was there in November 2017. The people are very friendly, great restraunts on the sea front board walk, and as a diver great access to the great Barrier Reef. Either a train or cable car ride from the town station will take you up into the largest tended an cultivated tropical rain forest in the world. If you like life free and easy beautiful Cairns is for you.
cairns.description:
Cairns is a tropical place known for its relaxed atmosphere and natural beauty. Visitors appreciate the friendly locals and the nice restaurants along the waterfront that serve fresh and tasty food. If you like diving, you will enjoy how easy it is to get to the Great Barrier Reef, which is very close by.

Looking for some adventure? You can take a train ride or a cable car ride to the largest cultivated tropical rainforest in the world. The views are amazing! However, keep in mind that Cairns can be a bit expensive, especially during busy tourist times, so plan your budget carefully.

Public transportation is limited, so having a car can be useful if you want to see more. While English is spoken by many people, the local accents and slang might be hard to understand at times. Overall, Cairns has a balance of relaxation and adventure, making it a great place for anyone who wants to relax in nature. Just enjoy the slower pace and everything this wonderful city has to offer!
cairns.description_kor:
케언즈는 여유로운 분위기와 아름다운 자연경관으로 유명한 열대 지역입니다. 방문객들은 친절한 현지인들과 수변에 위치한 훌륭한 레스토랑에서 맛있는 음식을 즐기는 것을 높이 평가합니다. 만약 다이빙을 좋아한다면, 가까운 그레이트 배리어 리프에서의 즐길 거리도 많습니다.

모험을 찾고 계신가요? 세계 최대의 재배된 열대 우림을 기차나 케이블카를 타고 탐험할 수 있습니다. 그 풍경은 정말 환상적이에요! 하지만 케언즈는 특히 관광 시즌에는 다소 비용이 많이 들 수 있으니, 예산을 잘 계획하는 것이 중요합니다.

대중교통 이용이 제한적이기 때문에, 더 많은 관광지를 방문하고 싶다면 차를 렌트하는 것이 유용할 수 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 영어를 사용하지만, 지역 사투리나 속어는 가끔 이해하기 어려울 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 케언즈는 휴식과 모험의 조화를 이루고 있어, 자연 속에서 힐링을 원하시는 분들에게 훌륭한 장소입니다. 느긋한 시간을 즐기면서 이 매력적인 도시가 제공하는 다양한 경험을 만끽해보세요!

reviews:
Cagliari is not that Nomad friendly but once you adjust, you like the staying. Being concrete:
1) In cafés you are expected to order, drink the coffee and get out, not to chill for half day
2) People will not speak English even if they knew, they still answer in Italian
3) You can't go swimming or gyming without a doctor's certificate that you're eligible for that activity.... you may buy cigarretes without doctor's appointment though :-/
4) Renting houses / cars is expensive, especially in summer
5) You are not allowed to sleep at the beaches nor to camp anywhere else except tha camping paid places
6) Even McDonalds wifi won't work without linking with your social network account
cagliari.description:
Cagliari is a nice city with a mix of culture and good views of the coast, but it has its oddities! Many visitors find it a bit difficult at first because of the language difference—most locals speak Italian, even if they know some English. But once you get into local life, you’ll enjoy the friendly vibe and sites like the old Castello district.

Just a warning: if you like to relax in cafes, you might feel hurried here. It’s about ordering your coffee, enjoying it, and then leaving. Renting a place or a car can be expensive, especially in the busy summer months. Also, keep in mind that while you can buy cigarettes easily, you need a doctor's note to swim or go to the gym.

Beach lovers should also be careful; sleeping on the beach is not allowed. Still, Cagliari has lively neighborhoods, good local food, and a relaxed feel that's hard to resist. Just be ready for some surprises along the way!
cagliari.description_kor:
카그리리(Cagliari)는 문화와 아름다운 해안 경관이 어우러진 멋진 도시입니다. 하지만 몇 가지 특이한 점도 있습니다. 많은 방문객들이 언어 장벽 때문에 처음에는 약간의 어려움을 겪는 경우가 많습니다. 대다수의 현지인들은 이탈리아어를 사용하며, 영어를 조금 하는 사람들도 있지만 대부분 이탈리아어로 소통합니다. 하지만 지역에 익숙해지면 친근한 분위기와 함께 오래된 카스텔로(Castello) 지구 같은 매력적인 명소들을 만끽할 수 있습니다.

조금 더 자세히 말씀드리자면, 카페에서 느긋하게 시간을 보내는 것을 좋아하신다면, 여기서는 다소 빠르게 진행되는 느낌을 받을 수도 있습니다. 커피를 주문하고 즐긴 뒤, 곧바로 자리를 떠나는 것이 일반적입니다. 여름 성수기에는 숙소나 차량 렌트 비용이 비쌀 수 있다는 점도 고려해야 합니다. 또한, 담배는 쉽게 구입할 수 있지만 수영이나 헬스장 이용을 위해서는 의사의 소견서가 필요하다는 점도 염두에 두시기 바랍니다.

해변 애호가들도 주의가 필요합니다; 해변에서 잠을 자는 것은 금지되어 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 카그리리는 활기 넘치는 동네와 맛있는 현지 음식, 그리고 편안한 분위기를 자랑합니다. 그러니 여행 중 예상치 못한 놀라움을 경험할 준비를 해보세요!

reviews: The salsa capital of the world. If you want to learn how to dance, go here. There are so many great places to learn and practice and at a fraction of learning anywhere else. The people are some of the most loving and kind people I've ever encountered. It's a bit of a party scene. You can also access the pacific very easily from Cali. The weather is always beautiful. As is the case with any Latin American country, you need to develop a 6th sense for your belongings and surroundings. Don't pull out your phone in the streets, and take Ubers after dark, as there is a risk of getting robbed.

Cali has beautiful weather and kind, friendly people. You will need to use Spanish here so it is a great place to learn. Locals are very patient with novice speakers. The city has many green spaces and weekend travel to the Pacific region and Coffee country is possible as well as inexpensive flights to other major cities in Colombia. Salsa is king here so it is worth taking lessons, as this is a major part of the city's nightlife. You can live quite cheaply here but expect foreign or imported foods, liquor, and goods to be similar or more expensive than prices back home. The terrible traffic and poor road and sidewalk infrastructure is a major downside. Also expect frequent and sometimes gross catcalling as a woman living here.
Dangerous and the salsa wears out after a while...
cali.description:
Cali, known for salsa dancing, is a great place to dance! Whether you are experienced or just starting, this city has many dance schools where you can learn salsa for a low cost compared to other places. The locals are friendly and welcoming, which makes it easier to practice your Spanish, but you should review it before you come!

One of the best things about Cali is its nice weather, good for visiting parks or traveling to the nearby Pacific coast. Just remember to be careful with your belongings and consider using Ubers at night for safety.

Living in Cali can be cheap, but imported goods can be expensive. The traffic can be difficult, and some women deal with unwanted attention. However, if you enjoy nightlife, tasty local food, and a rich culture, you will enjoy this busy city! Just remember to bring your dancing shoes and be ready for fun.
cali.description_kor:
칼리(Cali)는 살사 댄스로 유명한 멋진 댄스 도시입니다! 경험이 많든, 이제 막 시작하는 단계든 상관없이, 여기에는 저렴한 비용으로 살사를 배울 수 있는 많은 댄스 학교들이 있습니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하고 따뜻하게 대해 주기 때문에 스페인어 연습하기도 쉽지만, 가기 전에 기본적인 표현은 미리 연습해 두는 것이 좋습니다.

칼리의 큰 장점 중 하나는 화창한 날씨로, 공원에 가거나 인근의 태평양 연안을 즐기기에 적합하다는 점입니다. 귀중품을 잘 챙기고, 안전을 위해 밤에는 우버를 이용하는 것이 좋습니다.

칼리에 사는 것은 상대적으로 저렴하지만, 수입품은 꽤 비쌀 수 있습니다. 교통 혼잡도 있을 수 있고, 일부 여성들은 원치 않는 관심을 받을 수도 있습니다. 하지만 밤문화와 맛있는 현지 음식, 그리고 풍부한 문화를 만끽할 수 있다면 이 활기찬 도시에 반하게 될 것입니다! 꼭 춤추는 신발을 챙기고 즐길 준비를 해보세요!

reviews:
I lived in Cairo for one month. The city has some problems with the traffic and poverty. But, the people, are the best that I ever meet (not the sellers). The food is amazing, everything is cheap. the uber is almost for free. The internet have some problems, but it'll depend of the area that you'll live. a lot of people speak English, even the apps have the option to read in English. The city is very safe, even for womans at 2AM on the street.

Never, never, and never believe in any seller or anyone that is trying to sell something to you. 95% of the sellers will try to scam you, so be smart with it. Accept the reality of the country and you'll have a lot of fun!
It's a nice place. But the caos and the scams destroy everything. It's nice to live a while, but you'll need a huge amount of patient.

I stayed in Cairo for a week as a solo female (21 years old). I was followed a lot and cat-called / asked for a 'view' or a kiss every 5 minutes even though I was completely covered up, so this is definitely not a place for the faint hearted. It was never with malicious intent though (no one forced themselves on me or even tried to mug me), the culture is just very different than western culture. Whilst they're pushy, they won't do anything unless you let them. It took a couple of days for me to understand that. Other than that, the internet is relatively slow but still consistent, and the majority of people speak a least a little bit of English. The air is very unhealthy and the roads take a while to get used to too!

I ve lived in Cairo now for 3 years, unfortunately its very difficult to find work online here if you dont speak Arabic, I signed up to many site who immedately refused me/offered me work in Arabic despite I selected I speak only English/or there was never any tasks viewable due to my location. The internet is improving but no where near to western standards, VPNs can be blocked with the government employing deep packet spying methods and throttling the connection. Life can be cheap but the quality is very bad, since the devaluation of the currency anything of decent international standards is twice of what it costs outside of Egypt.
Life for single females can be daunting and research into local culture must be done as to not attract unwanted attention simply by being friendly with the opposite sex unfortunately. Local shops will try to rip you off as a foreigner so stick to malls and supermarkets with barcodes and displayed prices. The lack of open spaces, health & safety and decent trustable health care are things to consider before moving here, as are traffic and nightmare road conditions. Unless you have a substantial budget to live in a modern compound bubble-type community then life can become depression and dull due to lack of decent well priced faciltities, over crowding, rubbish, pollution and poverty. Its great for a hit and run trip to do the tourist things, but long term you need something that makes it worth being here.
stayed in giza for 10 days. internet was inconsistent. very cheap here but the locals are constantly trying to screw your over for money
cairo.description:
Cairo is a lively city with many experiences to offer. The traffic can be confusing, and the air is not always fresh, but the friendliness of the people is very noticeable—most people you meet will smile at you. The food is enjoyable, and the prices around town are low—Uber rides are very affordable!

However, you may face some challenges. Be ready for some sellers in markets who may try to overcharge or trick tourists, so it's good to stay alert. For women travelers, the cultural differences may take some time to get used to, so doing some research on local customs can help.

Public transport can vary in quality, and while many people speak basic English, knowing a few Arabic words can be useful. Interestingly, Cairo is great for short visits, but if you plan to stay longer, think about living in areas with good facilities, like malls that provide a better shopping experience. Accept the challenges, and you may find that Cairo can be an exciting part of your travel experience!
cairo.description_kor:
카이로는 다채로운 경험을 선사하는 활기찬 도시입니다. 교통이 혼잡할 때도 많고 공기가 항상 맑지는 않지만, 사람들의 따뜻한 친절함은 여전히 눈에 띕니다. 거리를 걸으면 많은 사람들이 미소를 지어주고, 음식 또한 맛있어서 즐길 거리가 넘칩니다. 시내에서의 식사 비용이 저렴하고, 우버 이용 요금도 부담이 없어요!

하지만 몇 가지 도전과제도 있을 수 있습니다. 시장에서 관광객을 대상으로 바가지를 씌우거나 속이려는 판매자들이 있을 수 있으니 조심하는 것이 필요합니다. 여성 여행자에게는 문화적 차이에 적응하는 데 다소 시간이 걸릴 수 있으므로, 지역 관습에 대해 미리 알아보는 것이 좋습니다.

대중교통은 품질이 천차만별이고, 많은 사람들이 기본적인 영어를 구사하지만, 몇 마디 아랍어를 알고 있으면 더 편리할 수 있습니다. 짧은 방문에는 카이로가 제격이지만, 더 오랫동안 머무를 계획이라면 쇼핑몰 등 편의 시설이 잘 갖춰진 지역에 거주해보는 것도 고려해 볼 만합니다. 도전과제를 잘 극복한다면, 카이로에서의 여행은 정말 흥미로운 경험이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
Been there for an educational event. The architecture is great and there's a lot of history for those interested in exploring it. The city can be crowded with tourists though (I was there in July.) It's a great place for walking around in and doing a punting tour to learn about the colleges.
Commerce tends to close very early, as well as the bars and clubs. I was not a big fan of the food and every place seemed overpriced.

Gorgeous city with great bars and restaurants, although poor nightlife.
Ideal for summer days/evenings, with outstanding food, punting on the river, and nice shops.
Great greens and Europe's longest outdoor pool on Jesus Green make it a nice place to 'chill' in the warmth.
However, the nightclubs are poor and Cambridge lacks things to do when it's cold/wet.
cambridge.description:
Cambridge is a city that combines history with culture. You will see interesting buildings and rich history everywhere—great for a relaxing walk or a boat tour on the river, where you can see the well-known colleges. Many visitors enjoy summer days on Jesus Green, where you can relax or visit one of the longest outdoor pools in Europe.

However, this busy city can become very crowded, especially in peak tourist season like July. While there are many good bars and restaurants, some people wish the nightlife was more active, as many places close early. You may find dining a bit expensive, and the food choices can vary in quality.

Public transportation is good, but it’s best to enjoy walking here. While Cambridge is nice in summer, it can feel a bit limited in winter when the weather is wet. So, if you plan to visit, bring an umbrella and keep your plans flexible, and you will discover the interesting things this city has to offer!
cambridge.description_kor:
캠브리지(Cambridge)는 역사와 문화가 어우러진 아름다운 도시입니다. 이곳에서는 다양한 매력적인 건물과 풍부한 역사적 유산을 곳곳에서 느낄 수 있어, 편안한 산책이나 강에서 즐기는 보트 투어에 안성맞춤입니다. 보트 투어를 하며 유명한 대학들을 구경하는 것도 좋은 경험이죠. 많은 관광객들이 여름철 예수 그린(Jesus Green)에서 하루를 보내며 휴식을 취하거나, 유럽에서 가장 긴 야외 수영장 중 하나를 즐깁니다.

하지만 이 활기찬 도시는 특히 7월과 같은 성수기에는 매우 붐빌 수 있습니다. 다양한 좋은 바와 레스토랑이 있지만, 일부 장소는 일찍 문을 닫는 경우가 많아 야간 활동이 좀 더 활발했으면 하는 아쉬움이 남기도 합니다. 식사는 다소 비쌀 수 있으며, 음식의 품질에도 차이가 있을 수 있습니다.

대중교통이 잘 되어 있지만, 캠브리지에서는 걷는 것이 가장 좋습니다. 여름철에는 추천할 만하지만, 날씨가 습한 겨울에는 조금 불편할 수도 있어요. 그래서 방문 계획을 세울 때는 우산을 꼭 챙기고, 일정을 유연하게 조정하면 이 도시가 주는 매력을 한껏 즐길 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews:
Nice clean city with lots to do if you're into sports and outdoor activities. Pretty good rec leagues (hockey, baseball, etc.) and probably the only city in North America with a full motocross track in the city centre. Also have kart racing nearby (Strathmore) and indoor/outdoor skydiving. Also lots of mountain biking, rock climbing, and hiking within a short drive (Maclean Creek, Drumheller, mountains). Obviously great snowboarding and skiing both in the city (Canadian Olympic Park) and nearby mountains.

For those who aren't into sports or the like the city might be a bit boring. The downtown core is coming back after the recession but still not as lively as many other metropolitans. Definitely a car based city once you get outside the city core but city is investing in subway system so that might get better in next few years.

I've lived here all my life. Its cold, dry , but sunny usually . Summers are short. Job opportunities are ok for well educated only. Economy has been in a long term downturn due to an oil and gas base. Used to be much better economy (pre-2014). Currently over 25% vacancy in downtown buildings you see in photos of downtown office towers. Recovery will depend on a successful transition to tech and other industries considering climate change initiatives away from oil and gas. People stick to themselves here a lot compared to other countries. Generally polite but not friendly. Females are extremely closed and hard to meet here, Most are unattractive and overweight anyways. So definitely not a dating hotspot for male nomads. Good for families however, if you earn good money. And there is good scenery, infrastructure is excellent, and close to the mountains and outdoor activities, if you don mind the cool to cold climate.

Don't Expect to make any friends if you're immigrant after living there for 2 year. Food is suck , Weather is suck , it is long and cold AF
Most Canadian here is closed minded like other said it made me depress so much of living here

Nice city if you drive only. The public transportation is a joke here and the winters are long and cold.
Good parts - there are still jobs even in recession, beautiful scenery, dry climate compared to the East coast of Canada. Hard to make friends if you are an immigrant even after ten years. Despite the false sense of canadian openness - people do not care about warm, human relationships, the majority is interested in career or prefer to stay in their bubble, closed-minded. Europe is much more attractive than this place, socially speaking.
calgary.description:
Calgary is a city with many activities, especially for those who enjoy sports and being outdoors. The area is clean and offers many activities like hockey, motocross, and skydiving. Nearby mountains provide good chances for hiking, mountain biking, and winter sports like skiing and snowboarding at Canadian Olympic Park.

If exciting activities are not what you enjoy, you might find Calgary a bit boring. The downtown area is recovering from a difficult economic time but is not as busy as other big cities. Many people here keep to themselves, and it can be hard to make friends, especially for new arrivals. The weather is also a factor—winters are long and cold, so be ready for that!

Public transport needs improvement, so having a car can be helpful. The job market can be unstable, but families with good incomes may feel comfortable here. Just be ready for some cold days, but the nice scenery and outdoor life can make it worth it.
calgary.description_kor:
캘거리(Calgary)는 스포츠와 야외 활동을 사랑하는 이들에게 다양한 즐길 거리가 많은 도시입니다. 이 지역은 깨끗하고 하키, 모토크로스, 스카이다이빙 등 여러 가지 액티비티를 즐길 수 있습니다. 근처에 있는 산들은 하이킹과 산악 자전거, 그리고 캐나다 올림픽 공원에서는 스키와 스노보드 같은 겨울 스포츠를 즐기기에 최적의 장소입니다.

하지만 흥미로운 활동을 즐기지 않는다면 캘거리는 다소 지루하게 느껴질 수도 있습니다. 시내는 경제 상황 회복 중이지만, 다른 대도시들만큼 활기차지는 않습니다. 이곳 주민들은 대체로 자신만의 세계에 사는 경향이 있어, 특히 새로 이사 온 사람들에게는 친구를 사귀는 게 쉽지 않을 수 있습니다. 그리고 날씨도 중요한 요소인데, 겨울이 길고 춥기 때문에 이에 대한 준비가 필요합니다.

대중교통은 개선이 필요하므로 자동차를 소유하는 것이 유리할 수 있습니다. 일자리 시장은 다소 불안정할 수 있지만, 좋은 수입을 올리는 가족들은 이곳에서 편안하게 지낼 수 있습니다. 몇몇 추운 날씨에 대비하면서도 아름다운 경치와 야외 활동은 그만한 가치를 느끼게 해줄 것입니다.

reviews:
I have been to Canberra multiple times now. It is not easy to make friends here but once you managed to, it is a very homely place.

It is also a great place to study because the distractions are in Sydney & Melbourne.

In terms of good food, I recommend Charcoal Rooster's Turkish Pizza
man made city , very ugly city with communist looking buildings and statues. it's expensive as well. don't bother going there are much better places in Australia to go
canberra.description:
Canberra, the capital city of Australia, provides different experiences that can be surprising. Many visitors find it hard to make friends at first, but they often say once you do, it really starts to feel like home. With fewer distractions compared to Sydney and Melbourne, it’s also a good choice for students who want to concentrate.

While Canberra may not win many beauty contests—some think it looks like old communist buildings with its plain structures—it does have its own appeal. Food lovers should try Charcoal Rooster for a tasty Turkish pizza, which seems to be a local favorite.

On the downside, some people think that living here can be a bit expensive, and public transport is not as good as in larger cities. If you’re planning to explore, be ready for a quieter atmosphere and possibly fewer options compared to other Australian cities. If you’re willing to take on the challenge, enjoy visiting its many museums and natural parks, which show its rich history and culture!
canberra.description_kor:
캔버라, 호주의 수도는 정말 다양한 경험을 선사하는 곳입니다. 많은 방문객들이 처음에는 친구를 사귀기 어렵다고 느끼지만, 한 번 친구를 만들게 되면 꼭 집처럼 편안하다는 이야기를 많이 합니다. 시드니나 멜버른에 비해 방해 요소가 적어서 집중하고 싶은 학생들에게는 훌륭한 선택이기도 합니다.

캔버라는 미인 대회에서 높은 순위를 차지하지 못할 수도 있지만, 어떤 사람들은 도시의 건축물이 구공산주의 시절의 모습과 비슷하다고 생각하지만, 그 자체로 독특한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 음식 애호가들이라면 지역에서 인기 있는 맛있는 터키 피자를 제공하는 Charcoal Rooster를 꼭 한 번 맛보아야 합니다.

다만, 살기에는 다소 비싸다고 느끼는 이들도 있고, 대중교통이 대도시에 비해 불편하다는 단점도 있습니다. 탐험을 계획하고 있다면, 다른 호주 도시에 비해 조용한 분위기와 선택의 폭이 조금 더 좁을 수도 있다는 점을 염두에 두어야 합니다. 그러나 도전하는 것을 기꺼이 받아들인다면, 풍부한 역사와 문화를 간직한 많은 박물관과 자연 공원을 즐길 수 있습니다!

reviews:
I find the monthly cost of living numbers listed here are way off. In fact, living in Cannes is much cheaper than living in Chicago. Groceries are very affordable. Much lower than shopping at Whole Foods and probably by now, even Trader Joes.
 Eating out, well, it can cost you a lot but there are so many affordable options. Rents can be high but again, there are many apartments that are reasonable if you are renting year-round. We have been renting Airbnb's during the winter months, from October to February, and were able to get a beautiful sea view one-bedroom for $1200. Another AirBnb a bit higher up again, for $1200. We splurged on a place with a large terrace and beautiful mountain view for $2300. But it was worth it! $2300 was about what my mortgage was in Chicago. According to Numbeo, cost of living here is around $4100 for a family of four. By the way, Cannes is gorgeous with a sandy, accessible beach, people are very friendly, and it is meticulously maintained. We have been to Aix-en-Provence, Marseilles, Montpellier, Nice, Bordeaux and of course Paris, but have chosen Cannes to live. It is more expensive than Montpellier and perhaps Bordeaux, but not more than Nice or certainly Aix. Aix I found to be the most expensive after Paris.
cannes.description:
Cannes is a nice city where the sun shines and the Mediterranean sea looks good. Life here is quite affordable compared to some big cities. You will find that groceries cost less than at your local grocery store, making it easy to cook good meals. Eating out can be expensive, but there are many small places with affordable options for you.

Living arrangements vary, but if you look beyond the busy tourist areas, you can find a good apartment at a fair price, especially in the off-season. Renting through Airbnb is quite popular, and you can enjoy nice sea or mountain views without spending too much money.

The local beaches are very nice and easy to get to, perfect for relaxing in the sun. Public transport can be tricky, but walking around the pretty streets is enjoyable. Learning some basic French phrases might help you talk with the friendly locals more easily. Cannes has a good mix of beauty, affordability, and a relaxed Mediterranean feel that makes it a great place to visit or live.
cannes.description_kor:
칸은 태양이 빛나는 아름다운 지중해 도시입니다. 여기서의 생활비는 일부 대도시에 비해 꽤 저렴한 편입니다. 식료품 가격이 동네 마트보다 낮아서 맛있는 요리도 손쉽게 만들 수 있습니다. 외식은 다소 비쌀 수 있지만, 상대적으로 저렴한 작은 식당들도 많이 있어 선택의 폭이 넓습니다.

거주 조건은 다양하지만, 관광지에서 조금만 벗어나면 합리적인 가격에 좋은 아파트를 찾을 수 있습니다. 특히 비수기에는 더욱 그렇습니다. 에어비앤비를 통한 임대도 매우 인기가 있으며, 많은 비용을 들이지 않고도 멋진 바다나 산 전망을 즐길 수 있습니다.

현지 해변은 정말 아름답고 접근이 용이해서 태양 아래에서 느긋하게 시간을 보내기 좋은 곳입니다. 대중교통이 때때로 불편할 수 있지만, 예쁜 거리를 걸으며 다니는 것은 또 다른 즐거움입니다. 기본적인 프랑스어 문구를 배우면 친절한 현지인들과 더 친밀하게 소통할 수 있습니다. 칸은 아름다움과 저렴한 물가, 여유로운 지중해 느낌이 잘 어우러져 있어 방문하기에나 거주하기에 정말 좋은 장소입니다.

reviews: So many red necks... with huge pickup trucks, hot rod kids with no mufflers LOUD! Neighbors park all over their lawns and run mechanic shops out of their garages.
cape-coral.description:
Cape Coral has a special atmosphere that some people find exciting while others think it is a little busy. It is known for its many canals, making it appealing to those who enjoy living by the water. The area also has its share of interesting people, with big pickup trucks and loud cars occasionally passing by. If you like relaxed neighborhoods with some character, you might feel comfortable here in the active environment.

On the positive side, the cost of living is generally lower than in other parts of Florida. However, public transportation options are not very extensive, so having a car is helpful. The safety here is usually good, but it is always smart to be aware of your surroundings.

Cape Coral is great for outdoor activities—boating, fishing, and enjoying the sun are popular here. The local culture tends to be friendly and community-focused, so feel free to start a conversation. Just keep in mind that it is not the quietest place, but the lively atmosphere might appeal to you!
cape-coral.description_kor:
케이프 코랄은 일부 사람들에게 매력적인 특별한 분위기를 제공하는 반면, 다른 이들에게는 다소 북적거리는 곳으로 여겨질 수 있습니다. 이 지역은 많은 운하로 유명해 물가에서 생활하는 것을 선호하는 사람들에게 인기를 끌고 있습니다. 또한 대형 픽업 트럭과 시끄러운 차량들이 가끔 지나가는 등 다양한 사람들을 만날 수 있는 흥미로운 장소입니다. 특색 있는 여유로운 동네를 좋아한다면, 활발한 환경 속에서도 편안함을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다.

좋은 점은 이곳의 생활비가 플로리다 다른 지역에 비해 전반적으로 낮다는 것입니다. 그러나 대중교통은 그리 다양하지 않아서 차가 있으면 더 편리합니다. 이 지역의 안전은 보통 좋은 편이지만, 항상 주변 상황을 인지하는 것이 중요합니다.

케이프 코랄은 야외 활동에 매우 적합한 장소로, 보트 타기, 낚시, 일광욕 등이 인기를 끌고 있습니다. 지역 사람들은 대체로 친절하고 공동체 중심적인 경향이 있으니, 대화를 시도해보는 것도 좋습니다. 다만 이곳이 가장 조용한 장소는 아니라는 점을 염두에 두세요. 그럼에도 불구하고 활기찬 분위기가 마음에 드실 수도 있을 거예요!

reviews: I come from venezuela and the hospitals are definitely not great, my family have to go to Colombia to get treatment when they get sick so you get an idea of the condition of the health care system in Venezuela. The rest of the pros and cons are pretty accurate 👌🏼
caracas.description:
Caracas, the capital of Venezuela, is a city with a lot of life, culture, and different experiences. It is located in a valley and has nice mountain views as well as a mix of modern and old buildings. Many visitors enjoy the local music, tasty street food, and the lively atmosphere of places like Plaza Bolívar.

However, there are some problems. The city has issues with healthcare; many people need to go to Colombia for better treatment. Public transportation can also be difficult, with few options and sometimes unsafe rides. 

Even with these problems, Caracas has its good sides. You should visit neighborhoods like Chacao and El Hatillo to see local life and art. Just a warning: there can be language difficulties, so knowing some Spanish may be useful. Overall, with its rich culture and friendly people, Caracas has a lot to offer for those who are ready to experience its complexities.
caracas.description_kor:
카라카스는 베네수엘라의 수도로, 생명력 넘치는 문화와 다양한 경험이 가득한 도시입니다. 이 도시는 아름다운 계곡에 위치해 있으며, 현대적인 건물과 전통적인 건물이 조화를 이루며 멋진 산 경치를 배경으로 하고 있습니다. 많은 방문객들은 현지 음악과 맛있는 길거리 음식을 즐기며, 플라자 볼리바르와 같은 명소의 활기찬 분위기에 매료됩니다.

하지만 어려움도 존재합니다. 카라카스는 의료 서비스가 부족해 많은 사람들이 더 나은 치료를 받기 위해 콜롬비아로 떠나야 합니다. 대중교통 역시 선택지가 적고 가끔은 안전하지 않아 불편을 겪을 수 있습니다.

이런 문제에도 불구하고, 카라카스는 매력적인 면도 많습니다. 차카오나 엘 하티요 같은 동네를 방문하면 현지의 풍부한 삶과 예술을 체험할 수 있습니다. 다만 스페인어를 조금이라도 배우는 것이 도움이 될 수 있으니 언어 장벽에 유의하는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로, 카라카스는 풍부한 문화와 친절한 사람들 덕분에 다양한 매력을 제공하며, 그 복잡한 모습을 경험할 준비가 된 이들에게 많은 이야기를 들려줄 수 있는 곳입니다.

reviews: Cardiff is a lovely and friendly place filled with plenty of shopping areas, plenty of cuisines all over the city whatever your pallet may be and is not too expensive shall you go to the right places, my favourites being YO! sushi which I loved to go with my partner (the furukaki fries now named yo fries are to die for) but while here there are a lot of things you must do; buy welsh cakes and get yourself a coffee or tea they are delicious little flat cakes sold all over the city for cheap usually cheaper in bulk. I saw 10 for 3 pounds in many flavours, raisins, chocolate, cinnamon, lemon the list goes on. next you need to go to Cardiff castle (it can be pricey) during normal session it costs 13 pound a person but during popular events like football it is often free to visit and climb the castle which is what I did during a football game in the millennium stadium and yes it does get crowded when these games are on but the good thing being in the city the roads close so people can walk on the roads making it easier to not get stepped on. while here you need to try a nice pub at least one time while I cant remember the name there is a lovely cocktail bar/pub that does 2 for 1 cocktails for 7 pound (my favourite being buffalo soldier (which is rum, ginger beer and apple juice with lime added and its delicious). when you are here make sure you check out the welsh gift shops and get a few souvenirs here, the amount of highly detailed and shiny dragon statues you can buy are insane so if you like castles, medieval literature and dragons (and sheep) make sure you come to Cardiff for a break from London.
cardiff.description:
Cardiff is a nice city that has a lot of history and a friendly atmosphere. You will find busy shopping areas and many food choices, suitable for everyone. Try YO! Sushi for some good food, especially their yo fries. And don’t forget to try Welsh cakes! These soft treats are available in many places, often at good prices, even in bulk.

You should visit Cardiff Castle, which has both historical and modern aspects. While the entrance fee can be high on normal days, you might get in for free during special events, like football matches at Millennium Stadium, which makes it lively. Be prepared for crowds when there are games—roads close and people fill the streets, making it an exciting place to be.

For an evening out, check out the local pubs and cocktail bars. You can find some 2-for-1 offers that will make your night enjoyable without spending too much. Just be aware that the language can be a bit challenging for visitors, but the locals are usually friendly and helpful. Don’t forget to buy some Welsh souvenirs—those dragon statues are hard to resist! Cardiff is a great place that shows the unique culture and history of Wales.
cardiff.description_kor:
카디프는 풍부한 역사와 아늑한 분위기를 지닌 매력적인 도시입니다. 활기찬 쇼핑 지역과 다양한 음식 선택지가 있어 누구나 즐길 수 있습니다. 맛있는 음식을 원하신다면 YO! Sushi를 꼭 들러보세요. 특히 그들의 요 fries는 강력 추천합니다. 그리고 웨일스 케이크도 잊지 말고 꼭 맛보세요! 이 부드러운 간식은 여러 곳에서 저렴한 가격에 구입할 수 있으며, 대량으로도 판매되고 있습니다.

카디프 성은 꼭 방문해봐야 할 곳입니다. 이곳은 역사와 현대가 조화를 이루고 있습니다. 평소에는 입장료가 비쌀 수 있지만, 밀레니엄 스타디움에서 축구 경기가 열리는 등의 특별한 이벤트 때는 무료로 입장할 수 있는 경우도 있습니다. 경기가 있는 날에는 사람들이 많이 모여 도로가 폐쇄되는 경우도 있으니, 소란스러운 분위기를 즐길 준비를 하세요. 이런 열기 있는 분위기가 정말 흥미진진합니다.

저녁에는 현지 펍과 칵테일 바를 추천합니다. 2-for-1 프로모션을 잘 찾아보면 큰 비용을 들이지 않고도 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 언어가 방문객에게 다소 어렵게 느껴질 수도 있지만, 현지인들은 대체로 친절하며 도움을 주려고 합니다. 또한 웨일스 기념품도 꼭 사가세요—그 드래곤 동상들은 정말 매력적이어서 쉽게 저항할 수 없답니다! 카디프는 웨일스의 독특한 문화와 역사를 엿볼 수 있는 훌륭한 장소입니다.

reviews: There are no digital nomad, hipster or tourist in Casablanca as the city is ugly, dirty and unsafe with heavy traffic. This is why I choose this place.
Completely agree with the other review, the Hassan II mosque is incredible and there are some nice places to eat but other than that I would never come back.

A really gross town, to be honest. Walking in the streets felt unsafe and borderline aggressive. Animals, homeless people, and trash as far as the eye could see. Beach was nice, though literally no females wear bathing suits, so my girlfriend felt wildly uncomfortable. Wifi was eh at our AirBnB and the cafes/restaurants we went to. The Hassan II mosque is really incredible, but otherwise, I'd never ever come back here.
casablanca.description:
Casablanca has a mix of experiences that can be surprising. Many who walk through its streets find its roughness interesting. While the city does not look perfect—some mention problems like litter and busy traffic—it gives a real view of city life that some visitors value.

One important place to see is the Hassan II Mosque, which is worth a visit, even though it is in a part of the city that may seem a bit rough. There are places to eat, with a few good options for local food, but not every meal will be great. Also, the local beach might not meet everyone’s expectations, especially for women, as there are different cultural standards for swimwear.

Safety can be an issue, and many suggest staying alert while exploring. Public transport is not very good, so be prepared to walk or take a taxi. Overall, if you want a real experience away from the tourist spots, Casablanca might interest you—but it may also bring some challenges.
casablanca.description_kor:
카사블랑카는 다양한 경험이 어우러진 특별한 도시입니다. 이곳의 거리에서 사람들을 구경하다 보면, 그 독특한 매력이 흥미롭게 느껴질 것입니다. 도시가 완벽하진 않지만, 일부러 쓰레기와 복잡한 교통 문제를 언급하는 사람들도 있을 것입니다. 그럼에도 불구하고, 카사블랑카는 도시 생활의 진짜 모습을 체험할 수 있는 가치가 있는 곳입니다.

여행 중 꼭 들러야 할 중요한 장소 중 하나는 하산 2세 모스크입니다. 이곳은 다소 거친 환경에 위치해 있지만, 방문할 만한 가치가 충분합니다. 지역의 음식을 제공하는 괜찮은 식당이 몇 군데 있지만, 모든 곳이 훌륭한 것은 아니니 참고하세요. 또한, 현지 해변은 특히 여성들에게 기대에 미치지 않을 수도 있으며, 수영복에 대한 문화적 인식이 다른 점도 염두에 두어야 합니다.

안전 문제도 고려해야 할 사항으로, 탐험할 때는 항상 주의하는 것이 좋습니다. 대중교통은 그리 편리하지 않으니, 걷거나 택시를 이용할 준비를 해두는 게 좋습니다. 전반적으로 관광 명소를 벗어난 진짜 경험을 원하신다면 카사블랑카는 흥미로운 선택이 될 수 있지만, 몇 가지 도전 과제를 마주할 준비도 필요할 것입니다.

reviews:
Personal Rating: 2/5

As a nomad kiteboarder, I spent 2 weeks in Cartagena just to work and enjoy the sunsets on the water.
On the positive side, the city provides affordable accommodation options and a decent food scene with noteworthy restaurants like Celele or bars like Alquimico. The city's nightlife boasts lively bars and rooftop venues, and the sunsets are truly beautiful.

However, prostitution and sex tourism is really to much and to present, which may be uncomfortable for some visitors... Safety can be a concern depending on where you stay (locals advised me not to walk alone at night). The city is really noisy, and full of scams.

A short trip there can have it's charms if you stay in the Centro or Boca Grande or Castillo Grande. If you look for protitutes, it's like open bar. Overwise I think this place is a bit overrate for the DNs lifestyle.

I mostly don't like it here. Possibly I am too used to USA or have not traveled enough. 

PRO: It is beautiful, with great natural resources, inexpensive rates & lots of activities to do. There are carriage rides & snorkling, beach events, etc. Lots & lots of great places for brunch or dinner & drinks. 

CONS: There's a strong cultural, economic & racial divide here. The locals see the tourist as distinctly different from them. It's hard to find any locals to have a conversation & just treat you like a person, no matter how down to earth you are. Pretty much any transaction can devolve into begging & visible frustration if you say no. There's a lot of resentment that presents in many conversations. 

Ultimately it creates a scenario where it's hard to be a person & treat the locals like people. Apparently, the best-case scenario is to enjoy the locations where the restaurant/bar/lounge/etc forcefully keeps the locals out. They put the best places on the second floor so that you don't even see the locals. But for someone like me who was hoping to have authentic experiences in Colombia, it is frustrating to find that it is not really possible.

I was there for one week and stayed in Bocagrande, about a 10 minute taxi ride from the Walled City. Pros of Cartagena: Inexpensive locale, reliable and fast internet, good weather (if you like it hot), not terribly crowded (aside from Walled City), beauty/history/nightlife of Walled City. Cons: Local beaches are average at best and riddled with vendors who accost visitors non-stop, street vendors are less pushy but everywhere, fluency in Spanish is very helpful (not really a con, just is), Walled City is loaded with tourists and priced accordingly. Cartagena struck me as a one-trick pony like a Las Vegas. Some people love Vegas because of the weather and the entertainment. Cartagena has the weather and the Walled City. Unfortunately even though its a coastal city, it's tough to enjoy the beach.

The beaches are not good. You'll have to go to the islands or natural park if you want a nice beach. Unless you're looking fo a Miami remake, don't stay in the area with all the newer high-rises. The walled city is cute, but it's not worth staying there. Within a day you've seen it all and it's relatively expensive. Everyone is a tourist and it's super hot because there's no breeze with the walls. I recommend staying in a residential area south of the high-rises. It's a safe and charming place with friendly locals who are always out on their porches. Everyone says hello to you here. More culture, more affordable, laid-back, but no co-working.
cartagena.description:
Cartagena is a colorful place on Colombia’s coast. Visitors enjoy the beautiful sunsets and the busy nightlife with many bars and rooftop locations. There are many nice places to eat, like Celele and Alquimico, making food both enjoyable and affordable.

However, some travelers point out a few issues. There are worries about safety in some areas, especially at night, so it is best to stay in popular neighborhoods like Centro, Boca Grande, or Castillo Grande. Also, while the city is nice, there is a noticeable presence of sex tourism, which can be uncomfortable for some.

The Walled City is lovely but can be crowded and expensive. Many people say that the local beaches are not as good, often having many vendors. If you want a more local experience, think about staying away from tourist spots and exploring residential neighborhoods where locals are friendly.

Overall, Cartagena has much to offer, but being careful and planning ahead can help you enjoy your visit more!
cartagena.description_kor:
카르타헤나(Cartagena)는 콜롬비아 해안에 위치한 다채로운 도시입니다. 방문객들은 아름다운 일몰과 활기찬 밤 문화를 즐길 수 있으며, 여러 바와 루프탑이 있어 다양한 경험을 제공합니다. 특히 Celele와 Alquimico 같은 훌륭한 레스토랑이 많아 맛있는 음식을 저렴하게 즐길 수 있습니다.

하지만 일부 여행자들은 몇 가지 문제를 언급하기도 합니다. 특히 밤에 일부 지역의 안전 문제에 대한 우려가 있어, 센트로(Centro), 보카 그란데(Boca Grande), 혹은 카스티요 그란데(Castillo Grande) 같은 인기 지역에 머무는 것이 좋습니다. 도시 자체는 아름답지만 성매매 문제로 인해 불편함을 느낄 수도 있습니다.

성벽 도시(Walled City)는 매력적이지만 혼잡하고 가격이 비쌀 수 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 현지 해변들이 기대 이하라고 말하며, 종종 상인들이 많이 밀집해 있습니다. 좀 더 현지적인 경험을 원하신다면 관광지에서 벗어나 현지 주민들이 살고 있는 친근한 주택가를 탐방하는 것도 좋은 방법입니다.

종합적으로 카르타헤나는 많은 매력을 지닌 곳이지만, 미리 계획하고 주의한다면 더욱 즐거운 방문이 될 수 있습니다!

reviews: This city doesn't deserve to be ahead of cities like Da Nang or Chiang Mai. Still way to underdeveloped. Yes a lot of coffees for wifi but dirty and overall not great conditions for nomads. You'll not find almost any nomads there. I would skip it.

Hi guys, I live in south of Cebu since 2014.Subdivison in Carcar city. Find it safe people are friendlier than me. I'm just causes. I'm 30km from CBD to the south. About an hour drive. If you interested to live in Carcar, check out Lamudi. There are properties for rent and sale. Camelia and Glenrose straight of south road, easy excess. Traffic is quite annoying even in Carcar, mostly because of slow drivers holding, or vehicles who constantly overtaking AGAINST TRAFFIC. Heaps of roadworks nowadays, they trying to improve. Oslob is near, many waterfalls further south. Peaceful. I wouldn't live in CBD. Have all in Carcar, from coffee shop to restaurants. Super metro, Gaisano, save more. They have all.

I was living in the touristy exclave on mactan island, and it was very nice in terms of cost/quality. 600mb symmetrical stable internet, helpful and super friendly (sometimes even too much) staff, clean pools/beaches, all good. But it is exclave for tourists. When you step outside - it is poverty, a bit of chaos and other things you would expect from a third world country. So you can find a balance of these 2 thing that works for you. 
Compared to Palawan - this place is absolute winner for me because you get much more for much cheaper.

I was reading previous reviews and there are digital nomads here calling locals idiots, i dont even know if i wanna be classified as a digital nomad because of these arrogant and privileged expats. better go back to your first world country and not travel.

anyway, Cebu is a good jump off point for other islands but good internet is not easy to find unless you just stay at the center.

I love Cebu so maybe I may seem biased but here's my perspective as an American who has spent many months, off and on, in Cebu. It is my other home. I have even owned a condo in Marigondon, Lapu-Lapu previously and a car there too.

First, it's a big city and like any big city you need to be careful. I don't find Cebu to be unsafe. I've felt just as safe in Cebu as I do in my native Los Angeles (California, USA). Obviously don't do things like flash money or valuables, etc. Use common sense... but as my mom used to say "common sense isn't so common" at least not these days.

Many people DO speak English but why would anyone go to a country where English isn't the first language and expect everyone to be fluent in English??? If you want to find people Fluent in English go to English speaking countries.

I'm learning Bisaya as it's my wife's native language (Nagkaton ko ug Bisaya) and I think if you're going to spend a reasonable amount of time in a country you should at least make some effort to learn a little of the language, you don't need to be fluent but it will be helpful to both you and the locals.

No place is perfect but I find Cebu to be very pleasant and I love it despite it's imperfections, I just feel at peace in Cebu.

Cebu does have traffic problems but it seems they're trying to resolve some of the congestion such as adding a 3rd bridge between Cebu City and Cordova/Mactan.

If you're curious about Cebu I recommend that you see it for yourself and check out other reviews for places to stay, sightseeing, etc.

I'm not one who focuses on race but i'm a conservative black American and haven't had any issues regarding race but there are a few who will charge any foreigner higher prices for things. If you go elsewhere you can find many others who are honest and reasonable.

Cebu city isn't safe, and internet is really slow unless you have a fiber connection.
Most of areas are unsafe at night, some are sort of dangerous at daylight too. 
Even in deep province of Cebu island (such as Carcar city) I've been feeling much safer than here.
Also don't forget about terrible road traffic and the fact that most of locals here doesn't speak English.

Peacev = Bad, Racial Tolerance = Bad, LGBT Friendly = Bad

Sorry but this is simply not true here in the Philipines. The Koreans and the Chinese are very rude, unsofisticated not to mention dominant. But that something you'll see all over Asia nowadays. 

I think revieuwers should at least try to notice the difference between Asians.

Professional fulltime Traveler since 2007

Just don't. Want to get ANY work done? Don't come here. I'm here now, hey. I wanna die. If 50 Kbps is your thing, let's go. Just don't go to this country in general. Internet is so bad, even Laos and Cambodia were MUCH better when it comes to free internet in coffee shops and co-working spaces. 

Thinking about going to Manila or Cebu for travel + work? Don't.

By instant rock star status you mean the local idiots who point, laugh and stare and gossip in Bisaya? People are not friendly and should be kept at arm's length. Cebu is probably the best city in the Philippines though so all is not lost.

Lived in Cebu City for 15 years and as you can understand I liked it coz else I would have left. Started a business with 7 employees. As a white foreigner you get instant rock star status. The people are outstandingly friendly.
The air, traffic and humidity is terrible. It's a safe and fun city. Best public WiFi is in Starbucks. Lots of retired American Expats. Left when my two children entered middle school, no good affordable schools.

Stay near Cebu IT Park or Cebu Business Park. Hot and humid city, so use the Grab app, turn the AC on always, and shower daily. Must get a decent Cable ISP with Sky Cable or DSL line with PLDT, the LTE with Smart and Globe Data are lousy. You will not get any decent work done when you're in Bantayan / Camotes / Kawasan / Badian because you can only use LTE in these areas, and the signal is spotty. Airbnb condos in the city offer WiFi, join Facebook groups in Cebu, I noticed that they would usually advertise there. Good luck!
So so. Better than Manila as long you stick to Central Cebu. Terrible city to visit. Surprisingly decent and charming to live in. over time.
cebu.description:
Cebu has a special appeal that attracts many people to its busy streets and friendly locals. Those who live there or spend a lot of time there often talk about the nice people and the calm atmosphere in places like Carcar, which is away from the busy city center. There are many coffee shops and restaurants, offering plenty of spots to relax, although some areas may seem a bit neglected.

However, there are some issues to be aware of. Traffic can be a problem, and road construction is happening in some places, with some people saying the city's public transportation is not very good. While many people speak English, not everyone is fluent, so learning a few Bisaya phrases might help you connect better.

Cebu is also a good starting point for trips to nearby islands, waterfalls, and beautiful beaches. Just remember to keep your belongings safe and not show expensive items. If you want to be in a lively area, consider staying near Cebu IT Park or the Business Park. Overall, Cebu combines city life with a bit of a tropical feel, making it an interesting place to visit.
cebu.description_kor:
세부는 바쁜 거리와 친절한 현지인들로 인해 많은 사람들을 매료시키는 독특한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 그곳에 살거나 오랜 시간을 보내는 이들은 종종 카르카르와 같은 번화한 도심에서 벗어난 고요한 지역의 따뜻한 사람들과 차분한 분위기에 대해 이야기하곤 합니다. 다양한 커피숍과 레스토랑이 있어 편안하게 쉴 공간이 많지만, 일부 지역은 다소 소외된 느낌을 줄 수 있습니다.

하지만 주의해야 할 점도 몇 가지 있습니다. 교통 체증이 심각할 수 있고, 특정 지역에서는 도로 공사가 진행 중이며, 대중 교통이 그리 원활하지 않다는 의견도 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 영어를 할 줄 아는 정도지만, 모두가 유창하진 않아서 몇 가지 비사야어 표현을 익히면 소통하는 데 도움이 될 것입니다.

세부는 또한 인근 섬과 폭포, 아름다운 해변으로의 여행을 위한 훌륭한 출발점이기도 합니다. 소지품을 안전하게 지키고 비싼 물건을 드러내지 않도록 주의하는 것이 중요합니다. 활기찬 분위기를 즐기고 싶다면 세부 IT 파크나 비즈니스 파크 근처의 숙소를 고려해 보세요. 전반적으로 세부는 도시 생활과 열대의 매력을 결합한 흥미로운 여행지입니다.

reviews:
Great place in summer if you love the mountains/adventure/hiking. Quite pricey tho. 
The Ski Locker is the recommended co-working, very international, great vibe for well-focused work.

I spent one day (and night, by accident) in Chamonix. It was supposed to be a day-trip, but I didn't bother to read the sign where I parked the car and came back for it too late, after the lot was locked. This is a great place to visit if you want to get up into the mountains and see the glacier. I was saddened to see how much the glacier had receded over the years, but it's still worth exploring. The countryside around Chamonix is gorgeous.
chamonix.description:
Chamonix is a great place for anyone who enjoys the outdoors, especially in summer. If you like mountains, hiking, or just enjoying nice views, this area is for you. The landscape is beautiful, with green fields and the impressive glacier that, although smaller now, still provides a wonderful experience.

While it is a good spot for adventure fans, be ready for high prices – it can be a bit expensive here. For those wanting to work remotely, The Ski Locker is a nice co-working space with a friendly atmosphere that helps you stay on task.

Just a reminder, if you are driving, make sure to check the parking signs! One visitor learned this when they returned to a locked parking lot after their trip.

With few public transport options, renting a car is a good idea to explore the area completely. Whether you are hiking, enjoying local food, or shopping in interesting neighborhoods, Chamonix offers a memorable mix of nature and mountain culture. Just keep an eye on your spending, and you will have a great time!
chamonix.description_kor:
샤모니는 여름에 야외 활동을 즐기는 이들에게 정말 좋은 장소입니다. 만약 산악 등산이나 멋진 경치를 감상하는 것을 좋아한다면 이 지역은 딱 맞습니다. 이곳의 경치는 아름답고, 푸른 들판과 인상적인 빙하가 조화를 이루고 있어, 비록 지금은 작아졌지만 여전히 멋진 경험을 제공합니다.

모험을 좋아하는 사람들에게는 최적의 장소이긴 하지만, 가격이 조금 비쌀 수 있다는 점은 감안해야 합니다. 원격 근무를 원하는 분들을 위해서는 ‘더 스키 락커’라는 친근한 분위기의 멋진 공동 작업 공간이 있어, 작업에 집중할 수 있도록 도와줍니다.

차를 운전하시는 분들은 주차 표지를 꼭 확인하세요! 한 방문자는 여행 후에 주차장에 갔을 때 잠긴 사실을 알게 되었습니다.

대중교통 수단이 적기 때문에 이 지역을 충분히 탐험하고 싶다면 자동차를 렌트하는 것이 좋습니다. 하이킹을 즐기든, 현지 음식을 맛보든, 흥미로운 동네에서 쇼핑을 하든 샤모니는 자연과 산 문화가 어우러진 기억에 남는 경험을 선사합니다. 지출만 조금 주의하면 멋진 시간을 보낼 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: It's like Denver, but with less hippies, style and outdoorsy people. Most of the city is suburban, and most of the people are basic. Culture and art, while improving, are still undeveloped. As a city, Charlotte seems like a pre-teen still coming-of-age. Not yet cool, but it has potential to get there eventually.
charlotte.description:
Charlotte seems to be in a process of change, similar to a teenager finding their style. While the city has some charm, the cultural scene is still developing. The art and music are getting better, but they haven't reached their best yet. 

On a positive note, many people find that the cost of living here is reasonable compared to other cities. Public transportation is useful, but it could be improved. Safety is mostly good, so you can explore without too much concern. 

For a fun activity, you can visit local parks or eat at one of the new restaurants. You might also want to check out neighborhoods like NoDa to experience the growing arts scene. Just remember, some areas may seem similar to each other. Overall, Charlotte is on the way to becoming something special!
charlotte.description_kor:
샬롯은 마치 자신의 스타일을 찾고 있는 십대처럼 변화의 과정을 겪고 있는 것 같아요. 이 도시는 어느 정도 매력을 지니고 있지만, 문화적인 면에서는 아직 성장 중에 있습니다. 예술과 음악이 점점 발전하고는 있지만, 아직 완전한 수준에는 이르지 않았어요.

긍정적인 점은, 많은 사람들이 이곳의 생활비가 다른 도시들에 비해 꽤 합리적이라고 느낀다는 거예요. 대중교통도 유용하지만, 개선할 부분이 여전히 있죠. 전반적으로 안전한 편이라서 너무 걱정하지 않고 탐험할 수 있답니다.

재미있는 활동으로는 현지 공원을 찾아가거나 새로운 레스토랑에서 맛있는 식사를 해보는 것도 좋습니다. 또한, 발전 중인 예술 씬을 경험하려면 NoDa와 같은 동네를 방문해보는 것도 추천해요. 단, 어떤 지역들은 서로 비슷하게 보일 수 있으니 유념해 주세요. 전체적으로 샬롯은 특별한 무언가로 성장해가고 있는 중이랍니다!

reviews: Yaaassssss. That’s my home city. Pretty damn gay too which is great.🏳️‍🌈
chattanooga.description:
Chattanooga is a city that welcomes everyone. It has a friendly atmosphere and a good LGBTQ+ scene, making it feel like home for many people. There are many arts and culture activities here, including local music events, theaters, and festivals that happen throughout the year.

People enjoy living here because the cost of living is lower than in larger cities, but there are a few things to keep in mind. Public transportation is not very extensive, so having a car can be useful. Residents generally feel safe, but it's always a good idea to be aware of your surroundings, especially at night.

You should visit Chattanooga's beautiful outdoor places like Lookout Mountain and the Tennessee Riverwalk. Areas like Southside and Northshore have many good restaurants and shops. Locals suggest trying the food trucks and local diners for an authentic taste of the area. It’s a city where community and tradition come together, offering something for everyone.
chattanooga.description_kor:
채타누가는 모든 사람을 환영하는 도시입니다. 친근한 분위기와 뛰어난 LGBTQ+ 문화 덕분에 많은 이들이 이곳을 집처럼 느끼고 있습니다. 지역 음악 행사, 극장, 그리고 연중 열리는 다양한 축제 등으로 다채로운 예술 및 문화 활동이 펼쳐집니다.

이곳의 생활비는 대도시보다 저렴해 많은 사람들이 편안하게 살고 있습니다. 그러나 몇 가지 유의해야 할 점이 있습니다. 대중교통이 넓지 않기 때문에 차량 소지가 편리할 수 있습니다. 거주자들은 대체로 안전하다고 느끼지만, 특히 밤에는 주변을 항상 주의하는 것이 중요합니다.

채타누가의 아름다운 야외 명소인 룩아웃 마운틴과 테네시 리버워크를 꼭 방문해 보시길 권합니다. 사우스사이드와 노스쇼어 지역에는 훌륭한 레스토랑과 상점들이 많이 있습니다. 지역 주민들은 진정한 맛을 경험하기 위해 푸드 트럭과 지역 다이너를 이용해보라고 추천합니다. 이 도시는 공동체와 전통이 잘 어우러져 있어, 누구나 즐길 거리가 plentiful합니다.

reviews: Don't go thinking it's another Chiang Mai, because it doesn`t. Instead, Chiang Rai is much smaller and simple, not so much to see and do --forget about nighlife, just relax and get the work done. Food is amazing and you can have as much khao soi you can eat. Finding a condo with pool and gym is possible, but there are not much options available. Better book something in the middle of nature -- rent a motorbike.
chiang-rai.description:
Chiang Rai is a calm place compared to the busy city of Chiang Mai. It is a smaller city where you can enjoy good local food, especially khao soi. There is not much nightlife, but this simplicity makes it pleasant. You can relax and enjoy the natural beauty around you here.

Living in Chiang Rai is inexpensive, but there are not many condos with pools and gyms. If you want to explore, you can rent a motorbike to see the beautiful countryside and hidden spots near the city. Public transportation is not very good, so having your own transport is useful.

As you explore, make sure to see the local traditions and the lovely temples in the area. Keep in mind there may be some language difficulties, but a smile can help. Overall, Chiang Rai is good for those who want a slower lifestyle, nice views, and a real taste of Thai culture.
chiang-rai.description_kor:
체앙라이(Chiang Rai)는 활기찬 치앙마이(Chiang Mai)와 비교했을 때 훨씬 한적한 곳입니다. 현지 음식을 맛볼 수 있는 아담한 도시로, 특히 카오소이(khao soi)가 유명합니다. 밤문화는 그리 없지만, 이러한 간결함이 도시에 편안함을 더해줍니다. 이곳에서는 아름다운 자연을 감상하며 여유롭게 휴식을 취할 수 있습니다.
