체앙라이의 생활비는 저렴한 편이지만, 수영장과 헬스장이 있는 콘도는 많지 않은 편입니다. 새로운 곳을 탐험하고 싶다면 오토바이를 렌트해 주변의 아름다운 시골과 숨겨진 명소를 찾아보세요. 대중교통이 불편하므로 개인 이동 수단이 매우 유용합니다.

탐험하면서 지역 전통과 주변의 아름다운 사원들도 꼭 방문해보세요. 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있지만, 미소만으로도 충분히 소통할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 체앙라이는 느긋한 라이프스타일과 멋진 경치, 그리고 태국 문화를 진솔하게 체험하고 싶은 분들에게 최적의 장소입니다.

reviews: My favourite city in the world, obviously difficult to get in, and pollution is a huge issue, but I love the culture of Chengdu and it's an extremely vibrant city, I am never bored in Chengdu.

I lived and worked (at a law firm) in Chengdu for about 3 months. I absolutely loved the city! It's so different from east coast China, especially given the Tibetan influences in many areas. I had a company arrange my apartment and registrations, but was a seamless process. I am a white, American male who speaks a decent bit of Mandarin, and I found the locals to be incredibly hospitable. China is general is extremely affordable for a Westerner, and Chengdu offers the luxuries of any large, Western city/metro area.
chengdu.description:
Chengdu is a city that will attract you with its culture and lively atmosphere. Many people say it is their favorite city. The mix of local traditions and Tibetan influences gives a special touch to daily life here. Living costs are low, allowing you to enjoy city life without spending too much money.

Public transportation can be difficult at times, but once you learn it, exploring the city can be enjoyable. Keep in mind that pollution is a major problem, so be aware of it while visiting.

The locals are friendly, which makes living here nice, especially if you know some Mandarin. Make sure to try the local customs and food, especially if you like spicy dishes! To have a great time, explore areas that show Chengdu's lively spirit and enjoy the city's special characteristics. Just be ready for some cultural differences, and you will have a great experience!
chengdu.description_kor:
충둥은 독특한 문화와 활기찬 분위기로 여러분을 매료시킬 도시입니다. 많은 사람들은 이곳을 가장 좋아하는 도시라고 말하곤 합니다. 지역 전통과 티베트 문화가 어우러져 일상 생활에 특별한 매력을 더해줍니다. 생활비가 저렴해 부담 없이 도시 생활을 즐길 수 있는 장점도 있습니다.

대중교통은 가끔씩 불편할 수 있지만, 익숙해지면 도시 탐험이 훨씬 즐거워질 거예요. 다만, 오염이 큰 문제이니 방문 중에는 이에 유의하시는 것이 좋습니다.

현지인들이 매우 친절해서 이곳에서 생활하는 데 긍정적인 경험을 할 수 있습니다. 특히 약간의 중국어를 할 줄 알면 더욱 좋습니다. 현지의 관습과 음식을 꼭 경험해 보세요, 매운 음식을 좋아하신다면 더할 나위 없겠죠! 충둥의 활기찬 매력을 느낄 수 있는 지역을 탐방하며 도시의 특별한 매력을 즐기는 시간을 가져보세요. 문화적 차이를 미리 준비해 두신다면 정말 멋진 경험을 하실 수 있습니다!

reviews:
Guys, the internet is actually very fast because it's taken from Romania. Pretty much any apartment has at least a 100 Mbps connection and a big portion already have upwards of 300 Mbps both download and upload. Some even have a 1 Gbps connection. If you only judge by the speed you get at cafes, then obviously you won't get a fast internet since the available bandwidth is split between everyone who's connected at that time, but that's a very poor way of judging it.

My 4G connection itself gets around 85 Mbps, which is way higher than what you get in most other countries from a broadband connection!

I'am from Chisihau. Response for previos message("Good before..") : prices rise because natural gas price was 3Lei(0.16USD) and now is 21Lei(1.1USD). Petrol was 0.9USD now 1.3USD. Refugees from Ukraine rised rent prices.
17/10/2022 nomadlist writes that cost of living is 1900USD. Crazy. Rent good-normal (imho) flat in center is 350EUR htt ps://999 .md/ ru/78274199 + utilities + home made food from 185 to 250usd. +200 fun. Finally 800$ in winter when high utilities price!

Good before, pretty expensive now (there is now VAT),
Pretty chaotic but safe in the center, Taxi services are pretty bad , hard impossible to get a cab in the peak hours, Yandex taxi
Huge traffic (there is simply no new roads since soviet union),
You need VPN to access some websites, fast internet but not the most stable,

My main concern with Chisinau is that there is basically only one decent coffee shop in town, namely the Tucano coffee. This means you'll be drinking their lousy coffee at all times, and after a week or so the city is slightly depressing to be honest. However, there are nice affordable Soviet-style cantines all around the city, so you can eat well for less than US$3. Hostels are also OK.

Chisinau is an underrated city for Eastern Europe! It's similar to being a smaller version of Minsk or Kiev. Very clean, the fastest internet in Europe. It's quite poor but the city center is lively and I enjoy it quite a bit. Most younger people speak good English, you'll need some Russian in order to speak to middle-aged or older people.
I live in Chisinau, and the total amount of money that i spend is $500/month. I don’t know where they find this prices. Maybe they live in very expensive apartments that cost more then $800.
chisinau.description:
Chisinau is an interesting place in Eastern Europe that is gaining attention from travelers. It has some of the fastest internet in the area, allowing you to stay connected while you explore. Many places have good rental prices, especially in the center, although prices are going up. The local atmosphere is active, especially among young people who often speak English well, but it helps to know some Russian to talk with older people.

For food, you can find affordable Soviet-style cafeterias that serve filling meals for under $3, so you can enjoy good food without spending much. However, coffee lovers might be disappointed, as there is only one good café in the city.

Chisinau may feel busy because of traffic and limited taxi services, but it is generally safe, especially in central areas. Just be ready for possible traffic delays and the challenges of public transport. Overall, Chisinau offers a genuine experience, clean streets, and a mix of history and modern life.
chisinau.description_kor:
키시나우는 동유럽 여행자들에게 점점 더 주목받고 있는 흥미로운 도시입니다. 이곳은 빠른 인터넷 속도로 유명해 탐험을 하면서도 항상 온라인 상태를 유지할 수 있습니다. 특히 도심에서는 다양한 곳에서 저렴한 임대료를 제공하고 있지만, 가격은 점점 오르고 있는 추세입니다. 지역 분위기는 활기차며, 특히 젊은 층은 영어를 잘 구사하는 경우가 많지만, 나이 많은 분들과 대화할 때는 러시아어를 알고 있는 것이 유용합니다.

음식에 관한 한, 3달러 이하로 배부르게 식사할 수 있는 저렴한 소련 스타일의 카페테리아가 많아, 금전적인 부담 없이 맛있는 음식을 즐길 수 있습니다. 그러나 커피를 좋아하는 사람들은 아쉬울 수 있는데, 도시에 괜찮은 카페가 하나밖에 없기 때문입니다.

키시나우는 교통 혼잡과 제한된 택시 서비스 때문에 다소 바쁜 느낌을 줄 수 있지만, 일반적으로는 안전하며 특히 도심에서 그런 경향이 강합니다. 다만, 교통 체증과 대중교통의 불편함에 대비해야 합니다. 전반적으로 키시나우는 독특한 경험을 제공하며, 깨끗한 거리와 역사적인 요소, 현대적인 삶이 조화롭게 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다.

reviews: I lived in Chongqing for about 5 years. I mostly love this place but it's not easy for Westerners unless you can speak some Chinese. But with a smartphone you can translate anything you need to say. Chongqing is beautiful, gritty and romantic. Extremely inexpensive and lots of things to do. Beautiful women. Maybe the most unique city in China. Weather terrible in winter and summer. Winter is foggy, rainy and low light while summers are uncomfortably hot and humid. They don't speak standard Mandarin here so even Chinese from Beijing can't talk to the locals. I had the time of my life here but it's too strange and foreign for many. Not like going to Thailand or the Philippines. It took a while to grow on me.
chongqing.description:
Chongqing is a city with a mix of beauty and toughness, showing a special part of life in China. Located in the mountains, it is known for its great views and night scenes, but be ready for the weather—winters can be foggy and gray, while summers can be hot and humid.

Living here is quite affordable, and you can enjoy a lively culture with tasty spicy food and local customs. However, language can be a challenge; the locals do not speak standard Mandarin, which may be difficult for Westerners. But do not let that stop you! A smartphone translator can help.

There are many activities to do: visit the well-known hot pot restaurants, take a boat ride on the Yangtze River, or explore the historic areas. Keep in mind, it may take some time to get used to this city’s unique features. Popular neighborhoods have a warm feeling and community, but a little patience with local language can help a lot. If you accept its differences, Chongqing will likely become a favorite!
chongqing.description_kor:
충칭은 아름다움과 강인함이 조화를 이루는 도시로, 중국의 특별한 문화를 경험할 수 있는 곳입니다. 산악 지역에 위치해 있어 멋진 경치와 야경으로 유명하지만, 날씨에 대한 준비가 필요합니다. 겨울에는 안개가 많이 끼고 흐린 날이 많으며, 여름은 덥고 습합니다.

충칭에서의 생활비는 상당히 저렴하고, 맛있고 매운 음식을 마음껏 즐길 수 있는 활기찬 문화가 특징입니다. 다만, 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있습니다. 현지인들이 표준 만다린을 사용하지 않기 때문에, 외국인에게는 이해하기 어려운 경우가 많습니다. 그러나 걱정할 필요는 없습니다! 스마트폰 번역기가 큰 도움이 될 수 있습니다.

할 수 있는 즐길 거리는 정말 많습니다. 유명한 훠궈 식당에 가거나 양쯔강에서 보트 타기를 즐기거나 역사적인 장소를 탐방하는 것도 좋습니다. 이 도시의 독특한 매력에 익숙해지려면 시간이 필요할 수 있습니다. 인기 있는 동네들은 따뜻한 분위기와 강한 공동체 의식을 느낄 수 있으며, 현지 언어에 대한 인내심이 큰 도움이 될 것입니다. 충칭의 다양한 매력을 받아들인다면, 분명 당신의 소중한 도시가 될 것입니다!

reviews: Cincinnati is where you see and experience a normal American life. Weather has seasons and a temper. Nothing is world class, but you can experience the arts, community, and business at a rather high level.
cincinnati.description:
Cincinnati feels like a comfortable part of normal American life. You will find a city that has its own charm, where the weather can change from snowy winters to hot summers. While it may not have major attractions, the arts scene is active, and the community spirit is strong, making it a good place to meet friendly people.

Living costs here are quite low, making it easier to enjoy what the city has to offer without spending too much. Public transport is average, but having a car can make it easier to explore nearby areas and attractions. Safety is usually good, but it's always a good idea to be aware of your surroundings.

You might want to visit Over-the-Rhine for its lively atmosphere or go to Clifton for a look at the local college scene. Whether you like arts, sports, or food, Cincinnati has something for everyone. Just remember to bring an umbrella—those seasonal weather changes can be unexpected!
cincinnati.description_kor:
신시내티는 미국의 편안한 생활과 밀접한 관련이 있는 도시입니다. 여기서는 겨울에 눈이 내리기도 하고, 여름에는 더운 날씨를 경험할 수 있는 다양한 매력이 살아 있습니다. 주요 관광지는 많지 않지만, 예술 문화가 활발하고 공동체 의식이 강해, 언제든지 친절한 사람들을 만날 수 있는 곳입니다.

이곳은 생활비가 상대적으로 낮아서, 많은 돈을 쓰지 않고도 다양한 즐길 거리를 마음껏 누릴 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 평균적인 편이지만, 차가 있다면 주변 지역과 명소를 탐험하기가 훨씬 편리합니다. 일반적으로 안전한 편이지만, 항상 주변을 주의하는 것은 좋은 습관입니다.

활기찬 분위기를 느끼고 싶다면 오버 더 라인(Over-the-Rhine)을 방문해보세요. 또는 지역 대학의 생동감을 경험하고 싶다면 클리프튼(Clifton)도 추천합니다. 예술, 스포츠, 음식 등 다양한 취향을 충족시킬 수 있는 신시내티는 모두에게 매력적인 요소를 제공합니다. 다만, 계절에 따라 날씨가 변덕스러울 수 있으니 우산을 챙기는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: I grew up in Chicago and still return fairly often. I love the character of the different neighborhoods, the variety of architectural styles, and as others have said, the food scene is incredible. It's easy to make friends in the suburbs, perhaps not so much in the city itself. I have never witnessed racial tension here, and have been pleasantly surprised by the interracial friendliness I have observed. There are a wonderful selection of forests and parks just about everywhere, and the museums can't be beat. There's always something to do - too many choices! In recent years, though, the crime rate has increased significantly. Shootings are becoming increasingly commonplace - including people firing guns out of cars on the expressways. In spite of that, Chicago definitely has a personality all its own, and I will always love it.

Amazing nightlife and possibly the best overall food scene in the states (lots of michelin-level restaurants at far lower prices than NYC/SF). Avoid the winter and you'll love your time Chicago. It's a city of neighborhoods, so do some research to find which area suits you best. Lots of creative types live/work in the west side (West Loop, Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square, etc.)

Chicago is great if you can afford it. I’m not sure why the “low” rating for fun and nightlife. One of the only US cities (after New York, Miami and Vegas) that stays open late (4am and 5am bars and clubs). One of the best foodie cities in the world. Winter is freezing, summer time is a blast with rooftop bars and beach days.
chicago.description:
Chicago is a city full of activity and character. In its neighborhoods, you can find everything from artistic scenes in Wicker Park and Logan Square to the more upscale area of Gold Coast. The food here is notable—think Chicago-style deep-dish pizza, various global dishes, and restaurants with top ratings that are reasonably priced.

There is a lot to do with many museums, parks, and nightlife options. You can enjoy rooftop bars in the summer or relax in local cafés during winter—just be ready for the cold weather!

While the city is very creative, some areas have problems like increased crime rates, so it’s important to know which neighborhoods are safe. Public transportation is good, but you should think about how to travel late at night.

If you are planning to visit, it’s better to avoid winter if possible, and be sure to explore different neighborhoods to find the one you like best. Chicago is ready to show you its culture and welcoming people!
chicago.description_kor:
시카고는 활기가 넘치는 매력적인 도시입니다. 다양한 동네들이 모여 있어, 예술적인 매력이 가득한 윅커 파크와 로건 스퀘어부터 고급스러운 골드 코스트까지 다양한 풍경을 즐길 수 있습니다. 특히 시카고의 음식은 눈여겨볼 만합니다. 시카고 스타일의 딥 디쉬 피자와 다양한 국제 요리, 그리고 합리적인 가격에 높은 평가를 받은 레스토랑들이 즐비합니다.

박물관, 공원, 그리고 나이트라이프를 즐길 수 있는 곳이 많아 방문할 거리가 넘쳐납니다. 여름에는 루프탑 바에서 시원한 음료를 즐기고, 겨울에는 아늑한 카페에서 따뜻한 시간을 보내며 추위를 피할 수 있습니다. 단, 겨울은 꽤 춥기 때문에 미리 대비하는 것이 좋습니다.

시카고는 창의력이 넘치는 도시이지만, 일부 지역은 범죄율 증가와 같은 문제가 있으므로 안전한 동네를 파악하는 것이 중요합니다. 대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있지만, 늦은 시간에는 여행 방법을 미리 계획하는 것이 필요합니다.

방문 계획이 있다면 겨울은 가능한 한 피하는 것이 좋고, 다양한 동네를 탐험하며 자신에게 맞는 곳을 찾아보세요. 시카고는 풍부한 문화와 친절한 사람들을 만날 준비가 되어 있습니다!

reviews:
To be honest, as an English man with no use of Indo Bahasa, I've got no chance (like the last chance saloon) in finding an English speaking human..unless it Hiya, Hello, How are you, language is totally useless unless you know sign and body expressions! And that Works! Point to the food in the picture on the wall, have small cash in you pocket (and bigger cash stored away out of sight) You buy food in the picture and only get half of what you saw! Yer, It happens like Shx.all the time where ever you go! Locals are wise.. but expect it and order a double portion...Lol! 
 I am Tim Love from the UK and I have married an Indonesian beauty! We do not live together because the UK law makes it a terrible ordeal to fix...(ongoing issues) But, as I said... If you are WHITE.. then you must expect to be RIPPED OFF !
cirebon.description:
Cirebon, in Indonesia, is a city with many interesting things to see and do, but it has its own challenges. If you don’t speak Bahasa Indonesia, understanding the culture can be hard. A visitor from the UK had to use sign language to order food, which made for some amusing moments at local restaurants. Keep cash with you, but be aware that you might get less food than you thought—ordering a double portion could help satisfy your hunger!

The local culture is full of good street food that offers a taste of Cirebon’s dishes. Be ready for some small difficulties, like not many people speaking English, which can make talking harder.

Many people find the cost of living affordable, but foreigners sometimes pay more. In terms of safety, locals usually feel safe, but it’s best to stay alert to your surroundings.

For a great experience, engage with local customs, visit busy markets, and meet the friendly locals—just keep your expectations reasonable!
cirebon.description_kor:
인도네시아의 치레본은 볼거리와 즐길 거리가 풍부한 도시지만, 그만큼 도전 과제가 존재합니다. Bahasa Indonesia를 잘 못하면 문화에 대해 이해하는 데 어려움을 느낄 수 있습니다. 영국에서 온 한 방문자는 음식을 주문하기 위해 수화로 소통해야 했고, 이는 현지 식당에서 특별한 순간을 만들어 주었습니다. 현금을 준비하되, 주문한 것보다 적은 양의 음식을 받을 수도 있으니 주의하세요. 배고픔을 덜기 위해서는 두 배로 주문하는 것이 나쁘지 않을 수 있습니다!

치레본은 지역 문화를 체험할 수 있는 맛있는 길거리 음식으로 가득 차 있습니다. 영어를 잘 구사하지 못하는 사람도 많기 때문에 대화에 약간의 어려움이 있을 수 있다는 점, 미리 염두에 두는 것이 좋습니다.

대부분의 사람들은 생활비가 저렴하다고 느끼지만, 외국인은 가끔 더 많은 비용을 지불할 수도 있습니다. 안전에 관해서는 현지인들이 대체로 안전하다고 느끼지만, 주변을 잘 살피는 것이 중요합니다.

멋진 경험을 원하신다면, 지역 전통에 참여하고, 활기찬 시장을 방문하며, 친절한 현지인들과의 만남을 즐겨보세요—단, 기대하는 수준은 적당히 하시는 게 좋습니다!

reviews: Super chill city with nice architecture and fantastic cafes. Seems a little unexplored, and would be a great small hub if there was a nomad community here.

Terrible air quality, much worse than smaller cities in Romania (nearby Sibiu is much better). Also not that pretty and getting more expensive each year. Cluj only started to build proper public transportation 3 years ago which explains it, but overall I am quite underwhelmed I must say. I would not spend much time here.

I found Cluj to be a nice but fairly boring place to stay. There are a few coworkings that you can check out, but I would personally recommend Silicon Forest over ClujHub for a more personal experience.

It is an OK place for staying for a few months, however after a few months, you have seen everything and realize the place is just a small town with a few things to do but not that many. Restaurants are great and stuff but besides that not much going on.

Everybody was speaking so positive about Cluj so I tried it for 2 months there. In the end it was rather disappointing, the vibe of the city is somewhat uninspiring, even a bit depressing the longer you stay. The old town is cute with bars and restaurants, but after a few days there's nothing new to discover. Very ugly that there's to much car traffic for such a small city, there are literally cars everywhere. It might be a good choice for couples enjoying to live a traditional life, but for nomads or single guys there's not much to do there.

I've been a superhost for a digital nomad-friendly in Cluj for the last 2 years and I've seen a good number of nomads come and go. This city is more on the chill side as far as cities go but it is very lively. Cluj is regarded very highly from people in Romania and the vibe in the city is very nice. People are more conservative than average but they are extremely nice to foreigners.

Loved this city, mid-size, great food and coffee, decent architecture, and the friendliest and most welcoming people for hundreds of miles. ClujHub was a fantastic way to make friends with locals and other nomads. Only left to do COVID-19 situation

It's the kind of city where I'd stay and build a life if I wasn't a nomad. There are many nice bars and bistros and cafés, people is very nice and the city has a young vibe. I'd love to go back someday.

Pretty city but hard to meet nomads. 
Cluj Hub has good internet, air conditioning and a killer view from the balcony. Pricey by the day though.
cluj.description:
Cluj is a city where old buildings and a lively café culture are present. Travelers enjoy the good food and friendly locals, who are happy to share a smile and a story. There’s a young atmosphere with busy bars and small restaurants that serve both traditional Romanian food and modern dishes.

However, there are some downsides; the air quality can be poor, especially compared to smaller Romanian cities like Sibiu. The public transportation system is still improving, making it hard to get around. Some visitors think Cluj is less interesting after a few days, feeling a bit like a small town with few activities. If you're a digital nomad, coworking spaces like Silicon Forest provide a friendly atmosphere, but the city might feel a bit dull after a couple of months.

If you’re planning a trip, check out the old town, snack at the local cafes, and enjoy the slower pace. Just remember that meeting other nomads might be a bit difficult. Overall, Cluj is a relaxed place with some possibilities, but maybe not the best for long stays.
cluj.description_kor:
클루지는 오래된 건물과 활기찬 카페 문화가 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다. 여행자들은 이곳에서 맛있는 음식과 친절한 현지인들의 환대를 받으며, 미소를 나누고 이야기를 즐기는 경험을 할 수 있습니다. 젊은 분위기가 감도는 이곳에는 전통 루마니아 음식과 현대적인 요리를 모두 제공하는 아기자기한 작은 레스토랑과 바들이 많습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 단점도 존재합니다. 공기 질이 그리 좋지 않은 편이며, 특히 시비우와 같은 작은 도시와 비교했을 때 더 저조합니다. 대중교통 시스템은 꾸준히 개선되고 있지만, 이동이 불편할 수 있습니다. 일부 방문객들은 며칠 후 클루지가 흥미롭지 않게 느껴지고, 몇 가지 활동이 부족해 작은 마을 같은 인상을 받을 수도 있습니다. 디지털 노마드라면 실리콘 포레스트와 같은 coworking 공간이 따뜻한 분위기를 제공하지만, 몇 달이 지나면 도시가 다소 지루할 수도 있습니다.

여행을 계획하고 있다면 구시가지를 탐험하고, 현지 카페에서 간식을 즐기며 여유로운 시간을 가져보세요. 단, 다른 노마드들을 만나는 것이 조금 어려울 수 있다는 점을 염두에 두기 바랍니다. 총체적으로 클루지는 여러 가능성을 지닌 아늑한 장소이지만, 장기 체류하기에는 최적의 선택지는 아닐 것입니다.

reviews:
The food here is excellent. Bolivians call it food capital of the country. Food is also cheap.

Not a lot of variety, but it's good, and they care.

Otherwise, a nice city. But not a place for nomads as far as I can tell. Nobody speaks English
A lot to do, quite democratic, not expensive to live in and internet speed is great.
Internet speed in Cochabamba has improved dramatically in the past year or two. My download speed is 25mbps. Not great, but way better than the reported 3mbps.
cochabamba.description:
Cochabamba is known as the food capital of Bolivia, and once you try its tasty dishes, you will see why! The local food is not only good but also cheap, making it a great place for food lovers to eat without spending too much. While the choices may be a bit limited, the quality of each dish is clear.

Living in Cochabamba is quite nice; it's a friendly city. The cost of living is low, and you’ll notice that internet speed has gotten better recently, so you can stay online easily. Just a note: English is not commonly spoken, which may be hard for some visitors.

There are many activities to do, so you won't run out of things to see and experience. However, keep in mind that Cochabamba is not really known as a place for travelers. If you are willing to accept the local culture and customs, you will enjoy what this lively city has to offer!
cochabamba.description_kor:
코차밤바는 볼리비아의 음식 수도로 유명하며, 그 맛있는 요리를 한번 맛보면 왜 그런지 바로 알게 될 것입니다! 현지 음식은 맛이 뛰어날 뿐만 아니라 가격도 저렴해, 음식 애호가들이 큰 비용을 들이지 않고도 다양한 맛을 즐길 수 있는 최적의 장소입니다. 선택할 수 있는 메뉴는 다소 제한적일 수 있지만, 각 요리의 품질은 확실히 뛰어납니다.

코차밤바에서의 생활은 정말 좋습니다. 이곳은 아주 친근한 분위기를 자랑하는 도시입니다. 생활비도 저렴하고, 최근에는 인터넷 속도도 빨라져서 온라인 접속이 매우 용이해졌습니다. 다만 참고로 말씀드리자면, 영어 사용 빈도가 낮아서 일부 방문객들에게는 의사소통이 어려울 수 있습니다.

즐길 거리가 많아 다양한 활동과 경험이 넘치는 곳입니다. 그러나 코차밤바가 여행자들에게 가장 유명한 목적지는 아니라는 점은 기억해 두세요. 현지 문화와 관습을 받아들일 준비가 되어 있다면, 이 활기찬 도시가 선사하는 매력을 충분히 만끽할 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews:
One of the cheapest cities in Portugal to live, since it's basically an university town. It's definitely a gem, with not so many distractions and perfect to get the work done.

Coimbra has all the qualities of Portugal cities such as food, wine, safety, cultural events etc, everything quite low-cost oriented, specially accomodation -- you can find really good deals way cheaper than Lisbon or Porto. It's a bit tourist but not a trap. Great green spaces to relax, however it's a hill city and climbing up and down might be a con for those with reduced mobility.
coimbra.description:
If you are looking for a city that is a good mix of work and fun, Coimbra might be what you need. As a university town, it is one of the cheapest places to live in Portugal, making it great for students or anyone wanting to save money. With tasty food, good local wines, and many cultural events, Coimbra offers a lot of what Portuguese life has to offer without high costs.

You can enjoy its green spaces, but be ready for some hills! Whether you are walking through the old streets or visiting the University of Coimbra, the atmosphere is relaxed. Also, the low-cost places to stay are better than in bigger cities like Lisbon or Porto.

However, if you have trouble walking, the hilly area might be hard to manage. The city does have some tourists, but it is not very crowded. So, if you plan to visit, be ready for a real Portuguese experience with energy from students and historical sights!
coimbra.description_kor:
일과 여가의 완벽한 조화를 이룰 수 있는 도시를 찾고 계신다면 코임브라가 바로 그곳입니다. 코임브라는 포르투갈의 대학 도시로, 저렴한 생활비 덕분에 학생이나 경제적인 부담을 줄이고 싶은 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 맛있는 음식, 훌륭한 지역 와인, 다양한 문화 행사들이 넘쳐나 코임브라에서 포르투갈의 매력을 높은 비용 없이 만끽할 수 있습니다.

녹지 공간이 많아 여유를 즐길 수 있지만, 언덕이 많다는 점은 유념해야 합니다. 오래된 거리를 거닐거나 코임브라 대학교를 방문할 때 느껴지는 편안한 분위기는 특별한 경험이 될 것입니다. 또한, 저렴한 숙소는 리스본이나 포르투 같은 대도시보다 더 나은 선택입니다.

하지만 걷는 데 불편함이 있다면 언덕이 있는 지역은 다소 힘들 수 있습니다. 관광객이 있긴 하지만, 많지는 않아서 여유롭게 구경할 수 있습니다. 따라서 코임브라를 방문할 계획이시라면, 학생들의 활기와 역사적인 명소가 어우러진 진정한 포르투갈 경험을 만끽할 준비를 해보세요!

reviews:
Although I would not praise Cologne as the top destination for digital nomads I have certain doubts about some negative aspects listed here. 

Hospitals: How can hospitals be pretty bad if Germany has one of the best medical systems in the world? This judgments compares it with remote 3rd world cities which is by definition not logical. Germany, and therefore also Cologne, has most likely the best emergency system in the world (ambulance must arrive within max. 12 minutes - independent of traffic) and no one will ask "who pays" when you have a serious illness/accident. Doctors have a high education as well (you have to be part of the top 5% of high school to enter a medical study).

Cold in winter: Well, it is not a tropical country. However, snow is rarely. Temperature during days drops below zero on maximum 20 days a year. Surely it is not the most sunny place on earth, but "very cold" is definitely elsewhere.

Friends: Cologne is the city of carnival. From November to February you will find parties every day and meet people. Surely, friends are made elsewhere, but at least you will not be alone drinking your Kölsch at the bar. "Bar talks" with strangers are common. Share your number and see what happens. Besides this, Cologne has a tradition of clubs (football club, tennis club, carnival club...). If you want to find friends, you must integrate and do such things as well. Then you find plenty of cool people. Just break the ice.
cologne.description:
Cologne is a city that many people enjoy, especially if you like lively social events and cultural activities. The city is famous for its carnival season, which takes place from November to February, with many parties—great for making new friends and having a Kölsch (the local beer) in a bar. The locals are friendly and often start conversations, so feel free to chat!

Winter can be a little cold, but it's not too bad, and snow is not very common. When it comes to healthcare, you will be well taken care of, as Germany has one of the best medical systems in the world, and Cologne is included in that. Public transport is generally good, but it might be difficult to travel outside the city without a car.

However, if you are looking for a busy digital nomad community, you might feel a bit alone. The cost of living can be high in some neighborhoods, but places like Ehrenfeld or Belgisches Viertel have a good balance of culture and lower prices. Be sure to follow the local customs, and you will enjoy your time in Cologne!
cologne.description_kor:
코엘른은 폐허의 문을 지키고 있는 매력 넘치는 도시로 많은 사람들에게 사랑받고 있습니다. 활기찬 사회적 이벤트와 문화 활동을 즐기는 이들에게 특히 매력적이며, 이 도시는 11월부터 2월까지 열리는 카니발 시즌으로 유명합니다. 이 시기에는 다양한 파티가 열리며 새로운 친구를 사귀고, 바에서 현지 맥주인 쾰쉬를 즐기기에 최적의 장소입니다. 현지 주민들도 친절하고 대화를 잘 이끌어 내니, 마음껏 이야기를 나눠보세요!

겨울에는 날씨가 다소 쌀쌀할 수 있지만, 그렇게 추운 편은 아니며 눈도 자주 내리지 않습니다. 의료 서비스에 대해선 독일이 세계적으로 우수한 시스템을 갖추고 있어 안심하셔도 좋습니다. 코엘른도 이러한 혜택을 누릴 수 있는 도시입니다. 대중교통은 전반적으로 잘 갖춰져 있지만, 자동차 없이 도시 외곽으로 여행하기는 다소 어려울 수 있습니다.

디지털 노마드 커뮤니티가 활발한 곳을 원하신다면, 다소 외로움을 느낄 수도 있습니다. 일부 지역에서는 생활비가 높을 수 있지만, 에렌펠트나 벨기에 지구와 같은 곳은 문화와 저렴한 가격이 잘 어우러져 있습니다. 현지 문화를 잘 따르신다면, 코엘른에서 멋진 시간을 보내실 수 있을 겁니다!

reviews:
Sri Lanka is not ready for tourism. Besides scams and "cartel prices" for tuktuks and other services, it is unsafe for women. Men catcalling, touching, and groping are the norm. Moreover, it is not cheap at all compared to other countries in South/Southeast Asia. Especially when landlords tend to increase rental prices once they learn you're a good tenant.
Locals may appear friendly, but the reality often differs. As a patriarchal society, instances of domestic violence against girlfriends and wives are unfortunately not uncommon. Additionally, certain tourism-related businesses, such as surf schools, may be controlled by gangs. After 5 months in the country, I can say: don't go.

Colombo is okay. It's definitely challenging compared to other cities in the world. It's not convenient. Finding good restaurants is difficult, and the food and drinks are a hit or miss. You'll find better food in the south of Sri Lanka.

Everyone will try to scam and overcharge you for everything.

Tuktuks are incredibly cheap, so you don't need to walk. 100 rupees per 1km. They have an app called Pick Me, but it's not your usual Uber. After it finds a driver, the driver will usually call you and ask where you are going (? the app doesn't show the location for them) and how much you'll pay (?). Most of the time, they won't move, so you have to cancel the ride and find another driver (thankfully, they don't charge for canceling rides).

Also, tuk-tuks have local gangs/cartels and won't let Pick Me drivers pick you up there, so you have to walk a bit far from where the tuk-tuks are parked; otherwise, the app drivers will be terrified of them - I've seen them argue and threat the Pick Me drivers.

Sri Lanka is a beautiful country with great surf. But it is very expensive and the wifi is atrocious. It is not a digital nomad's destination. Was very surprised by the cost of food Western and Sri Lankan. There are MUCH cheaper & better options in Japan or Korea! Of course, they have just suffered from a financial melt down and so anything imported is very expensive. I am an Aussie and its is a very expensive place to live. The prices charged in Sri Lanka to eat out are equal (or more!) than those in Oz. Had a simple breakfast in a pretty ordinary cafe the other day and two coffees and a simple breakfast was 30 USD! I have been here a couple of months and have an Aussie-Sri Lankan mate that has done the very best to introduce me to the best Sri Lankan street food which basically consists of overcooked curries and rice for around 12 USD. After 20 years of living on & off in Chiang Mai, it does come as a bit of a shock. The one thing though that is absolutely fantastic are the Sri Lankan people who are absolute sweethearts. And did I mention the killer surf?

Sri Lanka is a great country to visit and explore on vacation, but it is not good for nomading.
The internet is the worst I've experienced in 3 years of travelling around SE Asia. Usually I would supplement terrible wifi with mobile data but I found this also terrible. I visited several places in Sri Lanka, including supposedly up-and-coming nomad destination Welligama. There are very few cafes that are fit for working (almost none with AC/power), Western food is expensive (and so is Sri Lankan food if you're in an area that is suitable for working online), and most of the accommodation is quite expensive if you want high standards. Definitely visit this beautiful country with it's friendly local people, but don't expect to be productive here.
colombo.description:
Colombo, the busy capital of Sri Lanka, has both good and bad aspects that leave many travelers unsure. On one side, the friendly locals and nice surf spots keep people coming back. The beaches are lovely and great for surfing, but if you want good food, you may need to look around. Many have found eating out expensive, with simple meals sometimes costing more than in cheaper countries.

Getting around can be interesting too, especially with tuk-tuks. While they are cheap and enjoyable, using apps like Pick Me can be challenging—drivers often need to call for directions, and dealing with local groups can feel like a game.

Safety is a serious issue, especially for women. There are times of catcalling and unwanted attention that you should be careful about. Public transportation is limited and can be uncomfortable, so be ready to find your way carefully.

Colombo has a unique culture and strong local traditions, but it’s important to be aware of the downsides. It’s a place to visit, just stay alert and plan ahead!
colombo.description_kor:
콜롬보는 스리랑카의 바쁜 수도로, 여러 면에서 여행자들에게 혼란을 줄 수 있는 매력과 단점이 공존하는 곳입니다. 친절한 현지인들과 훌륭한 서핑 스폿이 사람들을 끌어들이는 반면, 해변은 아름답고 서핑하기에 최적이지만, 맛있는 음식을 찾아보려면 주변을 잘 살펴봐야 할 수도 있습니다. 많은 사람들은 외식 비용이 비싸다고 느끼며, 간단한 식사조차도 다른 저렴한 나라들보다 비쌀 수 있다는 것을 발견했습니다.

교통수단도 흥미로운 점이 많은데, 특히 유명한 툭툭(tuk-tuk) 덕분입니다. 툭툭은 저렴하고 즐겁게 탈 수 있지만, Pick Me와 같은 앱을 사용하는 것이 어려울 수 있습니다. 운전사들이 방향을 묻기 위해 전화를 해야 하는 경우가 흔하고, 현지인들과의 소통이 마치 게임처럼 느껴질 수도 있습니다.

여성에게는 안전 문제가 심각한 타이틀로 다가올 수 있습니다. 가벼운 희롱이나 원치 않는 주목을 받을 수 있는 상황이 있으니 주의가 필요합니다. 대중교통 역시 제한적이고 불편할 수 있으니, 길찾기를 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다.

콜롬보는 독특한 문화와 강한 지역 전통이 있지만, 그 단점도 알고 가는 것이 중요합니다. 방문할 가치가 있지만 항상 경계를 유지하고 사전에 계획하는 것이 필요합니다!

reviews: Great place if you like to connect with nature and prefer to live in a small city. People are very nice, I felt very welcomed as a latino and intertwined a lot with locals. Good restaurants. Nightlife is lame.

Big city with a small town feel. Quite spread out, not a very dense population, besides downtown. Lots of military presence. Tons of great places to eat/drink/get coffee, and countless amazing small businesses. Lots to do outdoors, not as much nightlife. Residents are generally very hardworking and friendly. It's a great place to visit, especially if you have time for some of the more "hidden" attractions. The tourist traps are great too, but there's much more to the city if you know where to look.
colorado-springs.description:
Colorado Springs is a nice place for nature lovers and people who like small towns. There are beautiful mountains and many outdoor activities nearby—hiking, biking, and exploring are part of everyday life here. Residents are friendly, making it easy for newcomers to feel at home.

The city is relaxed and welcoming, but the nightlife is a bit quiet, so don’t expect a lively party scene. While Colorado Springs doesn't have much nightlife, it has many cozy restaurants and a strong small business community. The local food options are worth checking out.

Keep in mind that the city is spread out, so having a car will help you get around. Some neighborhoods are more appealing than others, so feel free to ask locals for their suggestions. Overall, Colorado Springs provides a calm lifestyle with some opportunities for adventure!
colorado-springs.description_kor:
콜로라도 스프링스는 자연을 사랑하고 아늑한 작은 도시를 선호하는 이들에게 아주 좋은 곳입니다. 아름다운 산들이 가까이 있어 하이킹, 자전거 타기, 탐험 같은 야외 활동이 일상적이며, 주민들도 매우 친절해 새로운 사람들도 금방 편안하게 느낄 수 있습니다.

이 도시는 전체적으로 편안하고 환영하는 분위기지만, 밤문화는 상대적으로 조용하니 활기찬 파티를 기대하기에는 다소 아쉬운 점이 있습니다. 콜로라도 스프링스에는 많은 나이트라이프 옵션이 없지만 아늑한 레스토랑들이 많이 있어 맛있는 식사를 즐길 수 있으며, 강력한 소상공인 커뮤니티가 지역에서 활발하게 활동하고 있습니다. 지역 음식을 경험해 볼 가치가 충분합니다.

또한, 이 도시는 넓어서 자동차로 이동하는 것이 매우 편리합니다. 어떤 동네는 다른 동네보다 더 매력적일 수 있으니, 현지 주민들에게 추천을 물어보는 것도 좋은 방법입니다. 전반적으로 콜로라도 스프링스는 모험의 기회를 제공하는 차분한 라이프스타일을 누릴 수 있는 곳입니다!

reviews: In summer prices go up like crazy! Mamaia rentals are as high as New York in summer months because rich Bucharest spend their money there. Mamaia beach is beautiful but very crowded.
Gets expensive in the summer season

The old casino is really nice but the beaches are not, ugly buildings facing the sea. And not a lot of things to do when i went in september (2018). In the summer Mamaia is much more animated if you like this kind of stuff.
Great internet, nice beaches and lots to do during the summer. During winter it can be a bit more lonely but some might enjoy the lack of crowds and the beach all to themselves.
constanta.description:
Constanța is a busy place on Romania's Black Sea coast, especially during the summer. When the weather gets warm, prices go up, especially in Mamaia, which can be as costly as New York City. If you want a lively beach, Mamaia has nice sands, but expect lots of people in the busy season.

While Mamaia is active in the summer, some visitors find the rest of Constanța quieter in the off-season. The old casino is interesting, even if the nearby buildings aren't very nice. Beach lovers will enjoy good internet and summer activities, but after September, it may feel a bit empty with fewer events.

Public transportation may not be very good, so it’s a good idea to walk or rent a bike to get around. Language can be a problem, but local people are usually nice. If you want a mix of activity and peace, Constanța is a good place to visit!
constanta.description_kor:
콘스탄차는 루마니아 블랙해 연안에 위치한 활기찬 도시로, 특히 여름철에 많은 관광객들로 붐빕니다. 날씨가 따뜻해지면 가격 상승이 발생하는데, 특히 마마이아의 경우 뉴욕시 못지않은 비싼 숙소 가격을 자랑합니다. 만약 활기 넘치는 해변을 원하신다면 마마이아는 훌륭한 모래사장을 가지고 있지만, 성수기에는 많은 인파를 각오해야 합니다.

마마이아는 여름 동안 활기를 띠지만, 비수기에는 콘스탄차의 다른 지역들이 좀 더 조용하다는 느낌을 받을 수도 있습니다. 오래된 카지노는 흥미로운 볼거리지만, 주변의 건물들은 그리 매력적이지는 않습니다. 해변을 즐기는 여행객들은 좋은 인터넷 환경과 다양한 여름 활동을 누릴 수 있지만, 9월 이후에는 이벤트가 줄어들면서 다소 썰렁한 느낌을 받을 수 있습니다.

대중교통이 불편할 수 있으니 걷거나 자전거를 빌려 이동하는 것이 좋은 방법입니다. 언어 소통이 다소 어렵긴 하지만, 지역 주민들은 보통 친절합니다. 다양한 활동과 평화를 동시에 원하는 분들께는 콘스탄차가 정말 좋은 여행지가 될 것입니다!

reviews: Córdoba is a city with a convenient size to explore and live in. They also have a Digital Nomads Program that offers free coworking places, accommodation and gastronomy discounts, and a cycle of activities to meet locals and other nomads.
cordoba.description:
Córdoba is a special place in Argentina that combines a small city feel with city life. Many visitors appreciate its size, making it easy to walk or bike around. The city has a friendly atmosphere, and if you're lucky, you might find one of the local festivals that highlight its culture and history.

One interesting thing about Córdoba is its Digital Nomads Program. This program provides free coworking spaces, discounts on places to stay and food, and fun activities to meet locals and other travelers.

However, like any city, it has some challenges. Some people might find the public transportation a bit limited, and while many locals understand basic English, knowing some Spanish can really help you connect better.

To experience Córdoba, be sure to visit the historic Jesuit Block and try some tasty empanadas at a local restaurant. Whether you want to work or explore, Córdoba has a lot to offer!
cordoba.description_kor:
코르도바는 아르헨티나에서 작은 도시의 아늑함과 도시 생활이 조화를 이루는 특별한 장소입니다. 많은 방문객들은 코르도바의 크기를 좋아해 쉽게 걸어다니거나 자전거를 탈 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 친근한 분위기를 지니고 있으며, 운이 좋다면 지역 문화와 역사를 살펴볼 수 있는 다양한 축제를 경험할 수 있습니다.

코르도바에서 특히 흥미로운 점은 디지털 노마드 프로그램입니다. 이 프로그램은 무료 공동 작업 공간과 숙소, 식사 할인뿐만 아니라, 지역 주민들과 다른 여행자들과의 만남을 위한 재미있는 활동들도 제공합니다.

하지만 모든 도시와 마찬가지로 몇 가지 도전 과제가 존재합니다. 일부 사람들은 대중교통이 다소 불편하다고 느낄 수 있으며, 많은 지역 주민들이 기본적인 영어를 이해하지만 스페인어를 조금만 알아도 더 원활한 소통이 가능합니다.

코르도바를 방문하면서는 역사적인 예수회 블록을 꼭 들러보고, 지역 레스토랑에서 맛있는 엠파나다를 시도해보세요. 일이나 탐험 어떤 것이든, 코르도바는 여러분에게 많은 즐거움을 선사할 것입니다!

reviews: It can be hard to get a medium-term rental. Rentals are expensive for little amenities in comparison to other places around Mexico. There are some cafes with good internet but, no coworking spaces.

Cozumel for me is a dream digital nomad location. The internet is flawless. The adventures to be had when not online with clients are many and varied. It is clean, serene, and safe. Its international Airport allows access to the whole world, and, you can walk to it! The cost of living can range from $ 1000 per month to _______________whatever your heart desires.

I liked it.
I stayed in middle of city at tamaindo b&b.
I went all over island on scooter .

It’s a lot less crazy than playa del Carmen .
cozumel.description:
Cozumel is a nice island in Mexico waiting for you. This island is good for those looking for a relaxing atmosphere. The environment is clean, calm, and safe, making it a good place for both working and having fun. If you want to work remotely, the internet is strong, but finding medium-term rentals can be hard and expensive.

Adventure is right outside your door! You can ride scooters and explore the island’s beaches and coral reefs when you are not working. There are some nice cafes with good Wi-Fi, but you might not find many coworking spaces. The cost of living can change a lot, so you can find options that fit different budgets.

Cozumel is quieter than nearby Playa del Carmen, but there are still many things to do. Be ready for some language challenges if you don’t speak Spanish, and remember that rentals may not have all the features you expect. Overall, this island has its own charm!
cozumel.description_kor:
코수멜은 여러분을 기다리는 멕시코의 아름다운 섬입니다. 이곳은 편안한 분위기를 찾는 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 환경이 깨끗하고 차분하며 안전하여 일과 여가를 동시에 즐기기에 적합한 장소입니다. 원격 근무를 원하신다면 강력한 인터넷이 있지만 중기 렌탈을 찾는 것은 어려울 수 있고, 비용이 다소 비쌀 수 있습니다.

모험은 바로 당신의 문 앞에 있습니다! 일이 없는 날에는 스쿠터를 타고 섬의 아름다운 해변과 산호초를 탐험해 보세요. 좋은 와이파이가 있는 멋진 카페들도 몇 군데 있지만, 코워킹 스페이스는 찾기 어려울 수 있습니다. 생활비는 지역에 따라 차이가 날 수 있으니 다양한 예산에 맞는 옵션을 고려해 보세요.

코수멜은 가까운 플라야 델 카르멘보다 조용하지만 여전히 많은 즐길 거리가 있습니다. 스페인어에 자신이 없으시다면 언어 장벽도 염두에 두세요. 또한 렌탈이 기대하는 모든 기능을 갖추고 있지 않을 수도 있다는 점을 잊지 마세요. 전반적으로 이 섬은 그 자체로 매력적인 곳입니다!

reviews: Another over-hyped place in Portugal, it got expensive, really crowded, and messy, especially in the summer. Instagram people did their job

I spent a month in Caparica and I really loved my time there. The vibe is amazing, the community was growing by that time and it was already very good and welcoming, I felt welcomed and part of something :) Dr. Bernard was one of my favorite spots and their surf classes were suuuuuper great, amazing surf teachers with a really nice vibe. Also, the food is amazing all around Caparica with a lot of options. Really looking forward to go back and spend more time in Caparica with the amazing community :)

I loved the community, surf classes for less than 20 euros and chilled surf vibes. 
There's a local Discord channel managed by a local association, just google "Digital Nomads Caparica". 
Dr Bernard is the place to work, Koa café the best food and there's daily events.
costa-da-caparica.description:
Costa da Caparica is a lively coastal place that is winning over many people with its relaxed atmosphere and growing community spirit. If you visit in summer, expect many visitors, as it has become popular for its beautiful beaches and surfing culture. Many people enjoy the friendly environment, with welcoming locals and a feeling of community that makes it hard to leave. Surf classes at places like Dr. Bernard are very affordable and are highly recommended—good teachers and a nice atmosphere mean you’ll be riding waves soon!

The food scene here is a nice mix, with Koa café being a local favorite for tasty meals. Look out for daily events and join the local Discord channel to connect with others and get involved in the community.

However, it’s not always perfect; it can get expensive, especially in high season. Public transport may not always be easy to use, so be ready to walk. Overall, whether you’re surfing or relaxing with locals, Costa da Caparica has a special atmosphere that is hard to ignore!
costa-da-caparica.description_kor:
코스타 다 카파리카는 편안한 분위기와 성장하는 공동체 정신 덕분에 많은 사람들의 마음을 사로잡고 있는 활기찬 해안 지역입니다. 여름에 방문하신다면 아름다운 해변과 서핑 문화 덕분에 많은 관광객들을 만나게 될 거예요. 많은 이들이 따뜻한 환경에서 현지인들의 환대를 받으며, 떠나기 힘든 공동체의 따뜻함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 특히 Dr. Bernard와 같은 곳에서의 서핑 수업은 가격도 저렴하고 강력히 추천드립니다. 훌륭한 강사와 함께 즐거운 분위기 속에서 금방 파도를 탈 수 있을 거예요!

이곳의 음식 문화는 다양하고 훌륭합니다. Koa 카페는 맛있는 음식을 제공하는 지역 주민들에게 사랑받는 핫플레이스입니다. 매일 열리는 다양한 이벤트를 찾아보고, 지역 Discord 채널에 가입해서 다른 사람들과 소통하며 공동체에 참여해 보세요.

하지만 항상 완벽한 건 아니죠. 특히 성수기에는 비용이 다소 비쌀 수 있습니다. 또한 대중교통이 항상 편리한 건 아니니, 걷는 것도 준비해야 합니다. 전반적으로 서핑을 즐기거나 현지 주민들과 느긋하게 시간을 보내든, 코스타 다 카파리카는 정말 특별한 분위기를 간직하고 있어 쉽게 잊을 수 없는 곳입니다!

reviews: I really enjoyed my month in Cuenca, but mostly because I wanted a chill place to focus on work and practice my Spanish. there isn't much to do, but it's very clean and safe and there's music everywhere. beautiful churches, people are very friendly (although very little English is spoke) and it's ridiculously cheap. they use the USD as official currency and it was easy to find a huge, hearty, multi-course lunch for $2.25. no joke. there are ice cream and pastry shops every few feet it seems. the park in the center of the city (Parque Calderon) is a nice place to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. not many gringos, although there is a decent population of american retirees. there's one street (Calle Larga) which has a few bars and restaurants that cater to americans and there are some touristy places around the park, but my advice is to avoid these and wander a few blocks away from the park for good, authentic, local food. one of my favorite dishes is a seafood and onion stew called encebolloado which is fantastic and costs about $5. the Airbnb I stayed is had 100mps internet which was great. the National Park (Cajas) is beautiful. I strongly recommend a guided tour (about $75) because the trails aren't marked well and the guides are full of useful and interesting information. be prepared though, Cuenca is 2500m (8000 feet) up and Cajas is 4000m (13000 feet) up so you'll definitely feel the altitude. I stupidly went on the hike less than a week after I arrived and it was brutal. I'd wait until you have more time to acclimate to the height.

A beautiful colonial medium size city in the mountains of Ecuador. Currently here in Dec and the highs are 70, lows are 45. Beautiful temperate weather all the way around. 
Pros:
- walkable with great outdoor fitness
- diverse and high quality F&B scene. Great cocktails @ Madame
- good coffee culture and cafes. 
- internet is fine. It’s stable. Not 1gb speed but not slow. 
- lots of history and the city has some beautiful parts 
- safe
Cons:
- smaller city. It isn’t a major metropolis. 
- if you’re looking to party, Cuenca is a bit quite. There’s night life but it’s pretty chill.

It gets chilly at night and most places don't have a heater, so pack some extra thick socks!

Felt quite safe compared to other latinAm countries. This had a safer vibe than Guayaquil and all was very affordable. People are friendly. Went to the zoo, spa, a few hiking trails and such but otherwise not much to do. Great if you wanna hunker down for a few months and live cheaply in a quieter part of Ecuador.
cuenca.description:
Cuenca is a nice place in the mountains of Ecuador, good for those looking for a relaxed atmosphere. With its colonial buildings and friendly people, you will quickly like the city. The streets are clean and safe, making it easy to walk around and enjoy the lively feel, especially near Parque Calderon, where you can take it all in.

Food lovers will be happy to find that meals are very cheap—like a full lunch for just $2.25! Be sure to try local dishes like encebollado, a tasty seafood stew. If you like sweets, there are ice cream and pastry shops everywhere.

On the downside, if you want a busy nightlife, Cuenca may not be the best choice, as it is more relaxed. English is not commonly spoken, so knowing some Spanish can be useful. Public transportation is limited, but the city is easy to walk around.

If you want some adventure, a guided tour of the beautiful Cajas National Park is a must—just be ready for the high altitude. Overall, Cuenca is a nice place for those who want to enjoy its culture and beautiful nature!
cuenca.description_kor:
쿠엔카는 에콰도르의 산속에 위치한 아름다운 도시로, 편안한 분위기를 원하는 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 식민지 시대의 건축물과 따뜻한 사람들 덕분에 이곳에 금세 매료될 것입니다. 거리는 깨끗하고 안전하여 여기저기 돌아다니며 활기찬 느낌을 만끽하기 좋고, 특히 칼데론 공원 근처에서는 그 매력이 더욱 돋보입니다.

음식 애호가라면 이곳에서 식사가 매우 저렴하다는 점에 기뻐할 것입니다. 맛있는 해산물 스튜인 엔세볼라도가 포함된 점심 한 끼가 단 2.25달러밖에 안 합니다! 또한, 단 것을 좋아하시는 분들을 위해 아이스크림과 패스트리가게도 곳곳에 있어 다양한 선택을 즐길 수 있습니다.

하지만 만약 활기찬 밤문화를 원하신다면, 쿠엔카는 최선의 선택은 아닐 수 있습니다. 이곳은 좀 더 차분한 분위기가 특징이기 때문입니다. 또한, 영어 사용이 일반적이지 않아서 스페인어를 조금 아는 것이 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 다소 제한적이지만, 도시는 충분히 걸어 다닐 수 있어 편리합니다.

모험을 원하신다면 아름다운 카하스 국립공원에서 가이드 투어를 경험해 보세요. 단, 고산지대에 대한 준비는 필요합니다. 전반적으로 쿠엔카는 그 문화와 아름다운 자연을 즐기고 싶은 분들에게 아주 좋은 여행지입니다!

reviews: Nice and clean modern city. Nothing about it fitted my preconceptions I had as a European about Brazil: I though it'd be dangerous with favelas everywhere. Of course this is South Brazil so it's rich and very different than the North. Curitiba feels more like a Western European city than anything. It can get quite cold in the winter (which is June/July/Aug for Europeans). It has great public transport, and apparently is known for its modern urban planning that grew it from a small town in the 1950s to almost 2 million people now. People are friendly, and service is nice, especially if you try speak a bit of Portuguese. People in Curitiba generally are known to be a bit more stuck up / arrogant than rest of Brazil, but to me they felt quite friendly. Then again anyone is friendly if you're used to service in Lisbon.

Very nice and underrated city. Many parks, and things to do. The best neighborhoods are Centro (near Shopping Estacao) and Batel (near Praca Japao). You can do everything on foot. Everything is cheap by European standards. The nightlife is very good, Latin America standard. Women are beautiful. Security is okay in these neighborhoods, but be aware. English speaking is only possible with young people or some adults. The weather is good and comfortable in the fall. One of my favorite cities in Brazil, I recommend it.
curitiba.description:
Curitiba, in southern Brazil, surprises many with its modern feel and clean streets. It combines Brazilian qualities with Western European style. Visitors often say it is different from what they expected of Brazil, with well-planned urban areas that make it a busy city of nearly 2 million people.

One of its key features is the good public transport system, which makes it easy to get around. There are many parks and open areas, great for walking or having a picnic. Centro, near Shopping Estação, and Batel, close to Praça Japão, are popular neighborhoods to stay in; both are lively and easy to navigate on foot.

Keep in mind the language. While younger locals might speak some English, knowing a bit of Portuguese can be helpful. Winter can be cold, so dress warmly! Safety in busy areas is usually good, but it's smart to stay alert. The nightlife is active, with many locals ready to enjoy themselves. If you want an overlooked destination, Curitiba might become one of your new favorite cities!
curitiba.description_kor:
브라질 남부의 꾸리치바(Curitiba)는 현대적인 분위기와 깨끗한 거리로 많은 사람들을 매료시키고 있습니다. 이 도시는 브라질의 독특한 매력과 서유럽 스타일을 조화롭게 결합하고 있습니다. 방문객들은 종종 꾸리치바가 자신이 생각했던 브라질과는 정말 다르다는 이야기를 하며, 인구 약 200만 명이 사는 이 활기찬 도시는 잘 계획된 도시 공간을 자랑합니다.

꾸리치바의 가장 큰 장점 중 하나는 훌륭한 대중교통 시스템으로, 이동이 매우 편리합니다. 많은 공원과 열린 공간들이 있어 산책이나 소풍에도 안성맞춤입니다. 쇼핑 에스타상(Shopping Estação) 근처의 센트로(Centro) 지역과 프라ça 자판(Praça Japão) 근처의 바텔(Batel) 지역은 숙박하기에 인기 있는 동네로, 두 곳 모두 활기차고 도보로 관광하기에도 좋습니다.

여행할 때 언어에도 유의해야 합니다. 젊은 현지인들이 조금 영어를 구사할 수는 있지만, 포르투갈어를 조금이라도 배우면 도움이 될 것입니다. 겨울철에는 날씨가 춥기 때문에 따뜻하게 입는 것이 좋습니다! 바쁜 지역의 치안은 대체로 양호하지만, 항상 조심하는 것이 현명합니다. 꾸리치바의 밤문화는 매우 활발하며 현지인들도 즐길 준비가 되어 있습니다. 새로운 여행지를 찾고 계신다면, 꾸리치바가 여러분의 새로운 사랑스러운 도시가 될 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: Very bad place to visit right now. The country is in a time of political and civil unrest, with mass protests closing down airports, train stations, and roads since early December 2022 (it is now mid January 2023). Tourists have had to be evacuated. The train to Machu Picchu is indefinitely closed until further notice. 48 people have died in the conflicts so far. Peru, and Cusco in particular, is a beautiful place with amazing things to see - but right now is not the time to visit.

Famous city, the historical capital and crown jewel of Peru. While the food does not compare to what is available in Lima, man the hiking opportunities are above and beyond. The boleto touristica is fantastic, for around $50 USD you get access to 11 archeological sites (all worth it), a cultural show (worth it), and 4 museums (I did not go). You have the option of hiring a tour guide, who will arrange transport and lunch for around 15-50 USD depending who you go with, but I decided to go it alone via collectivos and buses. Beware for newcomers: there are no bus schedules on google maps, government sites, or even the bus stop sign. It's all by word of mouth. For the ruins specifically, look for the "Terminal de Buses Urcos" and the "Pavitos Colectictivo A Ollantaytambo" on google maps. These buses will go to or near the ruins on the ticket, for Moray you will need to take another collectivo from Moras.

Cafes in the Centro Historico can be hit or miss regarding wifi. Some have amazing wifi (50mbps) but do not want you to charge laptops there (Dwasi) others are setup as a great place to work from but with just 10mbps wifi (Cafe Panam).

If it's your first time traveling to Cusco the Centro Historico is a great place to be, but do be prepared for a lot of tourists and their results (higher prices for tourists than locals, it's why prices are not posted at convenience stores. 2.5L water should be around 3 soles, not 11 or even 7 like my first seller tried to sell me on; lots of street sellers asking if you would like a shoe shine, massage, some paintings or failing that, weed.) If you go just 2-3 blocks outside the historic center you will see the "real" Cusco, with crowds and crowds of people browsing street sellers selling fruits, vegetables, meat, trinkets, electronics. I did not see many people living on the street, which is great, but the housing conditions are not the best (many unfinished apartments with roofs or windows missing, some houses with metal plates for roofs, and so on). 

Overall I do recommend staying at least a month in Cusco, especially if you are planning on doing one of the many hikes to Machu Picchu (allowed with tour guide only) and the boleto touristica (tour guide or alone). It's a safe city with spots of good and bad wifi, terrific opportunities for adventures, and a very practical people.
cusco.description:
Cusco is a city with a lot of history, beautiful views, and lively culture. Located in the Andes, it is known as Peru's historical capital and offers great hiking opportunities, especially for those who want to visit Machu Picchu. However, it is important to know that the city is currently dealing with political and civil unrest, with protests affecting transportation and tourist activities, so it may not be the best time to go.

The busy Centro Historico is a good first stop, filled with cafés and street vendors. Just be aware that prices can be higher for tourists. If you walk a few blocks away from the tourist areas, you can see local life, including busy markets. Getting around can be difficult, as bus schedules are often unreliable. It is a good idea to ask locals for help; they are usually friendly and helpful.

While locals enjoy good food at reasonable prices, it may not be the same as what you find in Lima. If you are interested, you can buy the boleto turistico, which gives you access to many archaeological sites and cultural experiences. Just keep an eye out for vendors and know that the city's Wi-Fi can be inconsistent. Overall, Cusco can offer a great experience if you are ready for an adventure and some challenges!
cusco.description_kor:
쿠스코는 풍부한 역사와 아름다운 경치, 그리고 활기찬 문화를 지닌 도시입니다. 안데스 산맥에 자리 잡고 있는 이곳은 페루의 역사적 수도로 유명하며, 특히 마추픽추를 방문하는 이들에게 훌륭한 하이킹 코스를 제공합니다. 하지만 현재 시위와 정치적 불안정으로 인해 교통과 관광 활동에 영향을 미치는 상황이므로, 지금은 여행하기에 최적의 시기가 아닐 수도 있습니다.

번화한 센트로 히스토리코는 첫 번째 방문지로 매우 좋은 곳이며, 카페와 길거리 상인들로 가득 찹니다. 관광객을 대상으로 하는 가격이 높을 수 있으니 유의하세요. 관광지에서 몇 블록 떨어진 곳으로 걸어가면, 붐비는 시장을 포함한 지역 주민들의 일상적인 삶을 엿볼 수 있습니다. 교통은 다소 불편할 수 있는데, 버스 시간표가 자주 변화하기 때문입니다. 이럴 때는 지역 주민에게 도움을 요청하는 것이 좋으며, 그들은 대개 친절하게 안내해 줄 것입니다.

지역 주민들은 합리적인 가격에 맛있는 음식을 즐기지만, 리마에서의 식사와는 조금 다를 수 있습니다. 관심이 있다면, 여러 고고학 유적지와 문화 체험을 즐길 수 있는 보레토 투리스티코(boletos turísticos)를 구입하는 것도 좋습니다. 상인들을 잘 살펴보고, 도시의 Wi-Fi가 일관되지 않을 수 있다는 점도 염두에 두세요. 전반적으로 쿠스코는 모험과 도전을 준비한 여행객에게 멋진 경험을 선사할 수 있는 장소입니다!

reviews: Da Lat is not a great place. I came here for fresh air (after 1 year in Chiang Mai) but unfortunately that is an illusion. They are burning in the mountains and you can see the smoke going up to the sky. And in the city it is not much better, the air is very much polluted there as well. I tried many restaurants but mostly the food is not very good and the service is depressingly bad. Combine that with the rubbish you see everywhere (especially around the center) and Da Lat makes not a happy place.

Perfect temperatures, fantastic coffee scene, rather relaxed mid-sized town atmosphere. As of late 2018 it's still not crowded with tourists or expats so it's retained authenticity. That said, the small expat community is very friendly and relatively close-knit. Moreover, great waterfalls and a few decent mountain hikes around the city.

On the downside: the night life is about non-existent and the town seems poor for dating if you're into it. However, overall it's great for winding down from big city life and getting some work done.

Best time to stay: from late November to late April, when it's dry.
da-lat.description:
Da Lat is a small town in Vietnam that provides fresh air, except for some smoke issues from nearby burning. This mid-sized town is good for those wanting a break from busy city life, with its coffee culture and cooler temperatures. You might find some good local restaurants, but not all meals are great, and service can be inconsistent.

With a laid-back atmosphere and a small, friendly expat community, Da Lat keeps a genuine feel, especially since it is not yet heavily visited by tourists. Nature lovers will enjoy the beautiful waterfalls and hiking options nearby, which are great for getting outside.

However, if you want nightlife and dating options, you may need to lower your expectations. The best time to visit is from late November to late April when it is drier, making it easier to explore. Despite its flaws, many people find Da Lat a peaceful place to relax and enjoy life at a slower pace. Just remember to keep your expectations in check and appreciate the local differences!
da-lat.description_kor:
다랏은 베트남의 아담한 도시로, 근처에서 발생하는 연기 문제를 제외하면 맑고 신선한 공기를 제공합니다. 이 중간 규모의 도시는 바쁜 도시 생활에서 벗어나고 싶어하는 사람들에게 적합하며, 풍부한 커피 문화와 상쾌한 기후가 특징입니다. 좋은 지역 식당들도 있지만, 모든 식사가 퀄리티가 높진 않고 서비스가 일정하지 않을 수 있습니다.

여유로운 분위기와 친근한 외국인 커뮤니티 덕분에 다랏은 관광객이 많지 않아 진정한 매력을 유지하고 있습니다. 자연을 사랑하는 이들은 인근의 아름다운 폭포와 하이킹 코스를 즐길 수 있어 야외 활동을 즐기기에 좋은 장소입니다.

하지만, 밤문화나 데이트 옵션을 기대한다면 약간의 실망이 있을 수 있습니다. 방문하기 가장 좋은 시기는 11월 말부터 4월 말까지인데, 이 시기에 날씨가 더 건조해서 탐험하기 좋습니다. 비록 몇 가지 단점이 있지만, 많은 사람들은 다랏을 여유롭게 휴식을 취하고 느린 삶을 즐기기에 평화로운 곳으로 기억합니다. 기대치를 적절히 조절하고 지역의 매력을 즐기는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: This is the most realest country I've visited next to my homeland in Jamaica. Streets are made of dirt. Horses still pull carts. Very little English spoken. You cannot easily find things you need so bring all your necessities to start with. I have barely seen a street light, the traffic can be unbelievable. It's the perfect place for a real cultural experience and to learn wolof and French. You almost have no choice but to when here. Food made by the family I stayed with is great. So far I've only ate out once at a place in the city and I was not impressed. Get all necessary vaccines before coming here and depending on where you are staying. From what I see this country is very much undeserved and they really deserve better than this, so don't expect to get vaccines readily available like living in other parts of the world.

Financial services are shockingly backward and inefficient. Zero ease of doing business. This review is about Dakar specifically. Very difficult to find high quality consumer products in one centre of commerce, you have to go to random little shops all over the city. Most places don't have websites or have non-functional websites with bugs in online enquiry forms making it difficult to obtain information. E-commerce sites are poorly designed and barely function, and they don't accept credit card payments, you have to have an Orange Money account or cash on delivery. It's all very expensive and honestly not that great. Roads are not maintained, resulting in damage to car shocks and tyres. A lot of land pollution, litter everywhere including on beaches. Municipal services largely non-functional. Not safe for a single woman unless you have a car. Drivers have no issue with colliding with you and it's normal for most cars to be pretty banged up. Yellow cabs very old and in bad shape. These and the buses contribute hugely to air pollution because they're not roadworthy. Quality of petrol and diesel is so bad that it causes really bad air pollution and it's almost impossible to ever take a breath of clean, fresh air. The people of Dakar deserve better.
dakar.description:
Dakar is a city that offers a lively experience and reflects the friendly nature of its people. Imagine this: busy streets (often dusty and narrow), where horses still pull carts and the smell of home-cooked meals fills the air. While English isn’t commonly spoken, trying out French or Wolof can be a fun challenge and a good way to connect with locals.

But let’s be honest – getting around can be difficult. Traffic jams happen often, and many roads need repairs. When it comes to shopping, you won’t find everything in one place. You’ll need to visit different small shops, as most don’t have websites, which can be a bit annoying. And while the food can be enjoyable when shared with a local family, eating out might not always be great.

Safety is another thing to consider, especially for solo travelers – having your own transport isn't just an option; it's advisable. Still, the strong sense of community and rich culture here make Dakar a unique city. Remember to pack what you need and enjoy the adventure!
dakar.description_kor:
다카르는 활기 넘치는 경험을 제공하며, 사람들의 따뜻한 성격이 잘 드러나는 도시입니다. 상상해 보세요: 바쁘고 먼지가 많은 좁은 거리에서 여전히 말이 끄는 손수레가 지나가고, 집에서 요리한 음식 냄새가 공기를 가득 채우는 모습이요. 영어는 일반적으로 통하지 않지만, 프랑스어나 울로프어를 시도해 보는 것은 흥미로운 도전이 될 수 있고, 현지인들과 더 가까워질 수 있는 좋은 방법이기도 합니다.

하지만 솔직히 말하자면 이동이 쉽지 않을 수 있습니다. 교통 체증이 자주 발생하고, 많은 도로가 수리를 필요로 하죠. 쇼핑을 할 때도 모든 것을 한곳에서 구할 수 있는 건 아닙니다. 대부분의 가게가 웹사이트를 갖추고 있지 않기 때문에 여러 작은 가게를 돌아다니며 물건을 찾아야 하는 불편함이 따릅니다. 그리고 현지 가족과 함께 나누어 먹는 식사는 즐거움을 주지만, 외식이 항상 좋은 선택이 아닐 수 있습니다.

안전 또한 중요한 요소입니다. 특히 혼자 여행할 때는 더더욱 신경을 써야 합니다. 자가용을 갖는 건 선택이 아니라 권장 사항이에요. 그럼에도 불구하고, 다카르의 강한 공동체 의식과 풍부한 문화는 이 도시를 특별한 곳으로 만들어 줍니다. 필요한 것을 잘 챙기고, 모험을 즐겨보세요!

reviews: idk how to suggest an edit, but the hub is gone. The Hive is a pretty great space for getting work done

It's a... 6.5/10 from me! 
It's really a place that have everything on paper, but in the end it's just ..... kinda boring (for me)? 
However.. this place really depends on you if you will like it or not. If you're a low budget kinda guy, then this is probably heaven on earth. If you don't like the intensity of Bangkok or Bali, you will probably like this place as well. 
For me Hanoi, Ho Chi Min, Bangkok and Bali have better traffic, the unpredictability is the killer here, I saw 3 collisions of local people on my 1 month stay
Pros:
- Cheap
- Beach
- Mountain

Cons
- Traffic is unpredictable
- A bit boring

Things to consider:
- I Vietnamese food, but I did get tired of it during my month, in contrast to Thai food where I ended liking it more and more.
- It's not hard to get laid, but they are a bit more conservative so be patient
- Grab / Scooter oriented environment instead of public transport
- It's more walkable than Bali less walkable than Bangkok

It seems to be one of the cities with the lowest cost of living on nomadlist but you kinda get what you pay for. 

Lots of good, cheap local restaurants where you can eat for $1 if you want. Otherwise, the $10-15 restaurants serve very good food. Adoption of Grab by restaurants is limited, so you will have to go out to eat at those restaurants. If you just want to hustle from home and not waste time going to restaurants, you will feel like you're always eating the same things after a month due to the limited good options. 
Try the egg coffee and salt coffee, I don't like coffee but found them delicious. 

Ants are a problem to consider when booking accommodation, it seems the whole city has a problem with that. It's like they live inside the floors and walls of buildings. I wouldn't book an apartment on a low floor.

Renting a scooter for a month costs 45 usd for the cheapest kind, which is nice. I recommend you do it as it will open up the city for you, but be careful when riding. You get used to it but half of the top 50 most insane things I have ever seen people do on the road happened here.
I recommend doing a day trip to Hoi An, it is a giant tourist trap but it is beautiful. 

Vietnamese people are not very nice in my experience. Completely different from the lovely Thai people. I'd say they are much closer to the Chinese culturally. I personally view the locals as a bit too inconsiderate and a bit too aggressive for my taste especially when trying to take your money, although if you stand your ground they quickly back down, which I guess means they see it as "just business" and there is still a form of underlying respect. But "just business" also extends to fake google reviews, misleading photos and descriptions on accommodation listings, convenient order "mistakes", 2-3x price gauging, random people trying to charge you for parking your scooter in a public place, and it quickly gets annoying. For these reasons, I do not hold Vietnamese culture in high regard.

If you're a young broke backpacker or bootstrapper, I guess it might make sense for you to be here. Otherwise I'd say lower your expectations, or just go somewhere else entirely. When you know you can go to any of the neighbouring countries and be treated much better, why come to Vietnam?
Such is the beauty of the free market.

Visited it for two weeks, and I wish I can stay more, still not crowded, good food and almost all coffee shops have a working space, beautiful beach and affordable accomodations, really nice for digital nomading.

Trying a month — 3 weeks in, not a fan. 
Transient.. feels like nowhere. Faint smell of sewerage, not walkable, beach absolutely packed and at the end of the day when the sun backs off (June). Food and coffee is either excellent or terrible, little inbetween.. but that’s fine once you find the good spots.
Nice beach city. Had amazing view from apartment. Less congested than ho chi Minh and Hanoi. Able to work their easily. Easy to get around.

Da Nang is a fantastic city, with all the amenities that you could wish for. From great beaches to beautiful mountains arund. Next to this, the Vietnamese fantastic is just fantastic. Happy to also have found Coworking Danang which offers a great vibe and community in the city. Can totally recommend!

I have spend a few days in Da Nang in January and its one of the only cities in Vietnam, I absolutely couldnt find aything positive about. It felt dead to me. Almost no people there and it feels like the city doesnt have a soul. I would even go so far to say the city is the only place in Asia that made me feel unformfortable. 
Cant recommend it. 
Furthermore i got a food poisoning there. So the overall experience wasnt good.

Da Nang offers a nice beach, good air quality, comparable less traffic and pollution than other Vietnamese cities. Overall a relaxed vibe in the beach area. Don't expect international shopping or buzzing nightlife. It's not Bangkok. It's though ridiculous cheap, food is great, and locals are friendly.

The biggest mistake you can make is staying in An Thuong / My An. This area is full of filthy backpackers and Russians. Lot's of construction going on there. The beach in this area is too close to a major street. In general a very noisy area, honking, karaoke, night market, megaphone advertising. You won't sleep much. 

I enjoyed the middle and northern part of Phước Mỹ better. It's the area with the international hotels. Difference like night and day. Less traffic, less karaoke, and the international hotels offer good noise insulation. The beach in this area is a bit further from to the road which makes it more enjoyable. 

Overall a good city for extended stays with focus on work and spending some time in nature. If you want extensive nightlife, cultural experiences, socialising or shopping better go somewhere else.

Unspectacular. I spent 28 days in Da Nang. There are some positives, but let's start with the negatives. Da Nang is the 7th city I've lived in Vietnam, I've lived in over 100 cities for a month or longer. Prior to this trip, I had Vietnam ranked in my top 5 countries and was hoping that trend to continue (been coming here since 2019), but alas, no. Super disappointing. 
Even though it's same size as Vientiane, Laos (1m) it feels like a big city, kinda. I mean, there's not much traffic, but there's so many, unnecessary highrises. There's a dozen 30+ stories on the waterfront, totally empty. It's actually not that touristy, but you'd think you're in Thailand. There a million massage parlors and guys asking if you want boom boom on every corner. Don't get lost while running errands if on foot! Due to the humidity, you have about 10 minutes outside before you start sweating. And, during rainy season, which isn't terrible, places randomly close. Gym closed at 6pm. Restaurants and cafe's don't open. I stayed in An Thuong area and there are zero nice gyms, zero nice restaurants, zero nice grocery stores. And I mean zero. English level very, very low. I met three Vietnamese who spoke passable Enlgish.
The Vietnamese are, in general, friendly. But here, I felt the vibe was off. You know that vibe you get? It's subtle, but it's there. The vibe I got was that they weren't interested in interacting. Rude might be a bit much to say. But they had their group, and foreigners had their own. This may be due to the area I was in and that's it's more touristy than other places.
The wifi is fine. The cafe scene is awesome. It's walkable. The beach, for me, is underrated. Yes, it's not busy, but it's also not empty. It's a giant beach and at any time you'll find a hundred people within eyeshot. The air is super clean.
I'm so, very disappointed in my review here. I was hoping to love Da Nang. Generally, I love beach towns.
Oh ya! I almost forgot. The following has little to no bearing on my review more than it was part of my overall experience, but I post some videos to TikTok. I did about 15 videos during my time in Da Nang. One of those videos was negative about the grocery store situation and it got 15x more views and the local Vietnamese jumped on me, called me names in the comments, insulted me, etc. I was surprised at this reaction and total silence on the other 14 videos highlighting the positives.

Spent two weeks there and honestly I wish I had planned to stay longer. I don’t know why it says the internet is bad. My airbnb had a very fast wifi of almost 100GB. Also, buying a sim card is really cheap, I paid 150k vnd (around 6 dollars) for 180GB. The city had lots of cafes, amazing local & international restaurantes (more international restaurants than Hanoi). The beach is not so pretty, but great for walks, and grabbing a drink. At night the vibe is really nice by the beach. Overall i had a great time, cheapest place in South East Asia so far!
I have been both HCM and Da Nang. Da Nang is obviously a winner. Cooler climate, nicer people, less crowded, less pollution. Love it here

Let's make it short again: (1,5 years living experience in Da Nang)
Da Nang is Chiang Mai with a Beach without the annoying nomad scenes.
-Most foreigners are English teachers or retired Australians. If you don't like it, mix up with locals. 90% of my friends are Vietnamese. 
-Be careful with Constructions at the Beach Side. If you want a quiet life go to Son Tra. If you want more Action go to An Thuong Area. If you want local experience go behind the bridge 
- Nightlife growing and enough Options there. (Check out DJ Mad Tea Party in Da Nang) 
- Clean Air and Beautiful Environment
- Amazing Girls that are easy if you are good-looking. ( But logically not comparable to Saigon or Hanoi ) But if you are not good-looking go better to Thailand or Philipinnes.
- Locals English level is very low besides some young people

If you need this whole scam Digital Nomad Events, you are wrong here. If you are able to earn yourself a nice income and want a beautiful and amazing place with BEACH AND MOUNTAINS. Welcome to Da Nang!
I love it so much.
PS: the rain season sux asf. See it as the burning season in chiang mai without the burn :) Avoid it!

After having lived here for two months, I've got to say that this must be one of the worst places in Asia. The only reason I am still here is because I'm stuck due to the covid-19 situation. There is nothing to do here, except going for a walk at the beach. No events, no social life, no activities. Mind you, this has nothing to do with the current situation, it was the same before things got shut down because of the virus.

The locals don't really like foreigners and you can feel that often, even though the city wants to be a tourism destination. There is no mingling between locals and foreigners at all, because the city is divided by the river. All the locals live on the left side and all the foreigners on the right side. A few foreign guys date Vietnamese girls, that's it. That means you are living in a bubble with other foreigners which has nothing to do with living in Asia. The expat community consists to 90% of English teachers. It's really hard to meet people here who are actually nomads or are doing something else with their lives than teaching English. If that's your crowd, go ahead.

Pro's:
- Beach is beautiful
- Food pricing is decent

Con's
- This whole city starting from the airport to the beach is trying to take advantage of your tourist intentions, feels like everyone is trying to overcharge or scam
- Barely any english spoken here, hard to communicate
- Lot of construction because it is still developing

In summary: 
Ok for a 2 days visit, skip living here long term

I previously wrote a very long review on Da Nang and wanted to update my experience after almost 1 month here. As mentioned, Da Nang is an up and coming place but is not for everyone. From my perspective the main pros and cons are as follows:
+ very affordable. Rent, food, and taking grabs around is very cheap.
+ beautiful area and surrounding. A lot of interesting day trips, especially with a motorbike.
+ good place to digital nomad in, plenty of coffeeshops and places to work. An expat scene too.
- You'll feel like a walking wallet. We've been ripped off by immigration, taxi drivers, restaurants, etc. Most of the restaurants in our area have fake reviews. You sort of have to be on your guard more than other places in south east asia.
- Its not pleasant to walk around here. Crossing the road is terrifying (you get used to it a bit) and there's construction everywhere so sidewalks are a mess.
- Still developing. At least where I live (My Anh), there is tons of construction (really loud). People selling various foods with loud speakers (Banh Bao!) into the late hours of the night (which gets old really fast. This area feels like a mix of tourist traps and construction sites. However, there are some gems to be found and once you're here for a week or so, there are plenty of good places to regular.

To summarize: While I had a very negative impression of Da Nang, i don't think it's such a bad place. Compared to a place like Chiang Mai, it is a much harder place to live as a DN, but you also may be rewarded with a bit more authenticity. There is something fun about living in a place that is changing at such a rapid place, but many downsides as well. Personally, I would probably advise waiting several years before coming to Da Nang until it's more developed. Or if you do stay, trying to stay in neighborhoods by the main city rather than near the beach, which feels more like a tourist trap under construction. In general, it's a reasonably livable city. You'll get some of the vibrant energy that makes Vietnam special, but without the convenience of a place like Chiang Mai or the culture and history of somewhere like Hanoi.

There's another long review here that's based on (1 week) but is very accurate.
Been here almost 3 months, 
If you've lived around Asia, you'll find the Vietnamese to be louder and rude in comparison to Thailand / Korea / Taiwan.
Da Nang is a huge construction site, Vietnamese food is bland.
They tend to rip each other off, and foreigners aren't treated differently as well.
Do not pay Grab taxis here in advance (cash only, avoid credit cards) the locals like to "pick up" without actually picking you up.
Hoi an is near by, and its got a nice beach (An Bang)
In general, have to agree with the one week reviewer, 

Da nang is relatively safe but if you've lived in Bangkok or Chiang mai in the past, you won't like it.

This is going to be a long review but hopefully it will be helpful. I understand this is my subjective experience after only a limited amount of time (1 week) in Da Nang and your mileage may vary. I could imagine some people really enjoying living here but for me it is not a great place to live and I decided to shorten my stay as a result. 
To start, some good things about Da Nang: It is a very cheap place to live and I think you get decent value too. There are many coffeeshops to work out of and if you search you can find some nice spots to eat, drink, and hang out. There are things to visit in the surrounding area. The city itself has an interesting vibe, like the rest of Vietnam it is very vibrant, but also is in an extreme period of transition and it shows.

I have been living in the My An area of Da Nang (by the beach). I could imagine some people really enjoying living here but I personally do not like it here for a few reasons.

To start, some good things about Da Nang: 
— It is a very cheap place to live and I think you get decent value too.
— There are many coffee shops to work out of and if you search you can find some nice spots to eat, drink, and hang out.
— There are things to visit in the surrounding area. 
— The city itself has an interesting vibe, like the rest of Vietnam it is very vibrant, but also is in an extreme period of transition and it shows. 

— The traffic isn’t so bad and roads are decent for the region.

— There is a decent expat scene and some nice people to hang out with, although this seems in isolation to the rest of the city.

However, there are many negatives, I’ll just list the two main ones for brevity:
— You will feel like a walking wallet and people will try to rip you off everywhere. We had some majorly inconvenient and expensive issues with the visa process, experienced blatant lying and short changing by taxi drivers, ridiculously priced items at shops. In our neighborhood, tons of the restaurants have fake reviews and terrible food. Basically, you feel like you need to be on your guard or you will be taken advantage of, which makes it not very enjoyable to stay here.
— Rapid Development Pains. Because Da Nang is developing so fast, there are a lot of rough edges, as one could expect. Construction is everywhere and makes it hard to walk around. To add to this, crossing the street in any city of Vietnam is quite a stressful experience. Most of the ATMs in the city seem to not work. There are random power outages in our neighborhood. The area we live feels like a depressing mix of construction lots and tourist traps. 

To summarize: We had a very negative introduction to Da Nang, but after several days here, things did get a bit better. Compared to a place like Chiang Mai, it is a much harder place to live as a DN, but you also may be rewarded with a bit more authenticity. There is something fun about living in a place that is changing at such a rapid place, but many downsides as well. Personally, I would probably advise waiting several years before coming to Da Nang. Or if you do stay, trying to stay in neighborhoods by the main city rather than near the beach, which feels more like a tourist trap under construction.
Scenic beach + mountains, decent internet, excellent cheap food and a vibrant expat community makes this one of my favorite spots in SEA.

I've been here a couple times, living in HCMC right now. Compared to HCMC, there's alot less traffic and pollution. Beach is a huge plus. Locals are super friendly. Loads of Korean tourists. Nightlife is actually pretty decent given it's not an especially big city. I'd say there's a fair amount for a young single guy to do. Considering moving here.
