One of the other reviews mentioned the construction, that's everywhere in Vietnam. But it's easy enough to avoid it in Da Nang if you get a place closer to the river/downtown. I'm honestly surprised to see Da Nang hasn't taken off more with the remote working crowd. Way better than Bali. Yuck!
I have spend 2 months there but their is not a lot to do. The city is not very special. And the beach is ok for walking. But that is about it.
Wrote a really long review that disappeared. To summarize it: way too much construction going on here. Might be a nicer place 5-10 years from now.
One of the best places to live in Vietnam. I'm glad not many people have discovered this city yet :)
da-nang.description:
Da Nang, with its beaches and mountains, is a city that offers a lot. For budget travelers and digital nomads, it is affordable with tasty street food available for just one or two dollars. If you like a quieter place than the busy streets of Bangkok or the crowded scenes of Bali, Da Nang might be a good choice for you.

However, it is important to keep your expectations in check. Many visitors find that while there are many things to do, the city can become a bit dull after some time. Public transport options are limited, and unpredictable traffic can make getting around a challenge. Renting a scooter is common – but be careful, as driving can be chaotic!

Culturally, you might face some difficulties. While the locals can be kind, language differences may make communication harder. Eating out can vary; there are good options, but you should watch out for places with high prices or fake reviews.

Nature lovers and beach fans will enjoy Da Nang’s landscape, and the growing coworking spaces are good for those needing a place to work. Overall, it is a nice spot for short stays or working vacations, but it may not be the best place for those looking for active nightlife or large social networks. If you find the right area, you might uncover a hidden treasure in this changing city!
da-nang.description_kor:
다낭은 해변과 산이 조화롭게 어우러진 도시로, 다양한 매력을 가지고 있습니다. 예산을 고려하는 여행자나 디지털 노마드들에게는 맛있는 길거리 음식을 1~2달러에 즐길 수 있어 매우 저렴합니다. 방콕이나 발리처럼 복잡한 곳보다는 한적한 분위기를 원하신다면 다낭이 좋은 선택이 될 수 있습니다.

하지만 기대치를 조절하는 게 중요합니다. 많은 관광객들이 다양한 활동을 즐길 수 있지만, 시간이 흐르다 보면 다낭이 다소 지루하게 느껴질 수도 있습니다. 대중 교통이 제한적이어서 예기치 못한 교통 상황 때문에 이동이 어려울 수 있습니다. 스쿠터를 렌트하는 건 일반적이지만, 도로가 혼잡할 수 있으니 운전할 때 주의해야 합니다.

문화적으로는 몇 가지 어려움에 직면할 수 있습니다. 현지인들은 친구처럼 다정할 수 있지만, 언어 장벽으로 소통이 힘들 수 있습니다. 외식 옵션은 다양하지만, 가격대가 높은 곳이나 가짜 리뷰가 있는 식당은 주의해야 합니다.

자연을 사랑하는 분들과 해변을 즐기는 분들은 다낭의 아름다운 경치를 마음껏 만끽할 수 있습니다. 그리고 최근 늘어나고 있는 코워킹 스페이스는 일할 장소를 필요로 하는 이들에게도 좋은 환경을 제공합니다. 전반적으로 다낭은 짧은 여행이나 워킹홀리데이에 적합한 장소지만, 활발한 야경이나 넓은 사회적 네트워크를 찾고 있는 분들에게는 최적의 선택은 아닐 수 있습니다. 올바른 곳을 잘 찾아간다면, 변화하는 이 도시에 숨겨진 보물을 발견할 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: The city of Dallas has captivated me to an extent that I never will find another place so memorizing to live in, with all the opportunities and amenities present.
dallas.description:
Dallas is a city that knows how to welcome its visitors and residents. It has a mix of culture, history, and modern services that keep people coming back. You can enjoy good food, a busy arts scene, and friendly locals who are happy to talk. The warm weather makes outdoor activities easy, from visiting popular places like the Dallas Arboretum to exploring neighborhoods like Deep Ellum and Bishop Arts District.

However, some people find the cost of living quite high, especially for housing. Public transport could be improved, so having a car makes things easier. While English is commonly spoken, you might find some neighborhoods with a strong Spanish influence, making it interesting to experience the local culture.

To enjoy Dallas, try to visit local art festivals and farmer's markets. Just remember, with the busy atmosphere, safety can be a concern in some places, so be aware while you enjoy what this Texas city has to offer!
dallas.description_kor:
댈러스는 방문객과 주민들을 환영하는 데 능숙한 도시입니다. 이곳은 매력적인 문화, 풍부한 역사, 현대적인 서비스가 잘 어우러져 사람들을 다시 찾게 만드는 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 맛있는 음식, 활기찬 예술 현장, 그리고 친절하게 이야기를 나눌 수 있는 지역 주민들과 함께 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 따뜻한 날씨 덕분에 댈러스 아보레텀 같은 인기 명소를 방문하거나 딥 엘럼, 비숍 아트 지구와 같은 동네를 탐방하는 야외 활동이 편리합니다.

하지만 일부 사람들은 주택 등 생활비가 상당히 높다고 느끼기도 합니다. 대중교통은 개선할 점이 많아서 차를 소유하고 있는 것이 더 편리할 수 있습니다. 영어가 널리 사용되지만, 일부 동네에서는 스페인어의 영향이 두드러져 현지 문화를 더 깊이 경험할 수 있는 기회가 많습니다.

댈러스를 제대로 즐기려면 지역 예술 축제와 농산물 직거래 장터에 가보는 것을 추천합니다. 하지만 바쁜 일상 속에서 일부 지역에서는 안전 문제가 염려될 수 있으니, 이 텍사스 도시의 매력을 만끽할 때 주의가 필요합니다!

reviews: I rented a house at the bottom of Mount Kassioun for a few months in 2004, in the French-style, newer part of Damascus, near the US Embassy. There's also the walled (with several different entrances) ancient, warren-like, oval-shaped city, which is about a mile across with lots of markets, small hotels and restaurants. I hear post-war Damascus, unlike Aleppo, is fairly intact.
damascus.description:
Damascus is a city with a lot of history and a mix of old and new. Imagine living near Mount Kassioun, where you see nice views every day. The city has a newer neighborhood in the French style that is modern but close to the busy old center of Damascus. The old city has narrow streets full of life with busy markets, small hotels, and restaurants serving traditional food. It’s a great place to learn about local culture and history.

Public transportation might be limited, but the areas you can walk make it easy to get around. Some visitors have said there can be challenges, like a language barrier, but many find it friendly to connect with locals. Safety is a concern for many, so it’s important to stay informed.

A practical tip is to follow local customs and try to learn a few simple Arabic phrases; this helps a lot in communication. With its rich history and lively atmosphere, Damascus is a city that makes a strong impression!
damascus.description_kor:
다마스쿠스는 오랜 역사와 현대적인 요소가 조화를 이루는 매력적인 도시입니다. 매일 아름다운 경치를 즐길 수 있는 카시운 산 근처에 살고 있다고 상상해 보세요. 이 도시는 현대적이면서도, 분주한 다마스쿠스 구시가지와 가까운 프랑스 스타일의 새로운 동네를 자랑합니다. 구시가지는 좁은 거리와 활기찬 시장, 아늑한 호텔, 전통 음식을 제공하는 식당들로 가득 차 있어 생동감 넘치는 분위기를 만끽할 수 있습니다. 이곳은 지역 문화와 역사에 대해 배우기에 아주 좋은 장소입니다.

대중교통은 다소 제한적일 수 있지만, 도보로 쉽게 돌아다닐 수 있는 지역이 많습니다. 일부 방문객들은 언어 장벽 때문에 어려움을 겪기도 하지만, 많은 이들이 현지인들과 원활하게 소통하는 즐거움을 경험합니다. 안전 문제는 많은 사람들이 걱정하는 부분이므로, 사전 정보 파악이 중요합니다.

실용적인 팁으로는 현지 관습을 잘 따르고, 간단한 아랍어 구문 몇 가지를 배워보는 것이 좋습니다. 이렇게 하면 소통이 훨씬 더 수월해질 거예요. 풍부한 역사와 활기찬 분위기를 갖춘 다마스쿠스는 잊을 수 없는 인상을 남기는 도시입니다!

reviews: In summer season, temperature will 31°C, feels like 36 or more, humidity is 90% even at 28°C. Nearly impossible to to work without a good AC. In rainy season, temperature drops under 30 and air quality becomes just terrible, leaving a window open will leave your floor black. Lots of places to rent, but very hard to close a long term rent deal due to landlords unwilling to close a deal remotely (cash only). Long term rentals are much more affordable than airbnb.
Great city, great weather, many parties, many different beaches, quite safe in the international neighborhoods, not too expensive and decent internet
dar-es-salaam.description:
Dar es Salaam is a busy coastal city in Tanzania, known for its culture and beaches. The average temperature is around 31°C in the summer, and it can feel hotter because of the humidity. If you visit, you will need air conditioning. The rainy season is cooler but may have some air quality problems.

Finding a place to rent can be difficult because many landlords want cash and might not want to negotiate from a distance. However, long-term rentals are usually cheaper than Airbnb, which is good for those wanting to stay longer.

The city is full of life, with many parties and events throughout the year, making it a great place if you like social activities. Safety is usually good, especially in areas where many international people live. Don’t forget to visit the local beaches and be ready for some fun—there are many things to see and do! Here are a few practical tips: be ready for some difficulties with transportation and language, but it is all part of the experience. Enjoy your time in this lively city!
dar-es-salaam.description_kor:
다르 에스 살람은 문화와 해변으로 유명한 탄자니아의 활기찬 해안 도시입니다. 여름철 평균 기온은 약 31°C이지만, 습도가 높아 더운 기분이 들 수 있으니 에어컨은 필수입니다. 우기에는 기온이 다소 내려가지만, 대기 질이 나빠질 수 있으니 유의해야 합니다.

숙소를 찾는 것은 쉽지 않을 수 있습니다. 많은 집주인들이 현금을 선호하고, 원거리에서의 협상을 마다하는 경우가 많기 때문입니다. 하지만 장기 임대는 일반적으로 에어비앤비보다 비용이 저렴하므로, 오랫동안 머무르려는 분들에게는 좋은 선택이 될 수 있습니다.

이 도시는 연중 내내 다양한 파티와 이벤트가 열리기 때문에 사회적 활동을 즐기는 사람들에게는 최적의 장소입니다. 특히 외국인이 많은 지역에서는 안전도 대체로 양호합니다. 현지 해변 방문을 잊지 마시고, 재미있게 즐길 준비를 하세요—볼거리와 할 거리가 정말 많거든요! 몇 가지 실용적인 팁을 드리자면, 교통과 언어 장벽에 대비하되, 그것이 모두 좋은 경험의 일부라는 점을 기억하세요. 이 활기찬 도시에서의 시간을 만끽하시길 바랍니다!

reviews: nice small city many young ppl. was workig remote in August and September.. Herrengarten nice big park with a lot of stuff to do. Many Airports are super close. Good spot
darmstadt.description:
Darmstadt is a small city that is good for people who want a relaxed atmosphere with some energy. There are many young people here, which makes it lively but not too busy. If you like parks, you should visit Herrengarten. It is a large area with many activities, like picnics and walking.

Getting around is easy, especially with several airports nearby, which helps if you like to travel. However, you might face some language issues if you do not speak German. The cost of living is usually reasonable, but some things can be more expensive than you might think.

For some history, you can look at the local buildings – they are quite nice. If you want to know where to stay, neighborhoods close to the center are good for easy access to everything. Darmstadt is a nice place to work remotely or enjoy a good European experience!
darmstadt.description_kor:
다름슈타트는 편안한 분위기와 약간의 활기를 원하는 분들에게 좋은 작은 도시입니다. 이곳은 비교적 많은 젊은이들이 있어서 활기찬 느낌이 있지만, 과하지 않아 너무 붐비지 않습니다. 공원을 좋아하신다면 헤렌가르텐을 꼭 방문해 보세요. 피크닉이나 산책 등 다양한 활동을 즐길 수 있는 넓은 공간이 마련되어 있습니다.

이동은 매우 편리하고, 여러 공항이 가까이 있어서 여행을 좋아하는 분들에게 유리합니다. 다만 독일어를 잘 못 하신다면 언어 장벽에 직면할 수 있습니다. 일반적으로 생활비는 합리적인 편이지만, 예상 외로 비싼 항목도 있을 수 있습니다.

역사에 관심이 있으시다면 지역의 아름다운 건축물들을 살펴보는 것도 좋습니다. 머무를 곳을 정하지 못했다면, 중심가 근처의 동네가 모든 것에 쉽게 접근할 수 있어 추천합니다. 다름슈타트는 원격 근무를 하거나 훌륭한 유럽 경험을 즐기기에 안성맞춤인 장소입니다!

reviews: I was here for almost three weeks last month. The internet is fast, and the surroundings are beautiful. The people are friendly, and most of them speak English well. I never felt unsafe during my stay. If you know where to go, there's plenty to do. There are many lovely parks, and the food is delicious and surprisingly affordable (I highly recommend Roxas). The shopping centers are of high quality. It's best to install the Grab app or take taxis for transportation. Public transportation can take a bit longer, but with Grab and taxis, you can get anywhere quickly, and it's reasonably priced. There's a relaxed atmosphere in Davao City. For beaches, it's best to visit Samal Island or spend a few days in Mati (approximately a three-hour drive). You won't encounter many Westerners or nomads here. Tourism is starting to pick up again after the pandemic, but most visitors are from Asia. I highly recommend it and will definitely come back here 100%.

Internet has significantly improved from the last time I have been. Traffic is still terrible, with public transportation is quite challenging. Overall the city is really nice, excellent beach on nearby Samal Island and beautiful mountain resorts somewhere in Marilog district. There are a lot of affordable accommodations to choose from. Food is cheap and restaurants are everywhere, there area lot of night markets where food is not that bad but incredibly inexpensive. Locals are friendly and communication is not a difficulty because they are amiable and have good English communication skills. Jacks Ridge is an ideal place to unwind late in the afternoon with panoramic view of the city. Great folks and a great city, I'll probably return.

Not sure where the last person went in the city for him/her to say that there are zero expats. Throughout my years with Davao, I would bump into at least 20 expats in one night out in just a single area. Davao City is only boring if you don't know where to go, and as someone who lives outside of Davao, I find myself coming back more than five times a year for the people, the culture it has, and how conveniently close it is to beautiful vacation places. You'll love it when you know the gems that you can only find if you approach the right people. You attract the right people if you're a cool person yourself.

Terrible internet even taxi drivers can't use maps and don't know where they are going. Super boring. Congested with traffic and horns. No infrastructure. Bums everywhere. Sketchy people. Davao city is a scary and weird place. There are zero foreigners here. Check the expat group on Facebook it's a handful of creepy old men. I guess Filipinos that live here that are pumping up the reviews for this place because they are proud of where they are from and love their president and his beloved city. Lots of fake crap about how amazing it is all over the internet. Really far from the truth. Police and military all over yeah maybe that makes some people feel safe but I'd rather deal with threats from pickpocketers than terrorists and kidnappers!

Very safe, very cheap city to live in. They have a couple decent gyms and coworking spaces. Overall, the city is quite boring with very little to do - unless you enjoy walking around the 2-3 big malls they have dotted around the city. They have liquor restrictions so clubs and bars stop serving alcohol after midnight. A great place to live if you want to get a lot of work don with no distractions and live cheaply - also close to other hot spots like Cebu, Manila and the rest of Asia.
davao.description:
Davao City is a special place in the Philippines that attracts those who come here. You can enjoy fresh fruit shakes in nice parks, eat local dishes at good prices, and experience the friendliness of the locals, many of whom speak English well. The city is known for its beautiful nature, with impressive mountains in the Marilog district and nice beaches on nearby Samal Island, great for a weekend trip.

Although traffic can be slow and public transport may take time, using the Grab app makes travel easier. There are many shopping centers and night markets where you can find tasty food at low prices. Davao has its unique features: some visitors feel a bit out of place with fewer foreigners around, and some areas may feel unsafe. But for those who enjoy the local culture and know where to go, the city offers many opportunities.

With a laid-back atmosphere, a lively food scene, and local customs to experience, Davao is best visited with an open mind and a desire to explore. Whether you are here for a short time or thinking about a longer stay, there is a lot to appreciate about this city!
davao.description_kor:
다바오시는 필리핀에서 방문객들을 매료시키는 특별한 장소입니다. 멋진 공원에서 신선한 과일 쉐이크를 즐기고, 합리적인 가격에 현지 음식을 맛볼 수 있으며, 많은 주민들이 영어를 유창하게 구사해 친절하게 대합니다. 이 도시는 아름다운 자연으로 유명하며, 마릴로그 지역의 웅장한 산들과 인근 사말 섬의 아름다운 해변은 주말 여행에 제격입니다.

교통이 느릴 수도 있고 대중교통은 시간이 걸릴 수 있지만, Grab 앱을 이용하면 이동이 훨씬 편리합니다. 저렴한 가격에 맛있는 음식을 찾을 수 있는 쇼핑 센터와 야시장이 많이 있어 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 다바오에는 독특한 매력이 있습니다. 일부 방문객들은 외국인이 적어 어색함을 느끼거나 몇몇 지역이 안전하지 않다고 생각할 수도 있지만, 현지 문화를 즐기고 잘 아는 사람들과 함께라면 이 도시는 많은 기회를 제공합니다.

여유로운 분위기 속에서 활기찬 음식 문화를 경험하고 다양한 현지 관습을 접할 수 있는 다바오는 열린 마음과 모험심을 가지고 방문하는 것이 가장 좋습니다. 짧은 시간 동안 체류하든, 긴 일정으로 여행하든, 이곳에는 정말 감사할 만한 것들이 많이 있습니다!

reviews: Horrible place full of alcoholic men who like to fight, no women so the vibe is awful. nothing to do except drink yourself stupid!!
darwin.description:
Darwin has an interesting atmosphere that is worth experiencing, but it has its good and bad sides. Some visitors say that there is a rough environment, especially with reports of loud behavior and nightlife focused on drinking. However, many people enjoy the relaxed lifestyle and warm weather in Darwin.

The city's culture combines Indigenous traditions with modern influences, and there are many festivals and markets to see. Public transportation is not very extensive, but it is possible to use for getting around the main areas. Just be aware that some places may feel a bit unsafe at night, so it's a good idea to stay alert.

For those looking for activities, you can visit the nice parks or the waterfront. Mindil Beach is known for its sunset markets and shows local customs and food. If you are thinking about moving or visiting, some neighborhoods are better than others, so it’s good to do some research first. Keep an open mind, and you may find Darwin's unique character surprising!
darwin.description_kor:
다윈은 경험할 만한 흥미로운 분위기를 지니고 있지만, 좋은 점과 나쁜 점이 모두 있는 곳입니다. 일부 방문객들은 특히 시끄러운 행동과 음주 중심의 야경 덕분에 거친 환경이 존재한다고 지적하기도 합니다. 그러나 많은 이들은 다윈의 편안한 라이프스타일과 따뜻한 날씨를 즐깁니다.

이 도시의 문화는 원주민 전통과 현대적인 영향을 조화롭게 결합하고 있으며, 볼거리가 가득한 축제와 시장이 많이 열립니다. 대중 교통은 그렇게 발달되어 있지는 않지만, 주요 지역을 돌아다니기에는 충분히 이용할 수 있습니다. 단, 밤에는 일부 장소가 다소 안전하지 않게 느껴질 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다.

활동을 찾는 분들은 아름다운 공원이나 해변을 방문할 수 있습니다. 민딜 비치는 일몰 시장으로 유명하며, 지역의 문화와 음식을 경험할 수 있는 좋은 기회를 제공합니다. 다윈으로 이사하거나 방문할 계획이라면, 일부 동네가 다른 동네보다 더 나은 환경을 제공하니 미리 조사를 해보는 것이 좋습니다. 열린 마음으로 다윈을 탐방하면 이곳의 독특한 매력에 매료될 것입니다!

reviews: Born and raised 1 hour from Daytona Beach. Pros - Beach is nice. The sand is so packed down you and bike up the beach. You can drive onto the beach and snag wifi from local hotels work in your van. There are a few decent coffee shops. Some nice Diners and local farmers markets depending on the day. If you have a paddle board or kayak there are plenty of players to pop it in the river or sea. The Cons: Unless you're into Nascar and Motorcycles there isn't too much to do after the sun goes down other than a local bar. For longer stays it can get a little quiet and slow. I look forward to if / when this area shifts into more of an entrepreneur vibe.
daytona-beach.description:
Daytona Beach is a nice place to visit with a mix of relaxing and fun activities. The wide, hard sand beaches allow you to drive onto the shore and even use Wi-Fi from nearby hotels while you work from your van. If you like water sports, there are many places to take your paddle board or kayak along the river or sea. Also, the coffee shops and local diners have good food and drinks to keep you energized.

However, keep in mind that the nightlife here is mostly for racing fans, so if you're not interested in Nascar or motorcycles, it might be quiet after dark. If you stay longer, it may feel a bit slow, which is good for relaxing but not for those looking for a lot of excitement. To have more fun, exploring local markets and getting involved in the community might be helpful. Overall, Daytona Beach is a laid-back place great for beach lovers and those wanting to relax!
daytona-beach.description_kor:
데이토나 비치는 편안한 활동과 즐거운 놀거리가 조화를 이루는 멋진 여행지입니다. 넓고 단단한 모래 해변에서는 차를 몰고 해변에 들어갈 수 있고, 근처의 호텔에서 제공하는 Wi-Fi를 이용해 밴 안에서도 일을 할 수 있습니다. 수상 스포츠를 좋아하신다면, 강이나 바다에서 패들 보드나 카약을 자유롭게 즐길 수 있는 좋은 장소가 많습니다. 또한, 커피숍과 지역 다이너에서는 맛있는 음식과 음료를 제공해 활력을 충전할 수 있습니다.

하지만 이곳의 야간 활동은 주로 레이싱 팬들을 위한 것이라, NASCAR나 오토바이에 관심이 없으시다면 밤이 되면 조용해질 수 있습니다. 더 오래 머무르다 보면 느린 분위기가 좀 답답하게 느껴질 수도 있지만, 이 점은 오히려 편안함을 느끼기에는 좋을 수 있습니다. 좀 더 흥미로운 경험을 원하신다면 지역 시장을 탐방하거나 커뮤니티 활동에 참여하는 것도 좋은 방법입니다. 전반적으로 데이토나 비치는 해변을 사랑하고 편안하게 쉬고 싶은 분들에게 적합한 여유로운 장소입니다!

reviews: Dayton is a growing city. Many parts of Dayton-proper are still experiencing severe poverty but a few area are beginning to see gentrification. The area has moved away from the large-scale industry which has all but abandoned the area and now experiences a lot of growth through local entrepreneurs including a rich culture of Craft Beer brewing, tattoo shops, cafes, music, and a variety of other "fun" businesses. While Dayton, itself, is growing fast and the housing prices can be extremely cheap, one will find that the surrounding suburbs host a large portion of the local population and are not lacking in entertainment or cultural life. The metroparks are outstanding and bike trails are rapidly tying various areas together. Technology-wise, the area has two universities and a large Air Force base so one would find mostly enterprise-level organizations. There is a lot of potential to grow the local technology scene and Dayton hosts one of the largest HAM Radio festival annually.
dayton.description:
Dayton is a city that offers many surprises and has a lot of energy! It started with manufacturing but is now focusing more on local culture and businesses. You will find good craft breweries, interesting tattoo shops, and nice cafés that make the city special. Some areas still deal with issues like poverty, but improvements are bringing new chances.

The cost of living is reasonable here, which is good if you want to move. You may also want to look at the nearby suburbs, where many people live, for their active cultural and entertainment options. Don't forget to visit the local parks and bike trails that connect different parts of the city – great for people who enjoy being outside!

Be aware that some places in the city may still have problems, and getting around can be difficult. However, with two universities and an important Air Force base, it has a lot of potential, especially for those interested in technology. Also, make sure to check out the annual HAM Radio festival – it is a popular local event!
dayton.description_kor:
데이턴은 놀라움을 가득 안겨주는 에너지 넘치는 도시입니다! 처음에는 제조업으로 시작했지만, 지금은 지역 문화와 비즈니스에 초점을 맞추고 있습니다. 이곳에서는 훌륭한 수제 맥주 양조장, 흥미로운 타투 가게, 그리고 이 도시를 특별하게 만들어주는 멋진 카페들을 쉽게 찾아볼 수 있습니다. 물론 일부 지역은 여전히 빈곤 문제를 겪고 있지만, 이러한 문제들이 개선되면서 새로운 기회들이 생겨나고 있습니다.

또한, 이곳의 생활비는 합리적이어서 이사하기에 아주 좋은 곳입니다. 그리고 인근 교외 지역도 많은 사람들이 살고 있어서 활발한 문화와 오락 옵션이 많습니다. 도시 곳곳을 연결하는 공원과 자전거 도로도 방문해 보세요. 야외 활동을 즐기는 사람들에게는 더없이 좋은 장소입니다!

다만, 일부 지역에서는 여전히 문제가 있을 수 있어 이동이 불편할 수도 있습니다. 하지만 이 도시는 두 개의 대학과 중요한 공군 기지가 있어 특히 기술 분야에 관심 있는 사람들에게 다양한 가능성을 제공합니다. 매년 열리는 HAM 라디오 축제도 놓치지 말고 꼭 확인해 보세요. 이 축제는 지역에서 매우 인기 있는 이벤트로 자리 잡고 있습니다!

reviews: Des Moines has a surprising amount of bike paths and sweet breweries. It’s a pretty sleepy town but if you happen to get stuck here there are some charming spots!

Des Moines is a great little big city compared to the rest of Iowa. It has everything you need centrally located and the small surrounding suburbs have great school systems. Downtown Des Moines boasts a smorgasbord of delicious bakeries, coffee shops, and non-chain restaurants. They have recently added bike lanes to make it more pedestrian friendly. There are quite a few bars and nightclubs on Court Ave. to keep you entertained. Some have live entertainment, outside patios, and a cover to get in. 

Something else I love about Des Moines: its many parks and hiking trails! Plenty to do during the summer between that and the many festivals that seem to be going on every other weekend. 

Des Moines isn’t bad but it can be very slow so I wouldn’t recommend it to my thrill seekers: you’ll be bored! However, if you’re a nomad looking for a place to lay low and take things slow for a bit or, you’re a family looking for a better life: Des Moines is for you!
des-moines.description:
Located in Iowa, Des Moines is a city waiting to be discovered. Some may think it is quiet, but it has a lively side with many bike paths and local breweries. If you visit, you will find nice bakeries, coffee shops, and many non-chain restaurants, especially in downtown. The city is now more bike-friendly, making it good for easy rides and walks.

Families like the nearby suburbs for their good schools, while those looking for entertainment will find many bars and clubs on Court Avenue with live music and outdoor seating. There are also parks and hiking trails that are busy in summer, hosting many festivals that happen often.

If you want a lot of excitement all the time, you might find Des Moines too relaxed. But for those who prefer a slower pace or a friendly community, it is a great place to relax and enjoy simple things in life!
des-moines.description_kor:
아이오와에 위치한 디모인은 발견될 날을 기다리고 있는 도시입니다. 어떤 사람들은 이곳이 조용하다고 느낄지도 모르지만, 자전거 도로와 지역 양조장 덕분에 매우 활기찬 면모를 가지고 있습니다. 방문하게 되면 우수한 빵집, 커피숍, 그리고 시내의 다양한 독립 레스토랑들을 발견할 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 이제 더 자전거 친화적인 환경으로 변화하여 자전거를 타고 한가롭게 산책하기에 아주 좋은 곳이 되었습니다.

가족들은 좋은 학교가 있는 교외를 선호하고, 오락을 찾는 이들은 라이브 음악과 야외 좌석이 있는 바와 클럽이 많은 코트 애비뉴를 즐기게 됩니다. 여름철에는 많은 축제가 열리는 공원과 하이킹 코스가 특히 인기를 끕니다.

만약 항상 흥미로운 활동을 원한다면 디모인이 너무 느리고 평화롭게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 하지만 여유로운 분위기와 친근한 공동체를 즐기는 이들에게는 휴식과 삶의 소소한 기쁨을 만끽하기에 안성맞춤인 장소입니다!

reviews: extremely dirty, very noisy, non walkable, the city is also ugly (except mausoleum and forts, of course). Hard to recommend, unless you’re very found of spirituality. Forget to mention but the food is of course amazing!

Very culturally enriching. The architecture, the history, the food, the customs of the people. It's also very cheap. Nightlife is good but it ends up very early. Also, public transportation is chaotic.
delhi.description:
Delhi has its own unique personality, busy and full of life, but it also has some challenges. The city can be quite noisy and crowded, which may not appeal to everyone. If you want to take a quiet walk, be ready because walking around can be difficult. The streets are often busy and not always clean, but in the middle of the activity, you will find rich culture and history.

Make sure to see the beautiful tombs and forts that show stories from the past. And the food is amazing! From street food to local restaurants, Delhi has something for everyone, and it's all very affordable. The nightlife is energetic but usually ends early, so plan for that.

Public transport can be a little chaotic, but with some patience, you can get around. While there may be language differences, the friendly nature of the people often makes up for it. Whether you are visiting local markets or historical sites, Delhi will definitely leave an impression on you!
delhi.description_kor:
델리는 고유한 개성과 생기가 넘치는 활기찬 도시지만, 몇 가지 도전 과제가 존재합니다. 이 도시는 종종 시끄럽고 혼잡할 수 있어 모든 이에게 매력적이지는 않을 수 있습니다. 조용한 산책을 원하신다면 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 거리에서 돌아다니는 것 또한 쉽지 않을 때가 많습니다. 거리의 상황이 자주 붐비고 항상 깔끔하지는 않지만, 그 속에서 풍부한 문화와 역사를 발견할 수 있습니다.

역사적인 이야기들이 담긴 멋진 묘소와 요새들은 꼭 방문해 보시길 추천드립니다. 그리고 음식이 정말 맛있어요! 길거리 음식부터 현지 레스토랑까지, 델리는 다양한 선택지를 제공하며, 가격도 매우 저렴합니다. 야경은 활기차지만 대부분 일찍 끝나니 이 점도 고려해 두세요.

대중교통은 다소 혼란스러울 수 있지만, 조금만 인내심을 가지고 이용하시면 됩니다. 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있지만, 친절한 델리 사람들의 성향이 이를 잘 보완해줍니다. 지역 시장이나 역사적인 장소를 방문하든, 델리는 확실히 여러분에게 잊지 못할 경험을 선사할 것입니다!

reviews: Overall, a pretty great place. Good restaurants and many breweries. Solid entertainment. It has all four seasons and lots of sunshine. Some homelessness issues downtown, like most cities.
denver.description:
Denver is a city that balances city life and outdoor activities. It has many restaurants and a busy craft beer scene, so people who enjoy food and drinks will feel comfortable. The city gets a lot of sunshine and has four seasons, which means there is always something to do, from winter hikes to summer festivals.

Denver has interesting places to visit and offers entertainment, such as art areas and music venues. However, there are some things to consider. Some downtown areas have issues with homelessness, which can be a worry for visitors. On a positive note, the cost of living is reasonable compared to other big cities, but some neighborhoods may be more expensive.

Getting around can be a bit hard if you only use public transport, so having a car or planning your journey ahead is a good idea. Check out neighborhoods like LoDo or Capitol Hill for a glimpse of local culture, and remember to enjoy the beautiful mountain views! Just stay aware and make the most of what Denver has to offer.
denver.description_kor:
덴버는 도시 생활과 야외 활동이 조화롭게 어우러진 곳입니다. 다양한 식당과 활발한 수제 맥주 문화 덕분에 음식과 음료를 즐기는 사람들은 편안하게 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 햇살이 가득하고 사계절이 뚜렷해 겨울엔 하이킹을, 여름엔 축제를 즐길 수 있는 다양한 활동이 항상 준비되어 있습니다.

덴버에는 방문할 만한 흥미로운 장소가 많고, 예술 지구와 음악 공연장 등 다양한 엔터테인먼트도 제공되어 즐길거리가 넘쳐납니다. 다만, 몇 가지 주의할 점이 있습니다. 일부 다운타운 지역에서는 노숙자 문제가 있어 방문객들이 걱정할 수 있는 부분입니다. 하지만 생활비는 다른 대도시에 비해 상대적으로 합리적인 편이며, 일부 동네는 가격이 더 비쌀 수도 있습니다.

대중교통만 이용할 경우 이동이 다소 불편할 수 있으니, 차량을 이용하거나 미리 여정을 계획하는 것이 좋습니다. 로도(LoDo)나 캐피톨 힐(Capitol Hill) 같은 동네를 탐방하며 지역 문화를 경험해보는 것도 좋고, 아름다운 산 풍경도 만끽하는 것을 잊지 마세요! 항상 주의를 기울이며 덴버의 매력을 만끽하시길 바랍니다.

reviews:
Deventer: A Charming Escape with Small-Town Heart.

Deventer is a city that captures your heart with its charm. It's not a metropolis, but that small-town feel is precisely what gives Deventer its unique character. In recent years, the city has been buzzing with a growing selection of shops and restaurants and small little niche stores!

One of my favorite things to do in Deventer is to visit the bustling Saturday market. It's a feast for the senses, with local vendors offering everything from fresh produce and flowers to handcrafted goods. I also love to stroll through the city park, a peaceful oasis in the heart of Deventer.

Whether you're visiting for a day of shopping, a culinary adventure, or simply to soak up the relaxed atmosphere, Deventer has something for everyone. The weekly markets on Fridays and Saturdays are a true delight, showcasing local produce and crafts. And for those working remotely: Deventer offers plenty of inspiring spots to set up your laptop, including the vibrant Havenkwartier, a creative hub with trendy cafes and unique shops.

The city has become a magnet for people escaping the hustle and bustle of the big city's Such as Amsterdam or Rotterdam, without sacrificing vibrancy. 
The entrepreneurial spirit is thriving, adding to Deventer's dynamism.
 And as soon as the sun comes out you can enjoy at the IJssel River, where you can unwind and enjoy the views.

Deventer is a hidden gem that hasn't yet been overrun by tourists. A city where you immediately feel at home and where there's always something new to discover. An undiscovered pearl that's definitely worth a visit!
deventer.description:
Deventer is located in the middle of the Netherlands. It has a nice mixture of being friendly and lively, which makes it a good place to escape from larger cities. Visitors enjoy its small-town feel, where you can easily walk through streets with interesting shops and restaurants. The Saturday market is popular, offering fresh food, flowers, and handmade items all in one spot.

Walking through the city park is a nice way to relax, especially when you want to take a break. If you are working remotely, the Havenkwartier has cafes where you can set up your laptop and enjoy the environment.

While Deventer has many things to offer, some people may find public transportation not as good as in bigger cities. The cost of living is lower than in Amsterdam or Rotterdam, making it a good place to live or visit. With nice views by the IJssel River, Deventer is a hidden gem waiting to be found—great for anyone looking for a friendly and relaxed place!
deventer.description_kor:
데벤터는 네덜란드 중앙에 위치한 매력적인 도시입니다. 친절하고 활기찬 분위기가 조화를 이루어 대도시에서 벗어나기 좋은 곳이죠. 방문객들은 흥미로운 상점과 맛있는 레스토랑들이 늘어선 거리에서 편안하게 산책하며 소도시의 매력을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 특히 토요일 시장은 신선한 식품, 아름다운 꽃, 수공예 아이템 등을 한꺼번에 구매할 수 있어 많은 사랑을 받고 있습니다.

시립 공원을 걷는 것은 여유를 즐기기에 완벽한 방법이며, 잠시 숨을 고르고 싶을 때 특히 좋습니다. 원격 근무 중이라면 하벤크바르티에 지역의 카페에서 노트북을 펼치고 편안한 환경 속에서 일할 수도 있습니다.

데벤터는 많은 장점이 있지만, 일부 사람들은 대도시에 비해 대중교통이 다소 불편하다고 느낄 수 있습니다. 그러나 생활비는 암스테르담이나 로테르담보다는 낮아서 살기 좋은 곳이거나 방문하기에 적합한 장소랍니다. 아이셀 강 근처에서 멋진 경치를 바라보고, 친근하고 편안한 환경을 찾는 이들에게 데벤터는 꼭 발견해야 할 숨겨진 보석입니다!

reviews: East Timor is a beautiful country if you travel from Dili to Beaco it's some of the most beautiful scenery i have ever seen. Dili isn't the prettiest cities, lots of poverty. Internet is the worst, and your roaming mobile service will not work. even if you get a local sim - it's v.unreliable. I was stressed out trying to find good internet to work here with my job
dili.description:
Dili, the capital of East Timor, has both natural beauty and some problems. The trip from Dili to Beaco shows some very nice landscapes, but Dili itself has different aspects. Many visitors say the city is not very attractive and shows signs of poverty.

On the positive side, the local culture is lively, and you can learn about its history and meet friendly people. However, if you need the internet for work, be ready for some difficulties—many have had issues with slow connections, whether using local SIM cards or roaming services.

Public transportation is not always good, so it is wise to have a plan for getting around. Look for areas near the waterfront for more activity. Also, be aware that language differences can occur, so learning some local phrases can help! Overall, Dili is a unique place with its own charm, but be ready to deal with both its good and bad sides.
dili.description_kor:
딜리, 동티모르의 수도는 자연의 아름다움과 몇 가지 문제를 동시에 안고 있는 도시입니다. 딜리에서 베아코까지 이어지는 여행은 환상적인 경치를 선사하지만, 딜리 자체는 다양한 면모를 보여줍니다. 많은 방문객들은 이 도시가 그리 매력적이지 않으며, 빈곤의 흔적이 보인다고 말하곤 합니다.

긍정적인 점으로는 현지 문화가 매우 활기차고, 그 역사를 배우는 과정에서 친절한 사람들을 만날 수 있다는 점입니다. 하지만 일이 필요하여 인터넷을 사용해야 한다면 몇 가지 어려움에 대비해야 할 필요가 있습니다. 지역 SIM 카드나 로밍 서비스를 이용하는 많은 사람들이 느린 인터넷 속도에 고충을 겪었다는 이야기를 많이 듣습니다.

또한 대중교통 상황이 항상 좋지는 않기 때문에, 이동 계획을 미리 세우는 것이 현명합니다. 더 많은 활동을 원하신다면 해안 근처의 지역을 탐방해보는 것도 좋습니다. 그리고 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니, 현지에서 자주 쓰이는 표현 몇 가지를 배워두면 많은 도움이 될 것입니다! 전반적으로 딜리는 독특한 매력을 지닌 장소지만, 긍정적인 면과 부정적인 면 모두를 잘 헤쳐 나갈 준비가 필요합니다.

reviews: Don´t go. Pollution, traffic ,not safe... no fun.. bad experience.
dhaka.description:
Dhaka is a busy city with a lot happening, so it’s good to know what to expect! Many visitors talk about the heavy traffic that can make getting around difficult. The pollution is another common issue, so if you are sensitive to air quality, consider wearing a mask.

On the positive side, Dhaka has a lively culture with a rich history and active street life. The food is great—street food is available everywhere, and you should try the biryani! Visit the local markets to experience the atmosphere, but be prepared for crowds.

In terms of safety, it’s important to stay alert, especially in busy places. Public transportation is available, but it can be limited, so many find it a bit hard to navigate the city.

If you choose to visit, consider staying in areas like Gulshan or Banani for a more comfortable stay. Be careful while exploring, use ride-sharing services, and keep a sense of adventure!
dhaka.description_kor:
다카는 다양한 일들이 일어나는 분주한 도시이기 때문에 사전에 무엇을 준비해야 할지 아는 것이 중요합니다! 많은 방문객들이 심각한 교통 체증 때문에 이동이 어렵다고 이야기합니다. 공기질에 민감하신 분들은 오염 문제도 빈번한 이슈라 마스크를 챙기는 것이 좋습니다.

긍정적인 측면으로는, 다카가 풍부한 역사와 활기찬 거리 문화로 가득한 도시라는 점입니다. 음식 또한 매력적인데, 특히 길거리 음식은 어디서나 쉽게 찾아볼 수 있습니다. 비리야니는 꼭 맛보시길 권합니다! 현지 시장을 방문해서 그곳의 분위기를 만끽해보세요. 다만, 인파에 대비하는 것은 필수입니다.

안전을 위해서는 특히 혼잡한 장소에서는 항상 경각심을 가지고 있어야 합니다. 대중교통이 있으나 제한적일 수 있어 많은 사람들이 도시를 탐험하는 데 어려움을 겪기도 합니다.

방문하시기로 결심하신다면, 굴샨이나 바나니 같은 지역에서 좀 더 편안한 숙소를 찾는 것을 추천드립니다. 탐험할 때는 조심하시고, 차량 공유 서비스를 이용하며, 모험심을 잃지 마세요!

reviews: I suggest you go the people are nice and I love the Djibouti Palace Kempinski it is very nice! I LOVE it ♥
djibouti.description:
Djibouti is a city that is easy to love because of its friendly people. If you want a nice place to stay, the Djibouti Palace Kempinski is a good option. Guests often talk about the great views and good service, making it a nice spot to relax after seeing the city. The cost of living can be high, so it is important to plan your budget.

Getting around can sometimes be hard because there are few public transport options, but many people find that walking or taking taxis is good for short distances. It feels safe, and you can walk through areas like Balbala or downtown and see the local culture.

Also, if you don’t speak French or Arabic, it may be a bit hard to communicate, but local people are usually friendly and willing to help. Enjoy the mix of cultures and tasty food – you will have a great time in Djibouti!
djibouti.description_kor:
지부티는 친절한 사람들 덕분에 사랑스러운 도시입니다. 편안한 숙소를 원하신다면 지부티 팰리스 켐핀스키를 추천합니다. 많은 손님들이 멋진 전망과 훌륭한 서비스에 대해 칭찬하며, 도시 탐방 후 편히 쉴 수 있는 좋은 곳으로 손꼽습니다. 생활비가 꽤 높을 수 있으니 예산 계획에 신경 쓰는 것이 중요합니다.

대중교통이 다소 불편할 수 있지만, 짧은 거리는 걸어 다니거나 택시를 이용하는 것이 좋습니다. 안전하게 느껴지며, 발발라나 시내 같은 지역에서는 현지 문화를 체험할 수 있습니다.

또한, 프랑스어나 아라비아어에 익숙하지 않다면 의사소통에 어려움이 있을 수 있지만, 현지인들은 대부분 친절하고 도움을 주려는 마음이 큽니다. 다양한 문화와 맛있는 음식을 만끽하시고, 지부티에서 멋진 시간을 보내시길 바랍니다!

reviews: Doha's skyline is undeniably impressive, a collection of gleaming skyscrapers that showcase the city's modern side. However, as a female traveler, I encountered situations that made me feel unsafe. The nature of unwanted attention I received was unsettling, and differed from my experiences in Dubai. This feeling of unease was further amplified by witnessing several public arguments escalate quickly, even over seemingly trivial matters. One particularly disturbing incident involved two men who went from arguing to one punching the other, knocking him unconscious. It's important to acknowledge that travel experiences are subjective, and I encourage others to research Doha's diverse neighborhoods to determine if it aligns with their comfort level and travel style.

How TF is this on Nomadlist? No one in their right mind should live there. In fact, everyone living there is either: Qatari, a desperate immigrant being paid peanuts for a shitty job, or a wealthy expat looking to pay 0% tax. The vibe is strange, like everyone knows everyone else is there for money. I've met some super desperate immigrants who told me horror stories. Please, don't support this place, spend your time and money elsewhere.

Doha is livable for sure, pricier than other nomad destinations. Kind of need to really look to find decent places to live at decent prices. But I'll hand it to Doha, very safe city even at night. For the most part Doha is an expat city, hardly any actual Qatari citizens. As with being well developed, wifi speeds are nothing to complain about but it also can depend on your host. Maybe not stay at the Pearl Island if you want to find a decent place to stay at a decent price.

Nightlife here absolutely sucks though, very limited options that often are inside a hotel that requires a metal detector. Seems more like the go-to nightlife activity is to smoke Hookah rather than drink.

I had a lot of preconceptions about Doha when I arrived but everything was great. It's clean, safe, almost everyone was nice and helpful. 90% of people working here aren't Qatari but are from Philippines, Nepal, Bangladesh, India and Pakistan. People aren't judgemental here but just minding their own own business, even if you're not muslim etc. The food quality is good. Even at a random museum you get fresh food. The only bad thing I can think of was the air quality, but we didn't really notice it except for it showing on the AQI apps that it was bad. Maybe it's just dust from the dust storms? Not sure. Airport is amazing and very new too. All buildings are very new and modern. Lots of activities like desert buggy driving, jetski'ing on water. I do wonder long term if you could live here as the expat scene might not be as big as Dubai. Anyway very nice altogeher.
doha.description:
Doha is a city that combines modern features with local customs. Its skyline has many tall buildings that give a feeling of a futuristic place. Many visitors like the cleanliness and safety, especially at night, but some have faced uncomfortable situations, especially women who mentioned receiving unwanted attention and witnessing public arguments.

Living in Doha can be expensive compared to other cities, and finding good places to stay may require some work. Most people living here are from countries like India and the Philippines, which adds a mix of cultures but can sometimes feel business-like. Nightlife choices are few, mostly found in hotels, where smoking hookah is more common than drinking alcohol.

Public transportation is not very widespread, so it's important to plan. However, the locals are friendly and willing to help, and many are surprised by the good quality of food even at simple places. If you enjoy activities like dune buggy rides or jet skiing, Doha will meet your expectations. Just be ready for a different experience as you explore this fast-growing city!
doha.description_kor:
도하는 현대적 요소와 지역 문화를 잘 조화시킨 매력적인 도시입니다. 고층 건물이 즐비한 스카이라인은 미래지향적인 분위기를 자아냅니다. 많은 방문객들이 특히 밤에 도시의 깨끗함과 안전함을 즐기지만, 일부는 불편한 경험을 하기도 했습니다. 특히 여성들은 원치 않는 시선이나 공개적인 갈등을 겪었다고 전했습니다.

도하에서의 생활은 다른 도시들에 비해 다소 비쌀 수 있으며, 좋은 숙소를 찾기 위해서는 어느 정도 노력이 필요할 수 있습니다. 이곳에 거주하는 대다수는 인도나 필리핀 출신으로, 다양한 문화가 잘 어우러져 있지만 가끔은 비즈니스적 분위기도 느껴집니다. 나이트라이프 선택지는 그리 많지 않지만, 대부분의 호텔에서 즐길 수 있으며, 술보다는 후카를 즐기는 사람들이 더 많습니다.

대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있지 않기 때문에 사전에 계획을 세우는 것이 중요합니다. 하지만 지역 주민들은 매우 친절하며 도움을 주려는 마음이 큽니다. 간단한 식당에서도 음식의 품질이 높다는 점에 많은 사람들이 놀라곤 합니다. 사막에서의 오프로드 차량 운전이나 제트 스키와 같은 액티비티를 즐길 계획이라면 도하에서 만족스러운 경험을 할 수 있을 것입니다. 이 빠르게 발전하는 도시를 탐험하면서 특별한 경험을 할 준비를 해보세요!

reviews: Visited in February of 2019, the week before Carnival. Great time to visit as there were hardly any tourists and only a few other travelers. Downside is a lot of the restaurants aren't open and some tours are shut down. Upside is you get to live like a local in a insanely touristy town 10 months of the year. We were able to grab a very nice 1 bedroom apartment in the old town center with a kitchen for 150 euros for 5 nights (30 euros/n). Probably 10-15 restaurants were open in the old town, including the main grocery store. It appeared most everything was getting ready to open for Carnival, which probably marks the end of the lowest season (Few days after New Year's to Carnival). We did all the touristy stuff, and saw no other International travelers but a few random couples and one Chinese tour bus that overnighted (Right as COVID was taking hold...) We walked the walls and saw less than 20 people in 2 hours. If you want to avoid the crowds you can't beat Dubrovnik in the winter.

1. Dubrovnik is in Republic of Croatia and Croatia is among FIRST SIX COUNTRIES IN THE WORLD that legally regulated 12 month visas for Digital nomads.
2. When this Town (under name of Ragusa) was independent state it was The first country in the world that officially recognize independency of the USA. Historic heritage of this town is enormous so there is plenty amazing things to see and learn.
3. During last year Dubrovnik was almost COVID-19 FREE ZONE with extra small numbers of infections and deaths.
4. Local inhabitants fluently speak English and German and are good in Italian or French. Foreign languages are learnt from grade school up to the University. 
5. All major internet providers, bank offices, exchange offices and lot of ATMs are present in the city.
6. Credit cards and POS machines are present in almost every shop, caffe, restaurant and taxi.
7. Food is very tasty and often made from local vegetables and fresh fish and shells. You can find numerous cheap fast food as well as Michelin star restaurants.
8. Safety is exceptional in all parts of the city. Men, women or children can stroll the streets in any time of the day and night. Crime is much lower than in other parts of the region.
9. During late fall and early winter city is 'hibernating' its peak tourist season activities, just lite every other Mediterranean tourists spot, but during December, January, February and Spring, open spaces are filled with Christmas season, Saint Blasius (Patron of the city) festivities and celebration of Easter. So, it is always something to wait and enjoy.
10. Dubrovnik is located close to the borders of Montenegro and Bosnia and Hezegovina so You have possibility for short excursions to explore their towns and attractions. 
11. There is lot of interesting islands around town to visit. All with good internet speed and numerous scheduled boat lines so there is possible to combine work and pleasure.
12. During cold days local citizens on average heat only one room in the house or apartment. So there is much smaller offer or central heated houses or apartments, compared with offer during warm summer season. If heating is available heat air is available mostly from air condition units. 
13. Local people are very polite but it takes time to earn their trust. 
14. Another important information: its possible that Your perception of time differs from local perception of time. So arm yourself with patience when you need or ask for services, because something that in Your 'language' means 'Fast like-Today' in their 'language' could mean 'Fast like: This week'. 
15. Community is not very LGBTQ+ friendly but with long tradition in tourism industry they learned to tolerate it.
16. City, suburban and and intercity public transportation is well organized and reasonably priced.
17. Besides souvenir and jeweler shops there is a small number of shops for shoes, apparel, computers, sport goods etc. Choice is not rich and prices are higher than in the other parts of Croatia.
18. From May till end of October You may expect warm see ideal for sun tanning, swimming and other water sports.
19. Traditional Family connections and community care for children is very strong and evolved. Therefore Dubrovnik is declared to be 'City for Kids'. That stands for network of well equipped nurseries, elementary schools, high schools as well as lot of different sport and art activities. 
20. Croatia is member of the European Union so citizens of the EU have all rights as in any other EU country.
dubrovnik.description:
If you are looking for a historic place to visit, Dubrovnik in Croatia is worth seeing. It is known as the "Pearl of the Adriatic," and it has ancient walls and great views, which many travelers enjoy. If you visit in February, you will avoid the crowds and experience local life in this popular location. Keep in mind that many restaurants may be closed, but the few that are open serve tasty dishes with fresh fish and local ingredients.

Safety is good here; you can walk around the streets at any time. The locals are nice and speak several languages, which makes it easy to communicate. If you want to work and have fun, there are good internet connections and nearby islands to visit.

While living costs can be high, you might find good deals on places to stay, especially in the off-season. You could also enjoy one of the many local festivals for a memorable visit. Just remember that local time can be a bit relaxed, so bring some patience! Whether you explore the historic Old Town or relax in the sun, Dubrovnik offers a special experience.
dubrovnik.description_kor:
역사적인 여행지를 찾고 있다면, 크로아티아의 두브로브닉은 꼭 가봐야 할 곳입니다. "아드리아 해의 진주"로 알려진 두브로브닉은 고대 성벽과 아름다운 경치를 자랑하며 많은 여행자들에게 사랑받고 있습니다. 2월에 방문하면 인파를 피하고 이 인기 있는 장소에서 현지인들의 일상도 경험할 수 있습니다. 다만, 많은 식당들이 문을 닫을 수 있으니 유의하시길 바랍니다. 그러나 몇몇 식당은 여전히 운영 중이며, 신선한 생선과 지역 재료로 만든 맛있는 요리를 즐길 수 있습니다.

두브로브닉은 안전한 장소로, 언제든지 거리에서 자유롭게 걸어 다닐 수 있습니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하며 여러 언어를 구사해 소통이 용이합니다. 일과 여가를 동시에 즐기고 싶다면, 좋은 인터넷 연결이 가능한 곳에서 일하면서 인근 섬들도 방문해보세요.

생활비는 다소 높을 수 있지만, 비수기에는 저렴한 숙소를 찾기 쉽습니다. 또한, 기억에 남는 여행을 위해 지역 축제 중 하나에 참여해보는 것도 좋습니다. 단, 현지 시간은 다소 여유로울 수 있으니 인내심을 가지셔야 합니다. 역사적인 구시가지를 탐험하든, 해변에서 휴식을 취하든, 두브로브닉에서 특별한 경험을 만들어보세요.

reviews: I lived for 2.5 months in Kumbo, hours outside of Doula, in summer (their winter) 2009, doing feminist humanitarian aid work. If I could go back in time, I never would have gone as I developed chronic fatigue syndrome for 4.5 years starting during this trip, due to overvaccinating (several tropical diseases injected into me in a short time), the Malarone effects, poor diet, stress, etc. I stopped by Doula for a one night stay both when I arrived and when I left. Do not give men at the airport money. Don't let anyone handle your suitcases. Guys came out wearing (fake) uniforms, then repeatedly demanded money from me. I eventually told them in French to "leave me alone," which worked, but the cab drivers took my luggage even though I told them I was waiting for the hotel to pick me up (hotels should do this, I used Ibis and it was very clean and comfortable, with hot water). The woman working at Ibis told me not to go outside at all, even during the day. (I was traveling alone.) An activist I met in Kumbo said they knew someone who was robbed at knife point at 11 a.m. in Doula. I had black stuff coming out of my nose after the bus ride through town from the pollution being so bad. The airport demanded more money when I returned, and I honestly couldn't tell if it was legit, the guy kept insisting and they even had a booth. Living in Kumbo, I was one of only about 10 white people I saw the entire time I was in Cameroon. It took three days to travel between there and Doula. I felt much more comfortable in the small town, but was often lectured by older men about not greeting properly (once said "hey" to my friend and he berated me for being so casual until I started crying). I had stomach spasms from eating and developed a rash from the dirty water (though there are clean water sources, I just chose to use the shower instead of a bucket). I spoke French in Doula and English in the Northwest region, I'm not sure if many people speak English in Doula or not. I met people who'd gotten malaria while staying in Cameroon, and people waited to take malaria pills till after they got sick, since it's the same pill (which is what I'd do in hindsight). Overall, it was the most culture shock I've ever had and a very challenging experience. As far as I know, people only traveled there to help social causes like I was (the Peacecorps has a presence), not for tourism. I'm not sure how it is now, but in 2009, I had to go to a (pretty slow) internet cafe, didn't have internet at home (though I believe they had it in the Doula Ibis hotel), and there were days-long electricity outages. So I don't know that it would make sense for a digital nomad long term.
douala.description:
Douala, Cameroon’s economic center, offers a mix of experiences, but it has its challenges. Visitors often notice the busy atmosphere of the city, with its markets and street life full of activity. You will find attractions like the arts scene, but remember that getting around Douala can be difficult due to language barriers—French is the main language spoken.

The cost of living can be high in some places, especially in hotels like Ibis, which many travelers find clean and nice. However, it's important to stay aware; some reviews suggest being careful with your belongings and not letting others handle your bags, especially at the airport. Safety can be an issue, so it’s best to stay in crowded areas, even during the day.

While public transportation may be limited, there are some options, but traveling around might take some time. Learn about the local customs and interact with the friendly Cameroonians, but be ready for some cultural surprises. Douala is a complex city with its own appeal, so just be smart about your travel and enjoy the experiences—both good and challenging!
douala.description_kor:
도우알라, 카메룬의 경제 중심지는 다양한 경험을 선사합니다. 하지만 몇 가지 도전 과제도 존재합니다. 방문객들은 흔히 바쁜 도시의 시장과 활기찬 거리 생활을 느낄 수 있습니다. 예술 현장과 같은 관광 명소도 있지만, 도우알라에서 이동하는 것이 언어 장벽 때문에 어려울 수 있다는 점을 알아두세요. 프랑스어가 주로 사용되는 언어입니다.

일부 장소에서는 생활비가 다소 높을 수 있으며, 많은 여행자들이 깨끗하고 편안하다고 느끼는 이비스 같은 호텔에서 특히 그렇습니다. 하지만 주의가 필요합니다. 일부 리뷰에서는 자신의 소지품을 잘 챙기고, 특히 공항에서 다른 사람에게 가방을 맡기지 말라고 경고합니다. 안전 문제도 있을 수 있으니, 가능하면 낮에는 붐비는 지역에 위치하는 것이 좋습니다.

대중교통 수단은 제한적일 수 있지만 몇 가지 옵션이 있으며 이동하는 데 시간이 걸릴 수 있습니다. 현지 문화에 대해 배우고 친근한 카메룬인들과 소통해 보세요. 하지만 문화적 차이에 대비하는 것도 중요합니다. 도우알라는 복잡한 매력을 가진 도시이므로, 여행을 현명하게 계획하고 즐거움과 도전 두 가지를 모두 경험하시길 바랍니다!

reviews:
Rent is cheap by German standards. Clean and tidy city, good public transport.
Like the rest of East Germany, it’s full of old people. If you’re under 40, don’t come here. Dresden is a mausoleum.

Old Bricks like chuches, museums and other important buildings: (innere) Altstadt.
Bars & Clubs: (innere) Neustadt.
Shopping: Prager Straße + Altmark-Galerie.
Hookers: Pieschen.
The airport is a joke.

Also: Pegida sucks.
dresden.description:
Dresden is a place that attracts visitors with its historic buildings and lively culture. It is known for its nice old structures, especially in the Altstadt, and walking through the city feels like going back in time. The public transport is dependable and makes traveling around easy, and many believe that rent is reasonable compared to other German cities, which is a good thing.

However, it is good to know that Dresden has a quieter atmosphere, especially for those under 40. If you want lively nightlife, you should visit the bars and clubs in Neustadt, where there is more activity. For shopping, Prager Straße and Altmark-Galerie have a variety of modern shops and unique products.

While the city is clean, some visitors notice a small number of younger people and fewer activities. Also, if you are flying in, keep your expectations low for the airport. It is a nice place for those who enjoy history and peace, but it might not be for everyone. Overall, it is a city full of character waiting to be explored!
dresden.description_kor:
드레스덴은 역사적인 건축물과 풍부한 문화로 많은 방문객을 끌어들이는 매력적인 도시입니다. 특히 올트슈타트 지역의 아름다운 오래된 건물들 덕분에 마치 시간 여행을 하는 듯한 기분을 느낄 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 잘 되어 있어 이동이 편리하며, 다른 독일 도시들에 비해 임대료도 합리적이라는 점은 큰 장점입니다.

하지만 드레스덴은 특히 40세 이하의 젊은 층에게는 조용한 분위기일 수 있다는 점을 염두에 두는 것이 좋습니다. 활기찬 밤문화를 즐기고 싶다면, 노이슈타트에 있는 바와 클럽으로 가야 할 것입니다. 쇼핑을 원하신다면 프라게르 스트라세와 알트마르크 갤러리에서 다양한 현대 상점과 독특한 아이템을 만나볼 수 있습니다.

도시는 전반적으로 깨끗한 편이지만, 일부 방문객들은 젊은 사람들의 수가 적고 활동이 다소 부족하다고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 비행기로 오시는 경우에는 공항에 대한 기대를 조금 낮추시는 것이 좋습니다. 역사와 평화를 중시하는 분들에게는 적합한 곳이지만, 모든 이에게 맞는 도시라고는 할 수 없겠네요. 전반적으로 탐방할 준비가 된 독특한 매력을 지닌 도시입니다!

reviews: Lot's of great little eating places hidden around. the food style is much different than Johannesburg.
durban.description:
Durban is a lively city with a warm coastal atmosphere. It is known for its good food spots found in unexpected places, offering a different experience compared to Johannesburg. You can enjoy a mix of flavors, from Indian curries to fresh seafood, making it a great place for food lovers.

The cost of living is lower than in some bigger cities, but public transportation may not be very extensive, so having your own car can make it easier to explore. Safety can be a concern in some areas, so it's best to stay aware and stick to busier places, especially at night.

Durban has a lot of culture, with nice beaches and attractions like uShaka Marine World. You should also experience the local customs and the friendly nature of the people—talking with a local can be rewarding! If you plan to visit, check out neighborhoods like Umhlanga and Glenwood for a taste of everyday life. Just remember to bring some cash for those great little eateries!
durban.description_kor:
더반은 따뜻한 해변의 느낌이 물씬 나는 활기찬 도시입니다. 이곳은 의외의 장소에서 맛있는 음식점을 발견할 수 있는 곳으로 유명하며, 요하네스버그와는 색다른 경험을 제공합니다. 인도 카레부터 신선한 해산물까지 다양한 음식을 즐길 수 있어 음식 애호가들에게 정말 좋은 장소입니다.

생활비는 일부 대도시에 비해 저렴하지만, 대중교통이 그리 발달해 있지 않아서 차량을 소유하면 더 편하게 돌아다닐 수 있습니다. 안전 문제에 대한 우려가 있는 지역도 있으니, 특히 밤에는 주의하고 사람들이 많은 곳에 머무르는 것이 좋습니다.

더반은 멋진 해변과 우샤카 마린 월드 같은 유명 명소가 있어 문화적으로도 풍부한 곳입니다. 현지인들과의 교류를 통해 그들의 친절한 성격을 경험해보는 것도 좋은 경험이 될 것입니다. 방문할 계획이 있다면, 움흘랑가와 글렌우드 같은 동네를 둘러보며 일상의 분위기를 느껴보세요. 맛있는 작은 식당을 찾으실 때 현금을 준비하는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews: My favorite tiny big city! Everything super close together, but a massive breadth of culture, activities, neighborhoods.
dusseldorf.description:
Düsseldorf is a small city that attracts you with its close community and lively culture. Visitors often say that everything is easy to reach by walking—great for those who like to explore on foot! You can enjoy a mix of culture, shops, and welcoming neighborhoods, each with its own character.

The Altstadt, or Old Town, is a place you should visit with its busy bars and restaurants, while the Rhine River promenade is nice for relaxing in the sun. The city has some oddities, though. Some people say that living costs can be high, and while public transportation is good, it may not reach every place you want to see.

Language can also be a difficulty, but many locals are nice and ready to help. If you’re visiting, try local food and enjoy art at the many galleries. Düsseldorf is a special city that feels both comfortable and modern—great for anyone wanting to experience Germany!
dusseldorf.description_kor:
뒤셀도르프는 아기자기한 커뮤니티와 활기찬 문화로 가득한 매력적인 작은 도시입니다. 방문객들은 이곳이 모든 것이 도보로 쉽게 접근 가능하다고 자주 이야기하는데, 이는 걷기를 좋아하는 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다! 다양한 문화와 개성 넘치는 동네의 상점들을 마음껏 탐방할 수 있습니다.

구시가지인 알트슈타트(Altstadt)는 바와 레스토랑으로 붐비는 명소로 꼭 방문해야 할 곳이며, 라인 강 산책로는 따뜻한 햇살 아래에서 여유롭게 휴식을 취하기 좋은 장소입니다. 물론 이 도시는 몇 가지 고유한 특징도 가지고 있습니다. 생활비가 좀 높은 편이라는 의견도 있으며, 대중교통은 괜찮지만 원하는 곳에 다닐 수 없을 수도 있습니다.

언어 장벽이 있을 수 있지만, 많은 현지인들이 친절하고 도움을 주고자 합니다. 방문할 때는 현지 음식을 꼭 맛보고, 다양한 갤러리에서 예술을 즐기는 것도 잊지 마세요. 뒤셀도르프는 편안함과 현대적인 매력을 겸비한 특별한 도시로, 독일을 경험하고 싶은 누구에게나 아주 좋은 선택입니다!

reviews: Compared to other Canadian cities rent is affordable, but it's unfortunately such a depressive place to live, due to the harsh and long winters. You get about 2-3 months of fantastic weather, and between 5-8 months of absolutely oppressive cold. It has some decent local culture for its size, but a distinct lack of fun nightlife. Public transit is absolutely horrendous. People can be a bit close-minded. Quality of life is otherwise comparable to other big NA cities. Taxes are on the low side. It's very out of the way - there's no real reason to come here as a tourist because Calgary is closer to everything interesting.
edmonton.description:
Edmonton, sometimes considered a less well-known city in Canada, has a mix of experiences, with both good and bad points. On the positive side, rent is cheaper than in other Canadian cities, which is helpful if you want to live there without spending too much. You can also expect about 2-3 months of nice weather, which is great for outdoor activities and enjoying the sunshine.

On the downside, winters are long and very cold, which can be tough. Many visitors say the nightlife in the city is limited, making it hard to find evening activities. Public transportation needs work, so having a car might be a good idea.

Culturally, there are some local places to visit, but it might feel quieter than in larger cities. The community atmosphere varies; some locals are friendly, while others can be less open. If you visit, take time to explore the neighborhoods and appreciate local traditions, but remember that it is a quieter place compared to cities like Calgary!
edmonton.description_kor:
에드먼튼은 때때로 캐나다에서 덜 알려진 도시로 여겨지지만, 긍정적인 면과 부정적인 면이 혼재된 다양한 경험을 제공합니다. 우선, 임대료가 다른 캐나다 도시들에 비해 상대적으로 저렴해 경제적인 부담 없이 거주할 수 있다는 장점이 있습니다. 또한, 약 2-3개월간 쾌적한 날씨를 경험할 수 있어 야외 활동과 햇볕을 즐기기에 아주 좋습니다.

하지만 겨울은 길고 매우 추워서 힘들 수 있습니다. 많은 방문객들은 이 도시의 야간 생활이 다소 제한적이라고 느끼며, 저녁에 할 거리를 찾기가 쉽지 않다고 전합니다. 대중교통이 개선될 필요가 있어, 자동차를 소유하는 것이 현명할 수 있습니다.

문화적으로는 방문할 만한 명소들이 있지만, 상대적으로 더 큰 도시들에 비해 조용하다는 느낌이 들 수 있습니다. 지역 사회의 분위기는 다양하며, 일부 주민들은 매우 친절하지만, 다른 이들은 덜 개방적일 수 있습니다. 방문할 때는 이웃을 탐험하고 지역 전통을 즐기는 시간을 가지되, 캘거리에 비해 상대적으로 조용한 도시라는 점을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Love Edinburgh. A very historic place that's just generally lovely to enjoy! It's actually not as Scottish as Glasgow. There is a huge English population, as well as many other cultures. A lovely city to spends hours walking around.

LOVED my stay in Edinburgh! This was my very first stop as a nomad and I stayed here for a month with my partner. The city is so beautiful and has so much character. Everything just felt very easy, as previous people have mentioned, it's super walkable, great wifi, good bus system, amazing trails for running/biking, and lots to do. I'd recommend staying a round Cannon Mills or the Stock Bridge area. We stayed there and it was a nice, quite and more residential part of town, but was only a 20-30 min walk to a lot of the cool sites and attractions around the city, if you're doing a longer stay, somewhere a little further away from the business of the Royal Mile would probably be idea. 

The only cons would be exactly what others mentioned – a bit more expensive, and not a ton of other nomads, and maybe the cooler, rainier weather (though in our experience, the rain storms were short-lived and much less frequent than we were lead to believe). 

Overall, my partner and I were both absolutely in love with this city and are still talking about it now, months later. Definitely will be returning here!

Edinburgh is one of my favorite cities and I've spent quite a bit of time here. It's charming, friendly, beautiful, and walkable, and has a range of cafes and coffeeshops with fast wifi. The downsides: it's pretty expensive (housing especially), and there doesn't seem to be much of a nomad scene. The general tech scene seems to be smallish but growing (CodeBase seems cool), but not many nomads seem to come here.

Edinburgh is one of my favourite places in the world. I've lived here for a few months twice now, but unfortunately the nomad scene isn't great. 

If you're looking for a nice spot that's super walkable, has lots of parks/green space, and isn't too expensive, Edinburgh is great! If you're looking for great coworking spaces or to meet lots of other nomads, Edinburgh currently isn't the place to do that.
edinburgh.description:
Edinburgh is a city with a lot of history that can really attract you. It’s not just any Scottish city; it has a lively mix of cultures, including many English people. One of the best things? You can spend hours walking around its nice streets, parks, and historical sites.

The city is easy to walk in, making it enjoyable to explore. If you want a quieter area, neighborhoods like Canon Mills and Stock Bridge are good – just a 20-30 minute walk to all the main attractions. Edinburgh does have some downsides; housing can be expensive, and the weather can be cooler and rainier than you might like. But usually, the rain does not last long.

For those considering spending some time here, remember the café scene has good Wi-Fi and you can enjoy some nice trails. Just don’t expect a busy coworking community or many other travelers around. With its nice views and friendly locals, Edinburgh is sure to impress you, just like it has for many before you!
edinburgh.description_kor:
에든버러는 매력적인 역사를 지닌 도시로, 여러분을 사로잡을 많은 요소가 있습니다. 이곳은 단순한 스코틀랜드의 도시가 아니라 다양한 문화가 조화를 이루는 활기찬 곳으로, 많은 영국인들도 이곳에 살고 있습니다. 그리고 가장 좋은 점은 초콜릿같이 아름다운 거리와 공원, 역사적인 명소를 거닐며 여유로운 시간을 보낼 수 있다는 것입니다.

이 도시는 걷기 쉽고 탐험하기에 정말 즐거운 곳입니다. 조용한 분위기를 원하신다면 카논 밀스나 스톡 브리지 같은 동네를 추천합니다. 이곳은 주요 명소까지 도보로 20-30분 거리에 있어 이동이 편리합니다. 하지만 에든버러에도 몇 가지 불편한 점이 있습니다. 주택 비용이 비쌀 수 있고, 날씨가 예상보다 쌀쌀하거나 비가 오기 쉬운 편입니다. 다만 비는 보통 오랜 시간 지속되지 않으니 걱정하지 않으셔도 됩니다.

에든버러에서 시간을 보내고자 하는 분들은 카페에서 무료 와이파이를 즐기며 편안한 산책로를 경험할 수 있다는 점을 기억하세요. 다만, 바쁜 공동 작업 공간이나 많은 관광객을 기대하지는 않는 게 좋습니다. 환상적인 경치와 친절한 현지인들과 함께 한다면, 에든버러는 여러분에게 잊지 못할 인상을 남길 것입니다!

reviews:
Pros :
* Everyone speaks in English. 
* Nice people, everyone is helpful. 
* Great airport, cheap flights. 
* Nice bars. 

Cons : 
* Weather is bad especially during winter, always cloudy, no sun. 
* Hard to make local friends, people are nice but distant. 
* Quite expensive to eat outside. 
* Most of the stores they don't accept Visa and Mastercard, you need to have Maestro card. 
* Housing is expensive and it's hard to find house.
eindhoven.description:
Eindhoven is a city that has a friendly atmosphere and some unique features. If you like English, you are in luck—everyone here speaks it, which makes getting around easy. The people are known for being helpful, and you can find some nice bars where you can relax. The airport is also good, with cheap flights to other places.

However, there are some challenges. The weather, especially in winter, can be quite dull, with many cloudy days. Making local friends might take a while; while people are nice, they can seem a bit distant. Eating out can be expensive, as dining can cost a lot. Also, remember to bring your Maestro card when shopping, as many places do not accept Visa or Mastercard.

Eindhoven has many cultural activities to enjoy, but keep these things in mind as you explore the city. Finding housing can be difficult, so start looking early!
eindhoven.description_kor:
에인트호번은 친근한 분위기와 몇 가지 특별한 매력을 지닌 도시입니다. 영어를 잘 구사하는 분들에게는 좋은 소식이 있습니다. 여기서는 거의 모든 사람들이 영어를 사용하기 때문에 이동이 매우 편리합니다. 사람들은 친절하기로 유명하며, 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 멋진 바들도 많이 있습니다. 공항 시설도 괜찮고, 다른 지역으로 가는 저렴한 항공편이 마련되어 있습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 도전 과제가 존재합니다. 특히 겨울에는 날씨가 꽤 단조롭고 흐린 날이 많습니다. 지역 친구를 만드는 데에는 시간이 걸릴 수 있는데, 사람들이 다소 친절하긴 하지만 거리를 두는 것처럼 보일 때도 있습니다. 외식하는 비용이 적지 않아서 식사가 꽤 비쌀 수 있습니다. 또한, 쇼핑을 할 때는 Maestro 카드를 꼭 챙기세요. 많은 상점에서 Visa나 Mastercard는 잘 받지 않습니다.

에인트호번에서는 다양한 문화 활동을 즐길 수 있지만, 도시를 탐험하면서 이러한 점들도 고려하시기 바랍니다. 주택을 찾는 것이 쉽지 않을 수 있으니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다!

reviews: Cute fisherman's town + surf. The town is beautiful and laid-back. Loved the mix of locals + wealthy tourists + surfers. It reminded me of Canggu (with its hipsters coffeeshops, everything nearby) + Uluwatu (cliffs, surfer bars & events). It's quite expensive. Very quiet at night. Super nice spots for a surf beginner, and was not that crowded in July. Weather is super mild as well. It's windy, and the water is freezing. The town itself has 3 accessible beaches, always some waves which are quite strong. I would definitely come back for a month or two in summer. Winter must me miserable with the wind & poor insulation the houses have. With a car it should be better as you can move around other towns. We did not see many places to work from. Most cafes don't allow laptops, even the hipster ones like Dear Rose.

The review of the one that said: 

"Surfing capital of Europe, only World Surf Reserve in Europe" Yea, this is actually a negative, why would you want your surf break to be so popular? Ericeira people seem so superficial

"The good thing is Ericeira is quite expensive which keeps the quality of people that can live here quite high" I can't believe someone wrote this, the locals have been quicked out of their land because of this digital noman phenomenon causing a lot of disappointments but someone is actually happy about it, they want to live in their little exclusive western bubble.

"The climate is perfect: it's usually around 20-25C, the winter is very mild" The winter is cold, windy, rainy and sometimes even grey, the water in the ocean is very, very cold, I can see this person is probably from Sweedem, Demark or the Netherland, for them is not so bad, for the rest, is different, you actually see loads of people subletting apartments during winter so they can escape to warmer places.

"During WW2 many people fled from Netherlands, Germany and Sweden to live in Ericeira where there was no war" This is false, neither there is any historical data that proves this, some people just want to justify their laptop colonization

"But you can only go here if you've kinda finished seeing the entire globe and are okay with standing still" Someone made even rules on who can go or not, incredible.

Facts

Surfing capital of Europe, only World Surf Reserve in Europe and the most chill techie beach village you can imagine. It reminds me of Canggu before it got busy and crowded. 

The good thing is Ericeira is quite expensive which keeps the quality of people that can live here quite high. It's a high income high intellect entrepreneurial ambitious health focused tech crowd. Compared to a few years ago in 2020, now in 2023 there's actual weightlifting gyms too, not just yoga places.

There's construction all around the town now and it looks to be booming. The climate is perfect: it's usually around 20-25C, the winter is very mild. Compared to Lisbon which can be very humid and hot, Ericeira is mild because of the sea breeze. 

Ericeira changes people I think: they arrive from wherever in the world stressed and unhealthy and they end up here calming down, slowing down, focusing on their work and their friends or family, getting healthy and fit, eating local food.

For me it's a great mix between the busy megacities of Asia and then to come back here in a place with clean air, having walks around the coast and cliffs and in downtown where all the houses with blue white paint look cute. It's picturesque and many times like a cartoon. You'll see a cat walk with a fish it stole from the fishermen. You'll see grandmas hanging up their laundry outside and shouting to the other grandma. So many cartooney things I've never seen in cities. I love it.

Ericeira has been a refuge for nomads, travellers and people seeking refuge for centuries. During WW2 many people fled from Netherlands, Germany and Sweden to live in Ericeira where there was no war. Interestingly, Ericeira is home to the Saint of Good Travels which all people sailing to the New World prayed to! Not a coincidence!

Be sure to not cheap out on rent, you'll probably be paying 2000-3000 EUR for a place with 2/3 bedrooms and good aircon/heater and insulation. You'll need both because Ericeira can get very wet in the winter and cold humid is horrible. It means nothing dries. So you'll need your AC as a heater/dryer.

My favorite place. But you can only go here if you've kinda finished seeing the entire globe and are okay with standing still. It's a low senses place. You have to retrain to be okay with just the sea breeze, the cute houses, a few people. Bring your friends for sure or make friends in some of the new coworking spaces that pop up!

Enjoy Ericeira!

It is a very woke town, also, loads of yogis whit spiritual businesses that wants to sell you some magic "technique" to improve your life, again if you are not a woke person, this place is not for you. Don't think is a tropical place because it is not, it is often windy and winter is wet and cold. Also, it is not a beginner surf place, they're a much better places to learn the sport in Portugal

Stayed in Ericeira for 4 months at the end of 2022 -

Pros -
- The town is beautiful and still retains a lot of charm of a little seaside town despite how popular it has become. 
- The locals are so friendly and, in the event you do not speak Portuguese, will happily speak English to a great standard.
- Multiple lovely, clean beaches 

Cons -
- Rent is crazy expensive as are many of the restaurants in the town. 
- Once the peak season of summer passes, the place becomes really quiet. Not ideal for a solo traveller as I was.

Overall, I really loved Ericeira but I definitely made a mistake going there solo during autumn/winter! Can see it being a great spot to live for couples/families provided you can afford it.
Ericeira is better than lisbon r now you have a lot of buses from Ericeira to sintra ---> to lisboa if
This is another beautiful place in Portugal that got too crowded, overhyped, and expensive unfortunately

We play hopscotch with the dog turds on the streets and sidewalks. Ericeira is amazing, and beautiful, our favorite place, but they need more grassy patches for dogs, with baggies and trash. They also need a cleanup crew like in downtown Lisbon to wash the poo and poo streaks off the cobblestone. It's very dangerous to walk your own shoes into your home, especially if you have kids who will then contract flesh-eating bacterias from feces, such as Staphylococcus Aureus. Too many people will just let their dogs defecate right in the middle of the walkways, and just walk away not even batting an eye. Even those who do pick up after their dogs, it leaves a nice streak, which then hardens into the ground for weeks, eventually turning into a layer of brown dust that covers the sidewalks. 

Other than this, I highly recommend Ericeira. It's one of the best places to live in Portugal. They just need to start being responsible with da poo.
ericeira.description:
Ericeira is a fishing town along Portugal's coastline that many surfers and sun lovers enjoy. It has white houses, friendly people, and a relaxed atmosphere. This town is known as the "surfing capital of Europe," with strong waves and three nice beaches suitable for beginners and skilled surfers.

However, Ericeira can be expensive. Rent often costs between €2000 and €3000 for good places, especially in the busy summer months. After the peak season, the town becomes much quieter, which may not be great for solo travelers wanting more activities.

You can use public transport to visit nearby towns, but having a car might make getting around easier. The weather is generally mild, but winters can be cold and wet, so remember to bring warm clothes.

There are many cafés, but most do not allow laptops, so look for coworking spaces if you need to work. Overall, Ericeira's mix of local culture, surfing, and beautiful views makes it a nice place to visit or live. Just watch out for occasional surprises on the sidewalks!
ericeira.description_kor:
에리세이라(Ericeira)는 포르투갈 해안에 위치한 매력적인 어촌으로, 많은 서퍼들과 해변 사랑하는 이들이 즐겨 찾는 곳입니다. 이곳은 하얀 집들, 친절한 주민들, 그리고 한가로운 분위기 속에서 편안한 시간을 보낼 수 있는 특징이 있습니다. "유럽의 서핑 수도"로 불리는 이 마을은 강한 파도와 초보자부터 숙련자까지 모두에게 적합한 아름다운 세 개의 해변이 있습니다.

하지만 에리세이라는 다소 비싼 곳일 수 있습니다. 성수기인 여름철에는 좋은 숙소의 임대료가 €2000에서 €3000 사이에 달하는 경우가 많습니다. 성수기가 지나면 마을 분위기가 한층 조용해져 혼자 여행하는 분들에겐 활동할 기회가 줄어들 수 있습니다.

인근 마을로의 이동은 대중교통을 이용할 수 있지만, 자동차가 있다면 더 편리하게 돌아다니기 좋습니다. 날씨는 대체로 온화하지만 겨울철에는 추워지고 비가 올 수 있으니 따뜻한 옷을 꼭 챙기는 것이 좋습니다.

카페는 많지만 대부분의 곳에서는 노트북 사용이 금지되어 있으니 작업이 필요하다면 코워킹 스페이스를 찾아보는 게 좋습니다. 전반적으로 에리세이라는 지역 문화, 서핑, 아름다운 풍경이 어우러져 방문하기 좋고 살기 좋은 곳이지만, 보도에서 예상치 못한 일이 벌어질 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다!

reviews: Place is actually pretty amazing. I've lived in many locales, and Erie PA is easily at the top portion of my list.
erie.description:
Erie, Pennsylvania, is a place that surprises visitors with its appeal. People enjoy the nice views of Lake Erie, especially at sunset. The city has a friendly feel, making it easy for new people to settle in. There are many parks and outdoor activities for those who like nature.

The cost of living here is reasonable, which is a good thing. You can find nice neighborhoods without spending too much money. However, some people say that public transportation is not very extensive, so having a car might be useful if you want to see more.

Erie's history and culture offer a lot to explore. You can visit local museums, join festivals, or walk along the waterfront. The community spirit is strong, especially during local events. Just keep in mind that the lake can bring changing weather, so be prepared! Overall, Erie combines natural beauty with a friendly atmosphere, making it a great place to visit or live.
erie.description_kor:
에리, 펜실베이니아는 방문객들에게 매력적인 장소로 많은 사랑을 받고 있습니다. 특히 해질 무렵에는 에리 호수의 아름다운 풍경을 즐기기 위해 사람들이 많이 모입니다. 이 도시는 아늑한 분위기를 가지고 있어 새로운 사람들이 쉽게 정착할 수 있습니다. 자연을 좋아하는 분들을 위해 다양한 공원과 야외 활동이 준비되어 있습니다.

이곳의 생활비도 합리적이어서 좋습니다. 많은 돈을 들이지 않고도 살기 좋은 동네를 찾을 수 있습니다. 그러나 일부 사람들은 대중교통이 그다지 발달해 있지 않다고 언급하기 때문에, 더 많은 명소를 구경하고 싶다면 차를 갖는 것이 좋습니다.

에리의 역사와 문화도 탐방할 거리가 많습니다. 지역 박물관을 방문하거나 축제에 참여하고, 해변 주변을 산책할 수 있습니다. 지역 행사에서는 공동체의 강한 정신을 느낄 수 있습니다. 호수 주변의 날씨는 변화무쌍하니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋겠네요! 전반적으로 에리는 자연의 아름다움과 따뜻한 분위기가 어우러진 멋진 장소로, 방문하거나 거주하기에 아주 좋은 곳입니다.

reviews: I wanted to comment on the low 'walkability' score because this is completely inaccurate - I lived in Erlangen for 4-1/2 years and never owned a car. I walked a lot around town, and it was perfectly safe. There are even some pedestrian zones with no traffic. Erlangen should have a really high score in this category- it's not exactly a big town where getting around on foot just isn't reasonable. You can alternatively ride a bike pretty much anywhere. Getting in and around town is also possible with public transport - trains and buses which are reliable, affordable, and convenient. Also, it was super easy to make friends... if you make an effort. If you walk around being very loud and drawing attention to yourself, locals will shy away from you. Once you make an effort to meet locals, there is plenty to do. It's not a touristy town so it's easy to miss all the fun that's available. If you happen to be in Erlangen during the annual Bergfest (the 3rd largest beer festival in all of Germany), you're in for a real treat. The only real downside is the weather - it does get really cold, and stay cold for too long.
erlangen.description:
Erlangen is a small city in Germany that is great for those who like a comfortable and friendly place. Many visitors enjoy walking around the city; you can easily explore on foot without needing a car. Biking is easy, and public transport—like trains and buses—are dependable and cheap. It’s a safe location where you can walk around calmly, especially in areas for pedestrians.

While Erlangen doesn't have many tourists, there is a lot to see when you engage with the locals. Don't hesitate; just make a little effort, and you'll find many enjoyable activities available. If you are here during Bergfest, the excitement of the third largest beer festival in Germany adds to the experience.

However, remember that winters can be cold and last longer than you might think. So, dress warmly! Overall, if you're looking for a city with its own charm, good community spirit, and rich traditions, Erlangen is a place to visit. Just remember to relax and enjoy the slower way of life.
erlangen.description_kor:
에를랑겐은 편안하고 친근한 분위기를 사랑하는 분들에게 적합한 독일의 아기자기한 도시입니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳을 걸으며 탐방하는 것을 즐기며, 자동차 없이도 충분히 도보로 돌아다닐 수 있습니다. 자전거도 쉽게 이용할 수 있고, 기차와 버스 등의 대중교통은 믿을 수 있고 비용도 저렴합니다. 특히 보행자 전용 구역에서는 안전하고 여유롭게 산책할 수 있습니다.

에를랑겐은 관광객이 많지는 않지만, 현지인들과의 교류를 통해 다양한 볼거리를 발견할 수 있습니다. 조금만 노력하면 풍성한 즐길거리가 기다리고 있으니 주저하지 마세요. 만약 베르크페스트 기간에 이곳을 방문하게 된다면, 독일에서 세 번째로 큰 맥주 축제의 신나는 분위기도 함께 경험할 수 있습니다.

하지만 겨울철에는 추울 수 있으니, 예상보다 길어질 수 있다는 점도 염두에 두셔야 합니다. 그러니 따뜻한 옷차림을 잊지 마세요! 전반적으로, 독특한 매력과 좋은 공동체 정신, 그리고 풍부한 전통을 지닌 도시를 찾고 계신다면 에를랑겐은 꼭 방문해 보아야 할 곳입니다. 잊지 마세요, 여기서는 느긋한 삶의 방식을 즐기는 것이 중요합니다.

reviews: it is horrible if u choose to walk DONT i had people honking and catcalling me dont make that mistake
erbil.description:
Erbil has a mix of history and culture, but it also has some challenges. Many visitors enjoy the old feel of the Citadel, which is one of the oldest places still lived in. The local food is good, with tasty dishes that you will want to eat again. However, if you choose to walk around, be careful: the streets can be a bit difficult. Honking cars and attention from others can make walking less enjoyable, so it’s often better to use a taxi or rideshare.

The cost of living here is usually lower than in many Western cities, which is good for both locals and travelers. Public transportation can be limited, but private options are easy to find. Safety is generally good, but it’s wise to be aware of what is happening around you.

You can explore neighborhoods like Ankawa, which has cafes and shops, but always pay attention to local customs. Knowing a little of the local language can help you connect with people. With its mix of challenges and good things, Erbil is worth a visit!
erbil.description_kor:
에르빌은 역사와 문화가 가득한 도시지만, 몇 가지 도전 과제도 존재합니다. 많은 방문객들은 사람들이 여전히 살고 있는 성곽의 오래된 분위기를 즐깁니다. 현지 음식은 정말 맛있어서 다시 찾고 싶어질 것입니다. 그러나 주변을 걷기로 했다면 주의해야 합니다. 거리가 조금 좁고 복잡할 수 있기 때문에, 경적을 울리는 자동차와 사람들의 시선이 걸어다니는 것을 덜 즐겁게 만들 수 있습니다. 그런 이유로 택시나 차량 공유 서비스를 이용하는 것이 더 나을 수 있습니다.

여기서의 생활비는 대부분의 서양 도시들과 비교했을 때 낮아서, 지역 주민과 여행자 모두에게 유리합니다. 대중교통은 제한적일 수 있지만, 개인적으로 이용할 수 있는 옵션은 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 안전한 편이지만, 주변 상황에 대한 인지는 항상 필요합니다.

앙카와와 같은 카페와 상점이 있는 동네를 탐방할 수 있지만, 현지 관습에 유의하는 것이 중요합니다. 현지 언어를 조금만 알고 있어도 사람들과의 소통이 쉬워집니다. 도전과 매력이 공존하는 에르빌은 정말 방문할 가치가 있는 곳입니다!

reviews:
High speed internet in Fes, Morocco ? Yes, it' possible.
Visit Café Clock, on rue Talaa Kebira (actually its located on a small street perpendicular to Talaa Kebira, simply look for the sign)
We've been on the hunt to find high speed internet in Fes and the only place we've find is this great restaurant/cafe. 
Internet speed was between 40mbs and 101mbs. A few electric plugs and a very nice menu (finally a place serving other things than tagine or couscous) Delicious vegan options, fresh juices, great ambiance, comfy couches.
fes.description:
Fes is a special place in Morocco, where history and modern life come together. Walking through the narrow streets of the old medina feels like going back in time; the busy markets and old buildings share stories from many years ago. If you need to stay connected, Café Clock is a popular spot for good internet and tasty food.
