This place is more than a café; it’s a comfortable spot with soft couches, good vegan choices, and fresh juices. It’s a nice change, especially if you want something different from tagine or couscous!

While Fes is interesting, it also has some difficulties. Some travelers say there can be language problems, especially if you don't speak French or Arabic well, and getting around on public transport can be hard. It’s also a good idea to be careful in crowded places.

In general, Fes gives a different experience full of culture and taste—just remember to enjoy the local traditions and take in all the sights in the busy city!
fes.description_kor:
페스는 역사와 현대 생활이 조화를 이루는 모로코의 특별한 도시입니다. 구시가지의 좁은 골목길을 걷다 보면, 마치 과거로 여행하는 듯한 느낌을 받게 되며, 북적이는 시장과 오래된 건물들은 수많은 이야기들을 품고 있습니다. 만약 인터넷 연결이 필요하다면, 카페 클락은 맛있는 음식과 좋은 인터넷을 제공하는 인기 장소입니다.

이곳은 단순한 카페가 아니라 편안한 소파와 다양한 채식 옵션, 신선한 주스가 있는 아늑한 공간으로, 특히 타진이나 쿠스쿠스를 기호하지 않는 분들에게 반가운 선택이 될 것입니다.

페스는 매력적인 곳이지만 몇 가지 도전 과제도 존재합니다. 일부 여행자들은 언어 장벽을 느낀다고 하며, 특히 프랑스어나 아랍어에 익숙하지 않은 분들에게는 더욱 힘들 수 있습니다. 대중교통 이용도 불편할 수 있으니 혼잡한 장소에서는 항상 주의해야 합니다.

전반적으로 페스는 풍부한 문화와 맛을 선사하는 특별한 경험을 제공합니다. 현지 전통을 즐기고, 분주한 도시의 모든 매력을 만끽하는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: I live in Miami and I love going to Las Olas area in fort Lauderdale to party, the crowd changes a lot just an hour north from the 305....
fort-lauderdale.description:
Fort Lauderdale has its own style, and people from nearby Miami really like it. The busy Las Olas area is a place you should visit, filled with good places to have fun and relax. You will see a lively crowd that changes during the night, creating a vibrant atmosphere.

But there’s more than just nightlife. The city has beautiful beaches and waterways, great for spending a sunny day or taking a nice boat ride. Also, the cost of living can be lower compared to Miami, so it might be easier to manage your expenses.

However, be aware that public transportation is not very good, which can be difficult. Most locals speak English, but there are different cultures that can make communication a bit tricky.

In summary, if you want a mix of beach life, nightlife, and interesting places, Fort Lauderdale could be a great choice for you! Just remember to take sunscreen and be ready to see new things!
fort-lauderdale.description_kor:
포트 로더데일은 독특한 매력을 가진 도시로, 인근 마이애미 사람들에게 큰 인기를 끌고 있습니다. 특히 라스 올라스 지역은 활기찬 분위기로 가득 차 있어 꼭 방문해볼 만한 곳입니다. 이곳에서 휴식을 취하며 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 밤이 되면 사람들로 북적거리며 생동감 넘치는 경험을 하게 될 것입니다.

하지만 포트 로더데일에는 밤문화 외에도 다양한 매력이 있습니다. 아름다운 해변과 수로가 있어 맑은 날에는 해변에서의 여유로운 시간이나 멋진 보트 타기를 즐기기에 안성맞춤입니다. 게다가 생활비가 마이애미에 비해 저렴할 수 있어 경제적으로도 부담이 덜할 수 있습니다.

다만, 대중교통 시스템이 다소 불편한 점은 고려해야 합니다. 이로 인해 이동에 어려움을 겪을 수도 있습니다. 대부분의 현지인들은 영어를 잘 구사하지만, 다양한 문화가 공존하는 만큼 소통에 다소 익숙해져야 할 필요가 있습니다.

결론적으로, 해변 생활과 밤문화, 흥미로운 장소의 조화를 찾고 있다면 포트 로더데일이 훌륭한 선택이 될 수 있습니다! 자외선 차단제 잊지 말고 챙기시고, 새로운 것들을 경험할 준비를 해보세요!

reviews: My wife is from there and we have a house in beach park not in Fortaleza is Aquiraz I absolutely love leaving there. lower cost of leaving, great food. Great beach

Does not worth it, way too dangerous and not so beautiful. My grandpa lives there and I went to visit him on my vacation and it was terrible, very dangerous, beaches in downtown are super polluted, I couldn't find a reason to indicate it.

You gotta be kidding me.. i lived in Fortaleza for 5 years. Safety is almost non existent, only in 1-2 limited neighborhoods. There are not so many things to do in the city and you can only walk around beiramar beach, otherwise you have to take an uber because you feel unsafe while walking. You see nobody on the streets but beggers. The hospitals are the worst public ones usually don't have a doctor, and private ones has long queues besides expensive price you pay, the city is dirty, the main beach was infested with rats just last month. It's kinda cheap but the quality of life is bad and not worth living there. It's only a good spot for a week if you enjoy beach imo.
fortaleza.description:
Fortaleza, a city in Brazil, has its good and bad points. Many people like its beautiful beaches and tasty local food. If you enjoy sun and sand, the beach parks around Aquiraz are popular, providing a nice break from the city. However, it's important to note that not all experiences are positive. Visitors often talk about safety concerns, especially in certain neighborhoods, where walking can feel unsafe.

The cost of living is generally low, but some people have mentioned issues, like dirty streets and pollution at some beaches. Public transportation is not very reliable, so you may need to use Uber to get around. Also, hospitals can vary—public ones often do not have enough doctors, and private facilities can have long wait times.

If you plan to visit, stay in the beachfront areas and enjoy the local food. Just be aware of your surroundings and remember that while Fortaleza has beach attractions, it's smart to be careful!
fortaleza.description_kor:
포르탈레자(Fortaleza)는 브라질의 매력적인 도시로, 장단점이 모두 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 이곳의 아름다운 해변과 맛있는 현지 음식을 즐깁니다. 햇살과 모래를 만끽하고 싶다면 아퀴라즈(Aquiraz) 주변의 해변 공원이 특히 인기가 많으며, 도심에서의 즐거운 휴식을 제공합니다. 그러나 모든 경험이 긍정적이지는 않다는 점도 염두에 두어야 합니다. 관광객들은 종종 특정 지역에서의 보행이 불안감을 느끼게 하는 안전 문제를 언급하곤 합니다.

생활비는 일반적으로 저렴하지만, 더러운 거리와 일부 해변의 오염 같은 문제에 대해서도 우려하는 목소리가 있습니다. 대중교통은 그리 신뢰할 수 없으므로 이동할 때는 우버(Uber)를 이용하는 것이 좋습니다. 또한 병원 질은 차이가 있으며, 공공 병원은 의사 부족 현상이 발생할 수 있고 사립 병원은 대기 시간이 길어질 수 있습니다.

방문할 계획이라면 해변 근처에 숙소를 잡고 현지 음식을 꼭 맛보세요. 주변 환경에 주의하고, 포르탈레자에는 훌륭한 해변 명소가 있지만 항상 조심하는 것이 중요하다는 점을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Locals are incestuous, friendly to outsiders, but rarely let them into their inner circles. Fredericton is often referred to as cliquish. Feels much more like a town than a city, where locals all grew up together, know each other's business, have little tolerance for anything or anyone dissimilar to what they know.
fredericton.description:
Fredericton has a small-town feel that makes you feel comfortable, even if you are just visiting. The locals are friendly to newcomers and often smile, but it can be difficult to fit into their close groups. It is a tight community where many people know each other, which can sometimes feel exclusive.

The city is known for its nice streets, historic places, and parks, making it a good place for walks. Public transportation is not very good, so having a car might help you see more. In terms of safety, Fredericton is quite safe, so you can walk around without much concern.

Culturally, Fredericton has festivals and local events that are helpful for meeting people. Just to note, while the cost of living is reasonable, some things can be more expensive than you think, especially when eating out. If you're visiting, try to engage with the local customs and maybe join a community event — it’s a good way to enjoy the friendly atmosphere!
fredericton.description_kor:
프레더릭턴은 아늑한 작은 마을 같은 느낌을 주어 방문객들에게 편안함을 안겨줍니다. 지역 주민들은 새로운 사람들에게 아주 친절하고 자주 미소를 지으나, 그들의 친밀한 친구 그룹에 합류하는 것은 조금 어려울 수 있습니다. 이곳은 서로를 잘 아는 밀접한 커뮤니티라 가끔 외부인에겐 배타적으로 느껴질 수 있습니다.

이 도시는 아름다운 거리와 역사적인 명소, 그리고 편안하게 산책할 수 있는 공원들이 있어 여유롭게 걷기에 좋은 장소로 알려져 있습니다. 대중교통이 그리 편리하지 않아서 차량을 이용하면 더 많은 곳을 둘러볼 수 있습니다. 안전 측면에서도 프레더릭턴은 상당히 안전한 편이라 큰 걱정 없이 돌아다닐 수 있습니다.

문화적으로, 프레더릭턴에서는 다양한 축제와 지역 행사들이 열려 사람들을 만나는 좋은 기회를 제공합니다. 참고로, 생활비는 비교적 합리적이지만 외식할 때는 예상보다 비쌀 수 있는 점은 염두에 두세요. 방문하신다면 지역 관습에 참여하고 커뮤니티 행사에도 참석해 보세요 — 친근한 분위기를 느낄 수 있는 좋은 방법입니다!

reviews: Very luxurious yet has some parts of the city that are charming and have gothic architecture. A lot of tourists and people from Balkans who work in region. Pretty expensive. If you are not very rich just visit it and choose to stay in some other, more modest german city. In my opinion Frankfurt is city nr 3 in Germany after Berlin and Munich and I have travelled through much of Germany. Hamburg and Cologne are somewhere with the Frankfurt, but Frankfurt is more luxurious.
frankfurt.description:
Frankfurt has a mix of luxury and charm, making it a special place in Germany. The skyline features modern skyscrapers, but there are also beautiful gothic buildings that show the city's history. It is a busy city where many tourists meet people from the Balkans who work there, creating a multicultural atmosphere.

However, Frankfurt can be expensive, so if you plan to stay for a long time and have a tight budget, looking at smaller cities nearby might be better. Many visitors think it is not as popular as Berlin and Munich, but still enjoy its luxury.

Public transportation is good, but some people find it not as extensive as in other large cities. Always pay attention to your surroundings, as you would in any city. When visiting, make sure to check out the historical sites and experience the local culture. With its mix of old and new, Frankfurt is worth a stop on your travels!
frankfurt.description_kor:
프랑크푸르트는 럭셔리와 매력이 완벽하게 조화를 이루며 독일에서 특별한 장소로 자리 잡고 있습니다. 현대적인 고층 건물들로 가득 찬 스카이라인과 함께 도시의 역사를 간직한 아름다운 고딕 건물들도 눈길을 사로잡습니다. 이곳은 바다르크 지역에서 일하는 사람들과 많은 관광객들이 모이는 바쁜 도시로, 다문화적인 분위기를 자아냅니다.

하지만 프랑크푸르트는 물가가 비쌀 수 있으므로, 장기간 체류할 계획이 있고 예산이 빠듯하다면 인근의 작은 도시들을 고려해 보는 것이 좋습니다. 많은 이들이 프랑크푸르트가 베를린이나 뮌헨처럼 유명하지 않다고 생각하지만, 여전히 그곳의 럭셔리는 충분히 즐길 수 있습니다.

대중교통도 괜찮지만, 일부 사람들은 다른 대도시에 비해 그 범위가 넓지 않다고 느끼기도 합니다. 어떤 도시에서든 마찬가지지만, 주변에 항상 주의를 기울이는 것이 중요합니다. 방문할 때는 꼭 역사적인 장소를 확인하고 지역 문화를 경험해 보세요. 오래된 것과 새로운 것이 조화롭게 어우러진 프랑크푸르트는 여행 중 꼭 들러볼 만한 가치가 있는 곳입니다!

reviews: I really enjoyed Gaborone - clean, safe, plenty of shopping areas, great roads, plenty of restaurants. We stayed in a beautiful 3-bedroom, 2 bath house in the Phakalane neighborhood. I felt safe and secure. The weather in early February was beautiful, although it did rain some. If you're looking for excitement and a lot of activities, Botswana may not be for you but I loved it. I thought the quality of life in Gaborone was perfect.
gaborone.description:
Gaborone has surprised many visitors with its clean streets and safety. People appreciate the good roads and many shopping places and restaurants, which makes it easy to enjoy different types of food. If you stay in the Phakalane area like some visitors, you will find nice homes and a calm environment—great for relaxing after a day of sightseeing.

While Gaborone may not be the best choice for those looking for excitement, it offers a friendly and pleasant way of life. The weather is generally good, especially in February, even though it may rain a bit. However, remember that the city is relaxed, so if you want a lot of activities, you might plan some trips to nearby attractions.

Public transport can be limited, but getting around by car or taxi is easy. Overall, you will find Gaborone to be safe and welcoming—just what many want in a city escape!
gaborone.description_kor:
가보로네는 깨끗한 거리와 안전한 환경으로 많은 방문객들을 놀라게 했습니다. 사람들은 양호한 도로와 다양한 쇼핑 장소, 레스토랑을 높이 평가하고 있으며, 여러 음식을 손쉽게 즐길 수 있습니다. 만약 파칼란 지역에 머무르게 된다면, 멋진 집들과 평화로운 분위기를 경험할 수 있어 관광 후 여유를 즐기기에 좋은 장소입니다.

가보로네는 흥미로운 경험을 원하는 사람들에게는 최고의 선택이 아닐 수도 있지만, 친근하고 쾌적한 삶의 방식을 제공합니다. 날씨는 대체로 좋은 편이며, 특히 2월에는 비가 조금 내릴 수 있지만 대부분 맑은 날이 많습니다. 그러나 이 도시는 긴장을 풀기에 좋은 곳이므로, 다양한 활동을 원하신다면 근처 관광지를 방문하는 것을 추천합니다.

대중교통은 다소 제한적일 수 있지만, 자동차나 택시로 이동하는 것은 매우 간편합니다. 전반적으로 가보로네는 안전하고 환영 받는 곳으로, 많은 사람들이 이 도시에 머물며 편안하게 지낼 수 있는 모든 것을 갖추고 있습니다!

reviews:
I'm Polish and I've been to Gdańsk a number of times over the course of the last 10 years. When I was younger and have seen and experienced less, I was very impressed by the old town. However, these days, after having seen most of Europe and some of the US, I can't help but feel that Gdansk's old town is small and everything that surrounds it has a distinct, post-communist feel, which I do not enjoy. I was there this summer (2022) and it felt like being in an amusement park, with many of the apartment complexes around the old town turning into cheap, short stay aparthotels. The place felt empty due to that. The biggest allure of the city is that it is so close to the sea. Unfortunately, as locals would tell you, it is extremely crowded when the weather is nice, therefore most locals avoid the sea in the summer, which to me sounds weird. Considering the climate, I wouldn't want to be near that sea outside of the summer time!

To end this review on a more positive note, I think the city is well connected with the municipal rail making all parts accessible. It is very green outside of the old town and the air quality is the best among largest Polish cities. For foreigners, I think Gdańsk is a must see and as other commenters here noted, it's a good place to nomad from.
I can't believe that this city has never ranked in the top 10 here. Gdansk is one of the most beautiful cities I have ever been to!

Gdansk is a city in northern Poland and the capital of the Pomeranian Voivodeship, with a population of 464,113 (December 2013). It is the 16th most populous city in the European Union, with a population of 740,918 (2011). Gdańsk is the largest city of the Kashubian region. It is the historic capital of Gdańsk Pomerania.

Gdańsk lies at the mouth of the Motława River, connected to the Leniwka, a branch in the delta of the nearby Vistula River, which drains 60 percent of Poland's territory. According to the Statistical Yearbook of Gdańsk, the city had a population of 466,631 in 2014.

The city was built in the Middle Ages on the site of a former Baltic Sea trading town known as Qwanty (or Gdansk, pronounced "Gdantsk"), which dates back to the 11th century. Gdańsk was the capital of the Prussian Province of Pomerania. The city's history is closely tied with the Hanseatic League.

Gdańsk is home to the University of Gdańsk, the Gdańsk Shakespeare Theatre, the Museum of the Second World War, and the annual Gdańsk Shakespeare Festival. In 1980, the UNESCO added the city to its list of World Heritage Sites, as the first ever site in Poland and one of the largest and most spectacular Gothic and Art Deco centres.
gdansk.description:
Gdańsk is a city that mixes history with some modern life. It is located on Poland's northern coast and has an old town that many visitors like. Some people feel it is smaller than other European cities. While the old town is nice, the areas around it can seem a bit run-down. If you enjoy being outside, the city is nice, especially in the parks where there is fresh air and nature.

For getting around, the public transport is good, with a train that connects different parts of the city. However, on sunny days, be ready for crowds, especially by the sea! Many locals try to stay away from the busy beach areas during summer, which may seem strange because Gdańsk is by the coast.

If you are new to the city, be sure to visit the Museum of the Second World War and the Shakespeare Theatre—there are many cultural activities! A helpful tip is to learn a few Polish phrases, as there may be language challenges. Explore Gdańsk, and you might discover a lot to enjoy!
gdansk.description_kor:
그단스크는 역사와 현대 생활이 잘 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다. 폴란드 북부 해안에 위치해 있으며, 많은 방문객들이 사랑하는 구시가지가 있습니다. 일부 사람들은 다른 유럽 도시들에 비해 규모가 작다고 느끼기도 합니다. 구시가지는 정말 아름답지만, 그 주변 지역은 다소 황폐해 보일 수도 있습니다. 야외 활동을 즐기는 분들이라면, 신선한 공기와 자연을 느낄 수 있는 공원이 많아서 좋습니다.

이동은 대중교통이 잘 발달돼 있어 여러 지역을 쉽게 연결하는 기차가 있습니다. 하지만 맑은 날에는 해변 근처의 인파에 대비해야 할 필요가 있습니다! 현지인들은 여름에 붐비는 해변 지역을 피하고 싶어 하기도 하는데, 그단스크가 해안가에 위치한 점을 고려하면 이 점이 좀 이상하게 느껴질 수 있습니다.

도시에 처음 방문하는 경우, 제2차 세계 대전 박물관과 셰익스피어 극장을 꼭 들러보세요. 다양한 문화 활동이 기다리고 있습니다! 유용한 팁 하나는 몇 가지 폴란드어 문구를 미리 배우는 것입니다. 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니까요. 그단스크를 탐험하면서 많은 즐길 거리를 발견해 보세요!

reviews: Nice for a few days, and as a basing off point for other places. Not much to do here and not a great nightlife. Stayed for a week and wished it was only a few days.
galway.description:
If you’re thinking about visiting Galway, it’s good for a short trip or as a place to explore the beautiful scenery of Ireland. This city has a lot of character, with bright buildings and busy streets that give it a special feel. Just be ready—while it looks nice, some visitors find there’s not much to do for a long time.

During the day, you can enjoy the local culture, eat at small cafes, and maybe listen to some traditional music. But when it gets dark, the nightlife is usually quieter than in bigger cities, which may not appeal to everyone. If you want to enjoy your trip, consider staying for a couple of days and then visiting nearby attractions, like the Cliffs of Moher or Connemara.

For a smooth visit, having a plan and using public transport for day trips is important, as the options in town can be limited. Overall, Galway offers a relaxed atmosphere, perfect for enjoying the local charm and nature of Ireland!
galway.description_kor:
갈웨이를 방문할 계획이라면, 짧은 여행이나 아일랜드의 아름다운 경치를 만끽하기에 좋은 곳입니다. 이 도시는 화려한 건물과 활기찬 거리가 어우러져 독특한 매력을 뿜어냅니다. 하지만 미리 알고 가세요—경치가 예쁘긴 하지만, 일부 방문객들은 시간이 오래 지나도 할 일이 많지 않다고 느낄 수도 있습니다.

낮 동안에는 지역 문화를 즐기고, 아늑한 카페에서 식사를 하며 전통 음악을 듣는 시간을 가져보세요. 그러나 해가 지고 나면 밤문화가 대도시보다는 조용해져서 모든 이에게 매력적이지 않을 수 있습니다. 그러니 여러 가지 즐길 거리가 많은 여행을 원하신다면 며칠 동안 머무르면서 모허 절벽이나 코네마라 같은 인근 명소도 함께 방문해보는 것을 추천합니다.

여유로운 여행을 위해서는 미리 계획하고, 당일치기 여행 시 대중교통을 이용하는 것이 중요합니다. 시내에서 선택할 수 있는 옵션이 제한적일 수 있기 때문입니다. 전체적으로 갈웨이는 지역의 매력과 아일랜드의 자연을 즐기기에 정말 좋은 여유로운 장소입니다!

reviews:
It's a beautiful small city with nice parks. 

The population is somewhat used to foreigners since there are many humanitarian agencies with offices in the city. Nevertheless, basically no one speaks English. 
There is a large mall with several options to eat and work. 
I've spent days in local cafes without issue although cafe owners were clearly surprised by this behaviour. 

Regarding activities, they are constrained to the touristic, such as museums, and hamams (saunas).
I've heard that there are pubs and places to dance but I've not seen them. 

The female population mostly behaves as small town people. Caring about appearances and stuff like that. 

Be extremely careful with traffic! No rules are respected. 

Finally, this nation has an honor culture, like all of the region. Do no criticize anyone for anything!
gaziantep.description:
Located in Turkey, Gaziantep is a city that many visitors like for its welcoming feel and nice parks. The local people are friendly and used to seeing foreigners because of humanitarian groups, but be prepared for a language barrier—English is not commonly spoken here, so knowing a few basic Turkish phrases can be helpful.

To experience local life, you can spend time at the many cafes, though you might get some curious looks from cafe owners. If you enjoy food, you should visit the large mall with many dining options—it's a good place to eat or relax.

For activities, the city's attractions are more traditional, including interesting museums and calming hamams (saunas). Although nightlife options like pubs may not be easy to find, the true spirit of Gaziantep shows in its culture.

Just a warning—traffic here can be hectic, so be careful! And keep in mind that it’s better to avoid criticism as respect is important in this culture. Enjoy your visit to Gaziantep!
gaziantep.description_kor:
터키의 가자이안텝은 많은 방문객들에게 따뜻한 분위기와 아름다운 공원 덕분에 인기 있는 도시입니다. 현지 사람들은 매우 친절하며, 인도적 단체 덕분에 외국인들과 널리 접촉하기 때문에 외국인에게도 익숙합니다. 하지만 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다. 영어가 일반적이지 않으니 몇 가지 기본적인 터키어 문구를 아는 것이 도움이 될 것입니다.

현지 생활을 체험하고 싶다면 많은 카페에서 여유로운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 다만, 카페 주인들이 호기심 어린 눈빛으로 지켜볼 수도 있으니 그 점을 감안해주세요. 음식을 사랑한다면 다양한 다이닝 옵션이 있는 대형 쇼핑몰을 방문해보세요. 식사를 하거나 쉴 수 있는 좋은 장소입니다.

활동을 원하신다면, 도시의 명소들은 전통적인 매력을 가지고 있습니다. 흥미로운 박물관과 편안한 하맘(사우나) 등이 있어 즐길 거리가 많습니다. 밤 문화는 술집 같은 옵션이 적어 다소 찾기 어려울 수 있지만, 가자이안텝에서의 진정한 매력은 그곳의 문화에서 느낄 수 있습니다.

마지막으로, 이곳의 교통은 혼잡할 수 있으니 주의하시고, 이 문화에서 존중이 중요하니 비판적인 발언은 피하는 것이 좋습니다. 가자이안텝에서 즐거운 여행 되시길 바랍니다!

reviews:
I work in Fukuoka and all I can say is that it's a fantastic city. As a disclaimer I happen to be close to fluent in Japanese, and as the metrics here would indicate speaking next to no Japanese might be somewhat difficult, but it's certainly still livable (tons of signage is in English, and there is information on places to go and see in English as well). Also it feels a tad more unexposed in comparison to some of the more major cities, though Fukuoka has a pretty large population at about 1.6 million inhabitants. I find it incredibly affordable (but I hail from NYC), and there is a lot of green space in close proximity to urban areas, which gives the city this really organic feeling to it- the perfect mix of big and small city. Food is without a doubt exceptional. Incredibly rich culinary history and culture here. Coffee is also terrific (may I recommend ManuCoffee? I used to work in a coffee start up and I still think Manucoffee makes one of the best blends I've had the pleasure to drink in a while). As another reviewer stated, these low key coffee places are often optimal for getting work done/studying/etc. and I often frequent them for this reason. I would say of the major Japanese cities is certainly one of the most livable, and with an airport 15 minutes away from the city center by subway it's very accessible and you can quite easily get around to different parts of the country from there. 

As for cons summers here are quite tough. Brutally humid and hot. Winters then get quite cold, but there's rarely snow. 

I remember the first time I came here I was visiting as a tourist but even as I work from here the same mellow, free feeling predominates. Lovely, lovely, lovely city.

Solo female travelers can find safe and affordable accommodations with quiet work spaces included. It's a great taste of Japan with shopping and canals. English is spoken enough to assist at stores and supermarkets. You may want to have some things translated if you're looking for a specific item. It's a convenient location for those traveling throughout Asia and want to rest for a month or two in Japan.

Hipster capital of Japan. Fukuoka is a lovely city with a super mellow feeling to it. There's 1.5 million people living here but you wouldn't think so when walking here. It feels a lot like Utrecht, a kinda relaxed artistic hipster city than's more livable than the busy capital Tokyo. 

And unlike Tokyo, there is lots of short-term coworking spaces, artisinal coffee places, affordable boutique hotels and even coliving spaces with hotel and coworking mixed. 

Fukuoka is just very different than the rest of Japan. In the rest of Japan it's hard to come by good coffee places to work (mostly bad coffee chains), accommodation is crazy expensive (you'll end up sleeping in capsules) and coworking spaces look more like offices and require 1 or 2 year minimum subscriptions!

The best area to stay is Tenjin, it has coworking spaces, fashion stores, vintage stores, boutique hotels and startups.

Fukuoka is absolutely lovely. And I wouldn't mind living here for longer times. And this comes from someone who's been pretty critical at Japan for how unlivable it usually is for remote workers. Fukuoka is a great exception.
fukuoka.description:
Fukuoka is located in the south of Japan and offers a mix of city life and a relaxed atmosphere. It has a population of about 1.6 million people, making it busy but easy to enjoy. The city is known for its parks, which allow you to get away from the city without going too far.

One great thing about Fukuoka is its food. You can find delicious ramen and coffee at local stands and small cafes (don't miss ManuCoffee). Many places also have a comfortable setting suitable for working or studying.

The cost of living here is quite reasonable, especially compared to cities like Tokyo. However, be prepared for hot and humid summers and cold winters. Getting around the city is simple, with a subway that takes you to the airport in just 15 minutes.

If you visit, Tenjin is the main area to explore with many shops and coworking spaces. It's also helpful to know some basic Japanese phrases, as you might encounter language barriers. Fukuoka could become a favorite place for you in Japan!
fukuoka.description_kor:
후쿠오는 일본 남부에 위치한 도시로, 활기찬 도시 생활과 편안한 분위기가 잘 어우러져 있습니다. 인구는 약 160만 명으로, 바쁘면서도 즐거움을 만끽할 수 있는 곳입니다. 이 도시의 장점 중 하나는 가까운 거리에서 자연을 느낄 수 있는 다양한 공원들입니다.

후쿠오에서 가장 매력적인 점 중 하나는 맛있는 음식입니다. 현지 가판대와 아기자기한 카페에서는 정말 맛있는 라멘과 커피를 즐길 수 있으며, 특히 메뉴에 있는 커피는 꼭 맛보셔야 합니다. 많은 가게들이 일하거나 공부하기에 편안한 아늑한 분위기를 제공합니다.

생활비는 꽤 합리적인 편이며, 특히 도쿄 같은 대도시와 비교했을 때 더욱 그렇습니다. 다만 여름은 덥고 습하고, 겨울은 추운 날씨를 대비해야 합니다. 도시 내 이동은 매우 간편하고, 지하철을 이용하면 공항까지 단 15분 만에 도착할 수 있습니다.

방문하신다면 텐진 지역을 추천합니다. 다양한 상점과 코워킹 스페이스가 있어 매우 활기찬 장소입니다. 언어 장벽으로 조금 어려움을 겪을 수 있으니, 간단한 일본어 문구를 아는 것이 큰 도움이 될 것입니다. 후쿠오는 일본에서 여러분이 사랑할 수 있는 멋진 장소가 될 것입니다!

reviews: Incredibly expensive city, but a great location to get to many other destinations. The city is highly diverse due to all the diplomats and their various supporting structures. You can see most of Geneva in 2 days. The lake is gorgeous!!! Public transport is fantastic and on the honor system. The people are very nice and everyone speaks English.
As an expat in Geneva since 5years now, I'll recommend Lausanne or Zurich before Geneva. French Swiss are slow to make business with and have a lot of bureaucracy.
geneva.description:
Geneva is a nice city located by a large lake, making it a good place for relaxing and having fun. It has many different people because of the many diplomats and international organizations that are based there. You can see most of the city in just a few days, visiting cafes and parks.

However, be ready – it can be quite expensive! The cost of living is high, so plan your budget well. Public transportation is very good, making it easy to travel around, and it works on an honor system, which is interesting. The local people are friendly, and while many speak English, dealing with official matters can take some time.

If you are looking at neighborhoods, each has its own appeal, but if you are new to the area, you might like places like Lausanne or Zurich more. Overall, Geneva has a mix of culture and nice views, but be careful with your spending!
geneva.description_kor:
제네바는 큰 호수 옆에 위치한 아름다운 도시로, 휴식과 즐거움을 만끽하기에 좋은 장소입니다. 이곳에는 많은 외교관과 국제기구가 있어 다양한 사람들이 살고 있습니다. 카페와 공원을 돌아다니면 며칠 안에 도시의 대부분을 탐방할 수 있습니다.

하지만 준비가 필요합니다 – 비용이 꽤 높을 수 있으니요! 생활비가 비싸기 때문에 예산을 잘 계획해야 합니다. 대중교통이 아주 잘 되어 있어 여행하기 편리하며, 신뢰할 수 있는 시스템으로 운영됩니다. 현지 사람들은 친절하며, 많은 이들이 영어를 잘 구사하지만 공식적인 일을 처리하는 데는 시간이 걸릴 수 있습니다.

동네를 살펴보면 각 지역마다 독특한 매력이 있지만, 제네바가 처음이라면 로잔이나 취리히 같은 곳이 더 마음에 들 수도 있습니다. 전반적으로 제네바는 문화와 아름다운 경치가 잘 어우러진 곳이지만, 지출에 주의하는 것이 중요합니다!

reviews: Genoa is one of the most underrated cities in Italy: the medieval historic center is one of the largest in Europe and it is just gorgeous. Being hilly, there are so many places to get beautiful views of the city: spianata castelletto, Righi, giardini Dinegro and so much more... not to mention the food (focaccia and pesto are the specialties) and the people, who are warm and welcoming
Genoa is a pearl covered in shit
genoa.description:
Genoa, Italy, is a place that many people should visit. It has one of the largest old town areas in Europe, making it easy to walk through its narrow streets and see interesting sights. You should go to places like Spianata Castelletto for good views or relax in the Giardini Dinegro.

If you like food, you will enjoy local dishes like focaccia and pesto, which you should try. The local people are friendly and welcoming, helping you feel comfortable.

Be aware that this city has many hills, which can make walking around a bit difficult with its steep paths and winding streets. Public transportation may not always be easy, and you might find it helpful to know some Italian words. Also, be ready for higher living costs than in other Italian cities. 

In summary, Genoa has a lot of culture and history to learn about. Enjoy the food and the lively community, but prepare for those hills!
genoa.description_kor:
이탈리아 제노바는 꼭 방문해야 할 곳입니다. 유럽에서 가장 큰 구시가지 중 하나를 자랑하며, 그 좁은 골목길에서 쉽게 흥미로운 명소를 찾아볼 수 있습니다. 멋진 전망을 원하신다면 스피아나타 카스텔레토(Spianata Castelletto)나 자르디니 디네그로(Giardini Dinegro)에서 여유로운 시간을 가져보세요.

음식 좋아하시는 분들도 실망하지 않을 거예요. 포카치아(focaccia)와 페스토(pesto) 같은 현지 요리를 맛볼 수 있습니다. 현지인들은 정말 친절하고 환영해 주어 기분이 아주 좋습니다.

다만, 이 도시에는 언덕이 많아서 가파른 길과 구불구불한 거리 때문에 걷기가 조금 힘들 수 있다는 점은 감안하셔야 합니다. 대중교통이 항상 편리하지 않을 수 있으니, 이탈리아어 몇 마디 힌트를 알고 계시면 도움이 될 것입니다. 그리고 다른 이탈리아 도시들에 비해 생활비가 높은 편이니 이 점도 고려하시길 바랍니다.

종합적으로 보면, 제노바는 배울 거리와 역사, 아름다운 문화가 가득한 곳입니다. 맛있는 음식과 활기찬 커뮤니티를 만끽하되, 언덕에 대한 준비를 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Information here about Gibraltar is very inaccurate. (but not willing to pay just to be able to fix it)
gibraltar.description:
Gibraltar is a small part of history located at the southern tip of Spain, known for its views of the Mediterranean and the Rock of Gibraltar. Many visitors like the friendly locals and the mix of British and Mediterranean culture. The city has cafes, historic sites, and parks, making it a nice place to walk around.

The cost of living here can vary—places to stay can be expensive, but eating out or getting a drink is usually cheaper. Getting around is easy; however, public transport can be limited, so be ready to walk or take taxis. Safety is mostly good, but like in any place, it's smart to be aware of your surroundings.

Visit the local shops, walk through the old town, and don't miss seeing the macaques at the top of the rock. If you go to Gibraltar, learning some basic Spanish phrases can be helpful! Overall, it's a lively, small destination with a lot to explore.
gibraltar.description_kor:
지브롤터는 스페인 최남단에 위치한 작은 역사적인 장소로, 지중해와 지브롤터 바위의 아름다운 경관으로 유명합니다. 많은 방문객들이 친절한 지역 주민들과 영국 및 지중해 문화가 어우러진 매력을 좋아합니다. 이 도시는 카페, 역사적인 명소, 공원이 있어 걷기 좋은 곳입니다.

여기서의 생활비는 다양하게 나타날 수 있으며, 숙소는 다소 비쌀 수 있지만, 외식이나 음료는 대체로 저렴한 편입니다. 이동은 용이하지만, 대중교통이 다소 제한적일 수 있으니 걸어 다니거나 택시를 이용할 준비를 하는 것이 좋습니다. 안전은 대체로 뛰어나지만, 어떤 장소에서나 주변을 잘 살피는 것이 중요합니다.

지역 상점을 둘러보고 구시가지를 걸으며 바위 꼭대기에서 마카크를 관찰하는 것을 잊지 마세요. 지브롤터를 방문한다면 기본적인 스페인어 문구를 익히는 것이 도움이 될 것입니다! 전반적으로 다양한 볼거리가 있는 생기 넘치는 작은 여행지입니다.

reviews:
Gili Air is a wonderful tropical island with good enough internet, amazing beaches and affordable accommodation and food. The locals are super friendly and it's super safe.
There is a party and live music every night for those that feel like socialising(with the exception of Thursday nights). There's a well equipped gym, Salsa dancing Night every Monday at the schick-kitsch mexican restaurant, stand up paddle, lots of wonderful yoga shalas, kite surfing, snorkelling, diving and lots of food options. It's actually becoming a vegetarian and vegan paradise lately. There's also a co-working space as part of a Yoga Center. Several music and traditional festivals are held every year and it's wonderful to watch local weddings. Land prices are also still reasonable given that the island will be developing at a faster pace now. The quality of people that seem to crowd Gili Air are very different to those that go to Gili Trawangan. Gili Air attracts a 30+ couples, families and friends groups who don't mind splashing out on nice accommodation, spa treatments and great culinary experiences.
All in all, my favorite place so far with an average of 322 days of sunshine! The climate doesn't get any better than this anywhere in the world(and given most other exotic islands are prone to hurricanes... there's never been a hurricane or tornado in the Gilis).
gili-air.description:
Imagine a nice place where blue waters meet palm trees—welcome to Gili Air! This island is great for anyone who wants to relax and enjoy the sun. With beautiful beaches and a calm atmosphere, you’ll find many affordable places to stay and tasty local food that is cheap. The locals are friendly and happy to share their culture, making it a comfortable place to feel at home.

If you like activities, you will have fun! You can go snorkeling in clear waters or use a paddleboard on the sea. For those who enjoy social events, there is live music every night, salsa dancing on Mondays, and local festivals that show special traditions. 

While Gili Air is safe and has good internet, some people find the prices going up because it is becoming more popular. Public transport is limited, so be ready to walk or bike around. Overall, this island offers a good mix of rest and fun, making it a popular choice for couples and families looking for a relaxing getaway!
gili-air.description_kor:
아름다운 푸른 바다와 야자수가 어우러진 멋진 장소, 길리 에어에 오신 것을 환영합니다! 이곳은 휴식을 취하고 태양을 만끽하고 싶은 분들에게 최적의 여행지입니다. 환상적인 해변과 평화로운 분위기 속에서 저렴한 숙소와 맛있는 현지 음식을 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하며 그들의 문화를 기꺼이 나누고자 하니, 마치 집에 있는 듯한 편안함을 느낄 수 있습니다.

활동적인 시간을 원하신다면 다양한 즐길 거리가 기다리고 있습니다! 맑고 투명한 바다에서 스노클링을 하거나 패들보드를 타며 바다를 누비는 것 또한 가능합니다. 사교적인 분들을 위해 매일 밤 라이브 음악 공연이 열리며, 월요일에는 살사 댄스가 진행되고, 특별한 전통을 체험할 수 있는 지역 축제도 열립니다.

길리 에어는 안전하고 좋은 인터넷 환경을 제공하지만, 최근 인기가 높아짐에 따라 가격이 상승하고 있다는 의견도 있습니다. 대중교통이 부족하니 걷거나 자전거를 이용할 준비를 해두셔야 합니다. 전반적으로 이 섬은 휴식과 즐거움을 완벽하게 조화시켜, 편안한 휴가를 원하는 커플과 가족들에게 인기 있는 선택지입니다!

reviews: Was in GLASGOW this end of JANUARY 2020. Post-industrial view everywhere, there is little to do in the old town + pedestrian area. Seems quite unattractive in comparison with EDINBURGH. Just to be quite frank with you nomads, it looks much more affordable if you eat at BURGER KING + LIDL or TESCO around there.

Just moved to Glasgow a year ago. Yes, weather is humid, grey, rainy, everyday (almost). BUT the people are great, the city is full of charm and vibrant. It is very authentic and doesn't have many tourists. The accent is awesome. It's cheaper than most important cities in UK. The post-industrial style is so interesting too ! I 'm in love with Glasgow.
glasgow.description:
Glasgow has a distinct feel that makes it different from its more well-known neighbor, Edinburgh. While it may not have the same big attractions, this city has a special appeal that many visitors enjoy. You might see some signs of its industrial past, and it often has grey and rainy weather—so remember to bring an umbrella!

One of the best things about living in Glasgow is the cost of living; eating at places like Burger King or local shops is affordable. The friendly locals also make the city welcoming. With street art and local pubs, there's always something cultural to see.

However, public transportation is not as wide-ranging as in other cities, which could make it difficult to travel around. And if you’re not used to the Scottish accent, you may need to pay close attention! Overall, Glasgow offers a mix of city life and local friendliness that makes it a good place to visit.
glasgow.description_kor:
글래스고는 에딘버러와는 확연히 다른 특색을 지니고 있습니다. 에딘버러가 더 유명한 이웃 도시일 수도 있지만, 글래스고는 많은 방문객들에게 특별한 매력을 선사합니다. 이곳에서는 산업 과거의 흔적을 발견할 수 있으며, 자주 흐리고 비가 오는 날씨가 지속되니 우산을 챙기는 게 좋겠죠!

글래스고의 장점 중 하나는 생활비가 상대적으로 저렴하다는 점입니다. 버거킹이나 지역 상점에서 식사하는 데 큰 부담이 없습니다. 또한, 친절한 현지인들이 있어 이 도시가 정말 환영받는 곳으로 느껴집니다. 거리 예술과 다양한 지역 펍 덕분에 항상 문화적인 즐길 거리가 넘쳐납니다.

다만, 대중교통은 다른 도시들만큼 편리하지 않아 이동이 불편할 수 있습니다. 그리고 스코틀랜드 억양에 익숙하지 않다면, 말에 좀 더 주의를 기울여야 할지도 모르겠어요. 전반적으로, 글래스고는 도시 생활과 지역 친화가 어우러진 매력적인 장소로, 방문하기에 좋은 곳입니다.

reviews: i lived here during the plandemic for 3 months, it's like living in a big city, traffic is hectic. plenty of bars if you like that thing, and restaurants. Nice beach

My partner and I lived in Gold Coast for 6 months during the coronavirus pandemic. Its a very expensive place to live and its hard to find optimal housing. There are many Austrialians looking to live here so its has a growing housing market, we experienced a rental rate increase during our stay. 

This seems to be a lively city with many visitors and fun amusement parks, clubs, and nice shopping centers. But for us the main value was its proximity to a world class beach. This is THE nicest city beach I have ever experienced and its hard to compare to anywhere else, tall expensive skyscrapers with luxurious white sand and big surfable waves was the highlights of our stay.
gold-coast.description:
Gold Coast is a busy area that mixes city life with nice beach views. Living here feels like being in a lively city, with lots of traffic and social activities. If you like nightlife, you will appreciate the many bars and restaurants available. The city is known for its beautiful beach, which many people say is one of the best, with fine white sand and good waves for surfing.

However, it is not always easy. The cost of living in Gold Coast can be high, and finding a budget-friendly place can be hard due to the housing market. During busy times, rental prices can go up, so it is wise to plan ahead.

For visitors, there are many things to do, from amusement parks to shopping areas. Just remember that the public transport system may not be very extensive. Always be aware of your surroundings, especially in crowded areas. Overall, Gold Coast offers a mix of fun and relaxation, making it a good place to visit or live!
gold-coast.description_kor:
골드코스트는 도시의 활기와 멋진 해변 경치를 동시에 즐길 수 있는 바쁜 지역입니다. 이곳에서 사는 것은 마치 번화한 도시 속에 있는 듯한 느낌을 주며, 다양한 교통과 사회 활동이 활발하게 이루어집니다. 밤문화를 즐기고 싶다면, 다채로운 바와 레스토랑이 여러분을 기다리고 있습니다. 이 도시는 많은 이들이 세계 최고의 해변 중 하나로 꼽는 아름다운 해변으로 유명하며, 고운 백사장과 서핑에 적합한 파도가 매력적입니다.

하지만 생활이 항상 쉽지만은 않은 점도 있습니다. 골드코스트의 생활비는 다소 높을 수 있으며, 주택 시장이 치열하기 때문에 예산에 맞는 주거지를 찾기 어려울 수 있습니다. 특히 성수기에는 임대료가 오를 수 있으니 미리 계획하는 것이 좋습니다.

관광객들을 위해서는 놀이공원부터 쇼핑 지역까지 다양한 즐길 거리가 마련되어 있습니다. 단, 대중교통이 그렇게 발달하지 않았다는 점을 염두에 두세요. 특히 혼잡한 지역에서는 항상 주변을 잘 살펴야 합니다. 전반적으로 골드코스트는 즐거움과 편안함이 어우러져 있어 방문하거나 살기 좋은 곳입니다!

reviews: Hi! I write from Granada. Now I'm staying in a flat with another 2 nomads and this is very good! We pay only 450€ for month with alls bills included. And for eat is very cheap in Granada because there is a TAPAS. With only 2.50€ you can eat and drink.
Granada is nice, but I wouldn't stay here longer than a few weeks. Not that much do to. Since you're in, y'know, Spain, you might as well go to a more exciting city.

This guide is UTTERLY WRONG. $3.300 per month!? You can rent a room as cheap as 200€ (erasmus rooms), 1beer costs usually under 2€ and has a free 'Tapa' - normally when I go out, with 5€ I've eaten and drank enough. Coworkings cost somewhere from 70-120€ depending if part time or full time. Then you can go almost anywhere around walking, and by bus to the mountains. Compared to Berlin, the Internet is much faster and cheaper. Simyo has 20€ prepaid cards that give you 60GB data x month. You also have many clubs, bars and a cultural scene. Granada is also very open and welcoming, not a 'racist' city like announced here. Obviously whoever writes this revies has no idea what it is to live here.

Granada is beautiful and cheap. It has 3-4 distinct areas that are so wonderful to explore. Granada is a traditional Spanish town, in that when you order a drink you will get a plate of tapas along with it. So 3 rounds and 3 plates later, you've had dinner. The people are great and super nice. As a native English speaker, there are less speaking English than a larger city like Madrid, but basic Spanish is just fine to get around in most settings. I can't recommend Granada enough, it's one of the best cities in Spain, if not, Europe.

LOL everything described in nomadlist is pretty much wrong. Granada is the cheapest city in spain. It's super fun and have lot to do for parties, food ect... This is ridicoulous. Please update with real data!

This city is amazing: beautiful, lively, great food, cheap and great surroundings. Beaches and mountains within 1 hour of your doorstep. The only downside is that the airport has very few flights and it’s not as easy to get here as for other bigger Spanish cities. This should be one of the top ranked cities in Spain imho.
It's necessary to update prices. Granada is the cheapest city in Spain.
Prices listed in this page are not even close to reality.
granada.description:
Granada is a city that attracts people with its Alhambra and busy streets. It is an affordable place to live, where you can rent a room for about €200 and enjoy tapas with drinks for around €2.50. Many locals and visitors talk about the friendly atmosphere and the active cultural scene, making it a good place to explore.

You can visit different neighborhoods and find many bars and clubs, while spending only €5 for a full meal, thanks to the free tapas that come with your drink. Some may find it quieter than larger cities like Madrid, but Granada still has a lot to offer, especially for those who like a relaxed lifestyle.

However, the airport has few flights, which can make getting here a bit difficult. Also, while basic Spanish is helpful, you will find fewer English speakers than in bigger cities. If you want a mix of history, good food, and a friendly vibe, Granada is worth the visit. Just remember to improve your Spanish for the best experience.
granada.description_kor:
그라나다는 알함브라와 활기 넘치는 거리들 덕분에 많은 이들을 끌어들이는 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳은 생활비가 저렴해 방을 약 200유로에 임대할 수 있고, 음료와 함께 타파스를 즐기면 단 2.50유로로 가능하답니다. 많은 지역 주민과 여행객들은 이곳의 친근한 분위기와 활발한 문화 현장을 칭찬하며, 정말 탐험하기 좋은 장소로 손꼽습니다.

다양한 동네를 돌아다니며 수많은 바와 클럽을 발견할 수 있으며, 음료와 함께 제공되는 무료 타파스 덕분에 전체 식사 비용이 겨우 5유로에 불과하죠. 어떤 이들은 마드리드와 같은 대도시에 비해 조용하게 느낄 수도 있지만, 그라나다는 여유로운 라이프스타일을 선호하는 사람들에게 많은 매력을 제공합니다.

다만, 공항으로의 비행편이 적어서 이곳에 오기 조금 어렵게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 기본적인 스페인어는 유용하지만, 대도시에 비해 영어를 사용하는 사람이 적다는 점도 알아두셔야 해요. 역사와 맛있는 음식, 그리고 친근한 분위기를 경험하고 싶다면 그라나다는 꼭 방문할 가치가 있습니다. 최고의 경험을 원하신다면, 스페인어 실력을 한 층 끌어올리는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews:
Graz is a nice place. It's prettiest in the Innere Stadt, like the old city center. So probably stay there. Graz has a very lefty, alternative, hippe vibe to it. You'll see people wear lots of hemp and earth toned clothing and dreadlocks all over the place. Which is kinda fun for a change. The same people you'd see in Ubud or Koh Pha Ngan or Goa, you'll see in Graz. Speaking of the people, they're nice, but they won't smile at you in public mostly. I also wouldn't say it's easy to meet people here, but that's probably Austrian culture. Everyone already got their cliques.

Oh one annoying thing, eveeeeeryone smokes here or that's how it feels like. You won't be able to sit anywhere outside without getting smoke in your face.

In terms of activities, you can do quite a lot of hiking/walking around Graz in the hills and mountains. It's really beautiful if you just walk half an hour north east which we did.

A nice place to work is Martin Auer, they have a few diff spots around town, really AMAZING coffee and baguette sandwhiches there, you won't believe how good. Also the Kunsthaus Graz has a great cafe with amazing food.

So TL;DR Graz is a nice little cosy town, fun to stop by for a few days.
The people are so quiet, so one really laughs or expresses feelings, especially Austrian guys, it's like they have no soul and take life so so seriously. Huge egos, not enough love as kids.
graz.description:
Graz is a small city that combines its historic side with modern influences. You can walk through the Innere Stadt, the old city center, where impressive buildings meet interesting street art. It is a popular place, attracting people who enjoy a relaxed style.

The locals are friendly, but don’t expect many smiles or casual conversations—Austrian culture is more reserved, which can make meeting new people a bit difficult. On the positive side, there are many activities to enjoy! Hiking in the nearby hills is a great option, providing nice views that are just a half-hour walk away.

One small downside is the smoke; it seems like many people like to smoke outdoors, so be prepared for that. For food lovers, you can visit Martin Auer for good coffee and sandwiches, or go to Kunsthaus Graz for tasty meals. Overall, Graz feels welcoming and is good for a short visit, but it might take time to connect with the locals.
graz.description_kor:
그라츠는 역사와 현대가 조화를 이루는 아담한 도시입니다. 인네레 슈타트, 즉 구시가지를 거닐다 보면 멋진 건물들과 흥미로운 거리 예술을 감상할 수 있습니다. 이곳은 여유로운 분위기를 즐기는 사람들에게 인기 있는 명소입니다.

현지인들은 친절하지만, 많은 미소나 가벼운 대화는 기대하지 않는 것이 좋습니다. 오스트리아 문화는 약간 내향적인 면이 있어 새로운 사람들을 만나는 것이 다소 어려울 수 있습니다. 하지만 긍정적으로는 다양한 즐길 거리가 많다는 점이 매력적입니다! 인근 언덕에서 하이킹을 하는 것도 훌륭한 선택으로, 단 30분 정도 걸어가면 아름다운 경치를 감상할 수 있습니다.

하나 아쉬운 점은 흡연입니다; 많은 사람들이 야외에서 담배를 피우고 있으니 미리 대비하는 것이 좋습니다. 음식 애호가를 위한 장소로는 마르틴 아우어에서 맛있는 커피와 샌드위치를 즐기거나, 쿤스트하우스 그라츠에서 훌륭한 식사를 경험할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 그라츠는 따뜻한 환영의 느낌을 주며 짧은 방문에 적합하지만, 현지인들과의 연결은 조금의 시간이 필요할 수 있습니다.

reviews:
My Experience as a Digital Nomad in Grenoble

I’ve been living in Grenoble for a few months now, and I can confidently say it’s a fantastic place for digital nomads. 

Here’s why:

Grenoble boasts an excellent 5G network, which is crucial for remote work. The internet speed is fast and reliable, so you won’t have to worry about connectivity issues during video calls or while uploading large files. This solid infrastructure has been a game-changer for my productivity.

The city is very eco-friendly. With numerous pedestrian zones and a comprehensive system of shared bikes and scooters, getting around is easy and green. I love that I can choose to walk or bike almost anywhere, reducing my carbon footprint while enjoying the fresh air.

One of the standout features of Grenoble is its tap water. It’s not only safe to drink but also considered among the best in the world. Having clean, high-quality water readily available is a huge plus.

For outdoor enthusiasts, Grenoble is a paradise. Nestled in the Alps, the city offers breathtaking views and endless opportunities for adventure. In the winter, skiing at nearby resorts like Alpe d'Huez and Les Deux Alpes is a must. In the warmer months, I’ve enjoyed hiking, canyoning, and rock climbing. The view from the Bastille is particularly stunning, offering a panoramic glimpse of the city and surrounding mountains.

Culturally, Grenoble is vibrant and full of life. The city is home to over 34 museums, numerous theaters, and a host of festivals throughout the year. The large student population injects a youthful energy into the city, making it a lively place to live.

Finding a place to work is never an issue here. There are plenty of coworking spaces and cozy cafes where you can set up your laptop. The local university adds an intellectual vibe, and I’ve met many other remote workers, making it easy to build a professional network.

Food lovers will be in heaven in Grenoble. The local cuisine is delicious, with specialties like gratin dauphinois and walnuts from the region. But what really sets Grenoble apart is its craft breweries. The city is dotted with numerous artisanal breweries offering unique local beers. Visiting these breweries has become one of my favorite pastimes. Additionally, the local markets, like the Hoche Market and Les Halles Sainte Claire, are perfect for picking up fresh, high-quality produce.

Despite the relatively high cost of living (around $2973 per month), the quality of life in Grenoble is exceptional. The modern infrastructure, combined with the natural beauty and cultural richness, makes it a fantastic place to live and work.

In summary, Grenoble is an ideal destination for digital nomads. The combination of reliable internet, eco-friendly transport options, incredible outdoor activities, rich cultural scene, and outstanding local cuisine makes it a unique and compelling choice. If you’re looking for a place that balances work and leisure perfectly, Grenoble should definitely be on your list.
grenoble.description:
Grenoble is a nice city located in the Alps, great for people who enjoy nature and culture. With fast and reliable internet, it's a good place for digital nomads – no worries about internet connection! The city’s eco-friendly atmosphere shows in its walking areas and shared bike systems, making it easy to get around while reducing your carbon footprint.

People who enjoy outdoor activities will love it here. Whether you ski in the winter or hike in the summer, the mountain views are beautiful. The Bastille offers a great view of the city and the surroundings, making your experiences more enjoyable.

Culturally, Grenoble has many activities with over 34 museums, theaters, and a busy events schedule because of its large student population. Food lovers will appreciate local dishes, from tasty gratin dauphinois to good craft beers available in different breweries in the city.

However, be ready for a higher cost of living, around $2973 per month. While many locals are friendly, you might face some language challenges. But with comfortable cafes and many coworking spaces, you will feel at home. Overall, if you're looking for a good mix of work, outdoor activities, and culture, Grenoble is a place to visit!
grenoble.description_kor:
그레노블은 알프스에 위치한 아름다운 도시로, 자연과 문화를 즐기는 사람들에게 최적의 장소입니다. 빠르고 안정적인 인터넷 덕분에 디지털 노마드에게도 안성맞춤이며, 인터넷 연결 걱정은 없습니다! 도시의 친환경적인 분위기는 보행자 전용 지역과 공유 자전거 시스템에서 뚜렷하게 나타나, 탄소 발자국을 줄이면서도 편리하게 이동할 수 있습니다.

야외 활동을 사랑하는 분들은 이곳을 특히 좋아할 것입니다. 겨울에는 스키를 즐기고, 여름에는 하이킹을 하며, 산의 절경을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 바스티유에서의 멋진 전망은 도시와 그 주변을 한눈에 볼 수 있게 해 주어, 여러분의 경험을 더욱 특별하게 만들어줍니다.

문화적으로도 그레노블은 34개 이상의 박물관과 극장이 있으며, 다양한 문화 행사도 예정되어 있습니다. 이는 많은 학생 인구 덕분입니다. 음식 애호가들이라면 그라탱 도피누아 같은 맛있는 지역 요리부터 지역 양조장에서 만든 훌륭한 수제 맥주까지 다양하게 즐길 수 있습니다.

하지만 생활비는 약 2,973달러로 조금 비쌀 수 있으니 준비가 필요합니다. 많은 현지인들이 친절하지만, 언어 장벽이 있을 수도 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 아늑한 카페와 다양한 공동 작업 공간이 많아 마치 집 같은 편안함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 일을 하면서도 야외 활동과 문화를 즐기고 싶다면 그레노블은 반드시 방문해야 할 멋진 장소입니다!

reviews:
I spent a month here. I think it's a livable city but I don't know the value of living here long-term compared to other cities in LatAm.

Pros:
- Great bar and restaurant scene. Coffee shops are really chill. Service is really good for the most part, but everyone is too cool to be friendly (hipsters).
- It doesn't feel too unsafe, especially if you're not out late at night. It's no worse than any US coastal city. Maybe even safer. (came from Chicago, definitely safer than Chicago)
- There are some American/European expats and tourists here, but it's not like Mexico City levels. You will need to go out a lot to find them. This can be a pro or a con. I think you really need to like drinking to meet people here as there isn't much else to do.
- It's definitely a walkable city, but the public transit isn't super useful for an expat/nomad. Ubers are ridiculously cheap anyway and I never had a bad driver. You can get anywhere you need to go for a few dollars.
- Climate, at least in winter, is perfect. Not too hot or too cold. Some people don't like how it drops into the 50s at night, but I don't really notice cause I'm a Northerner anyway. Though there are some bad air quality days if you're sensitive to that.

Cons:
- If you stay in Colonia Americana or Providencia (and you'll most likely stay in either one of these hoods since they're safe and convenient), it's very yuppy. Yes, Mexico has yuppies. And that's not exactly what I signed up for visiting Mexico. So if you like Brooklyn and "cool people", this is the spot... me personally, I like a friendlier and less upper-class crowd. I don't find the people here particularly curious or eager to get to know foreigners even though there aren't that many tourists here compared to other major Mexican locations. It's not unfriendly either, I just think it's fairly townie.
- The security culture is pretty intense here. Feels a little over-the-top compared to the relative safety. A lot of "haves vs. have nots" kind of vibe here... I don't really like that. I prefer a more egalitarian atmosphere.
- Tons of grafitti in the central city. Definitely a lack of respect for private property here. 
- Tourist sites are pretty boring if you're here for a short stay. I don't even think it's worth it to visit as a tourist or for only a couple of days. It's a good place to practice Spanish for a month, experience living abroad for the first time, or save some dollars in a place with mostly familiar amenities.
- The cost of living is overall low here but Mexico has gotten a lot more expensive than it used to be. I'm not sure it's a great deal anymore. Cheaper than the US, but maybe only 15% cheaper than the cheapest mid-tier Midwest city (like a Columbus). 
- The grocery situation isn't great, especially in Colonia Americana. It seems like people eat out all the time.
- The best amenities are in the burbs but you probably don't want to live there. I did visit Zapopan and it feels a lot like a US burb.
- Very liberal. Again, feels like Brooklyn. If you're not a lefty, this is probably not your city.
- I think people drink and party and go to music shows here. If that's not your thing, it's probably going to be hard to meet people here.

Not a very exciting city…. Not a lot to do. It does have good restaurants & shopping. I did find it quite boring. Weather depending on the month can be very hot or cold. Wouldn’t recommend for long-term living unless you just want a chill city with not much to do. Better value for money in other cities in Latin America

GDL is great for a short trip. But, it's only March 10, and already it's getting hot. I can't imagine the heat in May or Summer. All in all, it's a great place to visit for a week or two. There's lots to do and see. But, after staying here for a month, I'm ready to move on.

I have lived all over the world the past 12 years and i have to say that Guadalajara or Zapopan where i live is my biggest favorite so far of all places. I have lived in Sweden, Gibraltar, Mauritius, Dubai, Australia, Spain, Panama, Costa Rica, Serbia, Montenegro and the US and now recently moved to Mexico and love this city more than Mexico City and Monterrey which i also tried before Guadalajara.

Its a modern and bustling metropolitan city with the feel of a small town charm and has everything you need and friendly people that give first class service and even try to speak english.

Go check it out you wont regret it!! 👌🏼

Great place. My fifth time here. Nice weather all year around and good food. Prices are good as well and internet has been consistently fast. Before you go, look up the neighbourhood as some places aren't safe.

I spent ten months in Guadalajara from roughly December 2020 to September 2021.
By the end, I personally had enough of being in a city, but it was nothing particular to Guadalajara compared to any other city of a comparable size. I really appreciated the cost of living here and the great vegan/vegetarian options for eating. I also greatly enjoyed the vast amounts of cheap fresh ripe fruit here like pitaya, en español “ tunas” a cactus fruit, coconuts, and mango. If you have access to a car, there are some beautiful canyons north of the city about 30 minutes. They’re especially beautiful during the rainy months. It’s also about 6 hours in a BlaBlaCar and less than 50 to go to puerto Vallarta or San Francisco on the beach. (second more recommended). If you stay in the northern/eastern parts of the city and the more well off areas, safety is never really a problem. The most I was wary of is getting my phone grabbed which happened to some friends while I was there. The basic rule of thumb is to not have valuables out in crowded areas and when using your phone, hold it with two hands close to your chest away from the street edges. I never felt like I was in physical danger or heard stories of any of my friends feeling like that. It is advisable to not go walking at night especially as a women. But I didn’t get the sense that it was especially dangerous to do so. Just generally a good idea. Talpalpa is a mountainous town outside of the city which was my favorite place to go to be in nature. It costs about 50 usd to hire a driver to go there. Flights around Mexico usually cost less than 100 usd. If you ever want to go to San Diego to or from, a tip is to head into tiajuana as it’s half the price in my experience. 

Beyond that, the yoga scene is surprisingly strong and there are an abundance of studios. There are some parks and a lot of the streets in the richer areas are lined with very old trees, but I personally felt a bit lacking in the nature area since I didn’t have access to a car. There is a strong expat community there. Check out the Mexpats group on Facebook to connect. Clubs are decent. Music scene is also decent.

Guadalajara did seem like a great city with beautiful statues and cathedrals, amazing food, very nice people. Unfortunately my trip was cut short, I only stayed half a week. On day 3 of my stay I was mugged at knife point on Av Miguel five blocks from Av Chapultepec, thankfully they only stole my phone and I was left unharmed. Nevertheless this shook me a little bit and, along with the Nov 18 security advisory for Guadalajara and the recent cartel activity in Cancun, had me decide to cut my losses and leave. I will definitely be back in a year or two when things calmed down a bit though.

Lived here for 4 months and counting, in Americana near Chapultepec. Of course this isn't representative of the entire city of Guadalajara. There are some places you definitely should not go as a tourist or nomad. But my experience living in this part of town has been pretty amazing overall. Very walkable, tons of nomad-friendly cafes everywhere, great restaurants and unique bars on every block. It seems like an underrated place for DNs. Downtown Tlaquepaque is a cool spot to go out, and there are several big shopping malls in nicer areas of the city.

Spent one month living and discovering Guad and area. Walked, bussed and Uber when necessary. NEVER felt unsafe. My Spanish is very basic and yet was able to communicate. Friendly and helpful people! Amazing for such a large city!🌺❤️
No... I feel very safe in Guadalajara. Have you been watching Narcos on Netflix?
Is it like cartel everywhere?
guadalajara.description:
Guadalajara is a lively city where modern life meets local culture. It has a strong food scene with good restaurants and cozy coffee shops, so you can find a nice place for any craving. The nightlife is good for social people, but you might meet a young crowd that is not very welcoming. The cost of living is reasonable, but some say it is getting more expensive.

This city is easy to walk in, but public transport may not be the best for newcomers—thankfully, affordable Ubers make getting around simple. In terms of safety, it's mostly fine, especially in areas like Colonia Americana and Providencia, but be careful at night and try not to show valuables in busy places.

Culturally, you will see rich history in nice plazas and impressive cathedrals. For those who enjoy the outdoors, the nearby mountains can be a nice getaway. While some find it a bit quiet after a while, Guadalajara is great for a relaxed stay with good food, friendly people, and sunny days. Don't forget to improve your Spanish—a little goes a long way here!
guadalajara.description_kor:
과달라하라는 현대적인 생활과 지역 문화가 조화를 이루는 활기 넘치는 도시입니다. 다양한 훌륭한 레스토랑과 아늑한 커피숍이 있어, 어떤 음식이든 만족시킬 기회를 제공합니다. 나이트라이프는 사회적 활동을 즐기는 사람들에게 좋지만, 그곳에서 만나는 젊은 인파가 마음에 들지 않을 수도 있습니다. 생활비는 적당하지만, 점차 비싸지고 있다는 의견도 있습니다.

이 도시는 걷기에 편리하지만, 대중교통은 처음 방문하는 이들에게는 최선의 선택이 아닐 수 있습니다. 다행히 저렴한 우버를 이용하면 이동이 쉬워요. 대체로 안전하지만, 콜로니아 아메리카나나 프로비덴시아 지역은 특히 더 안전하니 참고하세요. 그러나 밤에는 조심하고 붐비는 장소에서 귀중품을 드러내지 않도록 주의해야 합니다.

문화적으로는 아름다운 광장과 인상적인 대성당을 통해 풍부한 역사를 느낄 수 있습니다. 야외 활동을 좋아하는 이들에게는 인근 산들이 훌륭한 휴양지가 돼 줄 것입니다. 시간이 지나면서 조금 조용하게 느껴질 수도 있지만, 과달라하라는 맛있는 음식, 친절한 사람들, 햇살 가득한 날들이 있는 편안한 휴식처로 제격입니다. 스페인어 실력을 키우는 것도 잊지 마세요—조금만 해도 정말 큰 도움이 됩니다!

reviews: Pretty much near impossible to get by if English is your only language. Couldn't get a Chinese SIM. Experienced Racism in bars / clubs as the only Westerners in there. Bar staff disinterested to serve us and looking down on us. Beautiful skyline very impressive modern architecture but generally a nightmare getting around if you don't speak any Chinese. Wouldn't go again
guangzhou.description:
Guangzhou is a busy city known for its tall buildings and modern design. The mix of old and new is interesting, showing China’s history and its fast development. You can enjoy tasty Cantonese food and visit lively street markets.

However, some things can be difficult. It can be hard to get around the city if you don’t speak Chinese, as many locals may not speak English. Some visitors have felt uncomfortable in bars and clubs due to unwelcoming attitudes. It is important to be ready for these cultural differences when exploring the nightlife.

Public transportation in Guangzhou is widespread, but the language barrier can be a challenge for new visitors. If you plan to visit, consider learning a few basic Chinese phrases or going with a local guide. Despite its challenges, Guangzhou's appeal lies in its energy and culture—just remember the language tips for an easier trip! Popular places like the Canton Tower and the Pearl River offer memorable experiences.
guangzhou.description_kor:
광저우는 높은 건물과 현대적인 디자인으로 유명한 활기찬 도시입니다. 오래된 것과 새로운 것이 조화를 이루는 모습이 흥미롭고, 이는 중국의 역사와 빠른 발전을 잘 보여줍니다. 맛있는 광동 요리를 맛보거나, 활기찬 길거리 시장을 돌아다니는 재미도 있습니다.

하지만 이곳에서 몇 가지 어려움을 겪을 수도 있습니다. 중국어를 하지 못한다면 도시를 탐방하는 것이 쉽지 않을 수 있습니다. 많은 현지인들이 영어를 잘 하지 않기 때문에 소통에 어려움이 있을 수 있습니다. 일부 방문객들은 바나 클럽에서 느끼는 환영받지 못하는 분위기로 인해 불편함을 겪기도 했습니다. 나이트라이프를 즐길 때는 이러한 문화적인 차이에 미리 대비하는 것이 중요합니다.

광저우의 대중교통은 잘 발달되어 있지만, 언어 장벽이 새로운 방문객들에게 도전이 될 수 있습니다. 여행을 계획하고 있다면 기본적인 중국어 문구를 배워보거나 현지 가이드와 함께 다니는 것을 고려해보세요. 어려움이 있더라도 광저우의 매력은 그 에너지와 문화에 있습니다. 여행을 더욱 즐겁게 만들기 위해 언어 팁을 잊지 마세요! 유명한 관광지인 광저우 타워와 진주강은 꼭 기억에 남을 경험을 제공합니다.

reviews: Groningen is easy going but very international. Due to it's kind of "remote" location (well, Amsterdam is only 2 hrs. away) it's an island one its own with lots to do here: culture, nightlife (véry late!) but also a lot of beautiful quiet nature in the surroundings, You take a bike and you are in the middle of nowhere in just 15 minutes: lakes, woods in the south, or at the northside of the city: beautiful endless tyoical dutch landscapes with lots of famous black and white frisian cows, mills, canals, and even a real river, Reitdiep.

Great place to live. Not sure why 'Fun' and 'Nightlife' are classified as 'Okay' - it's actually great, better than Amsterdam in my opinion. 60k students on a population of 200k. Dozens of bars and clubs in the same area, drinks are cheap, bars don't close until 4-6am. Expenses are lower than listed too.
groningen.description:
Located in the northern part of the Netherlands, Groningen is a city that combines a relaxed atmosphere with lively international life. With around 60,000 students among a population of 200,000, it has a lot of energy, but still feels welcoming. If you enjoy nightlife, you might find Groningen even better than Amsterdam—there are many bars and clubs, drinks are affordable, and they stay open until the early hours!

Nature lovers will also be happy. Just a 15-minute bike ride brings you to nice landscapes with Frisian cows, old mills, and calm lakes or forests. It's a good place for those who want some peace after a night out.

Living costs are usually lower than expected, but using public transportation can be difficult for some. Also, language barriers might show up, but a smile often helps! Overall, Groningen is a great place to live, full of culture, activities, and a friendly atmosphere that makes anyone feel at home.
groningen.description_kor:
네덜란드 북부에 위치한 그로닝언은 편안한 분위기와 활기찬 국제적인 삶이 조화를 이루는 매력적인 도시입니다. 인구 20만 명 중 약 6만 명이 학생이라서 에너지가 넘치면서도 따뜻하게 맞아주는 느낌을 줍니다. 밤 문화를 즐기는 사람이라면 그로닝언이 암스테르담보다 더 매력적일 수도 있습니다. 이곳에는 많은 바와 클럽이 있고, 음료 가격도 합리적이며 새벽까지 영업을 하니 즐길 거리도 다양합니다!

자연을 좋아하는 이들에게도 기쁨을 선사할 것입니다. 자전거로 15분 거리에 가면 프리지아 소들, 오래된 풍차, 고요한 호수와 숲 등 아름다운 풍경을 만날 수 있습니다. 외출 후 평온함을 원하는 분들에게는 정말 좋은 장소입니다.

생활비는 보통 예상보다 낮은 편이지만, 대중교통 이용이 일부 사람들에게는 불편할 수 있습니다. 또한 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있지만, 미소가 큰 도움이 되기도 합니다! 전반적으로 그로닝언은 다양한 문화와 활동, 그리고 누구나 집처럼 느낄 수 있는 친근한 분위기로 가득한 멋진 거주지입니다.

reviews: I lived Guatemala City and Antigua for 1,5 years, Guatemala city can be ok, if you live in the right neighborhood. But in general its not walkable. It's a city designed for cars, like in the US. It's very dangerous in certain neighborhoods, but it's not a problem if you stay out of them. The city is great for business, also really stylish apartments, there's a parallel high society living in a bubble there and if you're part of it, live is way superior to what you would know from home. Sadly poorer Guatemalans are a little depressed and introverted and the upper class wont talk to foreigners unless you are there for a longer term and do something important. Women in general are friendly there, very conservative and girl-friend material. Depending on the zone, this will vary a lot, like everything in Guatemala. I had an amazing time there, probably one of the best in my life.

Was here for less than a week and got jumped at gunpoint at 2pm, broad daylight in front of police and traffic. No one did anything, gangs seem the run the place. I've travelled to dozens of places and have lived in Mexico for >6mo, Guatemala is a whole different caliber of dangerous. Maybe I was just unlucky?
guatemala-city.description:
Guatemala City has a mix of experiences, but it is important to know how to get around both physically and socially. Some neighborhoods are good for living, but it is important to know which ones to choose—they can change your experience from good to risky. The city is not very walkable because it is designed for cars, similar to cities in the US.

The cultural scene is active, with nice apartments and a growing business environment, especially if you are part of the upper class. However, it can sometimes feel separated from the rest, making it hard to connect with others. Many locals can be shy, but you will often find women to be friendly and open.

Just a warning: safety is a real concern. Some areas have a lot of crime, so being aware of your surroundings is important. Visiting historical sites and enjoying local customs can be great, but always stay alert. If you plan to visit, doing some research on neighborhoods and using trusted transportation can help make your experience here pleasant and safe!
guatemala-city.description_kor:
과테말라 시티는 다양한 경험이 공존하고 있지만, 신체적, 사회적으로 어떻게 이동할지를 아는 것이 매우 중요합니다. 어느 동네가 살기 좋은 곳인지 파악하는 것 역시 중요합니다. 잘못된 선택은 즐거운 경험을 위험한 상황으로 바꿀 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 차량 중심으로 설계되어 있어 보행하기에는 다소 불편하며, 미국의 도시와 비슷한 모습입니다.

문화적인 풍경은 활발하게 변화하고 있으며, 좋은 아파트와 함께 상류층을 대상으로 한 성장하는 비즈니스 환경도 존재합니다. 하지만 때때로 이곳은 다른 지역과 단절된 느낌을 줄 수 있어서, 사람들과의 연결이 쉽지 않을 때가 있습니다. 많은 지역 주민들이 내성적인 편이지만, 여성들은 대체로 친절하고 개방적입니다.

하나의 경고를 드리자면, 안전 문제가 실제로 우려되는 요소입니다. 일부 지역에서는 범죄가 많이 발생하기 때문에 주변 환경을 잘 인지하는 것이 중요합니다. 역사적인 명소를 방문하고 지역 문화를 즐기는 것도 좋지만, 항상 경계를 늦추지 않는 것이 필요합니다. 여행을 계획하고 있다면, 방문할 동네에 대한 조사를 미리 하고, 신뢰할 수 있는 교통수단을 이용하는 것이 안전하고 쾌적한 경험을 만드는 데 큰 도움이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
A few places for remote working:
1. Regus: has two office in Halifax and one in Dartmouth, you can pay by day, about 20-30 CAD per day. has meeting room.
2. Central library: free, plenty of seats, has food and drink. network is slow, need to keep quiet
3. Jolt Cafe: network is fast, can speak (for meeting), desk is small and doesn't have enough power outlet.
halifax.description:
Halifax is a good place for both relaxing and working. It has a mix of lively culture, nice waterfronts, and friendly locals who are happy to help. It is not too expensive, which is better for your budget compared to larger cities. You can find good places for remote work like Jolt Cafe, where coffee is quick and the Wi-Fi is fast, but the desk space is limited. The Central Library is a great spot for quiet time, offering free access and a comfortable atmosphere, but the slow internet may require some patience.

Public transportation is acceptable, but having your own vehicle could make things easier, especially for discovering local neighborhoods. While Halifax is generally safe and friendly, be prepared to follow local customs and ask for help if English is not your best language. Make sure to visit the historic downtown and try the seafood, but remember that it can get crowded during busy times. In summary, Halifax combines a feeling of a small town with urban activities and many chances to enjoy nature and culture.
halifax.description_kor:
핼리팩스는 휴식과 업무 모두에 적합한 장소입니다. 활기찬 문화와 아름다운 해안선, 그리고 친절한 현지 주민들이 어우러져 있습니다. 물가도 저렴해 대도시에 비해 예산을 아낄 수 있는 장점이 있습니다. 원격 작업을 위한 훌륭한 카페인 졸트 카페가 있어요. 여기에서는 빠른 커피와 고속 Wi-Fi를 제공하지만, 데스크 공간이 좀 제한적이니 참고하세요. 중앙 도서관은 조용히 시간을 보내기에 좋은 장소로, 무료로 이용할 수 있고 편안한 분위기를 제공합니다. 다만, 인터넷 속도가 느릴 수 있어 약간의 인내가 필요할 수 있습니다.

대중교통도 괜찮지만, 차량이 있으면 특히 지역 탐방이 더욱 편리합니다. 핼리팩스는 대체로 안전하고 친근한 곳이지만, 현지 문화에 반응하고 영어에 익숙하지 않다면 도움을 요청할 준비를 하는 게 좋습니다. 역사적인 다운타운을 방문하고 해산물 요리를 꼭 맛보세요. 하지만 바쁜 시간대에는 혼잡할 수 있다는 점도 기억하세요. 요약하자면, 핼리팩스는 아늑한 마을 분위기 속에서 도시의 활기와 자연, 문화적인 경험을 만끽할 수 있는 곳입니다.

reviews:
Haifa is amazing but DO NOT COME HERE.
I Repeat
DO
NOT
COME
HERE
THIS PLACE SUCKSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS
haifa.description:
Haifa is a city with many surprises. It is located on the slopes of Mount Carmel, with good views of the Mediterranean Sea. It is known for its gardens and different cultures. People enjoy the relaxed atmosphere and the mix of communities living together, which makes the city special. The Bahai Gardens are a popular place to see, with nice terraces and a calm feeling.

However, some locals have issues with the city’s public transportation and some safety problems, so be careful if you plan to explore. The cost of living can also be high, especially in busy areas. If you are thinking of visiting, it is helpful to learn a few Hebrew phrases, as English is not always spoken widely.

In Haifa, you will find good street food and a mix of modern and historical sites. Be ready for some challenges, especially with transportation, but enjoy the experience! Visiting areas like the German Colony can give you a glimpse of local life.
haifa.description_kor:
하이파는 정말 놀라움이 가득한 도시입니다. 카르멜 산의 경사면에 위치하고 있어 지중해의 아름다운 전망을 자랑하죠. 이 도시는 정원과 다양한 문화로 유명하며, 사람들이 느긋한 분위기 속에서 다양한 커뮤니티와 함께 살아가는 모습을 즐깁니다. 이런 점이 하이파를 특별하게 만듭니다. 특히 바하이 정원은 많은 관광객들이 찾는 인기 명소로, 아름다운 테라스와 평온함을 느낄 수 있어요.

하지만 일부 지역 주민들은 대중교통과 안전 문제에 대한 불만이 있어, 탐험을 계획할 때는 주의하는 것이 좋습니다. 번화한 지역에서는 생활비가 비쌀 수 있다는 점도 염두에 두세요. 방문할 예정이라면 히브리어 몇 마디 정도 배우는 게 유익할 수 있습니다. 영어가 널리 사용되지는 않기 때문이에요.

하이파에서는 맛있는 길거리 음식과 현대적인 장소, 역사적인 장소가 어우러져 있어요. 특히 대중교통과 관련해 몇 가지 도전이 있을 수 있으니 미리 준비하시고 잊지 못할 경험을 즐기시길 바랍니다! 독일 식민지 지역 같은 곳을 방문하면 지역 주민들의 삶을 엿볼 수 있는 좋은 기회가 될 거예요.

reviews:
Been living here for 6-months. Not the most sociable place, people are a bit avoidant. Apparently a 'Northern' thing. On a good note not very windy. 
Food is pretty cheap as In Germany in general. Summers are quite nice to spend around some lakes and river beaches. 

Flight connections are amazing. Also airport functions even with staff shortages, not overcrowded.

You can get around without German language that's for sure. On a very basic level.

But having a conversation or dealing with paperwork outside of city-center can be tricky.

Crime is very low. There is a large party area. Some pretty fun clubs. 

Probably for a nomad I would not recommend. A bit snobby/cold. 

But for a short-term work-stop is okay.

Spacious and calm overall.
Lived in Hamburg for 12 years. Nice place, but on the brink on turning in a bad direction since around spring 2020. Freedom of speech and freedom are in decline.
hamburg.description:
Hamburg is a city with its own feel, making it a mix for those who decide to live there or visit. If you want a place to relax, you'll enjoy the summers by the lakes and river beaches. Also, the food here is quite cheap, which is good if you want to try new things!

Public transportation is good, but you might find the language a bit difficult outside the city center. It’s okay at a basic level, but serious talks or paperwork can be hard if you don't speak German. On the bright side, Hamburg is usually safe, with low crime rates, and there are some busy areas where you can enjoy nightlife and have fun at clubs.

However, it's important to note that the locals can seem a bit distant, which some say is due to the northern culture. This might not be the right city for everyone, especially if you're looking for a friendly, outgoing atmosphere. But if you visit for a short work trip or a relaxed getaway, Hamburg provides a calm and open setting, with good access to flights, even when things get busy!
hamburg.description_kor:
함부르크는 독특한 매력을 가진 도시로, 이곳에 살거나 방문하기로 한 사람들에게 다양한 즐길 거리를 제공합니다. 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 공간을 원하신다면, 호수와 강가에서 여름을 만끽할 수 있을 것입니다. 음식 가격도 저렴해서 새로운 메뉴에 도전하기에 안성맞춤입니다!

대중교통은 잘 발달되어 있지만, 도심을 조금 벗어나면 언어 문제가 있을 수 있습니다. 기본적인 대화는 괜찮지만, 복잡한 대화나 서류 작업이 필요할 경우 독일어가 필요할 수 있으니 유의하세요. 긍정적으로 봐야할 점은 함부르크가 안전하고 범죄율이 낮으며, 활기찬 밤문화를 즐길 수 있는 지역이 많다는 것입니다.

하지만 현지인들이 다소 거리감을 두고 있는 것처럼 느껴질 수도 있습니다. 어떤 이들은 이것이 북부 성격 때문이라고 이야기합니다. 특히 더 친근하고 외향적인 분위기를 원하신다면 이 도시는 잘 맞지 않을 수 있습니다. 하지만 짧은 출장을 가거나 편안한 휴가를 즐기고 싶으시다면, 함부르크는 차분하고 열린 환경을 제공하며, 바쁠 때에도 항공편 접근성이 좋습니다!

reviews:
emmm
四省交界处，距离4省的省会都不远不近
并没有沾到京津冀和中原城市群的光
但是吧...确实比周边城市都更好一些，就是三线城市该有的那样
handan.description:
Handan is a small but interesting city in China, located at the meeting point of four provinces. It may not be as famous as big cities like Beijing or Tianjin, but it has its own appeal. Many people find it a little better than nearby cities, showing the typical feel of a third-tier city.

The cost of living here is low, making it easier to enjoy a comfortable lifestyle. Public transportation is not very extensive, so be ready to find your own way around. Walking and biking are good options to experience the local environment.

Culturally, Handan has important historical sites that are worth seeing, including old buildings and local traditions. Just remember that some people might not speak much English, so being patient is helpful.

For visitors, trying the local food is essential, and exploring different neighborhoods adds to the experience. Just remember to enjoy the slower pace of life—it is part of what makes Handan special!
handan.description_kor:
핸단은 중국의 작은 도시지만, 그만큼 매력적인 곳입니다. 이 도시는 네 개의 성이 만나는 지점에 위치해 있으며, 베이징이나 톈진처럼 유명하지는 않지만 독특한 매력을 가지고 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 핸단이 인근 도시들보다 조금 더 나은 분위기를 갖추고 있고, 전형적인 3선 도시의 감성을 느낄 수 있다고 이야기합니다.

생활비가 저렴해 편안한 라이프스타일을 즐기기에는 좋지만, 대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있지 않아서 스스로 길을 찾아야 합니다. 그래서 걷거나 자전거를 타며 지역을 탐방하는 것도 좋은 방법이죠.

문화적으로 핸단은 오래된 건물과 지역 전통 등 역사적인 볼거리가 많습니다. 다만, 몇몇 사람들은 영어 소통이 미흡할 수 있으니, 인내심을 갖는 것이 좋습니다.

방문객이라면 지역 음식을 꼭 시도해 봐야 하고, 다양한 동네를 구경하는 것도 특별한 경험이 될 것입니다. 느린 삶의 속도를 즐기는 것도 잊지 마세요. 그것이 핸단의 특별함 중 하나니까요!

reviews: Very nice to visit, the architecture, nature... I think that person who wants calm stable life and can make friends and has family can live quite decent life gere. The shops... amazing... The Neckar river and bridges... amazing... I have visited Heidelberg I think three times and I will come back to visit it again... It brings smile on my face.
heidelberg.description:
Heidelberg is a nice city that attracts visitors with its interesting buildings and natural views. Walking along the Neckar River, you will see beautiful sights and bridges that make for a nice day out. The city has a relaxed atmosphere, making it good for those looking for a calm life. Many people say it is easy to make friends here, and the local shopping is good with many different stores.

While Heidelberg has a lot to offer, it is important to note that the cost of living can be high, and public transportation may not be as good as in bigger cities. However, getting around the town is easy for most people. A suggestion for visitors is to check out the historical sites, which show the city's cultural history. Whether you are walking through narrow streets or having coffee with friends, Heidelberg is sure to make you happy each time you visit!
heidelberg.description_kor:
하이델베르크는 매력적인 건물과 아름다운 자연 경관으로 많은 방문객을 사로잡는 멋진 도시입니다. 네카르 강을 따라 걸어가면 환상적인 풍경과 멋진 다리를 감상할 수 있어 하루를 즐겁게 보낼 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 아늑한 분위기를 가지고 있어 차분한 생활을 원하는 이들에게 적합합니다. 많은 이들이 이곳에서 쉽게 친구를 사귈 수 있다고 말하며, 다양한 상점 덕분에 쇼핑도 즐기기 좋습니다.

하이델베르크는 여러 매력을 지니고 있지만, 생활비가 다소 높고 대중교통이 대도시만큼 발달하지 않았다는 점은 주의할 필요가 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 대부분의 사람들은 이 도시에서 이동하기가 그렇게 어렵지 않다고 느낍니다. 방문객들에게 추천하고 싶은 것은 이 도시의 문화와 역사를 품고 있는 역사적인 장소들을 둘러보는 것입니다. 아늑한 거리에서 산책하거나 친구들과 함께 커피를 즐기든, 하이델베르크는 매번 방문할 때마다 새로운 행복을 선사할 것입니다!

reviews:
I’ve been to 14 countries across 4 continents and travelled most of the US and I must say Havana is probably the most incredible city I have ever been to but is probably better suited for a vacation than for nomading. It’s not difficult to find wifi as most airbnbs and restaurants have it but it’s not reliable if you have important video conferencing calls or need to constantly stream something. 

Since most industries are publicly owned by the government, there’s a deep lack of commercialization that makes this place look so different from what you see in most other countries. Instead of large advertisements and billboards at every turn, there’s rich and beautiful art culture that makes just walking around and exploring this place the streets so enjoyable. Many people say that Havana feels like it’s stuck in the 1950’s which is definitely true since the classic city architecture and the vintage American muscle cars are all so well preserved. 

If you admire live music then you are definitely in for a treat as there is usually so many talented musicians and performers at every corner and in most bars/restaurants.

The food is mostly seafood but it’s underwhelming as it lacks flavor. Cuban coffee & rum on the other hand definitely do not disappoint nor do the famous Cuban cigars if you’re into that.

Another huge highlight is the Cuban people. They are truly the warmest and most welcoming of any country that I have been to. Such a diverse community and everyone always a bright smile on their face and are so excited to welcome you to their beautiful country. Knowing Spanish definitely helps but there is usually someone around that speaks English pretty well and can help you if you need.

Yes there are definitely struggles with a lack of certain supplies and some infrastructure challenges but I honestly felt like it made for a more unique experience that I very much enjoyed.

Overall i’d say pros/cons

Pros:
Beautiful city to explore
Perfect weather
Amazing people
VERY safe (and not with cops at every corner)
Quite affordable

Cons:
Unreliable Wifi
Underwhelming food
Limited resources
Need cash for all transactions

It’s probably not up to everyone but it offers a very unique culture and has such an amazing history to learn about. If you like good art, live music, and carribean weather, this is a great vacation spot.

Is this a joke? Havana shouldn't even be on this list at all. I lived there for 2 months on a mission and it's the most poorest city I have ever seen from my so far 40 countries travelled and lived on this planet. At the time being 2022, there was no electricity for several hours every day, our food in the fridge was always tossed to the trash because no electricity daily. There was no bottled water anywhere to buy, if you walk in the center, there is simply no water. Restaurants were without food, there is no bread unless you pay like 10$ for one slice. Buying food in the supermarket for foreigners? Not possible, no electricity. Card payment not working, no electricity. The old cabs are nice to take pics, but smell like gasoline inside, you get a headake at least. Tourism is communist style resorts that bring frozen fish from spain to serve to dumb package tourists. There is no fishing industry either. There is nothing, it's in fact like a prision with most people 40+, all the younger people are fleeing this hell. Be aware, if you read anyhting positive about Cuba, it's just propaganda written by Cubans that mostly live in Miami and get paid by the Cuban goverment, because Tourism is Cubas only industry. I feel sorry for the Cubans, and unfortunately they're not nice either because they are fighting for survival, you only get a smile if you pay for it basically.

Havana is great for a vacation, not for remote work. One of the best thing here is the atmosphere - it means people, music, fun, nightlife. BUT the situation with food is very complicated, is hard to find literally anything, there are queues everywhere. The internet is expensive (2.5 GB of LTE for 8 dollars) and very unstable. If you don't need so much internet to your work and if you are patient enough, you can enjoy Havana as it is really interesting and unique city.

I visited Havana during Thanksgiving in 2019, and I loved it! It has an amazing energy, and it's one of my favorite places ever to buy art (you can buy amazing paintings in the street for a great price!). It's also super interesting to learn about the culture and the history.
