However, not everything is perfect. Some new areas feel empty, and there have been issues with public transport projects. Healthcare does raise some worries, so it’s good to stay updated. While the city has its appeal, there are mixed opinions about its overall condition, especially compared to other parts of Malaysia.

If you're visiting, be sure to try the local food and take your time exploring the neighborhoods. Just be careful with your health when trying new foods! Overall, JB may have its difficulties, but the friendliness of the locals and the experience is hard to miss.
johor-bahru.description_kor:
조호르바루, 즉 현지인들이 'JB'라 부르는 이 도시는 매력과 함께 몇 가지 문제를 안고 있는 곳입니다. 이곳에 살다 보면 레저 팜이나 베이유 크릭 같은 곳에서 합리적인 임대료로 좋은 이웃과 함께할 수 있습니다. 음식은 다양하고 맛있으며, 쇼핑하기 좋은 현대적인 쇼핑 센터도 많이 있습니다. 분위기는? 싱가포르 같은 바쁜 도시보다 훨씬 더 여유롭습니다.

하지만 모든 것이 완벽한 건 아닙니다. 새로 개발된 지역 중 일부는 다소 황량한 느낌이 있고, 대중교통 프로젝트가 지연되기도 했습니다. 의료 서비스에 대한 걱정도 있어 항상 최신 정보를 확인하는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로 이 도시는 매력적인 면이 있지만, 말레이시아의 다른 지역들과 비교했을 때 평가가 엇갈리는 경우도 있습니다.

방문하신다면 현지 음식을 꼭 맛보고 이웃을 탐험할 시간을 가지세요. 새로운 음식을 시도할 때는 건강도 챙기는 걸 잊지 마세요! 전반적으로 JB는 어려움이 있을 수 있지만, 현지인들의 친절함과 그 경험은 정말 놓칠 수 없는 매력이 있습니다.

reviews:
Bikes being stolen all the time, even during day time while you are at work! More and more young people who have problems with drugs and are taking part in the criminal world. If you don't like to drink, there's nothing to do.
Horrible and depressing - the only thing is that it's pretty safe, depending on which part of the city you live in.

Beautiful place, family friendly, safe (except for the bikes, you can lose your wallet with money inside and find it on a bench - so it will be visible and will remain dry - but there is a ridiculous amount of bike stealing), but boring, SO boring.. except the summer. The summer is nice, you can have fun in one of the many lakes - at walking / biking distance of city center. The citizens are shy and keep distance, and it's very, very hard to make friends, but they are polite and respectful. If you get lucky you can spot Northern Lights (it's rare but happens). And the people are beautiful..

the police are nazis and shitheads. otherwise people-friendly town but the criminal world there is very unpredictable but otherwise good services and well educated people. mostly friendly too. many low income housing possibilities with a little drama attached to it. family friendly and beautiful especially in the summer. not much nightlife but very active for the bars/clubs it offers. welcome!
jyvaskyla.description:
Jyväskylä is a city with beauty and some challenges that shape its character. This family-friendly place is nice in the summer, especially with its lakes just a short walk or bike ride from the center. While the scenery is impressive, some visitors have pointed out a problem: bike thefts can be common, even during the day.

The locals are usually polite and respectful, but making friends can be difficult because they are shy. If you’re not interested in nightlife, you might find it a bit quiet, but the bars and clubs offer a good chance to relax for those who want to. The population is well-educated and there are good public services, although safety can differ by neighborhood.

One interesting thing is the chance to see the Northern Lights, a rare but beautiful experience. If you can deal with some issues like limited public transport and occasional problems in lower-income areas, Jyväskylä has its own charm waiting to be explored!
jyvaskyla.description_kor:
위바스큘라(Jyväskylä)는 독특한 매력과 함께 여러 도전 과제를 안고 있는 아름다운 도시입니다. 이곳은 가족 친화적인 환경을 갖추고 있으며, 특히 여름철에 방문하기 좋습니다. 호수들이 시내 중심가에서 가까운 거리에 있어, 짧은 도보나 자전거로 쉽게 접근할 수 있습니다. 멋진 경치는 인상적이지만, 일부 관광객들은 자전거 도난 문제가 여름철에 자주 발생한다고 언급했습니다.

현지 주민들은 대체로 공손하고 친절하지만, 약간 수줍은 성격을 가지고 있어서 새로운 친구를 사귀기에는 어려움이 있을 수 있습니다. 야경에 관심이 없다면 다소 조용하게 느껴질 수도 있지만, 바와 클럽에서는 원하는 분들을 위한 편안한 공간을 제공합니다. 이곳은 교육 수준이 높고 공공 서비스도 잘 갖춰져 있으나, 지역에 따라 안전 문제가 다를 수 있습니다.

또한, 위바스큘라에서는 드물지만 아름다운 북극광을 경험할 기회도 있습니다. 대중교통이 제한적이고 저소득 지역에서 발생하는 문제 등이 있긴 하지만, 이러한 점들을 감수할 수 있다면 매력적인 탐험의 장소가 될 것입니다!

reviews: To the previous reviewer. Kaduna - safe city, are you serious? According to Wikipedia, Boko Haram has Headquarters in Kaduna since September 2021, and generally they are most active in Northern Nigeria. Abuja-Kaduna train attack just happened, are not you following the news?

Kaduna is an amazing city. Typical northern Nigerian laisser faire scene, good food, very drivable, low traffic and pretty much safe. In the major city centres, the city is very safe and very walkable. You will hear a lot of news about dangerous events happening at the fringes of the state but then, that is like judging a city like new york-based on the crime stats alone and not the actual experience. Colab is the main co-working space here in Barnawa, Kaduna south. Its cheap to rent out a place as you can get a flat in a nice area for 1000 USD for the whole year. Hotels are well nice too at reasonable prices.
kaduna.description:
Kaduna is a city that combines the culture of northern Nigeria with some modern aspects. It is easy to walk around, especially in the main city areas, where the usual busy life mixes with a more relaxed feel. The local food is a highlight, offering a variety of flavors that many people enjoy.

Although some may worry about safety because of events in nearby areas, many locals feel safe in their neighborhoods and say you shouldn’t judge the city only based on news reports. Traffic is light, making it simple to get around and explore without much stress.

An added benefit is that renting in Kaduna is quite affordable. For about $1,000 a year, you can find a good place to live. There are also budget-friendly hotels available.

It is also helpful to know some local customs, and if you don’t speak the local languages, learning a few phrases is always a nice touch. Overall, Kaduna welcomes you to experience its traditions and friendly atmosphere!
kaduna.description_kor:
카두나(Kaduna)는 북부 나이지리아의 문화가 현대적인 요소와 잘 어우러진 도시입니다. 특히 주요 도시 지역에서는 바쁜 일상과 여유로운 분위기가 공존해 있어 걷기에도 아주 편리합니다. 지역 음식은 다양한 맛으로 가득 차 있어 많은 이들이 찾아오는 매력 포인트입니다.

인근 지역에서 발생하는 사건들로 인해 안전에 대한 우려가 있는 사람들도 있으나, 많은 현지 주민들은 자신들의 동네에서 안전하다고 느끼며, 뉴스를 보고 판단하기보다는 실제 경험이 중요하다고 이야기합니다. 교통 체증이 없어서 편안하게 돌아다니고 탐험하기 좋은 환경입니다.

또한 카두나의 임대료는 비교적 저렴한 편입니다. 연간 약 1,000달러에 좋은 거주 공간을 찾을 수 있으며, 예산에 맞는 호텔도 많이 있습니다.

현지 문화를 이해하는 것도 큰 도움이 되고, 현지 언어를 하지 못하더라도 몇 가지 회화를 배우는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로 카두나는 여러분이 전통적인 매력과 따뜻한 환대를 경험할 수 있는 곳입니다!

reviews: This place rocks! when youre talking about Kabul you always have to use the 3 C's! Coffee , Cafes and Candy!
kabul.description:
Kabul is a city full of interesting things to see and do. Many visitors enjoy the coffee culture; there are many cafés in the city where you can drink strong coffee while feeling the local atmosphere. And don't forget the sweets! There are many shops with tasty treats that you should try.

While Kabul has many nice things, there are some difficulties to think about. Public transportation is not very good, and getting around can be difficult. Safety is important, so it's wise to be careful and follow local advice. The cost of living can be high in some areas, but you can find good deals in the local markets.

If you want a local experience, try visiting historical sites or walking in the parks. Get to know the culture, talk to the locals, and you will discover the unique features of Kabul!
kabul.description_kor:
카불은 볼거리와 할거리가 가득한 매력적인 도시입니다. 많은 방문객들이 도시 곳곳에 있는 카페에서 커피 문화를 즐기며 현지의 분위기를 만끽하고 있습니다. 이곳의 카페들은 강한 커피를 제공하니, 꼭 한 잔 드셔보세요. 아울러 달콤한 간식들도 놓치지 마세요! 다양한 맛있는 간식을 파는 가게들이 많으니, 꼭 한 번 맛보시길 추천합니다.

카불에는 좋은 점이 많지만, 고려해야 할 어려움도 존재합니다. 대중교통 시스템이 그리 발달하지 않아 이동이 불편할 수 있습니다. 안전이 가장 중요하니, 항상 조심하고 현지인들의 조언을 따르는 것이 바람직합니다. 특정 지역에서는 생활비가 비쌀 수 있지만, 지역 시장에서는 좋은 가격으로 물건을 구입할 수 있습니다.

현지의 진정한 경험을 원하신다면 역사적인 장소를 방문하거나 공원에서 산책해보세요. 문화를 배우고, 현지인들과 소통하면서 카불의 독특한 매력을 발견할 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews:
Kaliningrad is great city! Most of "scores" and "Pros and Cons" are not true. Because of Baltic Sea, it's quite warm here in winter, not much of snow. But yes, humidity is quite high.
Cannabis is illegal! Be attentive!
People are tolerant, no matter who you are if you have good maneers.
kaliningrad.description:
Kaliningrad is a city waiting to be visited. It is by the Baltic Sea, which means it has mild winters and you will not see much snow. However, it can be humid, so a light jacket may be useful.

One of the good things about Kaliningrad is the friendly people. If you are polite, you will find that locals are very welcoming. There is a mix of cultures here that gives the city a unique feel.

On the other hand, some visitors have said that public transportation is limited, which can make getting around difficult if you do not have a car. You might also face language barriers, so learning a few Russian phrases could be helpful.

When you are in Kaliningrad, make sure to check out the historical sites and local customs, as they explain the history of this interesting place. Just remember that cannabis is illegal, so avoid any issues there. Overall, Kaliningrad is a nice city for those wanting to see something different.
kaliningrad.description_kor:
칼리닌그라드는 방문을 기다리는 매력적인 도시입니다. 발트해 근처에 위치해 있어 겨울철은 온화하고 눈도 많이 내리지 않습니다. 다만, 습기가 있을 수 있으니 가벼운 자켓을 챙기는 것이 좋습니다.

칼리닌그라드의 또 다른 매력은 친절한 사람들입니다. 당신이 예의 바르게 행동하면 현지인들이 정말 따뜻하게 맞이해줄 것입니다. 다양한 문화가 어우러져 있어 이 도시만의 독특한 분위기를 자아냅니다.

하지만 일부 방문객들은 대중교통이 다소 제한적이라고 느끼기도 하며, 자동차 없이 이동하기에는 불편할 수 있습니다. 또한, 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니 몇 가지 기본 러시아어 표현을 미리 알아두는 것이 유용할 수 있습니다.

칼리닌그라드를 방문할 때는 이 흥미로운 도시의 역사를 잘 보여주는 역사적 유적지와 지역적 관습을 꼭 살펴보시기 바랍니다. 대마초는 불법이니 이 점도 유념하고, 불필요한 문제에 휘말리지 않도록 주의하세요. 전반적으로 칼리닌그라드는 색다른 경험을 원하는 여행자들에게 매우 적합한 도시입니다.

reviews: Visited Kampala a few times. I can't say I would really recommend it for nomads. It's quite chaotic, traffic is rough, not much of a food/cafe/coworking scene, not very scenic or much to do. The socializing is great - Ugandans are super friendly and love to party. But for remote work, I'd go elsewhere.

I love Kampala! I have been coming here since 10 years now as a digital nomad. I am here a few times a year. I have been in 20 countries in Africa and would say it is the most friendly one. Kampala is definitely a lot of fun and has good restaurants and the rest of Uganda is beautiful too. I host several times a year coworking and co-living experiences for digital nomads in Uganda. You are more than welcome to join us.
kampala.description:
Kampala is a lively city that is warm and friendly. If you enjoy social events, you will like how the locals invite you to their parties and celebrations. The city can be busy, especially with traffic that can test your patience, but that is part of its character.

Some visitors say that there are not many cafés or coworking spaces, but there are good restaurants where you can enjoy local food, and the beautiful nature in Uganda is worth seeing. If you plan to work remotely, you may find it a bit hard to settle down here, as working cafés are not very common.

In terms of safety, Kampala usually feels welcoming, but it's always good to be aware of your surroundings, especially in crowded places. For a taste of local culture, try to join in on celebrations or meet friendly people. If you are interested, getting involved in co-living or coworking events can be a good way to meet others.
kampala.description_kor:
캄팔라는 따뜻하고 친근하면서도 활기찬 도시입니다. 사회적 활동을 즐기신다면, 현지인들이 파티와 축하 행사에 초대해주는 방식이 마음에 드실 겁니다. 이 도시는 교통이 복잡한 편이라 인내심이 필요할 수 있지만, 그것 또한 도시의魅力 중 하나입니다.

어떤 방문객들은 카페나 코워킹 스페이스가 많지 않다고 느끼지만, 현지 음식을 맛볼 수 있는 훌륭한 레스토랑들이 있습니다. 또한, 우간다의 아름다운 자연은 꼭 한 번 경험해볼 가치가 있습니다. 만약 원격 근무를 계획하신다면, 일하기 좋은 카페가 그렇게 많지 않아 적응하기 어려울 수 있습니다.

안전 측면에서 보았을 때, 캄팔라는 전반적으로 환영받는 분위기지만, 특히 혼잡한 장소에서는 항상 주변을 주의하는 것이 좋습니다. 지역 문화를 체험하고 싶다면 축제에 참여하거나 친절한 사람들과의 만남을 시도해보세요. 또한, 공동 생활이나 코워킹 이벤트에 참여하면 새로운 사람들을 만나는 좋은 기회가 될 것입니다.

reviews: Really quite hectic and not a very nice city. I wouldn't spend more than a day or two here, not much to see, and there aren't many places to work/eat/see. You're better off heading down to the beaches for some sunshine and beach as well as much faster WIFI.
kandy.description:
Kandy, a city in Sri Lanka, has a mixed reputation among visitors. Some people say it is busy and recommend spending only a day or two there. While it has some nice features, it often seems to lack good food and work places that attract visitors.

On the positive side, Kandy is known for its famous Temple of the Tooth, a UNESCO World Heritage site, where you can learn about the culture and history. The views around are also nice, with green hills and calm lakes. However, if you want a lively city atmosphere or many dining choices, you might find it a bit lacking.

Public transport can be difficult, with few options, and language difficulties may arise too. For an easier experience, consider learning about local customs and having some Sinhala phrases ready. In short, Kandy gives a special look at Sri Lankan culture, but many people prefer to go to the coast for some sun and sand.
kandy.description_kor:
스리랑카의 도시 캔디는 방문객들 사이에서 복합적인 평판을 얻고 있습니다. 어떤 이들은 캔디가 다소 북적거린다고 느끼며, 하루나 이틀 정도 머무는 것을 추천하곤 합니다. 여기에는 몇 가지 좋은 특징이 있지만, 매력적인 음식점이나 편안히 일할 수 있는 장소는 다소 부족한 느낌이 드는 것 같습니다.

긍정적인 점은 캔디가 유네스코 세계문화유산으로 지정된 유명한 불치사로 잘 알려져 있어, 이곳에서 풍부한 문화와 역사를 배울 수 있다는 것입니다. 주변 경치도 아름다워 푸른 언덕과 잔잔한 호수로 둘러싸여 있습니다. 하지만 활기찬 도시의 분위기나 다양한 식사 선택지를 원하신다면, 캔디는 조금 아쉬운 면이 있을 수 있습니다.

대중교통이 제한적이라 이동이 불편할 수 있으며, 언어 장벽도 있을 수 있습니다. 보다 수월한 경험을 원하신다면, 지역 문화에 대해 알아보고 싱할라어의 몇 가지 표현을 익혀가는 것도 좋습니다. 요약하자면, 캔디는 스리랑카 문화를 깊이 있게 체험할 수 있는 장소지만, 많은 이들은 햇볕과 해변을 즐기러 해안 쪽으로 향하는 것을 선호합니다.

reviews:
- Relaxed city to live in and incredibly safe. Nice if you want access to nature in southern Taiwan. Not so much english but locals are very friendly and will always try to help you.
- Lots of cheap food available but while some is tasty, most is highly processed and full of oil/sugar . If you want decent quality food, it won't be much cheaper than back home. Many restaurants have an order card, so if you can't speak chinese you can grab the card and a pencil and use your phone to translate the card and tick off what you want - easy as.
- Nightlife is based around night markets, KTV, places to "hang out" etc with a handful of decent bars/clubs around if you're into that.
- Traffic is much safer than countries in SEA but still not perfect.
- Very hot in summer but winter has good temperatures (although increased pollution in winter). Lots of sunshine most of the year with little rain/clouds which is nice.
- Internet is fine and it's easy to get an unlimited data sim for around 700NTD/month and hotspot yourself if you need it .
- All healthcare professionals speak some degree of english.

Great city in Southern Taiwan on a major port. 
Lots of stuff to do if you like the outdoors. A mountain to climb, a beach to go to, and trains and buses readily available to go to surrounding outdoor activities. 
Cons:
English speaking is not great, but the locals are. And even if you don't speak Mandarin they will do their best to help you. Plenty of English speaking doctors, dentists etc. Most restaurants have a double menu. So it's not that big of a con and there are many classes that will help you learn at least the basics. 

Pollution and Air Quality are terrible, not so bad that you can't go out and can't function, but the south is home to lots of refineries and factories that pay their way out of keeping up to standards and the air from China blows right over the western part of the Island compacted by a mountain range from the central to eastern part of the Island so no where for the bad air to escape too. Lived in Kaohsiung 3 different times for a year each time and it is not unbearable if you don't have any breathing or allergy conditions. 

Scooters/ Also a Pro? There is a very clean efficient Metro but lines are lacking making it hard to get out to the neighborhoods that don't have easy access (Eastern Kaohsiung). The government is cracking down on crappy old polluting scooters, but that doesn't really help the people that like to drive on sidewalks and such. 

Traffic Laws and signals ignored - The government has installed cameras and over the years things have gotten better, but the lack of regard for traffic laws does make driving and walking dangerous. It's probably the biggest flaw within the control of the local people and government. There are hardly any sidewalks (especially in the older neighborhoods) so it does make you keep up your alertness while walking or biking around town. 

Pros:
Aside from the traffic wildness, the whole country is extremely safe and most people are honest. Women are safe, children are safe, elderly people are safe. As a young woman never felt unsafe. Can walk anywhere at 3 am. If not for the pollution this is where I would want to raise a family. 

Parks- Lots of parks in the city, lots of things to do and see in them. 

Museums- Lots of museums and everything is in English in all of the major ones. Great for children and school trips.

Community- Not just with all the Expats, Nomads, English teachers, but also friends with many locals. It's easy to make friends if you take the time. Join sports leagues, dance classes, jiu-jitsu classes, art classes you'll make plenty of friends and the local friends will help you to experience the actual culture of Taiwan, which is worth coming for. It also helps with learning the language to get over a bit of the culture shock of being illiterate. Of Europe, The American, (have yet been to Africa), this was culturally the coolest and most interesting of all of the places I've been. Just so much history and culture on this tiny Island.

Culture - Maternal Culture, I use to threaten kids by calling the head of the family, aka Grandma. Aboriginal, Portuguese, Japanese, Chinese, and US all wrapped into one tiny place. Festivals year-round.

Food - Excellent, even for picky eaters, but better if you're adventurous. Cheap food that's great, Western restaurants while more expensive are still really good and comparable to prices overseas, it's not crazy expensive.

Costco locations and carrefour so you have access to most of the goods you can get at home in Canada, Australia the US or Western Europe. 

Affordable 2 bedrooms, new, non-luxury around 17,000NTD. Luxury New around 24,000NTD, older not luxury less than 12000NTD. 

Wifi and Technology in general - Great Wifi, Great prices on Computers and tech stuff. Even a whole street dedicated to selling and fixing computers in a central location.

Cafe's - Lots of cafes with wifi, free wifi mostly everywhere though. Coffee culture was hardly there 12 years ago, it's a relatively new concept, but it's growing exponentially, check out SPR coffee. 

Healthcare - Great and reasonably priced. Have been in accidents and have been injured playing sports. Even if you aren't on the national health care, healthcare is easy to get and affordable, minimal fees. A serious accident/injury/illness would require some insurance though so check into that when you get here.

Some miscellaneous stuff:

Nightlife is so-so, Not many nightclubs, but the ones that do exist are okay and you'll find it hard to leave before daybreak. At which point you'll be able to hit up a breakfast shop before going home to pass out til noon (life as a young English teacher, or sometimes a major social event in which every English speaking local and Expat/foreign student shows up)

The weather is hot most of the year. Summer is brutally hot, but fall and spring are nice if you like around 26 or so. Winter is nice, but it can get cold, there is no heat in the apartments. By cold I mean the occassional string where the temperatures dip to around 10 or so. sometimes cooler. Doesn't last long, but does happen. You can buy heaters almost anywhere if you need them. 

It is really easy to get around Taiwan, via buses and trains. Busy during holidays so keep that into consideration. They are also very affordable. There is so much to do. Mountains, Festivals all the time year-round, Kenting(south), Taroko Gorge(northeast), The eastern side of the island is gorgeous and less populated. Air Quality is much better on the other side of the mountains. If you're a city mouse and you like getting out, Taiwan is a great place to be. 

Bureaucracy exists for visas and other life stuff, but given the language barrier, doing this kind of stuff in Taiwan is substantially easier than even being a citizen and the bureaucratic crap we put up with in western countries, especially Europe and visa processes. A dream compared to the American/Canadian processes. Most of the people that stay here for a long period of time and get their APRC(permanent residents) will tell you it's because life here is easy. And it is, if you make a certain threshold 2000 USD you'll live like a king or queen.

Kaohsiung is a more relaxed city as compared to other major cities in Asia. You can enjoying working and taking vacation in this warm city. However, it is not quiet a English speak city. So, it is better if you know some simple Chinese here. It also close to Kenting, a beautiful beach area in Taiwan. Good place for remote working and vacation.

Lovely city, nice people, easy to get around and great warm weather.
Kaohsiung is a fantastic hub for expats and nomads, however, the nightlife here can be a bit dull.
Still though, great fun all around, and very cheap and affordable.

An amazing city for the value. Beach, MRT, Sun, and about half price of what you would pay in Taipei. Also, lots of super cheap flights all around Asia from the city airport. Been here a year so far and I like it. Not much in terms of night life, but a good digital nomad community. Also, really helps if you speak Chinese. An undiscovered Gem that I could see getting more popular with digital nomads in the next few years.
The City and the area is quite nice but its very sleepy city... There is not much cultural stuff going on and nightlife is shitty. I got bored fast and mooved to another city
kaohsiung.description:
Kaohsiung is a friendly city in southern Taiwan, good for those who want a relaxed lifestyle. It is a place where nature is close and safety is normal. The local people are very nice and willing to help, even if you don’t speak Mandarin.

The food here varies, with tasty and cheap snacks at night markets and some greasy choices. If you want to try local dishes, be ready to pay a little more for better quality meals that taste good. The city is lively at night, with night markets and KTV spots, even if the bar scene is not very active.

Getting around can be a bit difficult with few metro lines, but cheap trains and buses make it easier to explore. Just so you know, traffic can be heavy and air quality is not always good. The healthcare system is good, and many people speak English, which is helpful.

So if you want a more relaxed city experience with lots of sunshine, parks, and local traditions, Kaohsiung could be a good choice for you. Be ready to enjoy some culture and make a few local friends.
kaohsiung.description_kor:
가오슝은 대만 남부에 위치한 아늑한 도시로, 여유로운 생활을 원하는 이들에게 매우 적합한 곳입니다. 자연과 가까워 안전한 환경이 일상에서 느껴집니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하고 도와줄 의향이 많아서, 비록 중국어를 잘 하지 못하더라도 걱정할 필요가 없습니다.

이곳의 음식은 매우 다양하고, 특히 야시장에서 맛있고 저렴한 간식과 기름진 음식을 즐길 수 있습니다. 현지 요리를 경험하고 싶다면, 조금 더 투자해서 질 좋은 음식을 맛보는 것도 좋습니다. 이 도시는 밤이 되면 활기로 가득 차며, 야시장과 KTV가 인기를 끌지만 바 문화는 그리 발달하지 않았습니다.

교통은 지하철 노선이 상대적으로 적어 다소 불편할 수 있지만, 저렴한 기차와 버스를 이용하면 도시를 탐험하기 편리합니다. 단, 교통 체증이 심하고 공기 질이 항상 좋지 않을 수 있다는 점은 유의해야 합니다. 의료 시스템은 양호하며, 많은 사람들이 영어를 구사할 수 있어 도움을 받을 수 있습니다.

그래서 많은 햇살과 공원, 그리고 지역 전통이 어우러진 편안한 도시 경험을 원하신다면, 가오슝이 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다. 문화도 즐기고 몇몇 지역 친구들도 사귈 준비를 해보세요.

reviews:
Probably biggest pro of Katowice is cheap and big airport. Think of most boring city you've been to, Katowice itself is even more boring. I don't know how this place made it to nomadlist. However there are nice cities around which seem nice destinations for nomads like Gliwice, Bielsko-Biała, Pszczyna, Żywiec. Moreover coworking space listed here on nomadlist - Wirtualne Biuro is not a coworking space at all. As you can read on it's website (adding URL blocked in review unfortunately)
"This is not a drop-in scenario for the homeless digital wanderer looking for somewhere to stash the laptop and the rear end to do some work, but it is the place to make a virtual office with a prestigious address in the city heart of Katowice to impress those you may want to dazzle".
Locals seldomly get what being digital nomad is about.
katowice.description:
Katowice may not be on everyone’s favorite list, and there are reasons for that. It has a large and cheap airport that connects you to Poland and other places, but some visitors find the city a bit dull. It is a quieter place, and you might need to go to nearby Gliwice or Bielsko-Biała for more to do.

On the positive side, the cost of living here is low, which is good for your budget. However, the public transportation may not meet your needs, and most people feel safe here, so that is not a concern. Just keep in mind that the culture may not be as friendly to digital nomads as you might like—don’t expect coworking spaces to be like what you know.

If you plan to visit, enjoy learning about local customs, but be aware that you might face some language difficulties. Overall, Katowice is a place where you may need to look a bit deeper to find its appeal.
katowice.description_kor:
카토비체는 모든 사람의 여행 스폿 목록에 오르기 어려운 곳입니다. 그럴 만한 이유가 있어서, 이곳에는 폴란드와 다른 지역으로의 연결성이 좋은 저렴한 공항이 있지만, 일부 방문객들은 이 도시가 다소 지루하게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 카토비체는 조용한 도시로, 더 많은 즐길 거리를 원한다면 인근의 글리비체나 비엘스코비아우라 등을 방문하는 것이 좋습니다.

하지만 긍정적인 점도 있습니다. 이곳 생활비가 저렴해 예산 여행에 안성맞춤입니다. 물론, 대중교통이 개인의 기대에 미치지 못할 수 있지만, 대부분의 사람들은 이곳에서 안전하게 지낼 수 있다고 느끼므로 그 점은 크게 걱정하지 않아도 됩니다. 단, 카토비체의 문화가 디지털 노마드들이 기대하는 만큼 친숙하지 않을 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다. 코워킹 스페이스도 일반적으로 알려진 것과 다를 거라는 생각은 하지 않는 것이 좋습니다.

만약 방문할 계획이 있다면, 지역 관습을 배우는 즐거움이 있는 동시에 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있다는 점도 인식해야 합니다. 전반적으로 카토비체는 숨겨진 매력을 찾기 위해 좀 더 자세히 살펴봐야 하는 곳입니다.

reviews:
Living here for a couple of years already. Cost of living information is very accurate, even surprised me :D But I can't agree with couple Cons. As mentioned in the older review, pretty much everyone speaks english, only some older folks (40+) doesn't.
It's true that LGBT community isn't very popular, but I would not say that it's hostile. Lithuanians indeed are a bit closed in, but that's only till the first drink, then everyone becomes besties. If you struggle with making friends visit "Dzem Pub" bar, it's very popular between foreigners and students, after a couple drinks people will come up to get to know you, don't be too shy to just ask groups if you can join them!

I am not sure when this was done but I have moved to Kaunas this September looking for a quiet place to work.
Everyone speaks english and the average of the costs I spent per month including the rent for the flat is 500 - 600 euros.
kaunas.description:
Kaunas is a nice place in Lithuania, good for anyone looking for an easy and low-cost place to live or visit. Residents like the low cost of living, with many managing on about 500-600 euros a month. Most people here speak English, especially younger people, so language won't be a big issue.

The atmosphere might feel a bit quiet at first, but if you go to Dzem Pub, a popular spot for locals and visitors, you will see that Lithuanians become friendly after having a drink or two. It’s a good place to meet new people.

Kaunas has a lot of history and interesting places to visit, such as the old town and nice parks. Just remember that the LGBT community is still developing, so it's good to be aware of local customs.

Public transport is okay, but you should check the schedules if you want to explore. Overall, Kaunas provides a mix of friendliness, low costs, and welcoming people who are ready to talk!
kaunas.description_kor:
카우나스는 리투아니아에 있는 훌륭한 장소로, 저렴하고 편안하게 생활하거나 방문하기 좋은 곳입니다. 이곳 주민들은 저렴한 생활비를 선호하며, 많은 사람들이 한 달에 약 500-600유로로 생활하고 있습니다. 대부분의 사람들이 영어를 잘 구사하고, 특히 젊은 세대는 더욱 그렇습니다. 따라서 언어 문제가 큰 걱정이 되지는 않을 것입니다.

처음에는 분위기가 조용하게 느껴질 수 있지만, Dzem Pub 같은 인기 있는 장소에 가면 곧 리투아니아 사람들의 친절함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 이곳은 새로운 사람들을 만나는 데 아주 좋은 곳입니다.

카우나스에는 역사와 흥미로운 관광지가 많습니다. 구시가지와 아름다운 공원 등 방문할 만한 곳이 가득합니다. LGBT 커뮤니티는 계속 발전 중이므로, 지역의 문화와 풍습을 이해하는 것이 중요합니다.

대중교통도 괜찮지만, 주변을 더 탐험하고 싶다면 시간표를 잘 확인해야 합니다. 전반적으로 카우나스는 친절한 사람들, 저렴한 비용, 그리고 대화를 나눌 준비가 된 분위기로 가득한 장소입니다!

reviews: It’s great. My lovely city
kazan.description:
Kazan is a place that attracts anyone who visits. This city combines history with modern life, giving you a taste of both. Walking through the streets, you'll see interesting buildings, from the well-known Kazan Kremlin to colorful mosques. The local culture is lively, with tasty Tatar food that many people enjoy – make sure to try the echpochmak and chak-chak!

While life in Kazan can be enjoyable, it has some challenges. The cost of living is usually affordable, but some areas may be more expensive than you think. Public transportation works well, but it might feel limited in some places, so you may need to walk a bit.

Safety is generally good, but it's a good idea to stay alert, like in any city. A tip? Learn some basic Russian phrases; it helps in talking to the friendly locals! Explore the neighborhoods, experience the culture, and enjoy the activities in the city – there’s always something going on in Kazan!
kazan.description_kor:
카잔은 모든 방문객을 매료시키는 멋진 도시입니다. 이곳은 역사와 현대적인 생활이 조화를 이루며, 두 가지 매력을 동시에 제공합니다. 거리를 걸으면 유명한 카잔 크렘린과 화려한 모스크를 포함한 다양한 흥미로운 건축물들을 만나볼 수 있습니다. 현지 문화는 생동감 넘치고, 특히 많은 사람들이 즐기는 맛있는 타타르 음식이 있습니다. 에흐포크막과 차크착은 꼭 한번 맛보세요!

카잔에서의 생활은 즐거운 경험이지만, 몇 가지 도전 과제가 있을 수 있습니다. 생활비는 일반적으로 저렴한 편이지만, 특정 지역에서는 예상보다 비쌀 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 잘 운영되지만, 어떤 지역은 다소 제한적일 수 있어 한두 곳은 걸어서 이동해야 할 수도 있습니다.

전반적으로 안전한 편이지만, 어떤 도시에서나 마찬가지로 주의를 기울이는 것이 좋습니다. 팁 하나 드리자면, 기본적인 러시아어 문구를 익혀두면 좋습니다. 그러면 친절한 지역 주민들과 소통하는 데 도움이 될 거예요! 동네를 탐험하고 다양한 문화를 체험하며 시내에서 진행되는 다양한 활동을 즐겨보세요. 카잔에서는 언제나 뭔가 흥미로운 일이 일어나고 있습니다!

reviews:
Kathmandu, the lively heart of Nepal, is a place where ancient traditions harmoniously mingle with the pulse of modern life. Tucked away in the stunning Himalayas, it’s a fantastic gateway to breathtaking landscapes and sacred sites, promising travelers a vibrant mix of experiences. From the energy of bustling markets to the tranquility of hilltop views, Kathmandu enchants everyone who steps through its doors.

What to Expect:
Get ready for a sensory adventure in Kathmandu! You'll be greeted by the captivating aroma of incense wafting from age-old temples, the familiar buzz of honking motorbikes zipping through narrow streets, and the sight of beautifully carved wooden buildings that whisper stories of a rich past. Durbar Square is a must-see, showcasing royal palaces, shrines, and statues from the magnificent Malla period. And don’t miss the UNESCO World Heritage Sites like Swayambhunath (the Monkey Temple) and Pashupatinath Temple—they’re the spiritual heartbeats of this vibrant city, drawing both Hindus and Buddhists from afar.

While the streets can feel a bit busy, especially in the lively Thamel district, there’s a constant thrill in the air. Visit local markets bursting with fresh produce, aromatic spices, and artisan crafts, or unwind in rooftop cafes offering stunning views of the city. From trendy spots to cozy yoga studios, Kathmandu combines modern conveniences with its authentic charm.

What You Should Know:
Cultural Heritage: Kathmandu is a treasure trove of history and spirituality. As you wander around, you'll stumble upon countless temples, stupas, and historical landmarks. The architecture tells tales of the city’s past, especially in the beautifully preserved areas of Patan and Bhaktapur.

People & Traditions: One of the best parts of Kathmandu is the warmth of its people. The hospitality is genuine, and locals love to share stories, give directions, or just have a friendly chat over a cup of chai.

Traffic & Infrastructure: With rapid growth, Kathmandu can get pretty congested, and you might encounter the occasional power cut. Traffic jams and uneven sidewalks are part of the adventure, but exciting improvements are on the horizon, like better roads and new infrastructure projects.

Outdoor Activities: If you’re up for a little adventure, Kathmandu is the perfect launching pad for trekking up to Everest Base Camp or the Annapurna Circuit. If trekking isn’t your thing, the nearby hills of Nagarkot and Dhulikhel offer breathtaking sunrise views of the Himalayas without stepping too far from the valley.

Food Scene: When it comes to food, Kathmandu has something to tantalize every palate. You’ll find delicious local staples like Dal Bhat (rice and lentils), momos (dumplings), and traditional Newari cuisine. Plus, there’s an increasing number of charming cafes and eateries serving a variety of international dishes.

Spiritual & Healing Retreats: Many travelers find themselves drawn to Kathmandu not just for adventure but also for spiritual growth and healing. Whether it’s a yoga retreat, a meditation center, or a wellness resort, Kathmandu is a nurturing space for anyone looking to reconnect with themselves.

Final Thoughts:
At first glance, Kathmandu may seem a bit chaotic, but the city rewards those who take the time to explore its many layers. Whether you’re here to soak up history, embark on a Himalayan journey, or simply enjoy the local culture, Kathmandu offers an unforgettable experience. Its unique mix of the old and the new leaves a lasting impression on all who visit!

Kathmandu has frequent power outages as of December 2019 even though everyone says otherwise, as does Pokhara. The old outages are referring to the load shedding issue which were routine power outages for the majority of the day. Now power outages are not routine and can last unknown amounts of time, even the main (and only) airport loses power often. Buildings are unheated, water for showering is generally unheated or lukewarm, many houses get their water from urban aquifers which may be heavily polluted, as city water is yellow and oily. Many roads in the city are dirt, and air quality is extremely poor, especially during the crop burning season. Locals are friendly and helpful and many outside of tourist areas may have never met a foreigner before. The locals and the mountains make the place special, everything else about it is quite bad, notably hygiene, food safety, traffic danger, and exposure to all sorts of environmental pollutants. That said, I will be returning to visit the local friends made while there.

I can't relate to many of the ratings here. 
I spent half a year in Kathmandu and it's amazing for digital nomads. I would give high scores for all mentioned categories except air quality. 

Great happiness. Great wifi (better than Munich in many places), good hospitals, amazing culture and people. Nomads there know each other. The community is small but growing

Kathmandu is an upcoming destination in the digital nomad community for its cheap living, great outdoor opportunities and its vibrant expat community. After the earthquake the country had to recover and with it came some major improvements: Internet connectivity has reached levels similar to many places in Asia such as Bali and the Philippines. Power cuts have been brought down to a minimum. And more and more places have started up co-working and living places that suit the digital nomads’ needs. Kathmandu now is a place that is alive with positive energy and is moving forward.

MMM I really think these ratings are really wrong. Kathmandu is a super polluted city, air quality get you dizzy dizzy... cost of living is really expensive if you want to have small comforts... like a swimming pool is 6euros, the zoo is 20 euros... you have to think that if you are a foreign you have an extra tax in most of the prices, there is a local price and a tourist price. Also taxis can become really expensive, short ride can jump into 6 euros, moto is a better solution but again, pollution and safety is not really into vogue. Also about food, there are no fridges in the supermarket so your milk or daily products must be buy in local shops, and again hygiene is not at its best. Woman friendly is not so much... you must cover you up in order to don't attract followers... there are no go zones in Kathmandu... and also be aware of bands of dogs... Internet is good speed after the earthquake, most houses have solar power so you will be able to be online full time... getting a SIM card needs the help of a local, since again SIM cards for foreigns need a permission, so is not easy going as a city... in fact is really chaotic and super dirty.... is not a 100% walkable city... is a moto city, and again is super dirty, so I you want to walk in rainy season better to not have bear foot... Pokhara is a better option...
There's an exciting buzz in Nepal now with the current government providing some stability and power cuts largely being a thing of the past.
kathmandu.description:
Kathmandu, the main city of Nepal, is a place where old and new life mix together. Located in the Himalayas, this busy city is a gateway to amazing views and important spiritual traditions. You can expect an interesting experience as you walk through the strong smell of incense from old temples, navigate the lively streets filled with motorbikes, and see the detailed wooden buildings.

A trip to Durbar Square is essential. It is an important area with palaces and shrines that show the city's history. Don’t miss the UNESCO World Heritage Sites like Swayambhunath and Pashupatinath Temple, where you can experience the city’s spiritual atmosphere.

However, be ready for some challenges: the busy traffic, occasional power cuts, and air quality can be tough to deal with. The cost of living can also be high for those wanting comfort, and safety can be a worry, especially for women. Despite these issues, the friendliness of the locals and the chance for adventure make Kathmandu a memorable place to visit. A little patience and a good attitude will help you enjoy this unique city!
kathmandu.description_kor:
카트만두, 네팔의 주요 도시,는 오랜 전통과 현대적인 삶이 어우러진 곳입니다. 히말라야 자락에 위치한 이 활기찬 도시는 아름다운 풍경과 깊은 영적 전통을 느낄 수 있는 관문입니다. 오래된 사원의 강렬한 향을 맡으며 걷고, 오토바이가 끊이지 않는 거리에서의 활력, 정교한 나무 건축물을 감상하는 경험은 정말 매력적입니다.

두르바르 광장은 꼭 방문해야 하는 장소입니다. 이곳은 도시의 역사적인 궁전과 신전이 모여 있는 중요한 공간입니다. 유네스코 세계문화유산인 스와얌부나트 사원과 파슈파티나트 사원을 놓치지 마세요. 여기서 카트만두의 영적 분위기를 진하게 느낄 수 있습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 도전 과제도 준비해야 합니다. 혼잡한 교통, 가끔 발생하는 정전, 그리고 공기 질은 다소 어려울 수 있습니다. 더불어 안락함을 추구하는 분들에게는 생활비가 부담스러울 수 있으며, 특히 여성 여행자들에게는 안전이 염려될 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 현지인들의 따뜻한 환대와 다양한 모험의 기회는 카트만두를 잊지 못할 여행지로 만들어 줍니다. 약간의 인내심과 긍정적인 태도가 이 특별한 도시를 더욱 즐겁게 만드는데 도움이 될 거예요!

reviews: As a person who’s born here and knows the place well I can give some valuable tips and share a biased view 😄 The city and people are great if you know how to navigate it. If you don’t know, it’s a big problem. Have an advice from the local, it’s important ⚠️ You should have a key for great experience in Kharkiv, get it! 🔑 WHY KHARKIV? Cool, well-educated people with own opinion, business-minded, direct. You’ll not find old historical buildings here the city was rebuilt ground up after WW2. The city is managed better than any other Ukrainian city, it’s clean. Not soviet in it’s heart ❤️ WHERE TO BE? Draw a triangle between Gor Kafe 1654 (tip), Otakara Yarosha st. (bottom). Rent there, live there, walk there, party there 😎 WHERE I LIKE TO WALK 1) Gorky Park, 2) Sarzhyn Yar (subway station Botanical Garden), 3) Pushkinskaya str. + around NTU “KHPI”, 4) Sumskaya + Rymarskaya. TAXI ONLY right now ON Taxi app with business class cars is the best and rather cheap, Uber and Bolt are so-so. HOTEL ONLY I’d not rent an apartment as prices aren’t fair (you can get a lot of money if you rent your apartment 10-15% a year 😉) rather look for a modern hotel like: 4 rooms and villa 4 rooms, Cosmopolit, Mirax, etc. normal Eastern European prices, rooms are spacious. DON’T WORRY it’s a safe place to be. I was never robbed or attacked even in scary 90-s, walking alone around dark, grotesque post-soviet haunted houses or empty streets, np at all. Locals love tourists and will help when they can, if you lost and people around don’t know English, you’ll soon find someone who’ll guide you, give you money and a good advice. People here are proud of the place and want others to know it. Good luck, see you here!

Lived there for 6 months. Incredibly "tough" city. Everything is concrete or dirt. Still has a Soviet vibe in 2020. One main street in the city center is vibrant and modern, but head one metro stop in any direction and its 1982 all over again. Almost no English, even with young people. Russian is preferred language even through there is a very strong anti-Russia/anti-Putin sentiment in the city, and rightfully so. However, all the street names and landmarks are in Ukrainian, so you need to mix the languages. Zero problem for natives, but can be confusing for foreigners. Sidewalks are destroyed, a pair of shoes would be ruined in a month or two. Housing is old and gloomy. Small apartments, bad utilities. Sometimes I'd go without water in my apartment for days. Winter never ends. Extreme cold and snow. I would take Ubers and lots of the cars were without seatbelts. These are some tough people. Only salvation is that its cheap, but you can find that in hundreds of other cities.

Spent 3 weeks there and enjoyed it. People were friendly, I had no bad experiences. I have an interest in the history of the area so there was lots for me to do. Inexpensive city but people seemed quite concerned with money. Bank notes are declined for payment because of the slightest of damage, I was hounded relentlessly by a landlord for a $3.00 dry cleaning bill for a stained blanket. I had every intention of paying just didn’t have the time right away to figure out international money transfer. Anyhow, I wandered around the city for days and never felt unsafe. People are very wary of their police force but I guess that’s common in non western countries. The parks in the city are really incredible. The best tip I could give a traveler is to find the pub called ‘school pub’. It’s hidden away but if you only know English, it is an absolute oasis. Great people run the place. I’d visit Kharkiv again for sure.

House rents are very expensive compared to average salaries. also the apartments are very old and gloomy. This problem exists all over Ukraine. The house is pretty cheap except for their rent. and safe city. A safer city than Kiev and Odessa.

Very friendly and tolerant city.
Safe, quiet and cozy. Has a large number of students from different countries. In Kharkov, more than 20 universities,
Beautiful parks, lit streets. Public transport is open until 12pm.
kharkiv.description:
Kharkiv has a unique appeal that mixes its history with a lively, modern atmosphere. Although it may not have the large historical buildings that other cities have because of post-WW2 rebuilding, its character is clear in the energetic spirit of its educated and business-focused people. If you want to see the center of the city, be sure to check out places like Gorky Park and Sarzhyn Yar, and enjoy a night out in the popular area around Gor Kafe 1654.

Getting around Kharkiv can be a bit difficult, especially since many locals do not speak English well. Russian is often spoken, but don’t worry; people are friendly and willing to assist. Just keep in mind that public transport runs until midnight, and it's better to book taxis through apps for an easier ride.

Watch out for rental prices if you’re considering living here; they can be high compared to salaries. The city often seems rough—with old apartments and cracked sidewalks—but many people find it safe and comfortable. With a growing number of students, there are many activities to enjoy, from finding hidden places like the ‘school pub’ to visiting the many parks. While winters can be hard, if you adapt to the local way of life, you'll find many reasons to appreciate Kharkiv!
kharkiv.description_kor:
하르키프는 역사와 현대의 생기가 조화롭게 어우러진 독특한 매력을 간직하고 있습니다. 제2차 세계 대전 후 재건 과정에서 다른 도시들처럼 많은 역사적 건물이 없을 수도 있지만, 교육과 비즈니스에 열정을 가진 사람들의 에너지 속에서 도시의 개성이 확실히 드러납니다. 도심을 탐방하고 싶다면 고르키 공원이나 사르진 야르 같은 명소를 꼭 방문해 보세요. 그리고 인기 있는 고르 카페 1654 주변에서 저녁 시간을 즐기는 것도 추천합니다.

하르키프에서의 이동이 조금 불편할 수도 있습니다. 특히 많은 현지인들이 영어를 잘 못하는 경우가 많기 때문입니다. 러시아어가 널리 사용되지만, 걱정하지 마세요. 사람들은 친절하고 도움을 주고 싶어 합니다. 공공교통은 자정까지 운영되므로 보다 편리하게 이동하려면 택시를 앱으로 예약하는 것이 좋습니다.

이곳에서 살 계획이라면 임대료에 주의하셔야 합니다. 급여에 비해 임대료가 꽤 비쌀 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 낡은 아파트와 갈라진 인도 때문에 다소 거칠어 보일 수 있지만, 많은 사람들이 안전하고 편안하다고 느낍니다. 학생들이 많아지면서 '학교 펍'과 같은 숨겨진 명소를 찾거나 다양한 공원에서 즐길 수 있는 활동도 많이 있습니다. 겨울철은 힘들 수 있지만, 현지 생활에 적응하게 되면 하르키프의 매력을 더 많이 발견하게 될 것입니다!

reviews: don't ever come here. all the people that live here hate it and end up getting into drugs. fr
killeen.description:
Killeen may not be a top choice for everyone, but it has its own character and uniqueness. Some people think it’s not the happiest place, while others like its close community and strong spirit. The cost of living is low, which is good if you want cheaper options.

Public transportation is limited, so having a car is helpful for getting around. If you’re visiting, you can check out the local parks and historic sites for a nice weekend activity. Just make sure to stay in well-lit areas at night and be aware of your surroundings, as safety can be an issue.

Killeen has a mix of cultures because it’s near military bases. While the nightlife might not be very lively, you can find comfortable places to meet friends or enjoy local food. So if you go to Killeen, be open-minded and you might find some nice surprises!
killeen.description_kor:
킬린(Killeen)은 모든 사람에게 최적의 선택은 아닐지 몰라도, 그만의 매력과 독특함을 가지고 있어요. 어떤 이들은 이곳이 최상의 행복을 느끼는 장소가 아닐 것이라고 생각하기도 하지만, 다른 이들은 가까운 지역 사회와 따뜻한 정을 좋아하죠. 게다가 생활비가 저렴해서 경제적 선택을 원하는 사람들에게는 매력적인 곳이기도 해요.

대중교통이 다소 불편하기 때문에 이동할 때는 차가 필요합니다. 방문한다면 현지의 공원과 역사적인 명소를 둘러보는 것을 추천해요. 주말에 즐거운 액티비티가 될 수 있습니다. 밤에는 잘 조명이 되어 있는 곳에 머무르고 주변 상황을 살피는 것이 안전상 중요해요. 안전 문제를 염두에 두고 조심하세요.

킬린은 군사 기지와 가까워 다양한 문화가 어우러져 있는 곳이에요. 밤 문화를 즐기기에는 조금 조용할 수 있지만, 친구들을 만나거나 현지 음식을 맛볼 수 있는 아늑한 장소들도 많이 있습니다. 그래서 킬린에 오게 된다면 열린 마음으로 다양한 경험을 해보실 수 있을 거예요!

reviews: Spent 2 months in Kigali and criss-crossed the country from there as my base. Pros: friendly people in the city (not so much in the far North rural areas of Rwanda if you travel on your own near Virunga). Clean air. A few good restaurants. Safe in the city (Kigali), even at night. Amazing wildlife and scenery/landscapes if you get a place with a good view and some nature around. Government entities have their sh*t straight more than many other nations. Average internet. Stable power grid. Cons: dangerous near Virunga unless you go on a guided tour, water is unpotable and unsafe from the tap unless boiled even in Kigali, locals stare at you without interruption (not in a frightening way but it's uncomfortable), dangerous to navigate the traffic unless you're used to complete road chaos, slow/poor service in restaurants, everyone asks you for money even the children in rural villages where tourists don’t go, need a car/motorcycle to do anything (not a walkable city), very poor selection of anything in terms of shopping needs and expensive. There's a lot of potential here and I'd gladly come back overall, just watch your safety (health, road, and up North).

I've spent a total of ~2 months in Kigali. Pros: very safe, pretty affordable, very pretty, hospitable people, great coffee. Cons: a bit dull, culture is very insular (respectful but quite conservative), food is bad, police state vibes are kind of weird. A certain kind of person who doesn't care about nightlife at all, is open to experiencing a foreign culture that's more inward-oriented, and wants to live a really chill lifestyle in a green, pleasant city would really like it. I personally need some more action and didn't vibe with the reservedness of the people there, lovely as they are.

Spent 1 month here with my girlfriend. The place has potential, but is not quite there yet. Pollution can be pretty bad. Otherwise it's very pretty and the people are helpful. You can find workable Internet, but not everywhere. Try Nyarutarama, which has a lot of embassies. Not extremely cheap, but affordable. Definitely take a trip to Lake Kivu and Volcanoes National Park in the North. Food isn't that great. The most common and cheapest way of getting around is by mototaxi, but beware, they can be very careless - we had an accident on day 1 that required medical attention. You need to haggle with taxi drivers, otherwise they'll rip you off. Car rentals could be cheaper for what you get. Malaria is not that much of an issue in the capital. Otherwise, Kigali is very safe for an African capital, you are mostly free to walk around at night. Very hilly, so be prepared for that. Hospital care was OK, although lacking - needed to go to a different hospital for an X-Ray machine that worked, but the doctors were very professional and care was cheap ($10 for an X-Ray at King Faizal hospital, rebandaging and wound cleaning between $8 to $12 each time).

All in all, I'm happy we went and will probably be back at some point - lots of growth potential.
kigali.description:
Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, is a city that surprises many with its friendly people and beautiful views. Imagine clean air, green hills, and safe streets where you can walk around even after dark. Some might find the culture a bit traditional and isolated, but you can enjoy the kindness of the locals who are generally welcoming, especially if you take the time to talk to them.

However, be ready for a few challenges. Traffic can be a bit busy, and while mototaxis are a common way to get around, you should be careful as they can be a little wild at times. Shopping options are limited and sometimes expensive, so bring your bargaining skills when dealing with taxi drivers and sellers. And while restaurants offer good food, don’t expect anything too fancy; the food scene is rather basic.

If you’re looking for adventure, a trip to Lake Kivu or Volcanoes National Park is a must. Just remember, Kigali’s appeal comes from its calmness and the possibility of growth; it's a place great for those who enjoy a slower lifestyle and the chance to experience a different culture.
kigali.description_kor:
르완다의 수도 키갈리는 친절한 사람들과 아름다운 풍경으로 많은 이들을 매료시키는 도시입니다. 깨끗한 공기와 푸른 언덕, 그리고 밤에도 안전하게 걸을 수 있는 거리들을 떠올려 보세요. 어떤 이들은 이곳의 문화가 다소 전통적이고 고립되어 있다고 느낄 수 있지만, 현지인들과 대화를 나누다 보면 그들의 따뜻한 환대를 경험할 수 있습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 도전에 대비해야 합니다. 교통량이 다소 많을 수 있으며, 오토바이 택시가 흔히 이용되지만 때때로 위험할 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다. 쇼핑할 곳이 제한적이고 가격이 비쌀 수 있으니, 택시 기사나 판매자와 거래할 때는 흥정을 잘 하는 게 좋습니다. 레스토랑에서는 만족할 만한 음식을 제공하지만, 큰 기대를 하진 마세요; 음식 문화는 다소 소박한 편입니다.

모험을 찾으신다면, 키부 호수나 화산 국립공원으로의 여행은 꼭 해보세요. 키갈리의 매력은 고요함과 성장 가능성에 있다는 점을 기억하시면 좋겠습니다. 느린 삶의 방식을 즐기고 또 다른 문화를 체험할 수 있는 좋은 장소입니다.

reviews: Although I'm usually in Montego Bay, I always spend at least a week in Kingston whenever I'm in Jamaica. I've been there twice a year since 2017. Despite Montegonians warning me about how dangerous it is, using common sense, respecting the locals and their culture, and not being an asshat, unsurprisingly, goes a long way. I'm not big on tourist traps, but stopping by Devon House is a must. If it isn't for the history of its buildings or the beautiful gardens, stop and get an amazing curry goat patty or amazing ice cream. Accommodation costs vary greatly and I've stayed at both the C$80/night Spanish Dream to $300/night at Spanish Court. Longer term stays would benefit greatly from having a local Kingstonian's assistance. Transportation costs also vary based on the honesty of your taxi driver. Locals are generally friendly and I was lucky to have experienced the nightlife from the club scene to outdoor reggae parties, and local dancehall parties. I've never felt unsafe but I was also always with locals who knew their way around the city. Food is amazing and pricing varies greatly as well. The culture is not LGBT friendly and the internet infrastructure is spotty even in the better areas. I often found myself without solid access and simply used it as an excuse to enjoy myself versus working. Definitely a city worth visiting either way.
kingston.description:
Kingston, Jamaica, is a lively city with its share of good and bad experiences. It is known for its culture and energy, and visiting Kingston can be a memorable experience if you keep an open mind. Many people enjoy the local food—be sure to try a curry goat patty or some of the best ice cream at Devon House.

Accommodation options vary, catering to different budgets, so whether you like small lodges or modern hotels, you will find something for your stay. The city's nightlife is active, with various clubs and reggae and dancehall parties.

However, Kingston has its challenges. Safety is an issue, so it’s smart to stay near locals who know the area. Transportation can be a bit difficult; it’s better to agree on a price with taxi drivers before getting in. Also, internet access may not be reliable, so be ready to disconnect and enjoy the local atmosphere!

In terms of culture, Kingston is not very LGBT-friendly, and being respectful to local customs is important. Still, with some caution, Kingston offers a unique experience of Jamaica that many people enjoy!
kingston.description_kor:
킹스턴, 자메이카는 좋은 경험과 나쁜 경험이 공존하는 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳은 풍부한 문화와 에너지로 유명하며, 열린 마음으로 방문한다면 잊지 못할 추억을 쌓을 수 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 현지 음식을 즐기는데, 특히 카레 염소 패티와 데본 하우스의 유명한 아이스크림은 꼭 맛봐야 할 별미입니다.

숙소 선택의 폭이 넓어 예산에 맞는 다양한 옵션을 찾을 수 있습니다. 아담한 롯지부터 현대적인 호텔까지 여러분의 취향에 맞는 공간을 찾을 수 있을 거예요. 킹스턴의 밤문화는 활기차고, 다양한 클럽과 레게, 댄스홀 파티가 열려 재미있는 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다.

하지만 킹스턴에는 주의해야 할 점들도 있습니다. 안전이 중요한 이슈이니, 현지인과 교류하며 돌아다니는 것이 좋습니다. 교통도 다소 복잡할 수 있으니, 택시를 이용할 때는 요금을 미리 협의하는 게 바람직합니다. 또한 인터넷 속도가 불안정할 수 있으니, 그 점도 고려해 현지의 느낌을 만끽하며 시간을 보내길 추천합니다!

문화적으로, 킹스턴은 LGBT 친화적이지 않은 편이므로, 현지 관습에 대한 존중이 중요합니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 주의를 기울인다면, 킹스턴은 많은 이들에게 특별한 자메이카의 경험을 선사할 수 있는 곳입니다!

reviews: Spent 2 months in 2011 and 3 month in 2012, amazing chill place. Waterfalls, wildlife, white sand beaches, local authentic fishermen villages (on both sides of island). One of my favorite places in Thailand, miss it so much (been in Samui, Chiang Mai, Pai, BKK, Pattaya, Ranong, total 2 years). Pai and Koh Chang, and Pattaya, are my top favorite places in Thailand.
Still a bit "raw", but with lots of potential. Avoid going in rainy season and get beautiful pristine only for you. It`s a wild paradise. Goi before it gets discovered by the masses and spoiled.
Remote from Bangkok and Pattaya which is good for calmness. In rain season expect internet or even electricity’s outage. Very chill place.
ko-chang.description:
Koh Chang, Thailand, is a nice place to visit for anyone who wants to get away from busy life. It has white sand beaches, waterfalls, and small fishing villages that feel like they are waiting for you to explore. It is a good spot for relaxing and enjoying nature, so bring your beach towel and have a good time!

Although the calm atmosphere is enjoyable, there are some things to consider. Visitors have mentioned that the rainy season can sometimes cause internet or electricity issues, so plan your trip carefully to enjoy your time here. On the positive side, the distance from busy places like Bangkok and Pattaya makes Koh Chang a quiet retreat where you can relax and enjoy nature.

If you plan to visit, try to avoid busy tourist seasons to see the island's natural beauty. Friendly locals, nice views, and a slow pace of life make Koh Chang a place you should see before it becomes more crowded.
ko-chang.description_kor:
코창은 태국에서 바쁜 일상에서 벗어나고 싶은 사람들에게 안성맞춤인 곳입니다. 하얀 모래 해변과 아름다운 폭포, 그리고 탐험을 떠나고 싶은 매력적인 작은 어촌 마을들이 있습니다. 이곳은 여유롭게 휴식을 취하며 자연을 만끽할 수 있는 최적의 장소이니, 해변 타올을 챙겨서 즐거운 시간을 보내보세요!

차분한 분위기는 큰 즐거움을 주지만, 한 가지 유의할 점이 있습니다. 방문객들은 우기 시즌에는 인터넷이나 전기가 불안정할 수 있다고 언급하기도 했습니다. 따라서 이곳에서의 시간을 즐기기 위해서는 여행 계획을 신중하게 세우는 것이 좋습니다. 다행히도 코창은 방콕이나 파타야처럼 복잡한 도시에서 떨어져 있어 조용한 휴식처가 되어 자연의 아름다움을 만끽할 수 있습니다.

방문을 고려하고 있다면, 섬의 자연경관을 온전히 즐기기 위해서는 관광 성수기를 피하는 것이 좋습니다. 친절한 현지인들, 그림 같은 풍경, 느긋한 삶의 속도가 코창을 꼭 가봐야 할 장소로 만들어줍니다.

reviews: One of the most beautiful islands I've ever been to (been to a lot) But, for vacation. For living there, there is just not so much to do.
ko-lipe.description:
Ko Lipe is a special place in Thailand, and visitors often love its nice beaches and clear water. Imagine waking up to the sound of waves and stepping onto soft sand right outside your door; it’s a perfect spot for a vacation. The island has pretty views and a relaxed feel that helps you forget about daily life.

However, if you plan to stay longer, remember that the island can feel a bit quiet after some time. There are fewer activities and services than in bigger cities, so it might not suit everyone who wants constant excitement. Public transportation is not very good, so getting around may need some planning.

Still, there are many things to do, like snorkeling in colorful coral reefs or just relaxing on the beach. For the more adventurous, don’t miss exploring nearby islands or trying local seafood at beachside restaurants. Just be prepared for some language differences and higher prices, especially during busy season. Enjoy the calm atmosphere and the island life!
ko-lipe.description_kor:
코 리페는 태국의 특별한 장소로, 방문객들은 종종 아름다운 해변과 맑은 바다에 매료됩니다. 파도 소리에 잠이 깬 후 귀여운 모래 위를 걸어보는 상상을 해보세요. 이곳은 휴가를 보내기에 최적의 장소입니다. 섬은 아름다운 풍경과 편안한 분위기를 자아내어, 일상에서 벗어나고 싶을 때 완벽한 선택이죠.

하지만 좀 더 오랫동안 머무를 계획이라면, 시간이 지나면서 섬이 점점 조용하게 느껴질 수 있다는 점을 유념하세요. 대도시에 비해 활기찬 활동이나 서비스가 적기 때문에, 끊임없이 흥미로운 것을 추구하는 분들께는 적합하지 않을 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 그리 잘 구축되어 있지 않아서 이동 계획을 조금 세워야 할 수도 있습니다.

그럼에도 불구하고, 다채로운 산호초에서 스노클링을 즐기거나 해변에서 한가로이 쉬는 등 즐길 거리가 많습니다. 좀 더 모험을 즐기는 분들은 근처 섬을 탐험하거나 해변가의 맛집에서 신선한 해산물을 맛보는 것도 좋은 선택이에요. 특히 성수기에는 언어 장벽이나 가격이 다소 높을 수 있으니 미리 준비하는 게 좋습니다. 평온한 분위기와 섬의 삶을 마음껏 만끽해 보세요!

reviews: Oh boy. Coming from someone who is from Knoxville, please don't move here. The internet is pretty good, but that's about all the pros. There is nothing to do, I get called at least one slur every day. Everyone here is homophobic and transphobic. If you are trans (like me) and are planning to move to Knoxville (Basically any part of TN is unsafe for us.) I wish so badly I could move out, please don't come here. The mountains, forests, and lakes are great, But the people are terrible. Maybe this homophobic and transphobic city is the place for you. Good luck.
knoxville.description:
Knoxville is a city with both positives and negatives. Located in Tennessee, it is surrounded by mountains and lakes, making it a good place for people who enjoy the outdoors. There are many chances for hiking and enjoying nature, which many visitors like. However, some locals have concerns about how the LGBTQ+ community is treated, saying that some interactions can feel unwelcoming.

In terms of culture, Knoxville has a growing arts scene, with local festivals and music events that show what the city has to offer. The cost of living is low, which is a benefit, but public transportation options are limited, making it hard to get around without a car.

If you are planning to visit, be sure to explore downtown and try some local food places. It might be helpful to learn about local customs and to be careful in areas where you feel safe. Overall, Knoxville has a beautiful setting, but think about your audience if you are considering moving here.
knoxville.description_kor:
녹스빌은 긍정적인 면과 부정적인 면을 모두 지닌 도시입니다. 테네시주에 위치한 이 도시는 산과 호수로 둘러싸여 있어 자연을 사랑하는 사람들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 하이킹과 자연을 만끽할 수 있는 기회가 많아 많은 방문객들이 이곳을 좋아합니다. 하지만 일부 지역 주민들은 LGBTQ+ 커뮤니티에 대한 대우에 우려를 표하며, 어떤 상황에서는 환영받지 못하는 느낌을 받을 수 있다고 전합니다.

문화적으로 녹스빌은 활발히 성장하고 있는 예술 씬을 자랑하며, 다양한 지역 축제와 음악 이벤트가 도시의 매력을 잘 보여줍니다. 생활비가 저렴하다는 점은 큰 장점이지만, 대중교통 수단이 부족해 차 없이 이동하기 힘든 점은 단점으로 꼽힙니다.

만약 녹스빌을 방문할 계획이 있다면, 다운타운을 탐방하고 지역 음식점을 경험해보는 것을 추천합니다. 또한, 지역 관습을 이해하고 안전하다고 느끼는 장소에서는 주의 깊게 행동하는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로 녹스빌은 아름다운 자연환경을 품고 있는 도시지만, 이사할 계획이 있다면 주변 사람들에 대해 잘 생각해보는 것이 중요합니다.

reviews: Stayed a whole month in Fort Kochi area, eventually going to Ernakulam (downtown area). It is unarguably very different than rest of India, much more cleaner and with friendlier people. Beaches aren`t nice for bathing but are a great choice to catch sunsets everyday. Cost of living is dirty cheap and public transport is good. They even have a subway crossing the city with reminds me the BTS in Bangkok. Actually, Kochi to me is like a small and boring version of Bangkok, which is good if you need a cheap place to get the work done while enjoy the sunsets and South Indian food.
kochi.description:
Kochi is a city on the southwestern coast of India that has a mix of culture and simple living. Many visitors say it feels cleaner than other parts of India, and the locals are known for being friendly. It is also affordable, with low prices for food and places to stay, which is great if you want to save money!

Fort Kochi is a popular area with a relaxed atmosphere. The beaches aren’t good for swimming, but they have beautiful sunsets. Getting around is easy because of a good public transport system, which includes a convenient subway similar to Bangkok.

Keep in mind that Kochi might feel quieter than other cities, which some people may find boring. It can also help to know a few local phrases, as there may be language barriers. Overall, if you want a calm trip with tasty South Indian food and nice views, Kochi could be a good choice for you!
kochi.description_kor:
코치는 인도 남서쪽 해안에 위치한 도시로, 풍부한 문화와 소박한 생활이 조화를 이루고 있습니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳이 인도의 다른 지역보다 더 깨끗하다고 느끼며, 현지인들도 친절하기로 유명합니다. 게다가 음식과 숙소 가격이 저렴하여, 예산을 아끼고 싶으신 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다!

포트코치는 편안한 분위기로 인기 있는 곳입니다. 해수욕을 하기에 적합하지는 않지만, 아름다운 일몰을 즐길 수 있습니다. 방콕과 유사한 편리한 지하철을 포함한 좋은 대중교통 시스템 덕분에 이동이 매우 수월합니다.

코치에서는 다른 도시들에 비해 조용하게 느껴질 수 있어서, 일부 사람들은 지루하게 느낄 수도 있습니다. 또한, 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니 현지어의 몇 가지 기본 표현을 미리 알아두는 것이 유용할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로, 맛있는 남인도 음식과 멋진 경치를 즐기며 평화로운 여행을 원하신다면 코치는 정말 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
Been coming to Koh Tao for years, it's an under-rated island IMO. Its small size makes it a great place to stay and remote work from. Lots of great beaches, walking trails, climbing and of course scuba and snorkeling. An amazing selection of restaurants, great coworks and cafes to work from. 

Being smaller it helps you stay focused, spend less time travelling around etc. 

I personally have never felt unsafe there and pretty much all the nomads I meet there say the same. 

Power is much more stable than 7 years ago, for me it's never really been an issue. Interenet to the island is usually 300-400mbps up/down for anywhere with a good router/wifi. Getting an AIS SIM is a good backup if you need backup internet.

"Off the record, however, they told of an island held in the iron grip of a mafia family, who demanded protection money, controlled the local police force and were not above attacking or burning down the homes and businesses of people that crossed them"

I don't think Koh Tao is dangerous in terms of absolute risk. Many tourists pass through, and not that many got murdered (under a dozen over several years, as far as I know, some cases might really be suicide). Riding a motorbike anywhere in Thailand probably carries higher risk, mathematically speaking.

The issue is that it's a small island, there are people who repeatedly murdered tourists, and they (or their families) control the island to a degree that they can act with impunity. Even if your chances of actual problems are low, do you really want to give your money to those people (which you almost certainly do by going there)?

Foreign tourists don't end up dead in mysterious circumstances on Koh Samui on a semi-regular basis. For its size, Koh Tao is highly over represented in mysterious deaths.

Ko Tao is a quiet, laid back island. Mostly diving, but there are a lot of things to do. Wifi is super fast, food is cheap and good, people are friendly. There is a good amount of nightlife on the island, but not like Ko Phangan. This is a great option to come and chill if you are under a deadline, like to dive, or just need a quiet island escape.
Happily spent several weeks there.

Beautiful island. Lots of mellow nightlife spots and cafe's. Too bad there's a serial killer murdering young women a few times a year. Seriously though, look into the Koh Tao murders over the last few years. Women raped and murdered. They blame it on Burmese workers but nobody believes this. More likely it's local mafia children running the island. It's only a matter of time before the next crime. Sucks because I loved the place. Cheapest spot in the world to get your diving certification.
Magic island, fast wifi, very good roads ;)

I have lived in this paradise for 12 years. The island has seen many changes over the years. Better roads, better safety with have the Koh Tao Rescue team working here as pre hospital care for people who have accidents. The dive safety is fantastic with all centres constantly communicating with each other. The eco projects we have on going include beach clean ups, dive site clean ups, 711 don't give plastic bags, the refused use of plastic.
This is my home and I wouldn't want to live anywhere else. Come and find out for yourself but be warned you may end up staying longer than you plan as you fall in love with this place straight away
Koh Tao is my favorite island in Thailand, stay on Sairee beach.
Koh Tao is a amazing and beautiful island with more and more great cafes with good and free WiFi’s and workspaces. It’s a truly inspiring and safe place to be a female nomade in.
Absolut lovely place to be.
Koh Tao is a amazing and beautiful island with more and more great cafes with good and free WiFi’s and workspaces. It’s a truly inspiring and safe place to be a female nomade in.

Koh Tao was a nice place to stay, but is not anymore. The main issue is the yet unsolved waste problem. Koh Taos air quality in the inner island has become very bad since more and more people start to burn their plastic waste in the backyard.
ko-tao.description:
Koh Tao is a small island in Thailand that is a good place for anyone looking to relax or seek adventure. With its nice beaches and walking paths, many visitors return year after year. The island has some of the best scuba diving spots and plenty of restaurants, making it easy to eat after a day in the water.

The internet here is fast, which is good for remote work, and getting around is easy because Koh Tao is small. Most people feel safe, with friendly locals and a community feel. However, some locals talk about issues related to past crimes and safety.

For those who want to explore, Sairee Beach is a popular area, and the nightlife is calm but enjoyable. It's also important to be aware of the island's eco-challenges like waste management, as this is a common topic among residents and visitors. Overall, if you want a quiet island getaway with good diving, Koh Tao could be your next destination!
ko-tao.description_kor:
코타오는 태국에 위치한 작은 섬으로, 휴식을 취하거나 모험을 즐기고 싶은 이들에게 안성맞춤인 곳입니다. 아름다운 해변과 산책로 덕분에 매년 수많은 방문객들이 다시 찾아옵니다. 이 섬은 세계적인 스쿠버 다이빙 명소로 유명하며, 다양한 레스토랑이 있어 수영 후 식사하는 데도 편리합니다.

여기서의 인터넷 속도가 빨라 원격 근무하기에도 좋고, 코타오가 작아 이동하기도 매우 편리합니다. 대부분의 사람들은 친절한 현지인들과 만드는 따뜻한 지역 커뮤니티 덕분에 안전하다고 느끼지만, 몇몇 현지인들은 과거의 범죄 문제와 관련된 이야기를 하기도 합니다.

모험을 좋아하는 분들은 사이리 비치를 추천합니다. 이곳은 인기 있는 관광지이며, 밤문화는 다소 조용하지만 즐거움이 가득합니다. 또한, 쓰레기 관리와 같은 환경 문제도 꼭 인지하는 것이 중요합니다. 이는 주민들과 관광객들 사이에서 자주 언급되는 주제입니다. 전반적으로, 최고의 다이빙과 조용한 휴식을 원하는 분들에게 코타오는 다음 여행지로 강력히 추천할 수 있습니다!

reviews:
Ko Pha Ngan is like a "Western resort". It feels like you see less than 1 local per 10-15 foreigners. Value as you wish, but it doesn't feel like you are in Thailand

There are predominantly two groups of people: homeless skinny hippies smoking weed all day and party-goers gym bros. If you are into that, you will have an amazing time. If not, you can also have an amazing time enjoying nature and a really peaceful and beautiful place. I could not find any relevant "digital nomad" scene.

The wellness and fitness community that is supposed to be here is nothing worth coming for. Unless for you wellness means eating very little vegan food and overcrowded and low-quality gym and infrastructure.

It's veryyyy chill (especially compared to Bali, Chiang Mai, Da Nang and Kuala Lumpur). Houses and villas are a bit simpler. There are like 30+ great cafes, restaurants and Thai places to eat and enjoy. There are hardly any hotspots here, so don't expect much exploration and culture. It's mainly relaxing (read: chilling, sunsets, beaches, coconuts, thai food, parties, weed, alcohol, fun people).

We got some solid work and gym training in there as well during the day. We are coming back for sure to work, train and chill the fook out.

The island is beautiful. Many tourists, especially for overrated Full Moon Party that elevates prices a lot. Roads are in good condition, you would need a scooter to get around, tourists drive very bad and irresponsibly. Wear a helmet! It is not a computer game, do not let the paradise island delude you, there are many accidents. A few places to work from. To get here you need to fly to Samui or Surat Thani and then take a ferry. Prices are not so different from other Thai islands. Nice beaches, nature, kitesurfing spot, friendly people, some modern "hippies" living in luxurious places :D I really enjoyed my time here but after 1 month I was ready to leave.

Agree with other reviewers about the influx of refugees and the increased prices. I'm there now and from my last visit a year ago prices have inflated significantly. There's also development everywhere now so the word is out.

Really enjoyed my time here. Stunningly beautiful island. Like the previous reviewer, I would also take my scooter and just bounce around the island, just to enjoy the landscape. Getting around by scooter is an absolute necessity on Ko Pha Ngan - it’s just not viable to walk or take taxis everywhere. I would really recommend having some practice on a scooter before arriving here. Some of the mountain grades are quite steep and you need to know proper braking to not have an accident IMO. Also, if I’m being real, the local Thai are some of the least aware drivers I’ve encountered. Most don’t have mirrors on their scooters, and will turn into traffic congestion without warning or desire to match the speed of traffic. I found foreign drivers to be more respectful than Thai drivers. Watch out. But I digress. 

There’s a lot of partying here, but book a hotel 5 minutes off the main strip and you can easily be in a quieter part of the island. It’s still pretty affordable (for me at least) - I found that a budget of $2,000/month was borderline luxury here. Only 1 power cut for the month I was there, but it was planned and was only effecting a small part of the island.

I guess my only complaint was the lack of “regular” 9-5 nomads. I found most people to either be backpacking, wannabe insta-influencers, or part of the conscious community. But everyone I met was very kind to me, so maybe the burden of negativity is on me.

I understand why Ko Pha Ngan is rated so highly and IMO it’s worth a visit for a month or two.

Still an amazing island, with very diverse adctivities, but prices have gone up massively lately due to an influx of European war 'refugees' and the recent growth of the digital nomad scene. If you book in advance, you can still find something affordable but it is rapidly changing and prices are in general very un-Thai like.

Beautiful island. For me it hits a sweet spot combining some of Canggu and Ubud. There's good stuff like breath work and ecstatic dance close by but you don't have to scooter a whole hour to get there. It's not too hippy and you can easily avoid that vibe if you're not into it. The mountainous landscape makes for some lovely scootering - so nice that I've taken a few rides just for the pleasure of it. The bigger roads are lit at night and pretty good, not much traffic.

Compared to Bali many restaurants are bit more basic with uncomfortable bamboo chairs and the same Thai menus (but great food). There are also good modern/western restaurants but not too many.


Main downside is that there's no really good coworking space. There is Remote&Digital (several locations), High Life has one, BeachHut. None of them is conducive to a community I find. There are regular nomad meetups though and there are whatsapp groups.


The pro/con review below also sums it up quite well, but here are two updates:
- there's food delivery now (phangan-delivery dot com). Takes about 60 minutes (I got used to that) and works well
- electricity is stable, no blackouts in 3 months (except one after a powerful storm that got fixed quickly)

I also enjoy that there are Thai people coming to Phangan for what it has to offer and it's nice chatting with them.
Love this island so much! The first time I went I only stayed in Haad Rin and hated it, second time I went, I ventured west and stayed nearly 3 weeks! Lots of great yoga retreats and healthy food

Koh Phangan has potential to become an awesome nomad hotspot. It's close, but it’s not quite there yet. I’ve spent 5 months here during the 2021 COVID-lockdown.

Pros:
- Stunning nature all around you
- You can live right on the beach, or have a sick view from a hill
- Can be very affordable
- Laid back, Bali-like lifestyle
- Low amount of traffic, very chill to drive around
- Lots of yoga, gyms, muay thai, etc
- Easy to explore other parts of Thailand (when there's no lockdown)
- E-commerce is fantastic, including grocery delivery (e.g. Paleo Robbie)
- Great electronic music parties (when there's no lockdown)
- Barely any crime

Cons:
- Not too many tech nomads. Mostly hippies, party people and families with young children
- No solid co-working space - please build a Tropical Nomad here!
- No ride hailing or food delivery apps
- Shortage of high quality, nicely designed places to rent - they exist, but the demand seems higher than the supply
- Easy to get lost in all the hedonism - be careful if you're prone to indulging
- Plenty of toxic people in the "conscious" community
- Some areas are straight from a zombie apocalypse movie - e.g. Haad Rin, the area of the Full Moon Parties 
- Frequent power cuts

The Thai Bali and one of the best place to be in Thailand now. I know I had preconceptions about it too, like there'd be too many hippies, and pseudo-science spiritual bs people. But it's not like that. The people we met were actually mostly really chill and friendly and not at all pushing their stuff on us. Also there seems to be an increasing group of just non-hippie general nomads who I'd say are more focused on living healthily (like in Canggu, Bali). Focusing on good food and fitness. It's a similar crowd you'd meet in Bali, or Mexico, or Portugal. The right people.

Ko Pha Ngan is MUCH more driveable with a motorbike than Samui. The roads are a bit worse, BUT there's no real fast cars traffic like in Samui. It's all jungle roads which is heaven to drive through. Then at random spots you'll find hipster cafes with great coffee and food (and aircon!). There's also lots of beautiful accommodation for very affordable prices. Think beautifully architecture designer houses in the jungle with night-lit luxury pools.

The only negative I heard about Ko Pha Ngan from people is there's no real good coworking space yet. But there's enough big cafes.

To get to Ko Pha Ngan: fly from Bangkok to Ko Samui, then take the 30 minute speedboat ferry from Samui.

I have been staying on this island for about 2 years, and would like to remind everybody something : working remotely is illegal in Thailand, and can get you in serious troubles if you do any kind of work without a work permit. There has been in the past reported cases of arrests in so called "co-working spaces". I think it is only a fair warning to people who plan to come here and hang in co-working spaces. 2 years ago koh phangan did not have a good rating on nomad list, not much as changed since, but i've seen over this time a group of european businessmen investing in many facilities for digital nomad, they are now craving for customers and massively trying to market the island as a digital nomad heaven.
That being said, for anyone aware of the risks, it is an amazing place to live, nature is beautiful and you will find wifi ranging from wacky to high speed depending on your location on the island, and mobile internet is really handy and cheap. Because of tourism, it is also one of the most expensive places in Thailand when it comes to food and housing, which makes it difficult for thais to move in, but you will find the local families who have been staying there forever and others who come for jobs in tourism. There is a big hippie/yogi community here and a lot of activities around this. And of course, it is a party island.

This island is a total gem. It has everything one desires in a paradise island! There is a huge higher consciousness/yoga/meditation/vegetarian/vegan community plus epic full moon and half moon parties, omg totally worth checking out! And the internet connectivity and speed on the island is good too. I've had no problem doing work from my laptop as a Digital Marketing Specialist either.

- Mobile internet is great, Wifi heavily depends on your place
- A scooter is needed to get around, but that's easily organized and not too expensive
- For people coming from Chiang Mai, expect things to be at least 50% more expensive
- The food is great! Not as cheap as in other places in Thailand (although cheap street food can be found), lots of vegan and health-oriented restaurants
- Cafes are of decent quality, there are definitely some in which you can get work done, although they close early (most around 6-7 pm). The coworking space situation has massively improved in the last year and although I don't want to advertise here you'll figure out what I mean by a quick Google search

Although the island is small, it heavily depends on your location and yourself what kind of lifestyle you can live here:

You could stay around Haad Rin and permanently live for the party (not recommended if you are actually a Nomad and intend to work, although it can be a lot of fun once or twice).
You could stay around Sri Thanu and live a perfectly healthy lifestyle, working out, doing Yoga and meditating, this could be a very good experience, but mind that people there are usually quite spiritual (or pretend to be), so it's up to you.
You could live in the main village in Thong Sala, but I honestly don't see the point of doing that, as it's the most polluted area, so only stay here for budget reasons.
You could stay in the very east of the island (Haad Yang) or in the very north (Chaloklum) and enjoy the laidback experience, although you might need to commute quite a while to get to any workable place.
If you stay anywhere else on the island, it's about the same experience as in other places in the South of Thailand, so I would say medium-level touristy but very convenient and doable for anybody.
Some places are not listed here and they kind of have their unique vibe, I'll let that to you to find out ;)

I personally recommend sticking with one place and one lifestyle here on the island. It's quite tempting to jump into something else, but for me, it is sometimes a huge distraction and quite bad for my overall productivity and happiness switching between those different lifestyles. That's why I developed some kind of love-hate relationship with the island. The only other place with such vast differences between spots I found so far is Bali.

Spent a lovely two weeks in Hin Kong in a guest house. Only had a car for a week. You can get around without a car on the songthaews, but they are overpriced. Scooter is better, they are cheep and easier to park. The island is mellow and very relaxed. A great place to escape. Internet is very reliable.
