While the rent in the city may be higher than in Southeast Asia, neighborhoods like Kabulonga, Woodlands, and Ibex Hill offer good appeal. However, be careful: some cheaper rental places may not be very safe, so choose your location carefully!

It is easier to get around with a car, but rideshare apps like Ulendo Taxi are a good choice, especially since they have female drivers—this is helpful for solo female travelers! When it comes to safety, it’s important to be cautious; try to avoid some areas where it may be more dangerous, especially if you appear to be a foreigner.

Street vendors are found on the busy streets, selling everything from clothes to local crafts, though you may want to avoid haggling. Instead, visit weekend markets for authentic items. If you're looking for good coffee, places like Zam Bean and The Corner Café are nice to check out. Join local expat groups on Facebook for useful tips! Lusaka has a unique feel that is ready for you to discover.
lusaka.description_kor:
루사카는 다양한 활동으로 가득하고 가까이서 살펴보면 작은 놀라움이 가득한 도시입니다. 도시의 임대료는 동남아시아보다 조금 더 비쌀 수 있지만, 카불롱가, 우들랜즈, 아이벡스 힐 같은 동네는 매력적입니다. 하지만 주의가 필요합니다. 더 저렴한 임대 장소 중 일부는 안전하지 않을 수 있으니, 위치를 신중하게 선택하세요!

자동차로 이동하는 것이 편리하지만, 울렌도 택시와 같은 차량 공유 앱 이용도 괜찮은 선택입니다. 특히 여성 운전사를 선택할 수 있어 혼자 여행하는 여성에게 더욱 안전합니다. 안전 문제에 있어서는 신중함이 중요하므로, 외국인으로 보일 경우 위험할 수 있는 일부 지역은 피하는 것이 좋습니다.

분주한 거리에는 의류부터 지역 공예품까지 다양한 노점상이 있습니다. 다만 가격 흥정은 피하는 게 좋습니다. 주말 시장에서 진짜 좋은 물건들을 찾아보는 것도 추천합니다. 괜찮은 커피를 원하신다면 잠빈이나 더 코너 카페를 들러보세요. 유용한 정보가 필요하다면 페이스북의 현지 외국인 그룹에 가입해 보시는 것도 좋습니다! 루사카는 여러분이 발견할 준비가 된 독특한 매력이 넘치는 곳입니다.

reviews: The center around Rynok Square was awesome with scenic views, street performers, interesting and creative restaurants, places to grab a beer/wine, coffee shops, pedestrian areas, etc. During the school year one out of five people in Lviv are students and so it definitely has a college town vibe. Personally I think it's Ukraine's best city and I found the cost of living value ratio to be superb. The co-working space I went to (iHub) had a good mix of locals and foreign digital nomads.

The best thing about Lviv is that it feels quite alive, with a quite positive vibe. Many young students and tourists all year round, as well as good cafes (Black Honey, Svit Kavy) and decent bars (Pravda). Recommended and usually much cheaper than Kiev.
lviv.description:
Lviv is a city that attracts visitors with its busy atmosphere and rich culture. The center of the city, Rynok Square, is lively, with street performers, different restaurants, and comfortable coffee shops. Locals and students often gather here, as the city has a college-town atmosphere, especially during the school year when many students are around.

Living in Lviv is usually affordable, providing good value for your money. Many visitors appreciate the lower cost of living compared to larger cities like Kyiv. Co-working spaces, such as iHub, bring together locals and remote workers, making it easy to connect and work.

While the city feels safe, some people may have trouble with language since not everyone speaks English. Public transportation can also be difficult, so using taxis or rideshare apps is often a better option. Overall, Lviv is an interesting city with a lot of energy, tasty food, and friendly people—just be sure to discover the local spots and customs that make it unique!
lviv.description_kor:
리비우는 활기찬 분위기와 풍부한 문화로 방문객들을 매료시키는 도시입니다. 도시의 중심인 리노크 광장은 거리 공연과 다양한 식당, 아늑한 커피숍으로 가득 차 있어 언제나 생동감 넘칩니다. 이곳은 대학가의 분위기가 물씬 느껴지며, 특히 학기 중에는 많은 학생들이 모여 동네 주민들과 활발히 교류합니다.

리비우에서의 생활은 대체로 저렴하고, 비용 대비 좋은 가치를 제공합니다. 많은 방문객들은 키예프 같은 대도시에 비해 저렴한 생활비를 높이 평가합니다. 아이허브(iHub) 같은 공동 작업 공간은 지역 주민과 원격 근무자들을 한데 모아 서로 연결되고 원활하게 일할 수 있는 환경을 제공합니다.

이 도시는 전반적으로 안전한 느낌이지만, 모든 사람이 영어를 유창하게 구사하지는 않기 때문에 언어 장벽으로 어려움을 겪는 경우도 있을 수 있습니다. 대중교통도 때로는 불편할 수 있어, 택시나 라이드셰어 앱을 이용하는 것이 일반적으로 더 나은 선택입니다. 전반적으로 리비우는 에너지가 넘치고 맛있는 음식과 친절한 사람들로 가득한 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳의 독특한 매력을 더욱 깊게 느끼기 위해 지역 명소와 관습을 꼭 경험해 보세요!

reviews: Lots of crime near downtown and central Macon, I don't know who put Bloomfield as the best place to move, but as someone who works in Bloomfield, it is basically an active warzone, I heard a drive-by at work tonight and that's normal for me, move to south Macon or northeast Macon, or better yet. Look up a crime map for Macon, they're pretty accurate to real life.
macon.description:
Macon is a city with different features, with friendly people and a rich cultural scene that includes music and history. There are nice neighborhoods like South and Northeast Macon that provide a quieter atmosphere for those who want to escape the busy city life.

However, be aware that downtown Macon has some areas with crime, so it’s important to pay attention to your surroundings, especially at night. Public transportation is not very good, so having a car is suggested for easy travel.

For things to do, enjoy the local music scene or visit the historical sites in the city. Macon is also known for its friendly hospitality, so feel free to talk to the locals!

If you plan to visit or move here, look into the neighborhoods to find the best one for you. Enjoy your time in the South while staying safe!
macon.description_kor:
맥온은 다양한 매력을 지닌 도시로, 친절한 사람들과 음악, 역사로 가득 찬 풍부한 문화가 특징입니다. 바쁜 도시 생활에서 벗어나고 싶다면, 조용한 분위기를 제공하는 사우스 맥온(South Macon)과 노스이스트 맥온(Northeast Macon) 같은 멋진 동네를 추천합니다.

하지만 맥온의 도심 일부 지역은 범죄가 발생할 수 있으니, 특히 밤에는 주변을 잘 살피는 것이 중요합니다. 대중교통이 불편하므로, 편리한 이동을 원하신다면 자동차를 소유하는 것이 좋습니다.

할 일로는 지역 음악 문화를 즐기거나 도시의 역사적인 장소를 방문하는 것이 있습니다. 또한 맥온은 친절한 환대로 유명하니 현지 주민들과 편하게 이야기 나눠 보세요!

여기 방문하거나 이사할 계획이 있다면, 자신의 스타일에 맞는 동네를 찾아보는 것이 중요합니다. 안전하게 지내면서 남부에서 즐거운 시간을 보내세요!

reviews: I have lived in Madison for many years and have mixed feelings about it. It is a very clean and green city, and hospitable to bicyclists. There are many parks and nature centers and an abundance of restaurants serving all varieties of cuisine. There is quite a bit to do here, and Madison is also close enough to Milwaukee for day trips to explore. I love the farmers markets and feel very spoiled to have access to so many locales from which to buy organic food (and vegan, paleo, etc.). What I don't love is the racism in the public schools. Madison is a fairly segregated city, which has been a huge disappointment. Over the past three years or so, road rage has become a significant problem and the crime rate has drastically increased. There has been a large influx of people moving to Madison, which has resulted in traffic challenges. I loved Madison when I first moved here, but it is becoming increasingly dangerous and the housing market is definitely overpriced.
madison.description:
Madison is a city that combines a lively culture with many green spaces, ideal for those who enjoy the outdoors. It is friendly to bikers, and you will find many parks and nature centers to visit. Food lovers will enjoy a variety of restaurants and busy farmers markets that sell organic and special foods.

However, some residents have expressed worries about the city's growth. Problems like more traffic, road anger, and crime have appeared as more people move to Madison. There is also an issue with separation in schools, which the community is trying to solve.

If you are visiting, think about checking out the local markets or taking a bike ride along the many trails. Neighborhoods can feel different, so exploring a few areas will help you find your favorite place. Although living here can be a bit expensive, the local culture and natural beauty might make it worth it.
madison.description_kor:
매디슨은 활기찬 문화와 풍부한 녹지 공간이 잘 어우러진 도시로, 야외 활동을 즐기기에 최적의 장소입니다. 자전거 타기 좋은 이곳에서는 다양한 공원과 자연 센터를 쉽게 찾아볼 수 있습니다. 음식 애호가들이라면 유기농 및 특색 있는 요리를 제공하는 다양한 레스토랑과 활기찬 농산물 시장도 만끽할 수 있습니다.

하지만 일부 주민들은 도시의 성장에 대해 우려를 나타내고 있습니다. 더 많은 사람들이 매디슨으로 이주하면서 교통 체증, 도로에서의 분노, 범죄 문제 등이 생겨나고 있습니다. 또한 학교 내에서의 분리 문제도 존재하며, 지역 사회는 이를 해결하기 위해 노력하고 있습니다.

방문하신다면 지역 시장을 둘러보거나 다양한 트레일을 따라 자전거를 타보시는 걸 추천합니다. 이웃마다 독특한 분위기를 지니고 있으니 여러 지역을 탐방해 보시면 마음에 드는 장소를 발견할 수 있을 것입니다. 매디슨에서의 생활비는 다소 부담이 될 수 있지만, 지역의 풍부한 문화와 자연의 아름다움은 그만한 가치를 느끼게 해줄 것입니다.

reviews: Makati greenbelt and rockwell are nice enough to stay long-term. Especially greenbelt is clean and safe, the greenbelt mall and park is outstanding. Around greenbelt you have three decent sized parks available. Outside of this small bubble of cosiness its chaos dirt and sketchiness. Stay away from Poblacion, its just disgusting. Best bet for a clean and comfortable place to stay are hotels and serviced apartments. Avoid airbnb, its all trash. BGC is another alternative, tough I don't like it much there, its too crowded and too much traffic for me.

A spot that that you pick in Makati is of crucial importance. I've stayed one month in Gramercy Residences, Poblacion only to have a base to visit other Asian countries like China, Korea, Japan. It's very chaotic neighborhood, dirty, in the night there are prostitutes, sexpats and viagra sellers stopping you when you walk in the street. Some of the streets in the night were full of cockroaches and rats, definitely not a good view. Apart from this Makati is known to have cockroach problem in the apartments themselves - in my apartment I had to kill on average 1 per day. And it was still very nice building. The traffic in Manila is super high, and the streets are not very organized - that means travelling anywhere will take you a lot of time. One time going from Makati to Intramuros took me 1 hour 30 minutes. Internet in my apartment was 50 mb/s and I was connected by LAN Cable, however still I had problems with connection (even though the speed was ok it wasn't stable which resulted in dropping from some calls etc.) I don't recommend staying for longer time but if you need to stay in Makati then pick area around greenbelt as the streets are more organized, clean and the area is just more nice. Good thing about Makati is that it has also some nice night life and good rooftop bars. However the only place I wold recommend staying in Manila is BGC in Taguig. This is a very organized area, clean with nice restaurants, bars, streets, lots of greenery. It's not chaotic and dirty. And the apartment prices are similar to Makati for 1 month stay.

My husband and I want to move to Makati but our decision really depends on how good the internet services are when working from home in a condo either in Makati or BGC. He will be on zoom meeting and calls pretty much all day. Would the internet be good enough without too much interruptions? What would be the best internet service provider? Thank
makati.description:
Makati is a busy city in the Philippines, especially around Greenbelt and Rockwell. Many visitors appreciate the area's cleanliness and safety, with nice parks and the big Greenbelt Mall at its center. It feels like a nice place to relax in the middle of the city's activity, where you can walk, shop, or eat.

However, if you go outside this area, it might be a bit messy, particularly in Poblacion, which can be unsafe and dirty at night, with cockroaches in some apartments. Traffic can also be a problem—expect long travel times, even for short trips.

For a good stay, look for hotels or serviced apartments near Greenbelt, as some suggest avoiding Airbnb. While Makati has some good nightlife and rooftop bars, many prefer the cleaner and more organized feel of Bonifacio Global City (BGC) for longer stays. Just be aware of internet issues if you’re working remotely—it can be unreliable. Overall, there is a lot to enjoy, but pick your area carefully!
makati.description_kor:
마카티는 필리핀의 분주한 도시로, 특히 그린벨트와 록웰 주변이 매우 활기차죠. 많은 방문객들이 이 지역의 청결하고 안전한 분위기를 높이 평가하며, 중심부에는 아름다운 공원과 큰 그린벨트 몰이 있습니다. 이곳은 도시의 바쁜 생활 속에서 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 훌륭한 장소로, 산책하고 쇼핑하며 맛있는 식사를 즐길 수 있는 다양한 활동이 가능합니다.

하지만 이 지역을 조금만 벗어나면, 특히 포블라시온에서는 다소 어수선하고, 밤에는 불안감과 함께 더러운 느낌을 받을 수 있습니다. 일부 아파트에서는 바퀴벌레가 발견될 수도 있습니다. 교통 문제도 있어 짧은 거리 이동에도 예상보다 오래 걸릴 수 있습니다.

좋은 숙소를 원하신다면 그린벨트 근처의 호텔이나 서비스 아파트를 추천하며, 에어비앤비는 피하는 것이 좋다는 의견도 많습니다. 마카티에는 멋진 나이트라이프와 루프탑 바가 있지만, 많은 사람들이 더 깨끗하고 정돈된 보니파시오 글로벌 시티(BGC)를 선호하곤 합니다. 원격 근무를 하신다면 인터넷 문제에 유의하세요. 전반적으로 많은 즐길 거리가 있지만, 지역 선택에 신중해야 합니다!

reviews: As the main gateway to Sulawesi and the rest of eastern Indonesia, Makassar is probably better for travelers than nomads at the moment. However, this is the place where I met the man, who turned me from a tourist into a real, hardened traveler. A local English teacher and prince with royal blood from the pulau selayar, this man organized a two month itinerary where I traveled to his students' villages, eating their food, sleeping in their homes and gaining a deep window into their lives that left me forever changed. If you'd like to become a traveler, or gain a window into the real Indonesia, go to Fort Rotterdam and ask the guard to meet "Daeng Lala," the English teacher." If you embark on this journey, bring your courage and an open mind, but remember that you are an ambassador of the west. Be respectful of the local culture, and understand that in Sulawesi, there is more than meets the eye.... it goes many levels deep. Good luck and safe travels....Daniel.
makassar.description:
Makassar, a city in Indonesia, is a starting point for adventures in Sulawesi and eastern Indonesia. It is suitable for travelers looking for real experiences, where you can engage with local life and learn more about the culture. You can ask about Fort Rotterdam, and you might meet Daeng Lala, an English teacher who can help connect you with local villagers and their traditions.

Although Makassar has a rich culture and a busy atmosphere, language barriers can be a challenge. The cost of living is low, but be aware that prices at tourist spots can be higher. Public transportation is available but may not always be the easiest option, so plan ahead.

When exploring, be respectful of local customs and enjoy the hospitality of the people. Take your time to enjoy local dishes and the beautiful surroundings. So pack your bags with an open mind and be ready for a memorable experience in Makassar!
makassar.description_kor:
막카사르(Makassar)는 인도네시아의 도시로, 술라웨시(Sulawesi)와 동부 인도네시아의 모험 시작점입니다. 진정한 경험을 원하는 여행자에게 안성맞춤인 이곳에서는 현지 생활에 직접 참여하고 문화를 깊이 이해할 수 있습니다. 포르트 로타르담(Fort Rotterdam)에 대해 궁금한 점이 있다면, 현지 주민들과 그들의 전통을 잘 아는 영어 교사 다엥 라라(Daeng Lala)를 만나보세요. 

막카사르는 풍부한 문화와 활기찬 분위기를 지녔지만, 언어 장벽이 도전 과제가 될 수 있습니다. 생활비는 저렴하지만 관광지의 가격은 다소 높을 수 있으니 이 점을 유념하세요. 대중교통은 이용 가능하지만 항상 가장 편리한 선택은 아닐 수 있으니 사전에 계획을 세우는 것이 좋습니다. 

탐험할 때는 현지 관습을 존중하고 사람들의 따뜻한 환대를 즐기세요. 현지 음식과 아름다운 풍경을 만끽할 수 있는 시간을 꼭 가지시길 바랍니다. 그러니 열린 마음으로 짐을 싸고 막카사르에서 잊지 못할 경험을 할 준비를 해보세요!

reviews: great city, will be top3 in the future in Europe. good prices, amazing food, good airport, international community, good weather all the year.

Málaga is great. I don't agree on the comment that says it is not used to digital nomads, the person hasn't made a proper research. There are a lot of hostels, amazing night life, people are very cool and respectful, young people know English, and it has lots of COWORKING areas, even in banks. But not all of this is only in the center of the city, you need to discover also Costa del Sol, with places like Benalmádena, Fuengirola and Marbella, where is full of digital nomads that come the area because of the weather, the food and the great prices!

For anyone who has traveled a lot Málaga will be underwhelming. The weather is AMAZING but the city itself gets boring after 2 days and apart from the historic center most neighborhoods are not pretty to look at. The beaches are not very beautiful. The museums are not impressive and people are not used to digital nomads so if you're not fluent in Spanish it will be nearly impossible to make friends. Public transportation works quite well but to get to the better hiking spots you will need a rental car.

Its the paradise but getting really expensive! It actually makes sense! I would recomend Fuengirola! Regardles of the fact that is more expensive than Malaga city center. Good luck in la costa del sol. It hepls you if you speak Spanish! You are in Spain! Dont forget that!
malaga.description:
Málaga is a lively city that is becoming well-known in Europe. With good weather all year and a diverse international atmosphere, it is a good option for both tourists and those wanting to live there. The food is very good. From tapas to seafood, you will enjoy many flavors. Also, prices are reasonable compared to other European cities.

The city has good public transportation, but if you want to visit the beautiful hiking areas or nearby places like Benalmádena and Fuengirola, renting a car is necessary. Although Málaga has historical appeal, some areas may seem less interesting after a few days, especially if you want popular tourist sites.

One thing to remember: knowing some Spanish can help you connect with people, as locals are friendly but may not always speak English. While it is a good place for digital nomads, it can become a bit expensive as more people come here. Overall, Málaga offers a mix of culture, good food, and possible adventures waiting for you in Costa del Sol!
malaga.description_kor:
말라가(Málaga)는 유럽에서 점점 인기를 끌고 있는 활기찬 도시입니다. 연중 훌륭한 날씨와 다양한 국제적 분위기로 인해 관광객과 이곳에 거주하고 싶어하는 사람들에게 매우 매력적인 선택이 됩니다. 특히 음식을 다양하게 즐길 수 있는데, 타파스부터 신선한 해산물까지 맛있는 요리가 많습니다. 게다가 다른 유럽 도시들과 비교했을 때 가격도 비교적 합리적입니다.

이 도시는 좋은 대중교통 시스템을 갖추고 있지만, 아름다운 하이킹 코스나 베날마데나(Benalmádena), 푸엔히롤라(Fuengirola)와 같은 인근 명소를 방문하고 싶다면 자동차를 렌트하는 것이 좋습니다. 말라가는 역사적인 매력을 지닌 도시이지만, 며칠 지나면 특정 인기 관광지 외에는 다소 지루하게 느껴질 수도 있습니다.

하나 염두에 두어야 할 점은 스페인어를 조금 아는 것이 현지인들과 소통하는 데 큰 도움이 된다는 것입니다. 현지인들은 친절하지만 항상 영어를 잘하는 것은 아니라서, 기본적인 스페인어로 소통하면 더 원활하게 대화할 수 있습니다. 디지털 노마드에게는 훌륭한 장소지만, 점점 더 많은 사람들이 찾으면서 가격이 오를 수 있는 점은 감안해야 합니다. 전반적으로 말라가는 문화, 맛있는 음식, 그리고 코스타 델 솔(Costa del Sol)에서의 모험이 어우러진 멋진 여행지입니다!

reviews: Having travelled and lived around Thailand and Malaysia, Malacca feels somewhat disjointed without any real centre apart from the touristy Jonker Street. Weather (January 2024) ranges between a balmy & breezy 28C to a slightly uncomfortable and sticky 33C. Local food is very reasonably priced (3.50 Ringett for sweet tea or kopi, 7 Ringett for a plate of noodles), if you avoid the most touristy places and stick to local side alleys and restaurants where the local people eat. People here are very friendly and interested to know where you come from, many speak good English. Big Chinese and Nyonya community here, which reflects in the food, along with Portuguese & Malay influences. Some of the longer-stay hotels are cheaper when rented through private landlords (find them on Booking website). Buying a traditional wooden house in the centre of Malacca near the canal costs from 12,000 Ringett (prices as of Jan 2024).

Arrived yesterday, at Dreambase coworking now. A fascinating city in the sense that is seems strange, eerie, and sullen. It feels like the city was abandoned for 30 years and what remains is the population that decided to stay. Many random empty, lonely buildings. Patches of busyness dispersed in between patches of nullness. Everything feels just a little bit too far to walk. Grab works fine here for getting around. Extremely affordable. But so far it definitely doesn't feel like the place to be if what you're looking for is night life, socializing, and entrepreneurial communities. Internet speed is great. Weather is good. Things are quiet.
malacca.description:
Malacca is a city that mixes different cultures and foods in an interesting way. It may seem a bit spread out without a main area outside of the busy Jonker Street, but it is full of history. The weather can be warm and humid, ranging from 28°C to 33°C, but that should not stop you from enjoying the local food. You can have a filling plate of noodles for only 7 Ringgit, especially if you go to the quiet alleys where locals eat instead of tourist areas.

The friendly atmosphere here makes it easy to meet people, as many locals speak English and are interested in your travels. There are many cultural influences from Chinese, Nyonya, Portuguese, and Malay people seen in the food and buildings. While the city may seem calm and a little strange at times, ideal for thinking, it is not known for nightlife or a busy business scene. For transportation, Grab is a useful option, and renting a place from locals can help you save money. Just be prepared for a slow pace and enjoy the interesting stories this city has to share.
malacca.description_kor:
말라카는 다양한 문화와 음식을 독특하게 혼합한 매력적인 도시입니다. 분주한 존커 스트리트를 제외하고는 중심가가 없어 보일 수도 있지만, 이곳은 풍부한 역사로 가득 차 있습니다. 날씨는 따뜻하고 습해 28도에서 33도 사이를 오가지만, 현지 음식을 즐기는 데에는 전혀 방해가 되지 않을 것입니다. 관광 지역이 아닌 조용한 골목으로 들어가면 지역 주민들이 즐겨 찾는 맛있는 국수 한 그릇을 단 7 링깃에 맛볼 수 있습니다.

이곳의 친근한 분위기는 사람들과 쉽게 교류할 수 있게 해 줍니다. 많은 지역 주민들이 영어를 잘 구사하며 여행에 대한 관심도 높습니다. 음식과 건물에서는 중국, 뇨냐, 포르투갈, 말레이 문화의 영향을 뚜렷하게 느낄 수 있습니다. 마을은 가끔 평화롭고 약간은 기묘하게 보일 수 있지만, 사교나 활기찬 비즈니스 중심지로 알려져 있지는 않습니다. Grab을 이용한 교통 수단이 매우 유용하며, 지역 주민에게 숙소를 임대하면 비용도 절약할 수 있습니다. 느긋한 걸음으로 이곳의 흥미로운 이야기들을 만끽해 보세요.

reviews: I’m African American. Was in Mallorca for a week on a trip. I found everyone amiable, friendly and, in retail outlets, accommodating. Same with food service. I noticed a lot of black folk in Palma, presumably vacationing there. When I got lost I was graciously helped. It was very hot there—June 2023. Not much on the architecture front. Besides the central part of town, housing was rather plain and even ugly. Some of the small towns I visited were also rather plain.

Pretty racist to those that arent white, you feel unwelcome, locals stare at you like your alien, you get served last even when your 1st in line, you get ignored and when you walk into a shop you get followed around because the workers think your going to steal something. However for white people im sure Palma is great.
mallorca.description:
Mallorca is located in the Balearic Islands and has many beaches and towns. Many visitors appreciate the friendly vibe, especially in Palma, where locals often help and welcome you—just ask for directions, and you will likely receive a smile. The island’s warm weather is good for sunbathing and outdoor cafes.

However, some travelers point out issues with the local culture. Experiences can differ greatly, especially regarding race; some people have felt unwelcome, which can be upsetting. The public transportation is simple, but it does not reach all areas, so plan ahead if you want to visit less popular places.

While the buildings may seem plain—especially in residential areas—be sure to enjoy the lively street life and nice markets. With its beautiful beaches and active atmosphere, Mallorca has many fun activities, from relaxing on the beach to trying local food. Just remember to respect local customs and enjoy this great place!
mallorca.description_kor:
마요르카는 발레아르 제도에 위치해 있으며, 아름다운 해변과 매력적인 마을로 유명합니다. 많은 방문객들이 특히 팔마에서 친근한 분위기를 만끽합니다. 현지인들은 자주 도움을 주고 따뜻하게 맞이해 주며, 길을 물어보면 미소로 반응해주는 경우가 많습니다. 이 섬의 따뜻한 날씨는 일광욕과 야외 카페에서의 여유를 즐기기에 아주 좋습니다.

하지만 일부 여행자들은 지역 문화에 대한 우려를 표현하기도 합니다. 경험은 특히 인종에 따라 크게 다를 수 있으며, 어떤 사람들은 소외감을 느껴 속상해 할 수도 있습니다. 대중교통은 편리하지만 모든 지역에 연결되지 않기 때문에 덜 알려진 장소를 방문하고 싶다면 미리 계획하는 것이 중요합니다.

주거 지역의 건물들은 다소 평범해 보일 수 있지만, 활기찬 거리 생활과 멋진 시장은 꼭 경험해 보세요. 아름다운 해변과 생동감 넘치는 분위기를 가진 마요르카는 해변에서 편안하게 쉬며 현지 음식을 즐기는 등 다양한 재미있는 활동을 제공합니다. 단, 지역의 관습을 존중하며 이 멋진 장소를 마음껏 누리시기 바랍니다!

reviews:
Close proximity to Copenhagen and it’s airport; much cheaper than the Danish capital, though still quite expensive compared to many other European cities. 

I’ve been to Malmö multiple times and would say that I always feel safe during the day, but there are pockets I wouldn’t be so comfortable going to at night. The area close Triangeln Station is one place I didn’t feel so comfortable. Most of the center is fine though, I’d say — though I feel like the city has gotten worse since I first visited in 2017.

Lots of good food options and easy to cycle around. I personally couldn’t see myself living here as the only reason I would is to be near Copenhagen, but it’s an enjoyable day trip.

I've lived here since 2018. All areas are safe and you shouldn't have any problems anywhere. The other reviewer mentioned having bikes stolen; but that is just normal and happens in every single Swedish city. I wouldn't expect anything more bad than that to happen.

I´ve lived here for five years and know at least three friends, me included that have had stuff stolen. Ive had three bikes stolen for example. One of the cities strengths is its multicultural food industry! Some areas like Rosengård have a higher crime rate. Malmö has some decent areas that are nice, just be wary of what neighbourhoods you choose to spend your time in.
malmo.description:
Malmö is a city that is located just across the bridge from Copenhagen, making it a good option for a day trip for those looking for a more affordable city experience. While it’s not the cheapest city in Europe, it does offer more budget-friendly choices than its Danish neighbor.

The city is known for its diverse food scene—trying the different foods here is highly recommended! Whether you want a cozy cafe or a nice restaurant, there are many places to choose from. Also, cycling is a common way to get around, which makes it easy to see the city.

Most visitors and locals feel safe during the day, but it's smart to be aware of your surroundings at night and to stay away from certain areas like Triangeln Station and Rosengård, which have higher crime rates. Theft, especially of bikes, can happen, so making sure to lock your bike securely is a good idea.

Malmö has some drawbacks, but its special atmosphere, good food, and closeness to Copenhagen make it a city worth visiting!
malmo.description_kor:
말뫼는 코펜하겐에서 다리를 건너면 만날 수 있는 도시로, 더 저렴한 여행을 원하는 이들에게 안성맞춤인 하루 여행지입니다. 유럽에서 가장 저렴한 도시는 아니지만, 덴마크의 이웃 도시보다는 더 많은 예산 친화적인 선택지를 제공합니다.

이 도시는 다양한 음식 문화로 유명해서, 다양한 음식을 시도해보는 걸 추천합니다! 아늑한 카페부터 멋진 레스토랑까지 선택할 수 있는 곳이 아주 많습니다. 또한, 자전거를 타고 돌아다니는 것이 일반적이라, 도시를 편리하게 탐험할 수 있습니다.

대부분의 방문객과 지역 주민들은 낮에 안전하다고 느끼지만, 밤에는 주의가 필요합니다. 특히 범죄율이 높은 트리앙겐역이나 로젠고르드 같은 특정 지역은 피하는 게 좋습니다. 자전거 도난이 일어날 수 있으니, 자전거를 잘 잠그는 것도 중요한 팁입니다.

물론 말뫼에는 몇 가지 단점도 있지만, 특별한 분위기와 훌륭한 음식, 그리고 코펜하겐과의 가까운 거리 덕분에 충분히 방문할 가치가 있는 도시입니다!

reviews: Safety score is honestly too high! I passed through Managua a few times during my time in Nicaragua, and it remains the sketchiest, dirtiest city I've personally seen in Latin America. It's also ungodly hot and smelly. Would not recommend staying here for any reason whatsoever.
managua.description:
Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, is a city that people have different opinions about. On one hand, it is known for its warm weather and lively local culture, but on the other hand, some think it is a bit rough. It can get very hot, which might make you feel uncomfortable.

Many visitors say that the streets can be busy and not very clean, which may take some time to get used to. A common view is that safety can be a concern, so it is important to be aware of your surroundings if you decide to explore. Public transportation can vary, so planning ahead is a good idea if you want to make the most of your trip.

Be sure to try local restaurants and enjoy Nicaraguan food—it has a lot of flavors! If you decide to visit, staying in well-known neighborhoods and being careful can help you appreciate the city's unique style. Overall, while not everyone likes Managua, those who are willing to explore may find some interesting places!
managua.description_kor:
니카라과의 수도 마나과는 다양한 이견이 있는 도시입니다. 따뜻한 날씨와 활기찬 지역 문화로 잘 알려져 있지만, 한편으로는 다소 거칠게 느껴질 수도 있다는 의견도 있습니다. 날씨가 상당히 덥게 변할 수 있어 불편함을 느낄 수 있습니다.

방문객들 가운데는 도심이 혼잡하고 그리 깨끗하지 않다는 목소리도 있지만, 이런 점은 익숙해지는데 시간이 걸릴 수 있습니다. 안전 문제에 대한 우려가 있어, 탐험하기로 하면 주변을 신중하게 살피는 것이 중요합니다. 대중교통 수단도 다양하니 여행을 최대한 즐기고 싶다면 미리 계획하는 게 좋습니다.

현지 식당에서 니카라과 음식을 꼭 맛보시길 추천합니다. 정말 다양한 맛을 경험할 수 있습니다! 방문하신다면 잘 알려진 동네에 머물고 조심하면 도시의 독특한 매력을 느끼는 데 도움이 될 것입니다. 전반적으로 마나과를 좋아하지 않는 사람도 있지만, 모험할 준비가 된 사람이라면 흥미로운 장소를 발견할 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: It's quite boring. Not many things to do here. The beaches aren't clean. The place only seems lively in the summer. The rest of the year, most local businesses close their shops because there are no more tourists. Only malls are open all year. Most people don't speak English, so you are not likely to connect with people here. Many other cities in Romania like Bucharest (where I currently live), Cluj and Timisoara have much more to give.
mamaia.description:
Mamaia is a beach resort on the Black Sea that is busy during the summer. On sunny days, you can enjoy the sun on its beaches, but cleanliness may vary. Many people think that outside of the tourist season, this place can feel a bit boring, as most local businesses close, leaving only a few malls open all year. 

While you will enjoy the beach atmosphere in summer, it might be hard to talk to locals, as English is not commonly spoken here. If you want more activities and excitement, cities like Bucharest, Cluj, and Timisoara have more culture and energy. 

If you choose to visit Mamaia, try to go when the sun is out and the beach bars are busy. Just remember that if you stay longer, you might miss the lively feel that summer tourists bring. It is a nice place to relax, but you may want to have a plan for when the town gets quiet!
mamaia.description_kor:
마마이아는 여름철에 인파로 붐비는 흑해의 해변 리조트입니다. 맑은 날에는 해변에서 태양 아래 시간을 즐길 수 있지만, 청결 상태는 제각각이니 참고하셔야 합니다. 많은 이들이 관광 시즌이 아닐 땐 이곳이 다소 지루할 수 있다고 느끼곤 합니다. 왜냐하면 대부분의 지역 상점들이 문을 닫고, 운영되는 몇몇 쇼핑몰만 남기 때문이죠.

여름철에는 해변의 활기찬 분위기를 만끽할 수 있지만, 현지인들과 소통하기엔 어려움이 있을 수 있습니다. 이곳에서는 영어가 널리 쓰이지 않기 때문입니다. 더 다양한 활동과 흥미로운 경험을 원하신다면, 부쿠레슈티나 클루지, 티미쇼아라 같은 도시들이 더 풍부한 문화와 에너지를 제공합니다.

마마이아를 방문하기로 결심하셨다면, 태양이 뜨고 해변 바가 붐비는 시기에 가는 것을 추천합니다. 하지만 오랫동안 머무는 경우 여름 관광객들이 조성하는 활기찬 분위기를 놓칠 수도 있다는 점을 염두에 두세요. 이곳은 편안하게 휴식을 취할 좋은 장소지만, 마을이 조용해질 때를 대비한 계획을 세우는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Husband and I spent one month here, and we didn’t like it, at all! There is a lot of litter and graffiti everywhere!!!! The entire city needs a good power wash. I think that due to the volume of transitant people who live here, not much effort is put in to make it nicer. It’s a shame because there are some really nice buildings and neighborhoods that would be lovely if there was some care put into them. Unfortunately, it’s all dirty and run down. Almost every night, you will hear fireworks go off at all hours, especially if you are near any of the parks. It’s maddening! I’m aware that Manchester is the “working class/historically industrial” city of the UK, just sad that not a lot of effort has been put into it. We didn’t feel comfortable being out at night as there were several dodgy people out loitering the bus stops and yelling at random people. I will state though that they are doing some renovations and new construction in some areas, so perhaps in about 10 years it might get better, especially if more Londoners move up here. Also, there are nice neighborhoods such as Didsbury to stroll around. Overall, very disappointed and have no plans on returning.

Manchester is a working town, but has much going on in the weekend days. Well connected by train for the rest of England as well as cheap flights to Ireland and London if needed. National Football Museum, arcades, and high end and low end food for any budget.
manchester.description:
Ah, Manchester—a city with a lot of history, but it may not meet all your expectations! Picture walking its streets and feeling the atmosphere of a traditional working-class city with a strong industrial background. But don’t expect everything to be clean; you will see some dirty places, litter, and graffiti, which can be unpleasant. Some locals have mentioned that the city could use some cleaning up, especially because there are nice buildings and areas, like Didsbury, that are worth visiting.

On the positive side, Manchester has a lot going on during weekends! From the National Football Museum to fun game centers and food choices for all prices, there’s something for everyone. The public transport is good, making it easy to take a train for a day trip to other parts of the UK or catch a low-cost flight to Ireland.

However, going out late at night may not be very comfortable, as some areas can feel unsafe. So, if you plan to visit, try to stay in the quieter neighborhoods and be careful of those late-night fireworks!
manchester.description_kor:
아, 맨체스터! 많은 역사를 가진 도시지만, 모든 기대를 충족시키지 않을 수도 있습니다. 전통적인 노동자 계급 도시의 느낌을 만끽하며 그 거리들을 걷는 모습을 상상해 보세요. 하지만 모든 것이 깨끗하다고 기대하진 마세요. 곳곳에서 더러운 장소나 쓰레기, 그래피티를 볼 수도 있을 텐데, 이는 다소 불쾌하게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 일부 현지인들은 디즈버리 같은 멋진 건물과 매력적인 지역들이 있으니 도시가 좀 더 깨끗해질 필요가 있다고 언급하기도 했습니다.

긍정적인 면으로는, 맨체스터는 주말 동안 할 거리가 정말 많아요! 국가 축구 박물관을 시작으로, 재미있는 게임 센터와 다양한 가격대의 음식 옵션이 있어서 모두가 즐길 수 있습니다. 대중교통도 편리하고, 영국의 다른 지역으로 당일치기 여행을 하거나 저비용 항공편으로 아일랜드를 방문하기도 쉽습니다.

하지만 늦은 밤 외출하는 것은 조심해야 할 수 있어요. 특정 지역은 안전하지 않게 느껴질 수 있으니, 방문 계획 시 조용한 동네에 머물고 늦은 밤의 소음에 유의하는 것이 좋습니다!

reviews: If you can go elsewhere - go elsewhere. Unless you have a family, the country has absolutely no selling point for single people. High taxes, no benefits, boring people, back office jobs, nothing to do. Eveything is very expensive and bad quality. Salaries have also gone down in recent years. On the there hand great place to have a family.
luxembourg.description:
Luxembourg may not be on everyone's travel list, especially for single people, but it has its own appeal, especially for families. This small city has many historic sites, like the Grand Ducal Palace and the old town. It feels safe and clean, but visitors often say that the cost of living can be high, which can be a concern.

For single people, the nightlife can feel limited, and social gatherings often focus on families. However, the city's parks and outdoor areas are good for walks or picnics with friends. Public transport is usually reliable, but it might not be as complete as in bigger cities.

If you plan to visit, explore different neighborhoods to understand the local culture, and keep in mind that many things can be costly, so planning your budget is important. Overall, Luxembourg is suitable for families looking to settle down, while singles might find it a bit quieter.
luxembourg.description_kor:
룩셈부르크는 특히 싱글들에게는 여행 목록에 오르지 않을 수도 있지만, 가족에게는 매력적인 곳입니다. 이 작은 도시는 그랑 두칼 궁전과 구시가지처럼 많은 역사적인 명소를 보유하고 있습니다. 안전하고 깨끗한 느낌이 있지만, 방문자들은 종종 높은 생활비에 대해 걱정하곤 합니다.

싱글들에게는 밤문화가 다소 제한적일 수 있으며, 사회적 모임은 주로 가족 중심으로 이루어집니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 이 도시의 공원과 야외 공간은 친구들과 함께 산책하거나 소풍을 즐기기에 안성맞춤입니다. 대중교통은 대체로 신뢰할 수 있지만, 더 큰 도시들에 비해 그 완전성은 떨어질 수 있습니다.

방문할 계획이라면, 다양한 동네를 탐방하며 지역 문화를 이해하고, 많은 것들이 비용이 많이 들 수 있다는 점을 염두에 두어 예산을 잘 계획하는 것이 중요합니다. 전반적으로 룩셈부르크는 정착하기 적합한 가족들에게 좋지만, 싱글들에게는 다소 조용하게 느껴질 수 있습니다.

reviews: I'm staying in BGC as I write this, and so far PH most aggressively mediocre place I've travelled to in Asia. While I'm used to free/cheap wifi, friendly people, and great food living in place like Thailand, even staying in the most modern area in the country lacks all of those (no free Wifi even at Starbucks, and I've seen "cooked fresh" restaurant food taken out of the freezer before cooking). Social culture is very uncanny valley, people are "polite" but it's extremely fake, which you'll notice in subtle ways like slow service, not saying "you're welcome" to "thank you," and just a general dispassionate disposition even if you're very polite (which I am). I've also gone on a few dates here, and each one has been in a constant competition for the most awkward thing I've ever experienced (and I've gone out with people all over the world). It's also very dangerous by Asia standards — you have to stay in your bubble to stay safe. My verdict is avoid, unless it's visiting their beaches for a few days.

I’d say that everything said here about Metro Manila is about right. Transport is about the worst I’ve ever known, traffic is a nightmare that’ll leave you paying for Grab taxis (cheap but they add up quickly) and taking hours to get around. Would recommend BGC area as the most foreigner friendly.

Living options were limited on Airbnb, nothing like what you’d find in Bangkok or similar cities. Quality was much lower and generally not very comfortable.

Honestly the biggest issue for me was that free wifi basically doesn’t exist in Manila. Starbucks, McDonald’s, no matter where you go - will NOT have proper free wifi. Some malls offer a teaser 1 hour free session IF you’ve got a Filipino phone number. If not, you’re out of luck. Do not expect to go work in a cafe here and have wifi available. Locals use their mobile data instead.

I stayed in Manila for 3+ months and loved it. I am absolutely shocked by the reviews here—where do these people come from, the Upper East side of Manhattan? Sheesh. Yes, Manila is a BIG Asian city, it's a bit rough around the edges, and it's not the prettiest place in the world, but man does it have a lot going for it!

- Safety: I come from Cape Town originally, so for me, Manila felt very safe. Even in the more dodgy looking areas, I never really got a bad vibe. 

- Friendly people: I found everyone friendly here. I never had a rude encounter with anyone, and I always felt respected.

- Convenience: You can get anything here in Manila. There are convenience stores everywhere and you can order anything to your door using Grab. Not to mention the fact that everyone speaks English and all signs/menus are in English, too.

- Food: Some people here complained about the food, but I really have no idea what they're talking about. Unless you're on a shoestring budget, you can easily find tasty, healthy food here. In fact, you can get any kind of cuisine you want! There is amazing Japanese, Korean, Chinese food, as well as Western food and good coffee.

- Fun stuff to do: Some people here complained that there isn't much to do in Manila. They are wrong. There is plenty to do here. If you're into coffee, there are endless interesting cafes to check out, there are amazing restaurants and eateries all over, there is good nightlife, rooftop bars, and KTV, there are parks where you can walk or run, there are malls all over the place where you can shop, watch movies and eat, there are museums, historical places, etc etc.

- Atmosphere: Despite being a rather bustling, chaotic city, the vibe here feels remarkably relaxed. It's odd in a way, but it's also nice.

Don't get me wrong, Manila is a massive city, so your experience here will be influenced by where you live. I would recommend staying somewhere in Makati (Salcedo is very nice) or BGC. Coming from South Africa, I was hugely impressed by the infrastructure in these areas, it's incredibly first world and very modern. The regular rules apply here (as they do in any big city)—don't walk around dodgy areas at night, don't flash your gold watches around, and be respectful. Do this, and I imagine you'll have a good time.

Don't listen to the haters, go to Manila and decide for yourself whether it's for you!

A common theme of many major cities are that they're generally safe with some dangerous pockets you have to avoid. 
Manila is the inverse - it's a giant sprawling slum with one or two nice pockets in amongst it. 

 It's pretty dystopian and even if you try to isolate yourself into the 'rich' bubble you'll still see some of the poverty spillover on a regular basis. Eg in the central business district of Ortigas I saw multiple homeless children (a few girls who looked about 12 years old holding newborn babies). Armed guards with shotguns outside every store, coffee shop and mall. A tourist was murdered in the Makati area just a couple months back, supposedly one of the safer districts. My friend from Australia was robbed at knifepoint in the Eastwood area last month, again another supposedly safe area. 

You'll be advised not to 'look rich' (no fancy watches, clothes, bags etc) in order to avoid attention - good advice if you're Filipino. But if you're white, forget it. You could be the dirtiest and most poor looking white person on the planet but it doesn't matter to the Manila locals - white skin = rich and unfortunately in such an improverished place rich = a target. 

Unlike Bankgok, Kuala Lumpur, Ho Chi Minh etc, you'll rarely see white people walking down the streets - which tells its own story. It simply isn't safe. When there's so many great options in Southeast Asia to live, both islands and cities, absolutely no one in the right mind would ever choose to live in this place.

Anyone who would recommend living in Greenbelt / Legaspi / San Lorenzo must be in love with repression and boredom.

And there is no pickup culture. Everyone is busy. If they are alone, they are uncomfortable - because this place is uncomfortable. 
It has all the free flowing mating energy as a mechanic shop during rush hour. 
Stick to apps only. Because that's where all meetup culture got sucked into it like helium canisters. Permitting no more free range social energy to fumigate. This is how 2 extremes get formed and create a meta everybody!

Believe me when I say, you will be at tourist bars talking to only tourists. Like *every other played tourist trap on the planet*.

Greenbelt - and any other gentrified areas here - are completely leveled socially, smoking craters of mingle culture. And I fear millennial and zoomer phone addicts won't be the guardians to rescue it any time soon.

Anytime Delta and Marriott are posted up waiting for your landing, you should just roll your eyes and hit the gas pedal for another 10 KM.
The whole place is a cardboard prop that falls down when touched. Like all 3rd wave capitalist tourist traps.
The social ice is thick beyond function. The nightlife is a travesty.
So stay on your apps - learn how to refresh them - pipeline matches.
Stay far outside the 10 KM landing point radius. Unless you have some endless lightning of extroversion inside you - 
this place will frost you over just like any other, and we will join together as ice sculptures. Yet again. Praise Delta Marriott, while singing kumbaya for office herbivore culture that hosts full-uniform no-contact cocktail sipping parties. 1 of the only examples of social culture and interesting nightlife inside the 10 KM radius is Poblacion Makati. Beware the hideous traffic. Walk around with strong frame, like you know not a single person is trying to do you a favor ever. Any bar that has to hide what the interior looks like - you might as well be born yesterday going into it. 'I like my exotic experience to go with 3 middlemen and surrounded by thugs in a dark room' - What is this the 1980s? Quezon City and Alabang Muntinlupa - that is how far you have to go, and the corporate frost all starts to thaw out and human behavior turns real again. And don't ever hire people for your digital "content" - this place hasn't caught up to that side of Western culture on any level.

The worst traffic in the world. The word traffic is misleading because it assumes movement, often during rush hour it can take 1.5 hours to go 10km (how do you like 3 hour daily commutes). The streets are chaotic like world war 3. If you get anxiety/claustrophobia this is not a place to be. Food is not great and unhealthy (lots of fried oily foods). And lots of garbage, litter, pollution just not a very pleasant place. It’s also hard to meet or really integrate with locals as a foreigner. The one redeeming factor is that Philippine people are so warm and hospitable. Without that it would be unbearable.

The worst. Everyone in Manila is controlled like Rats in a cage. I rented an Airbnb and a girl I met couldn't go swimming in the pool because she wasn't a "registered guest." The entire city stinks, the bathrooms in the nicest buildings in Makati stink, and it's awful. The rich treat the poor like dirt and take advantage of them on every opportunity. I will never visit it again. Horrible place. If you like a place where the rich treat the poor like dirt and keep them separated from them with big gates and security guards, then you will love this place.

Coming here from Bangkok was kind of a shock. Most areas are slum, except for a few developed enclaves mainly around BGC. Due to the limited developed land area equivalent housing options are more expensive and less flexible than say Bangkok. Internet is horrible (walk around with phone in the air for signal bad), public transport hugely lacking, Grab rides sometimes take over an hour to book due to driver supply caps after reopening from COVID lockdowns, food options are limited and often unhealthy. Looking forward to going back to Bangkok and the more developed cities here in Asia. Maybe if you're into crazy adventures with third world style karaoke and other sketchy nightlife this is your place. Beaches could be nice for a few days -- I'm more into cities though. Not to completely trash this place, maybe with more research and local connections you're able to make your stay more enjoyable, but you shouldn't expect the convenience you'll get used to elsewhere.

Manila and the Philippines in general are an absolute horrible place to stay or live. The whole country looks like a slum. The food is horrible (mainly rice and burgers). Completely unhealthy. The air pollution is high. Fun level is absolute zero. Internet is bad. Accommodation is pricey for very low quality. Would never recommend this place to anyone. Go to Bali instead much better.

I find the score of LGBTQ and racial tolerance for this city to be highly inaccurate. Is this score more about perception? I find LGBTQ-friendliness in Manila to be higher than Bangkok or Taipei, maybe even friendlier than other known cities such as London, Stockholm, Mexico City or Los Angeles. The hospitality culture makes it really friendly towards people of different race, too accomodating to a fault sometimes. Makati, BGC, Eastwood I've stayed in these areas for years and this is completely a first world bubble, so it is highly safe, walkable, livable and everything is just a walk's reach away as traffic can get extreme in Manila. Internet speed in cafes or public areas are quite slow or absent but the ones in your accomodation or hotel is fast. What I like about this city is like your living in 2 worlds, you can go to an area where it is 3rd world (you can find really budget items there), but at the same time you can go back to your first world gentrified bubble in Township areas such as McKinley Hills, BGC, Ortigas or Eastwood City. During weekends you can rent a car and go to mountains and beaches around Manila.

Manila is an incredibly welcoming city and cheap to live. Accommodation in ultra luxurious condos is reasonable, foot massage whilst tapping out emails (£7 per hour) makes working from here a no brainer. Agree living in the Greenbelt area is a no brainer. Vegetarian choices can be limited in some places but excellent (and so cheap!) Delivery services are available, including diet chef stuff which is unaffordable anywhere else. The streets feel safe inside Makati and the areas around greenbelt and I have never felt uneasy in good areas, which is not the same as London where you are constantly feeling at risk. Bureaucracy is tough in Manila though. Just chill, queue, take your laptop to keep you busy, and remember to be unstintingly polite - locals do not deal well with confrontation and you do well to empathise with them rather than get off by being "right" .

Not great, not terrible. Lots of scammers and dirty streets, but also great and cheap food. Mobility isn't a highlight, but condos have a huge infraestructure and you can easily do everything you need (working, groceries, gym etc) without even put your feet outside. Never felt 100% safe, as some streets are really dark at night. Anyway it's a good choice considering value for money if you find a nice place, otherwise Bangkok is way better.

Eastwood City hands down best places for nomads in Manila. Why? 50-100 mbps from Sky or PLDT. Closely guarded community where you can feel safe. Everything you could want is inside the community- condos for rent short or long term fully furnished, over 100 restaurants (both fast food and fine dining and some american franchises too), 7 screen movie theater, bowling alley, billiards. Many unique shops that are centered around activities. Pet friendly. Also, has 2 grocery stores, at least a dozen convenience stores, barber shops, massage and day spas (you can even get a professional massage right in your room), laundromat. The mall has anything you might need to buy for your condo.

If you stay in the area immediately around Greenbelt then it's great. There's a cafe called Antipodean that serves all day breakfasts, with excellent bacon and eggs, I stay 2 mins walk from there. I've stayed at Gramercy Apartments in Poblacion in the past and that wasn't good. That area is not very walkable and not much nearby except for some trendy bars.

Being close to Greenbelt means you have everything you need in the malls. Also, if you're a single guy, then it's a wonderful place for dating, especially if you have the courage to talk to locals that you see in day to day life.

Greater challenges are around eating nutritiously. I think Filipino food is underrated for its deliciousness but it's definitely not healthy. To better understand the Greenbelt area, it's a series of Malls (Greenbelt, Ayala, Glorietta, and some other mall). Collectively there would have to be upwards of 200 restaurants, so I'm sure there's a healthy option in there somewhere, just need to find it.

It's true that there's not a lot to do in the city outside of nightlife. And the infrastructure makes it a headache to get around. That's why I recommend staying in this part of town. In this part of Makati you can just walk everywhere. I've heard good things about BGC but have never visited.
Really bad city to live and to visit unless you have money to live in BGC.
manila.description:
Manila has many experiences, mixing the busy feel of a big city with friendly local hospitality. In areas like BGC and Makati, you can find modern comforts and different types of international food, although some people may doubt the quality of the food. While many places have good options, dealing with traffic can be very frustrating, with some commutes taking hours.

Safety varies; some people feel safe in rich neighborhoods, while others warn about certain risky areas. The city is active, with interesting things to see, like nightlife, many coffee shops, and cultural sites. However, public transport is not good, and traffic leads many to use Grab services—just be ready for the rising costs.

Language should not be a problem since English is spoken widely. Visitors should stay in well-lit areas at night and pay attention to their belongings. It’s a city that encourages exploration but requires a mix of caution and openness to its unique features. So, whether you visit the busy malls or explore the streets, Manila is sure to offer a special adventure!
manila.description_kor:
마닐라는 크고 분주한 도시의 흥미진진한 분위기와 친절한 지역 주민들의 환대가 어우러진 특별한 경험을 제공합니다. BGC와 마카티 같은 지역에서는 현대적인 시설과 다양한 국제 요리를 즐길 수 있지만, 일부 사람들은 음식의 품질에 대해 의문을 제기하기도 합니다. 좋은 선택지가 많은 반면, 교통 체증은 꽤 무서울 수 있어서 출퇴근 시간이 길어질 수 있습니다.

안전 문제는 상이한데, 일부는 부유한 동네에서 안전하다고 느끼지만, 다른 이들은 특정 위험 지역에 대해 경고합니다. 이 도시는 활기차고 나이트라이프, 다양한 커피숍, 그리고 문화 명소 등 흥미로운 볼거리가 많습니다. 하지만 대중교통이 좋지 않아 교통 혼잡으로 인해 많은 사람들이 그랩 서비스를 이용하게 되니, 이 점도 고려해야 합니다.

영어가 널리 사용되기 때문에 언어 문제는 크게 걱정할 필요가 없습니다. 방문객들은 밤에는 잘 조명이 된 지역에 머무르며 소지품에 주의해야 합니다. 탐험을 장려하는 도시이지만, 마닐라의 독특한 매력을 느끼는 데에는 주의와 개방성이 필요합니다. 따라서 붐비는 쇼핑몰을 방문하든 거리를 탐방하든, 마닐라는 잊지 못할 특별한 모험을 선사할 것입니다!

reviews:
Marbella is probably the best place on the European mainland, warm and mild weather, big international community,(German, English, Scandinavian) fast and stable Internet, very relaxed about drugs and prostitution. It is the safest for female travellers, the police detains every man that verbally or fiscally abuses a woman. Prices go from 20€ a night to over 200€, that is why there are real successful digital nomads here, no "Tramps" with laptops. If you avoid the city centre and Puerto Banus but go to Elviria you have a perfect quiet workplace. 
Now there is a brand new flat bicycle path all along the beach from Capobino, Elviria, Center 8km to Puerto Banus but a car or a E-Bike is a plus as Andalucía is mountainous.

Beautiful place with some amazing people. Crisp clean beaches, natural wonders all over the countryside nearby, mountain views everywhere, the place oozes high quality and everything is just that. Everything. But this is no shoestring budget place, you could spend a lot of money there.

It looks like a safe place but it’s not. It has more than its share of crimes, and rude, bad tempered, obnoxious, and aggressively behaved people, oh and their always barking unruly vicious aggressive dogs with some of them not leashed.
marbella.description:
If you're looking for a sunny place on the European mainland, Marbella might be a good choice. Its warm and mild weather all year attracts a diverse international community, including people from Germany, England, and Scandinavia. The internet here is fast and reliable, which is helpful for those working remotely. You will find a variety of places to stay, from budget options to more expensive ones.

Walking along the clean beaches or biking along the new beach path from Capobino to Puerto Banus is recommended. While it’s a nice place with nature and mountain views, keep in mind that the cost of living can be high. Exploring areas like Elviria can provide a quieter option compared to the busy city center.

Safety is important here, especially for women, which makes it good for solo travelers. Just be aware of some local issues, like unruly dogs and occasional rude behavior. In short, Marbella has beauty and community, but you'll need to navigate its challenges!
marbella.description_kor:
유럽 본토에서 햇살이 좋은 장소를 찾고 계신다면, 마르베야를 추천드립니다. 이곳의 따뜻하고 온화한 날씨는 독일, 영국, 스칸디나비아 등 다양한 국제 커뮤니티를 불러모으고 있습니다. 마르베야는 빠르고 신뢰할 수 있는 인터넷 환경을 갖추고 있어 원격 근무를 하는 분들에게 특히 유용합니다. 예산에 따라 다양한 숙박 옵션이 있어 선택의 폭이 넓습니다.

깨끗한 해변을 따라 산책하거나, 카포비노에서 푸에르토 바누스로 이어지는 새로운 해변 자전거 도로를 즐기는 것도 좋은 방법입니다. 이곳은 자연과 아름다운 산 경치로 유명하지만, 생활비가 다소 높을 수 있다는 점은 유의해야 합니다. 엘비리아와 같은 지역을 탐험하면 번화한 도심과는 또 다른 조용한 매력을 발견할 수 있습니다.

여기서 안전은 특히 여성 여행자에게 중요하며, 혼자 여행하는 분들에게도 안전한 환경을 제공합니다. 그러나 무례한 행동이나 제멋대로 돌아다니는 개 등 일부 지역 문제에 주의하는 것이 좋습니다. 요약하자면, 마르베야는 아름다움과 커뮤니티가 매력적이지만, 그 안에서 해결해야 할 도전 과제도 있다는 점을 염두에 두시길 바랍니다!

reviews: Ask someone before visiting Marseille or you will end up in chaotic places. There are also some very beautiful places

It's a very cahotic city. The city center is very dirty and stinky and not pleasant at all. Old people are quite friendly and easy going, young people not so much. There is a lot of incivilities as well.

Marseille is a nice big city, with a strong identity (very different from the rest of the country even the south of France). I lived there 6 mounth (being french) there is a lot of things to do, you can find easily cheap things to buy or do, people are relaxed, cool, but it's not safe, a lot of violence in the streets. The beach is really nice, parks are big and beautiful, there are nice museums, beautiful churches to visit too. You can take a little boat to visit other cities. "Les calanques" is a nice place to visit.
marseille.description:
Marseille is a city full of life, but it can be a bit of an adventure—make sure to get some tips before you start exploring! It is known for its beautiful beaches and parks, but the city is not always tidy. The city center can be busy, with some areas looking dirty and feeling unsafe, especially at night. However, don't let that stop you!

Marseille has its own identity that makes it different from other parts of France, with friendly older locals who like to share stories and advice. The younger people might seem more distant, but once you get used to the place, you'll find many affordable activities and good food.

Be sure to visit “Les Calanques”—a lovely natural park. You can also take a boat to visit nearby towns. Don’t miss the local museums and beautiful churches. Public transportation is available, but be careful as it is not always dependable. Overall, embrace the busy atmosphere and you will find a city full of culture and experiences waiting for you!
marseille.description_kor:
마르세유는 활기 넘치는 도시지만 약간의 용기가 필요할 수 있습니다. 탐험을 시작하기 전에 몇 가지 팁을 챙겨보세요! 이 도시는 아름다운 해변과 공원으로 유명하지만 때때로 깨끗하지 않을 수 있습니다. 시내 중심가는 혼잡할 수 있고, 일부 지역은 다소 지저분해 보이며, 특히 밤에는 안전하게 느껴지지 않을 수도 있습니다. 그러나 그런 것에 좌절하지 마세요!

마르세유는 프랑스의 다른 지역과는 다른 독특한 매력을 가지고 있으며, 이야기를 나누고 조언을 주고받는 친절한 노인들이 많이 있습니다. 젊은 사람들은 처음에는 거리감을 느낄 수도 있지만, 이곳에 익숙해지면 다양한 저렴한 활동과 맛있는 음식을 발견할 수 있을 거예요.

“레 칼랑크(Les Calanques)”라는 멋진 자연 공원은 꼭 방문해보세요. 인근 도시를 가기 위해 배를 타는 것도 좋은 경험이 될 거예요. 지역 박물관과 아름다운 교회도 놓치지 마세요. 대중교통은 이용할 수 있지만 항상 믿을 만한 것은 아니니 주의가 필요합니다. 전반적으로, 바쁜 분위기를 즐기면 문화와 경험이 풍성한 도시를 만나게 될 것입니다!

reviews: Most people I speak to confirmed my belief that Marrakesh is a place to visit for a few days max. The excitement and chaos are novel for a short time, particularly in the old medina. Scams, expensive and tiresome. For sure Marrakech is something to experience, it really is a buzz, especially if you want to shop but within a couple of days I learned to avoid the medina as much as I could and within a week I was ready to leave. Plenty of excursions and day trips including Atlas mountains, Sahara, Essaouira and surrounding towns/villages to get you out of Marrakech but living staying a long time is too much.

Marrakesh has been one of my favorite places to visit. I spent 1 week there in October (2022). The temperature was cool and I could wear shorts or jeans throughout the day/night. We experienced 1 day of rain, but other than this time, it was pleasantly dry.
The town has many tourists, I met with many European visitors and some Americans. The locals are friendly and not pushy. The streets are quite clean and are maintained daily from what I see. I did not feel unsafe even as I walked alone at 11 pm. I only experienced positive behavior from the locals. My only issue was that I was charged tourist prices when purchasing items or riding the taxis at night (x5 the normal price), though I got better prices when I haggled and switched my speaking from English to Spanish.
The internet situation was a hit or miss. I was working from my laptop with video calls throughout the day, so fast and reliable internet was a must. My first AirBnB (located in the older North Medina area) had good reviews and was within walking distance to all places of interest, however, had very slow and unreliable internet. I had to switch airBnBs during my stay and was able to find a very good place with fast and reliable internet (in the West Medina area with a fiber connection). If continuous/fast/reliable internet is important to you, I'd suggest researching a bit before choosing your stay and maybe even contacting the owner beforehand.
As for food, we had some fantastic meals in the Medina area. Yelp and google reviews helped, but we found many restaurants not advertised in either of those two options and ended up just gauging the locales as we passed by them.
Last, we were happy with the budget we set for this trip. Marrakesh was very affordable for us. Will be back!

I'm currently in Marrakesh and been here for a month. I would definitely recommend visiting but not during summer as it can get really hot. My first day here it was 42 degrees and really dry. It has gotten better so I would say visit around August or later. Marrakesh is lovely but very touristy and I can only imagine how things were pre-pandemic. Since it is very touristy, locals are more lenient when it comes to what you choose to wear which helps a lot when it's really hot. Obviously, you still have to be very respectful of the culture and their customs and you should dress modestly when going to souks. I've heard a lot of stories from people about getting scammed or the place being dangerous to women especially but I feel and have found that it is as dangerous as any other place or country if you're not careful. I don't really tend to go out late at night anyway but if I do go out, I'm always with other people just in case. French is the main language but most people can understand a bit of English so you won't really have any problems communicating. Google translate helps as well. I would recommend going to Medina and walk around the old town. Go to Jemaa el-Fna at least once just to experience it. The YSL musee is cool as well as the Jardin Majorelle. Tons of cheap riads around Medina as well so definitely stay in one for a couple of nights. I would recommend staying in and around Gueliz if you're staying for longer than a week. It's a great area and you'll find everything you need in the center. I'm off to Tanger in a few days but I will definitely be back in Kesh in a few months when it's a bit colder and maybe camp in the desert! Oh and lastly, the internet was pretty bad in the airbnb that I stayed in so I found myself having to use my data most of the time.

Marrakesh December 2018. An amazing city with contrasts, modern and age-old wonders everywhere you look. Stayed near the main medina (pictured above) and that was a good location to see everything. Internet was good, and my tunnel service functioned fine. Weather is variable at this time of year... as a Canadian I had breakfast on a rooftop terrace at +1C and thought it was absolutely fine, but it also hit +27C later that day... dress in layers. Walk like you know where you are going and you'll be fine... the place is full of tourists (this was pre-covid). People are trying to make a living and will try to hustle you- don't be intimidated, just keep on moving. Prices for eating out were reasonable, and I was pretty careful about water consumption. My traveling companion got one bad meal from a streetside vendor (and a night in the toilet), but it didn't happen to me, so just be aware. Bank machines from major banks gave good exchange rates, just be aware of your surroundings as you use them. Got my laundry done for the equivalent of $2USD, which was a good deal (and they literally pressed the socks and underwear, too). If you know French you have it made here, some know English, too. See the Yves St. Lauren Museum, just check the times and days before you go. the food is amazing and varies (don't gert stuck eating Tagine every day). Alcohol is strictly controlled- package stores are few and you will need your passport to buy it. I will be back to Marrakesh, for sure... but I was here in December and I hear its REALLY HOT in the summer, so be aware.
marrakesh.description:
Marrakesh is a busy city full of life, colors, and many things to do. Many visitors find it a great place for a few days of fun. The old medina is a confusing area where you can experience the hustle and bustle, but be aware of some tourist traps and bargaining. Most travelers like the friendly locals, who are usually helpful rather than pushy, which is good for anyone walking through the busy streets.

While the cost of living is fairly low, be careful with taxi prices, especially at night. If you are staying longer, neighborhoods like Gueliz have a more relaxed atmosphere with everything you need nearby. For those who need internet, it's a good idea to check the rental’s connection before you arrive.

There are many cultural experiences to enjoy, from the famous Jemaa el-Fna square to the beautiful Jardin Majorelle. Just remember to show respect for local customs! If you plan to visit in summer, be ready for the heat—it is more enjoyable when it is cooler. So, pack your bags and get ready for a Marrakesh trip—it is a city you will remember!
marrakesh.description_kor:
마라케시는 삶과 색깔이 넘치는 붐비는 도시로, 즐길 거리가 많습니다. 많은 방문객들은 며칠 동안 즐력을 만끽하기에 적합한 장소라고 여깁니다. 오래된 메디나는 혼잡한 지역이지만, 그 속에서 살아있는 활기를 진정으로 느낄 수 있습니다. 다만, 일부 관광지에서는 함정에 빠지거나 가격 흥정에 주의해야 합니다. 대부분의 여행자들은 친절한 현지인을 좋아하는데, 그들은 보통 강압적이지 않고 필요할 때는 언제든 도움을 줍니다. 이는 참고 지나가는 모든 이들에게 좋은 일이죠.

비교적 저렴한 생활비를 자랑하지만, 특히 밤에는 택시 요금에 신경을 써야 합니다. 더 오래 머무를 계획이라면 겔리스 같은 지역이 편리하고 느긋한 분위기를 제공합니다. 인터넷이 필요하다면, 도착 전에 렌탈의 인터넷 상태를 미리 확인하는 것이 좋습니다.

유명한 제마 엘 프나 광장에서 시작해 아름다운 마조렐 정원까지, 다양한 문화 체험을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 현지 관습에 대한 존중을 잊지 마세요! 여름에 방문할 계획이라면 더위에 대비하는 것도 잊지 마시고요. 시원할 때 더 즐거운 여행이 될 수 있습니다. 이제 가방을 싸고 마라케시 여행을 준비하세요. 잊지 못할 도시가 될 것입니다!

reviews:
Have been in Weligama since Feb 25th and now I'm still here with the COVID-19 curfew going on. Before the curfew starts I was eager to get out of here because 1) it's too hot mid-day 2) tuktuk drivers are waiting around every corner asking "tuktuk?" and always horn at you when you're walking by the street - super annoying and 3) it's difficult to find workable wifi 4) everything just seemed super slow and it was hard to be productive. 
But after the curfew starts I actually like it way better because 1) the traffic noise dies and 2) I found myself a place with good wifi right next to the beach. The locals (besides pushy tuktuk drivers) are very friendly though often times their English is too limited to understand you but they still pretend they understand just to be "helpful". It's also a great place for learning to surf (I made some real improvement with my skills). 
The nomad cost is not accurate here. Expect similar or slighter lower cost than Chiang Mai, unless you're eating veggie rice and curry every day. 
In summary it can be good for living and working if you spend the time to find a place with good wifi or get your own boardband.


matara.description:
Matara is a coastal city in Sri Lanka that has a mix of culture and beaches. Visitors appreciate the relaxed atmosphere here. Whether you want to learn to surf or enjoy local cafes, Matara is likely to make a good impression. The local people are friendly and willing to help, though you may face some language difficulties.

The city has some interesting aspects, like the active tuktuk drivers and the warm weather. Life here is slow-paced, which some may find appealing. If you can manage the heat and noise, the calm beaches provide a nice retreat after a busy day. The cost of living is generally low unless you eat out regularly.

Finding good WiFi can be difficult, so look for places to work or simply enjoy the scenery. Staying near the beach is a good choice, and try to respect local traditions. Just be patient and take the time to explore what this city offers!
matara.description_kor:
마타르는 문화와 해변이 어우러진 스리랑카의 해안 도시입니다. 방문객들은 이곳의 여유로운 분위기를 만끽할 수 있습니다. 서핑을 배우고 싶거나 현지 카페에서 시간을 보내고 싶다면, 마타르는 정말 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다. 지역 주민들은 매우 친절하며 도움을 주고 싶어하지만, 가끔은 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있습니다.

이 도시에서는 활기찬 투투크 운전사들과 따뜻한 날씨 등 다양한 매력을 느낄 수 있습니다. 마타르의 삶은 느긋하게 흐르는 편인데, 어떤 이들에게는 그 점이 아주 매력적으로 다가올 수 있습니다. 더위와 소음을 감내할 수 있다면, 조용한 해변에서 바쁜 하루를 마무리하며 편안한 시간을 가질 수 있습니다. 외식을 자주 하지 않는다면, 생활비는 대체로 저렴한 편입니다.

좋은 WiFi를 찾는 것이 다소 어려울 수 있으니, 작업할 수 있는 장소나 단순히 경치를 즐길 수 있는 곳을 미리 찾아보는 것이 좋습니다. 해변 근처에 머무는 것은 좋은 선택이 될 것이며, 지역 전통을 존중하는 것도 잊지 마세요. 인내심을 가지고 이 도시가 제공하는 다양한 것들을 탐험할 시간을 가지시길 바랍니다!

reviews:
My home away from home.. I lived in McLeod for 22 yrs I spent the best yrs of my life there I made True Family Friends.. 
I was lead there.....
I lived, I fell in love, I did business yes I have a business visa.. and enjoyed my life for 22 yrs there.... in the morning after my morning prayer i would simply look outside at the sky are there clouds? if yes I was not doing my washing... then the day just happend moment by moment..... what enjoyment,,, on my way back in Feb 2022 see all of you soon
 Pina
mcleod-ganj.description:
Located in the Himalayas, McLeod Ganj feels like a special place. Many visitors feel a strong connection and see it as a second home. You often hear about new friendships and connections that feel like family. The mornings here are peaceful; after prayer, you can enjoy the beautiful mountain views as the day starts slowly.

While McLeod Ganj is nice, it has its own issues. The cost of living can be higher than in other parts of India, and public transport is not very good, so walking is usually the best way to get around. It is also a mix of cultures, but there may be language problems, so being patient is helpful.

Be sure to visit the local monasteries and experience the lively Tibetan culture that is important to this town. If you like adventure, trekking in the nearby mountains is a great option. Just remember to accept the slower pace of life—it’s a big part of being in McLeod Ganj!
mcleod-ganj.description_kor:
히말라야에 위치한 맥클레오 간지는 정말 특별한 곳처럼 느껴집니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳에서 강한 유대감을 느끼고, 제2의 고향으로 여깁니다. 가족 같은 새로운 우정과 뜻 깊은 인연에 대한 이야기를 자주 듣곤 합니다. 이곳의 아침은 평화롭고, 기도를 마친 후 천천히 시작되는 하루를 맞이하며 아름다운 산의 전경을 감상할 수 있습니다.

맥클레오 간지는 멋진 곳이지만 고유한 문제들도 있습니다. 생활비가 다른 인도 지역보다 다소 높은 편이고, 대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있지 않아 보통 걷는 것이 이동하기에 가장 좋은 방법입니다. 다양한 문화가 혼합되어 있지만, 언어 장벽으로 인해 어려움을 겪을 수 있으니 인내심을 가지는 것이 좋습니다.

이 지역의 수도원은 꼭 방문해 보시고, 이 마을의 활기찬 티베트 문화를 체험해 보세요. 모험을 좋아하신다면 근처 산에서의 트레킹도 환상적인 선택입니다. 느린 삶의 속도를 받아들이는 것을 잊지 마세요—그것이 맥클레오 간지에서의 큰 즐거움이니까요!

reviews: Ahhh Medan. This little jewel in the rough is a place to get away from it all. No foreigners, just you. Maybe 10% speak English. Still, prices are good. I walked into a 5 star hotel, stayed 3 days at the regular rate, then negotiated a rate for 30 days... 5 star perks for $29USD a night. I've been here 2 months now. If you're a fan of Art Deco or Art Moderne, this place is great. The city is beginning a modernization process... slowly... just slowly enough. There are 4-5 huge shopping malls (and a couple of dead ones :). The food choices are wide and varied. The core of historic Chinatown, in Kesawan district, is quite the place to shop or eat- there's food, fabric, motorcycles, musical instruments, sports equipment, cell phones (an entire mall for just cell phones). Medan has a LOT of coffee shops, from little carts on the sidewalk to hipster joints in refurbished buildings (and Starbucks). Like the song by 'Missing Persons' says, "Nobody Walks in Medan". The scooter and motorcycle rule the road here. Watch where you are walking (sidewalks are a bit rough). Brastagi is the fancy grocery store. Indiatown is wonderful and the restaurant Cahaya Baru is the best Indian food since... well... India. The area was settled by Local Aboriginal Natives, Chinese, and Indians, and there is a great cultural mix with a lot of tolerance today, especially as time moves on from those dark days of the late 1990's Indonesia... out with the old, in with the new...Young people just wanna have fun now. Mosques, temples (Indian, Buddhist, Confucian), churches... Medan really is the most culturally diverse spot in Indonesia. If you want to get off the tourist grid, really off, try Indonesia's 4th largest city. Did I mention the active volcano?
medan.description:
Medan is a city in Indonesia that offers a unique experience away from the typical tourist spots. It feels like a place where you can explore without the large crowds. Only about 10% of people speak English, but the friendly locals are willing to help you, especially if you are looking for good food. 

When it comes to food, there are many options. You can find busy streets in the historic Chinatown area and try tasty Indian dishes at places like Cahaya Baru. The cost of living is quite low; you can stay at a 5-star hotel for just $29 a night if you look around. Also, there are many coffee shops to visit, from small street vendors to modern cafes. Just be careful while walking, as the sidewalks can be uneven, and watch out for the many scooters on the streets.

Medan is becoming more modern, with new shopping malls and a lively art scene. The city has a rich mix of cultures, showing influences from its Aboriginal, Chinese, and Indian backgrounds. If you want to experience different cultures, enjoy great food, and have a relaxed atmosphere, Medan could be a good option for you.
medan.description_kor:
메단은 인도네시아의 도시로, 전형적인 관광지와는 다른 독특한 경험을 제공합니다. 인파가 적어 한적한 곳을 탐험할 수 있는 즐거움이 있습니다. 약 10% 정도의 사람들이 영어를 할 수 있지만, 친절한 현지인들이 도움을 주고 싶어 하니, 특히 맛있는 음식을 찾고 있다면 걱정할 필요가 없습니다.

음식에 관해서는 다양한 선택지가 있습니다. 역사적인 차이나타운 지역의 북적거리는 거리에서 여러 음식을 즐길 수 있으며, Cahaya Baru와 같은 곳에서는 맛있는 인도 요리를 맛볼 수 있습니다. 생활비는 매우 저렴해서, 주위를 둘러보면 5성급 호텔에 하루 $29에 묵을 수 있습니다. 또한, 아기자기한 노점상부터 세련된 카페까지 다양한 커피숍도 많습니다. 단, 보도가 울퉁불퉁해서 걷는 동안 조심해야 하고, 거리의 많은 스쿠터들에도 주의가 필요합니다.

메단은 새로운 쇼핑몰과 활기찬 예술 현장 덕분에 점점 현대화되고 있습니다. 이 도시는 원주민, 중국, 인도 문화가 어우러져 풍부한 문화적 배경을 보여줍니다. 다양한 문화를 경험하고 훌륭한 음식을 즐기며 편안한 분위기를 원하신다면, 메단이 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다.

reviews: When you've lived in LA, you take for granted the access to coffee shops with seating, parking, wifi, AND outlets. You can nomad in Memphis without needing to pay for a coworking space, which they don't have much of anyway, probably for this reason in part.
memphis.description:
Memphis is a city with its own charm and character. If you have lived in larger cities, you might like the relaxing atmosphere here. It is easy to find comfortable coffee shops where you can sit with your laptop, thanks to many seats, good parking, and power outlets. The cost of living is usually lower than in bigger cities, which means you can manage your budget while enjoying what the city offers.

However, Memphis has some challenges. Public transportation is not very extensive, so you may want to think about having a car or plan your trips well. Safety can be a concern in some areas, so it is a good idea to research neighborhoods before you visit.

Make sure to check out popular places like Beale Street, known for its live music, or Graceland, the home of Elvis Presley. Enjoy the local culture, try some famous BBQ, and meet friendly locals. Just remember to be aware of your surroundings and have a good time!
memphis.description_kor:
멤피스는 독특한 매력과 개성을 가진 도시입니다. 대도시에 살았던 경험이 있다면 이곳의 아늑한 분위기가 마음에 드실 거예요. 넉넉한 좌석, 편리한 주차 공간, 그리고 전원 콘센트 덕분에 편안하게 노트북을 켜고 시간을 보낼 수 있는 카페를 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 생활비도 대도시에 비해 상대적으로 저렴해서, 도시가 제공하는 다양한 즐거움을 누리면서 예산도 잘 관리할 수 있습니다.

하지만 멤피스에는 몇 가지 도전 과제가 있습니다. 대중교통이 꼭 넉넉하지는 않아서 자동차를 가지고 다니거나 미리 여행 계획을 세우는 것이 좋습니다. 일부 지역에서는 안전이 우려될 수 있으니, 방문 전에 해당 동네에 대한 정보를 조사하는 것이 현명합니다.

비욜 스트리트와 같은 라이브 음악으로 유명한 인기 장소나, 엘비스 프레슬리의 집인 그레이슬랜드도 꼭 가보세요. 지역 문화를 만끽하고 유명한 바베큐를 맛보며, 친절한 지역 주민들을 만나는 것도 잊지 마세요. 주변을 잘 살피고, 즐거운 시간을 보내시길 바랍니다!

reviews:
Melbourne is a fun and cute compact city. There are so many fun things to do here such as visit is beaches, go to its theme parks out of the CBD area. Its city CBD is so much fun as well. You can visit the Queen Victoria market which is the largest outdoors market in the world! You can also visit Federation Square which is a beautiful park on the edge of the CBD, and you can visit the Eureka Skydeck and Australia 108 which are the tallest buildings in Australia if you exclude the antenna from the Gold Coast's Q1 tower. If you are into surfing, there are surf beaches about a 1-2 hour drive out of the Melbourne area at the nearest.
Melbourne is a really good city to reside in if you like fun, but of course it does come with a cost. Melbourne is the 6th most expensive city in the world according to recent reports.
Overall, an awesome city
Not cheap, but you get what you're paying for. Really nice, comfortable city, not too dirty or crowded, awesome food, and lots to do
Expensive, but possibly the most amazing city on earth.

Nomaded here for 2 weeks in September 2018. It was really good! It's definitely not cheap (on par with Singapore/Paris/etc), but it has everything needed for nomads: coworking spaces, 4g, lots of cafes with good wifi. The food is really good, there are many things to do. I didn't have any issues with my Ru debit card anywhere. I'd say it's a good destination.
melbourne.description:
If you’re looking for a city with a lot to offer, you should consider Melbourne. This active and small city has many fun activities, including its nice beaches, theme parks, and busy central business district. Be sure to check out the Queen Victoria Market, which is the biggest outdoor market in the world. Federation Square is also a good place to visit with its green areas, and for a high view, don’t miss the Eureka Skydeck or Australia 108, the tallest buildings in the country.

Living in Melbourne is nice, but it can be expensive, making it one of the costliest cities globally. Many people believe that the quality of food and activities makes it worth the cost. Just keep in mind that public transport can be limited in some parts of the city.

For visitors, the city is safe and friendly. It’s helpful to know local customs and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. Overall, Melbourne might be a bit pricey, but its appeal and variety make it a good choice for both visitors and residents!
melbourne.description_kor:
멜버른은 다양한 즐길 거리를 찾아보는 여행객에게 추천할 만한 도시입니다. 이 활기차고 아기자기한 도시는 멋진 해변, 테마파크, 및 번화한 중심가에서 많은 재미있는 활동을 제공합니다. 세계에서 가장 큰 야외 시장인 퀸 빅토리아 마켓은 반드시 방문해봐야 할 곳입니다. 또한, 페더레이션 스퀘어는 녹지 공간이 있어 여유롭게 시간을 보내기 좋은 장소이고, 호주에서 가장 높은 건물인 유레카 스카이덱과 호주 108에서 멋진 전망을 내려다보는 것도 놓치지 마세요.

멜버른에서의 생활은 매력적이지만, 생활비가 다소 비쌀 수 있어 세계에서 가장 비싼 도시 중 하나로 알려져 있습니다. 많은 사람들은 음식과 다양한 활동의 질이 이 비용을 충분히 가치 있게 만든다고 이야기합니다. 그러나 일부 지역에서는 대중교통이 제한될 수 있다는 점도 기억하세요.

관광객으로서 이 도시는 안전하고 친근한 느낌을 줍니다. 현지의 관습을 알고 있는 것이 유용하며, 느긋한 분위기를 만끽하는 것도 좋습니다. 전반적으로 멜버른은 가격대가 조금 높을 수 있지만, 그 매력과 다양한 경험 덕분에 방문객과 주민 모두에게 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews: Safe, because it's basically a police state. Two cop cars on every block. After you've done the tourist stuff there really isn't much to do. Almost no nightlife center, flat, no parks, and I have to say it's a very boring city. If you just need a place that is cheaper than Playa Del Carmen and want to rent a house to hole up and work, then Merida might be for you. Personally after a week I found it very boring.

I've stayed in Merida for about 1 month during winter. I really enjoyed the Merida fest which take place during the month of January.
I felt very safe in this city and people are very friendly. There are plenty of cafes in Centro where you can work and the internet is quite good. Overall, it's a great place to be and I would see myself stay for a long time.

I've stayed in Merida for about 10 weeks now. It's a cute sleepy city with a good amount of restaurants and museums/history if you're into that sort of stuff. I cannot speak about the nightlife because I'm here during Covid times and the lockdown is real. The city is flat as a pancake, so if you're into cycling, this is a great city for you. The heat in this city is oppressive starting in March through the end of October. I've asked many locals why they come here and their number one response is safety, this is one of the "sleepy" cities which is where the families of the cartels live and so they've made a pact that no crime will happen here.

I've stayed in Merida about 5 months. Its okay. There is not much to do here other than go to visit ancient Mayan ruins, cenotes, restaurants and a few cantinas. Its a huge police presence and its really safe here. The nightlife is not good here. I would not recommend renting here because they want you to pay your entire lease upfront if you don't have a Mexican who owns property to co-sign for you. Most of the people here are nice. Many of them speak English but won't speak it because they're afraid they wont speak it correctly. Most of the restaurants mainly serve the local Mayan cuisine here but there are other options but it will get expensive. Some of the best food I've had is in Centro but there are many good options around the city. The beach is not far away. Its about a 45 minute drive by Uber or Didi that costs about $130 to $180 pesos. Sundays are quite slowed down here. If you are looking for a slower small town pace, Merida may be the place for you. Otherwise, there is nothing exciting about this place other than the safety here. Its really safe here.

Merida is a great place to work from with lots of people and many whom speak English, in fact I've been back i liked it so much. Rentals are very affordable, some of the cheapest in Mexico, but of course the cheaper it is the area isn't the best. There is much to do here, from heading to the Gulf of Mexico about an hour away, to visiting the ruins. Many, many places to eat and cuisines from around the world and for those who miss shopping at Costco no need to fear one is close by. Drive to Progreso and watch flamingos.
