Some say it's not safe here but I never had any difficulties and never felt threatened. Transportation is not a problem and is fairly cheap and plentiful
merida.description:
Mérida is located in Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula. It offers culture, safety, and low costs. It is a small city known for being family-friendly, with a strong police presence that helps people feel safe, which many locals and visitors like. If you enjoy history, you will appreciate the Mayan heritage and nearby ancient ruins. The local people are friendly and often speak English. Some may avoid using it because they worry about their accents.

Mérida is seen as a calm place with many cafes and restaurants that serve Mayan food, but some visitors say there are not many activities or nightlife after dark. If you like cycling, the flat ground is great! The Gulf beaches and cenotes are also nearby for a fun day out. Just remember that it can get very hot in the summer.

Rentals are cheap, which is good for remote work. However, some rental agreements can be difficult without someone local to help. Overall, if you want a slower pace, friendly people, and a safe place to live or visit, Mérida might be a good choice for you!
merida.description_kor:
메리다(Mérida)는 멕시코 유카탄 반도에 위치한 도시로, 문화와 안전, 그리고 저렴한 생활비를 제공합니다. 이곳은 가족 친화적인 작은 도시로 유명하며, 강력한 경찰 배치 덕분에 사람들이 안전하다고 느낄 수 있습니다. 그래서 현지인과 방문객 모두에게 인기가 높습니다. 역사에 관심이 있다면 마야 유산과 근처의 고대 유적지를 탐방할 수 있는 좋은 기회가 될 것입니다. 현지 사람들은 친절하며 대체로 영어를 구사하지만, 일부는 억양 때문에 영어 사용을 주저할 수 있습니다.

메리다는 아늑한 카페와 마야 음식을 제공하는 레스토랑이 많아 편안한 분위기를 자아냅니다. 그러나 일부 방문객들은 야경이나 저녁 활동이 부족하다고 느낄 수 있습니다. 자전거를 즐기는 분들에게는 평탄한 지형이 매력적입니다. 또한 멕시코 만의 해변과 세노테가 가까워 하루를 즐겁게 보낼 수 있는 기회가 많습니다. 여름에는 날씨가 매우 덥다는 점만 유념하세요.

임대료도 저렴해 원격 근무를 하기에 적합하지만, 현지에서 도움을 줄 사람이 없으면 일부 임대 계약이 어려울 수 있습니다. 전반적으로, 느린 생활 속도와 친절한 사람들, 그리고 안전한 환경에서 살거나 여행하고 싶다면 메리다는 충분히 매력적인 선택이 될 수 있습니다!

reviews:
Spent a month in Belarus this July - we have some good friends there we work with so it was an excellent time. Some good restaurants. People are extremely friendly, just gotta adapt to the culture a bit. Most seemed to be very interested in the fact that I was American. Felt kind of like the country is just starting to open up and it will be of more international interest in the upcoming 5 - 10 years. English is spoken in Minsk but probably less then in ukraine (my only other former soviet point of comparison). 

For entertainment, there's not much going on during the week but Zbitskaya street friday and saturday has bars overflowing into the streets during the summer time. It was a bit more expensive then I was expecting but I didn't really try to hustle for the best apartment rates. 

There's a bit of bureaucracy when it comes to renting an apartment, as a foreigner on a visa I had to notify the government of my whereabouts. I changed apartments and this resulted in me, my friend (who speaks russian) and the new landlord having to spend half a day at a government office updating them. I believe hotels can manage all this in the background for you so if I were to go back I would just get a hotel for the whole stay.
last year this time it was around 650$. now it says monthly costs are more than 1000$. does it worth it? don't think so.
minsk.description:
Minsk has friendly people and a rich culture that is worth exploring. Visitors often talk about how welcoming the Belarusians are, as they are interested in newcomers. There are many good restaurants throughout the city, especially busy on weekends when places like Zbitskaya street are filled with bars.

However, be ready for a mix of experiences. While Minsk is slowly opening up to international visitors, you may encounter some language difficulties, as English is not spoken as widely as in some nearby countries. If you plan to stay longer, remember that the cost of living can be higher than you might expect, with monthly rents going over $1,000.

On a practical note, renting can involve some paperwork, especially for foreigners—be prepared to spend a few hours at government offices if you are moving. To make things easier, booking a hotel for your entire stay is a good idea. Overall, Minsk is a nice city that shows both its traditions and a look at the future, making it an interesting place to visit!
minsk.description_kor:
민스크에는 친절한 사람들이 많고 탐험할 만한 풍부한 문화가 있습니다. 방문객들은 벨라루스 사람들이 신입 방문자를 환영하고, 큰 관심을 가져준다고 자주 이야기합니다. 도심에는 훌륭한 레스토랑이 많이 있으며, 특히 주말에는 Zbitskaya 거리와 같은 곳에서 바들이 북적입니다.

하지만 다양한 경험을 준비하는 것이 중요합니다. 민스크가 국제 방문객들에게 서서히 문을 열고는 있지만, 영어가 주변국들처럼 널리 사용되지 않기 때문에 언어적인 장벽을 느낄 수 있습니다. 장기간 체류할 계획이라면 월세가 예상보다 비쌀 수 있으니 유의해야 하며, 월세가 $1,000를 넘길 수도 있습니다.

실용적인 측면에서 외국인에게는 임대 계약이 다소 복잡할 수 있으며, 이사할 경우 정부 사무소에서 몇 시간을 보내야 할 수도 있습니다. 이를 간편하게 해결하려면 전체 체류 기간 동안 호텔을 예약하는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로 민스크는 전통과 미래가 조화를 이루는 멋진 도시로, 꼭 한번 방문할 만한 흥미로운 곳입니다!

reviews: I have worked remotely from Minca for the last 4 years and can attest that there are a few good spots with a reliable internet connection! The place is a paradise to work from, as the natural beauty of the mountain inspires, relaxes, and connects! I would suggest searching on AirBnB for houses with good WiFi or check the local ex-pat in santa marta page for tips!

This odd post on Minca makes me question the validity of any list on this site, which would be easily apparent to anyone who has been to Minca. The cost of living ($4,000+ USD) is based on if you paid per night at one of the fanciest hotels in Minca. Minca is a small, out in the middle of nowhere place that has a collection of hostels advertising yoga retreats, nature, horse rides, partying, etc. along with some hotels. Locals who own homes in Minca either live there and make a living off of farming or the tourist industry, or they use the country home as an escape from city life. Thus, there probably are not many Airbnbs or apartments for rent in Minca, and the Internet connection is probably either not great or not existent (I remember the hostel had a generator which would kick on during power outages). It's more a place you travel to if you are in the area of Santa Marta.
minca.description:
Located in the mountains of Colombia, Minca is a quiet place for those looking for peace and nature. This small town is good for a break, with nice views, waterfalls, and hiking paths that let you enjoy the outdoors. Many visitors find the surroundings motivating for remote work—just find a comfy place with good WiFi!

However, keep in mind that Minca is not like a busy city; it's more relaxed and simple. The cost of living can change a lot based on your choices, but if you stay in local hostels, prices are much lower than in fancy hotels. Food is usually cheap and tasty, great for those who enjoy local dishes.

While it's a nice escape, public transport is limited, so renting a bike or taking a slow walk is often the best way to get around. Minca is a friendly place that feels like it has not changed much over time, but you may need to be patient with internet issues and language barriers. Bring your spirit of adventure and enjoy all the local traditions and beauty this nice place has to offer!
minca.description_kor:
콜롬비아의 산속에 자리잡은 민카는 평화와 자연을 찾는 이들에게 안성맞춤인 조용한 마을입니다. 이 작은 마을은 멋진 경치, 폭포, 그리고 하이킹을 즐길 수 있는 다양한 코스들로 휴식하기에 그만입니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳의 평온한 분위기가 원격 근무에 적합하다고 느끼며, 편안한 장소에서 좋은 WiFi를 이용할 수 있습니다.

하지만 민카는 바쁜 도시와는 달리 느긋하고 단순한 삶의 방식을 제공합니다. 생활비는 개인의 선택에 따라 차이가 있을 수 있지만, 현지 호스텔에 묵으면 고급 호텔보다 훨씬 경제적입니다. 음식 또한 보통 저렴하고 맛있어서, 현지 요리를 즐기는 이들에게 매우 만족스러운 경험이 될 것입니다.

민카는 좋은 여행지이긴 하지만 대중교통이 제한적이니 자전거를 빌리거나 천천히 걸으며 마을을 탐방하는 것이 최선의 방법입니다. 이곳은 오랜 시간 변화가 없는 듯한 따뜻한 분위기를 가지며, 인터넷 문제나 언어 장벽에 대해 인내심을 가져야 할 수도 있습니다. 모험심을 가지고 이 아름다운 장소가 선사하는 지역 전통과 경치를 만끽해 보세요!

reviews: I've been living in the Twin Cities (Saint Paul to be exact but I'm often in Mpls too) for about 8 months now. It really is a hidden gem in North America. Possibly one of the last major metropolitan areas in the US where housing is still relatively affordable if you have a good job. Lots of music venues and outdoorsy culture. It's colder than you can even imagine in the winter but that's a fun experience. Shoulder seasons are short, and summer is hot and muggy. Good food.
minneapolis.description:
Minneapolis is often called a hidden gem in North America, and this is true! With its active music scene and outdoor activities, there is always something to do. You can see a live show at one of the many venues, or spend a sunny day at one of the city's parks or lakes. One good thing is that the cost of living is still quite reasonable compared to other large cities, especially if you have a steady job.

However, be ready for very cold winters; it can get colder than you might think! While summers are hot and humid, the lively atmosphere makes up for it.

Getting around can be difficult as public transportation is not very extensive, so having a car might make things easier. Don't forget to try the local food, which has become quite popular. Whether you’re exploring neighborhoods or enjoying the art scene, you will see that Minneapolis has its own charm. Just remember to dress warmly in winter and enjoy your time!
minneapolis.description_kor:
미니애폴리스는 종종 북미의 숨겨진 보석으로 불리며, 그 명성에 걸맞은 곳입니다! 이곳은 활발한 음악 공연과 다양한 야외 활동 덕분에 항상 즐길 거리가 넘치는 곳입니다. 여러 공연장 중 하나에서 라이브 쇼를 관람하거나, 도시의 아름다운 공원이나 호수에서 맑은 날을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 게다가 다른 대도시에 비해 생활비가 꽤 합리적이어서, 특히 안정된 직장에 있다면 더욱 부담 없이 지낼 수 있습니다.

하지만 미니애폴리스의 겨울은 정말 춥다는 점을 명심해야 합니다. 예상보다 더 차가울 수 있으니, 철저히 대비하는 것이 좋습니다! 여름은 덥고 습할 수 있지만, 그 분위기 덕분에 많은 이들이 여름을 즐깁니다.

이 도시의 대중교통은 다소 불편할 수 있어서, 차를 소유하면 이동하기 더 수월합니다. 또한, 지역 음식도 꼭 맛보시길 추천드립니다. 동네를 탐방하든 예술을 즐기든, 미니애폴리스에서는 그 고유의 매력을 만끽할 수 있을 것입니다. 겨울철에는 따뜻하게 입는 것을 잊지 마시고, 멋진 경험을 누리시길 바랍니다!

reviews:
From the Ashes rises a new City.
Invest in Mogadishu for the future lies in the horn of Africa. God was basically preserving for 30 years.
Mogadishu is a really fun place to live. Very exciting. Only lost two close friends last year.
mogadishu.description:
Mogadishu is a city that has faced many difficulties but is now improving. It has a special atmosphere that is noticeable. The feeling here is full of hope and new beginnings. People often talk about the joy of living in this busy city, which has a vibrant culture with music, art, and good food.

Like any city, there are challenges. While it is growing, some people say there are still safety issues. It is good to be aware of your surroundings and stick to areas recommended by locals. Public transport can be limited, so you might want to learn about local taxi options.

When you visit Mogadishu, be sure to see the beautiful beaches and the rich history, which you can notice in the buildings and local traditions. The neighborhoods are welcoming, but knowing a bit of the local language and culture can help. If you are looking for an adventure in a city that shows strength and kindness, Mogadishu could be a great place for you!
mogadishu.description_kor:
모가디슈는 많은 어려움을 겪어왔지만 현재 점차 개선되고 있는 도시입니다. 이곳에는 특별한 분위기가 감돕니다. 희망과 새로운 시작에 대한 감정이 가득하죠. 많은 사람들은 이 분주한 도시에서 음악, 예술, 맛있는 음식과 함께 살아가는 즐거움에 대해 이야기하곤 합니다.

모든 도시가 그렇듯, 이곳에도 도전 과제가 존재합니다. 발전하고 있는 중에도 여전히 안전 문제에 대한 우려의 목소리가 있습니다. 그러므로 주변을 잘 살펴보고 현지인들이 추천하는 곳에 머무는 것이 좋습니다. 대중 교통이 제한적일 수 있으니, 현지 택시 옵션에 대해 알아보는 것도 필요합니다.

모가디슈를 방문한다면 아름다운 해변과 독특한 건축물, 그리고 지역 전통에서 느낄 수 있는 풍부한 역사도 꼭 경험해보세요. 사람들은 매우 환영스럽지만, 현지 언어와 문화에 대한 기본적인 이해가 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 힘과 친절이 넘치는 이 도시에서 모험을 찾고 있다면, 모가디슈는 당신에게 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews: Mombasa proper is more popular with retirees than nomads, but Kilifi (~2 hours drive north, not listed here) is a bit of an emerging spot for African nomads, with a couple of nomad-friendly guesthouses (Distant Relatives, Salty's). It's party central over Christmas + NYE if that's your scene, otherwise quite chill and popular for kitesurfers too.
I enjoyed the beaches in Diani, Kilifi, and Watamu. However, Mombasa island is not a very enjoyable place to be and I would recommend only staying there the night before an early departure.
mombasa.description:
Mombasa is a lively coastal city that has both relaxation and adventure. It is known for its beautiful beaches, like Diani, Kilifi, and Watamu, which are popular spots for kitesurfers and sunbathers. The city becomes very active during Christmas and New Year’s, turning into a party place that many people enjoy if they want to have fun during the holidays.

However, Mombasa can be a bit mixed. While some people enjoy it, those looking for a more wandering lifestyle might not feel as comfortable here as retirees do. The island itself may not be the best area to stay for a long time—many people recommend just staying there for one night before moving on to other places.

Public transport can be difficult, and costs can add up, so it’s good to plan ahead. Safety is usually okay, but it’s smart to stay aware of your surroundings. If you learn about the local customs and eat at local restaurants, you will likely have nice experiences and memories from Mombasa!
mombasa.description_kor:
맘바사는 여유로운 분위기와 모험이 어우러진 활기찬 해안 도시입니다. 다이아니, 킬리피, 와타무 같은 아름다운 해변으로 잘 알려져 있으며, 이곳은 카이트서핑과 일광욕을 즐기는 사람들에게 인기 있는 장소입니다. 이 도시는 크리스마스와 새해 기간 동안 특히 활성화되며, 많은 이들이 휴일에 즐길 수 있는 다양한 파티로 활기를 띱니다.

하지만 맘바사는 다소 복잡하게 느껴질 수도 있습니다. 이곳을 즐기는 사람들이 있는 반면, 좀 더 자유롭게 떠돌고 싶은 여행자들은 은퇴자들처럼 편안함을 느끼지 못할 수도 있습니다. 또한, 이 섬에서 오랜 시간 머무는 것은 다소 부담스러울 수 있으며, 많은 여행자들이 다른 곳으로 이동하기 전 하룻밤 정도 묵는 것을 추천합니다.

대중교통이 불편할 수 있고 비용이 예상보다 많이 들 수 있으니 미리 계획하는 것이 좋습니다. 안전은 대체로 괜찮지만 주변을 잘 살피는 것이 현명합니다. 지역의 문화와 풍습에 대해 배우고, 현지 식당에서 식사를 즐긴다면 맘바사에서 기분 좋은 경험과 소중한 추억을 만들 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: I am not sure where some of these “stats” came from but Liberia is an English speaking country though many people speak a form of West Indian slang. It is not a good habit to go into a country for a short time, associate w/a small group who don’t represent the majority and write slanted comments from your limited perspective.
monrovia.description:
Monrovia is the capital of Liberia and has its own special appeal that many visitors enjoy. The city mainly speaks English, but you may also hear some West Indian slang in conversations. It's a lively place with a strong culture, where the people are friendly and welcoming.

Like any city, it has its good and bad points. You can experience the friendly atmosphere and local customs, but some visitors say the nightlife is quieter than in other large cities. Public transport can be a bit difficult, so it’s important to be patient when getting around.

You will find interesting places to see, from historical sites to nice beaches nearby, great for relaxing in the sun. Be sure to explore different neighborhoods since each one is different. A good tip to enjoy your time here is to talk to locals; they can guide you to the best places and local customs. Just keep an open mind, and you will have a nice experience in Monrovia!
monrovia.description_kor:
몬로비아는 리베리아의 수도로, 많은 방문객들이 눌러앉고 싶은 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 이 도시는 주로 영어가 사용되지만, 대화 중 서인도 방언을 듣기도 합니다. 몬로비아는 활기찬 분위기와 강한 문화적 색깔을 가지고 있으며, 사람들은 친근하고 따뜻하게 맞아줍니다.

모든 도시가 그렇듯 몬로비아도 장점과 단점이 있습니다. 친근한 분위기와 지역 문화를 경험할 수 있는 반면, 일부 방문객들은 야경이 다른 대도시에 비해 다소 조용하다고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 대중교통이 약간 불편할 수 있으니, 이동할 때 인내심을 가지고 접근하는 것이 중요합니다.

역사적인 장소부터 아름다운 해변까지, 흥미로운 명소가 많아 맑은 날 햇살을 만끽하는 데 제격입니다. 각각의 동네마다 독특한 매력이 있으니, 여러 동네를 탐험해보는 것을 추천합니다. 몬로비아에서 즐거운 시간을 보내고 싶다면, 현지인과 이야기를 나누는 것이 좋은 팁입니다. 그들이 추천해주는 최고의 장소와 지역 관습을 통해 더 깊이 있는 경험을 할 수 있습니다. 열린 마음으로 탐험하면 몬로비아에서 매력적인 경험을 많이 할 수 있을 거예요!

reviews: Montego Bay is a nice friendly place to stay if your a tourist. I like going to the market for fresh vegetables and fruit. There’s a lot of taxis and transportation for cheap If you know where your going and how to count jamaican money. Doctors Cave beach is popular and other community beaches in Montego Bay. There’s a lot of activities to do.
montego-bay.description:
Montego Bay is a friendly place that is popular with tourists who want to enjoy the Jamaican atmosphere. One of the best things to do is visit the local markets. You can find a good variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, which is a nice way to try local food. Getting around is easy too, with many affordable taxi options. Just make sure you know how to count Jamaican money, and you will be fine!

Doctors Cave Beach is a must-see, along with several other local beaches that are perfect for enjoying the sun. There are many activities available, from relaxing by the water to learning about the local culture.

However, it is important to keep a few things in mind: while the cost of living is generally low, being aware of your spending can help prevent any surprises. Also, if you do not speak English well, you might encounter some language challenges, but the locals are usually friendly and willing to help.

In general, Montego Bay is a great destination because of its warm people and many fun activities, making it a good place for anyone wanting to experience Jamaica!
montego-bay.description_kor:
몬테고 베이는 자메이카의 매력을 느끼고 싶은 관광객들에게 매우 인기 있는 친근한 장소입니다. 이곳에서 가장 추천하는 활동 중 하나는 지역 시장을 방문하는 것입니다. 신선한 과일과 채소를 다양하게 만나볼 수 있으며, 이는 현지 음식을 맛볼 수 있는 훌륭한 방법입니다. 이동할 때는 저렴한 택시 옵션이 많아 편리합니다. 자메이카 돈을 계산하는 방법만 알고 있으면 무리가 없어요!

닥터스 케이브 해변은 꼭 가봐야 할 곳으로, 태양을 즐기기에 안성맞춤인 여러 아름다운 해변들과 함께 방문할 가치가 충분합니다. 해변가에서 여유롭게 시간을 보내거나 지역 문화에 대해 배우는 등 다양한 활동을 즐길 수 있습니다.

다만, 몇 가지 유의할 점이 있습니다. 생활비는 대체로 저렴하지만, 지출에 주의하면 뜻밖의 놀라움을 피할 수 있습니다. 또한 영어를 잘 못한다면 언어적인 장벽이 있을 수 있으나, 대체로 현지인들은 친절하고 도와주고자 하는 마음이 큽니다.

종합적으로, 몬테고 베이는 따뜻한 사람들과 다양한 재미있는 활동 덕분에 자메이카의 매력을 경험하고 싶은 이들에게 훌륭한 여행지입니다!

reviews: One of the top 5 capital for industries and commerce, som of the most important companies have a sede in this city. Super easy to fly around the world. Wonderful places to visit for families or alome. Friendly people and it is the capitol of the comedy in Mexico.
monterrey.description:
Monterrey is often called a center of industry in Mexico. This city is one of the main places for business and has many major companies, making it a spot for business people and visitors. Getting around is easy, especially with its airport offering good connections to other places.

But it’s not just about work—Monterrey has a lot to offer for fun! Families can visit parks and cultural sites, while those traveling alone can enjoy the local scene. Comedy shows are popular here, and many say it's known for its comedy.

However, some people mention that the cost of living can be high compared to other places. Public transportation might not be as good as in other cities, so having a plan is important. Overall, Monterrey is a lively city with friendly people and a unique feel. Whether you’re visiting for work or fun, you’ll find something special here!
monterrey.description_kor:
몬테레이는 멕시코의 산업 중심지로 자주 언급됩니다. 이 도시는 비즈니스의 주요 허브 중 하나로, 많은 대기업들이 위치해 있어 비즈니스맨과 방문객들에게 인기가 높습니다. 특히 공항이 있어 다른 지역과의 연결성이 뛰어나 이동이 매우 편리합니다.

하지만 몬테레이는 일만 하는 곳이 아닙니다! 이곳에는 즐길 거리도 풍부합니다. 가족 단위로는 공원과 문화유적지를 방문할 수 있으며, 혼자 여행하는 분들도 지역의 매력을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 코미디 공연이 인기 만점으로, 이곳을 코미디의 메카로 부르기도 합니다.

다만, 일부 사람들은 다른 도시들에 비해 생활비가 비싸다고 느끼기도 합니다. 또한 대중교통이 다른 도시들만큼 발달하지 않았으니, 미리 계획을 세우는 것이 중요합니다. 전반적으로 몬테레이는 활기찬 도시로, 친절한 사람들과 독특한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 일이든 여가든 방문하신다면, 특별한 경험을 하실 수 있을 겁니다!

reviews: Driving looks and feels dangerous. It isn't. It's just scary to start (and I've got over a million miles in a truck across North America). That's probably why the 'dangerous' reviews. Was surprised to find EVERY time something happened, like a car door randomly opening in front of you or sudden lane disappearance, the drivers in the lane you needed made space. Drivers have exceptional road awareness. It's just that it's scary doing 75 km/h in a bumper to bumper traffic jam. Being a pedestrian is scary as cars have right of way. This is pretty normal around the world so not exceptional. Food is excellent. But not cheap. Service IS good if you're not a RICHARD. People unbelievably helpful and accommodating to foreigners. Huge, clean beaches along the ENTIRE ocean. You can drive an hour from the city, nothing around, no beach flotsam, sargasm or trash. It HAS to have been groomed as not even dead fish. But why? Nobody around. Amazed us. Bums look scary. Looks like you'll need shots if you come into contact. They just go away if you're firm. Wouldn't walk the ports at night. But you're an idiot if you do that ANYWHERE. LOVED THE PLACE. Would really like to move here. Only it's expensive. I'll keep looking but for us... to of our list to stay.

Phone speeds by OOKLA fast exceed this sites noted data speed. I clocked 250 to over 350 consistently within towns. (352 down 43 up / 246 down 40 up w/5g; my worst was Christmas Day at 60 down 30 up and it dropped to LTE. But virtually every single person was off work. Good luck finding food. (Plan appropriately). In the deep country it was slower but the phone had no issues. Was something like 100mbs. Probably every time you throw a stone in the city you'll hit a tech or remote worker. Lost count of how many I randomly met in the street. 
I didn't see much trash. We even discussed that there was so little. Researched foods in markets. Don't understand the complaint unless it's just someone that expected the identical choices and brands from home. Chivito is not like a hamburger unless you're vegetarian. If you visit I'd recommend one. Just understand it's bigger than your mouth and it'll be messy. If you want to sit in public laughing like an idiot and taking pictures of your food... order a Big Mac. Wife and i still tear up thinking about it. Hilariously sized. If you're actually hungry don't order anything from the typical menu and go with the local menu. Although, unless you're stuck you can find real food for only slightly more. Use a foreign credit card for car and hotels and tax is removed instantly. (There will be something like a 4 grand hold put on your card if you use the cards rental car insurance). I used Samsung Pay for almost everything. Only one beach restaurant didn't take cards. Even a town that had guys riding in a tractor bucket and a cow actually crossing the street accepted my phone. Speaking of... go to the Garzon Bodega. Beautiful, excellent wine, great food, etc. Just know you're SUPPOSED to book ahead. Sidewalks do suck. Seems that there are public works going on to replace and update but that's a lot of work with only so much cash. Probably they'll never catch up due to neglect in the past. But that's due to America screwing around and placing dictators where they don't like democracies that don't agree with them so don't blame Uruguay. The whole country has tap water that is TECHNICALLY drinkable. No bugs in it. Industrial waste? There have been some issues. We were warned.

Let's start with the trash - it is everywhere and no one seems to care. Even in the expensive barrios of multi-million dollar houses, you will see it. Sidewalks are dilapidated and the vegetation in public areas is overgrown - trees are left unchecked many of which overgrow into overhead power cables, or their roots tear up the street. "Ciudad Vieja", the old part of Montevideo could've been nice, but Uruguayans stopped caring about it a long time ago. Now it's just ugly and depressing. Tap water is drinkable, so don't buy it in a bottle - it'll only end up on the sidewalk, the beach or the sea. Prices for everything other than Beef (which is delicious) are eye-watering. The Rambla, Montevideo's beachside promenade is the jewel of the city, it's a great place to run and workout. Restaurants and Cafeterias are mediocre and expensive for what you get and customer service is derisible. In both Supermarkets and Restaurants, the food choice is limited - Uruguayans seem to live on a diet of Milanesa (bland, thinly cut sliced beef cooked in breadcrumbs) and Zapallito (a small flavourless pumpkin), and ignore the bounty of seafood that must exist off their coast. They are also very proud of the Chivito, their national dish which is nothing more than a Hamburger, but worse. Others have mentioned the Drivers and this is something rather peculiar. The average Uruguayan seems relaxed, chilled even, yet behind the wheel they are, and I'm going to generalise here, maniacs. They are reckless idiots. They have no respect for other road users, especially cyclists and pedestrians. As for the rest of Uruguay, there really isn't anything outside of the capital. Many Uruguayans consider Punta del Este to be their Miami, but if you want a Miami experience, that's where you should go. It will be cheaper, cleaner, and a lot more fun and you are less likely to be involved in a road traffic accident.

Everything in Uruguay works so well, great people, food, coffee, infrastructure. Their airport is also absolutely gorgeous (and super efficient).

GDP per capita of $25,000 per year, highest in Latin America and everyone here is highly educated as it's 100% free! It's #1 in many things in Latin America. Richest per capita. Highest educated. Highest IQ. Highest quality of life. Least corrupt. Most democratic. A breath of fresh air in a region plagued by problems.

Caveat is it's small, it's kinda a city state like Singapore. Easier to get 3 million people to behave than 200+ million!

Make sure you stay in the right area, Pocitos and Punta Carretas is nice. Ciudad Viejo (old city) is very bad and can be dangerous with junkies and homeless everywhere. They really have to clean that area up I think.

I've casually found this page, living in Montevideo for a twelve year now I want to write a little comment about some of the things I've read here.
1) the cost of living: yes, it's expensive. no, you don't need 4000 usd/month. Of course you can spend it if you want, but actually we're a family of four and our monthly balance is about 3000$. we don't own a car, we don't go out every evening, we don't live in punta carretas. of course, if you want to live in the most expensive neighborhood and want to dinner out sushi every day you need a lot of money, but normally 4000 usd/month for one person are a very good amount
2) internet speed: Montevideo and most of uruguay have optic fiber, for 50 usd/month you can get a 100/30 mpbs connection, the problem maybe the international bandwidth (I can use ssh to remote server in europe with a slightly delay), we watch netflix etc with no problem. also you can buy an LTE mobile chip with a very good speed (I can do RDP with no problems at all) but more delay in international routing.
3) tap water: it's generally drinkable, maybe you can buy a filter, but lot of people drink it
4) yes, the city can be pretty boring compared to other options (like buenos aires, for example) and there's no much variety
5) safety: yes, it's safer than other latin america cities, but if you go around with dollars sticking out of your pocket, an iphone in one hand, an ipad in the other, the latest model of nikon around your neck, an open backpack with a laptop sticking out of it and looking around bewildered, maybe even in a complicated barrio... well, you increase the chances of being robbed... since it's not tokyo (and there are complicated areas there too) you need to have some ability to understand the context

Hope this help!

I really like Montevideo. There may be a little bit of crime here and there - but coming from LA (like me), Montevideo is a picnic, frankly. If you're into architecture you will LOVE walking around here. Also, check out Eater's list of restaurants. There is some REALLY good food there. It's just not going to hit you in the face, like it does in NYC, or something. They also love their sweets - very good bakeries. And, a surprising number of great places to work and have a coffee. All those beautiful old homes have been converted to cafes and restaurants. As a digital nomad, that was really nice!

Everything (and everyone haha) seems to be old. Not a kind of place to have fun and enjoy. Food is great, but pricey — you can find the same or even better for a cheaper price in Buenos Aires. Legalization of marijuana isn’t something good to celebrate in my opinion and just created a weird environment. There are better places to go.

Most of the city felt a bit run down, trash in the streets, not much to see or do, and everything seemed really expensive. The Uruguayan people were nice and helpful, but once those nice folks got behind the wheel of a car they seemed to transform: Trying to cross the street as a pedestrian was annoyingly stressful. It wasn't easy to find good restaurants or coffee and they were all really expensive for what you got. I heard that Montevideo was safer than other South American countries but all that news did was make me not want to visit other South American countries because it didn't feel safe at all compared to Eastern and Western Europe.

One positive is that foreign credit cards are supposed to have IVA tax reimbursed, which is quite a bit in restaurants (+20%) although this didn't work properly on all of my US credit cards. However even with the tax break it didn't feel like a great deal most of the time.
montevideo.description:
Montevideo, the capital of Uruguay, has a mix of culture, beaches, and a strong community feel. Many visitors enjoy the city’s food, especially the Chivito – a large sandwich that many love. The Rambla is a popular place to visit; it’s good for jogging or relaxing in the sun. 

The cost of living can be high, especially for eating out, but you can find good value if you look for local places. Some people say there aren't many restaurant choices, but the city’s bakeries and cafes have nice food. 

Driving can seem busy at first, but most locals are good at finding their way around. As a pedestrian, be careful—cars usually have the right of way, which can make walking a bit tricky. 

Safety is better than in some other Latin American cities, but it’s smart to stay in busy areas like Pocitos or Punta Carretas. Even with its challenges, Montevideo’s relaxed atmosphere and friendly people make it a place many want to live in—so take your camera and enjoy this easy-going seaside city!
montevideo.description_kor:
몬테비데오, 우루과이의 수도는 문화와 해변, 그리고 강한 공동체 의식이 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳의 음식을 즐기며, 특히 치비토를 좋아합니다. 치비토는 많은 이들이 사랑하는 푸짐한 샌드위치랍니다. 또한, 람블라는 인기 있는 명소로, 조깅을 하거나 햇빛 아래에서 편히 쉴 수 있는 좋은 장소입니다.

생활비는 다소 높은 편일 수 있지만, 현지 식당을 찾아보면 품질 대비 좋은 음식을 발견할 수 있습니다. 일부는 레스토랑의 선택지가 많지 않다고 느끼지만, 다양한 제과점과 카페에서는 정말 맛있는 음식을 제공합니다.

처음에는 교통이 붐비게 느껴질 수 있지만, 대부분의 현지인들은 길을 찾는 데 능숙합니다. 보행자로서 주의가 필요하며, 차량이 우선권을 가지는 상황이라 걷는 것이 조금 힘들 수 있습니다.

안전성은 다른 라틴 아메리카 도시들에 비해 나은 편이지만, 포시토스나 푼타 카레타스와 같은 번화한 지역에 머무는 것이 가장 좋습니다. 어려움이 있더라도 몬테비데오의 편안한 분위기와 친절한 사람들 덕분에 많은 이들이 이곳에서 살고 싶어합니다. 그러니 카메라를 꼭 챙기시고 이 여유로운 해안 도시를 만끽해보세요!

reviews: I think it's better place to visit than to live. Very French with no signs of expat or digital nomad communities. Night life can be crazy. Great place to walk around.

Co-working spaces tend to not allow taking calls frequently at your desk. I tried many of the highest rated ones in Montpellier and was told that people expect quiet focus and calls need to be done in phone booths or in the corridors. No one uses noise cancelling headphones. Not ideal if your job requires lots of meetings/phone calls. I've ended up working from home.
Great city, perfect flagship of South of France. 30 min away there is the sea!
montpellier.description:
Montpellier is a nice place in the South of France that has a mix of culture and activity. It is often seen as a better place for visitors than for living long-term. The city has a busy nightlife, making it an enjoyable place to explore at night. Walk around its old streets—you will find many things to see and do! Just remember that co-working spaces here are not very good for phone calls; they prefer a quiet environment, so you may need to work from home if you need to make calls.

Living costs can be a bit high, and it feels very French with not much sign of expat life. If you want a calmer work environment, you may need to adjust to some unusual customs. Also, if you want to go to the beach, you are only half an hour away from the sea!

Make sure to check out the different neighborhoods to find the right one for you, and enjoy the local food—it gives you a taste of the South of France! Just be patient with the language—French is the main language here, and knowing a few phrases can help.
montpellier.description_kor:
몽펠리에는 문화와 다양한 활동이 어우러진 프랑스 남부의 매력적인 도시입니다. 주로 장기간 거주하기보다는 방문하기에 적합한 장소로 여겨집니다. 이 도시는 특히 활기찬 밤문화로 유명해, 야간에 탐험하기에 정말 즐거운 곳입니다. 고풍스러운 거리들을 거닐다 보면 볼거리와 할거리가 간 plentiful하게 있습니다. 단, 이곳의 공동 작업 공간은 전화 통화에는 적합하지 않으니, 조용한 환경에서 일하는 것을 선호합니다. 만약 전화 통화를 해야 한다면 재택근무를 고려해야 할 수도 있습니다.

생활비는 다소 높은 편이며, 외국인의 흔적이 많이 느껴지지 않아 매우 프랑스적인 분위기를 자아냅니다. 좀 더 조용한 근무 환경을 원한다면, 다소 낯선 관습에 적응하는 데 시간이 필요할 수 있습니다. 그리고 바다에 가고 싶다면, 해변이 단 30분 거리에 있어 편리합니다!

여러 지역을 탐방하면서 자신에게 맞는 곳을 찾아보고, 현지 음식을 만끽해 보세요. 프랑스 남부의 맛을 느낄 수 있을 거예요! 언어에 대해서는 인내심을 가져야 합니다. 이곳의 주요 언어는 프랑스어이므로, 몇 가지 간단한 문구를 익히는 것이 큰 도움이 될 수 있습니다.

reviews: I am from Moscow but grew up abroad. It's a lovely city, it's hard to find another city that matches the amount of cultural activities there are. Every day there are at least 2 festivals, 3 major concerts and tons of shows in theaters. The best season is winter and summer. The amount of decorations in the winter is incomparable (to London for example)! Snow adds magic to the city and if you are worried about the cold, there are plenty of shops with high quality winter clothes at decent prices. The city is very big, it will take ages to get somewhere and back, so only about 2 activities a day unless you live close.

Moscow is a great city, especially for young and adult people. Many business here and a lot of fun. Cheap taxi. Very clean city. Online delivery 24-hours for everything! Great and cheap subway (metro). Many cultural experience, good and different food. Fast Internet and free wifi in most of public places.
The best city I have ever been. But you will need google translate if want to communicate with most people.

Lived in Moscow for a year in 2019. I worked in the mornings and late evenings working in multiple locations across the city (mainly centre) and travelled via metro/walked. Never had safety concerns. M29yo

You can have MGTS landline internet 500mbps for $10/mo. Only swiss products in groceries, no EU due to current sanctions. Really cheap life, if you are rich i'd recommend AzbukaVkusa groceries. A lot of expensive restaurants.

I'm from Moscow though do not live there at the moment.
Actually it's a good city to live in if you enjoy big cities. Lots of activities (including lots of free ones), huge parks, very walkable, great public transportation, groceries are cheap, people are nice but seem cold because of their mentality. You can go to Moscow region by commuter train to enjoy the countryside or swim. Safety is underrated. Moscow is very safe, it's totally ok to walk at night, I had nothing stolen in 7 years of my living there as a student. Much safer than in Southern Europe I would say. Wifi speeds are skyrocketing and you can pay with card nearly everywhere. Yandex is a leading taxi hailing app (that bought Uber Russia).
On the other hand it's a giant city with 14 millions inhabitants, 4 airports (please don't use ZIA), 9 railway stations, so it can be quite a mess. No good food. Air quality is very low, returning from any other place I could literally smell the air. And winters (Nov - Mar) are grey and boring, snow is melting and freezing again, everything around is filthy, very depressing, that's why so many Russians who work remotely leave the country and spend winter somewhere in Southern Asia. Airbnbs are super expensive compared to local long-term rent boards like Avito. There you can also find options for several months but if you don't speak Russian you would need a local friend. The rent is expensive compared to St Petersburg and other Russian cities. Older people don't speak English.

Moscow is incredible for digital nomads. Lots of coworkings, including WeWork, plenty of bars, and restaurants. Nightlife is awesome - from usual nightclubs to techno spots etc. It is much more safe to there than in other European capitals (London, Berlin, Paris). You only need to be careful with illegal things like cannabis and other drugs because of zero tolerance. People are great, and girls especially. 
People look unfriendly because they are not smiling to everyone, but it is just because of mentality.
Privet! I think Moscow is much cheaper then on scores and internet is much faster and if you spend summer time there then it is an amazing place!
moscow.description:
Moscow is a busy city that doesn’t sleep, and if you like culture, you will enjoy it! There are festivals, concerts, and theater shows happening almost every day, so there is always something interesting to see. Winters here are beautiful, with the city covered in snow, but be prepared for the cold! Luckily, there are many shops where you can find warm winter clothes at good prices.

Getting around is easy with the cheap and efficient metro system, though the city is large—great for exploring, but plan to take your time (two activities a day is a good plan). You'll find the locals friendly, but they might seem a bit shy at first. A little help from Google Translate will help since many older people don’t speak English.

While grocery prices are usually low, just be aware that rent can be high, especially for short stays. Also, after autumn, the air quality can get worse, which is something to think about if you are sensitive. However, with a lively nightlife and a wide range of experiences, Moscow is an interesting place to live and visit!
moscow.description_kor:
모스크바는 결코 잠들지 않는 활기찬 도시로, 문화에 관심이 있다면 분명히 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있을 거예요! 거의 매일 축제나 콘서트, 연극 공연이 열려서 항상 흥미로운 볼거리가 넘쳐납니다. 겨울철의 모습은 특히 아름다운데, 하얀 눈으로 덮인 도시 풍경이 정말 장관이에요. 다만, 추위에 대비하는 건 필수입니다! 다행히도 따뜻한 겨울 옷을 좋은 가격에 구입할 수 있는 가게들이 많이 있습니다.

저렴하고 효율적인 지하철 덕분에 이동은 아주 편리하지만, 도시가 정말 넓기 때문에 탐험할 시간을 넉넉히 계획하는 것이 중요해요. 하루에 두 가지 활동 정도가 적당한 계획일 것 같습니다. 현지인들은 친절하지만 처음에는 조금 수줍어할 수도 있어요. 많은 어르신들이 영어를 잘 하지 않기 때문에 구글 번역기를 조금 활용하는 것이 도움이 될 거예요.

식료품 가격은 보통 저렴하지만, 단기 체류를 계획할 경우 임대료가 좀 비쌀 수 있다는 점은 유의하세요. 가을 이후에는 공기 질이 나빠질 수 있으니, 그 점도 주의해야 합니다. 하지만 활기찬 나이트 라이프와 다양한 경험이 기다리는 모스크바는 살고 방문하기에 정말 매력적인 장소입니다!

reviews:
Mostar is a cozy place near the capital city of Bosnia and Herzegovina. 
It is possible to go there by train and the view during traveling Sarajevo-Mostar is spectacular. Mostar has a small airport but is not functioning most of the time. 
Hotels, hostels, and apartments are affordable and look good. 
Food offers a lot of red meat, but it's possible to do a good combination of cheese, bread, salads, and seafood. 
WiFi is not the best. 
There are a few points in the town that should be seen but mostly Mostar is a service town with nightlife, restaurants, and coffee places. It's quite lovely all of it, but besides it, the town doesn't offer a lot. 
However, this part of Bosnia is beautiful and it is possible to see the different places around by staying in Mostar. It's a small region and in slow motion, five to seven days is more than enough. I have been several times and springs and autumns are the best, while winters are quite cold even without snow. Summers are unbearable, but it's possible to be on the sea cost in 45 minutes by car. 
Services in the restaurants and general communication (busses, cabs, hosts, hospitals, stores) are not satisfactory, but traveling around I figured out they just behave that way, it shouldn't be taken personally. 
If you are an outdoor person, there are mountains, rivers, and walking tours you shouldn't miss.
Really good place to work from. Cheap while offering a interesting and different experience. Close to nature and many sight seeing destinations.
An unexpectedly amazing town with many places to see and go. One of those towns that has gives quaint attachment feeling. And of course, very cheap!
mostar.description:
Mostar is a small town in Bosnia and Herzegovina that offers a quiet escape with some local activity. You can take a train from the capital, Sarajevo, to get there easily, and the views along the way are quite impressive. The town has a small airport, but it is not always open, so trains might be the best option.

You can find affordable places to stay, including hotels, hostels, and apartments. If you like food, you will enjoy the local dishes, especially if you like red meat, but there are also plenty of tasty cheese, bread, and salad choices. The WiFi is not very good, but this gives you a chance to relax and enjoy the surroundings.

Mostar has a lively nightlife, restaurants, and coffee shops. While the town is small and doesn't have a lot of attractions, it is a good starting point to explore the beautiful nature and culture nearby. In the summer, it can be quite hot, but a short drive can take you to cooler coastal areas. Overall, Mostar is a nice town to relax, enjoy nature, and experience a slower pace of life!
mostar.description_kor:
모스타르는 보스니아 헤르체고비나에 위치한 작은 마을로, 조용한 휴식과 다양한 지역 활동을 즐길 수 있는 곳입니다. 수도 사라예보에서 기차를 타면 쉽게 이동할 수 있으며, 가는 길의 경치도 정말 아름답습니다. 이 곳에는 작은 공항이 있지만, 항상 운영되는 건 아니어서 기차가 가장 좋은 선택일 수 있습니다.

저렴한 숙소로는 호텔, 호스텔, 아파트 등이 다양하게 있으니 걱정하지 않으셔도 됩니다. 음식이 좋으시다면 현지 요리를 만끽할 수 있을 것이고, 특히 붉은 고기를 좋아하시는 분들은 더 만족하실 거예요. 맛있는 치즈, 갓 구운 빵, 그리고 신선한 샐러드도 많이 준비되어 있습니다. 와이파이는 그리 좋지 않지만, 오히려 이를 통해 여유롭게 주변을 즐길 기회를 제공합니다.

모스타르에는 활기찬 밤문화와 다양한 레스토랑, 아늑한 커피숍이 있어 즐길거리가 많습니다. 작은 마을이긴 하지만 관광 명소는 적더라도, 근처의 아름다운 자연과 문화를 경험할 수 있는 훌륭한 출발점입니다. 여름에는 꽤 덥기도 하지만, 짧은 드라이브를 통해 시원한 해안가로 가는 것도 가능합니다. 종합적으로 보면, 모스타르는 여유롭게 휴식을 취하고 자연을 만끽하며 느린 삶의 속도를 경험하기에 최적의 장소입니다!

reviews: Wasn't a huge fan of Mui Ne. Looks like most of the place is catering to Russian midrange tourists. The sand dunes are pretty cool, make sure to visit them, but wear covering clothes in order to not get badly sunburned.
mui-ne.description:
Mui Ne is a beach town in Vietnam with its own atmosphere. While some visitors say it caters more to Russian tourists, there are still many unique things to do. The sand dunes are a must-see; they go on for a long distance, and the views are great after the walk. Just a tip—make sure to wear sunscreen! The sun can be very strong here.

The culture is relaxed, and you will find a mix of local seafood restaurants and bars along the beach. Prices are usually reasonable, but some travelers say that accommodations can be in the mid-range price. 

Public transportation is somewhat limited, so you might want to rent a motorbike or get a taxi for easy travel. Overall, Mui Ne feels safe, but like in any travel place, it is smart to watch your belongings. If you want a place to relax by the beach and have some fun, Mui Ne might be a good choice for you!
mui-ne.description_kor:
무이네는 베트남에 위치한 매력적인 해변 마을로, 독특한 분위기를 지니고 있습니다. 일부 방문객들은 이곳이 러시아 관광객들에게 더 맞춰져 있다고 느끼기도 하지만, 여전히 다채로운 활동들이 기다리고 있습니다. 특히 모래 언덕은 꼭 가봐야 할 명소로, 넓게 펼쳐진 경치를 걸으며 즐길 수 있습니다. 하나의 팁이라면, 자외선 차단제를 반드시 바르라는 것입니다! 이곳의 햇빛은 매우 강할 수 있으니까요.

무이네의 문화는 편안하며, 해변을 따라 지역 해산물 레스토랑과 바들이 조화를 이루고 있습니다. 가격은 대체로 저렴하지만, 일부 여행자들은 숙소가 중간 정도의 가격대라고 언급합니다.

대중교통은 다소 제한적이어서, 오토바이를 대여하거나 택시를 이용하는 것이 편리합니다. 전반적으로 무이네는 안전한 곳으로 느껴지지만, 어떤 여행지에서든 소지품을 잘 챙기는 것이 중요합니다. 해변에서 여유를 즐기고 재미를 찾고 싶다면, 무이네는 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews: Spent the month of September here and it was nice for the first 2 weeks. There are a lot of young people due to the multiple universities and you smell weed everywhere!!! There is also so much construction going on with the roads and buildings, so it’s best to walk and bike most places. The BIXI bike system is awesome! There are also a lot of homeless screaming at people randomly in the streets. Food and rent is expensive. The “European” vibe is isolated to a 3 street area, but the rest of the city is much like a normal downtown. Everyone speaks English, so super easy to get around. 2 weeks here is plenty!! I was hoping for more of a European vibe.

Spent two years in Montreal. I have zero regrets and it was a lot of fun for a few years, but ultimately needed to leave. 
Pros:
-Good variety of nightlife and activities. From clubs to cool bars to strip clubs, you can find it in Montreal. Drinking here is quite cheap. 
-Population feels very young in the city center due to multiple large universities. Other areas around are also full of young professionals. Lots of cool trendy areas. 
-Work to live not live to work attitudes. People in Montreal like enjoying life. 

Cons:
-The same work to live attitudes I mentioned above means people here abhor success. If you make good money, don't mention it to people. Quebec is much poorer than other Canadian provinces and they do not like the wealthy. 
-The winters are awful. Lots of snow, cold and dark. 
-Taxes are high as hell for the "rich", where even 80k USD qualifies you as rich. 
-The government is very inefficient for a developed city. 
-As an anglophone, it's clear a certain subset of a population won't like you. Even if you learn French, they still won't like you, because your french will never be to their standards. 
-The city at times feels more developing than it does developed. If you're coming from a world-class city, Montreal is going to feel very small and not cosmopolitan.

Having lived in the Montreal region almost all my life, here are a few things to note:
- Smoking is prohibited in all public buildings (restaurants, bars, stores, underground shopping malls, business and residential building (excluding your own living spaces), public transportation, etc.
- English is harder to come by outside Montreal and certain parts of south shore but very common in the west end of Montreal
- Montreal has 2 English universities: McGill and Concordia both of which are centrally located downtown and accessible by Metro
- Making friends is quite easy. Just join a local meetup
- Many free public wifi spots
- Traffic can be a nightmare (lots of construction)
- Relative to European cities, public transportation is unreliable but quite good compared to other cities in south america for example
- Winters are very cold and costly for heating and car maintenance
- Food is good and healthy if you stay away from fast food chains
Great city, lots of art and artists. Found it a bit hard to break in as an English-speaker, but I liked it there anyway!
Montreal is the best city in Canada. Quality of life is unmatched because the pressure to make money isn't high here. Everyone is having a great time and happy.
one of the best cities in N America. Paris meets Manhattan.
Circus scene is AMAZING, the restaurants are great, and it's super easy to eat vegan here. Love this city! The winter is really hard though. I plan to leave before it returns.

Montreal is truly one of my favourite cities in the Americas hands down. Lots of great restaurants, rent is still affordable here. The winter can be a bit rough, but frankly it's part of the charm. The mountain in the heart of the city really adds to the layers. A great place to be a bohemian and and a metropolis with one foot in Europe. I have been here for 3 years, and live in a mostly english speaking neighbourhood of NDG.
Tipping is a part of life here. 15% is the average (rule of thumb is to tip whatever the provincial and federal tax on what you’re purchasing is, which is currently around 15%).
montreal.description:
Montreal is a mix of different cultures, where the energy from its universities fills the streets. Walk through popular neighborhoods, enjoy a reasonably priced drink, and appreciate the city's artsy feel. Whether you’re going to bars or watching circus shows, you’ll find plenty to keep your evenings lively.

However, the city has its challenges. The high cost of living can surprise you, especially with rent and taxes. Winters here are tough, so get ready for snow, cold, and many layers! Walking or biking with the BIXI system is a good option, especially with all the road work.

Language can be a little hard; while many people speak English, knowing French can help you connect better with locals. Enjoy the laid-back lifestyle—work to live here, not the other way around. If you want to meet new people, consider joining local groups; making friends is often easier than it seems. So, put on your winter clothes and explore the interesting, if sometimes busy, charm of Montreal!
montreal.description_kor:
몬트리올은 다양한 문화가 어우러진 도시로, 대학에서 나오는 에너지가 거리를 가득 메우고 있습니다. 인기 있는 동네를 걷다가 합리적인 가격의 음료를 즐기며, 이곳의 예술적인 분위기를 만끽해 보세요. 바에 들르거나 서커스 쇼를 관람하면서 활기찬 저녁을 보낼 수 있는 다양한 선택지가 당신을 기다리고 있습니다.

하지만 이 도시는 도전적인 면도 있습니다. 생활비가 생각보다 높아서 놀랄 수 있는데, 특히 임대료와 세금이 부담으로 작용할 수 있습니다. 겨울이 힘든 만큼 눈과 추위에 대비해 여러 겹의 옷을 준비하는 게 좋습니다. 도로 공사가 잦은 만큼, BIXI 시스템을 이용해 걷거나 자전거를 타는 것도 좋은 방법입니다.

언어 장벽이 있을 수 있는데, 많은 사람들이 영어를 사용하지만 프랑스어를 알고 있으면 지역 주민들과 더욱 편하게 소통할 수 있습니다. 여기에서는 일하기 위해 사는 것이 아니라, 삶을 살기 위해 일하므로 편안한 라이프스타일을 즐기세요. 새로운 사람들을 만나고 싶다면 지역 모임에 참여해보는 것을 추천합니다; 친구를 사귀는 것은 생각보다 더 쉬울 수 있습니다. 그러니 겨울철 옷을 갖추고 바쁘고 매력적인 몬트리올을 탐험해 보세요!

reviews:
Mumbai, August 28-September 2, September 7, September 11 2019. Got a friend to pick me up at the airport, so I can't evaluate how well UBER works from the airport. Prepaid taxi from the airport is my usual recommendation, and if I was traveling tomorrow that is what I would do. Inside of Mumbai, UBER was my go-to app and worked well. Autos (aka 'Tuk-tuks' in some places) get around well and are cheap, some are also on Uber. Be aware that unless you use a service like UBER, as a foreigner, the price will go up if you do not look and act like a local when you flag down your ride.

Food was varied and can be had in any variety, veg or non=veg, any nationality or region. Alcohol is available if you seek it out (some places will even deliver it to you with your pizza :). There are bars and night life in Mumbai that are fun, and feel free to get swept up in festival crowds in the earlier parts of the evening in major metropolitan areas. I never felt unsafe in Mumbai, but do not throw good traveler caution to the wind here.

Internet was spotty at times, but that may have just been my location. The internet tunnel I used worked, but YMMV. JIO was my phone provider of choice, and it seemed to work all across India. The city is historic and modern, slow and fast, very very rich, and desperately poor. Although prices here are higher relative to all other places in India, I will return to Mumbai (Bombay), and you should too... no one person can ever see it all.

Mumbai is a city in India. It is the capital of Maharashtra state, the most populous city in India and the 11th most populous city in the world, with a population of approximately 14.2 million. Mumbai is also the richest city in India, and has the highest GDP of any city in South, West or Central Asia. It is also one of the fastest growing cities in the world.

It was originally a trading outpost of the Portuguese Empire, later taken over by the British East India Company. It served as the capital of the Bombay Presidency from the British colonial period until India's independence in 1947. Today, Mumbai is a bustling metropolis and the financial capital of India.

Mumbai is an alpha world city as per the Globalization and World Cities Research Network. It forms the financial capital of India and is one of the major commercial and business centres of India.
mumbai.description:
Mumbai is a city that mixes the old and the new. It has a lively atmosphere with many options, from tasty street food to nice restaurants. Whether you want spicy snacks or international food, there are many choices. The nightlife is active, and you should join in local festivals.

Getting around is simple, especially with Uber and auto-rickshaws (just be careful about prices if you look like a tourist). The city is busy and full of energy, but the cost of living can be higher than in other places in India. Safety is not a major issue, but it’s good to be aware of your surroundings.

You can learn about Mumbai’s history through its old buildings and busy markets, but be ready for some internet issues in some areas. With its different neighborhoods and unique customs, there is always something new to find. Are you ready to explore the excitement and uniqueness of Mumbai? You will have a memorable experience!
mumbai.description_kor:
뭄바이는 오래된 것과 새로운 것이 조화롭게 어우러진 도시입니다. 맛있는 길거리 음식부터 세련된 레스토랑까지 다양한 매력을 지니고 있어 활기찬 분위기를 자랑합니다. 매운 스낵을 원하든, 다양한 국제 음식을 맛보고 싶든 선택의 폭이 넓습니다. 밤문화도 매우 발달해 있고, 지역 축제에 참여해보는 것도 추천합니다.

이동은 쉽고 편리하며, 특히 우버나 오토 리크샤를 이용할 수 있습니다. 단, 관광객처럼 보일 경우 요금에 주의하는 것이 좋습니다. 도시는 붐비고 에너지 넘치지만, 생활비는 인도의 다른 지역에 비해 조금 비쌀 수 있습니다. 안전에 대해 크게 걱정할 필요는 없지만, 주변 상황에 대한 인지는 항상 필요합니다.

뭄바이의 역사에 관심이 있다면, 오래된 건물과 활기찬 시장을 구경해보세요. 다만, 일부 지역에서는 인터넷 연결이 불안정할 수 있으니 미리 대비하는 것이 좋습니다. 다양한 동네와 저마다의 독특한 관습 덕분에 언제나 새로운 발견을 할 수 있습니다. 뭄바이의 흥미로운 매력과 독특한 문화를 탐험할 준비되셨나요? 기억에 남는 경험이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
People
- People are generally friendly
- Not too many scams like BKK
- Scams are low here because the city doesn't have the same attractions like BKK
- Never ran in to a Digital Nomad here like Chiang Mai

Language
- English level is very low
- If they can speak a little bit of English the people are shy to use it
- Languages that you can use to get by are Thai, Cambodian and Lao

Health
- Hospitals have long line ups throughout the day. 
- Locals go in the morning to take a number, when their time slot is coming up they go back to the hospital and wait
- The wait is long to get served in the hospital it takes almost a whole day of waiting
- Private is better but cost more

Dental
- Good dental care is cheap and affordable
- Wait time is short, most of the time there is no wait time
- some dentist can speak English because they studied in the US
- Hard to find a good one (language barrier)

Food
- Cheaper to eat out than cook at home
- Eating out is cheap as long as you stick to places where locals go (outdoor stalls or sidewalk restaurants)
- Regular restaurants in malls and outside can add up over time. (not including food courts in malls they are cheap)
- If you want to cook the best places to buy food are the fresh markets and wet markets in terms of price. 
- Stores like Tesco and Big C are cheap but again in the long run it adds up.

Attractions
- Not too many places to visit here
- If you have a car you can go to Buriram to see the historical places like Phanom Rung and other ruins

WiFi
- A lot of free wifi in the malls and hotels
- Hotel wifi - some are good and some are very bad even if it's a higher end hotel wifi can be bad
- Mall wifi is fine - connects most of the time and sometimes it cuts off - the speed is okay
- I found in general wifi allover the kingdom is pretty much the same in terms of speed and sustained connection
nakhon-ratchasima.description:
Located in northeastern Thailand, Nakhon Ratchasima, or Korat as locals call it, has a relaxed atmosphere that is a nice change from busy Bangkok. The people here are friendly, making it easy to feel at home. Also, you are unlikely to face many scams because of its local feel.

Language may be challenging since not many people speak English, but a smile and a few words in Thai, Cambodian, or Lao can help. If you need healthcare, be ready for long waits at public hospitals, but dental care is surprisingly cheap and good, especially with some dentists who speak English.

Food lovers will be happy! Eating out is cheaper than cooking at home, especially if you visit local stalls. However, be careful with regular restaurants, as prices can add up quickly. While Nakhon Ratchasima does not have major attractions, a short drive to nearby Buriram shows beautiful historical sites.

There is plenty of free WiFi in malls and hotels, so you can stay connected, but don’t expect very fast speeds. Enjoy the slower pace and take in the unique local culture—Korat has its own special feel that is worth experiencing!
nakhon-ratchasima.description_kor:
북동 태국에 위치한 나콘라차시마, 현지인들이 코랏이라고 부르는 이곳은 바쁜 방콕과는 완전히 다른 느긋한 분위기를 제공합니다. 이곳 사람들은 매우 친절해서 마치 집에 있는 듯한 편안함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 그리고 지역적인 특성 덕분에 사기를 당할 가능성도 낮습니다.

영어를 잘 구사하는 사람들이 많지 않아서 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있지만, 미소와 몇 마디 태국어, 캄보디아어, 또는 라오어를 사용하면 큰 도움이 됩니다. 의료 서비스가 필요할 경우 공공 병원에서는 긴 대기 시간을 각오해야 하지만, 치과 치료는 surprisingly 저렴하고 질 또한 좋습니다. 특히, 영어를 하는 몇몇 치과 의사들도 있으니 안심하셔도 됩니다. 

음식 애호가라면 정말 기쁘실 겁니다! 지역의 길거리 음식 가판대를 이용하면 외식이 집에서 식사하는 것보다 더 저렴할 수 있습니다. 하지만 일반 레스토랑에서는 가격이 금방 올라가니 주의해야 합니다. 나콘라차시마에는 주요 관광 명소는 없지만, 인근의 부리람으로 짧은 차를 몰고 가면 아름다운 역사적인 장소들을 만날 수 있습니다.

쇼핑몰과 호텔에서는 무료 WiFi가 많이 제공되어 연결 상태를 유지할 수 있지만, 속도가 그리 빠르지는 않을 것입니다. 느린 속도를 즐기며 독특한 지역 문화를 만끽해 보세요. 코랏은 꼭 한 번 경험해볼 가치가 있는 특별한 매력을 지닌 곳입니다!

reviews: this is great place to work!
nagpur.description:
Nagpur is a city in India that has a lot to offer. Many people like its friendly atmosphere, making it a good place to live and work. With both city and rural areas, you are never too far from nature, which is a big benefit. The cost of living is quite reasonable, especially compared to larger cities, so your salary stretches further here.

Public transportation can vary in quality, but auto-rickshaws and local buses can help you get around. In terms of safety, it is usually a safe place, but, like in any city, it is smart to be aware of your surroundings.

When it comes to food, you will enjoy the local dishes—make sure to try the famous oranges! For culture, Nagpur has many festivals, and the locals are friendly and welcoming.

One challenge is the language barrier, so learning some basic Hindi might be useful. If you want a balance of work and a comfortable lifestyle, Nagpur may be a good choice for you!
nagpur.description_kor:
나그푸르는 인도에 위치한 매력적인 도시로, 많은 사람들이 이곳의 따뜻한 분위기를 사랑합니다. 이 도시는 거주와 근무에 적합한 곳으로 알려져 있으며, 도심과 농촌이 어우러져 자연을 가까이에서 즐길 수 있는 점이 큰 장점입니다. 생활비도 매우 합리적이어서 대도시와 비교했을 때 여러분의 급여를 더 효율적으로 활용할 수 있습니다.

대중교통은 다소 다양하지만, 오토리크샤와 지역 버스를 이용하면 편리하게 이동할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 안전한 편이지만, 다른 도시와 마찬가지로 주위를 잘 살피는 것이 중요합니다.

음식 면에서는 현지 요리를 다양하게 즐길 수 있으며, 특히 유명한 오렌지는 꼭 한 번 맛보세요! 문화적으로는 다양한 축제가 열리고, 현지인들은 매우 친절하게 맞아줍니다.

하나의 도전 과제로는 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있는데, 기본적인 힌디어를 배우면 많은 도움이 될 것입니다. 일과 여유로운 삶의 균형을 원하신다면, 나그푸르는 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
December 2022: Nairobi is a city less walkable than Bangkok, worse infrastructure than the Eastern European province, a non-service culture that would rival Germany, WiFi & 3G/4G like in rural Kyrgyzstan (the kind of where you walk with your phone in your stretched out hand)…. 
All of that you get for almost US-level prices. 

Nah, I didn’t have a good time. It feels utterly derelict and careless. Zero things to do except paying through your nose for Safari stuff. Although the people are very friendly (if you sift through the ones that want your wallet).

Lived in Nairobi off and on since 2019. I think it's an excellent place to live. Weather is phenomenal, between 20-27C most of the time. People are super friendly and it's very cosmopolitan (attracts people from all over Kenya, Africa and the world). For Africa it's relatively progressive and I'm not sure why it gets a "not safe for women" (IME it's not perfect but no worse than many other countries around the world and much less regressive than Middle East, South Asia, etc.) It's an excellent jumping off point for the rest of Kenya which is very diverse (beaches/mountains/savannahs/deserts) - a bit like SF in that the city itself is great but a lot of the appeal is surrounding nature. Tech and nightlife scenes are vibrant.
Main cons: it's not THAT cheap, it's not an amazing food city, mainly car-based for getting around (Uber is cheap though).

I visited Nairobi twice - in 2017 and then again in 2019. On my second visit, I stayed in a comfortable 2 bdrm apartment with friends. It was super easy to move around - just call Uber. I visited a few nice shopping malls where I shopped and ate lunch. Prices were reasonable for me (an American). I'm also vegan and there were vegan options at all of the restaurants I visited as well as a great vegan restaurant (Indian cuisine). The best part of the trip for us was going on safari. It's a long drive to safari country (Amboselli NP, Maasai Mara NP) but the experience is well worth it. I also visited Mombasa which, while not as big a city as Nairobi, had lovely beaches and the hotel where we stayed was great.
Nairobi is one of he best place to be a Nomad in Africa. Very low cost of living especially if you know where to look.
nairobi.description:
Nairobi is a mix of cultures, offering a special experience that many visitors enjoy, even with some difficulties! The weather in the city is nice, staying between 20-27°C, which makes it pleasant all year. The locals are friendly and helpful, contributing to the diverse community here.

While the nightlife and tech scene are active, getting around the city can be difficult because it relies mostly on cars. Uber is a well-liked and affordable way to travel, which makes it easier—especially for new visitors. Remember that while there are good shopping malls and places to eat with vegan options, Nairobi can be a bit expensive, and the food choices could be more varied.

Nairobi is a great starting point for exploring Kenya's beautiful nature, with safaris being a top attraction for many. It is true that there are some problems with infrastructure and safety, but many people say there is still a lot to enjoy if you look closer. Just be ready for some unusual things, and make sure to enjoy your time!
nairobi.description_kor:
나이로비는 다양한 문화가 어우러진 도시로, 많은 방문객들에게 특별한 경험을 선사합니다. 아무리 어려움이 있더라도 말이죠! 이곳의 날씨는 연중 20도에서 27도 사이로 유지되어 항상 쾌적합니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하며, 다양한 커뮤니티 활동에 적극적으로 참여하고 있어요.

밤문화와 기술 산업이 활발히 운영되고 있지만, 자동차에 크게 의존하는 도시라 이동이 다소 불편할 수 있습니다. 우버는 새로운 방문객들에게 특히 편리하고 저렴한 교통수단으로 인기가 많습니다. 쇼핑몰도 괜찮고 비건 옵션이 있는 식당도 있지만, 나이로비의 물가가 꽤 비쌀 수 있으며 음식 선택의 다양성은 앞으로 더 개선될 여지가 있습니다.

나이로비는 케냐의 아름다운 자연을 탐험하기 위한 훌륭한 출발점이며, 사파리는 많은 사람들에게 인기 있는 관광명소입니다. 인프라와 안전 문제도 있지만, 가까이에서 보면 여전히 즐길 거리가 많다는 의견이 많아요. 조금 특별한 경험을 할 준비를 하고 즐거운 시간을 보내시길 바랍니다!

reviews: Beautiful weather, it's like Hawaii. Only downside is you need a car if you want to see any sights outside the city.

Okinawa is an amazing place to live. I sadly just recently moved from Okinawa to Texas, but I spent my past 9 years on that island. If you ever get the chance to live there, you definitely should. The beaches are so nice, and the people are quite friendly off base. They also have some amazing food you ought to try.
naha.description:
Naha is located on the island of Okinawa, which has nice weather similar to Hawaii. You can find sunny beaches and kind people here. This city is a good choice for anyone looking for a relaxed way of life. You should try the local food, as Okinawan dishes are very tasty.

If you want to see places outside the city, having a car is important because it can be hard to get around by public transport, which is a common concern for locals.

Naha is a safe place, making it easy to relax. You can visit different neighborhoods to learn about the local customs and culture. While some people may not speak English, a friendly smile can help you connect. Whether you are planning a visit or thinking of moving here, Naha offers a mix of beautiful views and a laid-back lifestyle. Enjoy your time!
naha.description_kor:
나하(Naha)는 하와이와 비슷한 좋은 날씨를 자랑하는 오키나와(Okinawa) 섬에 위치해 있습니다. 이곳에서는 맑은 해변과 친절한 사람들을 만날 수 있습니다. 여유로운 삶을 원하는 모든 이에게 딱 맞는 도시죠. 오키나와의 요리는 정말 맛있으니, 현지 음식을 꼭 한 번 즐겨보세요.

도시 외곽의 매력적인 장소를 탐방하고 싶다면 자동차를 이용하는 것이 좋습니다. 대중교통이 이동하기에는 다소 불편하므로, 많은 현지인들도 이 점에 대해 걱정하곤 합니다.

나하는 안전한 장소로, 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 환경을 제공합니다. 다양한 동네를 다니며 현지의 관습과 문화를 직접 체험할 수 있습니다. 영어를 잘 하지 않는 사람들도 있을 수 있지만, 따뜻한 미소가 여러분을 환영해 줄 것입니다. 방문할 계획이거나 이곳으로 이사를 고려하고 있다면, 나하는 아름다운 경치와 여유로운 라이프스타일이 완벽하게 어우러져 있는 곳입니다. 즐거운 시간을 보내세요!

reviews: Lived there for 7 years. Nantes is like a little Paris but is 30~50% cheaper. There is usually no security issue so don’t trust the medias. Try to leave downtown near Place Graslin if you can. You don’t have the choices you can get in a lot of big cities for food though. I would say the city is perfect for a family who seek a calm city but can be annoying for young nomads if they stay too long. My favorite restaurant is La Cigale (the Tartare is renowned worldwide).
I live in Nantes and i'll say that it's mostly lgbt friendly in the city center even though it's really hard to navigate public spaces at times when you're a Trans person!
nantes.description:
Nantes is a nice city in France that feels like a smaller version of Paris, but without the high prices—most things are about 30-50% cheaper! It’s a good place for families looking for quiet, but younger people might find it too calm after some time. The city center, especially around Place Graslin, is where the activity is, and it’s considered quite safe, so you don’t have to worry too much about safety.

While you might not have as many dining options as in larger cities, the local food scene has some good choices. Don’t miss La Cigale, which is known for its tasty Tartare. Nantes is also friendly to LGBT people, especially downtown, though some public areas can be difficult for transgender individuals.

Getting around can be a bit hard, as public transportation might not be very easy to use. So, travelers should keep that in mind. Overall, Nantes offers a calm atmosphere with some culture, making it a good place for anyone who wants to explore!
nantes.description_kor:
낭트는 프랑스의 매력적인 도시로, 파리의 소규모 버전이라고 느껴질 법하지만, 비교적 저렴한 물가가 큰 장점입니다. 대부분의 물가는 30-50% 정도 낮아서, 경제적으로 부담 없이 즐길 수 있습니다. 조용한 환경을 원하는 가족에게는 안성맞춤이며, 반면 젊은이들은 시간이 지나면서 조금 지루하게 느낄 수도 있습니다. 도시의 중심가인 플라스 그라슬랭(Place Graslin) 주변은 활기가 넘치고, 꽤 안전한 곳으로 알려져 있어 안전문제에 대해 너무 걱정할 필요는 없습니다.

다양한 식사 옵션은 대도시에 비해 부족할 수 있지만, 지역 음식 문화 속에서는 꽤 괜찮은 선택을 할 수 있습니다. 특히 맛있는 타르타르로 유명한 라 시갈(La Cigale)을 꼭 방문해보세요. 낭트는 시내에서 LGBT 친화적인 분위기를 자랑하며, 다만 일부 공공장소에서는 트랜스젠더 개인에게 어려움이 있을 수도 있습니다.

대중교통 이용이 조금 까다로울 수 있으니 여행자들은 이 점을 유의해야 합니다. 전반적으로 낭트는 편안한 분위기와 문화적 요소를 갖춘 곳으로, 탐험을 원하는 누구에게나 좋은 여행지가 될 것입니다!

reviews:
The town has been taken over by tourists. Local music venues that have been around for 50+ years are closing because they can't afford the rent hikes. Tourism + out of town developers are driving prices for locals up and the job market can't keep up (minimum wage is still $7.25 an hour.) It would be possible to increase minimum wage, protect small business, and local cost of living if the state wasn't controlled by conservative republicans who won't pass any useful legislation to aid with the economic divide. But sure, let's spend $500 million to build a brand a second football stadium. I digress.

If you do visit, please stay at a hotel instead of an Airbnb. Low-income neighborhoods are being bulldozed and gentrified by developers to build 4 story houses ideal for investment property owners seeking to rent it out as an Airbnb. (This impacts pricing for both local home buyers as well as renters.)

Last, but not least, PLEASE tip service industry workers (servers, drivers, performers, bartenders, etc.) If you can afford to visit, you can afford to tip. Thank you!
nashville.description:
Nashville, called Music City, has a lot of energy but also faces some problems. The live music scene is active, with places that have hosted famous performances. However, many existing venues are closing because rent is going up, caused by more tourism and new developments. Many locals worry that the local music scene is at risk due to changes in their neighborhoods.

The cost of living can be high for residents, especially since the minimum wage is still low, making it difficult for many to manage. It’s important to support small businesses when you can, as they add to what makes Nashville special. If you plan to visit, consider staying in hotels instead of Airbnbs; this helps keep the local community stronger.

When you’re in the city, remember that tipping service workers is important. If you enjoy the music and overall experience, show appreciation for those who make it enjoyable. Nashville’s charm comes from its people, culture, and the daily rhythm of life.
nashville.description_kor:
내슈빌, 흔히 '뮤직 시티'라고 불리는 이 도시는 활기찬 에너지를 가지고 있지만 몇 가지 문제에도 직면해 있습니다. 라이브 음악 현장은 정말 활발하며, 유명한 공연들이 열린 장소들도 많이 있습니다. 하지만 많은 기존 공연장들이 임대료 인상으로 인해 어려움을 겪고 있어 문을 닫고 있는 상황입니다. 이는 관광객의 증가와 새로운 개발로 인해 발생한 문제입니다. 지역 주민들 중에서는 이러한 변화로 인해 자칫 지역 음악 씬이 위험에 처할까 걱정하고 있는 이들도 많습니다.

생활비가 거주자들에게는 꽤나 부담이 될 수 있으며, 최저 임금이 여전히 낮기 때문에 많은 사람들이 기본적인 생계를 유지하기 어려운 실정입니다. 내슈빌의 매력을 더해주는 소규모 기업을 지원하는 것이 매우 중요합니다. 방문할 계획이 있다면 에어비앤비보다는 호텔에 머무는 것을 고려해 보는 것도 좋습니다. 이는 지역 사회를 더욱 튼튼하게 만드는데 도움이 될 겁니다.

그리고 이 도시를 방문할 때는 서비스 종업원에게 팁을 주는 것이 얼마나 중요한지를 꼭 기억해 주세요. 음악과 함께한 멋진 경험을 즐겼다면, 그 기쁨을 누리게 해준 사람들에 대한 감사의 마음을 표현하는 것도 좋습니다. 내슈빌의 진정한 매력은 그곳의 사람들, 풍부한 문화, 그리고 일상적인 삶의 리듬에서 비롯됩니다.

reviews:
I have been to a lot of cities and places around the world like London, NYC, LA but Nashik was the one that caught my eye. I stayed here for 14 naights and had the time of my life. The nightlife, car culture, bike community, people, essentially the best place I've ever been to.

Keep in mind that I am from Amsterdam and saying that Nashik is better means a lot!
nashik.description:
Nashik is a surprising place for many visitors with its lively atmosphere and friendly people. It is known for its wine, but the city offers much more. There is a fun nightlife with interesting bars, a strong car culture, and a close bike community for those who like to ride. The locals are nice, making it easy to feel comfortable.

Living in Nashik has benefits—low living costs and a mix of culture and modern life. However, like any city, it has some issues. Public transportation may not be very good, so be ready for some local travel if you depend on it. Safety is generally okay, but it's smart to be aware, just like in any busy place.

Make sure to see the important sites and local traditions while you are there! Visit the vineyards and take part in local festivals. Whether you enjoy food or history, Nashik has something for everyone. Just be ready for some language differences, and you will have a great time!
nashik.description_kor:
나시크는 활기찬 분위기와 친절한 사람들 덕분에 많은 방문객들에게 매력적인 장소입니다. 이 도시는 와인으로 유명하지만 그 이상으로 다양한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 신나는 바가 즐비한 밤문화, 자동차에 대한 열정이 넘치는 문화, 자전거 애호가들을 위한 친밀한 자전거 커뮤니티도 있습니다. 현지 사람들은 매우 친절해서 지내는 동안 편안하게 느낄 수 있습니다.

나시크에 살면 저렴한 생활비와 함께 문화와 현대적 생활이 조화를 이루는 이점이 있습니다. 그러나 모든 도시가 그렇듯 몇 가지 단점도 존재합니다. 대중교통이 그리 편리하지 않을 수 있으니 이 점을 고려해 현지 이동 수단을 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 안전은 대체로 괜찮지만 붐비는 장소에서는 항상 주의하는 것이 지혜로운 선택입니다.

그곳에 가게 된다면 꼭 중요한 명소와 지역 전통을 체험해 보세요! 포도밭을 방문하고 지역 축제에도 참여해 보시길 추천합니다. 음식이나 역사에 관심이 있든, 나시크는 모두를 위한 소중한 경험을 제공합니다. 언어 장벽이 걱정된다면 미리 준비해 두면 멋진 시간을 보낼 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: There are not a lot of places to work from, there are not many cafes. The city is not so fun, but the city is close to great dunes and beaches. The sitances are relatively long and since its always very hot it is not ideal to walk. My score would be nomad score would be 2.
natal.description:
Located in Brazil, Natal is a city with sunny beaches and large sand dunes, ideal for nature lovers. It may not have a lot of nightlife or busy cafés, but it is a great starting point for exploring the natural beauty around it. Many visitors enjoy the beautiful coast and the chance to spend calm days by the sea.

However, be careful that getting around can be difficult; distances can be long, and walking may not be the best choice in the heat. Make sure to plan your travel well, maybe by renting a car or using rideshare services to make it easier.

The cost of living here can change, and while it is usually not too high, the few local facilities might sometimes feel limiting. For those who enjoy peace and being close to nature, Natal is a good place. Just remember to drink enough water and find shade while exploring!
natal.description_kor:
브라질에 위치한 나탈은 자연을 사랑하는 이들에게 완벽한 맑은 해변과 멋진 모래언덕이 있는 도시입니다. 이곳은 활기찬 밤문화나 바쁜 카페는 많지 않지만, 주변의 아름다운 자연을 탐험하기 위한 훌륭한 출발점이죠. 많은 방문객들이 이곳의 아름다운 해안을 즐기며 해변가에서 여유로운 하루를 보낼 수 있는 기회를 누립니다.

하지만 이동이 다소 불편할 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다. 거리가 꽤 멀고 더위 속에서 걷는 것은 별로 추천하지 않아요. 여행 계획을 잘 세우고, 차를 렌트하거나 카풀 서비스를 이용하면 훨씬 더 편리할 것입니다.

이곳의 생활비는 다양하게 변동할 수 있지만, 대체로 그리 비싼 편은 아닙니다. 다만 몇몇 지역은 편의시설이 제한적일 수 있으니 참고하세요. 평화롭고 자연과 가까이 있는 환경을 즐기는 분들에게 나탈은 정말 좋은 장소입니다. 탐험할 때는 충분한 물을 챙기고 그늘을 찾아 휴식을 취하는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: I was in Neapol recently, the city has a lot of potential, the weather is nice, it is not far away from very nice places like Capri or Ischia. However, the city itself is chaotic, dirty, no traffic rules, I felt more like in SE Asia than in Western Europe. There is not much going on in the city, you can walk the main stuff in half a day. I do not recommend to stay here short term, definitely not long term. Use the airport and then go to some charming village which there are plenty in this part of Italy.
naples.description:
Naples is a city with a lively atmosphere and nice views, good for enjoying the Italian sun. Visitors like its great weather and closeness to places like Capri and Ischia, making it a good starting point for exploring the Amalfi Coast. However, those who prefer a relaxed vibe might find Naples a bit busy. With its crowded streets and easygoing approach to traffic rules, it can feel very hectic, similar to some parts of Southeast Asia instead of Western Europe.

You can see the main attractions in just a few hours, but take time to enjoy the local pizza places and active street life. Just note: the city isn’t very clean and may not be the best for long visits, as the pace can be quite fast. If you are staying longer, stick to the historical neighborhoods, but watch your belongings. Public transport is okay, but walking can be an adventure! Overall, Naples offers a mix of experiences, so enjoy the lively energy and then head to a nearby quiet village for some peace.
naples.description_kor:
나폴리는 생동감 넘치는 분위기와 아름다운 경치를 자랑하는 도시로, 이탈리아의 햇살을 만끽하기에 아주 좋은 곳입니다. 방문객들은 멋진 날씨와 카프리, 이스키아 같은 명소와의 접근성을 좋아해 아말피 해안 탐험의 훌륭한 출발점이 됩니다. 하지만 여유로운 분위기를 좋아하는 분들에게는 나폴리가 다소 혼잡하게 느껴질 수도 있습니다. 붐비는 거리와 느슨한 교통 규칙 덕분에 동남아시아의 일부 지역과 비슷하게 복잡하게 느껴질 수 있습니다.

주요 관광지는 몇 시간 안에 둘러볼 수 있지만, 현지 피자 가게와 활기찬 거리 생활을 즐길 시간을 꼭 가져보세요. 단, 나폴리는 조금 지저분한 편이어서 장기 체류를 고려할 경우 최선의 선택이 아닐 수 있습니다. 이곳의 분위기는 빠르게 흘러갈 수 있으므로, 오래 머무를 계획이라면 역사적인 동네를 중심으로 둘러보되, 소지품을 잘 챙기는 것이 중요합니다. 대중교통은 괜찮지만 걷는 것도 모험이 될 수 있으니 조심하세요! 전반적으로 나폴리는 다채로운 경험을 제공합니다. 활기찬 에너지를 만끽한 후에는 근처의 조용한 마을로 가서 평화를 찾는 것도 좋은 방법입니다.

reviews: I've been to New Orleans plenty of time as a tourist, but this is my first time being a digital nomad and working down here for 3 weeks. Something about New Orleans always brings me back. Such a unique and one-of-a-kind place that while has gotten more expensive over the years, still is far more affordable than many places in the US. A lot of cheap good fun to have here and some amazing food. I will admit your safety factor will depend heavily on the area you're staying at.
I've found it a great place to be a digital nomad. Good weather, great culture, creative people.
new-orleans.description:
New Orleans is a city that attracts many visitors. It is known for its lively culture, and offers a mix of music, food, and friendly people. Its unique history makes it stand out from other places in the U.S. While it has gotten a bit more expensive over the years, it is still more affordable than many other large cities.

The food is great—there are dishes like gumbo, beignets, and po'boys that are very tasty. The warm weather allows people to enjoy activities all year long! Just be aware that safety can differ by neighborhood, so it is wise to check on the area where you will stay.

Public transportation is not the best, but the city is easy to walk around, which adds to its charm. If you work online, it is a good place to be a digital nomad with a creative vibe. So enjoy a café au lait, listen to some jazz, and take in everything this city has to offer!
new-orleans.description_kor:
뉴올리언스는 많은 관광객들을 끌어들이는 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳은 활기찬 문화로 유명하며, 음악, 맛있는 음식, 그리고 친절한 사람들과 함께하는 특별한 경험을 제공합니다. 독특한 역사 덕분에 미국의 다른 도시에 비해 차별화된 매력을 가지고 있습니다. 시간이 지나면서 살짝 물가가 올랐지만, 여전히 많은 대도시들에 비해 저렴한 편입니다.

음식이 정말 뛰어난데, 특히 꽈배기, 베니에, 포보이 같은 맛있는 요리를 즐길 수 있습니다. 따뜻한 날씨 덕분에 방문객들은 연중 내내 다양한 야외 활동을 즐길 수 있습니다. 단, 동네마다 안전 상황이 다를 수 있으니, 숙소 위치는 미리 확인하는 것이 좋습니다.

대중교통은 잘 갖추어져 있지 않지만, 도시는 도보 이동이 용이해 걸어다니는 재미를 더해줍니다. 만약 온라인으로 일을 한다면, 창의적인 분위기가 가득한 이곳은 디지털 노마드에게 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다. 그러니 카페 오 레를 즐기며 재즈를 듣고, 뉴올리언스가 제공하는 모든 즐거움을 만끽해 보세요!

reviews:
Amazing beaches and fancy places. My favorite season here is fall since it has great sunsets and the sky is sunny everyday (perfect temperature). Early summer can be gloomy and a bit cold. Late summer is too hot 🔥
Good asian food around here since there are so many asians. Otherwise, most of the restaurants seem to copy each other's menus.
newport-beach.description:
Newport Beach is a nice place where you can enjoy the sun and see beautiful views. The beaches are great for relaxing, swimming, or walking. Fall is a popular time to visit, with clear skies and nice sunsets that brighten up the ocean. However, expect some cloudy days in early summer, and late summer can get hot.

Food lovers will be happy here, especially if you enjoy Asian food, thanks to the active local community. You might see that some restaurants have similar menus, which can feel a bit repetitive.

If you think about living here, keep in mind that while it is beautiful, the cost of living is quite high. Public transportation is not very good, so having a car is usually needed. In short, if you want a beach atmosphere with good food and nice sunsets, Newport Beach is a place to think about—but remember to consider the weather and costs!
newport-beach.description_kor:
뉴포트 비치는 태양을 만끽하고 아름다운 경치를 감상하기에 완벽한 곳입니다. 해변에서는 휴식을 취하거나 수영, 산책을 즐기기 좋습니다. 특히 가을에는 맑은 하늘과 바다를 배경으로 한 아름다운 일몰 때문에 방문하기 좋은 시기입니다. 다만, 초여름에는 흐린 날이 가끔 있고, 늦여름은 더 위로울 수 있습니다.

음식을 좋아하신다면 이곳에서 정말 행복하실 겁니다. 아시아 음식을 특히 좋아하신다면, 이곳의 활발한 커뮤니티 덕분에 더욱 만족할 수 있을 거예요. 하지만 일부 레스토랑에서 제공하는 메뉴가 비슷해서 조금 반복적인 느낌이 들 수도 있습니다.

이곳에서 살 생각이 있으시다면, 아름답기는 하지만 생활비가 꽤 높다는 점을 고려해야 합니다. 대중교통이 그리 좋은 편은 아니어서 차가 필요한 경우가 많습니다. 요약하자면, 맛있는 음식과 아름다운 일몰이 있는 해변 분위기를 원하신다면 뉴포트 비치는 정말 매력적인 곳입니다. 단, 날씨와 비용도 함께 고려하시는 걸 잊지 마세요!

reviews: you mean cheap alcohol ? :) to some people there is more to a great nightlife than that.
Any score of Newcastle nightlife which isn’t “good/great/fantastic” is not by anyone who knows the city. Newcastle has one of the best night scenes in all of Europe.
newcastle-upon-tyne.description:
Newcastle-upon-Tyne is a city that knows how to have fun. It has a nightlife that many consider among the best in Europe, with lively pubs and busy clubs full of friendly locals. If you like a lively atmosphere, this city has nights filled with music and laughter.

While the nightlife is great, living in Newcastle has both good and bad sides. The cost of living is usually affordable compared to other large UK cities, which is a positive. However, some people say that public transport can be unreliable, making it sometimes hard to get around.

Culturally, Newcastle has a rich history with its interesting buildings and friendly atmosphere. The local customs are warm and welcoming, so feel free to talk to people you meet. Just keep in mind that if you’re not from the UK, the Geordie accent may take some time to understand.

In general, Newcastle is a fun place full of things to do, whether you’re interested in history or nightlife, there are many enjoyable experiences waiting for you.
newcastle-upon-tyne.description_kor:
뉴캐슬 어폰 타인은 정말 즐길 줄 아는 도시입니다. 이곳은 유럽에서 가장 뛰어난 밤문화로 유명한데, 활기찬 펍과 친절한 지역 주민들이 가득한 바쁜 클럽들이 있습니다. 활기찬 분위기를 좋아하신다면, 이 도시는 음악과 웃음으로 가득한 밤을 즐길 수 있는 완벽한 장소입니다.

밤문화가 뛰어난 만큼 뉴캐슬에 살면서 겪는 장단점도 있습니다. 생활비는 일반적으로 다른 대형 영국 도시들에 비해 저렴한 편이라 긍정적인 요소로 꼽힙니다. 반면, 일부 사람들은 대중교통이 불안정할 수 있어 이동이 불편할 때가 있다고 말합니다.

문화적으로도 뉴캐슬은 흥미로운 건축물과 친근한 분위기를 지닌 풍부한 역사를 가지고 있습니다. 지역 주민들은 따뜻하고 환영하는 마음으로 다가오므로 자유롭게 이야기를 나눠보세요. 단, 만약 영국인이 아니라면 조디 억양을 이해하는 데 시간이 걸릴 수 있다는 점은 미리 알아두시는 게 좋습니다.

결론적으로, 뉴캐슬은 즐길 거리가 가득한 재미있는 장소입니다. 역사에 관심이 있든 밤문화에 흥미가 있든, 다양한 즐거운 경험이 여러분을 기다리고 있습니다.

reviews: City was cheap and pretty but there's not that many cafes to work from, plenty of tourists and it was hard to make friends. If you go here make sure to rent a motorbike and check out the nature but there are better places to live at in Vietnam.

Many Russians live here. Not the tattoo ones, mostly Russian families often with small kids. Many of them has small restaurants or shops.
