We stayed for one months and it wasn't great but it was also not too bad. We stayed in many places in Vietnam for long periods of time but in Nha Trang the locals are not very friendly. Especially the men are very macho and rude.
0.02$ for dinner?? Load of crap. Anyone who has been here or lives here knows that it is impossible. Who puts those calculations!? Totally unreliable
nha-trang.description:
Nha Trang is a city that has nice views and low living costs, making it a popular place for travelers. This coastal area has good beaches and a relaxed atmosphere, but if you want a busy café scene to work, you might be disappointed—there are not many good places for that. You will see many tourists, which can make it hard to meet locals.

Renting a motorbike is a good idea to explore the nature around and enjoy the views, but some visitors find the locals less friendly, especially some of the men. There are also many Russian families there; you will see them running small restaurants and shops. Eating out can be very cheap, but don’t expect those low prices to be completely accurate—things might be different when you order!

If you choose to visit Nha Trang, enjoy the beach and try to go to some less popular spots for a more real experience. Just be ready for some surprises along the way!
nha-trang.description_kor:
냐짱은 아름다운 풍경과 저렴한 생활비 덕분에 여행객들에게 많은 사랑을 받고 있는 도시입니다. 이 해변 지역은 훌륭한 해변과 편안한 분위기를 제공하지만, 바쁜 카페 환경에서 일을 하려는 분들에게는 아쉬울 수 있습니다. 좋은 카페가 많지 않아서 그렇죠. 또, 관광객이 많이 오기 때문에 현지인과의 만남이 쉽지 않을 수도 있습니다.

자연을 탐험하고 멋진 경치를 즐기기 위해 오토바이를 빌리는 것은 좋은 생각입니다. 하지만 일부 방문객들은 현지인들이 다소 불친절하다고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 특히 몇몇 남성들이 그럴 수 있죠. 그리고 많은 러시아 가족들이 이곳에서 작은 식당이나 가게를 운영하는 모습도 볼 수 있습니다. 외식 비용이 매우 저렴할 수는 있지만, 기대하는 만큼 항상 정확한 가격이 아닐 수도 있으니 주의하시는 게 좋습니다. 주문 시 상황에 따라 다르게 나올 수 있으니까요.

냐짱을 방문하신다면 해변에서의 여유뿐만 아니라 덜 알려진 장소도 탐험해 보세요. 또, 여정 중에 예상치 못한 일들이 생길 수도 있으니 준비하세요!

reviews: As an expat in Ningbo the past two years, these scores aren’t really accurate in my opinion. I can’t imagine thinking Ningbo wasn’t one of the most peaceful places or that it was unfit for children. Maybe a bit boring at times, but there’s a whole bar strip called “Laowaitan” which literally means Foreigner town full of bars and live music. Not sure who scored this city or what experience they might have had.
ningbo.description:
Ningbo is a nice place in China that offers a mix of quiet living and fun activities. One expat said it’s hard to think anyone would see it as not good for families, given the calm atmosphere and community spirit. Some might find it a little boring sometimes, but if you want a night out, the "Laowaitan" bar area is the best choice.

Living here is usually affordable, and public transportation is good, making it easy to get around. It is also safe, so you can explore without worry. Like many cities, there are some challenges, such as language barriers if you do not know Mandarin.

For those new to Ningbo, enjoy the local customs, especially the food! Visit the local markets, and don’t forget to see the beautiful temples in the area. In general, Ningbo offers a peaceful yet fulfilling experience, great for families and expats.
ningbo.description_kor:
닝보는 중국의 조용한 생활과 즐거운 활동이 잘 어우러진 멋진 도시입니다. 한 외국인은 이곳의 차분한 분위기와 공동체의 따뜻함을 고려할 때, 가족들에게 더할 나위 없이 좋은 장소라고 말했습니다. 물론, 일부 사람들은 가끔 지루하다고 느낄 수도 있지만, 외출을 원하신다면 "라오와이탄" 바 지역이 최고의 선택이 될 거예요.

닝보에서의 생활비는 일반적으로 저렴하고, 대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있어 이동도 편리합니다. 또한, 안전한 도시이기 때문에 걱정 없이 돌아다닐 수 있습니다. 많은 도시와 마찬가지로 만다린어를 잘 모르는 경우 언어 장벽 같은 몇 가지 도전 과제가 있을 수 있습니다.

닝보에 처음 오신다면 현지의 풍습과 특히 다양한 음식을 꼭 즐겨보시길 추천합니다! 현지 시장을 방문하고 아름다운 사원들도 꼭 들러보세요. 전체적으로 닝보는 가족과 외국인 모두에게 평화롭고 보람 있는 경험을 제공하는 곳입니다.

reviews: Also known as 'Havanna at the Waal' due to its leftist city council and progressive (ex-)student population.

Nijmegen is surrounded by nature. From the city center you have easy access to various walking routes and natural parks. Nijmegen is also situated at the Waal river and has several beaches to relax or go for a walk. The surroundings are ideal for sports like cycling, walking, running, rowing, swimming. etc. Unique place in the Netherlands.
nijmegen.description:
Located by the Waal river, Nijmegen attracts visitors with its mix of nature and active culture. Known as 'Havanna at the Waal,' this city has a lively feel because of its young, left-leaning community. If you enjoy the outdoors, you will be happy with the easy access to nice walking paths and parks right from the city center. Whether you like cycling, running, or just walking along the riverside, there are many things for everyone to enjoy.

On the other hand, some people might find living here to be a bit expensive compared to other Dutch cities. While public transportation is good, having a bike can really make your time here better—it is a common way to get around!

The neighborhoods, filled with local traditions and a welcoming feel, encourage you to visit different cafes and shops. Remember that English is commonly spoken, but knowing a few Dutch phrases can be useful. Overall, Nijmegen is a great place for anyone wanting to enjoy city life along with the beauty of nature!
nijmegen.description_kor:
와알 강 옆에 위치한 네이메헌은 자연과 활기찬 문화가 어우러져 방문객들을 매료시킵니다. '와알의 하바나'라는 별명을 가진 이 도시는 젊고 진보적인 커뮤니티 덕분에 생동감 넘치는 분위기를 자아냅니다. 야외 활동을 즐기는 분들은 도심에서 쉽게 접근할 수 있는 멋진 산책로와 공원 덕분에 기쁨을 느끼실 거예요. 자전거를 타거나, 달리기를 하거나, 강변을 따라 걷는 걸 좋아하신다면 여러 가지 즐길 거리가 준비되어 있습니다.

반면에, 일부 분들은 네이메헌의 생활비가 다른 네덜란드 도시들에 비해 조금 더 비싸다고 느낄 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 잘 되어 있지만, 자전거를 가지면 이곳에서 훨씬 더 편리하게 생활할 수 있어요. 자전거는 이동의 주요 수단이랍니다!

지역의 전통과 환영하는 분위기로 가득한 이웃들은 여러분을 다양한 카페와 상점으로 이끌 것입니다. 영어가 널리 사용되긴 하지만, 몇 가지 네덜란드어 표현을 알고 있으면 더욱 좋습니다. 전반적으로 네이메헌은 자연의 아름다움과 도시 생활을 즐기고 싶은 모든 이에게 훌륭한 장소입니다!

reviews: Stay away from this urban village.
noida.description:
Noida is a city that often feels like a small urban area, which is both a good thing and a problem. Many visitors like its fast development and modern facilities, making basic needs easy to meet. However, some people have concerns about the speed of change, with overcrowding becoming a problem, especially in busy areas.

With a growing culture and lively markets, Noida has good shopping and eating options. You can find everything from local street food to nice restaurants. Public transportation, like the metro, connects you to Delhi, but it does not cover every part of the city.

Safety is usually okay, but it’s smart to stay aware, especially at night. When you are out and about, it helps to know some basic Hindi phrases, as language differences can sometimes arise.

If you choose to explore Noida, visit the parks and enjoy the calm they provide. While living or visiting here can be interesting, just be ready for the busy atmosphere that comes with it!
noida.description_kor:
노이다는 종종 작은 도시처럼 느껴지는 곳으로, 이곳에는 좋은 점과 함께 해결해야 할 문제점도 있습니다. 많은 방문객들이 노이다의 빠른 발전과 현대적인 시설을 좋아하며, 기본적인 필요를 쉽게 충족할 수 있습니다. 반면 일부 주민들은 변화의 속도에 대한 우려를 표하며, 특히 번화한 지역에서는 인구 과밀이 큰 문제로 부각되고 있습니다.

그러나 노이다는 점점 더 성장하는 문화와 활기찬 시장 덕분에 다양한 쇼핑과 식사 옵션이 마련되어 있습니다. 길거리 음식부터 고급 레스토랑까지 다양한 선택지가 많아 즐거운 경험을 할 수 있습니다. 물론 지하철 같은 대중교통이 델리와 연결되어 있지만, 도시의 모든 지역을 아우르지는 못합니다.

안전은 대체로 괜찮지만, 특히 밤에는 조심하는 것이 좋습니다. 외출할 때 기본적인 힌디어 문구를 알고 있으면 유용할 수 있습니다. 언어의 장벽이 때때로 문제를 일으킬 수 있으니까요.

노이다를 탐험하기로 마음먹으셨다면, 공원을 방문해 그곳의 평온함을 만끽해 보세요. 여기에서 생활하거나 방문하는 것은 흥미로운 경험이 될 수 있지만, 그와 함께하는 바쁜 분위기에 잘 대비하시기 바랍니다!

reviews:
I spent a month working remotely from Nice and really loved it. The beach is fantastic, grocery stores are a couple mins walk from nearly everywhere you could be in the city, wifi is good and the train access to Menton, Eze, etc. or quick drive to provence makes getting around to explore the region super easy. 

The only things I learned from my time and would think about next time:
- if you go in May, you will wish you had air conditioning because it gets pretty hot in the evenings and the city is lively, so you'll hear all of the happenings if you're relying on open windows, and you'll wake up with lots of mosquito bites
- Bed bugs were a thing more than I would have expected - I had a friend visit and get them from their airbnb, and two other friends who also got bed bugs from their spot, so keep an eye out.

Paris had originally disappointed me as a traveler, but if you have some proficiency with French, you should definitely come and visit Nice or any other place outside of the big cities in France as there will be more genuine people along with some history and cultural foods you can try.
nice.description:
Nice, a sunny city on the French Riviera, has great beaches, a lively culture, and easy access to nearby towns like Menton and Eze. If you can work remotely from here, you will enjoy the small grocery stores close by and the good wifi that keeps you connected while you enjoy the Mediterranean atmosphere.

Evenings can be warm, especially in May, making air conditioning helpful. If you choose to open windows, be ready for some noise from nightlife and a few mosquito bites. When it comes to where to stay, watch out for bed bugs—it’s smart to check before going to sleep.

While living costs can be high, spending time in Nice is worth it for the rich history, local food, and friendly culture. Knowing some French is helpful here, as it helps you connect with locals and find interesting places. Just remember to explore the neighborhoods and enjoy the unique character this city has!
nice.description_kor:
니스는 프랑스 리비에라에 위치한 햇살 가득한 도시로, 아름다운 해변과 활기찬 문화, 그리고 멘톤과 에즈와 같은 매력적인 인근 마을들도 쉽게 접근할 수 있습니다. 만약 이곳에서 원격 근무를 한다면, 근처의 작은 식료품점에서 쇼핑을 즐기고 지중해의 분위기를 만끽하며 당신에게 필요한 안정적인 와이파이도 이용할 수 있을 것입니다.

저녁 시간대에는 특히 5월에 따뜻할 수 있기 때문에 에어컨이 유용할 수 있습니다. 만약 창문을 열기로 했다면, 밤문화에서 오는 소음과 모기에 물릴 수 있는 점을 감안해야 합니다. 숙소를 고를 때는 침대 벌레에 대비해 미리 점검하는 것이 좋습니다.

생활비는 다소 높을 수 있지만, 니스에서의 경험은 풍부한 역사와 지역 음식, 그리고 친근한 문화 덕분에 충분히 그만한 가치가 있습니다. 프랑스어를 조금이라도 알고 있다면 지역 주민들과의 소통이 더 원활해지고 흥미로운 장소를 발견하는 데에도 큰 도움이 됩니다. 이 도시의 독특한 매력을 즐기며 동네 탐험을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: A friendly city. Felt safe. Older generation especially friendly and usually ready to help.
norwich.description:
Located in East Anglia, Norwich is a nice city that feels friendly and welcoming. Many visitors talk about how kind the local people are, especially older residents who are happy to help or share a smile while you explore. Safety is also a positive point, as many feel comfortable walking around its cobbled streets.

The mix of history and culture here is interesting. Be sure to see the Norwich Cathedral and the lively marketplace. While the cost of living is fair, some people say that staying in the town center can be expensive, so keep this in mind when making plans.

Public transport is okay, but some travelers find it limited, so walking or biking is a good option to enjoy the sights. If you want a nice neighborhood, the Riverside area has a mix of cozy cafes and local shops. A small tip: try to learn a few local phrases—people here appreciate it! So, whether you're visiting for a weekend or longer, Norwich welcomes you!
norwich.description_kor:
동부 앵글리아에 위치한 노리치는 정말 아늑하고 따뜻한 느낌을 주는 도시입니다. 많은 방문객들이 특히 노인 주민들이 얼마나 친절한지, 그리고 도움을 주거나 탐험하는 동안 그들과 나누는 미소에 대해 이야기합니다. 이곳은 안전한 환경 덕분에 많은 사람들이 자갈길을 걸으면서 편안함을 느낍니다.

노리치는 역사와 문화가 어우러지는 모습이 매력적입니다. 노리치 대성당과 활기찬 시장은 꼭 한 번 들러보세요. 생활비는 적당한 편이지만, 일부 사람들은 시내 중심가에서의 숙박이 비쌀 수 있다고 하니, 계획할 때 참고하세요.

대중교통은 나쁘지 않지만, 일부 여행자들은 다소 불편하게 느낄 수도 있습니다. 그러므로 걸어 다니거나 자전거를 타고 경치를 즐기는 것이 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다. 좋은 동네를 찾고 계신다면 리버사이드 지역에는 아늑한 카페와 지역 상점들이 함께 있습니다. 작은 조언을 드리자면, 몇 가지 현지어 구문을 배워가면 사람들이 정말 고마워합니다! 주말에 방문하시든 더 오랫동안 머무르시든, 노리치는 여러분을 언제나 환영합니다!

reviews: It's a gem! Niš is a tiny city full of green places to walk and friendly people. Cost of living is ridiculously cheap (current $2,137 / month listed here in nomadlist is probably wrong, as you can live here comfortably for half of that or even less, even living in the main street in downtown and eating out everyday).

Niš is not very touristic though you'll have to check the skull tower. The fortress is a nice place to hang out during the summer.
The locals are very smiling and friendly with foreigners (there aren't many foreigners around).
It's quite cheap overall and it has a medium city vibe.
It's super clean in the streets.
nis.description:
Located in Serbia, Niš is a small city that can appeal to you with its parks and friendly people. Life here is quite affordable—many people say they can live comfortably on just half of the average monthly budget you would need in larger cities. Imagine this: you could eat out every day, visit lively neighborhoods, and still stay within your budget!

Although it may not be a busy tourist spot, Niš has interesting sites to explore. Be sure to visit the Skull Tower, a historic site, and the fortress, which is good for a summer walk or a calm afternoon. The welcoming atmosphere is clear; locals often smile and greet visitors, making it pleasant for everyone.

While Niš is clean and has a relaxed, medium-sized city feel, keep in mind that English is not always commonly spoken, which might be a small challenge. But with its affordable living and friendly community, this city is truly a hidden gem worth exploring!
nis.description_kor:
세르비아의 니시(Niš)는 공원과 친절한 사람들로 매력을 더하는 아기자기한 도시입니다. 이곳에서의 생활비는 매우 저렴하기 때문에 많은 사람들이 큰 도시에서 드는 평균 월세의 절반으로도 편안하게 지낼 수 있다고 말합니다. 상상해보세요! 매일 외식을 즐기고 활기찬 동네를 돌아다니면서도 예산 내에서 여유로운 생활을 할 수 있습니다.

비록 인기 관광지와는 거리가 있지만, 니시에는 탐험할 만한 흥미로운 장소들이 많습니다. 역사적인 해골탑(Skull Tower)과 아늑한 오후에 산책하기 좋은 성곽은 꼭 방문해봐야 할 명소입니다. 이곳은 따뜻한 환영의 분위기가 느껴지며, 현지인들도 미소로 방문객들을 맞이해줘서 누구나 즐거운 경험을 할 수 있습니다.

니시는 깨끗하고 여유로운 중소도시의 매력을 지니고 있지만, 영어가 항상 통용되지는 않아 약간의 언어적 도전이 있을 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 저렴한 생활비와 우호적인 지역 사회 덕분에 이 도시는 정말 탐험할 가치가 있는 숨겨진 보석입니다!

reviews: This is a really cute little city with friendly people, high level of English and good prices. Restaurants were so-so, smoking everywhere which is terrible if you want to be able to eat your meal without choking on smoke, and bad air quality in winter. Beyond those two negative points, it has a lot to offer.
Amazing city! So cute and friendly...ppl speak good english , food, drinks and taxis are so cheap. Plenty of airbnbs
novi-sad.description:
In Serbia, Novi Sad is a small city that is known for its friendly people and welcoming feel. Visitors find it easy to get around because many locals speak English. The prices are also low, making it a good place for those who want to explore without spending too much money.

However, some travelers mention that the restaurant options can vary, and many places allow smoking indoors. This may not be ideal if you want to eat in a smoke-free environment. Also, be aware that the air quality can be poor during the winter.

Despite these issues, there is a lot to see and do! The city has a young and relaxed atmosphere, with many affordable Airbnbs available. There are historical sites and local traditions to experience. Just remember to enjoy the culture while keeping your airways clear! Overall, Novi Sad offers friendly people, interesting culture, and low prices, making it a good choice for a visit.
novi-sad.description_kor:
세르비아의 노비사드는 친절한 사람들과 따뜻한 분위기로 유명한 작은 도시입니다. 이곳을 방문하는 관광객들은 많은 현지인들이 영어를 할 수 있어서 편리하게 돌아다닐 수 있습니다. 가격이 저렴해서 많은 비용을 들이지 않고도 다양한 곳을 탐험할 수 있는 좋은 장소입니다.

하지만 일부 여행자들은 레스토랑의 선택지가 다양하지 않다고 언급하며, 많은 식당에서 실내 흡연을 허용하는 점이 불편할 수 있다고 말합니다. 흡연이 없는 환경에서 식사를 원하시는 분들께는 적합하지 않을 수 있습니다. 또한, 겨울철에는 공기 질이 좋지 않을 수 있다는 점도 유념해야 합니다.

이런 단점에도 불구하고 볼거리와 할 일이 많습니다! 노비사드는 젊고 여유로운 분위기로 가득하며, 저렴한 에어비앤비 숙소도 많이 있습니다. 역사적인 장소와 지역 전통을 경험하며, 건강한 공기를 마시며 문화를 즐길 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 노비사드는 친절한 사람들, 흥미로운 문화, 저렴한 가격 덕분에 방문하기 좋은 도시입니다.

reviews: Loved this city! It is not big although has great nightlife, coworkings, amazing streetart and is quite cheap. Although, when I visited in December 2021 they had problems with garbage removal.

Oaxaca is a charming little city full of history and culture. The internet here is strong and reliable and there is a cafe for work from seemingly on every street in El Centro. The food is by far the best in all of Mexico; be sure to try all seven different moles and find your favorite. The only minor downside is that there is are frequent political protests which often block the traffic outside the historical center. However, I never once felt unsafe there. Oaxaca is also the mezcal center of Mexico try "pechuga" which is distilled across a turkey imparting a distinctive umami flavor. I will definitely return to Oaxaca!

Oaxaca is probably the most underrated city for digital nomads in all of Mexico, or maybe I just stayed in the right neighborhood. I stayed in Jalatlaco, a foodie district and I can say that I am blown away by the experience staying in Oaxaca. Oaxaca is full or arts, artisans and creatives. It still has the small town feel but everywhere you look, theres art everywhere and these little piece of details brings a great touch of what could have been a regular town. It doesnt have any malls, but this place is highly livable and walkable. At night, there are salsa dance class in the neighborhood, coffee culture and did i say arts? Oaxaca is the most charming underrated city I have ever been in Mexico! I can easily see myself staying for 6 months in this place each year.

Oaxaca is one of a kind. It's a gorgeous city, incredible culture and the best mexican food around. It's cheap, clean, walkable and has quick wifi. I fell in love with this city. In my opinion, it has a Chiang Mai vibe except smaller and cleaner.
Oaxaca is magical! Tons of cute cafes, rooftop restaurants with gorgeous views of mountains and cathedrals, cheap, beautiful.

Oaxaca is a city of arts, in its style, vibe and people it attracts. It has a wonderfully peaceful and relaxed atmosphere. I was here for a few months and really enjoyed it. I am more a business type of guy but if I'd be more relaxed I could image spending a few years here.

I disagree greatly with Oaxaca not being family friendly in the pros and cons - it's extremely family friendly! There's a free children's Museum, a children's library, plenty of indoor play spaces, lovely playgrounds and the culture itself loves kids.
oaxaca.description:
Oaxaca is a unique place in Mexico with a lot of history and culture. Although it is small, this city has a lively nightlife and interesting street art. You can find many cafes with good WiFi on almost every corner, which is great for people who want to work online. And the food—Oaxaca is a great place for food lovers! Make sure to try all seven types of mole; it is some of the best in the country.

The feel of the city is relaxed and welcoming, with art and creativity all around. Areas like Jalatlaco have many restaurants and a local atmosphere that will make you feel comfortable. The city is easy to walk around and clean, but be aware there may be some roadblocks because of protests.

Like any city, it has its problems. Sometimes garbage collection can be a problem, and public transport is not very good. But safety is mostly not an issue, and families will find plenty of places for kids to enjoy. Overall, Oaxaca is a wonderful city where you might find yourself feeling very happy!
oaxaca.description_kor:
오악사는 역사와 문화가 풍부한 멕시코의 독특한 장소로, 작지만 활기찬 밤문화와 흥미로운 거리 예술로 가득 차 있습니다. 거의 모든 모퉁이에 좋은 WiFi가 갖춰진 카페가 많아, 온라인으로 일하고자 하는 분들에게는 최적의 환경을 제공합니다. 그리고 음식! 오악사는 음식 애호가들에게 환상적인 천국입니다. 일곱 가지 종류의 몰레는 꼭 한번 맛보셔야 할 지역 특산물로, 전국적으로도 손꼽히는 맛입니다.

이 도시의 분위기는 편안하고 환영받는 느낌을 줍니다. 예술과 창의력이 넘치는 곳인데, 특히 할라틀라코 지역은 여러 레스토랑과 아늑한 분위기 덕분에 편안히 시간을 보낼 수 있는 곳입니다. 도시는 걷기 좋고 깨끗하지만, 가끔 시위로 인해 도로가 차단되는 경우도 있으니 그 점은 유의하셔야 합니다.

어떤 도시든 문제는 있기 마련이지만, 가끔 쓰레기 수거나 대중교통이 불편할 수 있다는 점은 감안해야 합니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 안전 문제는 대부분 걱정할 필요가 없으며, 가족 단위로 즐길 수 있는 장소도 많아 아이들과 함께 하기 좋은 곳입니다. 전반적으로 오악사는 매우 행복한 기분을 느낄 수 있는 멋진 도시입니다!

reviews: It is a really nice city, as a resort, it has really cool vibe going on and the overall impression that it is a lively city, especially in the summer. The old town is really beautiful, the nightlife is also great. Can't remember the last time I had such a good nightlife experience, the bars and clubs are at a high level. Overall everyday people are friendly and nice to talk, however, about 50 percent don't speak English. I was lucky that I know some Russian, in some places which are highly rated even staff couldn't understand a word in English. The place is worth a visit, but have a precaution at all times, as scams are happening, especially at restaurants and bars for the foreigners. While I visited the strategy was to go to the places which only have really high ratings in trip advisor, so by doing that I avoided places that might scam, and the experience overall was good. If the place from the foreigns is not rated highly enough, just better be safe and plan in advance where to go. I tried working there also, so managed to get some cozy cafes in town with decent internet.

It's a nice city on the whole. In summertime you get a lot of tourists from Ukraine, and also other countries. The cost of living is reasonable, a standard meal in a decent restaurant will cost you about 200uah. Internet is fast and good quality, currently you can get a 4g data sim with unlimited data from Kievstar for 100uah for a month. Accommodation can be hard to come by and expensive during the summer months. It's largely safe, but Odessa is historically a criminal city, but most of that crime is not at street level. There have been increasing numbers of reports of foreigners having their drink drugged by "ladies of the night". Common sense prevails and you should not walk around quiet areas of the city at ngiht whilst inebriated.

Charming old town, with a italian/french architecture, the rest is Soviet style + it has a multiethnic diverse community inside it. Cheap cafes + restaurants/pubs and so on. The narrow streets + the main pedestrian side are a beauty in disguise so you people should take the chance in seeing it.
There are more than 5 nice specialty cafes with wifi and good vibe where Aeropress coffee is less than US$2. Decent hostels, and milder weather than in Kiev.
odessa.description:
Odessa is an active city on the Black Sea, especially busy in the summer. This city has a nice atmosphere with its old town, featuring a mix of Italian and French buildings that are good for walking around. The nightlife is memorable, with many bars and clubs that are open all night. 

Most local people are nice and ready to talk, but not everyone speaks English, so knowing some Russian can help you connect better. Be careful of scams, especially in popular tourist areas. Sticking to well-rated places or planning ahead can help you avoid problems. 

In terms of costs, Odessa is affordable—about 200 UAH for a good meal. Wi-Fi is fast and available in many cafes, and if you are careful at night, you can safely enjoy this diverse city with a rich history. Just stay in well-lit areas if you are out late, and you will have a great time enjoying what Odessa has to offer!
odessa.description_kor:
오데사는 검은해에 위치한 활기찬 도시로, 특히 여름철에는 많은 관광객들로 북적입니다. 이곳의 구시가지에는 이탈리아와 프랑스 스타일의 건축물이 어우러져 있어, 아늑하게 걸으며 산책하기에 최적의 장소입니다. 또 밤문화도 인상적이며, 많은 바와 클럽이 새벽까지 열려 있습니다.

대부분의 현지인들은 친절하고 대화를 나누고 싶어 하지만, 영어를 할 수 있는 사람이 많지 않으므로 약간의 러시아어를 아는 것이 소통에 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 특히 인기 있는 관광지에서는 사기에 조심하는 것이 좋습니다. 평판이 좋은 숙소에 묵거나 미리 계획을 세우면 불필요한 문제를 피할 수 있습니다.

비용 면에서는 오데사가 꽤 저렴합니다. 맛있는 식사를 위해선 약 200 UAH 정도면 충분하고, 많은 카페에서 빠른 Wi-Fi를 이용할 수 있습니다. 밤에 조심해서 다닌다면 이 역사적인 도시를 안전하게 즐길 수 있습니다. 늦은 시간에 외출할 경우에는 밝게 조명이 된 지역에 머무르면 오데사가 제공하는 다양한 즐길 거리를 만끽하며 멋진 시간을 보낼 수 있을 거예요!

reviews:
The downtown is cute and fun to visit. Besides "Historic 25th Street"(where some scenes of the show Yellowstone were filmed) and the two or three blocks surrounding it, the city is not walkable. There's a lot of fun things to see throughout the year like the Ogden Twilight Concert set in summer, and the Farmers market. Or around Christmas time the city and a bunch of companies put up a 'Christmas Village' which is super fun for kids.
On the other side of things, there are a lot of outspoken right-wingers. The types that have let's go brandon stickers on their trucks and such.
ogden.description:
Ogden is a nice place that combines history with a fun atmosphere. Start your visit on Historic 25th Street, where you can enjoy some local culture—fun fact: a few scenes from the show Yellowstone were filmed here! The downtown area is busy, especially during the summer Ogden Twilight Concerts and the Farmers Market. If you’re visiting in the winter, don’t miss the Christmas Village, which is enjoyable for both kids and adults.

There is a lot to see, but remember that the city is not easy to walk around, so having a car can be useful for exploring. Be ready for different opinions from locals, as the community includes some strong right-wing voices, which might surprise some visitors.

Overall, Ogden is a good place to visit, with special events and a friendly downtown. Just remember to respect local customs and plan your visits to enjoy this interesting city!
ogden.description_kor:
오그던은 역사와 즐거운 분위기가 잘 어우러진 멋진 장소입니다. 방문을 시작하신다면, 역사적인 25번가에서 현지 문화를 만끽해 보세요. 흥미로운 사실 하나: 인기 드라마 "옐로스톤"의 몇 장면이 이곳에서 촬영되었답니다! 다운타운은 특히 여름철 오그던 트와일라잇 콘서트와 농산물 시장 기간에 매우 활기차고 붐비게 됩니다. 겨울에 오신다면 어린이와 어른 모두가 즐길 수 있는 크리스마스 마을도 놓치지 마세요.

볼거리가 많지만 이 도시가 걷기에 다소 불편할 수 있다는 점을 알아두세요. 탐험하기 위해서는 차가 있는 것이 매우 유용합니다. 또, 지역 주민들로부터 다양한 의견을 들을 준비를 하셔야 해요. 커뮤니티에는 강한 보수 성향의 주민들이 있어 일부 방문객들은 적잖이 놀랄 수도 있습니다.

전반적으로 오그던은 특별한 행사와 따뜻한 다운타운이 있는 매력적인 방문지입니다. 지역 문화를 존중하면서 이 흥미로운 도시를 더욱 즐기기 위해 세심하게 방문 계획을 세우는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Best city to live in Europe if you don't like bigger cities and capitals. Smaller, compact, but not much missing compared to the big ones, and super beautiful and peaceful. Maybe a bit isolated but with an international airport, though. Transport is amazing, mainly due to its subway system - yes, it has a subway system, something that bigger cities like Frankfurt, Koeln, Duesseldorf or Stuttgart don't. A true gem of a place, plus somehow unspoiled yet!
nuremberg.description:
Located in southern Germany, Nuremberg is a city that has a mix of history and culture in a comfortable setting. If you like a city that is not too big or busy like larger capitals, this could be a good choice for you. Nuremberg is small and attractive, with nice buildings that are both impressive and calming.

One of the best things about living here is the good public transportation system, especially the subway. It’s efficient for a city of its size, making it easy to move around without the noise and crowd found in bigger cities like Frankfurt or Cologne. While some say it can feel a bit isolated, the international airport keeps you connected to other places.

The cost of living here is reasonable, but some may find it a bit higher than in other German cities. Overall, Nuremberg is a welcoming place where you can experience local life—be sure to check out its special traditions and learn about its history, especially the lovely old town. Just be prepared to learn some German words, as you might face language barriers sometimes.
nuremberg.description_kor:
독일 남부에 위치한 뉘른베르크는 편안한 분위기 속에서 역사와 문화가 아름답게 어우러진 도시입니다. 대도시처럼 크고 번잡한 곳을 선호하지 않는다면, 이곳이 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다. 뉘른베르크는 작지만 매력적인 도시이며, 인상적이면서도 차분한 건물들이 가득합니다.

여기에서 살면서 가장 큰 장점 중 하나는 뛰어난 대중교통 시스템, 특히 지하철입니다. 이 도시의 규모에 비해 교통이 편리해서, 프랑크푸르트나 쾰른 같은 더 큰 도시의 소음과 혼잡함 없이 쉽게 이동할 수 있습니다. 일부 사람들은 제가 위치해 있어 약간 고립된 느낌을 받을 수도 있지만, 국제공항이 있어 다양한 곳과 잘 연결되어 있습니다.

생활비는 합리적인 편이지만, 다른 독일 도시들보다 약간 높은 편이라고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 전반적으로 뉘른베르크는 지역 사회의 삶을 경험하기에 좋은 장소이며, 독특한 전통과 사랑스러운 구시가지의 역사에 대해 알아보는 것을 추천합니다. 다만, 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으니 독일어 단어를 미리 배우는 준비가 필요할 수 있습니다.

reviews: I don’t recommend living here full time. The summers are unbearably hot and humid and you have to drive 1+ hours to the closest beach. Actually, you have to drive everywhere because everything is a 20+ min drive. Traffic is terrible and everything is under construction. There are lots of bugs, mosquitos, gators, roaches, etc… You can be here for months and not do all the different entertainment, restaurants, experiences the Orlando area has to offer. Disney, Universal, SeaWorld, Legoland, Fun Spot… the list goes on and on.

Orlando has lots to do, but it is very spaced out and requires a car to get around. This fact is obvious by the constant traffic. The airport has great access, but is always extremely busy. Visit a few times to see Disney and Universal, but there are many other cities I'd prefer to live and spend more time in.
orlando.description:
Orlando is a city full of energy, known for its popular theme parks like Disney, Universal, and SeaWorld. If you enjoy attractions, you will always find something fun to do. Visitors like the wide range of activities – from family-friendly fun at Legoland to exciting rides at Fun Spot. However, be ready for the heat and humidity in the summer; it can be uncomfortable for some people. Also, if you are considering moving here, remember that you will need a car. Most attractions and services require driving, and traffic can be heavy, especially with construction happening.

While Orlando is a nice place for a vacation, living here all the time has its difficulties. The cost of living can be high, especially if you want to be close to the attractions. Safety can differ from one neighborhood to another, so it is important to do some research before choosing a place to live. Overall, for great experiences and some fun culture, Orlando is a good place to visit, but it may not be the best place to live permanently.
orlando.description_kor:
올랜도는 활기 넘치는 도시로, 디즈니, 유니버설 스튜디오, 씨월드와 같은 인기 테마파크로 잘 알려져 있습니다. 놀이기구를 좋아하는 분이라면 항상 즐길거리가 넘치는 곳이죠. 방문객들은 레고랜드에서 가족과 함께하는 재미부터, 다양한 짜릿한 놀이기구가 있는 펀 스팟까지 여러 가지 활동을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 하지만 여름철의 무더위와 습도에는 미리 대비해야 합니다. 이로 인해 불편함을 느낄 수도 있습니다. 또한, 이곳으로 이사할 계획이 있다면 자동차가 필수라는 점도 염두에 두세요. 대부분의 명소와 서비스에 가기 위해서는 운전해야 하며, 특히 공사 중일 때는 교통체증이 심할 수 있습니다.

올랜도는 여행지로는 정말 좋은 곳이지만, 여기서 오랫동안 살기에는 몇 가지 어려움이 있습니다. 생활비가 꽤 높을 수 있는데, 특히 주요 명소와 가까운 지역에 살고 싶다면 더 큰 부담이 될 수 있습니다. 또, 안전 문제는 동네마다 차이가 있으니, 거주할 지역을 선택하기 전에 철저한 조사가 필요합니다. 전반적으로 올랜도는 훌륭한 경험과 즐거운 문화를 제공하는데, 이곳에서 영구적으로 살기에는 최적의 장소가 아닐 수도 있습니다.

reviews: Stay 3 months. Great stay with everything you need. Great food and transportation like any japanese city. I think it's better positioned than Tokyo to visit the highlights of the country. Has everything a digital nomad needs and more. I'm not much of partier but their is a scene with all music genres. People are very friendly but of course helps if you can speak Japanese. Don't have any cons. Would definitely recommend.

Pros: Friendly people, safe, stable government, efficient and fast public transportation, established foreigner (gaijin) population due many English teachers, many great food options, many festivals (cherry blossom fest), onsens!

Cons: Expensive, work til you die at your desk mentality, drunken businessman culture, groping on packed public transit, lack of mental health services so be cautious around the destitute, over sexualization of underage females, high risk if caught with illegal substances, short tourist visa but just pop over to South Korea and return to renew another 3 months.

its very possible to be a digital nomad in japan - 3 months tourist visa on arrival.
free wifi at starbucks. who's stopping you?
lovely people, amazing food, and the worlds richest culture.
just say you're a tourist. its not as if you are an immigrant.
It's impossible to be a digital nomad in Japan - no visa allows it, and the country is extremely strict on immigration.
osaka.description:
Osaka is a lively city with great food, friendly people, and a good transportation system that makes it easy to get around. Whether you enjoy street food at Dotonbori or taking part in a cherry blossom festival, there is a lot to see and do. Many visitors say that Osaka is easier to explore than Tokyo, making it a good starting point for seeing Japan.

While life in Osaka is fun, be aware of the city's high costs and some cultural differences, like the strong work ethic that can feel demanding. You might face language barriers, so knowing a few Japanese phrases can help. The city is generally safe, but crowded trains can be a bit overwhelming.

For those exploring the city, areas like Namba and Umeda are full of activity and great food. If you plan to stay longer, you can easily travel to South Korea for a quick visa renewal. Overall, Osaka is an interesting mix of old and new, ideal for anyone wanting to experience its rich culture.
osaka.description_kor:
오사카는 맛있는 음식과 친절한 사람들이 가득한 활기찬 도시로, 편리한 교통 시스템 덕분에 이동이 매우 용이합니다. 도톤보리의 길거리 음식이나 벚꽃 축제에 참여하는 것을 좋아하신다면, 여기서 볼거리와 할거리가 넘쳐납니다. 많은 여행자들은 오사카가 도쿄보다 탐험하기 쉬운 곳이라고 입을 모으며, 일본 여행을 시작하기에 안성맞춤인 도시로 추천합니다.

오사카에서의 생활은 즐거운 부분이 많지만, 높은 생활비와 강력한 근무 윤리 같은 문화적 차이점을 염두에 두어야 합니다. 언어 장벽도 존재할 수 있어, 몇 가지 일본어 문구를 알아두면 큰 도움이 됩니다. 이 도시는 대체로 안전하지만, 혼잡한 지하철과 기차는 조금 부담스러울 수 있습니다.

도시를 탐방할 때는 난바와 우메다 지역에서 다양한 활동과 맛있는 음식을 즐길 수 있습니다. 만약 더 오래 머무를 계획이라면, 한국으로 단기 비자 갱신을 쉽게 할 수 있는 점도 장점입니다. 오사카는 오래된 것과 새로운 것이 절묘하게 어우러진 매력적인 도시로, 풍부한 문화를 경험하고 싶어하는 누구에게나 최적의 장소입니다.

reviews: Ottawa downtown is full of opioid addicts , mentally ill and homeless. Dirty and smelly - Goto Montreal instead !

Very clean city. Internet varies from medium fast to high speed. Public transport is improving greatly. Personal liberties are high, very safe for women and LGBT folk, not that expensive. Winters can be tough.
ottawa.description:
Ottawa has a mix of strengths and weaknesses. People who have spent time in the city often talk about the downtown area, where there are many things to do, but some have raised issues about homelessness and cleanliness. However, don’t let that stop you!

On the positive side, Ottawa is known for being safe, especially for women and the LGBTQ+ community, creating a welcoming environment. The cost of living is quite low compared to other large cities, and internet service is good, with speeds from medium to high.

Public transportation is improving, making it easier to visit important places like Parliament Hill and the Rideau Canal. Winters can be harsh, so dress warmly if you are visiting then!

A local tip is to explore the different neighborhoods, which show Ottawa’s culture and history. If you want a friendly and diverse city with its own unique features, Ottawa is definitely worth a visit!
ottawa.description_kor:
오타와는 강점과 약점이 공존하는 도시입니다. 이 도시에 시간을 보낸 사람들은 종종 다운타운 지역의 다양한 볼거리들에 대해 이야기하지만, 일부는 홈리스 문제와 청결에 대해 언급하기도 합니다. 그러나 그러한 점들이 여러분의 방문을 망치게 하지는 않기를 바랍니다!

오타와의 긍정적인 점은 특히 여성과 LGBTQ+ 커뮤니티에게 안전한 도시로 잘 알려져 있다는 것입니다. 이러한 환경 속에서 따뜻하고 환영받는 분위기가 형성되고 있습니다. 게다가 다른 대도시에 비해 생활비가 꽤 저렴하고, 인터넷 속도도 보통에서 빠른 편입니다.

대중교통이 점점 개선되고 있어 국회의사당이나 리도 운하와 같은 주요 명소들을 쉽게 방문할 수 있습니다. 겨울철은 꽤 춥기 때문에 그 시기에 오실 경우 따뜻한 옷차림을 잊지 마세요!

오타와에서의 추천 활동은 문화와 역사를 잘 보여주는 다양한 동네를 탐방하는 것입니다. 독특하고 친근하며 다양한 매력을 지닌 도시를 경험하고 싶다면 오타와는 반드시 방문할 만한 곳입니다!

reviews:
I am a foreign student here in Oulu, and I am pretty sure that the scores should be updated. Such as Internet connection here is great, 60-100mbs at my workplace. The city is bike friendly and foreign friendly, much better than the east and the south part of Finland. The city is promoting startups and improving environment toward internationalisation, so the future is bright and worthy. 
There is not much nightlife activities to do besides drinking and dancing, but in the summer you can do sports as it is never dark. I love the pier and city library, and this is the most famous area in Oulu where you can find many interesting events like the Polar Bear Pitch, Farmer's Market, MegaMatching, etc. Besides being called the Silicon Valley of Finland, Oulu is also a heaven to outdoor lovers with many trail paths as well as their campfires and saunas along the rivers and lakes. 
To me Oulu is perfect for Nomads who are up to challenges.
oulu.description:
Oulu, Finland, is a nice city that has a good mix of nature and modern life, making it a great place for both residents and visitors. If you like biking, you will appreciate how easy it is to bike here. The city has fast internet, which is great for students or people working from home, and it has a busy startup scene that welcomes international workers. The atmosphere is friendly, especially compared to other areas in Finland.

While the nightlife might not have many choices beyond bars and clubs, the summer provides many outdoor activities in the midnight sun, like hiking and biking, as well as enjoying the many lakes and trails. Popular spots like the pier and the city library often have events that show off the community spirit, from the active Farmer's Market to fun competitions.

On the other hand, be ready for some issues like limited public transportation and high living costs. However, for those who enjoy adventure and want to experience a mix of culture and outdoor fun, Oulu is a great choice!
oulu.description_kor:
핀란드의 오울루는 자연과 현대적 생활이 조화를 이루는 아름다운 도시로, 주민과 방문객 모두에게 멋진 장소입니다. 자전거를 좋아하신다면 이곳에서 자전거 타는 게 얼마나 편리한지 감사하게 여길 것입니다. 이 도시는 빠른 인터넷을 제공해 학생이나 재택근무자에게 아주 유용하며, 국제 근로자를 환영하는 활발한 스타트업 환경이 형성되어 있습니다. 특히 핀란드의 다른 지역에 비해 분위기가 더욱 친근합니다.

밤문화는 바와 클럽 외에 선택지가 많지 않을 수 있지만, 여름철에는 한밤중의 태양 아래 하이킹과 자전거 타기, 다양한 호수와 등산로를 즐길 수 있는 야외 활동이 풍부합니다. 부두나 시립 도서관과 같은 인기 있는 장소에서는 활기찬 농산물 시장과 다양한 재밌는 이벤트가 자주 열려 지역 사회의 따뜻한 정신을 느낄 수 있습니다.

물론, 제한된 대중교통과 높은 생활비와 같은 문제들도 존재하지만, 모험을 즐기며 문화와 야외 활동을 동시에 만끽하고 싶은 분들에게 오울루는 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
Bad walkability? Oslo is known for its great walkability and accessibility to nature. The public transport system is also great, and the city is safe. 

However, the downside is that it is a very expensive city. Basic items like fruits, vegetables, meat and even beer can be costly. Additionally, the import system in Norway is very protective, which means that grocery stores often only carry products that are made in Norway.

I've been there in summer. I don't understand why the rate of walkability is bad, that is ridiculous. People are friendly and polite, if you want to find a job is easy, although opening a bank account to get your salary can take two months. There are plenty of coffees, restaurants and bars, often you need to book in advance (more if the weather is good), and they will rip you off. I knew this, and I went there with the plan of no-eating out, no coffee-out and no-party, but even the supermarket is super expensive. 
It is a beautiful city, nature around it is amazing. Social rules are different, as they are in every place, so you should inform yourself before living there. Everybody speaks English and learning Norwegian is easy.
In September it starts to be too cold for my taste.
oslo.description:
Oslo is a city located between the fjords and forests of Norway, surrounded by nature. When you go outside, you can find parks and hiking trails nearby. The city is easy to walk around, allowing you to explore neighborhoods with small cafes and bars. It is a good idea to make reservations ahead of time, especially on sunny days.

However, be ready for high prices. Living in Oslo can be expensive because groceries, drinks, and eating out cost a lot. While local people are friendly, getting banking services may take some time. You won’t have trouble speaking English, as many people can communicate well in it. Learning some Norwegian can also improve your experience.

You can visit famous places, enjoy local traditions, and feel the atmosphere of the city. Just keep in mind that the weather can get cold by September, so be sure to pack the right clothing!
oslo.description_kor:
오슬로는 노르웨이의 아름다운 피요르드와 울창한 숲에 둘러싸인 도시로, 자연의 품에 안겨 있습니다. 밖에 나가면 가까운 공원과 하이킹 코스를 손쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 걷기에도 편리해서 아기자기한 카페와 바가 있는 동네를 탐방하기에 안성맞춤입니다. 특히 맑은 날에는 미리 예약해두는 것이 좋습니다.

하지만 가격이 꽤 비쌀 수 있다는 점도 염두에 두셔야 합니다. 오슬로에서의 생활은 식료품, 음료, 외식 비용이 많이 드는 편이어서 경제적으로 부담이 될 수 있습니다. 현지인들은 매우 친절하지만, 은행 서비스 이용 시 다소 시간이 걸릴 수 있습니다. 다행히 많은 사람들이 영어를 잘 구사하므로 소통하는 데에는 큰 문제가 없을 것입니다. 노르웨이어를 조금 배우는 것도 여행의 즐거움을 더해줄 수 있습니다.

유명한 관광지를 방문하고, 지역 전통을 즐기며, 도시의 독특한 분위기를 만끽해보세요. 하지만 9월에 접어들면 날씨가 쌀쌀해질 수 있으니 꼭 적절한 옷을 준비하는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Been there for a week, in March 2022, and If you happen to stay in El nido, you should definitely go to FRENDZ, where they have a nice open space where you can work, and the connection speed was like 300down/100up!!

Palawan, officially the Province of Palawan, is a province of the Philippines that is located in the MIMAROPA region. Its capital is the city of Puerto Princesa, but it is governed independently from the province as an urbanized city. The islands of Palawan stretch from Mindoro in the northeast to Borneo in the southwest and it lies between the South China Sea and the Sulu Sea. The province is named after its largest island, Palawan Island, measuring 450 kilometres long, the province is composed of the long and narrow Palawan Island, plus a number of other smaller islands surrounding it, totalling roughly 1,780 islands and islets.
palawan.description:
Palawan is a great place in the Philippines, known for its natural beauty and relaxed atmosphere that visitors like. If you are in El Nido, be sure to visit FRENDZ – it is a nice place with good Wi-Fi, ideal for those who wish to balance work and leisure.

The welcoming locals and lively culture make it a good area to explore. Puerto Princesa, the capital, is a place to see for its tasty food and special sights like the Underground River. There are many outdoor activities available, such as island hopping and snorkeling in clear waters.

However, remember that costs can be higher in tourist areas, and public transport may not be very available, so plan your trips. Language can be a bit difficult, but most people speak English, which helps tourists get around. Safety is usually good, but it’s always wise to be careful, especially at night.

For a calm experience, visit the quieter areas and learn about local customs. Whether you want adventure or just to relax in the sun, Palawan has something for everyone!
palawan.description_kor:
팔라완은 필리핀의 멋진 장소로, 자연의 아름다움과 여유로운 분위기로 많은 사랑을 받고 있습니다. 엘 니도에 가게 된다면, 반드시 FRENDZ에 들러보세요. 좋은 Wi-Fi가 갖춰진 아늑한 공간으로, 일과 여가를 균형 있게 즐기고 싶은 분들에게 안성맞춤입니다.

친절한 현지인들과 생동감 넘치는 문화 덕분에 탐험하기 좋은 지역이 형성되어 있습니다. 수도인 푸에르토 프린세사에서는 맛있는 음식부터 유명한 지하강 같은 특별한 명소까지 다양하게 즐길 수 있습니다. 섬 호핑이나 맑은 바다에서 스노클링과 같은 다양한 수중 활동도 가능합니다.

다만 관광지에서는 비용이 조금 더 들 수 있는 점을 유념하시고, 대중교통이 다소 부족할 수 있으니 여행 계획을 잘 세우셔야 합니다. 언어는 다소 어렵게 느껴질 수 있지만, 대부분의 사람들이 영어를 사용할 수 있어 관광객들에게 도움이 됩니다. 지역의 안전성은 대체로 양호하지만, 특히 밤에는 항상 조심하는 것이 좋습니다.

편안한 경험을 원하신다면 조용한 지역을 찾아보고 지역 문화를 배워보세요. 모험을 즐기고 싶으시든, 햇볕 아래 편히 쉬고 싶으시든 팔라완은 모두를 위한 맞춤형 즐거움이 가득한 곳입니다!

reviews:
I mostly agree to another negative feedback, although I don't think it's really 1/10 city, but overall, yes, it's also one of most unlikable cities I've been nomading to (and I've been to basically all countries of Europe as of now). I guess "enchanting atmosphere", as one of reviewers said is represented in a way of heaps of garbage everywhere, groups of sketchy immigrant people right on the main walking street (I've been asked for money two times already there by beggars) and I really lol'd at notion of "it felt extremely safe" in another review - I'm a tall man, and still I don't feel comfortable walking around a city in evenings apart from the main streets, gave me really "i'm-not-feeling-that-safe-here" vibes. And the best quality grocery shop in all center is this Lidl sh*thole? I can't even buy quality food...

And also yes, basically all the people here just don't speak English.

And I can't deny - there are quite beautiful places in Palermo, nice squares and there are cozy streets, and beautiful churches, there are definitely places to see and visit, but nevertheless... For example Trapani felt more safe and less dirty (even still quite dirty tho).

Was there May 2023 for a month. Nice city, great expat group held by Piero/Davide/Angelo. If you are looking for meeting people I really advise to get in touch with them - you can find on FB.
Dolce vita with extremely cheap food in restaurants (excellent pizza for less than 5 euros). I found the city very typical and beautiful, the weather was great too.
3 drawbacks in my opinion:
- no night club (at this period at least) / big party - only bars.
- no beach very close to the city center (closest is Mondello)
- if you do not speak italian at all you might struggle a lot to integrate with locals.

Carini, a serene neighborhood near Palermo, Sicily, is a hidden gem for digital nomads seeking a peaceful retreat with ample work opportunities. The town's enchanting atmosphere and proximity to nature make it an ideal choice for those looking to focus on their work while enjoying the tranquility of their surroundings.

Palermo is waaaaay cheaper than this. Lived here for two months and loved it! You need to get in touch with locals because some more touristic places might get expensive, but I was renting a 70sqm apartment in the city center for less than 500€ (November 2021).

All in all a very good place, great food, friendly locals and nice coworking spaces :)

Worst place I've been to as a nomad. Every person I've met/spoken to also dislikes it and left ASAP. Not sure why anyone would like living here, even the locals all leave if they get a chance to and there are no expats, just overhyped and filled with tourists. It's incredibly dirty, highly dysfunctional (more dysfunctional than in Latin America), it's pricy for the sh*tty quality of everything. Food was not even good even though we only ate at places locals loved and avoided touristic places (was alright but nothing great). The hyped up towns on the island are subpar, you can go anywhere else in Europe and see cuter towns with less tourists, only Taormina was nice enough. Nature was subpar was well (I expected more since I've been around the Mediterranean and most costal areas are very nice). I never say I hated my experience living in a place but I strongly disliked Palermo. Catania looked inhabitable. Remember there is a difference between living somewhere and visiting/travelling in a place. Sicily might be nice to travel around for a bit (I did travel around the island and nothing was remotely impressive though so I'd rather save my time and money and travel in another place), but it's like not liveable at all. I am just shocked at how it is here. This is an honest opinion. Been all over Europe and in Eastern Europe and this place is the most degraded and dysfunctional place. 1/10.

Awesome city! Spent nearly 2 months in Palermo and the area (Nov-Dev). Weather was perfect (especially when comparing to Europe)
Good 1BR apartments can be found at at < $1,000/mo ( in the central area ). Internet can be a hit or miss, I lucked a 80/80 Mpbs.
There's a cool (and free) coworking space (Magneti Cowork). Great city to just roam around walking, there are nice areas along with multiple old markets and many places to get a good bite/drink.
Had a chance to hang with a bunch of local people, all were really really nice. 

The old town area is great to stay at (anywhere between the train station and the politeama theater).
The city can be a little dirty (trash overload or dog piles at times) but shouldn't be a concern. (Crime shouldn't be either, it felt extremely safe)
Bottom line - very cheap (for EU), warm in the winter (again, relative to Europe), great people, great local food, bars.

Highly underrated. Lived here for 1.5 months, fantastic place, very cheap (155 euro/month rent on the East side). Sicilians have great food and are very friendly.

(Connect with me: scaur.nz)
palermo.description:
Palermo is a city that can leave you with mixed feelings. On one side, you will find a rich history with nice churches, busy squares, and good food that is affordable—think great pizzas for under 5 euros! The locals are usually friendly, and the city is full of life, especially around its busy markets. It’s a good place if you want to enjoy life and meet people (you can connect with expats for a friendly community).

However, there are some issues to consider. The city has a lot of litter, and you may see some areas that need cleaning. If you are out after dark, it is safer to stick to the main streets. Language can also be a problem; knowing some Italian can help you connect with locals. Public transport can be a bit difficult, so talk to locals for advice and think about renting a bike to get around.

For those who want a quieter experience, neighborhoods like Carini offer this, and although there is no beach in the center, the beautiful Mondello is a short trip away. Just be ready for a different pace of life compared to other European cities!
palermo.description_kor:
팔레르모는 다양한 감정을 일으킬 수 있는 매력적인 도시입니다. 멋진 교회와 활기찬 광장, 그리고 5유로 이하의 훌륭한 피자가 있는 저렴하고 맛있는 음식이 가득한, 풍부한 역사와 문화를 자랑합니다. 현지인들은 대체로 친절하며, 특히 분주한 시장 주변에서는 생동감 넘치는 분위기를 느낄 수 있습니다. 사람들과 어울리고 삶을 즐기고 싶다면 정말 좋은 장소입니다. 외국인들에게 친근한 커뮤니티를 통해 새로운 인연도 만들어 보실 수 있습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 주의해야 할 점도 있습니다. 도시 곳곳에 쓰레기가 쌓여 있는 모습이 눈에 띌 수 있고, 청소가 필요한 지역도 종종 발견될 수 있습니다. 어두운 후에는 주요 도로를 지키는 게 더 안전하니 유의하시길 바랍니다. 언어 소통에서도 어려움이 있을 수 있는데, 이탈리아어를 조금 아는 것이 현지인들과의 소통을 쉽게 해 줄 것입니다. 대중교통은 조금 불편할 수 있으니, 현지인들에게 조언을 구하거나 자전거를 빌려 이동하는 것도 좋은 방법입니다.

조용한 분위기를 원하신다면 카리니와 같은 동네를 추천합니다. 시내에는 해변이 없지만, 아름다운 몬델로 해변이 가까이에 있어 여유롭게 즐길 수 있습니다. 다른 유럽 도시들과 비교하면 느린 삶의 속도에 적응할 준비를 하셔야 합니다!

reviews: Peniche is like my digital nomad dream spot. It's got chill vibes with waves as my work soundtrack. Living here won't break the bank, and the surf scene is lit. Exploring cool historic spots and vibing with friendly locals make my remote work life feel like a chill adventure.

Peniche, a classical destination for old school nomads, is a serene and idyllic hideaway that has seemingly been overlooked by the digital nomad community. The tranquil and peaceful environment contrasts dramatically with the hustle and bustle of popular cities, making it a refreshing alternative for nomads seeking peace and quiet to focus on work.

Co-working space, Largo, is the digital nomad's hub in Peniche. This co-working space offers a comfortable working environment with stable, high-speed internet, and a cozy ambience that is perfect for productive hours of work. Coupled with a small yet friendly community of like-minded nomads, it offers the perfect balance between work and social life.

But work isn't all there is to Peniche. This town offers a plethora of fun and healthy activities that can complement the nomadic lifestyle. Famous for its surfing conditions, Peniche is a surfer's paradise, with numerous surf schools for beginners and challenging waves for experienced surfers. If you're more into exploring underwater worlds, there are exciting diving spots in Berlenga that showcase mesmerizing marine life and underwater caves.
peniche.description:
If you want a relaxed getaway, Peniche is a great choice! This small town in Portugal has a good mix of calm atmosphere and lively culture. It's a good place for people who want to work remotely without the pressure of a big city. With a low cost of living, you can enjoy your work and free time without spending too much money.

The surf scene here is great, attracting surfers of all levels—there are many surf schools to help you learn. If you are looking for a different adventure, the nearby Berlenga Islands are great for diving with amazing underwater life.

Public transportation is a bit limited, so renting a bike or car might be useful for getting around. While English is common, knowing some Portuguese phrases will help you connect with the friendly locals. 

Be sure to check out the local co-working space, Largo, where you can find a nice working environment and meet other travelers. Whether you are at the beach or visiting historical sites, Peniche is a perfect mix of work and relaxation!
peniche.description_kor:
편안한 휴가를 원하신다면, 페니쉐는 정말 좋은 선택이에요! 포르투갈의 이 작은 마을은 차분한 분위기와 생기 넘치는 문화가 잘 어우러져 있습니다. 대도시의 스트레스에서 벗어나 원격 근무를 하기에 안성맞춤인 곳이에요. 생활비도 저렴해서 많은 돈을 쓰지 않고도 일과 여유 시간을 만끽할 수 있답니다.

이곳의 서핑은 정말 훌륭해서 모든 수준의 서퍼들이 매력을 느끼고 있어요. 서핑을 배우고 싶으신 분들을 위한 서핑 학교도 많이 있어서 걱정 마세요. 만약 조금 더 색다른 모험을 원하신다면, 가까운 벨렌가 섬에서 멋진 수중 생물과 함께 다이빙을 즐길 수 있는 기회도 있습니다.

대중교통이 다소 불편할 수 있으므로 자전거나 자동차를 렌트하는 게 좋을 것 같아요. 영어가 통용되긴 하지만, 몇 가지 포르투갈어 표현을 익혀두면 친절한 현지인들과 더욱 원활하게 소통할 수 있을 것입니다.

현지 공동 작업 공간인 Largo도 꼭 방문해 보세요. 이곳은 쾌적한 근무 환경을 제공하고, 다양한 여행자들과의 교류 기회도 마련되어 있어요. 해변에서 여유를 즐기든, 역사적인 명소를 찾아가든, 페니쉐에서는 일과 휴식의 완벽한 조화를 느낄 수 있습니다!

reviews:
Panama City very interesting and slept on. Probably the most developed major city in Latin America with the strongest technology infrastructure which makes it very appealing for digital nomads. Also a lot of international business coming through here so there can definitely be good networking opportunities.

It’s also super safe compared to other South American hotspots like Medellin however it is significantly more expensive. I would say prices here are slightly less expensive than southern small-towns in the rural United States

The crowd does feel a bit more touristy than I would personally like but there are interesting people that you will meet here who are primarily from Europe.

The local seafood is good and there are a lot of great international options all over town.

Nightlife is strong on the weekends and if you’re specifically looking for that, I would recommend staying at the Selina in Casco Viejo since they have a rooftop sky bar and an underground club which are the most popular spots in town and are tough to enter if you’re not a Selina guest.

I do agree with the last comment that this city does seem like it can get boring fast if you’re staying for an extended vacation but if you’re spending most of your days living a normal daily life of work, self-care, exercise, basic social life, this is not a bad place to do it.

Panama City is a B+ place to live: solid weather, amenities, safety, and cleanliness... but, it feels much like an American city due to the skyscrapers, urban sprawl, and the limited activities. If you're not shopping, eating at a restaurant, bar hopping, or going to a reggaeton club until 3am, there's not a whole lot else to do.

The weather is remarkably consistent: everyday it will be 85F, it will be cloudy for a few hours including a 15-30 minute shower, and then it will be mostly sunny for the rest of the day. Wifi and cellular service is reliable (4G via GoogleFi or a local SIM card in most areas... buy from a convenience store for

Panama reminds me of the booming southeast asian capitals of bangkok, singapore, manila or kuala lumpur, filled with condos and malls. It is clean, the weather is warm but not humid. Internet speed is fast and reliable, all the conveniences of the city is available here. But aside from that, theres not much else to do here unless you enjoy the malls, eating out and going to the pubs. The only thing that you need to get used to is the roads do not have pedestrian lanes, although cars always prioritize pedestrians to cross first. But the cars here communicate in an orderly chaos. Frequently seeing cars beeping and almost crashing on each other on the crossroads. There are no traffic rules here unless there are traffic lights.
Use Uber transportation. I do not recommend to use bike because it is not safe. Traffic is a big problem, so be prepare ahead for your appointments and don’t get stock in the rush hours.
panama-city.description:
Panama City is a lively mix of modern life and rich culture, making it an interesting place to visit or live. It is known for its tall buildings and good tech infrastructure, and it is quickly becoming a center for digital nomads and business networks. It is safer than many other cities in South America, but costs can be higher than in smaller towns in the U.S.

The local food is great, especially the fresh seafood, and you can also find many international dishes. The nightlife is active with places like Selina in Casco Viejo, where you can enjoy views from rooftops and go to clubs. However, if you want a lot of activities, it may be a bit quiet after a while; shopping, dining, and bars are the main attractions.

Public transport can be difficult, and traffic jams make Uber the best choice. Just be careful when crossing the streets—there are not always crosswalks, but drivers usually stop for pedestrians. Overall, if you like a mix of city life and nice weather, Panama City is worth a look!
panama-city.description_kor:
파나마시는 현대적인 생활과 풍부한 문화가 멋지게 어우러진 활기찬 도시로, 방문하거나 거주하기에도 매우 매력적인 곳입니다. 이곳은 높은 건물과 뛰어난 기술 인프라로 유명하며, 빠르게 디지털 노마드와 비즈니스 네트워크의 중심으로 자리잡고 있습니다. 남미의 다른 많은 도시들에 비해 상대적으로 안전하지만, 미국의 소도시에 비해서는 생활비가 조금 더 비쌀 수 있습니다.

현지 음식은 정말 훌륭하고, 특히 신선한 해산물은 일품이며 다양한 국제 요리도 맛볼 수 있습니다. 또한, 밤문화가 활발해서 카스코 비에호의 셀리나 같은 곳에서는 멋진 옥상 전망을 감상하며 클럽을 즐길 수 있습니다. 물론 좀 더 활발한 활동을 원하신다면 다소 조용하게 느껴질 수도 있으며, 쇼핑과 식사, 바가 주요한 매력이 될 것입니다.

대중교통은 조금 불편할 수 있으며, 교통 혼잡하기 때문에 우버 이용이 가장 좋은 선택이 될 수 있습니다. 길을 건널 때는 주의가 필요하고, 항상 횡단보도가 있는 것은 아니지만 운전자들이 보행자를 배려해 대체로 정차하는 편입니다. 전반적으로 도시 생활과 좋은 날씨를 동시에 즐기고 싶다면 파나마시는 꼭 한 번 방문해볼 만한 곳입니다!

reviews:
Great place to stay overall. 
Pros:
- Cheap
- Safe 
- Lots of variety. Not too big, not to small of a city
- Great weather between December and February
- Very efficient ride-sharing apps like Bolt.
- Reasonable-priced round-trip plane tickets from Europe (especially if you opt for a stopover)
Cons :
- Meh weather except December-February
- Beware of motorcycles and tuk-tuk drivers, they drive recklessly.
- Difficult to get things shipped from Amazon and western retail websites in general
- Can be noisy in a lot of places. Carefully pick your accommodation.

I would be a bit careful with Pattaya, because the Police are cracking down on foreign illegal workers, Expessialy from Russia, and that can accidentally put a remote worker like me in the crossfire. That means that a digital nomad can be deported on a misunderstanding, because the police in Pattaya is not so used to deal with a digital nomads like they are in Phuket, Koh Samui and Chiang Mai, they put you in the same basket as illegally working Russians and out with you. Apart from that i would say that Pattaya is the part place for males aged 50+ so if you are a female or under 40, i would say Pattaya isn't for you. But ig you are a male 50+, then welcome to paradise!

Overflooded by russians. You get approached in russian. Many shops/food stalls/party flyers/pingpong shows and products are written in russian instead of in english. Nothing against russians but I just don't want to be in Moscow 2.0 in Thailand. Even if you say you are not russian they (locals & russian staff) are kinda rude sometimes because they think you are lying to them.

Unbelievably a great place to live! Forget Pattaya downtown and go for Jomtiem instead, with a more family-oriented enviroment, delicious street food and russian/scandinavian communities. You can live in great places with seaview paying less than you would pay for a regular place in Bangkok, with all the traffic and pollution. Also, Koh Larn island, an island 20 minutes far by boat is a gift, with pristine and clean beaches like the most famous islands in Thailand.

I've lived in Pattaya for 10 of my 19 years in Thailand. I am an old guy not paying sex workers for sex. If you don't want to see the nasty bits, don't go to those places. If you want to chillout, eat fresh seafood and enjoy blistering internet speeds, then welcome. Every morning when I wake up Pattaya is better than it was when I went to sleep. If you want to have some real city life, BKK is just 2 hours away. Some of you youngsters sure are prudes.

What's wrong with that? Why is that being looked at negativity? For "first world" "civilized" countries like U.S. with illegal prostitution being one of the top 5 countries with the highest rape rates in the world, maybe they need to learn a thing or 2 from Pattaya.

Sexpat capital of the world. It's just really mostly lots and lots and lots of sex workers and old guys paying them for sex. Avoid if you want to nomad or travel here. They're trying to change it but that's going to take awhile.
pattaya.description:
Pattaya is a busy city that offers a mix of experiences, good for people looking for warm weather and low living costs. The weather is nice from December to February, with sunny days and comfortable temperatures. To get around, ride-sharing apps like Bolt make travel easy.

However, it's important to know a few things about Pattaya. The city can be noisy, so choosing the right place to stay is important. Be careful of local traffic, especially motorcycles and tuk-tuks that can be a bit reckless. While it is generally safe, the police pay close attention to foreign workers, so if you are a digital nomad, keep this in mind.

For a family-friendly atmosphere, Jomtien is nice, with good street food and a friendly community. Don’t forget to visit Koh Larn island for beautiful beaches just a boat ride away! Whether you enjoy the lively nightlife or the relaxed beach life, Pattaya offers a mix of fun, sun, and local culture.
pattaya.description_kor:
파타야는 따뜻한 날씨와 저렴한 생활비를 원하는 사람들에게 다양한 즐길 거리를 제공하는 활기찬 도시입니다. 12월부터 2월까지의 날씨는 쾌적하고 맑은 날이 많아 여행하기에 딱 좋습니다. 이동할 때는 볼트와 같은 승차 공유 앱을 이용하면 매우 편리합니다.

하지만 파타야를 방문하기 전에 알아두어야 할 몇 가지 사항이 있습니다. 이 도시는 소음이 있을 수 있으므로 숙소를 선택할 때 주의가 필요합니다. 특히 오토바이와 뚝뚝 같은 현지 교통 수단에 조심해야 합니다. 일반적으로는 안전하지만, 경찰이 외국인 노동자에게 신경을 많이 쓰기 때문에 디지털 노마드라면 이 점을 염두에 두어야 합니다.

가족 친화적인 분위기를 원하신다면 염티엔 지역이 추천됩니다. 이곳은 맛있는 길거리 음식과 따뜻한 커뮤니티가 있어 좋습니다. 또한 아름다운 해변이 있는 꼬란 섬도 잊지 말고 방문해 보세요! 활기찬 밤문화나 편안한 해변생활을 즐기고 싶든, 파타야는 다양한 즐거움과 햇빛, 그리고 풍부한 지역 문화를 제공하는 곳입니다.

reviews: Penang is really, really hot and humid. It's pretty affordable but it's relatively small. Personally, I think traveling Penang is great because you have a mix of cultures but I couldn't stay here for a longer time because it is so unbelievable hot.

The noise pollution here is insane. The prayer calls from the mosques seem to reverberate throughout Penang. Seems like they are competing for who can be the loudest. This really ruined Penang for me and I cut my time short.
We picked up 4G SIM from the airport for $5 that got us 20Gb for the 2 weeks we visited the place to see if we wanted to work here.

Penang is great.

It's everything the rest of Malaysia is not: Penang is clean, super safe, people are friendly, the food won't make you sick.

Penang probably is not the next nomad hotspot soon though but it could be. There's quite a lot of cafes, but not many are good for laptopping. Very few cafes have solid airconditioning, so it'll be hot. They do usually have fans though. Most buildings are small built here, so cafes can also be quite cramped and get crowded fast, especially around lunch and late afternoons. Also cafes close very early, like 5pm or 6pm.

Internet is legendarily slow, doesn't matter if it's in your hotel or cafe. Internet in Penang in general is just very slow. But there's an easy fix for that: buy a 4G Hotlink SIM card and top it up every day/week with a few gigabyte. Then use your phone to tether. It'll be extremely fast at around 40 Mbps, vs the WiFi's at 1 Mbps (!).

Great thing vs. for example Thailand is that people here speak almost perfect English, and compared to Kuala Lumpur people here are generally quite educated. Also about the people: Penangites are just really friendly and nice. They know you're a tourist and it doesn't matter, they're happy to help you get around and give tips where to go. Really friendly and chill people.

Food is good but I'll be real here, there's kinda limited options. Everything is either Malay, Indian or Chinese. Which is nice, but gets limited fast.

Some recommendations to work:
- Wheeler's cafe (ask or book beforehand to make sure you sit in the aircon area upstairs)
- Coffee Addicts cafe
- Daily Dose (make sure you order food here though cause they don't seem to like laptops that much)

To eat:
- Nasi Kandar Line Clear, yes it's an alley way but nice and you won't get sick, very clean: go there ask for rice and beef or chicken and vegetables and curry sauce, it'll be $2 or $3 USD, ask for hot tea, that's how locals eat it. It's open 24/7.
- Halab, a Syrian restaurant, it's not cheap (think $20 for a meal) but it's a loooot of grilled meat, good if you need protein after gym, also didn't get sick it so seems safe.

I think if Penang gets some nice aircon'd hipster cafes that like laptops, fixes its slow WiFi speeds everywhere and gets more nomads coming, it could very well become a new nomad hotspot in Asia.

Beware of slow internet speed! It's also difficult to get month-to-month accommodation. Airbnb is basically the only choice. I got a great studio apartment at the Kim Haus for $620/month, which includes tourist tax of RM10 per day. Excellent location. But the internet is so slow it is unusable. And there are very few cafes that have better internet. One of the better cafes in town happens to be across the street from the Kim Haus. It's called Coffee Addicts.

I've been living here for a year. English is widely used everywhere so you don't need to learn any other language. Internet at home fiber 1Gbps super fast. Rental is both cheap and expensive, you can find places as cheap as $100 per month and as expensive as $1000-$2000 for luxury style condos. Food is excellent, you can literally eat every day out for less than $5 per meal + drink and never repeat the same restaurant. Maybe the only downside is that as it's so hot people only do exercise very early in the morning or at night or in the gyms (usually condos have a gym).

Loved Penang! I rented an Airbnb 1BR apartment in Straits Quay for a month @ $35/nt and rent is probably lower if you stay longer or live in a less touristy area. Great food, easy transportation, nice beaches, super affordable plus my host upgraded wifi to 30mbps. Everyone speaks English, thanks to Malaysia's colonial history and the people are so hospitable. I hope to move there permanently someday!

SLOW internet speed and local people mostly relies on 4G/LTE networks instead of cables. However, I need to recommend the Wheeler's: https://goo.gl/maps/Z2cLP2y9hqT2 It has the fast internet speed in town, around 20Mbps download/upload.
penang.description:
Penang is a mix of cultures where the heat and humidity support many food options and friendly interactions. The combination of Malay, Indian, and Chinese influences is clear in the local food - be sure to visit Nasi Kandar Line Clear for a good meal at a low price. Eating out can cost as little as $5 a day, but the choices may become repetitive.

Living here is affordable, but you should be prepared for the heat. The temperatures can be high and the noise from the mosque calls can be quite loud, which may make long stays difficult. Public transport is good for getting around, but do not expect fast internet in cafes – it is usually slow. A helpful tip is to get a 4G SIM card to stay connected easily when working from nearby spots like Wheeler’s Cafe or Daily Dose.

With friendly locals always ready to help, Penang feels safe. Just remember to plan activities for the cooler times of the day. Whether you are walking through its neighborhoods or exploring its history, the spirit of Penang will leave you feeling pleased, even with the heat!
penang.description_kor:
페낭은 다양한 문화가 어우러진 곳으로, 무더운 날씨와 높은 습도 속에서 여러 가지 음식 옵션과 친근한 사람들과의 교류를 즐길 수 있습니다. 말레이시아, 인도, 중국의 영향을 받은 현지 음식을 통해 그 조화를 쉽게 느낄 수 있습니다. 저렴한 가격에 맛있는 음식을 즐기고 싶다면 나시 칸다르 라인 클리어(Nasi Kandar Line Clear)를 꼭 방문해보세요. 외식을 해도 하루에 5달러면 충분하지만, 메뉴가 반복될 수 있다는 점은 참고하세요.

생활비는 저렴하지만, 더위에 대비하는 것이 중요합니다. 기온이 높을 때가 많고, 모스크에서 들리는 호출 소리가 상당히 시끄러워서 장기 체류하는 것이 조금 힘들 수도 있습니다. 대중교통은 이동하기 편리하지만, 카페에서 빠른 인터넷 속도를 기대하기는 어렵습니다. 보통 느리니까요. 유용한 팁으로는 4G SIM 카드를 구매하면, 휠러스 카페(Wheeler’s Cafe)나 데일리 도스(Daily Dose) 같은 근처 장소에서 작업할 때 쉽게 인터넷에 연결할 수 있다는 점입니다.

친절한 지역 주민들이 언제든지 도움을 줄 준비가 되어 있어 페낭은 안전하다고 느낍니다. 활동은 하루 중 더 시원한 시간대를 이용해 계획하는 게 좋습니다. 동네를 걸어다니거나 역사를 탐험하더라도, 페낭의 매력은 무더운 날씨 속에서도 기분 좋게 만들어 줄 것입니다!

reviews: Filled with rude provincial locals. Hard to fit in here and make friends. Extremely cliquey culture.

This city is so beautiful by the water! I loved going for runs in a loop around Swan River. There's a cute coffee shop and cafe by the water that I enjoyed. It's a great city, but pretty small. I wanted to check out Fremantle too when I was there, but ran out of time.
perth.description:
Perth is a coastal city known for its nice views and waterfront areas. The Swan River is good for running, and you can find coffee shops along the way. While the scenery is a big plus, some visitors say it can be hard to connect with others. A few have noticed that it can feel a bit exclusive at times. 

The city is small, which makes it easy to explore, but you might wish for more time to visit places like Fremantle. The cost of living can be high, and public transportation is not very extensive, so plan your trips well. Safety is generally not a problem here, but like in any city, it's good to stay alert. Enjoy the relaxed lifestyle, take in the views, and perhaps have a coffee by the river to relax!
perth.description_kor:
퍼스는 아름다운 풍경과 수변 지역으로 유명한 해안 도시입니다. 스완 강은 조깅하기에 최적인 곳으로, 그 주변에는 아기자기한 커피숍들이 자리하고 있습니다. 경치가 큰 장점이긴 하지만, 일부 방문객들은 사람들과의 연결이 쉽지 않을 수 있다고 언급하곤 합니다. 몇몇은 때때로 다소 배타적인 분위기를 느낀다고 하더군요.

이 도시는 규모가 작아 탐험하기 쉽지만, 프리맨틀 같은 매력적인 장소를 더 많이 즐기고 싶어할 수도 있습니다. 생활비가 꽤 높은 편이고, 대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있지 않아서 여행 계획을 잘 세우는 것이 중요합니다. 일반적으로 안전한 도시이지만, 어떤 도시에서든 항상 주의하는 것이 좋습니다. 여유로운 라이프스타일을 만끽하며 아름다운 경치를 감상하고, 강가에서 커피 한 잔의 여유를 즐겨보세요!

reviews:
Great kitesurf spot close, and also a surf spot close for winter breaks + snowboard ski in 1.5h away on a nice resort 
I would say laid back city with nice bars not crazy things to do but if you like outdoors its wonderful.
Plus cheap and can easily find cheap accommodation
patras.description:
Patras is a easygoing city in Greece that has a mix of relaxation and outdoor activities. If you enjoy kitesurfing or surfing, you will find good spots nearby to ride the waves. For those who like winter sports, a ski resort is just a short drive away—great for quick weekend trips!

The cost of living here is low, and finding affordable accommodation is simple, making it a good choice for both visitors and residents. The nightlife is quiet with nice bars to relax in, but don't expect a lively party scene. You can enjoy the calm atmosphere while trying some local food.

However, be aware that public transportation is not very good, so you may want to rent a car for easier travel. In terms of safety, Patras is usually a safe city, but make sure to keep an eye on your belongings like you would anywhere else. Whether you want adventure or a relaxing time, Patras has something for everyone!
patras.description_kor:
파트라스는 그리스에 위치한 느긋한 도시로, 휴식과 야외 활동이 어우러지는 곳입니다. 카이트 서핑이나 서핑을 즐기시는 분이라면, 근처에서 파도를 타기에 좋은 장소를 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 겨울 스포츠를 좋아하시는 분들을 위해 스키 리조트도 가까이 있어, 짧은 주말 여행으로 안성맞춤입니다!

여기서의 생활비는 저렴하고, 숙소 찾기도 쉬워 방문객과 거주자 모두에게 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다. 밤에는 조용한 분위기의 멋진 바들이 있지만, 활기찬 파티 장면은 기대하지 않는 것이 좋습니다. 현지 음식을 즐기며 여유로운 시간을 보내는 데 적합합니다.

대중교통은 그리 잘 갖춰져 있지 않으므로, 보다 편리하게 이동하시려면 차를 렌트하는 것이 추천드립니다. 일반적으로 파트라스는 안전한 도시지만, 다른 곳과 마찬가지로 소지품에 대한 주의는 필요합니다. 모험을 원하시든 편안한 시간을 원하시든, 파트라스는 모두를 위한 무언가를 제공합니다!

reviews: Came in October and weather was perfect. Downtown was a ghost town. Not really a digital nomad destination
phoenix.description:
Phoenix is a lively city with a lot to offer, especially if you visit in the fall months like October. The weather is nice then, making it a good time to explore. When you go to downtown, it can feel a bit quiet, almost like a ghost town at times. This might not be the best place for digital nomads looking for a busy atmosphere, but if you prefer a more relaxed experience, you might like it.

On the positive side, the cost of living can be quite affordable compared to many other cities in the U.S. Public transportation is not very good, so having a car can be very helpful to get around and see different neighborhoods. Phoenix also has nice parks and outdoor areas, great for hiking and enjoying nature. Just remember that it can get very hot in the summer.

Overall, if you like a slower pace and warm weather, Phoenix can be a good place to enjoy local culture and historical sites. Just plan your visit carefully!
phoenix.description_kor:
피닉스는 특히 10월과 같은 가을에 방문하면 정말 매력적인 도시입니다. 이 시기에 날씨가 좋기 때문에 탐험하기에 최적의 시점이죠. 도심에 가면 가끔 한적한 느낌이 들어서 유령 마을 같은 독특한 분위기를 느낄 수 있습니다. 바쁜 분위기를 선호하는 디지털 노마드에게는 최적의 장소가 아닐 수 있지만, 여유로운 경험을 원하신다면 좋은 선택이 될 수 있습니다.

긍정적인 점은 피닉스의 생활비가 미국의 다른 많은 도시들에 비해 상대적으로 저렴하다는 것입니다. 대중교통이 그리 발달하지 않아 차가 있으면 여러 동네를 편리하게 돌아다닐 수 있습니다. 하이킹과 자연을 즐기기에 좋은 멋진 공원과 야외 공간들도 많이 있어요. 단, 여름에는 매우 덥다는 점을 미리 알아두셔야 합니다.

전반적으로 느긋한 분위기와 따뜻한 날씨를 좋아하신다면, 피닉스는 지역 문화와 역사적 명소를 즐기기에 좋은 장소가 될 것입니다. 방문 계획은 잘 세워보세요!

reviews:
My best place to work in LONELINESS(that's an important remark) ever! Just 300 meters from the main street – you will find secluded guesthouses and small local resorts, which are completely quiet and peaceful.

Fast internet. And almost nothing to do :) which is prefect to finish important projects. Highly recommended for that purpose. No one will distract you from your task. That's quite cool. And still.. you have jungles, beautiful scenery, beautiful sea 5 minutes from your place(!), amazing sunsets, unbelievable variety of food (super cheap!!!), swimming pools, roads ro drive a motorbike without any traffic, super friendly people, place is extremely safe, and... a lot of other perks! 

Accommodation:
Never book in advance (just a hotel for first 2-3 nights). Ask the price per month in person! It's always 2-3 times cheaper, than booking our Airbnb shows. Great (I mean it!) accommodations are just for 200-250$ per month! But only if you ask in person and bargain. It's Asia :)

Phu Quoc takes a bit of effort to get the best out of. It's very resorty and there's some horrific tourist hellholes like 'Grandworld' which is an imitation world that is monstrously large and destroying the island.

However, there are some really good restaurants. Inland you can find some nice hiking spots and viewpoints (they're not easy to find). The waterfalls are nice if you hike further up them away from the piles of trash left by the locals. 

We stayed at Phu Quoc ecolodge which was stunning and really a good place to work. Good WiFi, provide free and delicious tea all day and such a good range of drinks. Also kikicoconut would be nice to stay at - was our other option and we got to know the owner. 
I'd say it's worth going to if you're in Vietnam and fancy going to an island. Just avoid staying in a resort.

Very nice place to stay a few days. I would not recommend to stay very long, since there is not much to do. On the other hand its a beautiful place to relax.
There will be a lot of tourists in the next years, so go there before that will happen.
Terrible. Don't go here if you need to get work done.
phu-quoc.description:
Phu Quoc is a nice place in Vietnam, good for those looking for calm and a bit of a tropical escape. Just a short walk from the busy main street, you can find guesthouses and small local resorts that offer peace. It’s a good place for remote work if you want to avoid distractions, as there is fast internet and quiet surroundings.

The island has great views, with lovely jungles and beaches just minutes away. You can enjoy tasty and affordable local food! Just be careful to stay away from tourist spots—places like “Grandworld” can feel too busy and take away from the island's natural beauty.

Public transportation isn’t very developed, but renting a motorbike gives you the chance to explore quiet hiking paths and nice viewpoints. The places to stay can vary a lot, so it’s best to ask about monthly rates in person to get a good deal.

Phu Quoc is a great place to visit, but don't plan to stay too long; it has a calm charm that might make you want more adventure. Enjoy its beauty before it gets too crowded!
phu-quoc.description_kor:
푸꾸옥은 베트남에 위치한 멋진 여행지로, 조용하고 열대 느낌의 휴양을 원하는 이들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 분주한 거리를 조금만 벗어나면 평화로운 게스트하우스와 아늑한 로컬 리조트를 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 만약 혼잡함을 피하고 싶다면, 빠른 인터넷과 고요한 환경을 제공하는 곳에서 원격 근무를 즐기기에도 좋습니다.

이 섬은 훌륭한 전망을 자랑하며, 아름다운 정글과 멋진 해변이 손쉽게 접근 가능합니다. 맛있고 저렴한 현지 음식도 큰 매력입니다! 하지만 “그랜드월드”와 같은 관광지는 인파가 많아 섬의 자연 아름다움을 해칠 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다.

대중교통은 잘 발달되어 있지 않지만, 오토바이를 빌리면 조용한 하이킹 코스와 전망대를 탐방하는 데 이상적입니다. 숙소의 종류가 다양하므로 직접 방문해서 월 요금에 대해 문의하는 것을 추천합니다.

푸꾸옥은 방문할 만한 멋진 장소이지만, 너무 오래 머무르지 않도록 하세요. 이곳은 차분한 매력이 있어 오히려 더 많은 모험을 갈망하게 만들 수 있습니다. 붐비기 전에 그 아름다움을 충분히 즐겨보세요!

reviews: Stayed in PP for around 2 months. I would say it appeals to a certain type of person. Unlike capital cities in neighboring countries, I found the vibe to be more relaxed. The city basically shuts down at 9pm. I would say if you want to visit, you should be willing to invest more in accomodations. I tried keeping my budget similar to those in Bangkok and that was my biggest mistake of my stay here. The Airbnbs I booked for around $20-25 a night had very slow wifi, no hot water or no water at all in some cases. If I had raised my budget I think I would have had a more enjoyable experience overall.

Only to PP briefly but I can say it's much, much busier than other cities in Cambodia. Having said that, seemed to calm down about 8/9pm so wasn't so crazy. Nice place to visit and probably much more to do than we saw briefly. 

Can say that we really enjoyed Kampot too - awesome food, lots of people. Has a bit more of a Backpacker/ drinking culture than Siem Reap. It's still getting going again after COVID but seems to be coming back to life now.

Pretty cool city, BKK1 and BKK3 are nice areas to stay in. Check out Suzy Anti-cafe and Workspace1 in Factory for neat places to work from. It's a busy city, but lots of great places to eat and hang out. Internet was stable and fast enough overall. I got a SIM from SMART for a few bucks that had 44GB of data for the month, $5 to renew it. 

Used "Ask Kim" visa agent to renew my tourist visa for 30 days, super easy to do and friendly.

Phnom Penh has plenty of air conditioned cafes and some co-working spaces, so it's quite possible to get work done. The river front area feels nice and spacious but other than that I didn't find it a particular pleasant city, and wouldn't stay for more a few days.

Kampot, however, 4 hours away by bus, has been one of the best places I've stayed. The atmosphere is great, it's a small town with nice architecture, hip cafes, yoga classes, and a riverfront to stroll along. It's much calmer than anywhere else I've been in Cambodia. I tended to work in open air cafes with a fan in the morning and then go to an air conditioned cafe during the afternoon heat. The only downside I found is that it could feel too relaxed if you need to get a lot of work done.

Best thing about Phnom Penh is its proximity to Kampot.
However, for some reason Kampot is not on Nomadlist.

i LOVE PP. it has a lot to offer and there are a lot of expats doing things other than drinking and imbibing weed. (yes, there are a lot of those people, too.) you do have to be willing to be a self-starter. and you do have to know where to look, and that just takes time. but the food scene is awesome. the culture and history are rich. and it's an easy access point to other locations in SE asia.

PP does have a BIG issue with pickpockets. more than anywhere else i've been in asia. just take extra precautions, and consider having a second (cheap) phone or keeping your phone somehow secured to your body when walking on the street.

I would urge anyone considering Phnom Penh to reconsider.

I've been jumping around South-East Asia for the past year and Phnom Penh has been by far the worst location for a remote worker I've encountered. The internet here is very unreliable. My house has a Fibre connection, but I'm dropping back to a 4G phone hotspot 5+ times per day.

This city is not geared for long-term remote workers. It's a paradise for sexpats and short term backpackers. With a few exception, the activities available here are: Drinking, smoking/eating weed, and talking shit to forigners at a bar.

YMMV.

I cannot wait to leave this place.
phnom-penh.description:
Phnom Penh has a relaxed feeling that is different from other busy capitals in Southeast Asia. The city tends to quiet down by 9 PM, so if you want nightlife, it may feel calm. There is a lot to see and a rich culture to explore—like good food and historical places—but you may need to look a bit to find the best spots.
