Locals are very polite but not the most extroverted. Another downside of Quito is that due to the US dollar, everything is a bit more pricey than in other latinamerican capitals (e.g. Lima, Bogotá). On the plus side, there's many tax advantages for europeans working online as a contractor and I actually end up saving a lot of money that way.

I have lived in the La Carolina District of Quito now for 3 months and love it so far. U started out with an Airbnb but found an awesome apartment including all but electric for 500.00 a month. 24/7 Security, gym,sauna and steam room. I walk to most places or was using taxis but Uber seems to be safer plus you know the cost upfront. Price is about the same. Most foreigners go to Cuenca but if you notice the prices as almost 500.00 more. Also Quito is next to the international airport.

AMAZING country, You will not get bored because it is super rich both culturally and for nature-related activities (hikes, lakes, waterfalls, etc). Everything is pretty close to Quito.
But be very careful not to walk around with laptop or cellphone-not even at daylight. Safety is not good. Specially if you are alone.

Very underrated. Had a great time staying in La Carolina. I have friends who have been living there for 3+ years and can confirm safety has gotten a bit worse but it's still reasonable. Prices are affordable and there's many hiking spots within 1-3 hours.

There are plenty of coffee shops and restaurants where it's normal for people to go with their computers! We have seen people working/have worked in many places around the city including Donde Gopal (vegetarian restaurant), Tandana (vegan restaurant) and cafes like Jaru. Quito is a beautiful city but I do not walk around here at night.
Carolina is not safe anymore. Agree with the rest. Live in Quito for 7 years

beautiful city, lovely people and culture, prices are affordable, but not that safe in general. The crime has been rising in Quito. Wouldn't recommend staying in the historic area if you want to go out at night (because most locals won't leave their houses once it's dark due to crime, especially important for women to note this). In the daytime, relatively okay to walk around but i wouldn't recommend taking a computer to a coffee shop (it's not that type of city and would raise eyebrows). I recommend dressing down and not wearing jewelry and taking uber if you need to get around. Knowing some Spanish will get you by further. If you're looking for nightlife you can check out the Zona Rosa which is pretty safe at night and is a good place to stay if you want to go out at night. Meals on average are $2 for a full plate of food juice and dessert. The safest neighborhood to stay in is near the park La Carolina which is might as well be an entirely different city (this is basically the "rich area" but is nice to stay at because you can also go out here at night and be safe). Also this area tends to have more modern apartments available on AIRBNB with aircon/heating/internet that sort of thing. InaQuito/Baton are the safest neighborhoods for nomads.
quito.description:
High in the Andes, Quito is a city with a mix of interesting culture and some challenges for visitors and expats. Many like the low cost of living here, where they can find good meals for just a few dollars and enjoy local benefits. The La Carolina district is known as a safe area; with its parks, cafes, and welcoming vibe, it’s a popular place for both locals and newcomers.

However, it’s smart to be careful. Reports of increasing crime mean it’s better to avoid walking around at night, especially in the older parts of the city. While taxis and Uber can be good choices for getting around, some drivers may not focus on safety when using their devices. Language differences can also make daily life harder, so learning some Spanish can be very helpful.

Despite these issues, Quito has many cultural and nature-related activities. Whether it’s a quick trip to nearby waterfalls or enjoying a warm coffee, there’s something for everyone. Just stay alert, dress simply, and you might find Quito's unique appeal quite enjoyable!
quito.description_kor:
안데스 산맥의 높은 곳에 위치한 키토는 매력적인 문화와 함께 방문객 및 외국인 거주자들에게 여러 가지 도전 과제를 안겨주는 도시입니다. 많은 이들이 이곳의 저렴한 생활비를 좋아하며, 소액으로도 맛있는 식사를 즐기고 다양한 지역 혜택을 누릴 수 있습니다. 라 카롤리나 지역은 안전한 곳으로 알려져 있으며, 공원과 카페가 많고 따뜻한 분위기로 인해 지역 주민과 새로 이사 온 사람들 모두에게 인기가 높습니다.

하지만 조심하는 것이 좋습니다. 범죄가 증가하고 있다는 보고가 있어, 특히 밤에 오래된 지역을 돌아다니는 것은 피하는 것이 바람직합니다. 택시와 우버는 이동 수단으로 좋은 선택이 될 수 있지만, 일부 운전자는 안전을 소홀히 할 수 있으니 주의가 필요합니다. 언어의 장벽 때문에 일상생활이 더 힘들어질 수 있으므로, 스페인어를 조금 배우는 것이 큰 도움이 될 것입니다.

이런 문제에도 불구하고, 키토는 다양한 문화 및 자연 활동을 제공합니다. 가까운 폭포로의 짧은 여행이나 따뜻한 커피를 즐기는 등, 모두를 위한 즐길 거리가 많이 있습니다. 경계를 늦추지 않고 간편한 복장으로 키토를 탐방하면, 이곳의 독특한 매력을 충분히 만끽할 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: Recife is one of Brazil´s larggest urban areas, with caothic traffic and other big cities problems, like insecurity. But it has so much colonial history, beautiful beaches and cool neighborhoods. The best area do stay is the south zone, specially Boa Viagem neighborhood. Recife is well knoe in Brazil for it´s famous carnival and cultural life, and in economical aspects, for the tech scene, with a lot of startups. Is such a beatutiful city to visit, with a lot of rivers and bridges, modern architecture and colonial buildings
recife.description:
Recife is a mix of old-style buildings and modern things, making it an interesting place for visitors and residents. Think about it: nice beaches like those in Boa Viagem, some old colonial buildings, and a lively environment filled with culture. Every year, many people come here for Carnival, where the streets are full of music, dance, and fun.

However, there are some problems. Like many large cities, Recife has issues with traffic and safety. It’s a busy place that you need to move through carefully, especially if you are new. Public transportation can be a bit complicated, so planning is important.

On the positive side, living costs can be low, especially compared to other big cities. If you are interested in technology, Recife's growing startup scene offers many chances. Just be ready for some language differences, as not everyone speaks English. In the end, whether you are checking out its rivers and bridges or the interesting neighborhoods, Recife has something for you!
recife.description_kor:
레시시는 고풍스러운 건물과 현대적인 요소가 아름답게 어우러진 곳으로, 방문객과 주민 모두에게 매력적인 장소입니다. 생각해보면, 보아 비아젬과 같은 아름다운 해변, 몇몇 오래된 식민지 시대의 건축물, 그리고 문화로 가득 찬 활기 넘치는 환경이 펼쳐집니다. 매년 많은 사람들이 카니발을 즐기기 위해 이곳을 찾는데, 거리에는 음악과 춤, 즐거움이 넘쳐납니다.

하지만 몇 가지 문제점도 존재합니다. 많은 대도시와 마찬가지로 레시시는 교통과 안전의 문제를 안고 있습니다. 특히 처음 방문하는 사람들은 신중하게 움직일 필요가 있을 정도로 바쁜 곳입니다. 대중교통은 다소 복잡할 수 있으니, 미리 계획하는 것이 중요합니다.

그러나 긍정적인 측면도 많습니다. 생활비는 다른 대도시들에 비해 상대적으로 낮을 수 있습니다. 기술에 관심이 있다면, 레시시의 발전하는 스타트업 씬에서 많은 기회를 찾을 수 있을 것입니다. 다만 모든 사람이 영어를 구사하지 않기 때문에, 언어 장벽에 대한 대비도 필요합니다. 결국, 레시시의 아름다운 강과 다리, 흥미로운 동네를 탐험하며 여러분에게 맞는 특별한 경험을 찾는 것이 가능합니다!

reviews: I was surprised to discover that you can find a lot of good food in Reno. It's basically a typical small American city. But it also has a pretty good bus system.
reno.description:
Reno may remind you of a small town, but there is much more to see and do here. The food options are good, with many local places offering tasty meals that are great after a day of exploring. If you like casual dining and unique restaurants, you will feel welcome.

Getting around is easy because of a good bus system, which helps you travel even without a car. However, keep in mind that while the area is friendly, some people may find it a little difficult to understand the local culture, especially if they don't speak English well.

Reno has a close community and some important attractions that show its history, like the famous Reno Arch. The cost of living is reasonable, but you might need to plan for some extra spending on meals. Overall, Reno is a nice place to visit with a mix of small-town feel and fun things to do, making it good for a relaxed trip!
reno.description_kor:
레노는 작은 마을 같은 분위기를 주지만, 사실 여기서 즐길 수 있는 것과 볼거리는 훨씬 더 다양합니다. 훌륭한 음식 옵션이 마련되어 있고, 많은 지역 식당들은 탐험 후 맛있는 식사를 제공합니다. 캐주얼한 다이닝이나 독특한 레스토랑을 좋아한다면 누구나 환영받는 느낌을 받을 거예요.

시내를 돌아다니는 것은 좋은 버스 시스템 덕분에 정말 편리합니다. 이 시스템 덕분에 자동차 없이도 자유롭게 이동할 수 있죠. 다만, 이 지역은 친근하지만, 일부 사람들은 현지 문화를 이해하는 데 어려움을 겪을 수 있으니, 특히 영어에 자신이 없는 분들은 조금 주의가 필요합니다.

레노에는 유명한 레노 아치와 같은 역사적 명소와 가까운 커뮤니티가 있습니다. 생활비는 꽤 합리적인 편이지만, 식사에 대한 추가 경비를 계획하는 것도 좋을 것 같습니다. 전반적으로 레노는 작은 마을의 정취와 다양한 즐길 거리가 어우러진 매력적인 여행지로, 편안한 여행을 원하는 분들께 적합한 곳입니다!

reviews:
The south of the island has miles of empty beaches and very calm inland villages. Lachania, Vati, Mesanagros and Arnitha all have beautiful squares with wifi where you can telework sitting in a kafeneio under the shade of a tree. 
In Vati there is free 5G in the square and no car in sight. You might see fallow deers grazing around. Perfect place to concentrate. Platanos taverna offers great home made food from April to November.
It can get cold in winter and insulation and heating are hard to find. There are many stray cats in poor welfare and also suffering stray dogs. Driving is a bit aggressive. Alternative lifestyles are tolerated but not really accepted. However attitudes are improving fast.
rhodes.description:
Rhodes is a nice place where you can enjoy quiet beaches and small villages. In the south, you’ll find towns like Lachania and Vati that have nice squares, good for working while having coffee at a local café. You can relax under a tree, use free 5G, and sometimes see fallow deer nearby.

However, be ready for cold winters since heating can be hard to find, and you might see some stray cats and dogs that need care. Driving here can be a bit tricky, so be careful because of the local driving habits. The community is friendly but holds traditional values, so while different lifestyles are starting to be accepted, they are not fully embraced yet.

If you want a good meal, try Platanos taverna, known for its tasty homemade dishes, which are available from April to November. Rhodes is a nice mix of calmness and cultural richness, making it a great place to relax away from busy life.
rhodes.description_kor:
로도스는 조용한 해변과 아기자기한 마을을 함께 즐길 수 있는 멋진 장소입니다. 남쪽에는 라차니아와 바티 같은 마을이 있는데, 이곳은 아늑한 광장이 있어서 현지 카페에서 커피를 마시며 시간을 보내기 좋습니다. 나무 그늘 아래서 쉬면서 무료 5G를 이용할 수 있고, 가끔은 근처에서 노루도 볼 수 있습니다.

겨울철에는 날씨가 추워져서 난방을 찾기 힘들 수 있으며, 보살핌이 필요한 유기묘와 유기견들도 종종 볼 수 있습니다. 이곳에서 운전하는 건 약간 까다로울 수 있으니, 현지의 운전 습관에 주의하는 게 좋습니다. 지역 사회는 친근하지만 전통적인 가치를 중시하는 경향이 있어 여러 가지 생활 방식이 점차 받아들여지고는 있지만, 아직 완전히 통합되지는 않은 모습입니다.

맛있는 음식을 원하신다면, 4월부터 11월까지 제공되는 수제 요리로 유명한 플라타노스 타베르나를 추천드립니다. 로도스는 평온함과 풍부한 문화가 잘 어우러져 있어 바쁜 일상에서 벗어나 여유를 즐기기에 안성맞춤인 장소입니다.

reviews: Cozy city, was my base for two days to visit San Marino. Don't know how is it there during summer, but in the beginning of February is was nice, there are places to walk around and a walking path along the sea is pleasant.
rimini.description:
Rimini is a small city on Italy's Adriatic coast, good for a short vacation. Many visitors appreciate its friendly and lively atmosphere, making it a good place to explore nearby San Marino. Walking along the path by the sea is a must, especially in the cooler months when the beach is quiet.

While February is a nice time to visit, many wonder about the busy summer season. The atmosphere changes during this time, with many people at the beach and various activities. Just be aware that the summer crowds can be a lot if you want a peaceful escape.

Rimini has a mix of history and modern life, with local shops and cafes where you can try real Italian food. Public transport is okay, but riding a bike or walking is a fun way to see the area. As with any travel, keep your things close, especially in crowded places. Overall, Rimini is a good choice for those looking for a relaxing time by the coast.
rimini.description_kor:
리미니는 이탈리아 아드리아 해안에 위치한 작고 매력적인 도시로, 짧은 휴가를 보내기에 안성맞춤입니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳의 친근하고 활기찬 분위기를 즐기며, 인근의 산마리노를 탐방하기 위한 최적의 장소로 추천하고 있습니다. 바닷가를 따라 걷는 것은 필수 코스이며, 특히 한적한 해변을 만끽할 수 있는 시원한 계절에 더욱 즐거움을 느낄 수 있습니다.

2월은 여행하기 좋은 시점이지만, 여름 성수기에는 많은 사람들이 몰리는 점이 궁금해지는 시기입니다. 여름에는 분위기가 훨씬 달라지며, 해변은 사람들로 가득 차고 다양한 활동이 펼쳐집니다. 평화로운 휴식을 원하신다면 여름철의 붐비는 점을 염두에 두시는 게 좋습니다.

리미니는 역사와 현대적인 삶이 조화를 이루고 있으며, 진정한 이탈리아 음식을 맛볼 수 있는 지역 가게와 카페도 많습니다. 대중교통도 괜찮지만, 자전거를 타거나 걷는 것은 이 지역을 탐험하는 재미있는 방법입니다. 여행할 때는 소지품을 항상 잘 챙기고, 특히 혼잡한 장소에서는 더욱 주의하는 게 좋습니다. 전반적으로, 리미니는 해변에서 여유로운 시간을 보내고 싶은 분들에게 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다.

reviews: I stayed in spring, and outside old town I didn't encounter many tourists at all. The city was beautiful. I would recommend it for foodies, most things were very tasty and the prices weren't crazy high. Overall, a nice place to visit.

Visited the small, cute part of RIGA's old town and the ART NOUVEAU architecture that is located a bit outside the center. 
Seemed quite juvenile + full of tourists during the summer of JULY 2019. Has a bit of that ex-comunist era inside the city.
riga.description:
Riga is a nice place to visit, especially in the spring when there are fewer people. You will see pretty streets with old town charm and notable Art Nouveau buildings just a short walk from the center. If you enjoy food, you will like the local dishes, which are tasty and not too expensive.

In the summer, the city can be quite busy with many tourists, which makes it lively, but it might be too crowded for some people. The city shows signs of its history, with reminders of its past as a communist country mixed with modern life.

Public transportation is okay, but you might have some difficulties if you do not speak Latvian. The city is generally safe, so you can explore freely, especially in popular areas like the old town. Be sure to take your time walking and enjoy the local customs—you may find some great places away from the usual tourist spots!
riga.description_kor:
리가는 방문하기 좋은 장소로, 특히 인파가 적은 봄철에 가면 더 매력적입니다. 도심과 가까운 곳에서 멋진 거리를 stroll하거나 구시가지의 아름다움을 느낄 수 있으며, 아르 누보 건축물도 꼭 봐야 할 부분입니다. 음식에 관심이 있다면, 현지 요리는 맛도 좋고 가격도 부담이 덜해 즐기실 수 있을 겁니다.

여름에는 관광객이 많아 도시가 꽤 붐비는데, 활기차긴 하지만 일부 사람들에게는 다소 혼잡하게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 과거 공산국가였던 역사적인 흔적과 현대적 생활이 잘 어우러져 있습니다.

대중교통은 제법 괜찮지만, 라트비아어를 하지 못하면 조금 불편할 수 있습니다. 일반적으로 도시는 안전하니, 특히 구시가지와 같은 인기 있는 지역에서는 자유롭게 탐방하셔도 괜찮습니다. 천천히 걸으면서 현지 문화를 즐기는 것도 잊지 마세요. 흔한 관광 명소에서 벗어나 숨겨진 멋진 장소들을 발견할 수도 있을 것입니다!

reviews: One of my favorite cities in Europe, only "con" is the cold, but you already know that coming into Iceland.
reykjavik.description:
Reykjavik is a small city in Iceland that is worth a visit, especially if you enjoy a friendly and creative atmosphere. People talk a lot about its interesting culture, colorful buildings, and welcoming residents. While the cold weather can be a downside, it adds to the Icelandic experience! Just dress warmly and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

The cost of living can be high, so be ready for that. Public transportation is okay but may sometimes be limited, so think about renting a car if you want to see areas outside the city. It is generally safe, making it a good place for solo travelers or families.

Don’t miss the well-known Hallgrímskirkja church or the lively Harpa Concert Hall. If you feel like it, try some local food! English is commonly spoken, so talking with people should be easy. Enjoy walking through artistic neighborhoods like 101 Reykjavik and learn about the history of this unique capital!
reykjavik.description_kor:
레이캬비크는 아이슬란드의 작은 도시로, 특히 친근하고 창의적인 분위기를 좋아하는 분들에게 꼭 한 번 방문해볼 만한 곳입니다. 이곳의 흥미로운 문화, 화려한 건물, 그리고 친절한 주민들에 대한 이야기가 많이 들리죠. 추운 날씨가 약간의 단점일 수 있지만, 아이슬란드의 매력을 더욱 돋보이게 하는 요소이기도 합니다! 따뜻하게 옷을 챙기고 아름다운 경관을 즐겨보세요.

생활비가 다소 높은 편이니 참고하시기 바랍니다. 대중교통은 괜찮지만 가끔 제한적일 수 있어요. 도시 외곽에 가고 싶다면 차를 렌트하는 것도 좋은 방법입니다. 안전한 편이라 혼자 여행하는 분이나 가족 단위 여행객에게도 적합한 곳입니다.

홀그림스키르카 교회와 활기찬 하르파 콘서트홀은 꼭 들러보세요. 기분이 좋다면 현지 음식을 맛보는 것도 좋습니다! 영어가 널리 통용되기 때문에 사람들과의 대화도 수월할 것입니다. 예술적인 동네인 101 레이캬비크 거리를 거닐며 이 독특한 수도의 역사도 한껏 즐겨보세요!

reviews:
I love Rishikesh, and it's a very pleasant place to live as a digital nomad. Prices are very cheap and it is lovely to have an ashram to go to every day. The flow of life is easy because I take with myself the backpack with the computer to a cafe by Ganga and have some nice healthy breakfast, at 08:00 am, and work to about 10:30. Then i go to Sachcha Dham Ashram join a Bhajans and listen to Satsang from my Guru there. Then i go out with my friends to a nice place to spend the day. Other days i work after that to about 5 Pm, and walk to Parmarth Niketan Ashram for som Bhajans and Satsang, and maybe a session of Yoga to, before i go to an restturant and have an evening meal before going home. 

Now that i am older an have traveled on and off for over twenty years, i have found my home in Rishikesh, and i am suppriced that there is not more Digital Nomads there than it is, but i am pretty shure that that will change in the future :)
rishikesh.description:
Rishikesh is a nice place located by the Ganga River, and it has a relaxed atmosphere that many people enjoy. Digital nomads like it as a good location to work while enjoying the calm environment. With low prices, you can have a healthy breakfast at a riverside café, use your laptop, and enjoy the quiet mornings. The daily routine here includes visiting ashrams like Sachcha Dham and Parmarth Niketan for bhajans and Satsangs.

While Rishikesh is welcoming, it can be a bit difficult for those who do not know about yoga culture or Hindi. Public transport is not very good, so walking or biking is common. But the real benefit is in the rich cultural experiences. There are many outdoor activities to enjoy, like yoga sessions, hikes, or simply spending time by the river with friends.

For a nice experience, explore the areas near the river, and feel free to join local events. Just remember that patience is important here, as life moves at its own speed. Rishikesh is a special place waiting for you!
rishikesh.description_kor:
리시케시는 강가(Ganga River) 근처에 위치한 멋진 장소로, 많은 사람들이 즐길 수 있는 편안한 분위기를 자아냅니다. 디지털 노마드들에게는 조용한 환경에서 일할 수 있는 좋은 장소로 특히 인기가 높습니다. 저렴한 가격에 강가의 카페에서 건강한 아침을 즐기며 노트북을 사용할 수 있고, 평화로운 아침을 만끽할 수 있습니다. 이곳에서의 일상에는 삭차 담(Sachcha Dham)과 파르마르트 니케탄(Parmarth Niketan)과 같은 아쉬람(ashram)을 방문해 바잔(bhajans)과 삳상(Satsangs)에 참여하는 것도 포함되어 있습니다.

리시케시는 환영받는 장소이지만, 요가 문화나 힌디를 잘 알지 못하는 사람들에게는 다소 낯설 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 다소 불편하기 때문에 걷거나 자전거를 타는 것이 일반적입니다. 그럼에도 불구하고, 이곳의 진정한 매력은 풍부한 문화 체험에 있습니다. 요가 수업이나 하이킹, 강가에서 친구들과의 시간을 즐기는 등 다양한 야외 활동이 기다리고 있습니다.

멋진 경험을 위해 강가 근처의 지역을 탐방하고, 지역 행사에 자유롭게 참여해 보세요. 이곳에서는 인내심을 갖는 것이 중요합니다. 삶은 저마다의 속도로 흘러가기 때문입니다. 리시케시는 여러분을 기다리고 있는 특별한 곳입니다!

reviews: Have to drive. Long winters. Have great art museums and music here but little else. Large LBGTQ community.
rochester.description:
Rochester has a mix of culture and cold weather. It is known for its art scene, with many museums and a lively music atmosphere. If you like art, you will enjoy it here. However, some people say that outside of the museums, there may not be many activities, especially in the long, snowy winters.

Getting around can be difficult since driving is necessary. Public transport is not very good, but once you drive, you can visit the city's neighborhoods or popular places.

Rochester also has an active and welcoming LGBTQ community, which creates a friendly atmosphere that many people like. Just remember that the winters can be tough, so be prepared for some snow shoveling.

If you are thinking about visiting, dress warmly, enjoy the art, and appreciate the community spirit!
rochester.description_kor:
로체스터는 문화와 추운 날씨가 어우러진 곳입니다. 이곳은 다양한 박물관과 활기찬 음악 씬으로 유명한 예술의 중심지이죠. 예술을 좋아하신다면 로체스터에서 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있을 것입니다. 하지만 일부 사람들은 박물관 외에는 활동이 적을 수 있다고 이야기합니다. 특히 길고 눈덮인 겨울에는 그 느낌이 더욱 강하죠.

이곳은 차량 이용이 필수여서 이동이 불편할 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 그리 좋지 않지만, 한 번 운전을 시작하면 도시의 여러 동네와 인기 있는 명소를 방문할 수 있습니다.

로체스터는 또한 활발하고 환영하는 LGBTQ 커뮤니티가 있어 많은 사람들이 이곳의 친근한 분위기를 좋아합니다. 겨울이 힘들 수 있다는 점을 염두에 두시고, 눈 치울 준비도 하세요.

방문하실 계획이라면 따뜻하게 옷을 입고, 예술을 만끽하며 지역 사회의 정을 느껴보세요!

reviews:
Rouen is my HQ since 6 years when I return in France, and it's a pretty city, with a lot of pubs, very good restaurants and a chill city.

If you like the parisian life (a lot of places to eat, drink a glass, some clubs and cultural outing) without the cost of Paris, Rouen is good for you !
rouen.description:
Rouen is a nice city that mixes the energy of Paris with a more calm atmosphere. If you want informal pubs and good restaurants, you will feel welcome here. Visitors enjoy the city's easygoing vibe, making it a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing.

One of the best things about Rouen is that you can have cultural experiences and tasty food without the high prices of Paris. With many places to eat and meet people, you can spend your evenings having drinks and enjoying the local life, all while appreciating the nice buildings.

On the other hand, while Rouen is smaller and easier to get around, some people may face a few issues, like limited public transport and sometimes a language barrier. But, in general, it’s a safe and friendly city where you can feel comfortable.

When you visit, don’t miss the important historic sites and local traditions, which will make your experience special. Take time to explore different neighborhoods and enjoy the rich culture that Rouen offers!
rouen.description_kor:
루앙은 파리의 에너지와 조용한 분위기가 조화롭게 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다. 비공식적인 펍과 훌륭한 레스토랑을 찾으신다면 이곳에서 환영받을 것입니다. 방문객들은 루앙의 여유로운 분위기를 만끽하며 관광 후 편안히 쉴 수 있는 최적의 장소입니다. 

루앙의 가장 큰 장점 중 하나는 파리의 높은 가격에 비해 합리적인 가격으로 문화 체험과 맛있는 음식을 즐길 수 있다는 점입니다. 다양한 식사 장소와 사람들과 만날 수 있는 공간들이 많아 저녁에 음료를 마시며 지역의 생활을 느끼는 데 좋은 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 멋진 건물을 감상하는 것도 잊지 마세요. 

루앙은 규모가 작고 이동하기 편리하지만, 일부 사람들은 제한된 대중교통과 가끔 발생하는 언어 장벽 때문에 어려움을 겪을 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고, 이곳은 대체로 안전하고 친근한 도시로 편안한 느낌을 줍니다. 

방문할 때는 중요한 역사적 장소와 지역 전통을 놓치지 마세요. 이 경험들이 당신의 여행을 더욱 특별하게 만들어줄 것입니다. 다양한 동네를 탐방하며 루앙이 제공하는 풍부한 문화를 즐겨보세요!

reviews: I think better than Amsterdam. Like Madrid. There are lot of things to do, good nightlife, good restaraunts..

I stayed in Rotterdam for about a week in early 2022. It's an interesting city, but not very large. A local could show you the best parts in a day or two. I found it to be somewhat expensive. I think it's more geared toward business, so unless you have something specific to take care of, there's no reason to go back.
Great city, but not for nomads. If you want to come here, come here for a week, that's more than enough to see all the interesting parts of the city. Best place for beers: Kaapse Brouwers.
don't come here it's a trap
rotterdam.description:
Rotterdam is a lively city that has modern buildings, a busy nightlife, and many good restaurants. Many visitors see it as a nice alternative to Amsterdam, with a lot to see in a small area. You can see the main attractions in just a couple of days—locals can help you find the best places!

However, remember that it can be expensive here, and it feels more like a business city. If you are not here for work, a week is enough to enjoy the culture and attractions. To try some local beers, be sure to visit Kaapse Brouwers, a popular place for beer lovers.

On the downside, some visitors say that public transport is not very extensive, and there might be language challenges if you don't know Dutch. Overall, Rotterdam has its own charm, but it might not be the best choice for long stays. If you plan to visit, enjoy the energy, but make sure to keep an eye on your budget!
rotterdam.description_kor:
로테르담은 현대적인 건축물과 활기찬 밤문화, 다양한 훌륭한 레스토랑이 있는 생동감 넘치는 도시입니다. 많은 방문객들은 로테르담이 암스테르담에 비해 매력적인 대안으로 여겨지며, 좁은 지역 안에서도 볼거리가 많다고 느끼곤 합니다. 주요 관광지는 단 이틀 안에도 충분히 둘러볼 수 있고, 현지인들이 추천하는 숨겨진 명소도 쉽게 찾아볼 수 있습니다!

하지만 로테르담은 물가가 다소 비쌀 수 있고, 그 도시 특유의 비즈니스 중심의 분위기를 느낄 수 있습니다. 만약 일이 아닌 관광 목적으로 방문하신다면, 문화와 명소를 잘 즐기기 위해 일주일 정도면 충분할 것입니다. 현지 맥주를 맛보고 싶다면, 맥주 애호가들 사이에서 인기 있는 카프스 브라우어스(Kaapse Brouwers)를 빼놓지 마세요.

단점으로는, 일부 방문객들이 대중교통이 그렇게 넓지 않다고 느끼며, 네덜란드어에 익숙하지 않다면 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있다는 점입니다. 전반적으로 로테르담은 독특한 매력을 가지고 있지만 장기 체류에는 가장 알맞은 선택이 아닐지 모릅니다. 방문할 계획이 있다면, 에너지를 만끽하되 예산에도 주의하세요!

reviews: I and my family moved here from Saudi Arabia, Rovaniemi is a great city to live in with an amazing free education system. The people there are so nice, in cafes, restaurants or just if you bump into them on the street they are so friendly and willing to help. There are so much fun things to do in Rovaniemi.
rovaniemi.description:
Rovaniemi is a nice city that feels welcoming, especially when you arrive from a far place like Saudi Arabia. The friendly locals make you feel at home; whether you are having a coffee at a café or walking down the street, you will likely get a smile or help. Also, the free education system is a great benefit for families.

There are many enjoyable things to do here. From exploring the Arctic Circle to visiting Santa Claus Village, there are both fun and exciting activities. However, be ready for some difficulties. The cost of living can be a bit high, and public transportation is limited, so having a plan is helpful.

If you are thinking about visiting or moving, be sure to embrace the local customs and be ready for the beautiful winter landscape. In Rovaniemi, there is always something interesting waiting for you nearby!
rovaniemi.description_kor:
로바니에미는 사우디아라비아와 같은 먼 곳에서 도착할 때 특히 환영받는 기분이 드는 멋진 도시입니다. 친절한 현지인들이 카페에서 커피를 마시거나 거리에서 산책할 때, 마치 집에 있는 듯한 편안함을 느낄 수 있도록 도와줍니다. 여기서는 미소를 지으며 도움을 받을 기회가 많습니다. 또한, 무료 교육 시스템 덕분에 가족들에게도 큰 혜택이 있습니다.

로바니에미에는 다양한 즐길 거리가 있습니다. 북극권을 탐험하거나 산타클로스 마을을 방문하며 신나는 경험을 할 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 몇 가지 어려움에 대비하는 것이 좋습니다. 생활비가 다소 높을 수 있고 대중교통이 제한적이기 때문에 미리 계획을 세우는 것이 도움이 됩니다.

방문이나 이사를 고려하고 있다면, 지역 관습을 존중하고 아름다운 겨울 풍경에 대비하는 것이 중요합니다. 로바니에미에는 항상 흥미로운 것들이 기다리고 있습니다!

reviews:
Did the previous reviewer say world class art and culture? Where would this be because after 2 years there, I was craving art and culture. Like, my experience is the polar opposite so unless art includes street statues that happen a month of each year and if by culture meaning you run into a single black guy on the street, I don't get it. It's really white, very few Hispanics, almost no blacks and few Asians. No museums (outside of historical ones). Most of the Mormons live in Provo if that matters. There weren't really any sketchy areas I've encountered in SLC.

SLC is a good city to visit especially if you're skiing. If you're not skiing, I don't know what else you can do. I found the city to be quite boring. 

The national parks in eastern and southern UT are gorgeous but we're talking 4-8 hour drive away. Skiing is great. I personally like Park City but it's boring there too. Dating sucks all around. Between recovering Mormons to Mormons, there aren't a lot in between even if the city attracts non-mormons to work there. 
And if you're not white, it'll be a struggle in the dating scene. SLC nightlife is dominated mainly by college kids. There's only 3 places that I'd consider hanging at as a 30's and up nomad and they're not very close to each other. It's a walkable city although things are a bit spread apart. 

The new SLC airport did not consider those who fly on airlines other than Delta. It's a 20 minute walk to get from check in to the furthest gate in terminal B. Imagine old folks and handicap. Crazy.

Salt Lake is a great place to be: Tons of things to do, world class art and culture, some of the best snow in America, friendly polite people. However, the metrics score/ review is inaccurate, during the winter, Salt Lake has some of the worst air quality in the country. It's called inversion, look it up. Somehow being surrounded by coal power plants and oil refineries, while being horizonally sandwiched between two east-west mountain ranges, at high altitude, and two major north south, east west freeways, creates third world level pollution.
salt-lake-city.description:
Salt Lake City, Utah, is surrounded by mountains and offers a mix of experiences, though not everyone agrees. If you enjoy winter sports, the skiing here is great; the snow is among the best in the country. The city is easy to walk around, and while it mostly has a college atmosphere at night, there are a few bars for older crowds.

However, if you want a lively arts scene and diverse culture, you might be disappointed. Reviews mention there are few museums and a mostly white community, which can make the cultural options feel limited. Also, many attractions are far away, with national parks located 4-8 hours from the city.

People say the city is relatively safe, but be prepared for winter inversions, which can affect air quality. If you plan to visit Salt Lake City, it's a good idea to arrange your activities, especially in winter, as some attractions might leave you wanting more.
salt-lake-city.description_kor:
솔트레이크 시티, 유타는 산으로 둘러싸여 있어 다양한 경험을 제공합니다. 하지만 모든 사람이 이런 생각에 동의하는 것은 아닙니다. 겨울 스포츠를 좋아하신다면 이곳 스키장이 정말 훌륭합니다. 눈 상태도 전국 최고의 수준입니다. 그리고 도시는 다니기 편리하며, 주로 대학가의 활기찬 야경이 매력적이지만, 연령층이 있는 분들을 위한 바도 몇 군데 있습니다.

그러나 활기찬 예술과 다양한 문화를 원하신다면 다소 실망할 수도 있습니다. 일부 리뷰에 따르면 박물관이 적고, 주로 백인 커뮤니티로 이루어져 있어 문화적 옵션이 제한된 느낌을 줄 수 있습니다. 또, 많은 명소가 상당히 떨어져 있어서, 국립공원은 시내에서 4~8시간 거리에 위치해 있습니다.

사람들은 이 도시가 비교적 안전하다고 하지만, 겨울에는 공기 질에 영향을 줄 수 있는 역전 현상에 대비해야 합니다. 솔트레이크 시티를 방문하실 계획이라면, 특히 겨울철에는 일부 명소가 아쉬울 수 있으니, 활동 계획을 잘 세우시는 것이 좋습니다.

reviews: Love this city, very romantic and cool in the summer. but it is difficult to find a nice airbnb. it is too much small or too expensive for the quality. you will def have great time here. but unfortunately, I had problem to make friends here. some how, It seemed the locals were not quite interested in having communication or making forein friends even in the co-working space. I don't think this is because of the language barrier but...I cant explain this well. anyway, the city is great to stay from Jun - July(Aug starts getting rains.), would be much nicer if you can speak Russian. Goodluck!

Doesn't matter what you're interested in, Saint Petersburg has it. It's the largest "small" city in Europe. Such a large population, but everything you want in nightlife and action is packed into several districts. Best city in Europe for nightlife. Not sure why nomadlist has "safety" as a con because it's safer than any western europe city and every american city. Cheaper than Thailand, but winter is COLD.

Came 14 yrs ago from Germany for a visit - and stayed. Is 1 of most beautiful cities on earth, and I was almost everywhere in my younger days.- Cost of living extremely cheap if you know the basic rules.- Opened my own travel agency 10 yrs ago and pay only 6% taxes no matter how much I earn.- Average internet speed is 77 Mbit/sec.- Red tape is on the down side. You really need a Russian lawyer if you want to stay for years.- Winters can get very harsh, my lowest was -34 C in 2016.-
Extremely beautiful and liveable city, not very expensive either, for the most part. People were very friendly too. Good public transport and working spaces (coffee shops, coworking spaces).
Beautiful livable and active city, relatively cheap.
saint-petersburg.description:
Saint Petersburg is a city that attracts people, especially in the summer. Think of sunny days, beautiful buildings, and active nightlife — everything you need in a few busy areas. While it can be a bit difficult to find a comfortable place to stay (with Airbnbs sometimes being complicated), you will enjoy what the city has to offer. However, making friends with locals can be tough; some visitors have mentioned that there is a barrier, not just with language but in connecting with people.

The cost of living is low for a city of this size, particularly if you know where to look. Also, public transport is effective, making it easy to get around. However, keep in mind that winters are very cold, so dress warmly! If you speak a little Russian, you may find things a bit easier.

In general, Saint Petersburg is a great city to live in — just explore its culture, find cozy coffee shops, and enjoy everything from art to activities!
saint-petersburg.description_kor:
상트페테르부르크는 특히 여름철에 많은 사람들을 매료시키는 도시입니다. 화창한 날씨와 아름다운 건물, 그리고 생동감 넘치는 야경을 떠올려 보세요. 번화한 지역에서는 필요한 모든 것이 갖춰져 있습니다. 편안한 숙소를 찾는 것이 다소 어려울 수 있지만(에어비앤비는 때때로 복잡하기도 하죠), 이 도시가 제공하는 매력을 충분히 즐길 수 있을 것입니다. 하지만 현지인과 친해지기는 쉽지 않을 수 있습니다. 많은 방문객들이 언어 장벽뿐만 아니라 사람들과의 연결에 어려움을 겪었다고 말합니다.

이 정도 큰 도시임에도 생활비는 상대적으로 저렴하며, 특히 어디서 무엇을 찾아야 할지를 알면 더욱 그렇습니다. 대중교통이 효율적이어서 이동하기에도 편리합니다. 다만, 겨울은 매우 추우니 따뜻한 옷차림을 잊지 마세요! 약간의 러시아어를 구사할 수 있다면 좀 더 원활한 소통이 가능할 것입니다.

전반적으로 상트페테르부르크는 살기 좋은 도시입니다. 문화도 탐방하고 아늑한 커피숍도 찾아보며 예술과 다양한 활동을 즐겨보세요!

reviews: Spent about 5 days in here. The city is quite nice and calm, surrounded by nature and tall hills. There is a really nice river embankment in the city where you can walk around or run. Take in mind that almost all the shops are completely closed on Sundays, which is still very unusual to me. Augustiner bräu is a really atmospheric bar which can recommend to visit, and Hangar-7 museum from Red Bull which is free to check out is also quite nice.
salzburg.description:
Salzburg is a city surrounded by hills and nice views, making it a good place for a short trip. You can spend your time walking along the river, where you can run or enjoy the view. The city has a lot of character, and a place you should visit is Augustiner Bräu, a busy bar where you can experience the local scene.

While the city is calm, remember that most shops are closed on Sundays, which may be different for you. If you like interesting places, be sure to visit Hangar-7, a museum by Red Bull that has free admission. 

Salzburg is affordable; you can find comfortable restaurants and cafes without spending too much. Just be aware that getting around might be a little difficult because public transport is not very extensive. Overall, it is a nice place with a lot of culture and beautiful views—great for travelers who want to relax and explore!
salzburg.description_kor:
잘츠부르크는 언덕과 아름다운 경치로 둘러싸인 도시로, 짧은 여행에 안성맞춤입니다. 강가를 따라 산책하거나 뛰며 멋진 풍경을 즐기기에 좋은 곳이죠. 이 도시는 독특한 매력을 지니고 있으며, 아우구스티너 브루(Augustiner Bräu)와 같은 인기 있는 바에서는 현지 분위기를 제대로 느낄 수 있습니다.

잘츠부르크는 조용한 도시이지만, 대부분의 상점이 일요일에는 문을 닫는다는 점을 기억해야 해요. 이는 여행 스타일에 따라 다를 수 있겠죠. 흥미로운 장소를 찾고 있다면, 무료로 입장할 수 있는 레드불의 박물관인 행거-7(Hangar-7)을 꼭 들러보세요.

잘츠부르크는 비용 면에서도 부담 없이 즐기기 좋은 도시입니다. 비싼 가격을 지불하지 않고도 아늑한 레스토랑과 카페를 찾을 수 있습니다. 다만, 대중교통이 그리 편리하지 않으니 이동 시에는 조금 불편할 수 있다는 점은 유념해야 합니다. 전반적으로 잘츠부르크는 문화가 풍부하고 아름다운 경치를 갖춘 멋진 여행지로, 휴식을 취하며 탐험하고 싶은 여행자에게 안성맞춤입니다!

reviews: Where cowboys and the wild west truly started, San Antonio is a beautiful and historic city with many layers to explore within and outside the city. It's a hotter town than Austin, not just in temperature, but also in terms of friendliness, activities, family values, and cultural richness (with authentic tacos of all types, Tex-Mex, Cali style, and from Mexico City), it has one of the best culinary and cocktail scenes in the country. It's one of the most affordable for millennials in the States with rich multicultural diversity, being predominantly Hispanic and inclusive. Many are bilingual in Spanish, but English is predominant as anywhere else in the States. From aviation (first military flight) to tech (the invention of the microprocessor), and even Hollywood (the first Best Picture), San Antonio has been home to many firsts. The spirit of these firsts has continued through the ages. Nowadays, there are incredibly fast internet speeds thanks to Google Fiber in many parts of town, San Antonio has all the ingredients for a booming creative economy due to a convergence of incentives in film, gaming, and traditional arts. Downtown San Antonio has old Spanish-architecture, mixed with colorful murals by local artists, and southern Texan charm, but it's the beautiful people who really make the town flourish.
san-antonio.description:
San Antonio has a mix of history, culture, and southern friendliness where cowboys used to ride. This city has many interesting stories in its old streets, and the locals are nice and often smile. The food is great, especially the tacos and various Tex-Mex dishes that you will enjoy. Also, it's one of the most affordable cities in the U.S. for young people, making it easier to experience everything available.

Many people here speak both English and Spanish, but if you only speak English, that's fine—it's common. Getting around is not too hard, but some places might have limited public transport, so having a car could be useful. The summer heat can be strong, so be ready to stay cool!

Be sure to visit downtown, where you will see beautiful Spanish buildings and colorful murals from local artists. With a rich mix of cultures and many activities in arts and technology, San Antonio is a lively place that may feel like home. Just bring your spirit of adventure!
san-antonio.description_kor:
샌안토니오는 역사와 문화, 그리고 남부의 친절함이 어우러진 멋진 도시입니다. 예전에는 카우보이들이 말타고 다녔던 곳이죠. 이 도시의 오래된 거리들에는 흥미로운 이야기들이 가득하고, 현지인들은 항상 친절하고 미소를 잃지 않습니다. 음식 또한 훌륭한데, 특히 타코와 다양한 텍스-멕스 요리는 정말 맛있어요. 또한, 젊은 층에게는 미국에서 가장 저렴한 도시에 속하며, 다양한 경험을 손쉽게 즐길 수 있습니다.

샌안토니오에서 많은 사람들이 영어와 스페인어를 모두 구사하지만, 영어만으로도 문제없습니다—그만큼 일반적이니까요. 이동은 비교적 수월하지만, 일부 지역에서는 대중교통이 제한적일 수 있으니 차가 있으면 더 편리할 수 있습니다. 여름의 더위는 꽤 강할 수 있으니, 시원하게 지낼 준비를 하세요!

다운타운은 꼭 방문해보세요. 그곳에서는 아름다운 스페인식 건축과 지역 예술가들의 다채로운 벽화를 감상할 수 있습니다. 다양한 문화가 풍부하게 얽혀 있는 샌안토니오는 예술과 기술의 활동이 넘쳐나는 생동감 있는 도시로, 마치 집에 있는 듯한 편안함을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다. 모험심을 가지고 방문하세요!

reviews: Unfortunately just a hard place to Nomad. Maybe ~10 years ago. Needless to say; accommodation is super high and you don't get much. Lots of driving culture. Surprisingly few gyms; most of which expensive and/or super crowded. Not very easy to meet people per sprawl/driving culture. The locals keep pretty insulated amongst each other. WiFi/Internet great. Food OK if you like Mexican and/or tex-mex. Beaches are great and surfing is pretty good, but it gets very crowded in desirable months with lots of parking problems. Housing quality is poor for what you pay; poor insulation/windows, many units don't have A/C and poor heat; but as the climate is changing you need it now. Winters can dip to 39-40 degrees at night and in the A.M. If you stay inland it gets hot. By the coast rarely hot even when you want it in the summer, lots of fog. I would recommend 1-month max in the summer in either Pacific Beach or Downtown area.
san-diego.description:
San Diego has a special feel that many visitors like, but it also has some challenges. The coastal city has sunny beaches and good surfing, but they can get very crowded, especially during the summer. You might find parking difficult, so plan ahead!

The local food mostly focuses on Mexican and Tex-Mex food—if you enjoy that, you're in a good place! However, places to stay can be quite expensive, and some locals say the quality is not always worth the price. It’s common to find places without air conditioning or good insulation. While the winters are mild, it can get cold at night.

In San Diego, people mostly get around by car, and some visitors say this driving culture makes it harder to meet others. If you want to socialize, you might need to go to different neighborhoods or check out local events.

If you are thinking about a visit, consider going for a month during the summer in areas like Pacific Beach or Downtown for the best experience. Just be prepared for some foggy mornings by the coast!
san-diego.description_kor:
샌디에고는 많은 방문객들에게 사랑받는 매력적인 도시이지만, 몇 가지 도전 과제도 있습니다. 이 아름다운 해안 도시에서는 화창한 해변과 훌륭한 서핑 스팟을 즐길 수 있지만, 여름철에는 상당히 혼잡해질 수 있습니다. 주차는 어려울 수 있으니 미리 계획하는 것이 좋습니다.

지역 음식은 주로 멕시코 요리와 텍스-멕스 요리에 중점을 두고 있습니다. 이를 좋아하신다면 정말 좋은 선택을 하신 거예요! 하지만 숙박 시설은 꽤 비쌀 수 있으며, 일부 현지인들은 가격에 비해 품질이 항상 좋지 않다고 언급합니다. 에어컨이나 단열이 잘 되어 있지 않은 곳도 종종 발견됩니다. 겨울철은 온화하지만 밤에는 다소 쌀쌀해질 수 있습니다.

샌디에고에서는 대부분의 사람들이 자동차를 이용하는데, 이로 인해 다른 사람들과의 만남이 어려워질 수 있다는 의견도 있습니다. 만약 사회적 활동을 원하신다면, 다른 동네를 방문하거나 지역 이벤트를 확인해 보시는 것이 좋겠습니다.

방문을 계획하고 있으면, 여름 동안 태평양 비치나 다운타운과 같은 인기 지역에서 한 달 정도 머무는 것이 최고의 경험이 될 것입니다. 해변가에서 안개 낀 아침을 준비하는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Old San Juan's architecture is lovely. Although it's as pricey as a US mainland city, the food is good and the coffee is excellent. Locals can vary in friendliness quite a bit -- although being brusque with someone from the US mainland is entirely understandable. Uber works perfectly well. The museums have very inexpensive admissions fees. All in all, a good destination for a shorter (3 weeks or less) trip. But not a place with a digital nomad community or lots of cultural activities.

San Juan is amazing. Tons of beautiful views and restaurants everywhere. If you like Latin America, you'll like San Juan. It is more expensive than other LatAm hubs, but it has better infrastructure and is safer.

There are many different vibes you can get on the island. Old San Juan is like Europe but more colorful. Condado is closer to Miami but with a better beach. There is the only rainforest in America just 20 minutes away, not to mention all the other beautiful parts of the island. 

I would live here even without the tax benefits.

Ignore the negative comments you might see online about 'tourists' and 'gringos.' 99% of Puerto Ricans are super friendly towards outsiders.

The main cons I would say is that there aren't too many restaurants here on the water. Also, don't expect the vibe on the rest of the island to be like Bali, Thailand, or Tulum. Restaurants in San Juan have a pretty good ambience but the buildings on the rest of the island are mostly just concrete boxes with bright hospital lights.
san-juan.description:
Imagine walking through the streets of Old San Juan, where you can see beautiful buildings that feel like they belong in Europe. The city has a lively atmosphere, with the old colonial streets of Old San Juan blending into the beach vibe of Condado, which is similar to Miami but has better sand. There is delicious local food and great coffee, so food lovers will find plenty to enjoy—even if the prices can be a bit higher than usual for Latin America.

Getting around is simple because Uber is effective here, and local museums have affordable entry fees. A helpful tip: don’t be put off by the sometimes direct attitude of some locals; once you get to know them, you will see that most are friendly and welcoming to visitors!

While San Juan may not have many digital nomads or a lot of waterfront restaurants, it offers stunning views and many natural attractions nearby, including the only rainforest in the U.S. Just keep in mind that the island's charm is different from Bali or Tulum—it's a special experience on its own. Enjoy your trip!
san-juan.description_kor:
산 후안 구시가지의 거리를 걷는 모습을 상상해 보세요. 유럽에서 볼 법한 아름다운 건물들이 줄지어 있습니다. 이 도시는 활기찬 분위기로 가득하고, 구시가지의 오래된 식민지 거리와 콘다도의 해변이 잘 어우러져 있어요. 콘다도는 마이애미와 비슷하지만, 모래가 훨씬 부드럽답니다. 음식 애호가들을 위해 맛있는 지역 요리와 훌륭한 커피도 준비되어 있어 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 단, 가격은 라틴 아메리카의 일반적인 수준보다 조금 더 높을 수 있다는 점 참고하세요.

이곳에서 이동하는 것은 매우 간편합니다. 우버가 잘 이용 가능하며, 지역 박물관의 입장료도 저렴해요. 기억해 두면 좋은 팁: 일부 현지인의 직설적인 태도에 불편해하지 마세요. 그들과 친해지면 대부분의 사람들이 따뜻하게 환대해 준다는 걸 알게 될 거예요.

산 후안에는 디지털 노마드나 해변가 레스토랑이 많지 않을 수 있지만, 아름다운 경치와 함께 미국 유일의 열대 우림을 포함한 다양한 자연 명소가 있어요. 다만 섬의 매력은 발리나 툴룸과는 다른 점이 있으니, 그 자체로 특별한 경험이 될 거라는 점을 잊지 마세요. 즐거운 여행 되세요!

reviews:
Cool city if you want to practice surfing and eat some basque food.
The weather is cool (maybe a little rainy), warm and not too hot.
The only downside is the housing price :/
san-sebastian.description:
San Sebastián is a great place if you enjoy surfing and Basque food. With nice beaches and good waves, it's a good spot for surfers. The city's food scene is interesting; you’ll find pintxos (small snacks) everywhere, which makes trying local food enjoyable.

The weather is usually cool and mild, with some rain at times. It is comfortable, but you should bring an umbrella just in case. Many people mention that housing prices can be high if you plan to stay for a while.

Public transportation is okay, making it easy to get around, but be ready for some language challenges since English is not widely spoken. However, the local people are often very friendly and willing to help. Explore the nice neighborhoods, try surfing, and experience the local culture. Just be careful about costs, especially when looking for a place to stay!
san-sebastian.description_kor:
산 세바스티안은 서핑과 바스크 음식을 즐기기에 안성맞춤인 장소입니다. 멋진 해변과 좋은 파도가 있어 서퍼들에게도 최적의 조건을 제공합니다. 이 도시의 음식 문화는 매력적이며, 곳곳에서 피인초스(작은 스낵)를 맛볼 수 있어 현지 음식을 즐기는 재미를 더해 줍니다.

날씨는 대체로 서늘하고 온화해서 가끔 비가 내리기도 합니다. 편안한 복장으로 다니기 좋지만, 혹시 모르니 우산을 챙기는 것이 좋습니다. 많은 사람들이 장기 체류를 계획할 경우 주택 가격이 높을 수 있다고 말하니 참고하세요.

대중교통은 편리해서 이동하는 데 큰 어려움은 없습니다. 다만 영어가 널리 사용되지 않기 때문에 언어적인 부분에서 약간의 어려움이 있을 수 있습니다. 그러나 현지 사람들은 대체로 친절하고 도움을 주고 싶어하는 마음이 큽니다. 아름다운 동네를 탐방하고 서핑에 도전하며 현지 문화를 경험해 보세요. 숙소를 찾을 때에는 비용에 유의하는 것도 잊지 마세요!

reviews: I love San Pedro for the diving, fishing and street food. Great internet and have worked here remotely several times in the last year. Some of the best diving in all of the Caribbean at offshore Atolls, with incredible bio-diversity, and world class fishing. I prefer minimalist island vibe without Gucci stores, am here for the wildlife, and love driving to dinner on the beach in a lifted golf cart.
san-pedro.description:
San Pedro, Belize, is a lovely place that attracts many visitors. You will find busy street food stalls, fresh seafood, and friendly locals. The main attraction here is the great diving and fishing; the nearby coral reefs have a lot of different sea life, making it a favorite spot for underwater fans.

For those who prefer a simple lifestyle, San Pedro has a relaxed island feel—think easy beach meals and driving around in a golf cart. Good internet is available for remote workers, so you can enjoy the nice surroundings while staying online.

However, keep in mind that the cost of living can be higher compared to the main part of Belize. Public transport is not very common, so using a golf cart or bike is often the best way to travel. The island is safe, but it’s smart to be aware of your surroundings at night. With its charm and natural scenery, San Pedro is truly a nice place to relax and explore!
san-pedro.description_kor:
샌페드로, 벨리즈는 많은 관광객을 매료시키는 아름다운 장소입니다. 이곳에서는 활기찬 거리 음식 가판대, 신선한 해산물, 그리고 친절한 지역 주민들을 만날 수 있습니다. 샌페드로의 가장 큰 매력은 훌륭한 다이빙과 낚시입니다. 인근 산호초에는 다양한 해양 생물이 서식하고 있어 수중 스포츠 애호가들에게 인기 있는 명소입니다.

간단한 라이프스타일을 선호하는 분들을 위해 샌페드로는 한가로운 섬의 분위기를 자아냅니다. 해변가에서 간편하게 식사를 즐기고, 골프 카트를 타고 이곳저곳을 돌아다니는 모습을 상상해 보세요. 원격 근무를 하는 사람들을 위한 좋은 인터넷 환경도 마련되어 있어, 온라인 업무를 보면서도 아름다운 풍경을 만끽할 수 있습니다.

하지만 생활비는 벨리즈의 다른 주요 지역에 비해 다소 높을 수 있으니 참고하시기 바랍니다. 대중교통은 그리 흔하지 않아서, 골프 카트나 자전거를 이용하는 것이 가장 좋은 이동 수단이 될 수 있습니다. 이 섬은 안전하지만, 밤에는 주변을 조심하는 것이 좋습니다. 매력적인 경치와 자연 환경을 가진 샌페드로는 진정으로 휴식을 취하고 탐험하기에 완벽한 장소입니다!

reviews: I lived in Santa Barbara for the last 15 years (originally from Russia, also lived in HN, NYC, CT, and Florida). Currently working remotely for a European startup. Sure, it's expensive (probably around 80-90% of Bay Area cost of living), but the weather is perfect (not too hot, not too cold, all year around), the scenery is beautiful (mountains on one side, ocean on the other), and the city itself is fairly old and cozy (home to the second oldest building in California). People are generally friendly and laid back, lots of tourists, plenty of hipsters. Lots of rich people and celebs own houses here. There's UCSB, a top-50 ranked university, which can provide both intellectual stimulation and fun (concerts, lectures, and partying in student town of Isla Vista). Los Angeles is ~2 hours away, San Jose ~5 hours away.
santa-barbara.description:
Santa Barbara is a coastal city that has nice views and a relaxed feel. With mountains on one side and the ocean on the other, many people enjoy the good weather all year—this is a big benefit! Although the cost of living is high, similar to the Bay Area, many believe it is worth it for the beautiful scenery and friendly environment.

You will see a mix of locals and tourists, along with some trendy people and celebrities enjoying their time by the beach. The city has important places, including historic buildings and UCSB, which brings young energy and many fun events.

However, keep in mind that public transportation is not very good, so having a car can be useful. There can be language issues, but in general, the community is friendly. If you like outdoor activities, art galleries, and local cafés, this could be a great place for you to visit!
santa-barbara.description_kor:
산타바바라는 아름다운 경관과 편안한 분위기를 지닌 해안 도시입니다. 한쪽은 산으로 둘러싸여 있고, 다른 한쪽은 바다로 펼쳐져 있어 많은 사람들이 연중 내내 좋은 날씨를 만끽합니다. 이것은 큰 장점이죠! 생활비는 베이 지역과 비슷하게 높지만, 그 아름다운 경치와 따뜻한 환경을 고려하면 많은 이들이 충분히 그 가치가 있다고 생각합니다.

이곳에서는 현지인들과 관광객들이 함께 어우러져 활동하며, 해변에서 여유롭게 시간을 즐기는 젊은 사람들과 유명인들을 자주 볼 수 있습니다. 또한, 역사적인 건물들과 젊은 에너지가 넘치는 UCSB(캘리포니아 대학교 산타바바라 캠퍼스) 같은 중요한 명소들이 있어 다양한 재미있는 행사들이 열립니다.

다만, 대중교통이 그리 잘 되어 있지 않기 때문에 차가 있는 것이 편리할 수 있습니다. 언어 소통에 어려움이 있을 수도 있지만, 전반적으로 지역 사회는 친근한 편입니다. 야외 활동, 미술관 방문, 그리고 아늑한 지역 카페를 좋아하신다면, 이곳은 꼭 한 번 방문해볼 만한 멋진 장소입니다!

reviews: Santa Fe, NM has a distinct culture that's beautiful! To get here, Santa Fe has a tiny airport, SAF. Albuquerque is just an easy 1 hour away and has more flight options, ABQ.
santa-fe.description:
Santa Fe, NM is a city with a unique culture and beauty. It's known for its adobe buildings, art scene, and history. The small Santa Fe airport (SAF) makes it easy to get there, but if you need more flight options, Albuquerque is about an hour's drive away.

While the cost of living can be high, many visitors find the experience worth it. Public transportation isn't always reliable, so having a car can help with exploring local attractions, like the historic Plaza or the Canyon Road art galleries. Some people mention difficulties with language, but most locals are friendly and helpful.

To experience local life, try to attend a community event or visit the farmers' market for fresh items. Popular areas like the Railyard District have a variety of shops and restaurants. Also, keep in mind that Santa Fe can get quite cold at night, so dress accordingly. Enjoy the mix of cultures and relaxed atmosphere this city has to offer!
santa-fe.description_kor:
산타페, 뉴멕시코는 독특한 문화와 아름다움으로 가득한 도시입니다. 아도비 건축물, 활기찬 예술 신, 그리고 깊은 역사로 유명하죠. 작은 산타페 공항(SAF)도 있지만, 더 많은 항공편을 원하신다면 앨버커키까지 차로 약 1시간 거리에 있습니다.

생활비가 비교적 높을 수 있지만, 많은 방문객들은 그 경험이 충분한 가치가 있다고 생각합니다. 대중교통이 간혹 불안정할 수 있기 때문에, 자동차가 있다면 역사적인 광장이나 캐년 로드의 예술 갤러리 같은 명소를 더 편리하게 탐험할 수 있습니다. 일부 방문객들은 언어 장벽에 어려움을 겪기도 하지만, 대부분의 지역 주민들은 매우 친절하고 도와주려 합니다.

지역 주민들과 직접 교류하고 싶다면 커뮤니티 행사에 참여하거나 농산물 시장을 방문하여 신선한 식재료를 사보세요. 레일야드 지구와 같은 핫플레이스에서는 다양한 상점과 레스토랑이 있어 즐길 거리가 많답니다. 그리고 산타페는 저녁에 기온이 많이 떨어질 수 있으니, 적절한 옷차림을 잊지 마세요. 이 도시가 가진 다채로운 문화와 아늑한 분위기를 만끽하시길 바랍니다!

reviews: Shortly: Sanur has best infrastructure, in comparison with other villages around here. Like - there are sidewalks and cycling lanes on the sea coast. It's just nicer to be outside here. This is main benefit for me, after trying Uluwatu and Ubud.
sanur.description:
Sanur, on the island of Bali, is a place that many visitors enjoy for its relaxed atmosphere and good facilities. Unlike some other areas, Sanur has proper sidewalks and bike lanes along the coast, making it easy for walks or bike rides. If you like being outside, you will find this place welcoming.

The local culture is relaxed, with many cafes, shops, and markets, great for experiencing the Balinese way of life. While it is quieter than busy places like Uluwatu or Ubud, you can still find good dining options and local traditions that highlight the appeal of Bali.

One downside is that some people might find the cost of living a bit high in certain areas compared to more rural locations. Public transportation can also be limited, so it’s good to plan your travel. Overall, Sanur is worth visiting, especially if you like a calm beach atmosphere with some available services.
sanur.description_kor:
산우르(Sanur)는 발리 섬에 위치한 아름다운 지역으로, 편안한 분위기와 훌륭한 시설 덕분에 많은 관광객들에게 인기 있는 장소입니다. 다른 지역들과 비교할 때, 산우르는 해안선을 따라 잘 정비된 보도와 자전거 도로가 마련되어 있어 산책이나 자전거 타기가 매우 용이합니다. 야외 활동을 즐기신다면 이곳은 정말 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다.

이곳의 지역 문화는 매우 여유롭고, 다양한 카페와 상점, 시장들이 있어 발리의 삶의 방식을 직접 체험하기에 적합합니다. 우루와투(Uluwatu)나 우붓(Ubud) 같은 번잡한 장소들보다는 상대적으로 조용하지만, 여전히 훌륭한 음식 옵션과 발리의 매력을 잘 살린 전통들을 발견할 수 있습니다.

한 가지 아쉬운 점은 일부 지역의 생활비가 농촌 지역에 비해 다소 높을 수 있다는 것입니다. 대중교통이 제한적일 수 있으므로 여행 계획을 잘 세우는 것이 좋습니다. 전반적으로, 산우르는 꼭 방문할 가치가 있는 곳이며, 편안한 해변 분위기와 세심한 서비스를 원하신다면 더욱 추천드립니다.

reviews: As a Dominican that lived over 25 years in Sto Dgo I have to say most of the comments are accurate. HOWEVER, Santo Domingo is the capital of the country. Just like most Capitals in Latin America (Mexico City being the exception), it's not worth visiting much time. If you want to experience what the Dominican Republic has to offer (Beaches, Nature, Friendly Locals) as a nomad I would recommend Las Terrenas or Cabarete.
Hot mess of a city, full of noise, fumes and trash. More of a dysfunctional, crowded urban sprawl than an organised city.

Santo Domingo was worth visiting for a few days, but I wouldn't live there. Locals are generally friendly to westerners, including many of the stunningly beautiful women. I found no shortage of excellent and mostly healthy food in the beautiful and clean Zona Colonial historic neighborhood, which also had modern amenities and great salsa bars with friendly locals. Most of the rest of the city is a filthy and decrepit dump. There are some nice beaches 30+ min away from the city. When using the "wawa" bus system, you can flag down and exit a bus anytime, but I definitely recommend renting a car while here because its timetables can't be found on the internet, its stations are not signed, its bus lines are not labeled clearly, it's never on schedule, and it's generally not worth your time. Unfortunately, as another commenter stated, there is definitely quite a bit of racism towards Haitians here. And there is little to do outside of the Zona Colonial.

I lived in Santo Domingo for two years. The people can be warm, friendly and genuine most of the time. There are many exceptions to this though where some will beg or try to scam you and take your money. You will really need at least basic Spanish to get by here, as 98% of the population do not speak any English... this is not an exaggeration. Culturally, it is conservative (partly because it is a Catholic country... partly because it's a pretty stale island in terms of ethnic diversity). Interestingly, cultural influences here are mainly American (baseball, big cars, fast food etc.), as there is little Spanish culture here... save for the language. In my opinion, the city is an umitigated dump. It's really not worth coming here. There is trash everywhere. The traffic is horrendous and is saturated almost all day. The public transport system is not fit for purpose and the metro only serves a small number of stops... none of them anywhere you'd want to go. Car horns, car alarms, sirens, revving engines and building alarms are constantly ringing in your ears. Drivers are aggressive and will run you over if you're not careful (common courtesy does not exist on these roads). Air quality is terrible. There are regular fires at the local landfill site which waft vast clouds of noxious fumes into the city. There is barely any greenspace (and what little there is is an overgrown, unloved garbage dump). There is no beach (nearest one, which isn't that great, is at least 30 minutes away). The diversity of food and availability of healthy food when eating out or ordering in leaves much to be desired (you'll be fine if you love American junk food, Mexican, Venezuelan, Italian and Japanese... other than that, there's nothing really to eat and it becomes a bit limited after a while). Almost everything is fried and full of salt... heavy on the meat and light on the veg. There's a tipping culture here but the quality of service is generally quite poor with no-one really giving a s**t. There are very few convenience foods in the grocery stores, meaning you will have to make all of your meals from scratch (which is a good thing, but sometimes you just want to have a microwave or freezer meal when you can't be bothered to cook). A lot of Dominicans are quite vain, obsessed with appearance and status, while there is an obvious undercurrent of racism towards Haitians and Venezuelans, coupled with a segregated class system. The government is corrupt and takes around 15-20% in income tax, however, there are no visible returns on this, as the roads are terrible, greenspace is a dump, schools are neglected, healthcare is a health hazard and the police have barely any presence. The peso is increasingly worth less than the dollar (with a 15% drop against the dollar in the last three years alone), meaning, what you earn here is worth increasingly less and less elsewhere. Overall, it's a pretty grim place that feels 30 years behind the rest of the developed world where the only saving graces are the weather and some nice people, I guess.

Been to Santo Domingo sooooooooooo many times lived there really cool city chaotic lol Dominicans are friendly but can also be very sneaky, even their own people say don't trust us LOL but meet wonderful people but just like ever where else be careful stay alert its some what expensive if you let the "chapiadores" run your pocket and go clubbing every night it can get expensive
I have been living in Santo Domingo and it is great. Almost all what they say is true.
santo-domingo.description:
Santo Domingo is a city of differences. On one hand, there is the Zona Colonial, a historic area with nice buildings and good food. People like the friendly locals, and salsa bars are popular for those who want to dance. However, the rest of the city can feel busy, with lots of traffic, noise, and pollution.

Living in Santo Domingo has its ups and downs. Some people enjoy the rich culture, but others find that living costs can be high, especially if they go out often. Public transportation can be challenging; many suggest renting a car because the local bus system, called "wawa," can be hard to understand and not very dependable. Also, knowing some Spanish will help a lot!

On the downside, some visitors talk about problems like trash and not enough parks, and there aren't many English speakers around. While you explore, be careful, as some people may try to take advantage. Overall, if you can handle a bit of chaos and enjoy the local atmosphere, Santo Domingo can be an interesting place to visit!
santo-domingo.description_kor:
산토 도밍고는 매력이 넘치는 도시입니다. 한편으로는 아름다운 건물과 맛있는 음식으로 가득한 역사적인 지역인 식민지 지역(Zona Colonial)이 있어 많은 사람들이 찾고 있습니다. 친절한 현지인들과 함께 춤을 추고 싶다면 살사 바도 인기가 많습니다. 하지만 도시의 다른 부분은 교통 혼잡, 소음, 오염이 심각하게 느껴질 수 있습니다.

산토 도밍고에서의 생활은 장단점이 있습니다. 풍부한 문화를 즐기는 사람도 있지만, 프로모션이나 외출이 잦아지면 생활비가 부담스러울 수 있습니다. 대중교통 이용이 어려운 경우가 많아 많은 이들이 현지 버스 시스템인 "와와"를 이해하기 힘들어합니다. 그래서 차를 렌트하는 것을 추천하는 경우도 많아요. 또한 스페인어를 조금 아는 것이 큰 도움이 됩니다.

단점으로는 일부 방문객들이 쓰레기 문제와 공원 부족을 언급하며, 영어를 구사할 수 있는 사람이 많지 않다고 합니다. 여행 중 주의가 필요할 수 있으며, 때때로 접근하려는 사람들이 있을 수 있습니다. 하지만 약간의 혼란을 감수하고 현지의 분위기를 만끽할 수 있다면, 산토 도밍고는 정말 흥미로운 여행지로 꼽힐 수 있습니다!

reviews: Don't let yourself be discouraged by the reviews here! Most of them are untrue and very negative and actually they made me skip Santiago in 2022. I came to spend a month in February 2024 and it was amazing! Everyday I got impressed by how nice this city feels. I've been in every latam country apart from Venezuela. Santiago is for sure one of the best. The city is very developed, clean and organized at the same time has a lot of shops, nice architecture, museums, bars and places with a soul. It's safer than most Latam countries and the quality of life is very high (also better than in all of the latam countries). It's not expensive, I'd actually place it as cheaper than most (it's for sure cheaper than Brazil, Medellin, groceries are cheaper than most of the latam countries, uber probably more expensive). The city has a very good metro line, bike itau rentals, allowing you to go everywhere and is very walkable and bikeable, lots of parks and nice streets. There are also many places that you can visit around the city, with 1 hour to the nice beaches and 1 hour to nice mountains. About the common thing in those reviews "boring" - every big city needs to be discovered, one needs to learn where to go out, which park is nice etc. Santiago is no different than that. Once you learn how to manouver it, it becomes very lively and exciting. Some examples of party areas are: Manuel Montt, Lastaria (bars), Bellas Artes. The digital nomad scene is not very big compared to e.g. Buenos Aires or Medellin, but does it mean that's a bad thing? Sometimes it's even better because it's easier to make friends in 10 person groups than 200 drunk people groups. There are many international communities thriving here just check the meetup app which offers language exchange meetups or internations community where people organize for multiple meetups during the week, such as sunset hiking etc.

Unfortunately this was supposed to be the best economy in LATAM but what I found instead was a very over priced for what you get experience. People are rude in general, until you get to meet them personally, and the country is way behind in infrastructure, innovation and culture that most countries around it. Not worth your time and money at all.
Good for a short visit, bad for anything longer than a week. Foods and airbnbs are expensive than neighbouring countries.
Beautiful, boring, and expensive. Also, if you have a northern European pedigree, expect lots of stares. Met some cool folks in my 3 weeks here, but I probably wouldn't return.
Expensive and organized by Latin American standars. It's possible to ski nearby so that's very fun. Great startup scene. Gastronomy is also great. Nightlife is very boring.

People are obsessed with American living way. Everything is in Malls, from store to restaurants. You will need a car or taxi to get there. Renting apartments will be extremely complicated as you will need to show your income, paid taxes, etc. You can always use Airbnb, but you will pay 3-4 times more then what is worth. Everything is overpriced for what you will get. Food in restaurants is 5/10, if you will buy in stores, expect most of it imported from Europe, USA and other countries. Fun factor is almost zero to nothing, the most boring place. The vibe is depressive, my feeling after 3 weeks here, can be best expressed by Edvard Munch picture The Scream.
Unless you're outdoorsy Santiago will be a quite boring place, as the other reviewers say. Expensive and ugly too.

It's funny that these 3 reviews are about Santiago being boring. I was born there but moved to the US at 2 years old, when I returned to Santiago as an adult, I too found it to be extremely boring. I thought for a long time that there was something wrong with me for feeling that way about the city i was born it, but these reviews confirm it is boring. Besides that I am going next week to see how fast the internet is and if i can work from there

I lived in Santiago for a year and I can confidently say that it is THE most boring place I´ve ever been to. It´s super expensive, the air quality is very bad, terrible food (I can´t stress that enough) and very boring and welcoming people. I don't see any reason why anybody would go there as an expat or digital nomad, tbh.

I’ve been living in Santiago since 2019… and I complete agree with the review calling Santiago boring and expensive. Unless you already have friends here, save yourself money and time and look for other cities in Latam.

Maybe I’m a bit unfair here, but Santiago is so... boring. People don’t look so happy and aren’t welcoming, city has nothing special, currency with so many zeros is hard to get used... didn’t have a bad time, but it wasn’t great either. Just dull. Maybe I’m wrong and in a long term it worth it, but it lacks authenticity and don’t even compare to other cities in Latin America such as Mexico City or even Buenos Aires, both cheaper and funnier.
santiago.description:
Santiago, the capital of Chile, has different experiences that can either please or disappoint you, depending on what you want. Many visitors like its cleanliness, organization, and modern feel. There are many unique buildings, bars, museums, and lively areas like Manuel Montt and Lastaria, where you can enjoy nightlife if you know where to go. The public transport system, especially the metro, works well, making it easy to get around the city and reach the beach and mountains nearby.

However, it can be a bit expensive, especially for places to stay and eat. For daily groceries, prices may be lower than in many other Latin American countries. If you don't speak Spanish well, you might face some language problems and meet some unfriendly locals.

Santiago can feel quieter compared to its neighboring cities. If you enjoy outdoor activities, there are options for hiking and skiing nearby. Take some time to explore the local scene to discover what makes it special—there is a lot to appreciate if you look closely!
santiago.description_kor:
산티아고, 칠레의 수도는 당신의 취향에 따라 즐거운 경험이나 실망스러운 순간을 제공하는 도시입니다. 많은 방문객들은 이 도시의 청결하고 정돈된 모습, 현대적인 분위기를 좋아합니다. 독특한 건축물들, 다양한 바와 박물관, 그리고 마누엘 몬트와 라스타리아 같은 활기찬 지역들이 있어, 가고 싶은 곳만 정해놓으면 밤문화를 만끽할 수 있습니다. 대중교통 시스템, 특히 지하철도 잘 운영되고 있어 도시를 쉽게 돌아다닐 수 있으며, 근처의 해변과 산으로 가는 접근도 용이합니다.

하지만 숙박과 식사는 다소 비쌀 수 있으니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 일상적인 장보기 가격은 다른 많은 라틴 아메리카 국가들에 비해 낮은 편입니다. 스페인어에 자신이 없다면, 언어 문제로 어려움을 겪거나 다소 불친절한 현지인을 만날 수도 있습니다.

산티아고는 이웃 도시들에 비해 상대적으로 조용하게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 야외 활동을 즐기는 분들을 위해 가까운 곳에서 하이킹이나 스키를 즐길 수 있는 기회가 많이 있습니다. 특별한 매력을 발견하기 위해 지역 주민들과의 소통을 시도해 보세요. 가까이서 살펴보면 감상할 만한 것들이 의외로 많이 숨어 있습니다!

reviews: Sargodha (Punjabi and Urdu: سرگودھا) is a District and capital of Sargodha Division, located in Punjab province, Pakistan. It is Pakistan's 12th largest city by population[14] and one of the fastest-growing cities of the country. Largest producer of Citrus and also known as California of Pakistan. Very good city with great hospitality. Great people. Sargodha is also known as the City of Eagles.
sargodha.description:
Sargodha, also known as the "City of Eagles," is a city in Punjab, Pakistan. It is the largest producer of citrus in the country and is sometimes called the "California of Pakistan." Visitors appreciate the friendly nature of the locals, making it a good place to visit.

Sargodha has a lively culture and tasty local food, but some newcomers find that living costs can be high, particularly for housing. Public transportation is available, but it may not reach every area well, so having a bike or a car can be helpful.

You can visit the busy markets or enjoy the parks where families spend time. If you are interested in history, you should check out the local museums. Also, learning basic Urdu phrases can help you connect with people! Sargodha is a growing city with unique characteristics, so it is worth visiting to see for yourself!
sargodha.description_kor:
사르고다(Sargodha)는 "독수리의 도시"로 알려진 파키스탄 펀자브 지역에 위치한 도시입니다. 이곳은 파키스탄에서 가장 많은 감귤류가 생산되는 곳으로, 종종 "파키스탄의 캘리포니아"라고도 불립니다. 방문객들은 현지인들의 따뜻한 환대에 감동하며, 이곳은 여행하기 좋은 장소입니다.

사르고다는 풍부한 문화와 맛있는 지역 음식을 자랑하지만, 최근 이주한 사람들은 주거비용이 다소 비쌀 수 있음을 느낄 수 있습니다. 대중교통이 제공되지만 모든 지역에 잘 연결되지 않을 수 있어, 자전거나 자동차를 이용하는 것이 더욱 편리할 수 있습니다.

또한, 복잡한 시장을 탐방하거나 가족과 함께 시간을 보낼 수 있는 공원도 잘 마련되어 있습니다. 역사에 관심이 있다면 지역 박물관도 꼭 방문해 보세요. 그리고 기본적인 우르두어 문구를 배우면 사람들과 더 원활하게 소통할 수 있습니다! 사르고다는 독특한 매력을 지닌 성장하는 도시이니, 직접 방문해 볼 만한 가치가 충분합니다!

reviews: I visited for about 3 weeks for a business trip in Ilidza, so I stayed in Ilidza. People were very kind. I always felt safe, even in the middle of the night. Local men never made me feel uncomfortable. Lots of people speak English, but not all. Google translate served the purpose for when they don't speak English. There are lots of stray cats, and I never saw a single stray dog. The Internet was ok, except when there was a thunderstorm or occasionally it shut off around midnight (which might be an issue if you work US time zones) at the same time as the cell phone signals. The city has a lot of character to it. I checked out a few war museums and took the cable car up the mountain, which was pretty cool. Local food was also good if you like meat and BBQ stuff, but after a while I started wishing I could put salsa verde on the meat.

Sarajevo is a hidden gem. I stayed 2 weeks in the city and I really enjoy the chill vibe. The city is safe and people are very friendly while happy to speak english. The city is small but you can find something new to do everyday. I would 100% recommend Sarajevo for an "exotic" for some days.

Amazing city with plenty of history and character!

Have been here for a month and there are plenty of things to do to keep you occupied, away from work. It's super safe, the food is only OK (but super cheap), the nature/hiking is great (city surrounded by mountains) and nightlife isn't bad at the moment even though clubs still aren't open. 

Highly recommend it to other nomads.

A really amazing city, I wouldn't agree that it's small, there's much more to it than just the historical core, 20th century architecture is like 4/5 of the city and there are many vibrant neighbourhoods, restaurants and places where the normie locals hang out.

Nice looking city in the rolling green hills. Quite small. If you're looking for any sort of nightlife you'll be disappointed, there are pretty much just 3 bars in the city center. People and service were more friendly than elsewhere in the Balkans - but that's not staying too much. I'd say it's worth checking out but would not stay for more than a week.

This summer I worked from Sarajevo, and it was great! The city has so much history and character. It's an affordable place to stay and eat, and WiFi was easily accessible at many independent cafes and restaurants. There are public transportation buses and trams (as well as taxis, had a good experience with Crveni taxi - red taxi), but I found walking easier for exploration and getting in 10K steps a day. There are great mountain hikes and parks very close to the city (Trebevic, Skakavac Waterfall, Park Prijateljstva). If you rent a car, historic towns like Mostar, Lukomir village, Konjic and Jablanicko jezero (lake), and the wine country are within ~2 hrs from the city. If you want to take a road trip to Dubrovnik, Croatia, you can go through Sutjeska National Park, which is great for hikes on Via Dinarica trail, mountain biking, and rafting (there are tour groups from Sarajevo as well).

I arrived a couple of days ago in SARAJEVO and first impression was of a ex-comunist capital with a tough/harsh image seen on people's faces. But once you advance and check the Old Town + some pedestrian streets you become astonished about the mix of Austro-Hungarian architecture, Istanbulish streets/markets and so on. Some of the parts of the Center have Orthodox/Catholic + Muslim heritage, so it's a Babel Tower somehow. Fully recommend if you wanna see a city that rised from it's ashes after the 90's war like a Phoenix Bird.

Sarajevo is a fantastic city that offers much to those who visit with an open mind and a willingness to engage with the local people and culture. It compares extremely favourably to other capital cities in the region and more generally, as it open, accessible (it is a small city) and low-cost. It is relatively straightforward to find accommodation (also seek local guidance on this and all other economic interactions) and costs of living are generally low. Local people are friendly and also keen to engage with internationals, which provides a welcome alternative to Croatia, for example, where you are more likely to be treated as tourist fodder. I would be interested to hear more about how Sarajevo is Islamifying, as in my experience this is not definitely not the case. Islam is practised here (along with other religions, as Sarajevo has a long-established tradition of religious tolerance and diversity) by an Islamic community who are clearly distinct from the largely secular society. This applies in Sarajevo to exactly the same extent as it applies in London (my home capital) and any tolerant, open, inclusive city. Setting this aside, Bosnia's Islamic community appear comparatively more 'modernised' and 'progressive' than separate religious communities in the Islamic world or other religious communities within the region. The war, which ended 25 years ago, is still an important part of the city's present: both Sarajevo and the wider country are still struggling to recover and I would encourage readers to take this into account when making judgements/demands about working spaces or the resources available to internationals more generally.

A former progressive beacon of the Balkans, Sarajevo is now Islamifying — fast. Even the locals think so. Otherwise, a beautiful city, jampacked with historical richness, delicious and cheap food, and amazing nature destinations are a day-trip away.

As a non-Yugoslav you'll probably love it. As a progressive Bosnian you'll likely have a love-hate relationship with it. 

Coworking spaces are mediocre.

Nestled in a valley surrounded by amazing mountains, the once host city to the 1984 Winter Olympic Games, is a charming and adorable city. It is very friendly to foreigners. The city itself is a wonderful mix of Western and Eastern cultures, and you can sample architecture from the Ottoman period, Austo-Hungarian period, as well as the Yugoslav period. It is a cosmopolitan city, with a mix of Catholic, Muslim, Orthodox and Jewish religions. It has a great caffe culture with many different cafes all across the city. The central and old town areas are the most interesting to both live and work. Amazing mountains, for the outdoorsy types are just minutes away. If you are a fan of hiking, the mountains surrounding Sarajevo and elsewhere across Bosnia will offer you an unforgettable experience. There are several co-working places, with new ones seemingly coming up every year. I've been spending time in Sarajevo for the past three years on and off. I would definitely recommend coming in late spring through summer and early fall. The winters can be harsh, and the city covered in fog and smog which is not fun (sometimes the airport closes due to the density of fog). In August there is a phenomenal film festival - SFF - which lasts for a week and is a Mecca for filmophiles and party animals alike. Should definitely not be missed. The beautiful town of Mostar is a mesmerizing two hour drive from Sarajevo and also has much character and history.
The cost of living is relatively inexpensive and you can find decent accommodation for very reasonable amounts. Eating out is also cheap with many different offerings. If you are a vegetarian or vegan, you may find it slightly more challenging as Bosnia and the Balkans in general are very meat intensive in their cuisine.
If you are based in the center or old part of town, walking everywhere is easy and convenient. Taxis are also cheap. There are enough decent gyms for exercise that are relatively inexpensive, as well as trails for jogging. Biking is also popular in the summer months, especially mountain biking and you can easily find people and crews to join in on tours.
sarajevo.description:
Sarajevo is a city that combines its history, culture, and friendly atmosphere. It is located in a valley and surrounded by mountains, offering winding streets with a mix of Ottoman and Austro-Hungarian buildings. The locals are welcoming and often willing to talk, making it feel safe, even at night. While many people speak English, having Google Translate can be very helpful.

There are many things to do here. You can take the cable car for great views, hike in the nearby mountains, or visit war museums to learn about the area's history. Food is tasty and cheap, but if you are vegetarian or vegan, there might not be many choices, as meat is common in local dishes.

The nightlife may not be very lively with only a few bars, but the city has a strong café culture where you can enjoy a relaxed atmosphere. Public transport is available, but many people prefer to walk to see more of the city. Just remember that winters can be harsh, and there could be internet issues during storms. Overall, Sarajevo offers a variety of experiences, and it is easy to appreciate its unique character.
sarajevo.description_kor:
사라예보는 역사와 문화가 조화롭게 어우러진, 아늑하고 친근한 분위기의 도시입니다. 이 도시는 계곡에 자리 잡고 있으며, 아름다운 산들로 둘러싸여 있어 오스만 제국과 오스트리아-헝가리 건축이 혼합된 구불구불한 거리를 제공합니다. 현지인들은 매우 환대하고 대화를 나누길 좋아해, 밤에도 안전하게 다닐 수 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 영어를 할 수 있지만, 구글 번역기를 챙기는 것도 유용합니다.

할 거리는 정말 많습니다. 케이블카를 타고 멋진 전망을 즐기거나, 근처 산에서 하이킹을 하며 자연을 만끽할 수 있으며, 전쟁 박물관을 방문해 이 지역의 역사에 대해 배울 수도 있습니다. 음식은 맛있고 가격이 저렴하지만, 채식주의자나 비건이라면 선택의 폭이 좁을 수 있습니다. 지역 요리에는 고기가 흔하게 사용되기 때문입니다.

밤문화는 몇몇 바 때문에 그리 활발하지 않을 수도 있지만, 이 도시는 편안한 분위기를 즐길 수 있는 강력한 카페 문화를 가지고 있습니다. 대중교통도 이용할 수 있지만, 많은 사람들이 도시의 매력을 더 잘 느끼기 위해 걷는 것을 선호합니다. 겨울철은 혹독할 수 있으니, 폭풍이 몰아칠 때는 인터넷 문제가 생길 수도 있음을 기억하세요. 전반적으로 사라예보는 다양한 경험을 제공하며, 그 독특한 매력을 쉽게 느낄 수 있는 곳입니다.

reviews: Family and church are the main criteria for fitting in. Northerners - Yankees - are still regarded askance. Explosive college population arrives each fall, Tybee is expensive and crowded in summer. Great eateries. Good music scene. BRING LOTSA BUG SPRAY - if the mosquitoes don't get y'all the sand gnats will.
savannah.description:
Savannah is a nice city that combines southern friendliness with a busy college atmosphere, especially when students arrive each fall. Families and community are important here, making it a welcoming place, but if you come from the north, you might notice some typical southern hesitance before you are fully accepted.

The city is known for its lovely parks and historic buildings, great for a relaxed walk. Food lovers will enjoy many tasty restaurants that serve southern dishes. Savannah also has a lively music scene where you can see local performers.

While Tybee Island has nice beaches, be prepared – it can be a bit expensive and crowded in the summer. And remember to bring bug spray! The mosquitoes and sand gnats can be bothersome. Public transportation is available, but having a car is often useful. Just keep in mind the local customs and enjoy the unique aspects that make Savannah different!
savannah.description_kor:
사바나(Savannah)는 따뜻한 남부의 정감과 활기찬 대학 도시의 분위기가 어우러진 멋진 곳입니다. 특히 가을철 학생들이 몰려올 때 그 느낌이 더욱 강해집니다. 이곳에서는 가족과 지역사회가 정말 중요하게 여겨지며, 그래서 이 도시가 외부인에게도 매우 환영 받는 장소로 다가옵니다. 하지만 북부에서 오신 분들은 정착하기 전에 약간의 전형적인 남부 특유의 조심스러움이 있을 수 있습니다.

사바나는 아름다운 공원과 역사적인 건물로 유명해 여유롭게 산책하기에 안성맞춤입니다. 맛있는 남부 요리들을 제공하는 훌륭한 레스토랑도 많아 음식 애호가들에게는 천국과도 같은 곳이죠. 게다가 지역 아티스트들의 공연을 즐길 수 있는 활기찬 음악 씬이 있어서 언제나 생동감이 넘칩니다.

타이비 섬(Tybee Island)의 아름다운 해변도 놓칠 수 없는 명소입니다. 다만 여름에는 비용이 비쌀 수 있으며, 인파가 많으니 미리 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 곤충 기피제도 꼭 챙기세요! 모기와 모래 날벌레가 귀찮을 수 있으니까요. 대중교통도 이용 가능하지만, 차가 있으면 더 편리하게 돌아다닐 수 있습니다. 지역 관습을 잘 살펴보면서 사바나의 독특한 매력을 만끽하시길 바랍니다!

reviews:
I live in Saskatoon. It's brutally cold in the winter--do not visit. That said, it's cheap and gorgeous in the summer (May to September). Temperatures usually are between 20 and 30 Celsius during the day, and the sky is almost always clear. The sunsets are gorgeous, and there is a riverbank corridor that runs through the city where you can walk for 20 kilometres along the river and never cross a street (it's called the Meewasin... If you like nature, you will want to book a place near it). Bring bug spray, as there are lots of mosquitos in the summer, especially in the evening. During the summer, there is also a lot more to do--there are often festivals like the jazz festival, the Fringe (theatre), Taste of Saskatchewan, etc. There is not a ton of nightlife or other things to do--there are a couple of museums and art galleries, but it's a very small town feel.

Like everywhere in Canada, it's generally safe, LGBTQ friendly, and multicultural. It's safe for minorities, although we have racism like everywhere (and Indigenous people--women in particular--have to be careful walking alone at night). As a white woman, I have walked anywhere I want at all times of day or evening for my whole life, and not had a problem (although I have a high threshold for risk).
