Canadian culture (prairie culture in particular) is polite and kind (you will be helped if you are in trouble) but reserved. Making friends requires some kind of "in" (like attending a mutual event or a shared sport or something like that.

There are no dangerous bugs or wildlife (there are bears if you travel to camp--and there is much gorgeous scenery nearby).

There are three good co-working spaces, currently. Two on Broadway (that is the trendy artsy area), and one downtown (called the Two Twenty). The Stand on Broadway is my top recommendation for a cheap place to get wifi and work, and the Two Twenty is the most established and the nicest.
saskatoon.description:
Saskatoon is a city with many interesting things! The winters can be very cold (so, bring your warm clothes if you visit then), but summer has nice weather with clear skies and temperatures of 20 to 30 degrees Celsius. From May to September, you can enjoy the Meewasin Riverbank, a great place for walking or biking along the river, without having to cross a street. Just remember to bring bug spray—those summer mosquitoes can be quite annoying!

The city has a welcoming and diverse atmosphere where you can feel safe, and events like jazz festivals and the Taste of Saskatchewan bring people together. While the nightlife might not be very lively and the art scene is small, you can check out a few museums and galleries, especially in the Broadway area.

A couple of tips? If you want to meet people, joining social events or sports can help you make friends. And if you need a good place to work, you’ll find nice co-working spaces like The Stand and The Two Twenty in popular areas. Overall, Saskatoon has a mix of nature and community, great for summer fun!
saskatoon.description_kor:
사스캐처원은 흥미로운 매력이 가득한 도시입니다! 겨울은 아주 추우니(방문할 예정이라면 따뜻한 옷을 잊지 마세요), 여름에는 맑은 하늘과 기온이 20도에서 30도 사이로 쾌적한 날씨를 즐길 수 있습니다. 5월부터 9월까지는 미와신 강변에서 산책이나 자전거 타기를 즐길 수 있는데, 강을 건너지 않고도 편하게 다닐 수 있는 좋은 장소입니다. 다만, 여름철에는 모기가 꽤 성가실 수 있으니 벌레 퇴치제를 꼭 챙기세요!

이 도시는 따뜻한 분위기와 다양한 문화가 어우러져 있어 안전함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 재즈 페스티벌이나 사스캐처원 맛보기 같은 행사들은 사람들을 한데 모으는 좋은 기회가 되곤 합니다. 밤문화는 그렇게 활기차지 않지만, 브로드웨이 지역에 있는 몇몇 박물관과 갤러리를 둘러보는 것도 즐거운 경험이 될 거예요.

몇 가지 팁을 드리자면, 사람들을 만나고 싶다면 사회적 행사나 스포츠 활동에 참여하는 것이 친구를 만드는 데 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 그리고 좋은 환경에서 일하고 싶다면 인기 있는 지역에 위치한 더 스탠드나 더 투 트웬티 같은 쾌적한 공유 작업 공간을 찾아보세요. 전반적으로 사스캐처원은 자연과 공동체가 조화를 이루며 여름에 방문하기 좋은 도시입니다!

reviews: I've been living in Semarang for about 6 months at this point. Living at the "Candiland Apartment" which is reasonably priced 2.5 million - 3.5 million rupiah per month. Great view of the city. It's hot here. Usually like 35+ degrees. The beach is all industrial. Usually a lot of traffic. In the southern part of the city there are some small hills which are cool but to go anywhere with nice air, cool temperatures and big mountains it's at least an hour south. Sometimes the locals will give you a dirty look but if you smile at them they perk right up and smile back usually. There's not too much going on here in my opinion. But there are tons of nice restaurants with good views and the Tinder game here is strong. It has nice malls - I bought a new apple laptop here - quality is fine. Prices are good. If you like vegetables and non-fried food it can be both expensive and hard to find. All in all it's a pretty cool city. I could stay here but I've decided to move to Bandung instead with hopes of more green space, less expensive rent and a cooler climate.
semarang.description:
Semarang, a city on Indonesia's north coast, offers a mix of modern living and local culture. If you are thinking of staying here, you can find affordable apartments, like those at Candiland, with good city views and rent that is reasonable. However, keep in mind that Semarang can be quite hot, with temperatures often above 35 degrees.

The city has a busy food scene—many restaurants serve tasty meals, some with nice views. But if you like fresh vegetables and non-fried dishes, you might find them a bit more expensive and not as easy to find. Also, although traffic can be difficult and the beach is somewhat industrial, small hills in the southern part provide a nice escape if you want to drive there. 

Public transportation options are limited, but locals are generally friendly. A smile can help a lot! So, whether you are here for a few days or months, there is something about Semarang that connects with people. Just be prepared for the heat and enjoy the local food!
semarang.description_kor:
세마랑은 인도네시아 북부 해안에 자리 잡고 있는 도시로, 현대적인 생활과 전통 문화를 멋지게 조화시킨 매력이 있습니다. 이곳에서 머물 계획이라면, 시내 전망이 아름답고 임대료가 합리적인 저렴한 아파트인 캔디 랜드를 고려해볼 수 있습니다. 다만, 세마랑의 날씨가 종종 35도 이상으로 올라간다는 점을 꼭 기억해야 합니다.

이 도시는 다양한 음식 문화로 유명하며, 많은 레스토랑에서 맛있는 음식을 제공하고 일부는 아름다운 경관도 함께 즐길 수 있습니다. 하지만 신선한 채소와 튀기지 않은 음식을 선호하는 경우, 이런 요리가 조금 더 비쌀 수 있고 찾기 어려울 수도 있습니다. 게다가 교통 혼잡이 심하고 해변 지역은 상대적으로 산업적인 느낌이 있지만, 남쪽 지역의 작은 언덕들은 드라이브할 때 멋진 피난처가 되어줍니다.

대중교통 수단은 다소 제한적이지만, 현지인들은 대체로 친절합니다. 작은 미소 하나로 좋은 소통이 만들어질 수 있으니, 그 점을 활용해보세요! 세마랑에서의 몇 일 혹은 몇 달 동안 사람들과의 연결고리를 느끼실 수 있을 것입니다. 더위에 대비하고 지역 음식을 마음껏 즐겨보세요!

reviews: I have a different experience than the other review. It's a fantastic little town - there are lots of tourists but there are many local joints and great spots with less people if you're willing to get out of the town square. Everyone is super friendly and it's easy to meet people here. There are a few good spots to co-work and the internet has been fine (not the best but more than usable for remote work i.e. software engineer). There's a good spot for surfing as a beginner, then there are the more crowded spots if you're a good surfer.

Small area/beach, claustrophobic. I think enough to do entertainment wise. Just expensive due the mass amounts of CA residents/expats/business owners, wifi is also weak unless you are at a top place like Sayulita Hotel. Surf break is essentially one peak and crowded, the locals don't really share it. One week tops here.
sayulita.description:
Sayulita is a nice small town on Mexico's coast, good for those looking for sunshine, surfing, and local culture. While there are many tourists, the town has a friendly atmosphere with welcoming locals. If you go beyond the busy town square, you can find quieter spots and some tasty local food.

For surfers, there is a beach for all skill levels, but be prepared for crowded waves, especially at the popular spots. The town is also a good choice for remote work, with decent internet available at some cafes, but it might not be very fast everywhere.

However, living in Sayulita can be expensive due to the number of expats and tourists. The area can feel a bit small during busy times, but this also adds to the unique feel of the town. With nice neighborhoods and a friendly vibe, Sayulita is a great place to visit—just plan your trip carefully and enjoy your time!
sayulita.description_kor:
사율리타는 멕시코 해안에 위치한 작은 아름다운 마을로, 햇살과 서핑, 그리고 지역 문화를 만끽하려는 사람들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 많은 관광객이 방문하지만, 이곳은 따뜻한 분위기와 친절한 현지인들로 가득합니다. 번화한 마을 광장을 조금만 벗어나면 조용한 장소와 맛있는 지역 음식을 찾을 수 있습니다.

서퍼들에게는 모든 수준에 적합한 해변들이 있지만, 특히 인기 있는 장소에서는 혼잡한 파도를 잘 준비해야 합니다. 또한, 원격 근무를 하는 분들에게도 좋은 선택이 될 수 있으며, 몇몇 카페에서 괜찮은 인터넷 속도를 제공하지만, 곳곳에서 아주 빠르지는 않을 수 있습니다.

사율리타는 외국인과 관광객이 많아 생활비가 다소 비쌀 수 있습니다. 그리고 바쁜 시간대에는 이곳이 꽤 붐비게 느껴질 수도 있지만, 이는 또 이 마을의 독특한 매력이기도 합니다. 아름다운 이웃들과 따뜻한 분위기를 지닌 사율리타는 방문하기 좋은 멋진 장소입니다. 여행을 잘 계획하고 즐거운 시간을 만끽하세요!

reviews: Seattle is a great city, especially if you like nature, there are plenty of outdoor activities to do all year round. People are generally open-minded and friendly. The cost of living is high but it allows you to be able to afford other places on earth easily if you can find a job here. You can also find plenty of good restaurants and arts around in the city. I recommend to stay at least 3-6 months to get the feel of living a PNW life.

Seattle is an awesome city, very acceptive and progressive! The weather is not bad most months of the year, when the sun is out it's one of the most beautiful places in the country. People are very friendly but it often takes time for them to warm up. Besides that the economy is booming and there's plenty of jobs available! It's a large city with other great cities in the metro that are suitable for families such as Bellevue, Redmond, Issaquah, Kirkland and so on. Safe overall for a large city and super safe cities close by. Plenty of amenities and a great food scene as well. It's an expensive metro to live in but very worth it if you can get a job here.
seattle.description:
Seattle is a great city for anyone who loves nature and outdoor activities. With many parks, mountains, and water views, you can find things to do all year round. The people here are usually friendly and open, but it might take some time to get to know them. The cost of living can be high, but many think it is worth it for the job opportunities and to enjoy life in the Pacific Northwest.

When the sun is out, Seattle shows some of the best views in the country. There are many food options and arts to enjoy, from food trucks to nice restaurants. The city is generally safe, and nearby suburbs like Bellevue and Redmond are good for families who want a quieter place to live.

Just to let you know—public transportation can be unreliable, so having a car is often a good idea. If you plan to move here, spending 3-6 months is suggested to really experience the local culture. Get ready to enjoy the mix of city life and the outdoors!
seattle.description_kor:
시애틀은 자연과 야외 활동을 사랑하는 분들에게 정말 멋진 도시입니다. 다양한 공원과 산, 그리고 아름다운 수변 경관 덕분에 연중 내내 즐길 거리가 많습니다. 이곳 사람들은 대체로 친절하고 개방적이지만, 친해지기까지는 조금 시간이 필요할 수 있습니다. 생활비는 다소 높은 편이지만, 많은 이들은 일자리 기회와 태평양 북서부에서의 삶을 누리기 위해 그 비용이 충분히 가치 있다고 여깁니다.

햇빛이 비추는 날에는 시애틀의 풍경이 미국에서 가장 아름답게 펼쳐집니다. 식품 트럭부터 고급 레스토랑까지 다양한 음식점과 예술을 즐길 수 있는 기회가 많습니다. 이 도시는 일반적으로 안전하고, 벨뷰와 레드몬드 같은 인근 교외 지역은 좀 더 조용한 생활을 원하는 가족들에게 안성맞춤입니다. 

단, 공공교통이 다소 불안정할 수 있어 차를 소유하는 것이 좋습니다. 이곳으로 이사할 계획이 있으시다면, 현지 문화를 진정으로 느끼기 위해 3-6개월 정도 시간을 보내는 것이 좋습니다. 도시 생활과 자연을 동시에 즐길 준비를 해보세요!

reviews:
Semiyak was my refuge from the crazy traffic, massive western crowds, mosquito attacks, and inflated prices of Canggu. Seminyak is not 'Balifornia' (Canguu), some will like it for that reason alone. 

Traffic can get clogged in Seminyak but it's still far better than Canggu. Seminyak is just as commercialized as Canggu, but in a different way. If you're familiar with NY, Canggu has east village or lower east side vibes, while Seminyak is more soho. 

Of course neither comes close to the actual NY neighborhoods. You could say Seminyak is more polished with better infrastructure, so you'll find more sidewalks and high end artisan shops, while Canggu is like a super westernized village. Both areas are full of tourists, expats, and nomads, so you'll find plenty of good co working spaces, vegan cafes, and good coffee in Seminyak. 
If you're trying to avoid mosquitos (and the gekkos they bring), there are definitely less in some parts of Seminyak, due to the infrastructure being more built up, although you still need to use repellent.
Be alert to Seminyak scammers, they will spot you from a mile if you're western. Thankfully my NY skills made it easy to avoid and/or get rid of them.
Seminyak has some of the best beachfront bars and cafes, with pools overlooking the sea, better than what you find in Canggu. Don't get me wrong, I still love Canggu, just not thrilled with what it's become, and Seminyak provides an escape that's just a grab or scooter ride away.

If you decide to check out Seminyak you need to dig to find the gems. Because on the surface it's pretty typical, but once you discover some of the amazing places there, you can create your own hideaway. It took me a few days and many hours of research, by foot and online, to find the best hidden places of Seminyak. Prices are better than Canggu but again, you need to dig a bit.

I wanted to say I was surprised that no one has left a review about Seminyak yet... but maybe I shouldn't be surprised. Seminyak is a messy, watered-down Balinese town especially for the typical tourists. Seasoned travellers & nomads will find Seminyak overstimulating and overcommercialized. Imagine Seminyak as Bali's version of Cancun, Mexico.

Having said that, the party scene is pretty fantastic... so if you're looking to put on your dancing shoes and paint the town red, Seminyak is the place to go (One just doesn't require to live or stay there)! Lots of taxis and if you're okay on a motorbike-taxi, try the Gojek app. 

Overall safe and easy to get around. Be wary of pickpocketers and being scammed in the money exchange places, I would recommend going to the atm instead.
seminyak.description:
Seminyak is a lively place in Bali that offers both relaxation and fun. Unlike its neighbor Canggu, which is more laid-back, Seminyak feels more organized, similar to New York’s Soho. Here, you will find nice shops and beach clubs where you can enjoy drinks with great ocean views, making it a good choice for those seeking a little luxury.

Although traffic can be heavy, it is manageable, and there are many taxis and motorbike rides available through apps like Gojek to help you get around. The good thing is, it is generally safer than some other tourist areas, but be careful of pickpockets and avoid suspicious money exchanges.

If you travel often, you might think Seminyak is a bit commercial, but don’t let that stop you! Walking around can reveal interesting places, from small cafés to local shops. Just remember to bring your mosquito repellent, even though there are fewer bugs here. With an active party scene and many cafes and co-working spaces, Seminyak is great for those who want to enjoy the beach while still experiencing city life.
seminyak.description_kor:
세미냑은 발리의 활기찬 지역으로, 휴식과 재미를 동시에 만끽할 수 있는 최적의 장소입니다. 보다 여유로운 분위기를 자랑하는 주변의 찡구와는 달리, 세미냑은 뉴욕의 소호처럼 세련된 감성을 느낄 수 있는 곳이에요. 이곳에서는 멋진 바다 전망을 감상하며 음료를 즐길 수 있는 매력적인 바와 비치 클럽들이 위치하고 있어, 조금의 사치를 원하는 이들에게 안성맞춤입니다.

교통 체증이 좀 심할 수 있지만, 충분히 관리 가능한 수준이며, Gojek와 같은 앱을 통해 편리하게 택시와 오토바이를 이용할 수 있습니다. 무엇보다 좋은 점은, 일반적인 관광지들보다 비교적 안전하다는 것이지만, 소매치기에는 각별히 주의하고 의심스러운 환전은 피하는 것이 좋습니다.

자주 여행하는 분이라면 세미냑이 다소 상업화되어 있다고 느낄 수 있지만, 그런 이유로 방문을 망설일 필요는 없습니다! 이곳저곳을 걸어다니다 보면 아기자기한 카페부터 독특한 지역 상점까지 다양한 흥미로운 장소들이 드러납니다. 벌레는 적지만 모기 기피제를 꼭 챙기는 것을 잊지 마세요. 활기찬 파티 풍경과 다양한 카페 및 코워킹 스페이스가 있는 세미냑은 해변의 여유를 즐기고 도시의 생동감도 함께 느끼고 싶은 분들에게 아주 훌륭한 선택입니다.

reviews: One of the best city i have lived. Very safe, beautiful, 3€ tapas, fast internet, digital nomads, etc. only cons: very hot in summer.

I spent around 3 months in this city. 
Pros:
- beautiful city (arquitecture- WOW)!!
-Not so cold in winter
-Lovely people
Cons:
It gets VERY HOT!! The summer is insanely hot and I could never live all year round in Seville. 
Conservative vibe
Very dry climate.
Amazing city for a week or two. Really beautiful and tons to do. Loved walking around the streets when I wasn't working!

Spent a month in Seville and had a blast. Quality of AirBnBs was great with 100MBPS internet to placate Zoom calls. I stayed in San Lorenzo / Feria / which was a trendy, LGBTQ+ vibe with countless tapas bars, restaurants, supermarkets, and beautiful young Spanish people. I much preferred it to Triana, which seems to be more touristy nowadays despite being billed as an “authentic” experience. The old town is great for a weekend to do the major historical and tourist attractions which are well worth doing - some stunning architecture and a lot of interesting history stretching back a couple thousand years. You can join the Sevillians and jog along the river in the evening, go kayaking, sip a beer at midday, or just chill on the rooftop of your apartment. It’s also quite international - a lot of expats from all over. This is a good place to set up a mid term base.

Seville is great. One of the best cities in Spain by far. I have been living here for 15 years. It's really safe, has lot of party, good weather and it's cheap (compared to the rest of Spain). You're 1h away from the beach and the montains. Free speech, real democracy values, and amazing police forces. Really respectful with LGTBI, women, foreings. There is no racism. Lots of "guiris"

Well, SEVILLE is definitely my favourite city from the ANDALUSIAN region of SPAIN. 
The old town, the buildings and the view from outside is quite marvelous. It has a typical imperial feeling when you walk over there, or maybe I was too drunk. :) 
For nomads, it might be the place where you can stay for a longer period of time.
seville.description:
Oh, Seville! This city is a special place in southern Spain that attracts many visitors. With its beautiful buildings, like the Seville Cathedral and the Alcázar, it feels like you are in another time. The busy streets invite you to explore, especially in neighborhoods like San Lorenzo and Feria, where you can find many tapas bars offering tasty dishes for just 3 euros.

The people here are friendly, which adds to Seville's appeal. It is a safe city, making it good for short visits and longer stays. However, be ready for very hot weather during the summer months—it can be really hot, so plan your outdoor activities for the cooler evenings. The dry climate is something to consider if you are not used to it.

Public transport is okay, but locals often like to walk or bike. If you stay for a while, you will adjust easily, with fast internet in many places to stay. You can enjoy jogging by the river, kayaking, or just relaxing in the sun with a cold drink. Seville is a place where history combines with a lively atmosphere, making it a great spot for anyone wanting to experience Andalusian culture!
seville.description_kor:
오, 세비야! 이 도시는 스페인 남부의 매력적인 장소로, 많은 여행객들을 유혹하고 있습니다. 세비야 대성당과 알카사르 같은 아름다운 건물들 덕분에 마치 다른 시대에 와 있는 듯한 느낌이 들어요. 특히 산 로렌소와 페리아 같은 동네에서는 분주한 거리가 탐험의 즐거움을 선사하며, 3유로에 맛있는 타파스를 제공하는 바들이 많이 있어요.

이곳 사람들은 정말 친절해서 세비야의 매력을 더욱 높여줍니다. 안전한 도시이기 때문에 짧게 방문하거나 오랜 시간 머무르기에도 아주 좋습니다. 하지만 여름철에는 매우 더운 날씨에 대비하는 것이 필요해요. 정말 덥기 때문에 야외 활동은 시원한 저녁 시간에 계획하는 것이 좋습니다. 그리고 건조한 기후는 익숙하지 않다면 신경 써야 할 요소입니다.

대중교통도 괜찮지만, 현지인들은 보통 걷거나 자전거를 타는 걸 선호해요. 잠깐 머물다 보면 쉽게 적응할 수 있으며, 대부분의 숙소에서는 빠른 인터넷도 이용할 수 있습니다. 강변에서 조깅을 하거나 카약을 즐기거나, 그냥 햇살 아래에서 시원한 음료와 함께 여유를 즐기는 것도 가능해요. 세비야는 역사와 생동감이 조화롭게 어우러진 곳으로, 안달루시아 문화를 체험하고 싶은 누구에게나 정말 좋은 선택이에요!

reviews: Lombok definitely has the most amazing virgin beaches , waterfall, and marine life! Senggigi is just one of its many long white sand beaches and a lot of them are still waiting to be discovered. Not much of a party going on here, but if you are itching for one, just hope to a speed boat for 15 minutes and you will arrive in the wild gili trawangan. I was only staying for 4 days, then I fell in love . Been here for 6 months and counting.
Amazing beaches, but no partys. if you don´t like partys, this is your place.
Cheap flights from Bali. Cheapee than Bali, amazing beaches. But there is no partys.
senggigi.description:
Imagine walking along Senggigi's white sand beaches, where the gentle waves invite you to relax and enjoy the sun. Many visitors talk about Lombok's natural beauty, and Senggigi is a place that shows it well. There is no busy nightlife here, which is great if you want a quiet getaway—just bring your beach towel and enjoy the calm.

If you want some fun, you can take a speed boat for just 15 minutes to the busier Gili Trawangan! It’s also a good choice if you are on a budget—flights from Bali are very cheap, and daily costs are even lower than in Bali.

However, watch out for language problems sometimes, and public transport can be unreliable, so it's a good idea to have your own transport or arrange rides. Senggigi is great for beach lovers who prefer beauty over crowds! Enjoy the local atmosphere, find quiet beaches, and appreciate the warm welcome from the locals!
senggigi.description_kor:
상상해 보세요, 센기기의 하얀 모래 해변을 따라 걷는 모습을. 부드러운 파도가 여러분을 맞이하며 편안하게 쉬고 태양을 즐기게 만듭니다. 많은 방문객들이 롬복의 아름다운 자연을 이야기하는데, 센기기는 그 매력을 잘 드러내는 장소입니다. 이곳은 번잡한 야경이 없기 때문에 조용한 휴양을 원하신다면 훌륭한 선택이죠. 그냥 해변 타올을 챙기고 평온한 시간을 즐기세요.

조금 더 즐거운 시간을 원하신다면, 속눈썹 보트를 타고 15분 거리에 위치한 더 북적이는 길리 트라완간으로 갈 수 있습니다! 예산이 넉넉하지 않은 분들에게도 좋은 옵션입니다. 발리에서의 항공료가 저렴하고, 일일 경비도 발리보다 훨씬 낮기 때문이죠.

하지만 언어 소통에 어려움을 겪을 수도 있으니 주의하시고, 대중교통이 불편할 경우에는 개인 교통수단을 마련하거나 차량을 예약하는 것이 좋습니다. 센기기는 군중보다 자연의 아름다움을 선호하는 해변 애호가들에게 딱 맞는 장소입니다! 현지의 아늑한 분위기를 즐기고 조용한 해변을 찾으며, 지역 주민들의 따뜻한 환영을 느껴보세요!

reviews:
Shanghai is a giant city and your experience really depends on a few factors like:
1) where you live in the city
2) do you speak basic Mandarin
3) do you make nice money
4) do you have to use the internet

If you can afford to live in Jing'an or the French Concession, you can live a fashionable metropolitan lifestyle like you would in New York City. There's amazing food (Asian, Western and fusion). You'll be surrounded by entrepreneurs, artists, fashion designers and models. Many of whom do speak English.

It gets better if you speak basic Mandarin though. You don't need to care about the characters. Just learn to speak, that's important enough. The nice thing about Mandarin is China is so big everyone has an accent, so for Chinese it really doesn't matter so much that you have one too.

Depending on how and what kind of money you make, your experience also changes. Like most places in Asia, English teachers are the lowest rank in the hierarchy of foreigners here. Chinese know. But if you're an entrepreneur, even (or especially) an online one, that's high regarded. The problem with working online here is obviously the firewall which can make it very difficult. I've heard good stories about Shadowsocks which seems to work better than regular VPNs.

The recent China vs. America tensions are in fact making people slightly more hostile against Western foreigners. But remember this is Shanghai, it's a metropolitan city, they're usually much less xenophobic than out in the country. Mostly Shanghainese are happy to embrace foreigners, become friends with them, as long as they speak Chinese. And as long as you invest a lot of time. Just popping in and out like a nomad isn't necessarily going to work so well with Chinese. Relationships are long-term.

Be wary of LIES, lies everywhere.

Lies like when a local restaurant tells you it uses clean filtered water. Assume that you will drink polluted water once in a while. It does not only include bacteria but also heavy metal. Drinking bottled water ? The most popular company, Nongfu, was caught using wrong norms years ago. Too many people were boycotting so they changed the traditional red bottle... and removed the English name.

Lies like when they told you the internet speed using local servers. Local internet is actually not that bad, but since you would never use Baidu, Bing or any other unblocked search engine, then your VPN will throttle much of your speed and freedom. Add to that the fact that 2-3 times a year, a political meeting happens and they totally CUT all VPN access.

Lies when you try to know the air pollution and the weather agency chose not to update the air quality index to play with the averages. It's still unhealthy but it got A LOT better these last few years.

Lies like when you just try to know how many people live in Shanghai. Between 25-35 million people (depending on if you include migrant worker and nearby Suzhou soon to be connected by the same subway) means you get access to lots of stuff. Delivery is one (electronics, food). Subway is ridiculously cheap and modern. Taxis (just replace Uber by Didi) is also awesome and quite cheap.

Lies like when you read my review and count as many bad points as good, but you still get Chinese people asking you why you hate China so much...

Surprisingly expensive compared to many other places and there is a major language barrier for most western folks. You often end up hanging out with other nomads or expats for sanity.

It's expensive to drink, and it's not really to make many local friends and very few speak English or any western languages. 

The internet is the killer for most folks and China is slowly closing down all the VPN connections from the commercial services, so it's getting harder and harder to find a way out for things like Gmail or even Google searches and even when it does work, it's really unpredictable.

Some of the hotels and workspaces have always-on VPN connections to Hong Kong for your internet handoff which eliminates the blocking and is a big help, but this is usually at a cost that is passed on to you.

I like Shanghai, but I find it very "showy". People want to make it clear if they have money, so you see lots of flashy cars, expensive clothes and "be seen" places. It's also amazing that you can go to a great restaurant and the table next to you will have six people sitting in complete silence because they are all on their phones.

As others have said, you need to figure out a way to get Alipay or Wechat pay money on your account so you can pay for things. Even people selling vegetables in the market have a QR code so you can pay them with your phone. 

Didi is the local uber-like take service, and you can use western credit cards with it on your phone, and it's pretty cheap by western standards. Public transportation is good and cheap, too.

Cool place, but not inexpensive unless you are out a way and a serious language barrier and a bit of indifference to customer service or dealing with westerners in general.
I also want to share that no matter where you are in China, the fucking GFW is going to ruin your internet experience to max

MOST IMPORTANT for a digital nomad is the internet connection, the speeds are great BUT BEWARE THE GREAT CHINESE FIREWALL even if your download speed is 100mbps, for ANY non chinese site the speed will get limited and will come out to be smth like 12-15 mbps LOL YOU NEED VPN ALWAYS for blocked sites (e.g. google, google maps, facebook, youtube, telegram, whatsapp etc) and it won't save you if you gotta work because even if the site is not blocked the speed will be ridiculous because of the aforementioned.
Shanghai is cashless, you have to get a chinese bank account to load your wechat pay or alipay but you can still use these wallets for receiving money from someone else & be able to pay with it. it's just that you can't withdraw anything or load it with your own money if you don't have a bank account. but you can use some online services that will give you wechat pay/ alipay rmb for visa/mastercard usd for example. 
the air is really bad, you may not notice it right away(unlike in ho chi minh city because of the bikes), but give it a couple of weeks and it'll kick in. i haven't gotten sick once for 2-3 years and once i got to Shanghai i got sick (coughing, sore throat etc.) multiple times in 6 months, always coughing up something. 
i do miss Shanghai now, but what drove me away was pollution and the complete lack of people's manners (e.g. smb will spit next to you inside a building or in the elevator- they say it was way worse before, like spitting in a conference room during a meeting - and you never know where that is gonna land; shoving, pushing, lack of respect for personal space&queues). but hey, that's not my culture, who am i to judge. 
the good things are the online shopping with next day delivery, you really don't need to leave your appartment at all, Shanghai being cashless, there's a lot of money going around if you wanna set up your own business. what happens in chinese parks in the morning is also pretty dope, everyday i'd pass through a small park next to my house there'd be people doing tai chi, some girl getting trained to fight with some kinda sword, old ladies dancing with large fans, a guy playing a flute, some pensioners dancing waltz or smth similar...and that's just your regular tuesday! 
there's a camera for every 2 people in the country so it's very safe, they solve crimes fast. supposedly. 
there's always smb staring at you in a 10m radius if you're a cute eastern european girl, which i haven't experienced in other countries in asia or otherwise.
I do not think Shanghai is a good work place due to GFW and bad PM2.5.
If you need wechat pay, find a Chinese friend as exchange some cash for digital yuan in the wechat wallet
Too many people to live a good life here
Shanghai isn't cashless for foreigners. It's near impossible for foreigners to use WeChat Pay or AliPay
shanghai.description:
Shanghai is a busy city where East meets West. Your time here can be enjoyable or hard depending on your choices. If you live in areas like Jing’an or the French Concession, be ready for a lifestyle similar to New York City, with many tasty food options from Asian, Western, and mixed cuisines. Talking to locals can make your visit better, and knowing some Mandarin can help since not everyone speaks English.

The city has its own unique features. There are clear differences—while the subway is new and inexpensive, cultural differences may confuse you, such as local customs and the "Great Firewall" that makes your internet slower. Remember to get a VPN! Also, while Shanghai is very safe with lots of cameras, the language barrier can be difficult, and the fast pace of life might seem a bit distant.

For relaxation, parks in the morning are lively with tai chi classes and interesting local traditions. If you like online shopping, you'll enjoy it here—next-day delivery is common! Just remember that using local payment methods can be tricky without a Chinese bank account.

So, enjoy everything that Shanghai has to offer, where you will find new things to discover everywhere—but be sure to be patient and flexible!
shanghai.description_kor:
상하이는 동서양이 만나는 분주한 도시입니다. 이곳에서의 경험은 선택에 따라 즐겁거나 도전적일 수 있습니다. Jing'an이나 프랑스 조계지와 같은 지역에 거주한다면, 아시아, 서양, 그리고 혼합 요리의 다양한 맛들을 즐길 수 있는 삶이 기다리고 있습니다. 현지인들과 소통하면 더 좋은 방문 경험을 할 수 있고, 모든 이가 영어를 할 수는 없기 때문에 기본적인 만다린을 알고 있는 것이 많은 도움이 될 것입니다.

이 도시는 그 자체로 독특한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 지하철 시스템이 새롭고 저렴하지만, 현지 관습이나 '만리방화벽'과 같은 인터넷 제한으로 인해 적응하는 데 어려움을 겪을 수도 있습니다. VPN은 필수입니다! 상하이는 다양한 CCTV 덕분에 안전한 편이지만, 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있으며 빠른 생활 속도에 압도될 수도 있습니다.

아침에는 공원에서 태극권 수업과 다양한 지역 전통을 경험하며 활기찬 분위기를 만끽할 수 있습니다. 온라인 쇼핑을 즐긴다면, 상하이에서의 쇼핑은 큰 만족을 줄 수 있습니다. 다음 날 배송 서비스도 아주 흔하니까요! 단, 중국 은행 계좌 없이 현지 결제 방법을 이용하기는 어려울 수 있다는 점은 참고하세요.

상하이가 제공하는 모든 것을 마음껏 즐기세요. 언제나 새로운 것을 발견할 수 있는 곳이니만큼, 인내심과 유연성을 잊지 않는 것이 중요합니다!

reviews:
Best vibe I have encountered so far as it is Philippines' holiday island. Everyone is so chill, surf vibe, people are here to enjoy.

2 coworking spaces so far, both equipped with Starlinks and generators (in case of power cuts which are kinda frequent).
Accommodation is relatively ok price wise though not the cheapest.
Food is pretty good, not the best of SEA but definitely OK.

I’ve come to expect a few challenges, but General Luna (including Back Road, Cloud 9, and Malinao) takes it to another level. The people are lovely, the food is ok, housing can be pricey.

TL;DR: If you want to work reliably, find a place with fiber internet and solar power, or a generator that can run all day, which are the more expensive places.

First off, forget about maintaining a regular work schedule. Power cuts, blackouts, and brownouts are the norm here. Whether planned or due to local incidents, the power goes out often. Repairs are fairly swift, but explaining the next 10-hour blackout to clients can become a headache.

The island's power system is woefully under capacity, and everyone knows it. Don’t expect this to change anytime soon. Some hostels, like Laxias, have generators, which are worth their weight in gold.

Even when the power is on, StarLink internet can be unreliable. It might drop out due to reasons nobody knows, or just because it’s a cloudy day. Patience is the only remedy here. Or find a place that has fiber.

If you manage to have both power and the internet, a good night's sleep is the next hurdle. At night, power cuts, or fluctuations, often stop the AC from working, so your bedroom gets hot.

If it’s none of the above, it's probably the noise. People blasting loud music from 6am (locals) or until 3am (guests) are not uncommon. And if that’s not the case, the local dogs will ensure you’re up at odd hours with their barking.

On the bright side, there aren't many mosquitos! So, there’s that.

All in all, not the best spot for getting work done, but if you can roll with the punches, the charm of the place, and surfing might just win you over.

I’ve come to expect a few challenges, but General Luna (including Back Road, Cloud 9, and Malinao) takes it to another level. The people are lovely, the food is ok, housing can be pricey.

TL;DR: If you want to work reliably, find a place with fiber internet and solar power, or a generator that can run all day. Which are the more expensive places.

First off, forget about maintaining a regular work schedule. Power cuts, blackouts, and brownouts are the norm here. Whether planned or due to local incidents, the power goes out often. Repairs are fairly swift, but explaining the next 10-hour blackout to clients can become a headache.

The island's power system is woefully under capacity, and everyone knows it. Don’t expect this to change anytime soon. Some hostels, like Laxias, have generators, which are worth their weight in gold.

Even when the power is on, StarLink internet can be unreliable. It might drop out due to reasons nobody knows, or just because it’s a cloudy day. Patience is the only remedy here. Or find a place that has fiber.

If you manage to have both power and the internet, a good night's sleep is the next hurdle. At night, power cuts, or fluctuations, often stop the AC from working, so your bedroom gets hot.

If it’s none of the above, it's probably the noise. People blasting loud music from 6am (locals) or until 3am (guests) are not uncommon. And if that’s not the case, the local dogs will ensure you’re up at odd hours with their barking.

On the bright side, there aren't many mosquitos! So, there’s that.

All in all, not the best spot for getting work done, but if you can roll with the punches, the charm of the place, and surfing might just win you over.

Siargao is a vibrant Island. Known for its beautiful surfing beaches, both for beginners and professionals Siargao also offers some great parties, almost every night and a nice mix of restaurants. You will see many people in General Luna, but the Island doesn’t feel too crowded, even in peak season. Internet is not great, but you can find places with 100-200/mps
Good surfing on this island. More experienced surfers head to Cloud 9.
siargao.description:
Siargao is a great place in the Philippines, known for its relaxed surf culture and friendly people. If you want a calm place to relax while surfing, this is it! General Luna is the main area of the island, where you can find places like Cloud 9, good for both new surfers and experienced ones. The sunsets here are beautiful and the nightlife is active, making it easy to meet other travelers.

But there are some drawbacks. Be ready for occasional power cuts and internet problems; locals often suggest finding places to stay with generators or good internet if you need to work. On the positive side, there are few mosquitoes, so you can enjoy being outside comfortably!

While prices for hotels and food can be high, the variety of restaurants is nice, even if the food isn’t the best in Southeast Asia. It’s all about enjoying the island life, adapting to its quirks, and having fun—this is not just a place to visit; it’s an adventure waiting for you!
siargao.description_kor:
시아르가오는 필리핀의 멋진 장소로, 여유로운 서핑 문화와 친절한 사람들로 유명합니다. 서핑을 즐기면서 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 장소를 찾고 있다면, 이곳이 딱입니다! 제너럴 루나 지역은 섬의 주요 중심지로, 초보 서퍼부터 경험이 풍부한 서퍼까지 모두에게 적합한 클라우드 9 같은 멋진 서핑 스팟이 있습니다. 이곳의 일몰은 환상적이며, 야간 활동도 활발해 다른 여행자들과 쉽게 만날 수 있답니다.

하지만 몇 가지 단점도 있습니다. 가끔 정전이나 인터넷 문제를 겪을 수 있으니, 대비가 필요합니다. 현지인들은 일이 필요한 경우 발전기나 안정적인 인터넷이 있는 숙소를 찾는 것을 추천하곤 합니다. 긍정적인 점은 모기가 거의 없어서 편안하게 야외에서 시간을 보낼 수 있다는 것입니다!

호텔과 음식 가격이 다소 비쌀 수 있지만, 다양한 레스토랑이 있어서 선택의 폭이 넓습니다. 음식이 동남아시아에서 가장 맛있지는 않지만, 섬의 삶을 경험하고 그 독특한 매력에 적응하며 즐거움을 찾을 수 있는 곳입니다. 단순히 방문하는 곳이 아니라, 여러분을 기다리고 있는 모험의 장소입니다!

reviews: Adler is close, it's the beach resort where most Russians flock making it extremely busy. Very walkable despite it's rating, especially in the centre and adler.

If you must stay in Russia in winter and want it warm - then it's probably the only place. 
Very close to to ski-resort - one hour via train.
sochi.description:
Sochi is a busy beach resort filled with Russian tourists, especially in the summer when many people come to enjoy the sun. If you want warmth in the colder months, it’s one of the few places in Russia that offers that. The city is easy to walk around, especially in the main areas and Adler, where you can find many shops, cafés, and, of course, nice beaches.

While the busy atmosphere is a big attraction, it can get crowded during busy times, so expect a lot of people. If you enjoy winter sports, you’re in luck—just an hour away by train, there are ski resorts, making Sochi a unique place where you can have both sun and snow.

Remember that the cost of living can be high, and public transportation options are limited, which might be challenging for new visitors. However, if you are looking for a mix of beach enjoyment and mountain activities, Sochi is definitely worth a visit!
sochi.description_kor:
소치는 러시아 관광객으로 가득한 활기찬 해변 리조트랍니다. 특히 여름철에는 많은 사람들이 햇빛을 즐기러 찾아옵니다. 추운 겨울철 따뜻한 곳을 찾고 계신다면, 러시아에서 몇 안 되는 그런 장소 중 하나이기도 해요. 이 도시는 중심 지역과 아들러 지역이 특히 걷기 좋은 평지로 되어 있어서, 다양한 상점, 카페, 그리고 당연히 아름다운 해변도 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다.

활기찬 분위기는 큰 매력적이지만, 혼잡한 시간대에는 사람들로 붐비니 미리 인파를 예상하시는 게 좋습니다. 겨울 스포츠를 좋아하신다면 특히 좋은 소식이 있어요. 기차로 단 한 시간 거리에 스키 리조트가 있어서, 소치에서는 태양과 눈을 동시에 즐길 수 있는 특별한 경험을 할 수 있습니다.

물가가 다소 비싸고 대중교통 수단이 제한적이어서 처음 방문하는 분들에게는 조금 불편할 수 있다는 점도 염두에 두세요. 하지만 해변에서의 여유로움과 산에서의 액티비티를 모두 원하신다면, 소치는 정말 가볼 만한 곳입니다!

reviews: A nice quite city, full of statuses!, The place can be visited within a week at max, would recommend Ohrid next to visit

One week is about right for Skopje if you're working full time. The people are pretty friendly and there are a few interesting things to do and see. A month or more is too much of a commitment in my opinion though.

I found Skopje, and Macedonia in general, a super interesting place to be. The old part of the city has got it's eastern charm about it, the people are friendly and it feels really safe. Mobile data in the country is really affordable and excellent coverage. Broadband wasn't amazing where we stayed. The local cuisine is great, as long as you're not vegan/veggie as it's very meat and cheese heavy. There's not a huge variety either, we only had local food, Italien or Mexican. It's surrounded by mountains and there are loads of great walks to do on the nearby Vodno mountain. Skopje is also really close to the Mavrovo national park, which is a ski resort and lake, plus the Tetovo national park, which I would highly recommend (start hiking from Popova Shapka). Going on from Skopje, Bitola is a really lively town with great vibes. We will go to Ohrid after which is the most famous tourist destination. I would recommend staying a month in Skopje as a maximum.

Skopje is certainly an interesting place to see, but where you shouldn't spend too much time. You can start here and take a trip around the country, as there are several places worth seeing. The city is safe, the air quality is very low and it does not get too cold in winter (though it does get cold). There isn't much to do, plus I visited the city during the time of the pandemic, which made it worse for socializing. Cheap prices and great Internet connection, even on the road between cities.
Been there recently. Little city with some Istanbulish appearences in the Old Town + it's really cheapppp!!! The old town + center is really cute. Definitely worth seeing it!
skopje.description:
Skopje is an interesting city that combines history and modern life. It is not too large, making it easy to walk around its streets and see the many statues scattered throughout. The Old Town has an Eastern feel, giving you the sense that you've entered a busy market with various colors and smells.

The people are welcoming, and many visitors feel safe here. Mobile data is cheap, which is a plus, but the internet may not be great in all areas. The local food is filling, but if you are vegan or vegetarian, your choices might be limited.

For those who enjoy the outdoors, the nearby Vodno mountain has good hiking paths, and Mavrovo National Park is not far away, making it great for skiing or relaxing by the lake. A week is usually enough time to see Skopje, but it is also a nice place to start for exploring North Macedonia. Just keep in mind that the air quality can be poor at times and prices are very low. So, pack your bags and prepare for a unique experience in Skopje!
skopje.description_kor:
스코페는 역사와 현대가 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다. 그리 크지 않아 거리를 쉽게 걸으며 곳곳에 있는 다양한 동상을 감상할 수 있습니다. 구시가 지역은 동양적인 느낌을 주며, 다채로운 색과 향기로 가득한 활기찬 시장을 경험할 수 있습니다.

사람들은 매우 친절하며, 많은 방문객들이 이곳에서 안전하다고 느낍니다. 모바일 데이터 요금이 저렴한 것은 큰 장점이지만, 모든 지역에서 인터넷 속도가 좋지 않을 수 있다는 점은 참고하세요. 현지 음식은 푸짐하지만, 비건이나 채식주의자는 선택의 폭이 다소 좁을 수 있습니다.

야외 활동을 좋아하는 분들에게는 근처 보드노 산이 훌륭한 하이킹 코스를 제공하며, 마브로보 국립공원도 가까워 스키를 타거나 호수 근처에서 여유를 즐기기에 적합합니다. 스코페를 둘러보는 데는 대개 일주일이면 충분하지만, 북마케도니아 탐방을 시작하기에 좋은 장소이기도 합니다. 가끔씩 공기 질이 좋지 않을 수 있으며, 물가가 매우 저렴하다는 점도 유념하세요. 그럼 짐을 챙기고 스코페에서 특별한 경험을 준비해 보세요!

reviews:
Sofia is a pretty safe city, lots of nice parks, at least in some areas of town.
Pro's:
Safe, relatively well connected (airport), good nightlife (if you are a student or part of the support center crowd), nice hinterland for recreational activities.
Con's
No longer cheap, low service quality, low quality of food (I've seen Cosmos featured here and c'mon :), the expat scene is well developed but again, more at the level of support center staff

I've been here 2 years now. I pay for internet at 3 seperate places (home, office, 2nd apartment on seaside) I pay about $20 USD / month for 300Mbps/300Mbps at each of the 3. Internet here is super cheap, reliable and fast.

I think Sofia is a wonderful place to be right now - especially as a base. Rent is super affordable and there are decent apartments available. 

There's a vibrant expat community with lots of WhatsApp groups. You can find a list of all the WA groups in the featured posts on the Sofia Digital Nomads and Remote Workers Facebook group. 

It's a very convenient place to live - walkable, good transportation, lots of English-speaking people.

WiFi speeds are great. Most cafes have plugs. Best ones to work from I think are: Cafe 1920, Altruist, Barter Community Hub, The Steps, Boho, Barista Coffee and More, КОМПАНИЯТА, Coffee Fellows. 

Unfortunately, food can be very hit and miss. Here are my favourite places after much exploring: StandArt, Niko'las 0/360, Contessa, HAMACHI, Cosmos, Royal Thai, Mediterraneo, Veda House, Satsanga, Under the Linden Trees, Umami.

In terms of things to do, there are plenty of parks, fun escape rooms, board games places, walking tours. Vitosha is a very popular hiking spot nearby. 

Overall, I highly recommend paying a visit!

The city has some nice parks and is not too crowded. The center of the city is easily walkable. But it gets boring very quickly. Not much happening there. Airpolution can be China level bad during the winter. The food is good and cheap. Internet and mobile works well.

Overall the city/country feels very old, you hardly see any young people on the street. Most buildings and streets are in bad shape. The locals are a dealbreaker. People are argumentative, rude, and cold. Nobody ever smiles, people stare uncomfortably long at you. The service sector is bad, nobody does more than the bare minimum. People hang up on you on the phone in the middle of conversation. Traffic is dangerous, cars seem to actively hunt you at crosswalks. 

Never felt this unwelcome in any other country. Romania or Serbia are far better choices in this region.

I've been living for 20 years in the Uk abroad outside of Bulgaria, nothing in the world like Bulgaria, the best country in the world, of course, there's a bad side to the country like any other country in the world. Bulgaria has 4 seasons summer being very hot and winter snowing and going to ski resorts, it has one of the tastiest cuisines worldwide rich in history and in culture. Also has the most beautiful women there !! It's very cheap and affordable coming from abroad. Definitely, a place to visit at least once in a lifetime. Of course, there is downside like the economy, poverty, and corruption beggars however if you choose the best places in Bulgaria you won't regret it xохо Gabriela (обичам българия)

Spent 1 week in Sofia working remotely. I did not like it at all. Perhaps I was staying at some bad part of the center. But it was dirty, drunks(just peeing on the street was a nice sight) and beggars on the streets. Was also very unlucky with the food I took in some resturants/cafes. (expensive and below average taste/portion size). Street food was actually good. I did see many people speaking English around the center so definitely there are tourists there. Nightlife- quite expensive, tourist fees for entrance to the bars by security guards. For me it seemed strange that parties happens extremely late at nigh (3:00 AM when it was most crowded and I was already heading home.) Rented a car and outside of Sofia I found the country to be more authentic with beautiful mountains etc. I suggest skipping Sofia as a nomad and going to Varna instead.

I love Bulgaria, but Sofia wasn't my favorite part by far. It is quite an ugly city, mostly flat and grey in color. There are some decent hostel, decent bars and nightlife, but not really much for the tourist to do. Yes, the women are very attractive, and it's cheap to rent there... but why would you want to? I had a great time down on Varna, and along the coast of the black sea. Sofia is worth a visit or a place to stay a few weeks, but I wouldn't want to live there personally.

Its time to make a review about my hometown. I lived many years in Sofia and Varna, so you can trust my review as a Bulgarian who lived in longterm in Vietnam, Germany, Thailand, Spain etc...
1. Bulgaria is amazing in the Summer. (Varna!) Sofia is not. Will get boring super fast.
2. Life is a lot cheaper as listed here. 
3. 90% of Bulgarians are racists and hate GAY people. Lesbians are tolerated.
4. Food is amazing and cheap
5. Its dirty and poluted
6. People will try scam you (not only foreigners even locals get scammed). You can get beat up pretty easily without a real reason. My friend (local from Sofia) got destroyed by the security, for putting a Flower Vase in the nightclub to another spot as an example. 
7. Fake Alcohol is even common in the best nightclubs. You are never safe to order a expensive bottle. Only the cheapest Vodka is always safe because not worth faking it.
8. Women are STUNNING but english level is low. So you will have a hard time finding non gold digger that are more than 7/10 on the looks.
If you are a white male, you will have fun! If not better avoid it for more long term visits.

Sofia is a small city and it is very polluted. In fact it is one of the most polluted cities in Europe. The restaurants and bars are ok. For the rest there is not a lot to do. After a couple of days you have seen it all. The people are ok but Sofia misses an international vibe. Lets be honest here, you mostly get where you pay for.

Sofia is one of the most amazing cities ever, it has old buildings because of the low economic status of the country, but the main cause is from the low number of tourists visiting this lovely country. The food is amazing and cheap, the population is very fun, but they are a little bit homophobics and racists (not everyone, but there are a lot of people who really are). Bulgaria has amazing views, parks, coffeehouses and of course the most beautiful beaches and sunsets, the temperature of the water is around 27°, which is really warm compared to the ocean temperature. All day and night the city center has open mini markets and coffeehouses, you will see a lot of Bulgarians having fun out there. It is a great country to visit.

I lived in Sofia for 3 months and I loved it. The food scene is amazing; quality food in very cheap price. Very calm atmosphere with a lot of nature. Park everywhere! As Asian, I felt the least racism in the region. However, I did see a lot of Swastikas everywhere, even on a guy's calf. The city center has some cool bars.

I really enjoyed my ten days in Sofia. It was early Sept and the students were just arriving, so it wasn't too busy. At first glance it seemed sort of dead, and boring. But since I'd been all over Bulgaria I knew that most of the gems would be hidden, so I asked locals. Then I found cool nightlife spots, good cafe's, and met a few girls to date. 

It's close to the mountains and there is hiking and winter sports. 

Sofia doesn't have the vibe of a top tier Euro city, but if you're a single man looking for an easy place to find a beautiful apartment for cheap, and maybe a beautiful girlfriend, Sofia could be up your alley. And if not, there are many cool places nearby, like Plovdiv, Banksko, and Varna further down.

Sofia is a pretty cool city if you know where to go. It's also next to high mountains (ski available) and feels very green. However, Bulgaria has a very strongly marked Soviet past, so it might be a bit of a shock to some.
the best city in the world lol
It’s the poorest country I’ve ever soon

Incredible cheap, great food (if you like meat) and lots of parks. Many bars and coffee shops in the city centre. Downside: Many aggressive gipsy's and beggars. Bulgarian people rather rude and everybody is staring at you uncomfortably long.
Sofia es una ciudad muy linda
Sofia es una ciudad muy linda
Sofia es una ciudad muy linda
Sofia es una ciudad muy linda
Sofia es una ciudad muy linda

Sofia is quite peaceful despite the medium to heavy traffic. It is very easy to travel this city, even without the metro, but public transportation is simple as well. 
Many beautiful parks, and access to wifi, make it easy to work anywhere. My favorite part is grabbing a coffee for .40 lev and getting to work. Also, grabbing a beer and lounging anywhere in the city is no concern. There are also plenty of outdoor, free events to experience if you want to meet other people, or travelers. 

Price of clothing and electronics is comparable to US/UK standard, some places even charge more. For this reason, I recommend having a good idea of the price range for any items you are looking to purchase.
It’s one of the most homofobic cities in Europe
sofia.description:
Sofia is a city with both good and bad aspects, but many people find it interesting. It is safe, with many parks to enjoy, especially if you like nature. The nightlife is lively because of the students and expats, but it can be expensive, especially in popular bars.

If you live here, you will see that while rent is cheap and the internet is very fast and reliable (about $20 a month for good speeds!), the food quality can vary. Some local places are worth trying, like StandArt or Royal Thai, but some might not meet your expectations.

For getting around, it is fairly easy, and you will find many people who speak English, which is helpful. However, be aware that air pollution can be high in winter, and some locals may seem distant, but once you settle in, there are many activities, like hiking on Vitosha or taking walking tours.

In summary, if you are open to new experiences and willing to explore, Sofia can provide an interesting experience with its history, nice views, and active community. A visit is definitely worth considering!
sofia.description_kor:
소피아는 장단점이 있는 도시지만 많은 사람들이 흥미를 느끼는 곳입니다. 자연을 좋아하는 분들에게는 다양한 공원이 있어 안전하게 즐길 수 있습니다. 학생들과 외국인 덕분에 밤에는 활기찬 분위기가 펼쳐지지만, 인기 있는 바에서의 음료 가격이 조금 비쌀 수 있습니다.

여기에서 살게 된다면, 임대료가 저렴하고 인터넷 속도가 매우 빠르며 신뢰할 수 있다는 사실을 알게 될 것입니다(좋은 속도에 한 달에 약 20달러 정도입니다!). 다만 음식의 품질은 곳에 따라 차이가 있을 수 있습니다. StandArt나 Royal Thai와 같은 훌륭한 로컬 맛집이 있지만 기대에 미치지 못하는 곳도 있을 수 있습니다.

교통은 매우 편리하며 많은 사람들이 영어를 할 줄 알아서 도움이 됩니다. 그러나 겨울철에는 공기 오염이 심각해질 수 있고, 일부 현지 주민들은 다소 거리감을 느끼는 것처럼 보일 수도 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 정착하게 되면 비토샤산에서 하이킹을 하거나 도보 투어와 같은 다양한 활동을 즐길 수 있습니다.

따라서 새로운 경험에 열린 마음을 가지고 탐험할 의향이 있다면, 소피아는 역사와 아름다운 경치, 그리고 활기찬 공동체가 어우러진 흥미로운 경험을 제공합니다. 한번 방문해볼 만한 가치가 충분히 있습니다!

reviews: Best place for solo travellers. The people here are awesome. Almost no crime against foreigners according to statistics. Give this paradise on earth a try :)
srinagar.description:
Srinagar is a great place for solo travelers who want adventure and relaxation in a nice setting. Known as "Paradise on Earth," this city has beautiful views with its well-known Dal Lake and mountains. Visitors talk about the friendly locals, which makes it easy to learn about the culture and feel welcome. The area is also considered safe, with very few crimes reported against foreigners, so you can explore without worries.

While you are there, don't miss a shikara ride on the lake or a stay in a traditional houseboat for a special experience. Although the prices for hotels and food can be high, the experiences make it worth it.

However, getting around on public transportation can be a little difficult, so having a plan could save you time. Language may be a small challenge, but most people can speak enough English to help you. Enjoy the local customs, try the tasty Kashmiri food, and enjoy everything that Srinagar has to offer!
srinagar.description_kor:
스리나가르는 모험과 휴식을 원하는 솔로 여행자들에게 최적의 장소입니다. "지상 낙원"이라고 불리는 이 도시는 유명한 달 호수와 멋진 산들로 장관을 이루고 있습니다. 방문객들은 친절한 현지인들과의 소통을 통해 문화에 대해 배우고 편안함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 이 지역은 외국인에 대한 범죄가 거의 없어 안전하다고 알려져 있어 마음 놓고 탐방할 수 있습니다.

방문하는 동안, 호수에서 시카라를 타거나 전통 하우스보트에서 숙박하는 특별한 경험은 꼭 놓치지 마세요. 호텔과 음식 가격이 다소 비쌀 수 있지만 그만한 경험이 기다리고 있습니다.

하지만 대중교통을 이용하는 것은 조금 번거로울 수 있으니 미리 계획을 세우면 시간도 절약할 수 있습니다. 언어는 다소 어려울 수 있지만, 대부분의 사람들이 기본적인 영어를 구사할 수 있어 큰 문제는 없습니다. 현지 문화를 만끽하고 맛있는 카슈미르 요리도 꼭 시도해 보세요. 스리나가르에서 제공하는 모든 것을 즐기시길 바랍니다!

reviews: I loved this city! We stayed for one week, but could easily stay longer. What I love about this city is its beauty, walk ability and convenience to other places such as Germany, Switzerland and other parts of France, just to name a few. It’s a big, little city. It has an airport as well, for when you want to go further. The cost for groceries were not any different than other parts of France or Germany. There are many students here and a rich culture of Alsatian, German and French cultures interwoven. The orange park is a fantastic place to walk, relax and picnic. Getting around on the tram and bus is very easy. City center is highly touristy, so if you don’t want that, I advise staying a little further out of the area.

I stayed 4 months in Strasbourg. The city is very pleasant, the architecture is nice, there are lots of places to stay and chill out on the weekend or before/after work. 
I strongly advise to live in the city center surrounded by a very nice river, which is not very big but very convenient because everything is less than 10 minutes away by foot. 

The airbnb are not affordable but are in the average of the French cities. I got away with 870 euros for a studio the first month via airbnb and then negotiated to 700 for the next 3 months. The city is safe and there is a good atmosphere. 

As far as work is concerned, I rarely go coworking but I like to work in coffee shops. There are not many in the city that are of good quality and have a big space to work. But there are some good spots and quality coffee shops like Coffee Stub : good coffee and nice atmosphere to work with your laptop (but no wifi).

For those who are not necessarily looking for a quality coffee, there are some nice Starbucks to work with your laptop. 

Strasbourg is a city where it's good to live, it's a good place to settle down, it's quite cosmopolitan because there are many students. I lived in Japan and I was happy to see that there is a big Japanese community in Strasbourg. 

In terms of walking around, we are not far from Germany and there are cities like Colmar which are cool for a relaxing/discovering day trip 

I warmly recommend, it's a city that I really enjoyed in France.
strasbourg.description:
Strasbourg is a city that combines French and German cultures, making it both familiar and different. It is a place where walking along the canals can lead to an easy picnic in the Orange Park—great for relaxing after looking at the beautiful buildings. Many visitors appreciate how easy it is to walk around the city, with most places just a short 10-minute walk away.

Living here has its advantages. There are many students and various neighborhoods. While the cost of living is similar to other French cities, many find that housing is slightly more expensive, especially in the city center. Public transport is simple, with trams and buses available to help you get around. Just note that the city center can be busy with tourists, so you might want to stay a bit outside for a quieter time.

On the downside, some people have pointed out that there are not many good coffee shops for working, but there are a few comfortable places to sit with your laptop. Strasbourg is safe, friendly, and has many interesting spots, making it a good place to live or visit!
strasbourg.description_kor:
스트라스부르는 프랑스와 독일 문화가 조화를 이루는 도시로, 익숙하면서도 독특한 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 운하를 따라 걷다 보면 오렌지 공원에서의 소풍도 손쉽게 즐길 수 있고, 아름다운 건물들을 감상하며 한적하게 쉴 수 있는 곳이에요. 많은 방문객들은 주요 명소들이 가까운 거리, 대체로 10분 이내에 위치해 있어 도시를 쉽게 탐방할 수 있다는 점을 높이 평가합니다.

이곳에서 생활하는 것에는 여러 가지 장점이 있습니다. 학생과 다양한 동네가 많아 활기차고, 생활비는 다른 프랑스 도시와 비슷하지만, 중심가에서는 주거비가 다소 비싸다고 느끼는 경우가 많습니다. 대중교통도 편리하고, 트램과 버스 덕분에 이동이 수월합니다. 다만 도심은 관광객들로 붐비는 경우가 많아 조용한 환경을 원하신다면 약간 외곽에 머무는 것도 좋습니다.

단점으로는, 일하기 좋은 커피숍이 많지 않다는 의견이 있지만, 노트북을 들고 앉아서 작업할 수 있는 편안한 장소는 몇 군데 있습니다. 전반적으로 스트라스부르는 안전하고 친절하며, 흥미로운 장소들이 많아 살거나 방문하기에 매우 좋은 곳입니다!

reviews: People aren't friendly at all, way too expensive and, overall, not a great place to live. Visiting is fine, but don't expect great things.
stuttgart.description:
Stuttgart has its own set of good and bad points. Many visitors like the city’s lively culture and history, with important sites like the Mercedes-Benz Museum and Schlossplatz. However, some people feel that the atmosphere can be a bit cold—locals might not be very friendly, making conversations somewhat difficult.

On the positive side, Stuttgart has nice parks and good public transport that makes moving around easy. However, be aware that the cost of living is high, especially for eating out or finding places to stay. While there are not many exciting activities, learning about local traditions and festivals can still be enjoyable.

If you plan to visit, make sure to explore areas like Bad Cannstatt for a more local feel. Just remember that language differences might come up, as English is not always commonly spoken. Overall, it’s a place to visit, but don’t expect too much!
stuttgart.description_kor:
슈투트가르트는 장점과 단점이 공존하는 도시입니다. 많은 관광객들이 메르세데스-벤츠 박물관과 슐로스플라츠 같은 주요 명소 덕분에 도시의 생동감 넘치는 문화와 역사에 매료되곤 합니다. 하지만 일부 사람들은 이곳의 분위기가 다소 차갑다고 느끼기도 하고, 지역 주민들의 친절도가 높지 않아 대화가 쉽지 않다고 할 수 있습니다.

긍정적인 면을 보면, 슈투트가르트에는 아름다운 공원도 많고, 대중교통이 잘 발달해 있어 이동이 매우 편리하다는 점이 있습니다. 그러나 외식이나 숙소를 찾는 데 드는 비용이 꽤 비싸기 때문에 생활비가 높은 점은 유의해야 합니다. 신나는 활동이 많지는 않지만, 지역의 전통과 축제에 대해 배우는 것 자체는 큰 즐거움이 될 수 있습니다.

방문 계획이 있으시다면, 바트 칸슈타트 같은 지역을 탐방해 보시면 더 현지의 매력을 느낄 수 있을 거예요. 단, 영어가 항상 통용되는 언어가 아니므로 언어 차이가 있을 수 있다는 점도 기억하시기 바랍니다. 전반적으로 방문할 만한 장소이긴 하지만, 너무 큰 기대는 하지 않는 게 좋을 것 같습니다!

reviews: I've been here in April 2013. I've found it good, however, the weather was hot.
sulaymaniyah.description:
Sulaymaniyah is a lively city in Kurdistan with many interesting things to see and do. You will meet welcoming locals who want to share their culture, and the city has a good mix of new and traditional elements. The weather can be very hot, especially in the summer, so bring light clothing and drink plenty of water while you explore.

The cost of living here is usually low compared to bigger cities, making it a good choice for travelers on a budget. Public transportation may not be very extensive, but local taxis and ride-sharing apps are available to help you get around. Safety is generally good, but it’s always smart to be aware of your surroundings.

You can visit local parks, busy markets, and interesting museums that provide information about the area’s history. Make sure to try the tasty Kurdish food, such as grilled meats and fresh bread! Remember, knowing a few basic phrases in Kurdish can be very helpful. Overall, whether you are walking around the city or spending time with locals, Sulaymaniyah offers a friendly experience.
sulaymaniyah.description_kor:
술라이마니야는 흥미로운 볼거리와 즐길 거리가 가득한 쿠르드스탄의 활기찬 도시입니다. 이곳에서 현지인들과의 문화 교류를 통해 따뜻한 환대를 느낄 수 있으며, 전통과 현대가 조화롭게 어우러진 멋진 장소입니다. 여름철에는 무더운 날씨로 가벼운 옷차림을 추천하며, 탐험하는 동안 충분한 수분을 섭취하는 것이 중요합니다.

이곳의 생활비는 일반적으로 대도시에 비해 저렴해 예산이 한정된 여행자에게도 좋은 선택이 될 것입니다. 대중교통이 넉넉하지는 않지만, 지역 택시나 승차 공유 앱을 이용하면 이동 편의성이 높아집니다. 전반적인 안전 수준은 괜찮지만, 항상 주위를 잘 살펴보는 것이 현명합니다.

지역 공원이나 번화한 시장, 그리고 역사에 관한 흥미로운 정보를 제공하는 박물관도 방문해 보세요. 특히, 맛있는 쿠르드 음식을 꼭 맛보셔야 합니다. 예를 들어, 구운 고기와 신선한 빵은 필수입니다! 기본적인 쿠르드어 몇 마디를 아는 것도 큰 도움이 될 수 있으니 기억하세요. 전반적으로, 술라이마니야를 걸으며 현지인들과 소통하는 경험은 따뜻하고 친근한 분위기를 느끼게 해줍니다.

reviews: The city lacks footpaths in most areas. The air pollution is quite unbearable especially when you walk to go around or riding motorbikes. Petrol sold here only met the Euro 3-4 emission standard. Most vehicles on the road do not meet the minimum emission standard. The locals burn their rubbish which includes burning plastic. Everywhere is pretty much the rubbish bin for many locals. Infrastructures are not well maintained. Definitely not a picturesque city except for the trees planted in city centres. The "parks" here are more like green pockets surrounded by heavy traffics. Not quite functioning as a park where you can chill. It's a fairly safe city but nothing is particularly interesting. Most working spaces free from air pollution would be in shopping malls. But they're currently having many restrictions to get in (as of 9/4/2021). Houses here are not designed to bear the humid tropical heat and are heavily reliant on AC. Healthy foods are expensive therefore not accessible to everyone even though it is a basic human right. The overall quality of life I'd rate 5/10.
surabaya.description:
Surabaya is a busy city in Indonesia, full of daily life but has its own problems. One of the first things you might see is the lack of sidewalks in many places, making it hard to walk around. The air quality can be poor, with pollution levels often high because of car exhaust and local actions like burning garbage. On the positive side, the city is generally safe, and the locals are friendly, welcoming visitors.

When it comes to attractions, Surabaya has its own character, though it is not very beautiful. The parks are more like small green areas among the busy streets, good for a quick rest rather than a relaxing day. The cost of living can be complicated, with healthy food being expensive and hard to find for some.

If you're in the city, shopping malls are a common place to relax, giving a break from the traffic and heat. Just remember that public transportation is not very wide-reaching, so plan your trips carefully. Overall, while Surabaya has some areas that could improve, it offers a true experience of city life in Indonesia that many people remember.
surabaya.description_kor:
수라바야는 인도네시아의 활기찬 도시로, 일상이 분주하지만 다양한 문제점들도 존재합니다. 첫눈에 띄는 것은 곳곳에 보도가 부족해 이동이 불편하다는 점입니다. 공기 질이 좋지 않고 자동차 배기가스와 쓰레기 소각 등으로 인해 오염 수준이 종종 높아집니다. 하지만 긍정적인 점도 있습니다. 대체로 도시가 안전하고 현지인들이 친절하게 방문객을 맞이해 줍니다.

관광 명소는 수라바야만의 독특한 매력이 있지만, 그다지 경치가 뛰어나지는 않습니다. 공원들은 바쁜 거리 사이에 있는 작은 녹지 공간처럼 보여서, 편안히 쉴 수 있는 공간보다는 짧은 휴식을 취하기에 적합합니다. 생활비는 복잡할 수 있으며, 건강한 음식을 찾기가 어렵고 가격도 비쌀 수 있습니다.

이 도시에서는 쇼핑몰이 흔한 휴식 공간으로, 더위와 교통 체증에서 벗어날 수 있는 곳입니다. 다만 대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있지 않아서 여행 계획을 신중히 세우는 것이 중요합니다. 전반적으로 수라바야는 개선할 여지가 많지만, 많은 사람들이 인도네시아의 진정한 도시 생활을 체험할 수 있는 장소입니다.

reviews: I haven't been to Suva in years but when I was there I cried when I had to return to the US. The people were friendly and humble. I was invited to weddings and villages by taxi drivers and the people working at the hotel before the week was up. I felt incredibly safe. The natural beauty was outstanding. There was a plethora of things to do, the hiking, the incredibly friendly villagers , the snorkeling and the Indian food. I do not know if things have changed for the worst since that time but I always wanted to go back and live there. I suppose it's worth a visit now.
suva.description:
Suva, the capital of Fiji, feels welcoming because of its friendly locals. Many visitors appreciate the kindness of the people here, experiencing hospitality that often leads to memorable moments, like being invited to local weddings or village gatherings. You can see the beautiful nature, whether you're hiking through green areas or snorkeling in clear waters.

While Suva has its good points, some things can be a bit difficult. The cost of living can be high, and public transportation may not reach every part of the city, so it’s good to plan ahead. However, safety is a strong point here; most travelers feel safe walking around.

If you want to try some local food, don’t miss the Indian dishes that are popular in town! A trip to Suva offers an experience filled with culture and friendly connections, making it a great choice for anyone looking for something different in the Pacific.
suva.description_kor:
수바, 피지의 수도는 친절한 현지인들 덕분에 따뜻한 분위기를 자아냅니다. 많은 방문객들이 이곳 사람들의 환대에 감동하며, 종종 지역 결혼식이나 마을 모임에 초대받는 특별한 경험을 통해 잊지 못할 순간을 만납니다. 아름다운 자연 속에서 하이킹을 즐기거나 맑은 물에서 스노클링을 하며 경치를 감상할 수 있는 기회도 많습니다.

수바는 장점이 많지만, 몇 가지 단점도 있습니다. 먼저 생활비가 꽤 높은 편이라 주의가 필요하고, 대중교통이 도시의 모든 지역을 커버하지 못할 수 있으니 미리 계획하는 것이 좋습니다. 하지만 안전한 면에서는 긍정적이며 대부분의 여행객들이 거리를 걷는 데에 있어서 안심할 수 있습니다.

현지 음식을 맛보고 싶다면, 이곳에서 유명한 인도 요리는 꼭 경험해 보세요! 수바로의 여행은 문화적인 경험과 따뜻한 사람들과의 교류로 가득 차 있으며, 태평양에서 특별한 무언가를 찾고 있는 이들에게 완벽한 선택이 될 것입니다.

reviews: This is the first review of Surat on this platform, and there's a reason. Don't bother. Surat is dry, dusty, and the air quality is awful (all those wedding fireworks and crematoriums). Sure the internet speed is great, but the housing and food costs are the same as Mumbai, or higher. There is very little to do here, no great cultural sights, no great venues to attend. There is hope, though: Romeo and Juliet (written in 1597) was performed live here for the first time in history in February 2022... way to go Surat!
surat.description:
Surat may not be a common tourist destination, but some visitors find it interesting. The city can feel dry and dusty, especially because of the air quality, which is affected by fireworks and nearby crematoriums. However, if you need fast internet, Surat has it.

The cost of living here can be quite high, similar to that of Mumbai, and the food options are not as varied as one might expect. While you may not find famous landmarks or lively entertainment, there is a strong local life that can be nice if you want to experience everyday Indian culture.

On a positive note, Surat has made progress in the arts, with a successful production of "Romeo and Juliet" being its first live show last year. For those who want to explore the unique aspects of the city, the neighborhoods can be visited to enjoy the local experience, just remember to stay hydrated and take your time while exploring.
surat.description_kor:
수라트는 일반적으로 관광지로 잘 알려져 있지는 않지만, 일부 여행자들에게는 꽤 흥미로운 장소로 여겨집니다. 이 도시는 공기질이 좋지 않아 가끔 건조하고 먼지가 많게 느껴질 수 있으며, 이는 불꽃놀이와 인근 화장터의 영향 때문입니다. 하지만 빠른 인터넷을 이용할 수 있는 점은 큰 장점입니다.

생활비는 뭄바이와 비슷하게 다소 높은 편이며, 음식 선택은 기대보다 다양하지 않을 수 있습니다. 유명한 관광 명소나 활기찬 오락 시설은 없지만, 일상적인 인도 문화를 경험하고 싶다면 탄탄한 현지 생활을 체험할 수 있습니다.

긍정적인 면으로는 수라트가 예술 분야에서도 발전을 이루어, 지난해에는 "로미오와 줄리엣"의 성공적인 공연을 첫 번째 라이브 쇼로 선보였습니다. 수라트의 독특한 매력을 탐험하고 싶다면, 다양한 지역 이웃들을 방문해 현지 분위기를 만끽해 보세요. 이때 충분한 수분을 섭취하고 여유를 가지는 것도 잊지 마세요.

reviews: Depending where you are, Surrey is either a suburban wasteland or a crime-ridden narco-city. Stay in Vancouver or Burnaby if you really have to.
surrey.description:
Surrey has a varied reputation among visitors and locals. Depending on where you are, some might find it a quiet suburb with less activity, while others might mention safety concerns. But don't let that stop you from visiting!

This city has some nice parks and community events that show local culture. The cost of living is usually lower than in nearby Vancouver, which can attract families and individuals looking for cheaper housing. Just remember that transportation options might be limited, so having a car could be useful.

When it comes to neighborhoods, places like South Surrey are often seen as calmer and good for families. However, it's wise to be careful and do some research when looking around! Enjoying outdoor activities like hiking in the nearby parks can be a good way to see what this area has to offer, so be sure to check those out. Overall, Surrey has its ups and downs, but there are some great spots to find if you are ready to look!
surrey.description_kor:
써리(Surrey)는 방문객들과 지역 주민들 사이에서 다양한 평가를 받고 있습니다. 위치에 따라 어떤 사람들은 이곳을 조용한 교외 지역으로 여기는 반면, 누군가는 안전 문제를 언급하기도 합니다. 하지만 이러한 이유 때문에 방문을 주저하지 마세요!

이 도시는 지역 문화를 담은 아름다운 공원과 다양한 커뮤니티 행사가 많이 열립니다. 생활비가 인근 밴쿠버보다 상대적으로 저렴해 저렴한 주택을 찾는 가족이나 개인에게 매력적인 곳입니다. 다만, 교통 수단이 제한적일 수 있으니 자동차를 소유하는 것이 유리할 수 있다는 점을 유념하세요.

동네에 관해서는, 서쪽 써리(South Surrey) 지역은 일반적으로 더 조용하고 가족 친화적인 곳으로 알려져 있습니다. 그렇지만 주변 환경을 잘 살펴보고 신중하게 조사하는 것이 중요합니다! 가까운 공원에서 하이킹 같은 야외 활동을 즐기는 것은 이 지역의 매력을 경험하는 좋은 방법이니 꼭 한 번 해보세요. 전반적으로 써리는 장단점이 있지만, 관심을 가지고 살펴보면 충분히 멋진 장소들을 발견할 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews:
Okay so this is coming from a person born and raised in Szczecin:

Pros:
- cheap
- decent public transport
- bolt and uber
- clean and safe (for the most part)
- I find it beautiful
- close to, and well communicated with Berlin and its airport (with buses and trains)
- close enough to the sea to go on weekend trips
- other pros generally applicable to Poland - decent level of english, not 3rd level world healthcare, beautiful girls

Cons:
- literally 2 co-working spaces + a few cafes to work from (honourable mention: Corona Coffee)
- boring asf, nothing is happening during the week and it's also pretty empty on the weekends, literally 2 spots to hang around (Deptak Bogusława and Bulwary [this one only during summer, and you will see a lot of drunk teenagers but it's not bad]) 
- no nomads and very limited amount foreigners, it's Szczecin not warszawa
- the 'Szczecin' airport is pretty far away and domestic flights are expensive in general (flight to warsaw is around 300-500PLN one way)

It's a decent base to come back to in between trips, and also pretty nice to come and see but I'd not stay here for long as a nomad.
szczecin.description:
Szczecin may not be the largest city in Poland, but it has its own appeal and a special atmosphere that many enjoy. Located near the German border, it’s a good starting point for trips to Berlin and the sea, making it nice for weekend trips. The city is known for being affordable, with a good public transport system and services like Uber that make getting around easy. When you are out, you'll find Szczecin to be clean and mostly safe, with nice parks and interesting sites.

However, keep in mind that the nightlife can be a bit quiet during the week, and weekends are often calm – there are only a few popular places like Deptak Bogusława and Bulwary, where you might find some local activity. While many people speak English, you might notice that the city does not have a large foreign community, which can feel lonely.

For remote workers, options are few; there are only a couple of co-working spaces. Overall, Szczecin is a nice place to explore and relax, but it might not have the busy atmosphere that some travelers want!
szczecin.description_kor:
슈체친(Szczecin)은 폴란드에서 가장 큰 도시는 아니지만, 많은 이들에게 사랑받는 매력과 독특한 분위기를 지니고 있습니다. 독일 국경 근처에 위치하고 있어, 베를린과 바다로의 여행을 위한 훌륭한 출발점이 되어 주말 여행지로 안성맞춤입니다. 이 도시는 비용이 저렴하고, 편리한 대중교통 시스템과 우버와 같은 이동 서비스 덕분에 쉽게 다닐 수 있습니다. 외출하면 슈체친은 깨끗하고 대체로 안전하며, 아름다운 공원과 흥미로운 명소들이 가득합니다.

하지만 주중에는 밤문화가 다소 조용할 수 있으며, 주말에도 한산할 때가 많습니다. 지역에서 활동할 수 있는 몇몇 인기 명소로는 Deptak Bogusława와 Bulwary 등이 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 영어를 구사하지만, 대규모 외국인 커뮤니티가 없기 때문에 외로움을 느낄 수도 있습니다.

원격 근무자에게는 선택할 수 있는 공간이 거의 없고, 협업 공간도 몇 곳에 불과합니다. 전반적으로 슈체친은 탐험과 휴식에 좋은 장소이지만, 바쁜 분위기를 원하는 여행자들에게는 아쉬움이 남을 수도 있습니다!

reviews: Here nearly a week and feeling like I'm only just finding my feet and wish I had come here sooner. Tiny place that revolves around surfing and skateboarding (fishing isn't as prevalent as I was expecting and much less compared to Essaouira). It's also not as 'sleepy' as everyone describes and not as cheap. Everyone knows each other and it's easy to dig into berber culture. Start with the taxi rank manager and ask about pretty much anything. Moroccan's love to help. You'll be sold weed every 10 meters, make of that what you will. Best things to do here are eat, surf and relax. Seems like a lot of construction and investment is going into this place so catch it while it's 'quiet'. I'd avoid staying on the main street as it's loud pretty much all the time with dogs barking, cats fighting, etc. I found Booking (website) to be the cheapest accommodation but nothing beats landing and getting stuck in to find a place for even cheaper. There is no bank machine in Taghazout. One in the Radisson nearby (when it works) and the next closest is Tamraght (I found one that doesn't charge). Sunny and chill. Fun if you like surfing and relaxing on the beach.

Just got here, it's busy summer season with lots of Moroccon tourists and some free Berber concerts! In about ten days it will quit down as people return 
to work and school. 
Overall I'm enjoying the vibe and Internet is good. I read they fixed the sewage problem that other reviewers have mentioned. I will post another review after a few weeks.

I was speaking to a local and he said rent for a basic apartment is max $300 and you can purchase one for about 25k (60 sq meters two bedroom)

Well. Stayed 3 days close to the beach. Last day on the toilet and 2 days in the bed at home (Czech Rep.). Cought the famous disease from water probably. So my review is probably not objective :-). My nomadic experience about Morroco however is quite poor. Dirty, uncertain, you can't believe anyone, not feeling safe at all ... I am maybe too old for this kind of adventure :-)

Hope you like dirty, overcrowded beaches and cockroaches. My apartment was swamped by roaches after sewage works in the street a few days prior. Unfortunately I fell for the hype and paid for it. Could be a decent nomad place, but definitely far from it in my experience.

This is a very laidback fisher village. Compared to the crowded places in Agadir and Marrakech this town is way better. There is good and cheap food and also modern hostels and co-working spaces. If you are into surfing this place is also paradise, for advanced surfers 'Boilers' is the place to go.
taghazout.description:
Taghazout is a small coastal town that is popular for surfers and those looking to relax. It has a calm atmosphere, with people surfing and enjoying the sun. The town mainly focuses on surfing and skateboarding, so bring your board and join in! The local community is friendly and willing to share their Berber culture.

While Taghazout is generally relaxed, it can become busy in the summer with many tourists. If you prefer quiet walks by the beach, visiting in the off-peak months may be better. Some visitors have mentioned issues like crowded areas, noise from nearby streets, and cleanliness problems.

You should be ready for limited public transport and some language difficulties. There aren’t many ATMs; there is only one near the Radisson. Accommodation is affordable, especially for longer stays. There are tasty food options available, and you can enjoy free Berber concerts during busy times. Just be careful about where you stay if noise and cleanliness are important to you. Overall, if you like surfing and a relaxed beach atmosphere, Taghazout could be a great choice!
taghazout.description_kor:
타가즈우트는 서핑과 휴식을 즐기고자 하는 사람들에게 인기 있는 작은 해안 마을입니다. 이곳은 한적한 분위기로, 많은 사람들이 서핑을 하거나 햇살을 만끽하고 있습니다. 서핑과 스케이트보드가 주된 취미인 만큼 보드를 챙겨 함께 즐겨보세요! 지역 주민들은 친절하며, 베르베르 문화를 나누는 데 열려 있습니다.

타가즈우트는 대체로 느긋한 분위기를 자랑하지만, 여름에는 관광객들로 북적일 수 있습니다. 조용한 해변 산책을 원하신다면 비혼잡 시기에 방문하는 게 좋습니다. 일부 방문객들은 번잡한 지역, 인근 거리의 소음, 청결 문제 등을 지적하기도 했습니다.

대중교통은 다소 제한적이며, 언어 장벽도 있을 수 있으니 사전에 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. ATM도 많지 않아서 라디슨 호텔 근처에 위치한 하나가 유일합니다. 숙박 시설은 가격이 저렴해 장기 체류에 특히 유리합니다. 맛있는 음식 옵션도 다양하며, 바쁜 시즌에는 무료 베르베르 공연도 즐길 수 있습니다. 소음이나 청결이 문제가 된다면 숙소 선택 시 주의가 필요합니다. 전반적으로 서핑과 편안한 해변 분위기를 좋아하신다면, 타가즈우트는 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews: The Middle Ages meet industrial-age pollution: this is a grimy tropical backwater with none of Taipei's vibrancy, efficiency or even politeness. Cycle or hike in the quote-unquote national park north of the city for marshes, dengue fever, junkyards, stray dogs, and massive concrete jetties obstructing ocean views.
Tainan is cheaper than Kaohsiung by a fair bit, not sure why it's being reported as costing more per month
tainan.description:
Tainan has a different feel compared to its busy neighbor, Taipei. You can walk through old streets full of history, but also see the less clean side of tropical living. Some visitors think the city is a bit rough, with pollution and stray dogs, but it has its own special character.

One of the best parts of Tainan is its culture, with nice temples and historical places that show its past. The cost of living is lower, so travelers can enjoy local food and street food without spending too much. You can easily ride a bike or hike in the nearby national parks, but be careful of dengue fever—taking some precautions is important.

While public transportation may not be very efficient, you can still get around. Be ready for some language issues; knowing a few basic Mandarin phrases can help. Overall, Tainan is an interesting mix of history and adventure, waiting to be discovered!
tainan.description_kor:
타이난은 바쁜 이웃 도시인 타이페이에 비해 색다른 매력을 지니고 있습니다. 역사적인 거리들을 걸으며 과거의 흔적을 느낄 수 있지만, 열대 지역 특유의 덜 깨끗한 면모도 엿보입니다. 일부 방문객들은 이 도시의 오염이나 유기견 때문에 다소 거칠게 느낄 수 있지만, 타이난만의 독특한 매력을 분명히 지니고 있습니다.

타이난의 가장 큰 장점 중 하나는 풍부한 문화입니다. 아름다운 사원과 역사적인 명소들이 과거의 이야기를 전해줍니다. 생활비가 비교적 저렴해 여행자들은 큰 비용 부담 없이 지역 음식이나 길거리 음식을 마음껏 즐길 수 있습니다. 자전거를 타거나 인근 국립공원에서 하이킹을 쉽게 할 수 있지만, 뎅기열에 대한 예방이 필요하니 주의해야 합니다. 이를 위해 사전 예방 조치를 취하는 것이 중요합니다.

대중교통이 항상 효율적이지는 않지만, 이동은 가능하니 걱정하지 않아도 됩니다. 언어 장벽도 감안해야 하며, 기본적인 중국어 문구 몇 가지를 익혀 두면 유용할 것입니다. 전반적으로 타이난은 역사와 모험이 조화를 이루는 흥미로운 곳으로, 방문객들의 탐험을 기다리고 있습니다!

reviews: I have visited Tallahassee several times over the past few years. I agree that it doesn't feel particularly safe - even in areas that appear "safe". I felt particularly unsafe at gas stations and, as a woman, would not stop for gas by myself in Tallahassee. I loved the Tallahassee Nature Museum, which I did feel safe visiting by myself. They also have ziplining there, which was a dream - up above the cypress swamp! I loved the fact that there were so many nature parks, bird sanctuaries and places to go canoeing and kayaking within an easy drive of this city. FSU has an outstanding law school, but the university is located in an area that is particularly unsafe. I also noticed a definite "redneck" presence in other areas of the city.
Definitely not a safe city. There are some clusters of safe-ish areas but overall not very safe.
tallahassee.description:
Tallahassee is a mix of nature and college life that gives a special feel to Florida’s capital. Visitors enjoy outdoor activities like canoeing and kayaking in nearby parks and nature areas. The Tallahassee Nature Museum is very popular – ziplining over the cypress swamps is a memorable experience! However, it's important to be careful, especially at night or at gas stations, as safety can be an issue in some places.

The city is home to Florida State University, which brings a youthful energy, but some visitors have mentioned that some neighborhoods can feel unsafe.
