The warm weather from spring to fall makes it a great place to visit, especially for beach fans and those looking for low-cost living—around $600-$700 a month for a decent apartment and daily meals.

While Varna has many positive aspects, there are some things to note. Public transportation can be difficult, with no ride-hailing apps and limited bus information, but most places are easy to walk to. The nightlife includes some bars that may not be for everyone, but there are a few good spots like Cubo, where you can enjoy drinks for a reasonable price.

The city's buildings and museums add some cultural interest, but the hipster scene may not be very active. If you plan to visit, spring or summer is the best time to see everything Varna has to offer!
varna.description_kor:
바르나(Varna)는 흑해 해안에 위치한 매력적인 관광 도시로, 다양한 즐길 거리와 볼거리가 가득합니다. 산책로를 따라 걸으며 친절한 사람들과 맛있는 음식들로 가득한 활기찬 분위기를 느끼고, 아름다운 해변 풍경을 감상할 수 있습니다. 특히 봄부터 가을까지 따뜻한 날씨 덕분에 해변을 사랑하는 여행객들과 저렴한 생활비를 원하는 이들에게 안성맞춤인 장소입니다. 일반적인 아파트와 하루 식사를 포함해 한 달에 약 600~700달러 정도면 충분합니다.

바르나에는 긍정적인 점이 많지만 유의할 점도 있습니다. 대중교통이 다소 불편하고, 호출 택시 앱이 없으며, 버스 정보도 제한적이지만, 대부분의 지역은 도보로 쉽게 이동할 수 있습니다. nightlife은 모든 사람에게 맞지는 않을 수 있는 몇몇 바가 있지만, 합리적인 가격에 음료를 즐길 수 있는 Cubo와 같은 좋은 장소도 있습니다.

이 도시의 건물과 박물관은 문화적인 흥미를 더하지만, 힙스터 문화는 그리 활발하지 않을 수 있습니다. 만약 바르나를 방문할 계획이라면, 봄이나 여름이 이곳의 매력을 최대한 즐기기에 가장 좋은 시기입니다!

reviews: Great for a visit. Beautiful scenery. Good food. I thought it would be great to live here, start a startup and be in the same time zone as SF, close to Seattle, etc. But compared to Vancouver in 2009, one big change that totally ruined it for me: Absolute zombie apocalypse of drug addicts and shouting/violent home less people. It was shockingly bad. The locals often visibly carry naxalone (anti-overdose medicine, I learned) because there are so many people overdosing in the street. Police were nowhere to be seen. Such a shame, I would have loved to live in this beautiful city otherwise.

Reviewing from permanent resident perspective. Excellent place to be if you have young kids; tons of parks, playgrounds, activities, and family-oriented. 

I can see how it wouldn't appeal much to single long-stay visitors. I call it "Singaportland" when trying to describe the vibe to remote colleagues. Clean, safe, orderly, but a bit constructed. You pay a serious CoL tax for the perks. Zero appeal for Chiang-Mai-nomad types, based on pricing and culture.

I think the reviews here a bit overly negative. It's true it's a city with a not of nightlife or activity, but that's not why people move to Vancouver. You move to Vancouver if you want a relaxed lifestyle with beautiful nature and access to the outdoors, fresh air, and a good climate (by Canadian standards), without having to give up on the comforts of a city-lifestyle. 

While it's expensive, you mostly get quality. My rental is not that much more expensive than I paid in many european cities, yet I get a completely modern flat with mountain views, and countless amenities (gym, pool, sauna). It's true Vancouver housing is expensive, but usually it's very high quality. For food, Vancouver has some of the best selection of asian cuisine you can find, and the prices are quite reasonable imo. 
If you want a nightlife oriented life, or a crazy vibrant urban experience, you won't find it in Vancouver. If you want a calm base in one of the most naturally beautiful regions in the world, and are willing to spend a bit of money for it, then Vancouver is a good fit. I've lived in 10+ cities and Vanouver may be my favorite, although it's true it's not for everyone.

Read the review that starts "I live here and I can tell you that many of the stats listed are wrong" - its spot on accurate
I will add to that - Vancouver is brain-numbingly boring and dead. There is noticeable and toxic mix of pedestrians, cyclists and car drivers. Mix in a very Vancouver trait of entitlement, and watch the the passive aggression fly. 
Vancouverites generally are a cold bunch making it difficult for newcomers. Worst of all they believe in their own created hype that live in the best world-class city. It does get annoying.
Pretty, yes, in places, good mountains, excellent outdoors. Beyond that, dead!

I live here and I can tell you that many of the stats listed are wrong. Getting an edible dinner for $10 is an utter fantasy. Typically that's what you pay for an appetizer. A 1-bdr in the city centre will cost you at least $1600 but probably more like $2000+ and chances are it will be a hell-hole at those prices. The night life is indeed terrible here. The saving grace is that there's dozens of micro-brewery pubs with very interesting beer very close to the city centre. But they're legally required to close at 23:00 and after that your options are mostly trash unless you happen to have insider knowledge about arty happenings. Most of the night life is so bad that it will make you feel like a tourist even if you're a local.
There is no Uber or ride-sharing of any kind here, the taxi lobby is far too strong. 
Tipping? Absolutely yes, minimum 15%! People that work in restaurants here cannot survive on their meagre wages. 
A really important thing to know is that listed prices here never include tax, so everything costs 12% more than you thought it would -- and at a restaurant your cost including taxes and tip will be at least 30% more than what you see on the menu. 
Don't come here unless you're looking for a quiet retirement. Go to Seoul or Berlin or Montreal instead. It will be cheaper, more social, more cultured, more fun, and there will be a lot more to do.

There is a new coworking space called FreeSpace that is only $49.99 per month and offers access to all three locations (Kits, Chinatown, Yaletown). The way it works is FreeSpace partners with local restaurants that are only open in the evenings and transforms them into unique, comfortable and affordable drop in coworking spaces during the day while the restaurant is closed. The don't have private boardrooms or phone booths for confidential exchanges, but they do have free coffee, outlets at every seat, and super fast Wifi (300mbps- I was surprised!). It doesn't have all of the bells and whistles that a lot of other coworking spaces available but if you are just looking for somewhere to stop in, grab a coffee, and get to work, this is an excellent alternative at a fraction of the cost. Check it out www.thisfreespace.com
vancouver.description:
Vancouver is a city that stands out because of its nice views and clean air. Imagine living near mountains with parks, great for families with children who can enjoy playgrounds and activities. The food options are good too, especially for those who like Asian food; there are many tasty choices at fair prices.

However, like any place, Vancouver has its advantages and disadvantages. The cost of living can be high, but many people appreciate the good housing quality — you may pay more, but often you get a modern apartment with a view. On the other hand, some visitors and residents have seen problems like homelessness and safety issues, which can be surprising.

The public transport system is not as strong as in other cities, and the nightlife is not very active — many locals say it is quiet and a bit dull. If you want adventure and excitement, this might not be the best place for you. But if you want a calm atmosphere in a beautiful natural setting, Vancouver could be a good fit.

In short, it’s a good place for nature lovers and families, but if you want busy nightlife or a simple city experience, you may want to think again. Knowing a little about the area helps a lot in this nice city!
vancouver.description_kor:
밴쿠버는 뛰어난 경치와 맑은 공기로 유명한 매력적인 도시입니다. 공원이 가까운 산 근처에서의 삶을 상상해 보세요. 어린 자녀를 둔 가족들에게는 놀이터와 다양한 활동이 마련된 훌륭한 장소입니다. 음식 선택의 폭도 넓고, 특히 아시아 음식을 좋아하는 사람들에게는 맛있는 요리를 적정한 가격에 즐길 수 있습니다.

하지만 모든 도시가 그렇듯이 밴쿠버에도 장단점이 존재합니다. 생활비가 꽤 높은 편이지만, 많은 사람들은 양질의 주택을 중요하게 생각합니다. 다소 비싼 비용을 감수하더라도 종종 전망이 좋은 현대식 아파트를 구할 수 있는 기회가 있습니다. 반면에, 일부 방문객이나 주민들은 노숙자 문제나 안전 문제를 경험하기도 하며, 이는 다소 충격적일 수 있습니다.

또한 대중교통 시스템은 타 도시들에 비해 강력하지 않고, 밤문화도 그리 활발하지 않습니다. 많은 현지인들은 다소 조용하고 지루함을 느끼기도 합니다. 만약 모험과 자극을 원한다면, 밴쿠버가 최적의 장소는 아닐 수 있습니다. 그러나 아름다운 자연 속에서 차분한 분위기를 즐기고 싶다면, 밴쿠버는 훌륭한 선택이 될 수 있습니다.

요약하자면, 자연을 좋아하고 가족 친화적인 환경을 추구하는 분들께는 적합한 도시지만, 활기찬 밤문화나 도시 생활을 원한다면 다시 생각해 볼 필요가 있습니다. 이 매력적인 도시에 대한 이해가 도움이 될 것입니다!

reviews: Completely disagree with reviews saying it is unsafe for women. Moved here on my own to live for a few months and have felt completely safe however it is extremely expensive, you pay for the beautiful surroundings and unique one off stores, resturants and experiences.
Very active and tight tech scene , good weather , walkable , close to nature , underrated spot for sure
victoria.description:
Victoria, Canada, is a nice place on Vancouver Island that many people enjoy. With its pretty views and lively culture, it's not surprising that visitors like the area. You will find local shops and different restaurants that show the city's character, but be aware that the cost of living is higher – you are paying for the nice scenery!

Safety is often talked about, but many locals and visitors say that walking around the city is safe, even for women on their own. The city also has a growing tech scene, making it an active place for new ideas. With good weather most of the year and being close to nature, it’s easy to stay active and enjoy being outside.

However, it's good to know that public transportation can be somewhat limited, so having a car might be easier. When you visit, be sure to check out different neighborhoods, learn about local customs, and enjoy all the little finds this city has to offer. So put on your walking shoes and get ready to enjoy Victoria!
victoria.description_kor:
캐나다 빅토리아는 많은 사람들에게 사랑받는 아름다운 도시로, 밴쿠버 섬에 위치해 있습니다. 환상적인 경치와 활기찬 문화 덕분에 이곳을 방문하는 이들이 많습니다. 도심 곳곳에는 지역의 특색을 살린 상점과 다양한 레스토랑들이 즐비해 있어, 먹거리와 쇼핑을 동시에 즐길 수 있습니다. 단, 생활비가 다소 높다는 점은 미리 알고 접근해야 합니다. 아름다운 풍경을 즐기기 위해서는 적당한 비용을 지불해야 합니다!

안전 문제에 대한 이야기가 자주 나오지만, 많은 주민들과 관광객들은 여성 혼자서도 도시를 자유롭게 걸을 수 있다고 말합니다. 빅토리아는 또한 빠르게 성장하는 기술 산업이 있어, 다양한 혁신과 아이디어가 활발히 이루어지고 있는 곳입니다. 대부분의 시기에 온화한 날씨와 자연과의 밀접한 연관 덕분에 외부 활동을 즐기기에는 최적의 장소입니다.

하지만 대중교통이 제약을 받을 수 있으니, 자동차를 소유하는 것이 보다 편리할 수 있습니다. 방문하실 때는 다양한 동네를 탐험하고 지역 문화를 경험하며 빅토리아가 선사하는 작은 발견들을 만나는 것을 잊지 마세요. 그러니 편안한 신발을 신고 빅토리아 탐방을 준비해보세요!

reviews: Very beautiful and atmospheric city, but firstly it's very expensive to stay in Venice itself (even in winter, I thought rent prices are on the level with Zurich lol) so many people rent a place/hostel in Mestre, it's like 10 minutes train ride to Venice, kinda smarter. And after a while navigating the city which is literally a maze becomes quite old. Recommend to visit Murano by the way.
venice.description:
Venice has canals and bridges that make it feel like a story from a book. However, staying in Venice can be expensive, similar to prices in Zurich. Many visitors choose to stay in Mestre, which is a short train ride away, to save money while still being near the main attractions.

Getting around Venice can be tricky; the streets and alleys can be hard to navigate at first. But once you understand it, you will find interesting places everywhere. Be sure to visit Murano, known for its glasswork—it’s a must-see!

While Venice is generally safe, it's still good to pay attention to your surroundings, especially in busy areas. If you're planning a visit, try to go during less crowded times to enjoy the city more. Don’t forget your comfortable shoes—there is a lot to see!
venice.description_kor:
베네치아에는 마치 동화 속에 나올 법한 운하와 다리가 있습니다. 그러나 베네치아에 머무는 것은 취리히처럼 비용이 꽤 들 수 있습니다. 그래서 많은 여행객들이 주요 관광지와 가까우면서도 비용을 절약할 수 있는 메스트레에서 지내기를 선호합니다. 

베네치아 내에서 이동하는 것은 다소 까다로울 수 있습니다. 처음에는 거리와 골목들이 헷갈릴 수 있지만, 한 번 익숙해지면 흥미로운 장소들이 곳곳에 숨어 있는 걸 발견하게 될 것입니다. 꼭 가봐야 할 곳 중 하나는 유리 공예로 유명한 무라노입니다. 

베네치아는 일반적으로 안전하지만, 특히 혼잡한 지역에서는 주변을 돌아보는 것이 중요합니다. 방문 계획을 할 때는 조금 덜 붐비는 시간에 가면 더 여유롭게 도시를 즐길 수 있습니다. 그리고 많이 걸어야 하니 편한 신발도 꼭 챙기세요—볼거리가 정말 많습니다!

reviews: Cool spot but definitely a touristy town. A lot of places to eat, work from, with (reliable) wifi basically everywhere. Not a lot of english speaking so it can get lonely if you don't speak Spanish! Also great beaches
vina-del-mar.description:
Vina del Mar is a busy place in Chile that feels very much like a tourist spot. It is known for its beautiful beaches that attract sunbathers and surfers, making it a good place to relax or surf. The city has many restaurants, so you will have many options for eating. Also, with good Wi-Fi almost everywhere, it is nice for those who want to work while having fun.

While the atmosphere is usually friendly and welcoming, it is important to know that English is not commonly spoken here. This might lead to some feelings of loneliness if you don’t speak Spanish. The cost of living is not the lowest, but you can find many ways to enjoy the town on a budget, especially if you visit local markets.

For a look at local life, don’t miss the nice coastal walks. Just remember to bring sunscreen, learn a few basic Spanish phrases, and you will have a great time!
vina-del-mar.description_kor:
비냐 델 마르는 칠레의 활기찬 관광지로, 해수욕객과 서퍼들을 끌어들이는 아름다운 해변이 유명합니다. 이곳은 휴식이나 서핑을 즐기기에 안성맞춤인 장소입니다. 도시에는 다양한 식사를 즐길 수 있는 많은 식당이 있으며, 거의 모든 곳에서 좋은 Wi-Fi가 제공되어 일과 여가를 동시에 즐기고 싶은 분들께 적합한 환경입니다.

일반적으로 친근하고 환영받는 분위기지만, 영어가 널리 통용되지 않는 점은 유의해야 합니다. 스페인어를 잘 못하면 외로움을 느낄 수 있습니다. 생활비는 매우 저렴하진 않지만, 특히 현지 시장을 방문하면 예산에 맞는 다양한 즐길 거리를 찾을 수 있습니다.

현지 생활을 체험하고 싶다면 멋진 해안 산책을 꼭 놓치지 마세요. 선크림을 챙기고 기본적인 스페인어 구문을 익힌다면, 더욱 멋진 시간을 보낼 수 있을 것입니다!

reviews: Young and cheap city. Most people can communicate in english. Locals are warmer than in other baltic countries but don't expect to make many local friends. Many foreigners thanks to the university.

Nothing to amazing about this city. It is cheaper and the locals can be friendly out of curiosity but most European cities are like this way. As always there is the language barrier but besides that it is just your average Baltic European city with its unique cuisine. Not too bad not too amazing.
It's very fun and green city in summer and quite dark and cold during winter time. Old town is beautiful and cozy, fast internet, few coworking spots.
vilnius.description:
Vilnius is a mix of history and modern life, good for young travelers and people on a budget. The city looks nice in summer with its green areas and pleasant Old Town, which is nice to walk through. You can find fast internet and some coworking spaces that make it good for digital nomads too. English is commonly spoken, so getting around is not too hard, though you may face some language issues.

Local people are generally friendly, even if they are busy. It’s a good place to try some Lithuanian food, but don’t expect anything too special; it’s more of a typical Baltic city experience.

Keep in mind that winters can be dark and cold, so be ready for that! While prices are lower than in many European cities, you can still find some good places worth spending on. Overall, Vilnius offers a relaxed environment that is worth visiting, just don’t expect anything too fancy!
vilnius.description_kor:
빌뉴스는 역사와 현대 생활이 조화를 이루는 매력적인 도시로, 젊은 여행자와 예산이 한정된 여행객에게 적합한 곳입니다. 여름철에는 도시의 아름다운 녹지와 쾌적한 구시가지 덕분에 걷기 좋은 환경을 제공합니다. 뿐만 아니라, 빠른 인터넷과 디지털 노마드를 위한 협업 공간도 되어 있어 매우 편리하죠. 영어가 널리 통용되기 때문에 이동하는 데 큰 어려움은 없지만, 가끔 언어 장벽이 있을 수 있습니다.

현지 사람들은 대체로 친절하고, 아무리 바빠도 친근하게 인사를 건네는 모습이 인상적입니다. 리투아니아 전통 음식을 맛보기에 좋은 장소들이 많지만, 너무 특별한 맛을 기대하진 않는 것이 좋습니다. 전형적인 발틱 도시의 매력을 느낄 수 있습니다.

겨울철에는 어둡고 추운 날씨가 지속되니, 그에 대한 준비가 필요합니다! 많은 유럽 도시들에 비해 가격이 저렴하지만, 여전히 만족스러운 소비를 할 수 있는 곳들이 있습니다. 전반적으로 빌뉴스는 방문할 만한 가치가 있는 편안한 환경을 제공하며, 너무 화려한 경험은 기대하지 않는 게 좋습니다!

reviews:
I'd skip Vientiane if I was you. It's mostly for Chinese business people. But there's not much to see or do there. We visited the unexploded bomb museum, which was interesting but tiny. There's some French cafes and massage places. But everything is quite basic. I'd just go straight to Laung Prabang if you want to see more of Laos. Or Vang Vieng if you want to party. 

Vientiane wasn't very remote worker suitable either, just like entire Laos. Internet is slow and if it's not slow it's unstable and cuts out. Food ingredient quality seems very low but you pay the same price as in Thailand for worse.

Laotian people are REALLY friendly though and their English is much much better than Thai people.

LPB is a beautiful small city (could even call it a town) but is more of a backpacker hub than DN destination. It's quite small, and you can really explore all of it within a few hours.

Probably the most expensive area in Laos, but's still decently priced despite being a heavily tourist based. Room at guest house $20-25, meal + drink in main street sitdown resturaunt for $7-10.

But again, this is a backpacker area. Most remote workers huddle between 4 cafes with air conditioning.

If you have a reason to be here, it's beautiful. But if not, a week is probably the max here.

it’s less developed than Chiang Mai or another provincial Thai city, but accommodation and restaurants prices like in the centre of Bangkok. I don’t think it’s worth to visit this place more then 1 time for tourist purpose. Maybe 0 times is enough too.
vientiane.description:
Vientiane, the capital of Laos, is a small city with a relaxed atmosphere. It is good for those who prefer a quiet place, but do not expect a busy city. Some visitors think there is not much to do—main attractions like the UNexploded Bomb Museum and a few French cafes can be seen quickly. While there are some activities, many suggest going to Luang Prabang for a better experience.

Living here can be mixed. The cost of living is relatively high for Laos; you might find guesthouse prices similar to those in larger Thai cities. The internet can be slow and sometimes not very reliable, which is not ideal for remote work. But don’t let that stop you—the locals are very friendly and often speak better English than in nearby countries.

For those thinking about a visit, you can enjoy good meals for about $7-10 and find comfortable places to stay. Just remember that a week might be too long unless you have a specific reason to stay. Feel free to explore, but remember there are more interesting places in Laos waiting for you!
vientiane.description_kor:
비엔티안(라오스의 수도)은 여유로운 분위기가 느껴지는 작은 도시입니다. 조용한 환경을 선호하는 분들께는 좋은 선택이지만, 바쁜 도시를 기대하시는 분들은 실망할 수도 있습니다. 일부 방문객들은 할 일이 많지 않다고 생각할 수 있는데, UN 폭발물 박물관이나 몇몇 프랑스 카페와 같은 주요 명소는 금세 둘러볼 수 있습니다. 몇 가지 활동은 있지만, 많은 사람들이 더 다양한 경험을 위해 루앙프라방으로 가는 것을 추천합니다.

이곳에서의 생활은 복합적인 면이 있습니다. 물가가 라오스의 다른 지역에 비해 상대적으로 높아서 게스트하우스 가격이 태국의 큰 도시들과 비슷할 수 있습니다. 또한 인터넷 속도가 느리거나 가끔 신뢰도가 떨어질 수 있어 원격 근무에는 적합하지 않을 수 있습니다. 하지만 이런 점에 낙담하지 마세요. 지역 주민들은 매우 친절하고, 종종 이웃 나라들보다 영어를 더 잘 구사합니다.

방문을 고려하시는 분들은 약 7-10달러에 훌륭한 식사를 즐길 수 있으며, 편안한 숙소를 찾는 것도 가능합니다. 특별한 이유가 없다면 일주일이 다소 길게 느껴질 수 있다는 점만 염두에 두세요. 마음껏 탐험해 보시고, 라오스에는 여러분을 기다리는 더 흥미로운 장소들이 있다는 것을 잊지 마세요!

reviews:
Vizag is an emotion to all the vizagities. 
One of the best places to live in the country. 
People are friendly, Cost of living is fine. 
You will get the best food in restaurants as well as streets.
Internet and mobile recharge are also cheap in India because of JIO.
Cloths you will be getting branded as well as normal with the best prices all over the city.
Places to visit are a lot, can't tell one name because every place to be visited.
The city is very neat and clean.
Night outs are allowed unless you don't drink and drive on the road. If any police caught you they would leave you with the punishment of a fine.
Please follow the rules when you visit.
Devotional places are very good like Simhachalam, Kanaka Maha Lakshmi temple etc

Very Friendly People, it is called city of Destination. Pleasant Beaches and Hills all around city are the main assets of Vizag Beauty. Night life is cool, can have pleasant walk in beach road and have best food all around. Traffic friendly, lush greenery and good developed parks everywhere. People can also make some Investments in terms of Property.
visakhapatnam.description:
Vizag, or Visakhapatnam, is a nice place on India’s east coast, liked by everyone who lives there. It is seen as one of the best places to live because of its friendly people and reasonable cost of living. Whether you are trying street food or eating at local restaurants, the food here is very good.

The city has not only good food but also nice beaches and green hills. For some culture, visit the important temples like Simhachalam and Kanaka Maha Lakshmi. People who enjoy nature will like the clean parks and green areas in the city.

The nightlife is active, but it is important to stay safe—follow the rules, especially if you go for a walk at night along the beach road. Public transport is satisfactory, but knowing some local words could be useful for communication. With so much to enjoy and a welcoming atmosphere, Vizag makes you feel at home.
visakhapatnam.description_kor:
비자크(Vizag) 또는 비사카파트남(Visakhapatnam)은 인도 동부 해안에 위치한 아름다운 도시로, 이곳에 사는 모든 사람들에게 사랑받고 있습니다. 친절한 주민들과 합리적인 생활비 덕분에 이곳은 매우 살기 좋은 곳으로 알려져 있습니다. 거리 음식이나 지역 식당에서의 다양한 요리를 즐겨보시면, 이곳의 음식이 정말 맛있다는 것을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다.

이 도시는 맛있는 음식뿐만 아니라 아름다운 해변과 푸른 언덕도 자랑합니다. 문화 체험을 원하신다면 심하찰람(Simhachalam) 사원이나 카나카 마하 락슈미(Kanaka Maha Lakshmi) 사원을 방문해보는 것을 추천합니다. 자연을 사랑하는 분들은 도시의 깨끗한 공원과 푸르른 공간에서 편안함을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다.

야경 역시 활기차고 매력적이지만, 안전을 위해 주의하는 것이 중요합니다. 특히 밤에 해변 도로를 걷는 경우에는 반드시 규칙을 잘 지켜야 합니다. 대중교통은 비교적 편리하지만, 몇 가지 지역 언어를 알고 있으면 의사소통에 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 다양한 즐길 거리와 따뜻한 환대가 가득한 비자크에서 당신은 집에 있는 듯한 편안한 기분을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다.

reviews: Best Coffee shop international vibe to work from in Virginia Beach / Norfolk area is Cafe Stella at 1907 Colonia Ave. (there are 2 locations, this is the good one). Outdoor seating, live jazz some nights.

Safe and clean. Typical peak tourist season in the summer. Some fun events during the year like the Neptune festival, sandcastle and jet ski competition. This is not your funky beach community vibe, but more of a planned commercial district. Restaurants are average and the surf fishing can be great. Norfolk International Airport is close but usually a bit more expensive flights than say BWI. Just north of VA Beach you can cross the modern marvel bay bridge tunnel and travel back in time 50 years to Cape Charles which is a quaint beach town on the Eastern Shore of Virginia. South of VA Beach you could also find Sandbridge which is like what Corolla or Duck, North Carolina use to like before the tourists discovered them.
virginia-beach.description:
Virginia Beach has a mix of coastal appeal and planned features. If you want a place to enjoy coffee, Cafe Stella is a good choice. It has outdoor seating and live jazz on some nights, making it a nice spot to relax. The city is lively in the summer, especially with events like the Neptune Festival and sandcastle contests that attract visitors.

Some people think the city feels more commercial than a typical beach town, but it is safe and clean. The local restaurants might not be amazing, but they will satisfy your needs, and if you like fishing, the surf fishing can be rewarding.

Remember that during the busy tourist season, things can get crowded, and flights from Norfolk International may be more expensive than at other nearby airports. If you want a quieter place, you can go a bit north to Cape Charles or south to Sandbridge for a more peaceful beach experience. Overall, Virginia Beach is a good mix of modern features and traditional beach fun!
virginia-beach.description_kor:
버지니아 비치는 해안의 매력과 현대적인 요소가 조화롭게 어우러진 곳입니다. 커피를 한 잔 즐기고 싶다면 카페 스텔라를 추천합니다. 이 카페는 야외 좌석이 마련되어 있고, 가끔은 라이브 재즈 공연도 열려서 편안하게 쉴 수 있는 좋은 공간입니다. 여름철에는 네프튠 축제와 모래성 경연 대회 등의 다양한 이벤트로 도시가 활기를 띠고, 이런 행사들이 관광객들을 매료시킵니다.

일부 사람들은 이 도시가 일반적인 해변 마을보다 상업적인 느낌이 더 강하다고 느낄 수 있지만, 안전하고 깔끔합니다. 지역 레스토랑들은 특별히 뛰어나진 않지만 기본적인 식사는 충분히 제공할 것이고, 낚시를 좋아하는 분이라면 서핑 낚시에서 큰 보람을 느낄 수 있을 것입니다.

관광 성수기에는 혼잡할 수 있으니, 노포크 국제공항에서의 항공편이 주변 다른 공항보다 비쌀 수 있다는 점도 고려해 주세요. 조용한 휴식을 원하신다면 북쪽의 케이프 찰스나 남쪽의 샌드브릿지로 가시면 한층 더 평화로운 해변 경험을 할 수 있습니다. 전반적으로 버지니아 비치는 현대적 요소와 전통적인 해변의 즐거움이 잘 어우러진 멋진 여행지입니다!

reviews: 2 years ago I chose to go Wanaka to see what it was like as it was recommended to me by my Kiwi friend who lives in Auckland. I looked at it on google maps and saw it was really small and thought it was boring so I booked a 3 day trip here. Oh my how wrong was I?! 3 days was not enough to do what’s here at all. I went skiing, checked out the town center and so much more! I was so hooked with this place and did not want to leave! I sadly had to. I am in love with this place and will definitely be coming back in August next year!
wanaka.description:
Located in the landscapes of New Zealand’s South Island, Wanaka is a town that surprises many visitors. At first glance, it may seem small and quiet, but as one traveler said – “Oh my, how wrong was I?!” This place has many activities, from skiing in the winter to hiking and water sports in the warmer months. Nature lovers enjoy the lakes and mountains around the town.

The town center is small but has a lot to offer, with cafes, shops, and a lively feel. However, some visitors have mentioned that living costs can be high, especially if you want to join in on the outdoor activities that may have fees. Public transportation options are limited, so it can be a good idea to rent a car or bike.

Don’t forget to learn about the local customs and try a meal at one of the many restaurants serving Kiwi dishes. For a good experience, plan ahead because just three days might not be enough to fully enjoy Wanaka!
wanaka.description_kor:
뉴질랜드 남섬에 위치한 와나카는 많은 방문객들에게 놀라운 경험을 선사하는 매력적인 마을입니다. 처음에는 작고 조용하게 느껴질 수 있지만, 한 여행자가 말했듯이 "오, 내가 얼마나 잘못 생각했었는가?!" 이곳에서는 겨울에는 스키를 즐기고, 따뜻한 계절에는 하이킹과 수상 스포츠 등 다양한 액티비티를 체험할 수 있습니다. 자연을 사랑하는 이들은 마을 주변의 아름다운 호수와 산을 만끽할 수 있습니다.

마을 중심가는 아담하지만, 다채로운 카페와 상점들이 있어 활기찬 분위기가 느껴집니다. 그러나 일부 방문객들은 야외 활동 참여 시 요금이 발생할 수 있어 생활 비용이 다소 높을 수 있다고 지적했습니다. 대중 교통이 제한적이므로, 자동차나 자전거를 렌트하는 것이 편리합니다.

또한, 현지 문화를 알아보고 여러 레스토랑 중 한 곳에서 키위 요리를 꼭 맛보는 것을 잊지 마세요. 좋은 여행을 위해 미리 계획하는 것이 중요하며, 단 3일로는 와나카를 충분히 즐기기에 부족할 수 있습니다!

reviews: Vitoria is always in the top 5 Brazilian cities for quality of life, and has a unique neighbourhood kinda style in the areas in which nomads are likely to live and work. Very walkable. I'd describe all the areas as cute, rather than majestic or big-city like, but they all have a nice, hip, kinda vibe that is great for strolling. Also much more difficult than in Rio to stumble into a bad neighbourhood. Lived here for 6 years and never had any problems. I walk and bike everywhere and never felt threatened. Pretty beaches and great access to nature. Good restaurantes, coffee shops, and nightlife. Short on musuems, football games, and big time tourist attractions (although the convent in neighbouring Vila Velha is really spectacular) if that is your thing. Not a huge expat community, but local people are very freindly. Live in Praia do Canto, Jardim da Penha, Jardim Camburi, Enseada do Sua, or across the bridge in Praia da Costa. Nice weather all year round. Pretty rich place, but cost of living much lower than Rio or Sao Paulo. Stay way from the suburbs, and favelas where there is a lot of crime (but why would you ever go there...).

Vitória is a rising city in Brazil. It is an island, capital of the province of Espírito Santo. With a variety of well developed sectors and industries, such as mining, steel, granite, coffee, the city has rising innovation economy lead by companies like Wine and Picpay and hubs such as Findes Lab, Hub Fucape and Base27, connecting startups and investors. 
Vitória has a unique life quality: In Vitória you can go for a walk on the beach in the morning and in a few minutes, with lo traffic, arrive at your office low stress.
Nightlife is good: Triangulo das Bermudas na Praia do Canto, Rua da Lama in Jardim da Penha, Laminha in Jardim Camburi and Rua 7 at Vitória Downtown are some options for nightlife.
vitoria.description:
Located on the coast of Brazil, Vitória is a mix of charm and modern living, making it one of the top cities for quality of life. The neighborhoods like Praia do Canto, Jardim da Penha, and Jardim Camburi are easy to walk around, with many cafes and restaurants that have a friendly atmosphere. The beaches are beautiful, and with nature nearby, it is great for outdoor activities.

While it does not have many big tourist attractions and museums, the nearby convent in Vila Velha is memorable. Safety is good; many locals say they've spent years biking and walking without any problems. The cost of living here is low, especially compared to Rio and São Paulo.

The nightlife is also active! You can go to Triangulo das Bermudas or Rua da Lama for a fun night out. Just avoid the suburbs and favelas, as those areas can be unsafe. Overall, if you want a sunny escape with a relaxed atmosphere, Vitória might be a good choice for you!
vitoria.description_kor:
브라질 해안에 위치한 비토리아는 매력과 현대적인 삶이 잘 어우러진 도시로, 삶의 질이 높은 곳 중 하나입니다. 프라이아 두 칸토, 자르딘 다 펜하, 자르딘 캄부리와 같은 동네는 보행하기에 매우 편리하며, 아기자기한 카페와 레스토랑들이 많이 있습니다. 해변은 아름답고 자연이 가까워 야외 활동하기에도 아주 좋습니다.

비토리아에는 큰 관광명소나 박물관은 많지 않지만, 근처 비라 벨하의 수도원은 특히 인상적입니다. 치안이 좋고 많은 지역 주민들이 여러 해에 걸쳐 자전거를 타거나 걷는 데 편안함을 느꼈다고 말합니다. 여기는 생활비가 상대적으로 낮아서 리오나 상파울루에 비해 더욱 저렴한 편입니다.

밤문화를 만끽하기에도 좋은 장소입니다! 트리아쿤고 다스 베르무다스나 루아 다 라마에서 즐거운 저녁 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 다만 교외와 파벨라 지역은 피하는 것이 좋습니다. 이곳들은 안전하지 않을 수 있기 때문입니다. 전반적으로 화창한 escape와 편안한 분위기를 찾으신다면 비토리아가 훌륭한 선택이 될 것입니다!

reviews: I really enjoyed my trip to DC for one week. I did NOT feel comfortable walking around many places alone because there are a lot of mentally ill/drugged out people. During daylight with other people I felt fine. There are soo many restaurants, interesting boutique gyms, cool libraries and more. The variety you can find in DC is closer to NYC than you can find most places. The memorials are pretty cool. There are a lot of free museums which are impressive. I liked the Lincoln Memorial/Gettysburg Address the most. It's expensive to live and participate in life here.

Currently live here and been here 30 years so I can tell you is the city has become much more violence increase murders in the hatch well it’s always had like a sense of division between black and white individuals that’s become more pronounced or some more mental illness in the street otherwise it’s a great place for a young professional who’s idealistic want to change the world but very expensive and certainly world class healthcare but also unless you have good insurance you’re going to pay for a class prices as well.
washington.description:
Washington, D.C. is a city with a lot of history. Visitors talk about the important memorials and famous museums, especially places like the Lincoln Memorial and the site of the Gettysburg Address. There are many food options and small gyms that make it different, mixing traditional DC with the variety found in New York City.

However, it’s important to be careful when exploring, especially alone after dark. Some areas may feel unsafe due to people facing mental health and substance issues. Living here can be expensive, so if you plan to stay a long time, be ready for the high cost of living.

The city has a rich culture and a history of division that some say is still present today. Still, for young professionals who want to make a change, D.C. has great opportunities. Public transit is available, but it’s a good idea to check routes and schedules for ease of travel. If you enjoy the local customs and face the challenges, this city can be a rewarding place to be!
washington.description_kor:
워싱턴 D.C.는 풍부한 역사를 지닌 도시입니다. 방문객들은 링컨 기념관이나 게티스버그 연설이 열린 장소와 같은 중요한 기념물과 유명 박물관을 자주 이야기하곤 합니다. 이곳에서는 다양한 음식 옵션과 아담한 체육관들이 있어 전통적인 D.C.와 뉴욕의 다양한 요소들이 조화를 이루고 있습니다.

하지만 탐험할 때는 특히 어두워진 후 혼자 다닐 때 주의하는 것이 중요합니다. 일부 지역은 정신 건강이나 약물 문제를 겪고 있는 사람들이 있어 안전하지 않다고 느낄 수도 있습니다. 또, 이곳에서의 생활비가 상당히 높기 때문에 장기 체류를 계획한다면 이에 대한 준비가 필요합니다.

워싱턴 D.C.는 풍부한 문화와 여전히 존재하는 사회적 갈등의 역사를 가지고 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 변화를 원하는 젊은 전문가들에게 D.C.는 많은 기회를 제공합니다. 대중교통이 잘 발달해 있지만, 보다 편리한 여행을 위해 경로와 시간표를 미리 확인하는 것이 좋습니다. 지역의 문화를 즐기고 도전에 맞선다면, 이 도시는 정말 보람 있는 곳이 될 것입니다!

reviews:
I had a good time here. The internet at my stay was terrible for gaming. Most restaurants had awful food, but a few were decent: Hangten, Nomad Café, and Rise. Hangten is a great place for breakfast; beautiful rooftop view.

There aren’t many cars, so renting a bike for daily commutes was awesome. Outpost is a solid spot to work, though it gets really busy during "hot seasons." I went in Sep and it was pretty quiet.

I stayed for two weeks and wouldn't recommend staying longer. There aren't many tourist spots, though there are some nice neighboring cities for weekend trips.
weligama.description:
Imagine yourself in Weligama, a coastal town in Sri Lanka that has a relaxed feel, making it good for a short trip. The local dining options might be mixed – while some places may not be great, you should try Hangten for breakfast and enjoy the nice rooftop view. Other good options are Nomad Café and Rise, which offer a better dining experience.

One of the best things about Weligama is how easy it is to get around; with not many cars around, renting a bike can be enjoyable and simple! For those who want to work while traveling, Outpost has a good working space, though it can be busy during peak times.

However, be aware that the internet may not always be reliable, especially if you enjoy gaming. If you find Weligama has fewer tourist attractions, don’t worry – nearby towns are just a short drive away and can be great for weekend trips. Just plan your stay well; two weeks could be just right!
weligama.description_kor:
웰리가마를 떠올려 보세요. 이곳은 스리랑카의 해안 마을로, 아늑하고 편안한 분위기를 자랑하며 짧은 여행에 제격입니다. 현지 식사 옵션은 여러 가지가 있지만, 몇몇 곳은 기대 이하일 수도 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 아침 식사로 행텐을 시도해보고 멋진 옥상 전망을 즐겨보세요. 노마드 카페와 라이즈 역시 훌륭한 선택으로, 더 좋은 다이닝 경험을 제공합니다.

웰리가마의 가장 큰 장점 중 하나는 이동이 쉽다는 점입니다. 차량이 많지 않아 자전거를 대여하면 편리하고 즐겁게 다닐 수 있습니다! 여행 중에도 일을 해야 하는 분들을 위해 아웃포스트가 좋은 작업 공간을 제공하지만, 성수기에는 인산인해일 수 있다는 점이 유의해야 합니다.

또한, 인터넷이 항상 안정적이지는 않다는 점도 기억하세요. 특히 게임을 즐기는 분들에게는 불편할 수 있습니다. 만약 웰리가마에 관광 명소가 적다고 생각하신다면 걱정하지 마세요. 근처 마을들은 가까운 거리로 주말 여행지로 적합합니다. 여러분의 여행 계획을 잘 세우시면 2주 정도 머물기 좋을 것입니다!

reviews: I spent one week there and it was more than enough. I stayed within 10 minutes walking distance to the center with its shopping mile and the Hilton Hotel. Internet was stable, but I didn´t feel comfortable at all. I felt a certain agressiveness, escecially on weekends. During the week I liked the area around the Hilton Hotel as well - some nice little restaurants and a great massage-place - but on weekends it deathquiet und you feel like an alien walking around. The best place is the roofterasse of the Hilton Hotel, were you can relax in one of the sunbeds and watch the sunset. It was the only place where I felt reallly safe. Noone is hussling you, you are on your own, dip on your drink, enjoy a good wiwi - but to be honest: thats it.

Windhoek is a simple and quiet city. Very few things to do but enjoyable for short stays. I've not experienced too much nightlife but I think it does exist with places like The Brewers Market and Joe's Beerhouse.

Internet is indeed unusable. Tethering is recommended or trying your luck with hotel/airbnb wifi (my first place was trash, my new place is somewhat usable).

With fantastic, relatively close destinations such as Etosha and Swakopmund, it's hard to recommend staying in Windhoek/Namibia without visiting those places.

Swakopmund seems to have a lot more going for it. Lot's to do and a vibrant place.
windhoek.description:
In the center of Namibia, Windhoek offers a mix of calm and city life. As a visitor, you will see that the city is quite simple and relaxed, which is good for a short visit but might not be ideal for those wanting a busy nightlife. Many people enjoy the calm atmosphere, especially during the week when you can check out local restaurants and relax at the Hilton Hotel's rooftop terrace, where you can see nice sunsets.

However, it’s important to know that weekends can feel quite empty, and some visitors may feel a bit uneasy. Safety can be an issue in some areas, so it’s smart to stay in well-known places. Public transport is not very strong, but the city is easy to walk around, especially in the central area.

For a livelier atmosphere, many suggest going to nearby Swakopmund or visiting the famous Etosha National Park for a real experience of Namibia's beautiful landscapes. If you want a quiet getaway with some local culture and slow activities, Windhoek could be a good choice—just remember to plan some adventures outside the city!
windhoek.description_kor:
나미비아의 중심부에 위치한 빈트후크는 고요함과 도시 생활이 조화를 이루는 멋진 곳입니다. 이곳을 방문하면 도시가 꽤 소박하고 편안하다는 느낌을 받을 수 있으며, 짧은 일정에는 적합하지만 바쁜 야경을 즐기고자 하는 분들에게는 다소 아쉬울 수 있습니다. 많은 사람들이 주중에는 특히 이 조용한 분위기를 만끽하며, 현지 식당을 탐방하고 힐튼 호텔의 옥상 테라스에서 환상적인 일몰을 감상하며 여유를 즐깁니다.

하지만 주말에는 조금 한산하게 느껴질 수 있어, 일부 방문객은 불안감을 느낄 수도 있습니다. 특정 지역에서는 안전 문제도 있을 수 있으니, 잘 알려진 장소에서 머무는 것이 좋습니다. 대중교통은 많지 않지만, 도심 내는 걷기 쉬운 편입니다.

좀 더 활기찬 분위기를 원하신다면 가까운 스와콥문트로 가거나 나미비아의 아름다운 자연을 만끽할 수 있는 유명한 에토샤 국립공원 방문을 추천드립니다. 현지 문화와 여유로운 활동을 원하는 분들에게는 빈트후크가 훌륭한 선택이 될 수 있지만, 도심 밖에서의 모험도 잊지 마세요!

reviews: Worcester is a hidden gem among the bigger cities. Second largest city in Massachusetts behind Boston. Huge redevelopment push past 5 years (2015-2020). All the big city things for work and play, with still many, many opportunities for cheap housing, etc.
worcester.description:
Located in central Massachusetts, Worcester is often called a hidden gem that is gaining attention. As the second-largest city in the state, it offers city life without the high prices. In the past few years, there has been a lot of redevelopment, so you will find new cafes and art scenes emerging everywhere.

One of the good things? Housing is quite affordable, giving you better value for your money compared to Boston. Also, with more attractions like museums, parks, and sports events, there is always something happening nearby.

However, some visitors find the public transportation options a little limited, so having a car can be useful for getting around. Language is usually not a big problem, but a friendly “Hello!” can help.

If you want to move here, neighborhoods like Shrewsbury Street have a lot of culture and good food. Just be aware of your surroundings like in any city. Overall, Worcester is a great place that might surprise you!
worcester.description_kor:
중부 매사추세츠에 위치한 우스터는 종종 숨겨진 보석으로 불립니다. 이곳은 이 주에서 두 번째로 큰 도시로, 비교적 저렴한 가격에 도시 생활의 매력을 제공합니다. 최근 몇 년 동안 많은 재개발이 이루어져서 새로운 카페와 예술 공간들이 곳곳에 생겨나고 있습니다.

우스터의 장점 중 하나는 주택 가격이 꽤 합리적이라는 점입니다. 덕분에 보스턴에 비해 더 나은 가치를 제공하죠. 또한 박물관, 공원, 스포츠 행사 등 다양한 명소가 많아 항상 흥미로운 일이 벌어지고 있습니다.

하지만 일부 방문객들은 대중교통이 약간 불편하다고 느낄 수 있어서, 이동할 때 차가 있으면 도움이 될 수 있습니다. 언어의 장벽은 대체로 크지 않지만, 친근한 "안녕하세요!"가 어떤 상황에서도 도움이 될 거예요.

이곳에 이사하고 싶다면 슈루즈버리 스트리트 같은 동네에서 문화와 맛있는 음식을 즐길 수 있습니다. 어떤 도시에 가더라도 주변을 잘 살펴보는 것이 중요하죠. 전반적으로 우스터는 여러분을 놀라게 할 수 있는 매력적인 곳입니다!

reviews: I would say the cost of living in Winnipeg is pretty accurately represented. I live here, and honestly, it's a decent cheap Canadian capital, I can live while doing my hobby here, and sharing a house. It could be a lot worse if you're thinking of coming to Canada for a while, rent can be found relatively low cost and utilities are cheap too. Meals vary, of course the locals know where the good cheap places are, I like the $5 tacos at BMC market. It is flat and very cold in the winter so do be prepared, Winnipeg is merciless that way.
winnipeg.description:
Winnipeg is a great place for anyone wanting to experience Canada without spending too much money. The cost of living is quite low, especially when compared to other Canadian cities, so you can find reasonable rental prices and utility costs. If you like food, try the $5 tacos at BMC Market—many locals recommend them!

However, be ready for the cold winters. Winnipeg can get very cold, and the flat land can lead to frostbite. Public transport is not very good, so having a car or bike can help you get around more easily.

Culturally, the city has a mix of art, history, and local traditions. There are always events happening, like festivals or community activities. Areas like The Exchange District are full of life and creativity. Just remember, as you explore, wearing warm clothes and being friendly can make your time here enjoyable!
winnipeg.description_kor:
위니펙은 캐나다의 매력을 경험하고 싶으면서도 많은 돈을 쓰고 싶지 않은 분들에게 아주 좋은 장소입니다. 이곳의 생활비는 다른 캐나다 도시들에 비해 상대적으로 저렴해서 합리적인 임대료와 공과금을 쉽게 찾을 수 있습니다. 음식에 관심이 많다면 BMC 마켓에서 꼭 $5 타코를 즐겨보세요. 많은 지역 주민들이 추천하는 맛집이랍니다!

하지만 겨울철의 추위에는 주의가 필요합니다. 위니펙은 매우 추운 날씨가 이어질 수 있으며, 평평한 지형 때문에 동상에 걸릴 위험도 있습니다. 대중교통이 그리 발달하지 않아서 자동차나 자전거가 있으면 더 편리하게 이동할 수 있습니다.

문화적으로 이 도시는 예술, 역사, 지역 전통이 잘 어우러져 있습니다. 축제와 지역 활동 같은 다양한 이벤트가 항상 열리기 때문에 즐길 거리도 풍부합니다. 익스체인지 지구와 같은 곳은 활기와 창의성으로 가득 차 있죠. 탐험을 떠날 때는 따뜻한 옷을 입고, 친절한 태도로 사람들과 대하는 것을 잊지 마세요. 그러면 위니펙에서의 시간이 더욱 즐거운 추억으로 남을 것입니다!

reviews:
Great city!
Many places to work from. Many great companies - I think you could find some cofounders for startup. Great connections to mountains, many flight directions. Great food! You can have a lot of fun in the night or during the day. Many beach bars and vineyards around the city. It's the city students from other Polish cities migrate to because of cool factor.
Great history.

What a nice city! I stayed two weeks here and have been amazed by how colorful and beautiful the center is. People can sometimes be quite cold and unkind - however I also met very nice people here and had a lot of fun going out. I will surely be back and recommend it to anyone. 2 weeks is perfect, I would have probably got bored afterwards as the city is quite small.
wroclaw.description:
Wrocław is a lively city that has a lot of energy and character. It is known for its colorful buildings and rich history, making it a good place for work and leisure. There are many comfortable places to work and several creative companies, making it a good location for startups. The active nightlife and relaxing beach bars add to the enjoyable environment, suitable for activities both during the day and at night.

People who love nature will like Wrocław's nearby mountains and vineyards, which offer nice escapes just outside the city. While the city is great, there are a few things to remember. Some people might seem a bit distant at first, but don’t worry—there are many friendly locals who are happy to have a good time!

Public transportation is reasonable, but it’s wise to plan ahead since it can be limited. For newcomers, a two-week stay is just right to see the sights without stress. So take your camera and get ready to discover this charming city!
wroclaw.description_kor:
브로츠와프는 에너지가 넘치고 개성이 가득한 활기찬 도시입니다. 다채로운 건물과 풍부한 역사로 유명해, 일과 여가를 동시에 즐기기에 좋은 장소입니다. 편안한 작업 공간과 다양한 창의적인 회사들이 있어 스타트업에 최적의 환경을 제공합니다. 또한, 활기찬 밤문화와 아늑한 해변 바가 낮과 밤에 활동하기에 즐거운 분위기를 만들어줍니다.

자연을 사랑하는 이들에게는 브로츠와프 근처에 위치한 산과 포도밭이 매력적일 것입니다. 이곳은 훌륭한 휴식처를 제공합니다. 도시가 정말 멋지지만, 유의할 점도 있습니다. 처음에는 일부 주민들이 조금 거리감을 느낄 수 있지만, 걱정하지 마세요. 친절한 현지인들이 많아 금세 편안한 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다!

대중교통은 편리하지만 가끔 제한적일 수 있으니 미리 계획하는 것이 좋습니다. 새로 오는 분들은 스트레스 없이 관광지를 둘러볼 수 있는 이틀 정도의 체류를 추천합니다. 그러니 카메라를 챙기고 이 매력적인 도시를 탐험할 준비를 하세요!

reviews: I'm actually staying in London, Ontario and this is the closest location available to post a review on the site. But I've spent a lot of time in Windsor so I can provide some overview. Windsor is a border town across from Detroit, Michigan, USA. A lot of day-trippers visit from other areas of Ontario and Michigan to visit the Caesar's Casino, which is a very nice casino if you're into gaming. Other than that there's not much to do other than enjoy the views of the Detroit skyline from the riverwalk. I always feel safe in Windsor. Like most of Canada, Windsor is expensive, but internet service and other infrastructure are great for working. Winters are extreme. Some Canadians have anti-American attitudes, unfortunately. If you're American be prepared to ignore these people and focus your time on the friendly locals.
windsor.description:
Windsor is located by the Detroit River and is a busy border city with a mix of cultures. It is a good place for day visitors who want to enjoy the lively atmosphere of casinos, with Caesar's Casino being popular among those who like to gamble. 

Many visitors appreciate the friendly and relaxed feel of Windsor, making it comfortable to visit. Walking along the riverwalk provides nice views of the Detroit skyline. The city is mostly safe, but like many places, it can be somewhat expensive. However, the good internet and services make it a suitable place for remote workers. 

Windsor can be cold in the winter months, so remember to bring warm clothes! You may also encounter some negative feelings towards Americans, but don’t let that spoil your visit—there are many friendly locals to talk to. If you decide to visit, check out the neighborhoods, try local food, and enjoy the diverse culture that makes Windsor special!
windsor.description_kor:
윈저는 디트로이트 강 옆에 위치한 활기찬 국경 도시로, 다양한 문화가 어우러진 곳입니다. 카지노의 생동감 넘치는 분위기를 즐길 수 있는 당일 여행지로 안성맞춤이며, 세저스 카지노는 도박 애호가들 사이에서 큰 인기를 끌고 있습니다.

많은 방문객들이 윈저의 아늑하고 친근한 분위기를 좋아해 편안하게 찾는 곳으로 여깁니다. 강변 산책로를 따라 걷다 보면 디트로이트 스카이라인의 아름다운 경치를 감상할 수 있습니다. 이 도시는 대체로 안전하지만, 다른 많은 장소와 마찬가지로 가격이 다소 높을 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 좋은 인터넷과 서비스 덕분에 원격 근무자들에게 적합한 환경을 제공합니다.

겨울철에는 날씨가 추울 수 있으니 따뜻한 옷을 꼭 챙기세요! 또한 미국인들에 대한 부정적인 감정을 겪을 수도 있지만, 그런 일로 당신의 여행이 힘들어지지 않도록 하세요. 친절한 현지인들이 많아서 대화하기에도 좋습니다. 만약 방문하기로 결정하셨다면, 동네를 탐방하고 지역 음식을 맛보며 윈저의 다양한 문화를 즐겨보세요!

reviews: My favorite place in China. Best months of the year are April to October. Any who loves rivers, mountains, rock climbing, caves, rafting, etc. will love it here. Biggest reccommendation, buy or rent a scooter and go exploring! There's so much to see. I made a lot of Chinese and international friends while studying Chinese here (Omeida Chinese Academy: www.omeidachinese.com ) That made my experience even better.
yangshuo.description:
In southern China, Yangshuo is a great place for people who love the outdoors. You can see mountains, rivers, and caves—this place is amazing! The best time to go is from April to October when the weather is good for exploring. Renting a scooter helps a lot; it allows you to travel around and find hidden places in this beautiful area.

While you enjoy the views, take the chance to meet local people. Many visitors make good friends, especially if you try to learn Chinese at schools like Omeida Chinese Academy. The community here is friendly and makes your trip better.

However, some travelers mention a few problems. Prices can be high during busy tourist times, and public transport may not always work well. Still, with a spirit of adventure and a friendly attitude, your stay in Yangshuo will be filled with great memories! You can enjoy rock climbing, rafting, and exploring the local culture—you will have stories to share!
yangshuo.description_kor:
남부 중국의 양숴는 야외 활동을 즐기는 사람들에게 최적의 장소입니다. 이곳에서는 멋진 산과 강, 그리고 신비로운 동굴들을 만날 수 있어 정말 놀랍습니다! 탐험하기에 가장 좋은 시기는 4월부터 10월까지로, 이때 날씨가 아주 좋습니다. 스쿠터를 빌리면 이 아름다운 지역의 숨겨진 보물 같은 장소들을 돌아보는 데 큰 도움이 됩니다.

경치를 만끽하는 동안 현지인들과의 만남을 경험해보세요. 많은 방문객들이 친구를 사귀고, 특히 오메이 중국어 아카데미와 같은 학교에서 중국어를 배우려 할 때 더욱 그렇습니다. 이 지역 사람들은 매우 친절해서 여행 경험을 더욱 특별하게 만들어 줍니다.

하지만 일부 여행자들은 몇 가지 문제를 겪기도 합니다. 관광 성수기에는 물가가 오를 수 있고, 대중교통이 항상 원활하지 않을 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 모험심과 친근한 태도를 가지고 방문하면 양숴에서 잊지 못할 경험을 할 수 있습니다! 암벽 등반, 래프팅, 그리고 지역 문화를 탐방하며, 나누고 싶은 이야기들로 가득한 멋진 추억을 쌓게 될 것입니다!

reviews: Who on earth wrote these reviews ?! Yaoundé is great !
yaounde.description:
Yaoundé, the capital of Cameroon, is a lively city. Visitors often talk about the local culture and friendly people who make you feel welcome. You can visit markets with fresh fruits and souvenirs, or try the local food that many find tasty.

The cost of living is usually low, but some things can be expensive, especially eating out in popular areas. The public transportation can be complicated; shared taxis are the main choice, but they can be crowded and confusing for newcomers. Most people feel safe walking around neighborhoods, but like in any city, it is good to be aware of your surroundings.

For attractions, be sure to see the National Museum and Mefou National Park, where you can see different animals. You might find it helpful to learn a few French phrases, as it is commonly spoken. Overall, Yaoundé has a mix of culture and friendly experiences for travelers.
yaounde.description_kor:
야운데(Yaoundé)는 카메룬의 수도이자 활기찬 도시로, 방문객들에게 현지 문화와 친절한 사람들을 자랑합니다. 이곳의 주민들은 따뜻하게 여러분을 맞이해줄 것입니다. 신선한 과일과 기념품을 파는 시장을 둘러보거나 많은 이들이 맛있다고 극찬하는 현지 음식을 꼭 시도해 보세요.

생활비는 대체로 저렴한 편이지만, 인기 있는 지역에서 외식할 경우에는 가격이 높아질 수 있습니다. 대중교통은 다소 복잡할 수 있는데, 공용 택시가 일반적이지만 혼잡해서 처음 오는 사람에게는 다소 혼란스러울 수 있습니다. 대부분의 사람들은 동네를 걸어 다니는 것이 안전하다고 느끼지만, 어떤 도시에서든지 주변을 주의 깊게 살피는 것이 좋습니다.

관광 명소로는 국립 박물관(National Museum)과 메푸 국립공원(Mefou National Park)을 추천합니다. 이곳에서는 다양한 동물들을 만나볼 수 있습니다. 프랑스어 몇 마디를 미리 배우면, 현지인들과 소통하는 데 큰 도움이 될 것입니다. 야운데는 여행자들에게 문화와 친절한 경험이 어우러진 매력적인 장소입니다.

reviews: Jogja is good for me, all the air quality and religious stuff is true. It is also very 'dirty' and chaotic, which most westerners probably wouldn't like.
yogyakarta.description:
Yogyakarta, or Jogja as the locals call it, is a city that appeals to everyone who visits. It's a lively place full of culture and history, where busy streets are full of art. You will see beautiful temples and traditional markets that attract you with their colors and smells.

However, it is not always perfect. Some people say that the city can feel a bit crowded, and others notice that cleanliness is not always great. If you prefer things to be organized, the busy atmosphere might be a little much!

Living in Jogja is generally cheap, with a cost of living that is reasonable. Public transport can be difficult, so renting a bike or using local ojek (motorcycle taxis) might be the best choice.

Safety is pretty good, but like anywhere, watch your belongings. Make sure to check out the local customs and try the tasty street food. Enjoy the lively vibe, and you might really like this interesting, if somewhat messy, city!
yogyakarta.description_kor:
요그야카르타, 혹은 현지인들이 부르는 '조지아(Jogja)'는 모든 방문객에게 매력적인 도시입니다. 이곳은 문화와 역사로 가득 찬 활기 넘치는 장소로, 분주한 거리에서는 예술이 넘쳐납니다. 아름다운 사원과 전통 시장의 다채로운 색깔과 향기가 당신을 사로잡을 것입니다.

하지만 완벽한 곳은 없죠. 어떤 사람들은 이 도시가 다소 혼잡하게 느껴질 수 있다고 하며, 다른 이들은 청결 상태가 항상 만족스럽지 않다고 느낄 수 있습니다. 정돈된 환경을 선호하신다면, 바쁜 분위기가 조금 과할 수도 있겠네요.

조지아에서의 생활비는 대체로 저렴하고 합리적입니다. 대중교통 이용이 불편할 수 있으니, 자전거를 렌트하거나 현지 오젝(오토바이 택시)을 이용하는 것이 더 나은 선택이 될 수 있습니다.

안전성은 꽤 좋은 편이지만, 어디에서나 그렇듯 개인 소지품에 주의해야 합니다. 현지의 관습도 알아보고, 맛있는 길거리 음식도 꼭 시도해 보세요. 활기찬 분위기를 즐기다 보면, 이 흥미롭고 다소 복잡한 도시를 진심으로 좋아하게 될 것입니다!

reviews: A great place if you speak Russian or Armenian, somewhat less so English. Good food, friendly people, nature around (eg in Lori) is just insane.

I recently stayed in an apt at Cascade. I loved being within walking distance of everything: cafes, bars, restaurants, museums, parks, money exchanges, groceries, etc. The most wonderful part for me was the ability to strike up conversation with strangers. Everyone there is just so friendly and accomodating. Also, safety. I arrived at 4am and was stuck outside with my belongings, in the middle of the city, for an hour waiting for my host. I've never felt this safe in a metropolitan area before. My main complaint is that internet connectivity needs improvement across the board. However, I was able to work for 2 weeks, even uploading video. But it is definitely not up to par with other places I've visited. I plan on returning for a longer stay soon.
Has a great techno music scene. Nightlife is great even during covid time. Young locals speak good English.

Spent 3 months there. As the others noted - at least at the moment, it's ok only to visit for a week and checkout the sights. Not recommending for long stays, as the only benefit of this place is only cheap prices (btw good apartments are quite overpriced). Also, do not advise in summer - weather was around 35-40 almost always, impossible to go out during the daytime. Checkout after 10 years, maybe things will change :D

Nice to spend some time as a tourist but not so good work and living. The traffic is huge, the streets are noisy, the roads are dangerous. Very cheap fruits and vegetables. The quality of service is really bad. You often have to begg sales person to sell you something. While the city center might look prosper and nobel most of the people here a very poor. And it looks like they do not see that their wealth somehow depends on how they do their job.

Cheap food and wine, beautiful churches and... that’s all. Young people seem to be quite conservative, desperate to leave and very pessimistic about the future. No jobs or opportunities, so the vibe isn’t “cool” at all. It’s safe and really cheap though, great for one month, getting works done and that’s all.
yerevan.description:
Yerevan is a city where every place has a story, and each meal is a good experience. If you know some Russian or Armenian, you will find it easy to connect with locals – they are very friendly. The food is a highlight, with tasty and affordable meals and nice cafes all around the city. Many visitors enjoy the nightlife and the active techno scene, which makes it easy to have fun even when it's quieter.

However, there are a few challenges. If you do not like hot summer weather, you might want to visit in another season because it can get very warm. Internet access can be unreliable, which can be a problem if you need to stay connected. Also, while the city center looks nice, some areas may feel less welcoming, and you should be careful of heavy traffic and noise.

Whether you’re learning about the history at churches or just taking a walk around Cascade, Yerevan has a unique charm. It’s good for a short visit, but those wanting to stay longer might face challenges with finding jobs and high living costs.
yerevan.description_kor:
예레반은 이야기가 가득한 도시로, 식사 하나하나가 특별한 경험이 됩니다. 러시아어 또는 아르메니아어를 조금이라도 알고 있다면, 현지인들과 쉽게 소통할 수 있을 거예요. 그들은 정말 친절합니다. 음식이 이곳의 하이라이트로, 맛있고 저렴한 식당과 멋진 카페가 곳곳에 자리하고 있습니다. 많은 방문객들이 활기 넘치는 나이트라이프와 테크노 음악을 즐기며, 때로는 조용할 때조차도 즐거움을 찾기 쉽습니다.

하지만 몇 가지 도전 과제가 있기도 합니다. 덥고 무더운 여름이 싫다면 다른 계절에 방문하는 게 좋을 수 있습니다. 여름 날씨는 정말 매우 뜨거울 수 있으니까요. 또한 인터넷 접속이 불안정할 때가 많아 연결이 필요할 때 불편함을 느낄 수 있습니다. 도심 지역은 경관이 아름답지만, 일부 지역은 덜 환영받는 느낌을 줄 수도 있고, 교통 혼잡과 소음 문제에도 유의해야 합니다.

교회에서 역사를 배우거나 캐스케이드 주변을 산책하면서 예레반의 독특한 매력을 느낄 수 있습니다. 짧게 방문하기에는 좋지만, 더 오랫동안 머물고 싶다면 일자리 찾기와 높은 생활비가 어려움을 줄 수 있습니다.

reviews: I quite liked Zagreb. People are fairly warm, and it's charmingly laid out. Lots of good cafes and restaurants, and the center is pretty walkable. As someone else said there are the commie block vibes, but those are in more peripheral neighborhoods. I felt it was safe, and had no issues getting around by tram mostly. As someone mentioned there is definitely the traditional Southern European cafes are for socializing, not working kind of vibe but still a decent number had wifi and didn't bat an eye at working all day. Winter gets too cold (single digits C), but early fall was lovely.

Didn't plan to come to Zagreb, and so had no expectations. Turned out to be a lovely, liveable city, so much so that I extended my stay by several weeks! Contrary to some of the comments from a year ago, it is now very vegan friendly, cards are universally accepted, steady WiFi si abundant, and many other people are working from coffee shops. The city is very walkable, and more affordable than Split or Dubrovnik.

I was only in Zagreb for about 10 days, but I was pretty impressed. The city was much more alive and vibrant than I had anticipated and I was pleasantly surprised by the number of cool places to eat, get coffee, etc. It's not huge and you'll get the lay of the land pretty quick, but it's easy to get around, I had good wifi both places I stayed (one was particularly excellent), and there was also some solid but unspectacular free wifi at various points in the city. Cheaper than Split or Dubrovnik, though obviously not as pretty and it did get pretty cold while I was there in October. Generally, I'd give it a thumbs up and wish I had a bit more time there.

Mixed feeling. I was in Zagreb and didn't particularly liked it. It was kinda very very Soviet feel, like the city that's left in 80s. I've traveled in other Eastern Europe, but Zagreb felt really weird. And price-wise it's more expensive than other cities, while not giving much value for that.
I would probably not stay there again unless needed. Try Bratislava, Budapest, Prague, Sofia, Lubljana or anything else :)

You need cash here in Zagreb.
Bars, clubs, and small business dont accept credit cards
These people smoke so much that you might as well be staying in a chimney.

Been here after Easter and to tell you honestly, it is a bit expensive in comparaison with other Balcanic countries but the scenery, the views are quite good. You can simply walk the pedestrian sides of the city and admire a mix of Austro-Hungarian + ex-Yugoslav architecture inside the Old Town. If you wanna see something different than other major important tourist attractions, then I think you can check it!
Absolutely not true that you can find a studio in the city center for 1500hrk! Even for a Croatian, it is simply not possible and should be reviewed

Locals here do not work in cafes with laptops - you will get strange looks. If you use linux or have a terminal open on your laptop, people will think you are hacking.

Other than that, very friendly people. Can be hard to find vegan food, but plenty of cheap options for non-vegans. 

Feels like an active city, there's always something going on in the main square. It's also an incredibly green city - check out the beautiful Park Maksimir, or consider climbing the mountain to Sljeme.
zagreb.description:
Zagreb, the capital of Croatia, has a mix of charm and character that may surprise you. The city is known for its friendly people and easy-to-walk streets, which are good for visiting cafes and restaurants. There is a nice atmosphere, especially in the busy main square where there is always something happening. If you enjoy nature, parks like Maksimir provide a quiet place to relax.

However, like any city, Zagreb has both good and bad reviews. Some visitors notice a past “commie block” look in the outskirts, and the winter cold can be harsh. While it is cheaper than well-known places like Split or Dubrovnik, some people still find the prices a bit high for what is available.

Getting around by tram is easy, but make sure to carry cash since many local bars and clubs do not take cards. If you are a vegan, there are new options available. Just remember, the cafe culture here is more about talking with friends than working. Whether you want a nice walk through the old town or a hike up Sljeme, Zagreb has something for everyone!
zagreb.description_kor:
크로아티아의 수도 자그레브는 매력적인 개성과 분위기를 지닌 도시로, 여러분을 매료시킬 것입니다. 이곳은 친절한 사람들, 아기자기한 카페, 다양한 레스토랑이 있어 보행하기 좋은 거리로 유명합니다. 특히, 항상 활기가 넘치는 중심 광장에서는 쾌적한 분위기를 만끽할 수 있습니다. 자연을 사랑하는 분들에게는 막시미르 공원이 조용히 휴식을 취할 수 있는 최적의 장소를 제공합니다.

하지만 다른 도시들처럼 자그레브 역시 긍정적인 평가와 부정적인 평가가 공존합니다. 일부 관광객들은 외곽 지역에서 옛 ‘공산주의 블록’의 흔적을 발견하고, 겨울철의 혹독한 추위에 대해 언급하기도 합니다. 자그레브는 스플리트나 두브로브니크 같은 유명 관광지보다 물가가 저렴하지만, 일부 사람들은 제공되는 서비스에 비해 가격이 꽤 비싸다고 느낀다고 합니다.

트램을 타고 이동하는 건 매우 편리하지만, 많은 바와 클럽에서 신용카드를 받지 않기 때문에 현금을 준비하는 것이 좋습니다. 요즘 비건 음식 옵션도 늘어나고 있으니 참고하시기 바랍니다. 이곳의 카페 문화는 일보다는 친구들과의 대화에 더 중점을 두고 있어, 여유롭게 시간을 보낼 수 있습니다. 자그레브는 오래된 마을을 거닐거나 슬예메에서 하이킹을 즐기기에 좋은 다양한 요소를 가지고 있어, 누구에게나 적합한 즐거움을 제공합니다!

reviews: This is where humans shouldn't stay or visit after the 2021 Feb Coup. Until now it's a dictatorship country, so expect everything that can happen in a dictatorship country.

A very poor city, not comparable to any other in SEA (maybe Phnom Penh, in Cambodia). Not much to see and do, particularly I can’t see any advantages to stay here, as Thailand, Indonesia and even Malaysia offer better option with higher quality for the same price.

It is a city similar to any other in SE Asia, nothing particularly special about it. A great jumping off point to the many other wonders of Myanmar. Differences include nicer and larger green spaces than many other major SE Asian cities. Seemingly safe with helpful people, quite a bit of English spoken.
yangon.description:
If you are thinking about a trip to Yangon, there is a lot to consider. This city has a lot of history and culture but also has some difficulties, especially since the political situation changed after the 2021 coup. Some visitors find it a bit hard compared to other Southeast Asian places, like Thailand or Malaysia, while others enjoy its different character.

Yangon has nice green areas that are different from other cities in the region, making it a good place for a walk. The friendliness of the locals can make your visit better; many people speak English, which is helpful. However, public transport is not very good, and the cost of living can be high, especially for foreigners.

Take time to visit local markets and historical sites, but remember to stay alert and aware of what is happening politically. Many people find Yangon a good starting point to explore the rest of Myanmar's beauty. Just keep in mind to have realistic expectations and prepare well!
yangon.description_kor:
양곤 여행을 계획하고 있다면, 고려해야 할 몇 가지 사항이 있습니다. 이 도시는 풍부한 역사와 문화가 있지만, 2021년 쿠데타 이후 정치적인 상황이 변하면서 어려운 부분도 존재합니다. 일부 방문객들은 태국이나 말레이시아 같은 다른 동남아시아 국가들에 비해 다소 힘들게 느끼기도 하지만, 동시에 그 독특한 매력을 즐기는 이들도 많습니다.

양곤은 이 지역의 다른 도시들과는 달리 아름다운 녹지 공간이 많아 산책하기에 적합합니다. 현지인들의 따뜻한 환대는 여행을 더욱 즐겁게 만들어 주며, 영어를 구사하는 사람들이 많아 소통하는 데 큰 어려움은 없습니다. 그러나 대중교통은 그리 편리하지 않고, 생활비는 외국인에게 특히 비쌀 수 있습니다.

현지 시장과 역사적인 명소를 방문하는 시간을 꼭 가지되, 정치적 상황에 대한 경각심을 잃지 않는 것이 중요합니다. 많은 이들이 양곤을 미얀마의 아름다움을 탐험하기 위한 훌륭한 출발점으로 생각하고 있습니다. 하지만 현실적인 기대를 가지고 철저히 준비하는 것이 필수적입니다!

reviews: Athens is a fantastic city. Locals are friendly and food is fantastic. There isn't a huge amount to do, but for a short stay it's definitely worth the visit.

I am a Greek living abroad just the last couple of years. I accidentally discovered this page and noticed the comments below. What I can recommend to people considering living in Athens is to explore places a bit outside of the city center. I agree with people that there are many areas very close to the city center that are dirty and perhaps not very safe to walk around at night. Explore areas like Glyfada, Voula, Kifisia, Marousi, Psychiko, Marousi and you will be amazed with how different it is! The quality of life in such areas area way way WAY better than what you get by living in the city center. If you don't have a car, top tip would be to find a place with a metro station nearby.

Athens is a great city; much to do! It offers a balance of daily life and nightlife. Rents are extremely reasonable. Two of my colleagues and I decided to live in the northern suburbs near metro stations called Doukisis Plakentias. 15 minute underground ride to Athens centre. Mt. Pentelis which is very nearby offers and great trekking paths and clean air for those who love to be close to nature as well as close to the city. Nice shopping area too, like Halandri. Great restaurants, cafes, etc., expensive and cheap. All around great place to live and work! No complaints here!

Like all cities that have lots of tourists, it's best to explore a little and get off the well beaten track. There are literally thousands of small cafes and bars that have free, fast WiFi, cheap coffee and good kebabs. 
If you stay in the absolute cheapest part of town, you will get a different vibe. There are a lot of AirBnB springing up and in the off-season these are very reasonably priced. 
I can't understand how you could be bored in Athens. So many places to see, so many museums and historic sites, beaches, clubs, mountains, markets and...
Check out some of the closer islands, but steer clear of the ones frequented by Cruise Ships like Mykonos and Santorini. The prices in these places are not really reflective of the rest of the country.

Pretty decent place. I usually spend September and October in Athens when the weather is close to perfect ie. not too hot nor too cold for yours truly.

You can get easily by with nothing but English, though tossing an occasional συγνώμε and παρακαλώ in the mix helps. That, of course, as long as you stay in the pricey parts of the city.

With a bit of luck and some advance planning Athens can be extremely affordable. There are Airbnb listings quite far away from the center, yet close to a metro station -- for less than 800€ per month you can get a two bedrooms + a kitchen + a large balcony next to a reasonably quiet street.

This, of course, works only for those who are more or less busy working from Monday to Friday. For something resembling more like a tourist visit, you'll be paying at least twice for a flat near the center and quite likely end up in somewhere with plenty of motorcycle noises to keep you awake all night, every night.
Great for 2 days to a week. No longer is needed. Was there for a month and frequently went to islands due to Athens being dirty, touristy, and somewhat boring. Foods good though!
Athens is a very interesting city. It is very large, a bit like Tbilisi, very hot in the summer. Refugees everywhere, but everyone is friendly

Athens is very diverse, which is great. As a black digital nomad, it was nice to be treated like a person for the most part rather than as a strange animal. This is more than I can say for so much of Europe. The city has not been well taken care of in recent years, but it is still very charming, as are the people. Almost everyone smokes here and it is difficult to find a completely smoke-free work location. The public transportation system is decent and the facilities are clean. WiFi is pretty fast as well and available in most places.

People and food are just lovely in Greece. Would argue that Greeks are the most friendly and welcoming people in Europe. The city is a disaster. Overrun by migrants, run down by the government, empty buildings and gratifies everywhere. Not far from city center (10min by feet) it feels more like a third world country than Europe.
athens.description:
Athens is a unique mix of history, culture, and friendliness that appeals to many people. The locals are known for being warm and welcoming, which makes it easy to enjoy life here. The food is also a highlight, with small cafes offering good coffee and kebabs, as well as many restaurants.

The city has many attractions like ancient sites and busy markets, but some areas near the center might feel a bit rough and less safe at night. However, if you go to neighborhoods like Glyfada or Kifisia, you will find cleaner streets and a better quality of life. Public transport is decent, especially the metro—it's best to stay near a station!

For visitors, it’s good to look beyond the main tourist areas. You can discover local history and art, and consider taking a day trip to nearby islands, just try to avoid the ones that are too crowded with tourists. English is often understood, but using a few Greek phrases can be helpful. Overall, Athens offers a nice blend of city life and nature, making it a great place for daily experiences. Explore carefully and enjoy the city!
athens.description_kor:
아테네는 독특한 역사와 문화, 그리고 친절한 사람들의 조화로 많은 이들에게 매력적인 도시입니다. 현지인들은 따뜻하고 환영해줘서 이곳에서의 삶이 정말 즐겁습니다. 음식 또한 큰 장점인데, 작은 카페에서는 훌륭한 커피와 케밥을 맛볼 수 있고, 다양한 레스토랑도 많이 있습니다.

이 도시는 고대 유적지와 활기 넘치는 시장 등 많은 명소가 있지만, 도심 일부 지역은 밤에 다소 거칠고 안전하지 않게 느껴질 수 있습니다. 하지만 글리파다(Glyfada)나 키피시아(Kifisia) 같은 동네로 가면 더 깨끗하고 삶의 질이 높은 곳을 경험할 수 있습니다. 대중교통도 괜찮은 편이며, 특히 지하철이 편리하니 역 근처에 숙소를 정하는 게 좋습니다!

방문객이라면 주요 관광지 외에도 다양한 장소를 탐방해보시기를 추천합니다. 지역의 역사와 예술을 발견할 수 있고, 가까운 섬으로 당일 치기 여행도 고려해보세요. 너무 관광객이 많은 섬은 피하는 것이 좋습니다. 영어가 잘 통하지만, 몇 가지 그리스어 표현을 익혀두면 더 좋습니다. 전반적으로 아테네는 도시 생활과 자연이 아름답게 어우러져 있어 일상적인 경험을 즐기기에 완벽한 장소입니다. 조심스럽게 탐험하고 도시의 매력을 만끽하세요!

reviews: It's a pretty awesome place and next year will definitely stay for longer. So clean, has amazing people, and great culture

Zurich is a nice city, not very big but charming, especially the old town where you can find bars and restaurants. Good party culture, a lot of different clubs. A lot if different things to do and other cities like the capital (Bern) are within a 1 hour train ride.
As a local there, I can say that I almost never carry cash with me. This has not been a problem for a very long time, except for parking and maybe some few ice cream and hot marroni stands.
zurich.description:
Located in the center of Switzerland, Zurich is a nice city that combines tradition and modern life. With its clean streets and friendly people, it’s easy to feel comfortable. The old town has many bars and different restaurants, which makes it a great place for nightlife and eating out. If you like to explore, you will enjoy the city's lively party scene and the many clubs to visit.

Getting around is easy, with public transport working well, and it's just a short train ride to other nice cities like Bern. However, one thing to remember is that while cash is not often needed, it’s good to have some for small stands and parking.

Though Zurich is not very big, there is always something happening, and the cultural scene is active and welcoming. Just a little tip: don’t forget to visit the nice parks and waterfront areas. Overall, Zurich offers a good mix of activities, culture, and a friendly atmosphere!
zurich.description_kor:
스위스의 중심부에 위치한 취리히는 전통과 현대가 조화롭게 어우러진 매력적인 도시입니다. 깨끗한 거리와 친절한 사람들 덕분에 편안함을 느끼기 쉽습니다. 구시가는 다양한 바와 레스토랑이 있어 밤문화와 외식에 적합한 장소입니다. 탐험을 좋아한다면, 활기찬 파티 씬과 방문할 클럽들이 많아 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있을 것입니다.

대중교통이 잘 발달되어 있어 이동이 편리하며, 베른과 같은 다른 멋진 도시까지 기차로 쉽게 갈 수 있습니다. 하지만 한 가지 기억해두실 점은, 현금을 많이 사용할 필요는 없지만 작은 가판대나 주차를 위해 약간의 현금을 준비하는 것이 좋다는 것입니다.

취리히는 그렇게 크지 않지만 언제나 생동감 넘치는 활동이 이뤄지고 있으며, 다양한 문화적 행사로 방문객들을 따뜻하게 맞이합니다. 작은 팁으로, 아름다운 공원이나 해변 지역도 꼭 방문해보세요. 전반적으로 취리히는 다양한 활동과 문화, 그리고 친절한 분위기가 잘 어우러진 도시입니다!

reviews: The best place I found In Europe as a digital nomad. The best thing about Belgrade for me are the events, almost every day you can find a language exchange or a CF event. The coworking spaces are good too, I recommend ICT hub. I spent there like 6 months and cannot complain. One down side I can think of is the low quality apartments. Even for 2k$ you will find a ran down communist era flat. The city is very energetic and lively so I recommend for sure. Check out Sinkopa bar and you wont regret

I was here for around a month in 2022. From what I could tell, the Dorcol neighborhood was the best. If you're into techno, there are fun parties to be had away from the tourist traps on the river. But overall I don't see the point of staying here long term. Neighboring Sarajevo was a lot more livable in my opinion, although not as much nightlife.

Totally agree with all the other reviews. Nothing good, nothing terrible, but no reason to come here unless you are super into Serbian culture & plan to stay long-term. 
I'm staying in Pancevo, a little town right outside Belgrade, just a 20 minute bus ride (without traffic, which is LA-levels of terrible). The town itself is much more beautiful & charming than Belgrade, I have to say. Belgrade is really ugly, & it's true that there's neither Soviet nor classically European architecture - just bland, brown, square & rectangular buildings with some ugly newer glass box ones thrown in. Also found that getting around Belgrade is mega unpleasant - lots of traffic, shockingly few cafes, which is crazy since that's always one of the things people rave about here. So basically you either have to spend a lot of time figuring out their dysfunctional public transport, paying for expensive, unreliable taxis, or walking the uninteresting streets dodging aggressive locals with nothing nice to look at. 
Pros (very few): safe, clean, hot guys & mostly attractive women, easy to get a cheap SIM card. 
Aside from that, super unpleasant vibe - everyone is sour & borderline aggressive. People cut in front of you at the supermarket, just elbow you right out the way to get what they need. People on sidewalks almost try to race you in order to either overtake or keep pace, it's really odd. Have no idea why people keep saying the locals speak English, as almost no one in either Belgrade center or the town I'm in can manage more than a broken sentence, & that's IF they speak any English at all. Which leads me to the next untrue myth: the people are not warm or friendly at all. I have made good efforts to use their language, but each time there is visible anger that they're having to deal with a foreigner. Again, I found this in the center of Belgrade & in the town I'm staying in. Also agree with everyone that there's absolutely nothing to do outside of going to a café & drinking. There are parks everywhere, but how many times are you going to visit the same 10 parks? As an American, I already have the experience of living in a city you have to leave in order to have fun in nature, so I'm not impressed with the excursions outside the Belgrade area - it's stuff we already have at home, & frankly, our nature is way better & more impressive with more stuff to do, as there's nothing exotic enough here to justify the terrible living experience. 
Also find that the gym experience is crap, as the town I'm in doesn't have a lot & they're expensive with weird rules that won't make sense to you as a foreigner. Also shocked that this town doesn't have any street workout areas, as I thought Serbia & Slavic countries in general were kinda known for this culture (guess I was wrong lol). 
A final note, the town I'm in has a lot, and I mean A LOT, of packs of stray dogs roving around, it's kinda scary since you don't know what the rabies situation is here. Some are aggressive, but most are just sleeping lol
Overall, I'm glad I came for a short stay to satisfy my curiosity, but I really want to leave & I would never recommend coming here for any reason. I've been to one other Slavic country, the Czech Republic, & I LOVED it, so if you have a Slavic curiosity, go there, but certainly don't waste time in Serbia.

City of up's and down's. It's great to see for 6 months to 1 year and explore the local culture which arguably is quite similar to Greek or Spanish. Food is amazing and affordable. As a tourist, especially if you are from western Europe, you will feel safe and welcome. To put it into context, for people actually living there, organized crime, car thefts, corruption on literally all levels can become challenging. I don't judge it since the country has scars of war from a recent unjust war but it's not a place to send your kids to school for sure.

As a Black woman, I found the people to be very unfriendly, racist and passive aggressive. Some resturants, the waiters were aggressive and I felt unwelcomed or they would take forever to give me a menu even though business was slow. 

In addition, Serbian men fetishize BW and said all sorts of derogatory things, like you guess it the n word and seem to have hangups over race, as well as insecurities regarding their pee pee size. Serbian food was really bland and nasty, however the vegan options are the best and I found the people there to be a lot nicer than say the traditional Serbian spots. I also appreciated the ease of taking a bus as it helped me get around when I had to live far from the center. 

But I found Belgrade overpriced for what you get and bland compared to cities like Sarajevo. Their airline Air Serbia is a scam, they will cancel flights and refuse to give you a refund and I found people at the airport to be quite unhelpful. Taxis also overcharged me. Would not go again if I could avoid.

Super safe city, many things to do, good restaurants. Nightlife is great (especially Boho Bar) but it's not for everyone as locals like to stick to tables and don't socialize much. The city is very walkable.

I'll preface this by saying I am American 30s male.
Belgrade is okay. Nothing about it really stands out to me. I'd say its mediocre at best.
I would maybe avoid if you are American. I mean the people that I met seemed fairly friendly but
there are alot of russians and there is a bit of resentment towards Americans (because of the 1999 bombing). Generally speaking.

Maybe its because its too early in the year (April - May). But the so called amazing nightlife seemed pretty lame tbh.
Most places to need reservations. People are at tables and sort of have their own groups. Not a great atomsphere it your solo and looking to mingle.
I would say unless you are a social butterfly its a challenging place to be a solo traveler.

Very cheap city, I don't know what nomadlist is smoking with their price estimates. I spent around $500-600/mo while I was here even while living in city center. City is relatively safe but you'll occasionally get harassed by beggars which can create a feeling of unease. Food is very meh, the best restaurants are the turkish/greek over the traditional "serbian" ones. Locals are generally nice and welcoming even if you're from the US, but the youth are obnoxious and loud especially at night. The smoking especially in indoor buildings is rude and obnoxious to most but not in Serbian culture.

Overall I would say 5/10.

TLDR; cheap city, locals are welcoming, surrounded by nature, not much to do compared to some other countries. Book a taxi ahead :)

Belgrade is a great city for digital nomads, with its low cost of living and excellent infrastructure. We spent about two months in Belgrade, and it's true that, at times, it can get quite... repetitive. There's not a huge variety of things to do in the city, and it can get quite old after a while. But if you're willing to be open-minded and try new things, Belgrade is an excellent place for digital nomads.

There are many cafes, locals speak perfect English, and the wifi is generally fast and reliable. If you like taking walks and being surrounded by nature, Belgrade has some beautiful parks and is well-connected to other cities that are perfect for getting away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

One great thing about Belgrade is its affordable cost of living - we got a GREAT spacious apartment in the center of town for under $1000/month, or even less if you're willing to live outside the city center or commit to longer-term (non-Airbnb rentals).

In terms of entertainment, we weren't wowed at all. While there are plenty of restaurants of all kinds (cheap, expensive, vegan, gluten-free, etc.) and bars, we've seen better places for entertainment. 

In general, we would definitely go back if we were looking for something more "slow-paced." We were very well welcomed in Belgrade; the locals were extremely warm from our experience.

A previous review said it well. Belgrade does not have much to do. Unfortunately there is the fortress with the military museum, the Tesla museum, and Tito's. The other tours outside the city vastly over charge too. Locals took me to Novi Sad for cheap and a tour there was around $90. 

The nightlife is something everyone brags about here but the reality is you won't meet people or break into groups very easily. It's a very clique like city where everyone hangs with the friends they know. I've been here 1 month now and some change and will leave after another month. I'll return for the friends I did happen to make, but it won't be a long stay like this was. 

Short stay in the city is fine, but there are much better cities to visit in the Balkans and Eastern Europe in general for a long stay.

Nomads, please stop playing up this city. Quite frankly, it sucks. There are only like three things to see in Belgrade (the fortress, Nikola Tesla museum, and Tito's museum). Those are fine but that's about it. The restaurants are also not as affordable as other parts of the Balkans and the people are not nearly as nice as the rest of the Balkans. They seem to be much more aligned with Russia and China and tend to have a bit of an attitude with those from Western European and North American countries.
